Ingredients:
- 2 lb. ground beef
- 2 garlic cloves, chopped
- 2 medium onions, chopped
- 2 Tbsp. salad oil
- 1 (28 oz.) can tomatoes (undrained)
- 1 (6 oz.) can tomato paste
- 1 (4 oz.) can chopped green chiles
- 3 Tbsp. chili powder
- 1 Tbsp. ground cumin
- 1 bay leaf
- 2 cans red kidney beans, drained
- salt and pepper

Directions:
- Cook beef, onions and garlic until beef is done; drain.
- Add remaining ingredients and simmer 35 or 40 minutes.

Mama'S Dried Apple Cake

Ingredients:
- 3/4 c. butter or Crisco
- 2 c. sugar
- 4 c. flour
- 3 level tsp. soda
- 1 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 c. buttermilk
- 3 eggs
- 2 1/2 c. warm stewed apples
- 1 c. seeded raisins
- 1 c. chopped nuts
- 1/2 tsp. pulverized spices (cinnamon)

Directions:
- Cream butter or Crisco and sugar.
- Add flour sifted with soda and baking powder alternately with buttermilk and eggs.
- Add remaining ingredients.
- Bake in layers at 325° for about 25 to 30 minutes.

Broccoli Casserole

Ingredients:
- 2 boxes frozen, chopped broccoli
- 1 can cream of mushroom soup
- 1 egg, beaten
- 3/4 c. mayonnaise
- 1 onion, diced
- sharp cheese, shredded
- Ritz crackers or similar

Directions:
- Cook broccoli and drain, then blend with mushroom soup, egg, mayonnaise and onion.
- Top with shredded cheese and crackers. Bake uncovered at 350° until bubbly in a 1 1/2-quart baking dish.

Boneless Pork Loin Roast

Ingredients:
- boneless pork loin roast
- 1 c. apple juice
- 1/4 c. lime juice
- 1/4 c. soy sauce
- salt and pepper
- 1/4 tsp. thyme
- 1 tsp. rosemary

Directions:
- Mix salt, pepper, thyme and rosemary.
- Roll roast in mixture; place in glass dish.
- Pour sauce over toast.
- Cover with Saran Wrap (fold back one corner).
- Cook in microwave for 5 minutes on High, then for 20 minutes on Medium.
- Turn and re-cover.
- Cook 20 to 30 minutes on Medium.

Chocolate Kahlua Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 pkg. (18 oz.) devil's food cake mix
- 4 eggs
- 1 c. sour cream
- 1 c. Kahlua
- 3/4 c. vegetable oil
- 6 oz. chocolate chips, add later

Directions:
- Mix first five ingredients.
- Beat 3 to 5 minutes.
- Stir in chocolate chips.
- Bake 50 to 60 minutes in Bundt pan.
- Cool 30 minutes.

Cheesy Zucchini Pie

Ingredients:
- pastry for 9-inch pie
- 1 1/2 Tbsp. Dijon mustard
- 1/4 c. margarine
- 2 large zucchini, thinly sliced
- 1 c. chopped onion
- 1/2 c. chopped fresh parsley or 1 Tbsp. dried parsley
- 1/2 tsp. basil
- 1/4 tsp. garlic powder
- 1/4 tsp. ground oregano
- 2 eggs, beaten
- 2 c. shredded Mozzarella cheese

Directions:
- Prick bottom and sides of pie crust.
- Bake at 400° for 6 to 7 minutes.
- Let cool.
- Spread mustard evenly over bottom of crust. Melt butter in large skillet.
- Add zucchini and onions and cook over low heat, stirring occasionally.
- Stir in parsley, basil, garlic powder and oregano; cover and simmer 5 to 7 minutes. Combine eggs and cheese, stir into zucchini mixture.
- Pour into pastry shell.
- Bake at 375° for 20 to 25 minutes or until lightly browned.

Hamburger Pie

Ingredients:
- 1 medium onion, chopped
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 1 (No. 2) can cooked green beans (2 1/2 c.)
- 1 (10 1/2 or 11 oz.) can condensed tomato soup
- 5 medium potatoes, cooked
- 1/2 c. warm milk
- 1 egg beaten
- salt and pepper

Directions:
- Cook onion until golden; add meat and seasoning.
- Brown.
- Add drained beans and soup; pour into greased 1 1/2-quart casserole dish.
- Mash the potatoes; add the milk, egg and seasonings.
- Spoon in mounds over meat.
- Bake in moderate oven at 350° for 30 minutes. Makes 6 servings.

Parmesan Chicken Breasts

Ingredients:
- 5 boneless, skinless chicken breast halves
- 2 Tbsp. butter
- 1/2 c. grated Parmesan cheese
- 1/4 c. dry bread crumbs
- 1 tsp. dried oregano leaves
- 1 tsp. parsley flakes
- 1/4 tsp. paprika
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. black pepper

Directions:
- Heat oven to 400°.
- Spray a 9 x 13-inch pan with nonstick cooking spray.
- Dip chicken in spread; coat with combined remaining ingredients.
- Place in prepared pan.
- Bake 20 to 25 minutes or until tender.

Pina Colada Salad(Diabetic)  

Ingredients:
- 1 (11 oz.) can Mandarin oranges, drained, reserve liquid
- 1 (8 oz.) can pineapple chunks in own juice, drain and reserve juice
- 1 small banana, sliced and sprinkled with 1 tsp. lemon juice
- 1 envelope whipped topping mix
- 1/2 tsp. vanilla extract
- 1/2 tsp. rum extract or 2 Tbsp. toasted coconut

Directions:
- Combine oranges, pineapple and banana in medium bowl.
- Whip low calorie topping with 1/2 cup fruit liquid (all of pineapple juice and enough orange liquid to make 1/2 cup).
- Whip in vanilla and rum extracts.
- Fold into fruit mixture; sprinkle with coconut.
- Chill several hours before serving.
- Yields 4 servings.

Roast Salmon Wiht Olive Spread 

Ingredients:
- (1) tbsp Olive Oil, plus more for Salmon
- 1/4 tsp Dried Oregano
- Fresh Ground Pepper to taste

Directions:
- - Heat 1 tbsp Olive Oil in a small skillet. Add Shallots and cook over medium heat until tender. Stir in olives, pine nuts and oregano. Reduce heat & simmer 2-3 minutes to blend flavors. Set aside
- - Lightly brush Salmon fillets with more oil. place skin-side down on lightly oiled baking sheet.
- - Season with salt & pepper
- - Roast in a preheated 425 degree oven 7-8 minutes.
- - Remove from oven and let sit 5 minutes to finish cooking.
- - Ease Salmon from baking sheet, leaving skin behind.
- - Spoon Olive Spread over Salmon.

Quesadillas with Salami and Tomato Salsa

Ingredients:
- 2 tomatoes, seeded, finely chopped King Sooper's 1 lb For $0.99 thru 02/09
- 1 small red onion, finely chopped
- 1 clove garlic, minced
- 2 Tbsp. Kraft Oil and Vinegar Dressing
- zest and juice of 1 lime
- 110 g sliced salami
- 1 cup Touch of Philadelphia Shredded Creamy Mozza Cheese
- 4 small flour tortillas

Directions:
- Combine tomatoes, red onion and garlic in medium bowl.
- Add dressing, lime zest and juice; stir until blended.
- Set aside.
- Divide salami and cheese over half of each tortilla; fold in half.
- Add to skillet; cook 1 min.
- on each side or until golden brown on both sides.
- Remove from skillet.
- Repeat with remaining tortillas and filling.
- Cut into wedges.
- Serve with salsa.

Chewy Ginger Molasses Cookies

Ingredients:
- 1/2 cups Butter, Room Temperature
- 3/4 cups Granulated Sugar, Plus Extra To Sprinkle On Cookies
- 1 whole Egg
- 1/2 cups Molasses
- 2 cups All-purpose Flour
- 2 teaspoons Baking Soda
- 1 teaspoon Cinnamon
- 1/2 teaspoons Salt
- 1/2 teaspoons Ginger

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350°F.
- In a large bowl, cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add in egg and molasses and beat until well-combined.
- In a second large bowl, sift together flour, baking soda, cinnamon, salt, and ginger. Gradually add to the wet sugar mixture and stir until combined.
- (I used my hand mixer until the dough became stiff and then I finished mixing by hand.)
- Drop by rounded tablespoons onto an ungreased baking sheet, placing cookies at least 2-inches apart. Sprinkle granulated sugar over each cookie. Bake 12-15 minutes.
- Remove to a wire rack and cool.

Ham And Mustard Crostini

Ingredients:
- 24 (1/2-inch-thick) diagonally cut baguette slices
- 1/4 cup unsalted butter, melted
- Thinly sliced prosciutto or ham
- Jarred mustard-mayonnaise sauce
- Chive sprigs

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 375°F. Arrange baguette slices in a single layer on a baking sheet. Brush tops with melted butter. Bake in preheated oven until slices are just beginning to brown at edges, about 12 minutes. Remove from oven, and cool to room temperature.
- Spread 1 1/2 teaspoons
- on each crostini.
- Top with prosciutto, mustard-mayonnaise sauce, and chive sprigs.

Oat Bran Biscuits (Cookies)

Ingredients:
- 60 g butter
- 1/3 cup golden syrup
- 2 1/2 cups rolled oats
- 1/2 cup oat bran
- 1 cup plain whole meal flour
- 1/3 cup brown sugar
- 1/3 cup low-fat milk

Directions:
- Melt butter & golden syrup together over a low heat.
- Combine oats, oatbran, flour & sugar in a mixing bowl, stir in butter mixture & milk and mix to form a soft dough.
- Knead lightly on a floured surface then roll out dough to 3mm thickness.
- Cut out biscuits using a 6cm round cutter.
- Place on a non-stick or baking paper lined tray and prick well with a fork.
- Bake at 180.C for 10-15 minutes.
- If desired, spread cooled biscuits with your favourite icing & sandwich together.

One Bowl Chocolate Fudge

Ingredients:
- 2 (8 sq. each) pkg. Baker's semi-sweet chocolate
- 1 can sweetened condensed milk
- 2 tsp. vanilla
- 1 1/2 c. nuts

Directions:
- Microwave chocolate and milk in a large bowl on High for 2 to 3 minutes or until chocolate is melted.
- Stir in vanilla and walnuts. Spread in foil lined square pan.

Cheryl's New England Clam Chowder Recipe

Ingredients:
- 1 pound boiling potatoes, peeled
- 1 c. (or possibly more) half and half
- 1/2 c. whipping cream
- 4 (6 1/2 ounce.) cans minced clams, liquid removed (juice reserved)
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- Healthy pinch of grnd thyme
- Freshly grnd white pepper
- 1/2 med. onion (diced)
- 1/2 med. carrot (diced)

Directions:
- Cook potatoes, carrots and onions in large pot of boiling salted water till knife pierces centers easily, about 25 min.
- Drain.
- Transfer to bowl.
- Mash lightly.
- Scald 1 c. half and half and cream in large heavy saucepan.
- Add in potatoes, clams, 1 c. reserved clam juice, onion, carrot, salt and thyme and pepper.
- Bring soup to simmer, stirring frequently and thinning with more half and half if you like.
- Ladle into bowls to serve.

No Bake Cookies

Ingredients:
- 1 stick oleo
- 2 c. white sugar
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 c. milk
- 2 Tbsp. cocoa
- 1/2 c. peanut butter
- 3 c. oats
- 1 tsp. vanilla

Directions:
- Put oleo, sugar, salt, cocoa and milk in iron skillet, bring to boil and boil 2 to 3 minutes.
- Take off stove and add vanilla, and peanut butter,
- stir well.
- Add 1 cup at a time of oats.
- Drop on waxed paper or foil with tablespoon.

Bacon Crescent Tarts

Ingredients:
- 2 (3 ounce) packages cream cheese, softened
- 5 teaspoons milk
- 2 eggs
- 1/2 cup shredded cheddar cheese
- 2 tablespoons finely chopped green peppers
- 1 tablespoon finely chopped onion
- 1 (8 ounce) package refrigerated crescent dinner rolls
- 5 slices bacon, cooked and crumbled

Directions:
- Mix in blender: cream cheese, milk, eggs, cheese, green pepper, onion.
- Grease muffin tin with Pam.
- Separate crescent dough into eight triangles.
- Press onto the bottom and up the sides of muffin tins.
- Sprinkle half the bacon into cups.
- Gently pour egg mixture over crust (don't overfill).
- Top with remaining bacon.
- Bake at 375 degrees for 18-22 minutes (until knife comes out clean).
- Makes a nice breakfast served with juice and fresh fruit.

Party Potato Casserole

Ingredients:
- 2 (10 3/4 oz. each) cans cream of celery soup
- 1 (8 oz.) carton dairy sour cream or unflavored yogurt
- 1 (32 oz.) bag frozen hash brown potatoes *
- 1 medium onion, chopped
- 3 Tbsp. diced pimento
- 2 tsp. salt
- 1 green pepper, chopped
- 1/8 tsp. pepper
- 1/4 c. grated Parmesan cheese (optional)

Directions:
- *Eight cups of cubed potatoes (about 8 medium) can be substituted for the frozen potatoes.

Roasted Root Vegetables

Ingredients:
- 1 (1-pound) bag parsnips
- 6 large turnips
- 2 large sweet potatoes
- 1 large rutabaga
- 6 large beets
- 1 teaspoon salt, divided
- 1 teaspoon pepper, divided
- 2 tablespoons butter or margarine, melted

Directions:
- Peel first 5 ingredients, and cut into large pieces. Coat 2 aluminum foil-lined baking sheets with cooking spray. Arrange parsnip, turnip, sweet potato, and rutabaga on a baking sheet. Lightly coat vegetables with cooking spray, and sprinkle with 3/4 teaspoon salt and 3/4 teaspoon pepper.
- Arrange beets on remaining baking sheet; lightly coat with cooking spray, and sprinkle with remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper.
- Bake vegetables at 425°, stirring occasionally, 35 to 45 minutes or until tender. (Pans may need to be rearranged after 15 to 20 minutes to ensure even cooking.)
- Toss vegetables with melted butter.
- Note: We cooked the beets separately to keep them from bleeding into the other vegetables.

Vegan Chocolate Pudding Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 cup flour
- 23 cup sugar
- 2 tablespoons cocoa powder
- 2 teaspoons baking powder
- 18 teaspoon salt
- 12 cup water
- 2 tablespoons applesauce
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 14 cup cocoa
- 23 cup brown sugar
- 1 34 cups hot water

Directions:
- Preheat to 350F and spray an 8" square pan/dish.
- Mix the first section of ingredients.
- By hand is fine.
- Pour into prepared pan.
- Mix the cocoa and brown sugar.
- Sprinkle over mix in pan.
- Pour on hot water.
- Bake for 45 minutes.

Sunflower Apricot Go Bars

Ingredients:
- 4 cups rolled oats
- 1 cup roasted lightly salted sunflower seeds
- 34 cup pitted dates, chopped
- 34 cup chopped dried apricot
- 18 teaspoon sea salt
- 1 cup sunflower seed butter
- 12 cup honey
- 1 tablespoon grated orange zest

Directions:
- In large bowl, combine oats, sunflower seeds, dates, apricots and salt.
- Stir in sunflower seed butter, honey and orange zest.
- Press mixture into prepared pan and refrigerate 30 minutes or until firm.
- Remove from pan and cut in 16 bars.

Split Pea and Ham Soup

Ingredients:
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 large onion, chopped
- 2 stalks celery, chopped
- 2 carrots, chopped
- 3 garlic cloves, minced
- 1 lb split peas
- 10 cups water
- 1 ham bone or 1 ham hock
- 2 medium potatoes, peeled and chopped
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 14 cup barbecue sauce or 14 cup sherry wine

Directions:
- Heat oil in a Dutch oven.
- Add onion, celery, carrots, and garlic.
- Saute 5 minutes.
- Add split peas, water, and ham bone.
- Bring to a boil.
- Reduce heat and simmer 1 hour.
- Add potatoes and simmer another 30 minutes.
- Remove ham bone from soup, pull meat off bone, and set aside.
- Discard bone.
- Using an immersion blender, puree soup.
- Add meat, salt, and barbecue sauce.
- Serve with crushed pita or corn chips.

Chocolate Eclair

Ingredients:
- 1 (6 oz.) pkg. French vanilla instant pudding
- 3 1/4 c. milk
- 9 oz. Cool Whip
- 1 box graham crackers
- 1 c. sugar
- 1/3 c. cocoa
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1/2 c. butter

Directions:
- Combine pudding with 3 cups cold milk; beat 2 minutes.
- Set until thickened.
- Fold in Cool whip.
- Place layer of graham crackers in 9 x 13-inch cake pan.
- Spread layer of pudding, then crackers.
- Top off with crackers.

Glazed Nuts

Ingredients:
- 2 c. pecan halves
- 1 c. sugar
- 2 Tbsp. cinnamon
- 1/2 stick butter

Directions:
- Combine nuts, sugar and butter in skillet and cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, for 6 to 8 minutes or until sugar is melted and nuts are toasted. Spread nuts on buttered baking sheet. Separate or put in clusters. Cool, then eat.

Octoberfest Sausage Soup

Ingredients:
- 1/2 lb smoked sausage
- 1 cup beef broth
- 1 cup chicken broth
- 1/4 cup coarsley chopped celery
- 1/4 cup coarsley chopped onion
- 1/4 cup coarsley chopped green bell pepper
- 2 tablespoons cornstarch, dissolved in 2 tbsp water
- 1 cup shredded swiss cheese
- 1 (8 ounce) can sauerkraut, drained
- 2 cups half-and-half
- 1/4 teaspoon white pepper
- 2 green onions, sliced

Directions:
- Combine broths, celery, onion, green pepper and potato in large saucepan; bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to low; simmer until vegetables are crisp-tender, about 15 minutes.
- Add dissolved cornstarch; cook and stir until soup thickens.
- Cut sausage into quarters, lengthwise, then cut crosswise into 1/4" pieces. Add sausage, cheese, sauerkraut, half and half and white pepper. Stir.
- Continue heating until mixture is hot. DO NOT BOIL. Serve immediately.

Sis' Tuna Salad Recipe

Ingredients:
- 1 sm. box macaroni shells (sm.), cooked and cooled
- 2 cans white tuna in water, liquid removed and shredded
- 1 c. diced celery
- 6 Large eggs, hard boiled (1 for decoration)
- 1 c. sliced green olives
- 1 green pepper, diced

Directions:
- Mix together all ingredients.
- Stir in dressing.
- Salad Dressing: Mix together 1 c. Hellmann's mayonnaise, 1/2 to 1 c. lowfat sour cream, and 1 tsp.
- (or possibly to taste) mustard.

Creamed Spinach With Mushrooms

Ingredients:
- 2 lb. spinach
- 2 Tbsp. butter
- 1/4 lb. sliced mushrooms
- 1 Tbsp. flour
- 1/4 c. milk
- dash of nutmeg
- salt and pepper

Directions:
- Cook spinach; drain and chop.
- Melt butter and saute mushrooms.
- Blend in flour, nutmeg, salt and pepper, then slowly stir in milk.
- Stir until thickened.
- Add spinach and heat well. Makes 6 servings.

Lasagna Vegetables

Ingredients:
- lasagne sheets
- 1 courgette
- 1 onion
- 1 carrot
- 2 cloves garlic
- cabbage
- salt
- pepper
- grated cheese
- bechamel sauce
- sesame seeds
- fresh basil leaves
- tomato paste

Directions:
- In the wok, saute the onion and the garlic over a pinch of olive oil.
- Then the zucchini, carrots and Lombard.
- Save the tomatoes and cook a little.
- Put salt, pepper and basil to taste.
- Grease a baking dish of your own for the oven with butter and put the sheets of lasagna alternating with vegetables.
- Put a little grated cheese such as bechamel.
- At the end of the layers cover everything with bechamel, put some grated cheese, a sesame seed or some more spice to taste.
- Place in the oven (20 minutes / 400 °F) or until well browned.

Jerk Sauce

Ingredients:
- 5 bunches whole scallions, finely chopped
- 3 large cloves garlic, minced
- 3 Scotch bonnet peppers (any color), seeded and minced
- 2 large sprigs fresh thyme or 2 tablespoons dried
- 1/4 cup ground allspice (dry pimento berries)
- 2 tablespoons freshly ground black pepper
- 1 1/2 tablespoons salt
- 1 cup water

Directions:
- In a large bowl, combine all the ingredients except the water.
- Mix well and add water to form a loose paste.

Candied Walnuts

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 c. sugar
- 1/2 c. milk, plus 4 drops red food coloring
- 1 tsp. white corn syrup
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 2 1/2 c. walnuts
- 1 tsp. peppermint flavoring

Directions:
- In
- 2-quart saucepan, mix first 4 ingredients.	Cook to soft ball stage (238°).	Add walnuts and peppermint flavoring; stir until
- creamy.
- Quickly
- turn
- out	on
- waxed
- paper
- and separate with forks.

Oatmeal Candy

Ingredients:
- 2 c. sugar
- 1 stick butter
- 4 Tbsp. cocoa
- 1/2 c. milk
- 1/2 c. peanut butter
- 1 1/2 c. Minute oats
- 1 Tbsp. vanilla

Directions:
- Mix together sugar, butter, cocoa and milk. Bring to a boil and boil 4 minutes.
- Remove from heat.
- Add peanut butter, Minute oats and vanilla. Stir well. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto wax paper.

Leeks with Egg and Lemon Sauce

Ingredients:
- 1 1/4 pounds baby leeks
- Salt
- 2 egg yolks
- Juice of 1 1/2 lemons
- 1 teaspoon sugar

Directions:
- Wash the leeks in running water, making sure you remove any dirt trapped between the leaves.
- Trim the root ends and the tough tops of the green leaves.
- Boil the leeks in salted water until tender, then drain, reserving 1 cup of the cooking water.
- Pour this cooking water back into the pan and bring to the boil.
- In a small bowl, beat the egg yolks and lemon juice with the sugar.
- Pour in a little of the hot cooking water and beat well, then pour the egg and lemon mixture into the pan, beating vigorously, for seconds only until the sauce thickens slightly.
- Be careful not to let it boil or it will curdle.
- Add a little salt, if necessary, to taste.
- Serve the leeks hot or cold with the sauce poured over.

Herb Sauce For Chicken

Ingredients:
- 1 whole chicken, cooked and skinned
- 3 Tbsp. chopped parsley
- 3 Tbsp. garlic, chopped
- 3 Tbsp. onion, chopped
- 1 Tbsp. sweet basil
- 1/2 c. olive oil
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1 c. white wine

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients except chicken.
- Simmer for a few minutes. Arrange cut up pieces of skinned chicken in baking dish.
- Spoon sauce over chicken.
- Broil until golden brown.

Quick Taco Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 lb ground turkey
- 1 teaspoon garlic, chopped
- 1 cup chili bean
- 1 large tomatoes, chopped
- 12 cup Catalina dressing
- 4 cups lettuce, chopped
- 4 cups nacho corn chips
- 12 cup grated cheddar cheese
- 4 tablespoons light sour cream
- 14 cup chopped onion
- 1 cup salsa

Directions:
- Brown the turkey in a skillet.
- While browning turkey line 4 plates with chips.
- Line chips with lettuce.
- Drain meat.
- Turn heat off.
- Stir in tomato and beans.
- Stir in Catalina.
- Divide the meat mix over the lettuce.
- Sprinkle on onion.
- Sprinkle on cheese.
- Plop on sour cream.
- Drizzle on salsa.
- Serve!

Dane'S Chicken Casserole

Ingredients:
- 1 whole chicken
- 1 pkg. Pepperidge Farm cornbread dressing mix
- 1 stick oleo
- 1 can cream of mushroom soup
- 1 can cream of chicken soup

Directions:
- Cook chicken; debone and cut into small pieces.
- Melt oleo and mix with dressing mix.
- Grease baking dish and layer 1/3 of dressing mix in dish.
- Layer 1/2 of chicken on dressing.

Marinated Vegetables

Ingredients:
- 4 c. assorted fresh vegetables (carrots, cherry tomatoes, cauliflower, mushrooms, broccoli, onion, cucumber, zucchini, etc.)
- 1/4 c. lemon juice
- 1/4 c. vegetable oil
- 1 Tbsp. sugar
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/2 tsp. oregano or thyme leaves
- 1/8 tsp. pepper

Directions:
- Place vegetables in shallow baking dish.
- In small bowl, combine remaining ingredients; mix well.
- Pour over vegetables. Cover; refrigerate 6 hours or overnight, stirring occasionally.

Pecan Pie

Ingredients:
- 3 eggs, beaten
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1/2 c. Karo syrup (white)
- 1 c. pecans, chopped
- 1 1/4 c. sugar
- 1/4 c. butter or oleo
- 1 unbaked pie shell

Directions:
- Combine sugar, syrup and butter in 2-quart saucepan.
- Cook over medium heat until melted, stirring constantly.
- Remove from heat.
- Gradually beat in beaten eggs.
- Add pecans and 1 teaspoon vanilla.
- Pour in 9-inch pie shell and bake at 350° for 40 to 50 minutes.
- Garnish with pecan halves before baking.

Black Bean Soup

Ingredients:
- 5 (14 1/2 oz. each) cans Cajun stewed tomatoes
- 4 (15 oz. each) cans black beans
- 3/4 c. chopped onion
- 3/4 c. Minute rice (not cooked)

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients together and let simmer 45 minutes to an hour.
- Can serve with nacho chips.

Quick Chili

Ingredients:
- 2 lb. ground beef
- 1 large onion, chopped
- 3 cans dark red kidney beans
- 2 cans whole tomatoes, chopped
- 2 Tbsp. chili powder

Directions:
- Brown ground beef and onion; drain off fat.
- In large pot, add beef, beans (include juice), tomatoes and chili powder to taste. Cook until beans are tender.

Rice Delight

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. butter, melted
- 1 small onion, diced (optional)
- 1 (10 1/2 oz.) can bouillon soup (undiluted)
- 1 (4 1/2 oz.) can sliced mushrooms
- 1 (8 oz.) can water chestnuts, sliced (optional)
- 1 c. uncooked regular rice

Directions:
- Saute onions in butter. Mix with soup. Drain mushrooms and water chestnuts, reserving the liquid. Add water to make 1 1/4 cups of liquid. Add mushrooms, water chestnuts, liquids and rice to soup mixture. Mix well. Pour into a lightly oiled baking dish. Cover and bake at 350° for 50 minutes. Yields 6 to 8 servings.

Impossible Greek Spinach Pie

Ingredients:
- 1/2 cup green onion, chopped
- 1 tablespoon butter
- 1 package spinach, thaw &amp drain
- 1/2 cup cottage cheese
- 1 cup milk
- 1/2 cup Bisquick
- 3 eggs
- 1 teaspoon lemon juice
- 1/4 teaspoon pepper
- 3 tablespoons parmesan cheese
- 1/4 teaspoon nutmeg

Directions:
- Layer spinach, onions and cottage cheese in greased dish.
- Put rest in Blender.
- Pour over cheese.
- Bake at 350 for 35-45 min until tests clean with knife.

Russian Dressing(Salad Dressing)  

Ingredients:
- 1/2 dill pickle
- 6 sprigs parsley
- 1 c. mayonnaise
- 1/4 c. ketchup

Directions:
- Chop parsley and pickle very fine.
- Add ketchup; stir and add mayonnaise.
- Blend thoroughly.
- Keep covered in refrigerator. Keeps indefinitely.

Walnut Raisin Cookies

Ingredients:
- 2 1/2 c. all-purpose flour
- 1/2 tsp. baking soda
- 1 c. softened margarine
- 1 1/3 c. firmly packed light brown sugar
- 1/2 c. seedless raisins
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 2 eggs
- 1 1/3 c. Planters walnut pieces, chopped
- 1 c. chopped dried apples

Directions:
- In small bowl, combine flour and baking soda; set aside.
- In medium mixing bowl, using an electric mixer, cream margarine, brown sugar and vanilla.
- Beat in eggs, one at a time.
- Stir in flour mixture.
- Stir in walnuts, raisins and apples.
- Drop by tablespoonful onto greased baking sheet.
- Bake at 350° for 12 to 15 minutes.
- Cool on wire rack.

Waldorf Salad 

Ingredients:
- 1 cup diced celery
- 1 cup diced cored, peeled apples
- 1/2 cup coarsely chopped walnuts
- 1/2 cup seedless red grapes, halved, optional
- 1/2 to 3/4 cup mayonnaise

Directions:
- Combine celery, apples, walnuts, and grapes in a medium bowl.
- Stir in mayonnaise.
- Serve at room temperature or chilled.

Rice Casserole

Ingredients:
- 1 c. long grain rice
- 1 onion
- 1 bell pepper
- 1 stick butter
- 1 Campbell's beef consomme soup

Directions:
- Brown rice in 1 stick butter with the onion and bell pepper. Put in casserole dish; cover with consomme.
- Bake at 350° for 1 hour.

Easy Pork Chops

Ingredients:
- pork chops
- ketchup
- brown sugar
- salt
- pepper

Directions:
- Spray a 13 x 9-inch Pyrex dish with Pam. Salt and pepper chops on both sides.
- Lay in baking dish. Completely cover with ketchup and sprinkle with brown sugar.
- Cover with aluminum foil and bake at 350° for about 1 hour.

Cracker Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 stack saltine crackers, crumbled
- 1 onion
- 1 bell pepper
- 1 small jar pimentos
- 1/2 c. sweet pickles
- 5 boiled eggs
- mayonnaise (to moisten)

Directions:
- Finely chop onion, bell pepper, pimento and pickles.
- Add to chopped eggs.
- Toss gently.
- Serve on a bed of lettuce.

Blue Cheese Sourdough Slices

Ingredients:
- 2 tablespoons butter
- 2 tablespoons crumbled blue cheese
- 8 thick slices baguette-shaped French or sourdough bread

Directions:
- Melt butter and blue cheese; stir to blend.
- Brush bread slices with mixture on both sides.
- Toast in toaster oven or under broiler for 10 to 15 minutes, or until lightly browned.

Cherry Wink Cookies

Ingredients:
- 1 c. sugar
- 3/4 c. shortening
- 2 eggs
- 2 Tbsp. milk
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 3/4 c. chopped maraschino cherries
- 2 1/2 c. flour
- 1 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 tsp. soda
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 c. chopped nutmeats
- 4 to 5 c. cornflakes, crushed

Directions:
- Mix together sugar, shortening, eggs, milk, vanilla and cherries. Add flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt and nutmeats. Mix well. Shape dough into balls and roll in crushed cornflakes.

Country-Style Pancakes

Ingredients:
- 1 1/4 c. flour
- 1 1/2 tsp. baking powder
- 1 tsp. sugar
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 egg
- 1 1/4 c. milk
- 2 Tbsp. soft shortening

Directions:
- Mix dry ingredients together.
- Beat egg, add milk and blend into flour mixture.
- Drop batter on hot griddle.
- Turn pancakes when bubbles appear.
- Makes 16 (4-inch) pancakes.

Asian Beef

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 1 tsp. crushed red pepper
- 1 medium red onion, sliced
- 1 medium green pepper, chopped
- 1/4 c. lemon juice
- 1/2 tsp. dried mint leaves
- 1 tsp. instant beef bouillon
- 2 c. hot cooked rice
- 2/3 c. seeded chopped cucumber
- 12 lettuce leaves

Directions:
- In a large skillet, brown meat and red pepper; pour off fat. Add onion, green pepper, lemon juice, mint and beef bouillon; mix well. Meanwhile, combine rice and cucumber; keep warm. place about 1/4 cup rice mixture and 1/3 cup meat mixture on each lettuce leaf; roll up. Serve immediately. Makes 4 to 6 servings.

Orange Frosting

Ingredients:
- 2 1/4 c. powdered sugar
- 3 Tbsp. milk
- 1 Tbsp. concentrated orange juice

Directions:
- Mix until smooth.
- Spread on orange cookies and decorate with raisins, gumdrops, chocolate pieces, etc.

French Toast Souffle 

Ingredients:
- 10 slices of egg bread, cubed
- 1 8 oz. package cream cheese
- 8 large eggs
- 1 1/2 cups 2% milk
- 3/4 cup half & half
- 1/3 cup real maple syrup
- 1/2 tsp. vanilla

Directions:
- Place bread cubes in a 13x9 pan coated with cooking spray. Beat cream cheese until smooth,then add eggs, one at a time, mixing well after each egg. Add milk, 1/2 & 1/2, maple syrup and vanilla. Mix until smooth. Pour over bread and refrigerate overnight. Remove pan from fridge and let stand at room temperature for 30 minutes. Heat oven to 375 degrees. Bake for 50 mins. or until set.

Coffee Cake Muffins

Ingredients:
- 34 cup sugar
- 13 cup shortening
- 1 egg (beaten)
- 12 teaspoon vanilla
- 12 teaspoon salt
- 1 12 cups flour
- 1 tablespoon flour
- 2 teaspoons baking powder
- 34 cup milk
- 2 teaspoons cinnamon
- 1 cup sugar
- 12 cup chopped small pecans
- 14 cup melted oleo

Directions:
- Cream sugar and shortening.
- Add egg, vanilla and salt.
- Beat well.
- Add 1 1/2 cups flour, baking powder and milk.
- Mix well.
- Pour into well greased muffin pans or use cupcake papers; fill 3/4 full.
- Mix together topping ingredients and sprinkle some on top of each muffin.
- Bake at 375 until done, about 20 to 30 minutes.

Dilly Beans

Ingredients:
- 2 lb. green or yellow string beans
- 1 tsp. cayenne pepper
- 4 garlic cloves
- 1/4 c. canning salt
- 4 heads dill
- 2 1/2 c. water
- 2 1/2 c. vinegar

Directions:
- Trim beans and pack in 4 pint canning jars. Add 1 garlic clove and 1/4 teaspoon cayenne and dill to each jar. Boil salt, water and vinegar. Pour into jars. Cover jars with canning lids. Process 10 minutes. These are great addition to a relish tray and good in Bloody Marys.

Sweet Potato Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 (16 oz.) can sweet potatoes, drained
- 1 stalk celery, chopped
- 1 green onion, chopped
- 1/2 green bell pepper, chopped
- 2 to 3 Tbsp. mayonnaise

Directions:
- Mash sweet potatoes; mix in remaining ingredients.
- (Make sure vegetables are dry before adding to potatoes.)
- Let chill overnight.

Acorn Squash

Ingredients:
- 1 acorn squash, cut in half with seeds removed
- 1/2 c. applesauce
- cinnamon

Directions:
- Place squash
- cut
- side down in glass baking dish.
- Add small amount of
- water, about 1 inch in pan.
- Bake at 325° for approximately
- 20
- minutes
- or
- until
- partially soft.
- Remove water from
- pan;
- turn
- squash
- cut side up in pan.
- Fill each half
- with 1/4 cup applesauce; sprinkle with cinnamon.
- Return to oven; continue baking until done.
- Makes 2 servings.

Fettuccine Al Fresco

Ingredients:
- 1 Tbsp. vegetable oil
- 1/2 c. cooked ham, diced
- 1 medium onion, chopped
- 1 clove garlic, minced
- 1 jar (28 oz.) Pasta Sauce with Mushrooms
- 1/4 c. fresh parsley, chopped or 1 Tbsp. dried parsley flakes
- 6 c. hot cooked fettuccine or spaghetti
- grated Parmesan cheese

Directions:
- Heat oil in saucepan. Add ham, onion and garlic and cook until onion is tender. Add pasta sauce and parsley. Heat through. Serve over fettuccine with cheese.

Chicken Satay Pizza

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 cups shredded mozzarella cheese
- 30cm pre made tomato based pizza base
- 1/2 cold BBQ chicken, skin and bones removed, broken into bite sized pieces King Sooper's 1 lb For $1.19 thru 02/09
- 1 red capsicum, cut into strips
- 4 spring onions, cut into 4 cm lengths
- 1/4 cup corn kernels
- 1/3 cup KRAFT Smooth Peanut Butter
- 2 tablespoons sweet chilli sauce

Directions:
- Scatter 1/2 the cheese over the base and top with the chicken, capsicum, spring onions and corn.
- Warm the peanut butter and chilli sauce until smooth and drizzle over the pizza.
- Scatter over the remaining cheese.
- Bake 15 minutes in a 200C oven.

Chocolate Squares

Ingredients:
- 1 stick butter or margarine, softened
- 1 c. flour
- 2 Tbsp. sugar
- 4 Tbsp. milk
- 1/2 c. chopped nuts

Directions:
- Mix together and spread out in oblong 9 x 13-inch cake pan. Bake at 350° for 8 to 10 minutes.

Split Pea And Butternut Squash Soup 

Ingredients:
- 1/2 (450-g) pkg dried yellow split peas
- 1 large butternut squash, peeled and cut into pieces
- 3 carrots, coarsely chopped
- 2 celery stalks, coarsely chopped
- 1 onion, coarsely chopped
- 6- oz (180- g) diced smoked ham steak, about 1 cup (250 mL)
- 1 bay leaf
- 2 tsp (10 mL) ground coriander or cumin
- 900- ml carton chicken broth

Directions:
- 1.Rinse peas. Drain well. Prepare vegetables and ham. Place all in a large saucepan along with remaining ingredients. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer, covered, until peas are tender, 35 to 40 min. Discard bay leaf. Soup will keep well covered and refrigerated up to 3 days, or frozen up to 3 months.

The World'S Best Cookies

Ingredients:
- 1 c. butter
- 1 c. sugar
- 1 c. brown sugar, firmly packed
- 1 egg
- 1 c. vegetable oil
- 1 tsp. vanilla extract
- 1 c. regular rolled oats
- 1 c. crushed cornflakes
- 1/2 c. shredded coconut
- 1/2 c. chopped walnuts or pecans
- 3 1/2 c. flour, sifted
- 1 tsp. baking soda
- 1 tsp. salt

Directions:
- Combine sugars and butter.
- Cream until fluffy.
- Add egg; mix well.
- Add oil and vanilla; mix.
- Add oats, cornflakes, coconut and nuts; stir well.
- Sift together flour, soda and salt; add to mixture and combine well.
- Form into balls the size of walnuts. Place on ungreased cookie sheet and flatten with a fork dipped in water.
- Bake at 325° for about 12 to 15 minutes.

Brown Stew Fish

Ingredients:
- 1 whole red snapper
- 1/2 onion, cut into rings
- 1 scotch bonnet pepper, left whole
- 1 sprig thyme
- 1/2 cup water
- 1/4 cup olive oil
- 3 tablespoons fish sauce
- 1 tomatoes, diced
- salt, to taste
- pepper, to taste

Directions:
- Heat a deep-fryer to 350 degrees F.
- Deep-fry the whole snapper until lightly brown, approxmately 4 minutes.
- Saute the onion, pepper, thyme, 1/2 c water and 1/4 c of oil in a large saute pan, for about 2 minutes. Add the fish sauce and the fried fish. Simmer for 5 minutes, then add the tomato, and let simmer for 1 minute. Season with salt and pepper , to taste, and place on a serving platter.

T.v. French Dressing

Ingredients:
- 1 cup salad oil
- 12 cup white vinegar
- 12 cup ketchup (I prefer Heinz)
- 14 cup white sugar
- 1 12 teaspoons salt
- 12 teaspoon chopped garlic
- 12 medium onion, chopped fine

Directions:
- Combine all ingredients and shake well before using!

Company Chicken Breasts

Ingredients:
- 6 chicken breasts, halved
- 2 cans cream of chicken soup
- 1 pkg. dried beef
- 1 1/2 c. sour cream
- 12 bacon slices
- 3 oz. cream cheese
- pepper (do not salt chicken)

Directions:
- Place layer of dried beef in bottom of greased baking dish. Arrange bacon wrapped chicken breasts on beef slices.
- Cover with mixture of chicken soup, sour cream and cream cheese.
- Cover pan tightly with foil.
- Bake at 325° for 2 hours.
- When tender, remove foil and let brown slightly.
- May be prepared the day before and refrigerated.

Peach Pie

Ingredients:
- 4 cups sliced peeled peaches
- 3/4 cup sugar
- 1/4 cup MINUTE Tapioca
- 1 Tbsp. lemon juice Safeway 4 ct For $5.00 thru 02/09
- 1 pkg. (15 oz.) ready-to-use refrigerated pie crusts (2 crusts)
- 1 Tbsp. butter or margarine

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 400F.
- Mix peaches, sugar, tapioca and lemon juice.
- Let stand 15 minutes.
- Place 1 of the pie crusts in 9-inch pie plate.
- Fill with fruit mixture; dot with butter.
- Cover with remaining pie crust; seal and flute edge.
- Cut several slits in top crust to allow steam to escape.
- Bake 45 to 50 minutes or until juices form bubbles that burst slowly.
- Cool.

Taco Shells

Ingredients:
- 1 c. flour (self-rising)
- 1 c. corn meal
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 4 eggs, beaten
- 2 Tbsp. oil
- 1 1/2 c. water

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients together.
- Pour about 3 tablespoons into medium hot pan.
- Roll pan around until bottom is covered.
- Flip over 1 time.

Cilantro Butter Tilapia Skillet Fillets

Ingredients:
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1/8 teaspoon ground red pepper
- 4 -6 ounces tilapia fillets
- cooking spray
- 1 lemon, quartered
- 2 tablespoons butter, softened
- 2 tablespoons cilantro, chopped
- 1/2 teaspoon grated lemon peel
- 1/4 teaspoon paprika
- 1/8 teaspoon salt

Directions:
- Combine the first three ingredients and wprinkle over both sides of the fish.
- Heat a large non-stick skillet over medium high heat and coat the pan and both sides of the fish with cooking spray.
- Place the fish in the pan and cook for three minutes on each side, or until it flakes with a fork.
- Place the fish on a serving platter and squeeze the lemon wedges over the fish.
- Place the butter and remaining ingredients in a small bowl and stir until blended, serve with the fish.

Roasted Jalapeno Butter

Ingredients:
- 1 jalapeno pepper
- cooking spray
- 7 teaspoons unsalted butter, softened
- 1 teaspoon grated lime zest
- 2 teaspoons honey
- 1/4 teaspoon salt

Directions:
- Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
- Place jalapeno on grill rack coated with cooking spray; cover and grill for 10 minutes or until blackened and charred, turning occasionally.
- Place jalapeno in a small paper bag and fold tightly to seal. Let stand for 5 minutes. Peel and discard skins; cut jalapeno in half lengthwise. Discard stem, seeds and membranes. Finely chop jalapeno.
- Combine jalapeno, butter, lime zest, honey and salt in a small bowl; stir well.
- If desired, brush corn with jalapeno butter.

Baked Tacos 

Ingredients:
- 6 Rhodes Dinner Rolls, thawed to room temperature
- 1 pound lean ground beef
- 2 tablespoons taco seasoning mix
- 4 ounce can diced green chilies
- 1 cup grated cheddar cheese
- salsa
- shredded lettuce
- chopped tomatoes

Directions:
- Spray counter lightly with non-stick cooking spray. Combine rolls together and roll into an 11x8-inch rectangle. Cover with plastic wrap and let rest 10-15 minutes. Place ground beef in a skillet and cook completely. Drain well. Add taco seasoning and green chilies to meat and simmer 5 minutes. Remove wrap from dough. Place dough in a sprayed 10x7-inch baking pan to cover bottom and at least 1-inch up the sides. Poke several times with a fork to prevent bubbles from forming and bake at 350°F 5-7 minutes. Remove from oven and fill with meat mixture. Sprinkle with cheese. Place back in oven and cook an additional 15-20 minutes. Sprinkle with salsa, lettuce and tomatoes to serve.

Lebanese Lentils

Ingredients:
- 2 Tbsp. olive oil
- 4 large onions, sliced
- 2 c. lentils
- 1 c. rice or bulgur wheat, washed
- 5 c. water (more or less)
- salt
- pepper
- 1/4 tsp. cinnamon

Directions:
- Put olive oil in iron frying pan.
- When hot, place onions until blackened.
- In separate pot, put remaining ingredients.
- Add onions to pot.
- Rinse frying pan with small amount of water; add to pot. Bring to boil with high heat, then lower to medium-low heat.
- Cook on slow heat until well done, approximately 1 hour.
- Serve with salad and pita bread.

Perfect White Bread

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. warm water
- 1 tsp. sugar
- 1/4 tsp. ginger
- 2 pkg. dry yeast
- 1/3 c. sugar
- 2 1/2 c. warm water
- 4 c. flour
- 3/4 c. dried skim milk
- 3 c. warm water
- 5 tsp. salt
- 1/2 c. soft lard
- 10 c. flour

Directions:
- Combine the first 4 ingredients and let stand in a warm place until bubbling nicely.
- In a large bowl, stir together 1/3 cup sugar, 2 1/2 cups water, 4 cups flour and 3/4 cup dried skim milk. Stir in the yeast mixture, beating well.
- Cover the bowl and let stand in a warm place until the sponge is well risen and bubbly. Add 3 cups warm water, 5 teaspoons salt and 1/2 cup lard; beat well.
- Stir in 8 cups of flour, mixing until the dough cleans the bowl.
- Spread the remaining 2 cups of flour on the pastry board. Turn out the dough and knead well, using a little additional flour if necessary to make it smooth and satiny.

Lemon Yogurt Pound Cake

Ingredients:
- 2 1/4 c. sifted all-purpose flour
- 1 1/4 c. sugar
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/2 tsp. baking powder
- 1 1/2 tsp. grated lemon peel
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 c. shortening
- 1 (8 oz.) carton lemon yogurt
- 3 eggs

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 325°.
- Put all ingredients into a large mixing bowl and blend at low speed.
- Beat 3 minutes at medium speed. Pour batter into greased and floured 10-inch tube pan.
- Bake at 325° for 65 to 75 minutes or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean.
- Cool for 30 minutes in pan on a rack.
- Remove from pan; cool completely.
- Sprinkle with confectioners sugar.

Chinese Cabbage Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 large head Napa cabbage, wash and chop
- 4 green onions
- 1 c. mushrooms
- 1 can sliced water chestnuts
- 1 c. mayonnaise
- 1 1/2 Tbsp. soy sauce

Directions:
- Mix ingredients together and refrigerate.
- One can Chinese noodles to add at individual taste as they get soggy.

Bread Pudding

Ingredients:
- 5 (5/8-inch) thick slices bread
- 2 Tbsp. soft margarine
- 1/2 c. raisins
- 3 c. milk, scalded
- 3 eggs
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 1/2 tsp. vanilla
- 1/4 tsp. cinnamon

Directions:
- Butter a 10 x 6 1/2 x 1 3/4-inch glass baking dish.
- Toast bread lightly.
- Butter while hot with margarine.
- Cut slices in halves or quarters.
- Fit neatly in prepared dish, overlapping slightly.
- Sprinkle raisins between slices, not over top.
- Scald milk.

Festive Holiday Punch 

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 cups pomegranate (or cranberry) juice
- 1 cup pear nectar
- 1/4 cup Grand Marnier
- 1 bottle Champagne (or Prosecco)

Directions:
- Combine pomegranate juice, pear nectar, and Grand Marnier. Slowly add Champagne, and serve over ice.

Barbecued Sauerkraut

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. chopped onion
- 5 strips bacon, cut up
- 1 (16 oz.) can sauerkraut, drained
- 1 (16 oz.) can tomatoes with juice, cut up
- 3/4 c. brown sugar

Directions:
- In small skillet, saute bacon and onion together.
- In a 2-quart casserole, combine sauerkraut, tomatoes and brown sugar with sauteed bacon and onion.
- Bake in 2-quart casserole uncovered for 2 hours at 350°.

Picante Sauce

Ingredients:
- 10 lb. tomatoes
- 8 jalapeno peppers
- 2 to 3 large onions
- 2 large bell peppers
- 1/4 c. sugar
- 1/2 c. vinegar

Directions:
- Put ingredients in food processor.
- Pour into large pot and cook for 1 1/2 hours.
- Pour into hot jars and seal.
- Process in boiling water for 20 to 30 minutes.

Pork Carnitas With Cilantro Tomatillo Sauce

Ingredients:
- 1 pound pork shoulder
- 2 tablespoons Mazola(R) Corn Oil
- 1/4 cup chopped onions
- 1/2 teaspoon Spice Islands(R) Garlic Powder
- 1 tablespoon Spice Islands(R) Chili Powder
- 1/4 teaspoon Spice Islands(R) Chipotle Chile Powder
- 2 tomatillos, finely chopped
- 1/2 cup finely chopped tomatoes
- 1/4 cup coarsely chopped fresh cilantro
- 4 corn tortillas

Directions:
- Cut pork into 1 inch cubes; season with salt and pepper. Heat oil in large skillet or Dutch oven. Add pork, onions, garlic powder, chili powder and chipotle chile powder; saute 3 to 5 minutes to brown the meat.
- Add enough water to barely cover pork. Bring to a boil; cover, reduce heat and simmer 30 minutes. Remove lid and continue to simmer an additional 45 minutes or until liquid has evaporated.
- Combine chopped tomatillos, tomatoes and cilantro in a small bowl.
- Place an equal amount of pork on each tortilla. Top with tomatillo salsa.

Turkey And Chile Casserole

Ingredients:
- 1/4 c. chopped onion
- 2 1/2 c. chicken broth
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 c. rice
- 1 (4 oz.) can diced green chiles
- 2 c. sour cream
- 2 c. chopped cooked turkey
- 1 1/2 c. shredded Jack cheese

Directions:
- Combine broth, onion, and 1/2 teaspoon salt; heat to boiling. Stir in rice.
- Cover and cook according to package directions. Stir chiles into sour cream with remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt. Layer 1/2 the rice, sour cream, turkey and cheese into 2-quart baking dish.
- Repeat, ending with cheese.
- Bake at 350° for 20 minutes or until heated through.
- Makes 6 to 8 servings.

Lasagna

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 1 box lasagna noodles
- 1 tsp. oregano
- 1/2 tsp. garlic salt
- 1 pkg. Swiss cheese
- 1 carton cottage cheese
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 can cream of chicken soup
- 1 can tomatoes
- 1 small can tomato paste

Directions:
- Cook noodles and brown ground beef.
- Combine beef, soup, spices, tomatoes and paste.
- Simmer.
- Layer ground beef, noodles and cheese in that order and bake at 400° for 20 to 25 minutes.

Chocolate Chess Pie

Ingredients:
- 1 sour cream pie crust, rolled out to fit 9 inch pie dish (in my recipes)
- 1 12 cups sugar
- 5 tablespoons dutch process cocoa
- 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour
- 14 teaspoon salt
- 12 cup evaporated milk
- 3 eggs, room temperature
- 13 cup butter, melted and cooled
- 1 tablespoon vanilla extract
- whipped cream

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
- Prick pie shell with fork.
- Bake 10 minutes.
- Set aside.
- Decrease oven temperature to 330 degrees F.
- Combine sugar, cocoa, flour and salt in large bowl and mix well.
- Blend in milk.
- Beat in eggs, one at a time.
- Add butter and vanilla and beat until smooth.
- Pour into crust.
- Bake until filling is puffed and set, 55-60 minutes.
- Let cool to room temperature before serving.

Chunky Chili

Ingredients:
- 1-1/2 pounds lean beef chuck roast or top round steak, cut into bite-size pieces
- 1 tablespoon canola oil
- 2 cans (14-1/2 ounces each) no-salt-added diced tomatoes, undrained
- 2 medium green peppers, chopped
- 1 large onion, chopped
- 2 garlic cloves, minced
- 1 to 3 tablespoons chili powder
- 2 teaspoons ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- 1 can (15 to 16 ounces) kidney beans, rinsed and drained
- Crusty round French rolls, optional

Directions:
- In a large heavy saucepan, brown meat in oil. Stir in the next seven ingredients; bring to a boil. Reduce heat; cover and simmer for 2-1/2 to 3 hours or until meat is tender. Stir in beans during the last 30 minutes of cooking.
- If desired, serve in bread bowls by hollowing out rolls and spooning chili into center.

Hawaiian Chicken from Aunt Phyllis

Ingredients:
- 14 cup flour
- 14 teaspoon salt
- 14 teaspoon celery salt
- 14 teaspoon nutmeg
- 14 teaspoon garlic powder
- 5 chicken breasts, boned
- 14 cup margarine, for browning
- 1 (13 1/2 ounce) can pineapple chunks, drain and reserve juice
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce

Directions:
- Combine the coating ingredients in a large bowl and coat the chicken with it.
- Brown the chicken in the margarine in a skillet on both sides.
- Mix the reserved pineapple juice and the soy sauce together and add to the chicken after it is browned.
- Reduce flame to low and simmer for 45 minutes.
- Transfer the chicken and the pan juices to an ovenproof dish and bake at 300 degrees for 30 minutes.
- Before serving, add the pineapple chunks.
- Serve with white rice.

New Zealand Corned Beef Hot Pot

Ingredients:
- 3 lbs corned beef
- 6 small onions, peeled
- 3 large carrots, peeled and cut in half
- 1 head garlic, cut in half crosswise (don't peel)
- 3 cups red wine
- 1 1/2 cups water
- 1 sprig fresh rosemary
- 2 bay leaves

Directions:
- Remove the corned beef from its wrapping and discard any liquid and seasoning packet. Rinse in cold water and pat dry with a paper towel. Place in a pot with a tight-fitting lid, that can be used on the stovetop and in the oven.
- Add the rest of the ingredients and bring to a boil. Put the lid on and place in the oven at 250F (or 120C) for 3 hours.

Sweet and Sauerkraut

Ingredients:
- 28 ounces canned sauerkraut, rinsed and drained
- 1 small onion, chopped
- 8 slices bacon, chopped
- 6 garlic cloves, minced
- 12 cup brown sugar
- 12 cup sherry wine
- 1 cup canned crushed pineapple

Directions:
- Saute bacon, onions and garlic until very well browned; drain off fat.
- Add remaining ingredients; mix well.
- Transfer to casserole.
- Cover and bake 45 minutes.

Jicama, Carrot, and Peanut Salad

Ingredients:
- 1/4 teaspoon dried hot red pepper flakes, or to taste
- 1 1/2 cups julienne strips of jicama or firm pear
- 1 1/2 cups julienne strips of carrot
- 1/4 cup chopped salted roasted peanuts
- 3 tablespoons fresh lime juice
- 2 tablespoons thinly sliced scallion greens
- 1/8 teaspoon ground cumin

Directions:
- In a small heavy skillet dry-roast red pepper flakes over moderate heat, stirring, until fragrant, about 2 minutes.
- Transfer pepper flakes to a bowl and toss together with remaining ingredients and salt to taste.

Basic Duck Marinade Recipe

Ingredients:
- 2 c. dry red wine
- 1/2 c. soy sauce
- 1/4 c. balsamic or possibly red wine vinegar
- 1/4 c. vegetable oil
- 1 med onion diced
- 6 x garlic cloves chopped
- 1 Tbsp. freshly-cracked black pepper

Directions:
- Combine all ingredients in a container with a tight fitting lid.
- Shake well and pour over game.
- Cover and chill for 6 to 24 hrs, turning occasionally.
- Before cooking, let game drain and pat dry with paper towels.
- This recipe yields about 1 qt.
- Yield: 1 qt

Breakfast Casserole

Ingredients:
- 2 lb. sausage
- 6 eggs
- 2 c. milk
- 14 slices bread
- 3 c. Cheddar cheese
- 1 tsp. dry mustard

Directions:
- Cook sausage; chop into small pieces.
- Mix eggs, milk and dry mustard.
- Take sides off bread and cube.
- Line bottom of casserole dish with bread.
- Then add sausage and cheese; pour egg mixture on top.
- Put in refrigerator overnight.
- Cook at 325° for 1 hour.

Stir-Fried Shrimp With Vegetables

Ingredients:
- 2 medium carrots
- 1 c. fresh mushrooms
- 1 lb. fresh or frozen shrimp in shells
- 1/2 c. chicken broth
- 1 Tbsp. cornstarch
- 1/4 c. soy sauce
- 2 Tbsp. cooking oil
- 1 clove garlic, minced
- 1 tsp. grated ginger root
- 1 c. thinly sliced cauliflower
- 2 c. chopped bok choy
- 1 c. fresh pea pods or 6 oz. pkg. frozen pea pods, thawed
- 1 c. fresh bean sprouts

Directions:
- Thinly slice carrots and mushrooms.
- Thaw shrimp, if frozen. Shell and devein shrimp.
- Halve shrimp lengthwise.
- Blend chicken broth into cornstarch; stir in soy sauce and set aside.

Hamburger Minestrone

Ingredients:
- Handful of gamesa stars pasta
- 2 cans diced tomatoes
- 1 can corn
- 1 can kidney beans
- 1 can sliced green beans
- 1 lb hamburger
- 1 onion, chopped
- 2 stalk diced celery
- 2 beef bouillon cubes

Directions:
- Saute onion, celery and hamburger until brown.
- Drain.

Tuna Fish 

Ingredients:
- Tuna Fish 36 Oz.
- Tomato 3.
- Onion Large one.
- Oil.
- Corn Starch.
- Soy Sauce
- Garlic Paste - 2 tea spoon.
- Ginger Paste - 1 tea spoon.

Directions:
- Put oil on the frying pan.
- Put chopped onions and fry.
- Put garlic and ginger and stir.
- Put Tuna and chopped tomatoes.
- Cook until water is gone. Put some soy sauce and Corn Starch if necessary.

Rice With Black Beans

Ingredients:
- 1 onion, chopped
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
- 1 (14.5 ounce) can stewed tomatoes
- 1 (15 ounce) can black beans, undrained
- 1/2 teaspoon dried oregano
- 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
- 1 cup instant white rice

Directions:
- In a large saucepan, cook and stir onion in oil until tender and translucent, but not brown. Add tomatoes, beans, oregano and garlic powder. Bring to boil. Stir in rice, return mixture to a boil. Reduce heat to simmer, and cover.
- Let mixture simmer for 5 minutes. Remove pan from heat and let stand 5 minutes before serving.

Banana Bread

Ingredients:
- 2 cups All-purpose Flour
- 1 teaspoon Baking Soda
- 1/4 teaspoons Salt
- 1/2 cups Butter, Softened
- 3/4 cups Brown Sugar, Packed
- 2 whole Eggs, Beaten
- 2-1/3 cups Mashed Overripe Bananas

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Lightly grease a 9X5 inch loaf pan.
- In a large bowl, combine flour, baking soda and salt. In a separate bowl, cream together butter and brown sugar. Mix in eggs and mashed bananas until well blended.
- Add flour mixture to banana mixture, and stir until just moistened. Pour batter into prepared loaf pan, and bake 60-65 minutes, until a toothpick inserted in loaf comes out clean. Poke several different spots, as you may hit a banana chunk and think the loaf is underdone, when it in fact isn't.
- Let cool in pan for 10 minutes, and turn out on wire rack to complete cooling.

Shelley'S Special Cod Dinner 

Ingredients:
- 8 oz or more cod per person
- 2 small (2-3" dia., 6-8" long) yellow squash (small green zucchini if you can't get yellow)
- 1 medium onion
- One can of italian style chopped tomatoes (Two for two people)
- Optional: Other vegetables as inspired - such as sliced mushrooms or sliced red pepper

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 500 degrees. Either spray with Pam, or drizzle some olive oil in the bottom of a baking dish. (A medium glass lasagna pan works fine.) Slice the zucchini and and onion in medium slices and layer them in the pan. Top with one to two cans of tomatoes. Drizzle with more olive oil. Sprinkle with ground pepper and liberal amounts of thyme. Cook the vegetables for twenty-five minutes.
- After twenty-five minutes, layer the cod on top of the vegetables. Sprinkle the cod with ground black pepper and olive oil. Cook an additional 12 - 14 minutes. Check the fish. It's done with it "flakes" with a fork.

Barbecued Spareribs

Ingredients:
- 3 to 4 lb. spareribs, cut into serving-size pieces
- 1 Tbsp. salt
- 1/2 tsp. pepper
- 2 medium onions, sliced
- 3/4 c. ketchup
- 3/4 c. water
- 2 Tbsp. vinegar
- 2 Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
- 1 tsp. chili powder
- 1 tsp. paprika
- 1/2 tsp. ground red pepper

Directions:
- Sprinkle ribs on both sides with salt and pepper; place in a shallow roasting pan.
- Lay onion slices over ribs.
- Combine remaining ingredients and pour over ribs.
- Cover and bake at 350° for 1 hour; baste occasionally, turning ribs twice.
- Remove cover and bake 15 minutes longer.

Carrot Soup

Ingredients:
- 2 Tbsp. butter
- 3/4 c. onion, chopped
- 3 c. carrots, chopped
- 4 c. chicken stock
- 2 Tbsp. tomato paste
- 2 Tbsp. plain raw rice
- salt and white pepper
- 1/2 c. heavy cream
- 1 Tbsp. butter

Directions:
- In a heavy saucepan, melt butter over moderate heat.
- Stir in onion and cook five minutes until soft, but not brown.
- Add carrots, stock, tomato paste and rice.
- Simmer 30 minutes.
- Puree the soup through a food mill or blender until smooth.
- Season and stir in cream.
- Reheat before serving.
- Add butter and garnish with carrot curls.
- Serves 6.

Slim Bloody Mary Deviled Eggs

Ingredients:
- 6 hard-boiled large eggs
- 3 tablespoons reduced-fat mayonnaise
- 1 tablespoon reduced-sodium tomato juice
- 3/4 teaspoon prepared horseradish
- 1/4 teaspoon hot pepper sauce
- 1/8 teaspoon salt
- 1/8 teaspoon pepper
- Crumbled cooked bacon, optional

Directions:
- Cut eggs in half lengthwise. Remove yolks; set aside egg whites and four yolks (discard remaining yolks or save for another use).
- In a large bowl, mash reserved yolks. Stir in mayonnaise, tomato juice, horseradish, pepper sauce, salt and pepper. Stuff or pipe into egg whites. If desired, garnish with bacon. Chill until serving.

Baby Ham & Eggs

Ingredients:
- 6 quail eggs
- 6 slices baguette (sliced 1/4" thick) OR 6 slices rustic bread warmed and cut to 1/4" thick and about 2 inches wide
- handful of baby arugula
- 6 thin slices proscuitto (or duck proscuitto to be found in specialty stores - even better!)
- sea salt (I used Himilayan Pink -- but any sea salt will do)
- pepper
- olive oil
- squeeze of lemon (optional)

Directions:
- Warm the baguette or rustic bread and cut to indicated size.
- Place small amount of baby arugula, and proscuitto (folded in fours) on each bread.
- Fry quail eggs in olive oil over medium low heat, basting yolks gently at end. (They will cook very quickly).
- Place a quail egg on each bread/arugula/proscuitto portion. Sprinkle with sea salt and a little fresh ground pepper. Add squeeze of lemon and enjoy.

Carrot Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 c. cooking oil
- 2 c. sugar
- 3 eggs
- 2 c. flour
- 2 tsp. cinnamon
- 1 tsp. salt
- 2 1/2 tsp. baking soda
- 1 c. coconut (optional)
- 8 oz. crushed pineapple with juice
- 2 c. grated carrots
- 3/4 c. chopped nuts

Directions:
- Cream oil and sugar.
- Add eggs and beat well.
- Mix flour, cinnamon, salt and baking soda.
- Add flour to creamed ingredients and beat until smooth.
- Add coconut, pineapple, carrots and nuts and mix in well.

Party Punch

Ingredients:
- 1 qt. ginger ale
- 1 qt. pineapple juice
- 1 qt. vanilla ice cream
- 1 qt. lime sherbet

Directions:
- Mix with mixer.
- Make shortly before serving.

Tzatziki 

Ingredients:
- 8 oz Greek yogurt
- 3 garlic cloves
- 1 cucumber
- 1 tbsp olive oil
- 1 tbsp lemon juice
- dill
- mint

Directions:
- -Peel, dice, and drain cucumber
- -Mix with garlic, olive oil, lemon juice, and dill/mint
- -Fold gently into yogurt
- -Refrigerate several hours to a day before serving
- 
- Note: drain all liquids, key to good tzatziki is to get prevent moisture from thinning it out

Carrot Salad- Quick and Easy

Ingredients:
- 6 large carrots peeled
- 1/4 cup lemon juice fresh
- 2 cloves garlic minced, or more or less to taste
- 1 1/2 teaspoons cumin ground, or to taste
- 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper or more or less to taste
- 1 x salt to taste
- 3 1/2 tablespoons olive oil, extra-virgin
- 1/4 cup parsley leaves or cilantro, freshly chopped

Directions:
- Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.
- Add the whole carrots (cut them in half if they don't fit in the pot) and cook until just cooked through, 5 to 8 minutes.
- Drain and cut carrots into 1/2-inch thick slices.
- Whisk together the lemon juice, garlic, cumin, cayenne, olive oil and salt in a large bowl.
- Stir in the parsley.
- Add the cooked carrots and toss to combine.
- Serve cold or at room temperature.

Mayonnaise Cake

Ingredients:
- 2 c. flour
- 1 c. sugar
- 2 tsp. baking soda
- 1/2 c. Crisco
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1 c. cold water
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 c. mayonnaise

Directions:
- Mix flour, sugar, baking soda, Crisco and salt in a large bowl. Add water and vanilla. Beat well, then add mayonnaise. Bake in oven at 375° for 30 minutes. Cool before frosting.

Cooked Salad Dressing

Ingredients:
- 1/4 cup sugar
- 1 teaspoon all-purpose flour
- 1 teaspoon ground mustard
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1 large egg, lightly beaten
- 1/3 cup white vinegar
- 2 tablespoons water
- 1 teaspoon butter
- 1/2 cup mayonnaise
- Torn mixed salad greens

Directions:
- In a small saucepan, combine the sugar, flour, mustard and salt. Stir in egg until smooth. Gradually add vinegar and water. Cook and stir over medium heat for 3 minutes or until mixture reaches at least 160° and coats the back of a metal spoon.
- Remove from the heat; stir in butter. Let stand for 5 minutes. Stir in mayonnaise until smooth. Cover and refrigerate until chilled. Serve with salad greens.

Beef And Chile Rellenos Bake

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 1/2 c. chopped onion
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 4 eggs, beaten
- 1 1/2 c. milk
- 1/4 c. flour
- 2 (4 oz.) cans whole green chilies
- 1 1/2 c. (6 oz.) shredded Cheddar
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- dash of pepper
- 1/8 tsp. Tabasco sauce

Directions:
- Cook first four ingredients until meat is brown and drain. Drain chilies and cut in half.
- Layer half of chilies and cheese in lightly greased 8 x 8-inch baking dish.
- Top with meat mixture. Top with remaining chilies and cheese,

Apple Whipped Sweet Potatoes

Ingredients:
- 3 c. sliced apples
- 3 c. cubed peeled fresh sweet potatoes (about 1 1/4 lb.)
- 1 1/2 c. apple juice or cider
- 1/4 tsp. nutmeg
- 3 Tbsp. margarine or butter
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1/2 tsp. cinnamon
- 1/4 tsp. ginger
- 1/2 c. firmly packed brown sugar
- 1/3 c. chopped pecans

Directions:
- Place apples, sweet potatoes and apple juice in a 3-quart saucepan. Cover and cook over medium heat about 20 minutes or until tender. Drain. Add salt, spices, margarine and sugar to mixture. Mash with mixer or by hand until potatoes are smooth. (I liked this better when I put mixture in blender and blended until smooth. You could also use a food processor.) Spread mixture in ovenproof serving dish. Sprinkle with nuts. (You can also cover with miniature marshmallows.) Bake at 350° about 15 minutes or until marshmallows are melted and lightly browned. Serve hot. Makes 6 servings.

Pineapple Mandarin Salad

Ingredients:
- 2 cans Mandarin oranges
- 2 tall cans pineapple tidbits
- 1 small box lemon Jell-O
- 1 small box orange Jell-O
- 1 (10 oz.) bag miniature marshmallows
- 1/2 pt. whipping cream
- 1/3 c. mayonnaise
- sharp Cheddar cheese, shredded

Directions:
- Prepare Jell-O using fruit and add water to make 4 cups.
- Add fruit and marshmallows on top.
- Chill.
- At least 4 hours before serving, whip cream and fold in mayonnaise.
- Spread on top of Jell-O and sprinkle with cheese.

Lasagne

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 1/2 c. chopped onion
- 1 (1 lb.) can tomatoes
- 1 (6 oz.) can tomato paste
- 1/3 c. water
- 1 garlic clove, minced
- 1 tsp. oregano
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1/2 lb. lasagne noodles, cooked
- 2 (6 oz.) pkg. Kraft natural Mozzarella cheese, sliced
- 1/2 lb. Velveeta cheese, thinly sliced
- 1/2 c. Kraft grated Parmesan cheese

Directions:
- Brown meat; add onion and cook until tender.
- Stir in tomatoes, tomato paste, water, garlic and seasonings.
- Cover and simmer 30 minutes.

Fruit Cobbler

Ingredients:
- 3/4 c. fruit (your choice: blackberries, gooseberries, raspberries, blue plums, apples, apricots, peaches, cherries or rhubarb
- 3/4 c. sugar
- 3 Tbsp. butter
- 1/2 c. milk
- 1 c. flour
- 1 tsp. baking powder
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1 c. sugar
- 1 Tbsp. cornstarch
- dash of salt
- 1 c. boiling water

Directions:
- Butter 9 x 13-inch pan; place fruit in pan.
- Cream 3/4 cup sugar and butter.
- Add milk, flour, baking powder and 1/4 teaspoon salt.
- Mix and spread over fruit.
- Mix 1 cup sugar, cornstarch and dash of salt and spread over batter.
- Pour boiling water over batter and bake one hour at 375°.
- Can use frozen, canned or fresh fruit.
- If you use canned fruit, use juice for water and reduce some sugar.

Shrimp & Mushroom Chowder Recipe

Ingredients:
- 1/2 pound cooked shrimp (scallops or possibly crabs or possibly any combination of)
- 1/2 pound fresh mushrooms, sliced
- 1 med. onion, minced
- 2 tbsp. butter
- 1/4 c. flour
- 2 c. fish broth, clam juice or possibly chicken stock
- 1/2 c. dry white wine (optional)
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon dill weed
- 1/2 teaspoon thyme
- 1/4 teaspoon mace or possibly nutmeg
- 1/2 c. whipping cream

Directions:
- Saute/fry mushrooms and onions in butter for 2 min.
- Stir in flour.
- Continue cooking for 1 minute to make roux.
- Slowly stir in broth, add in wine.
- Add in remaining ingredients, mix slowly till thickened.
- Add in shrimp.
- Stir in cream just before serving.

Haystacks

Ingredients:
- 2 c. kidney beans
- 1 c. taco sauce
- 1 pkg. chili seasoning mix
- 2 c. grated American cheese
- 1 head lettuce
- 1 large bag nacho cheese Doritos
- 2 c. vegetarian meat

Directions:
- Cook kidney beans for 5 minutes with taco sauce and chili seasoning mix.
- Add meat and let simmer for about 2 minutes.

Tater Tot Casserole

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 1 medium onion
- 1 medium green pepper
- 1 pkg. frozen peas or corn
- 1 can cream of mushroom soup
- 1 pkg. Tater Tots
- Velveeta cheese
- season to taste

Directions:
- Brown ground beef with onion, bell pepper and season to taste. Layer in dish with frozen vegetables and mushroom soup.
- Add a layer of Velveeta cheese. Top with a layer of Tater Tots and bake at 350° for 45 minutes.

Peanut Punch- Vegan- No Sugar

Ingredients:
- 2 1/2 cups sugar-free chunky peanut butter
- 3 cups unsweetened soymilk
- 2 1/2 cups water
- 12 g xylitol sugar substitute

Directions:
- blend all together, serve over the ice.

Ashkenazic Chicken With Figs (Huhn Mit Feigen) Recipe

Ingredients:
- 1 x chicken, cut into pcs - (2 1/2 to 3 lb.)
- 12 x canned or possibly fresh figs - stems removed
- 1 c. dry white wine or possibly water
- 2 Tbsp. honey - up to 4
- 1 tsp grnd cinnamon
- 1 tsp grnd coriander
- 1 tsp salt or possibly to taste
- 1/4 tsp pepper
- 1 x bay leaf Preheat oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit.

Directions:
- Place chicken and figs in a single layer in a large roasting pan.
- Combine wine, honey, cinnamon, coriander, salt and pepper and bay leaf, pour over chicken.
- Roast, basting and turning occasionally, till chicken is tender and brown, about 1 hour.
- Note: This dish typifies the Eastern European love of meats cooked with sweeteners and spices.
- To substitute dry for canned figs, cover with water and soak 2 hrs.

Coconut Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 c. Wesson oil
- 1 c. buttermilk
- 1 c. sugar
- 1 3/4 c. all-purpose flour
- 3 egg yolks
- 1/2 tsp. soda
- 1 heaping tsp. baking powder
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1/3 tsp. salt

Directions:
- Cream oil in sugar.
- Add egg yolks.
- Cream well.
- Add buttermilk and flour with soda, baking powder and salt.
- Mix well. Bake in three layers at 350° until done.

Spicy Roast Chicken

Ingredients:
- 1 whole chicken (3 lb.)
- 1 c. fresh cilantro
- 3 Tbsp. lemon juice
- 2 Tbsp. vegetable oil
- 3 cloves garlic
- 1 jalapeno pepper, seed and cut in half
- 1 1/2 tsp. paprika
- 1 tsp. each: ground ginger, cumin and salt
- 1/2 tsp. turmeric

Directions:
- Heat oven to 375°.
- In a blender, process all ingredients (except the chicken) until it is a smooth paste.
- Rub paste over chicken.
- Tie legs together with string and tuck wing tips under back.
- Place breast side up in a baking pan.
- Roast 1 hour.
- Let chicken stand before carving.

Pasta With Winter Squash And Tomatoes 

Ingredients:
- 3 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil
- 1 tablespoon chopped garlic
- 1/4 cup sliced shallots
- 1/4 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes, or to taste
- 2 cups chopped tomatoes
- 1 1/2 to 2 pounds peeled, cubed or shredded butternut or other winter squash, about 5 cups
- 1/2 pound cut pasta, like ziti or penne
- Freshly chopped parsley or Parmesan for garnish.

Directions:
- 1. Bring a large pot of water to a boil and salt it. Put olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic, shallots and pepper flakes and cook for about a minute; add tomatoes and squash, and cook with some salt and pepper.
- 
- 2. When squash is tender - about 10 minutes for shreds, 15 or so for small cubes - cook pasta until it is tender. Combine sauce and pasta, and serve, garnished with parsley or Parmesan.

Easter Buns

Ingredients:
- 8 eggs
- 1 12 cups sugar
- 1 cup cream
- 1 cup milk
- 1 cup water
- 1 cup margarine
- 1 fresh lemon rind, grated
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 10 -11 cups flour
- 3 tablespoons yeast (quick rise)
- 14 cup icing sugar
- 14 cup water
- candy sprinkles

Directions:
- Bear egg whites till stiff.
- Beat yolks with sugar.
- Scald cream and milk.
- Melt margarine.
- Put cream, milk margarine and water in a bowl.
- Add egg yolk mixture.
- Fold in egg whites, lemon rind and vanilla.
- Mix 4 cups flour with yeast and add to above.
- Add the rest of the flour.
- Dough will be sticky.
- Let rise at least an hour.
- Make into buns, place on greased sheets, cover and let rise again.
- Bake 325 for about 15 minutes.
- When cool, mix glaze and top buns with glaze and candy sprinkles.

Blueberry Cheesecake

Ingredients:
- 1 (9-inch) deep dish unbaked pastry shell
- 1 (21 oz.) can Thank You brand blueberry filling or topping
- 1 tsp. lemon rind, grated
- 1 large (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese, softened
- 1 can Eagle Brand sweetened condensed milk (not evaporated milk)
- 2 eggs
- 2 Tbsp. lemon juice (from concentrate)
- 1 tsp. vanilla

Directions:
- Place rack in lowest position in oven.
- Preheat oven to 425°. Combine blueberry pie filling with 1/2 teaspoon lemon rind; pour into pastry shell.
- Bake for 15 minutes.

Red Bean Chili Dip

Ingredients:
- 2 Tbsp. salad oil
- 1 small onion, chopped
- 1 clove garlic, crushed
- 1 tsp. ground red pepper
- 1 tsp. ground cumin
- 1 Tbsp. tomato paste
- 1 Tbsp. red wine vinegar
- 2/3 c. red kidney or pinto beans, cooked for 1 1/2 hours
- 1/2 c. cream cheese
- 1/2 c. grated sharp Cheddar cheese
- salt and pepper to taste

Directions:
- Heat the oil in small pan.
- Add the onion and garlic.
- Fry gently for 4 minutes.
- Add the spices and fry for 1 minute.
- Stir in tomato paste and vinegar.
- Leave to cool.
- Place the beans, cheese and onion mixture in a blender or food processor.
- Work until the consistency of thick mayonnaise.
- Add a little water if necessary.
- Check the seasoning.
- Chill until required.
- Serve with raw vegetables or tortilla chips.
- Makes about 2 cups.

Blackberry Vinaigrette

Ingredients:
- 1 quart red wine vinegar
- 2 cups pure maple syrup
- 4 ounces Dijon mustard
- 2 ounces dry tarragon
- 1 ounce kosher salt
- 1 tablespoon fresh ground pepper (toasted before grinding)
- 3 cups blackberry jam
- 1 quart blended oil (75% Canola/25% Olive Oil)

Directions:
- Put all ingredients into a LARGE container and continue to blend using an immersion blender until all ingredients have blended together well.
- This dressing will store refrigerated for several weeks but will need to be re-stirred before using due to slight separation of the oil.

Grilled Peppered Bread

Ingredients:
- 12 (1/2-inch-thick) French bread slices
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper

Directions:
- Brush both sides of bread slices evenly with olive oil; sprinkle both sides evenly with pepper.
- Grill bread, uncovered, over medium-high heat (350° to 400°) 1 to 2 minutes on each side or until lightly toasted and browned.

Santa Snacks

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. melted butter
- 2 c. graham cracker crumbs
- 2 c. coconut flakes
- 2 c. semi-sweet chocolate pieces
- 1 c. chopped nuts
- 15 oz. can sweetened, condensed milk (not evaporated milk)

Directions:
- Combine butter, graham cracker crumbs, coconut and spread in a 9 x 9-inch square pan.
- Press lightly.
- Cover with chocolate pieces.
- Put nuts on evenly.
- Pour on milk.
- Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.

Japanese Mushroom, Chestnut & Pumpkin Rice 

Ingredients:
- 6 dried shiitake mushrooms (soaked for 30 minutes in 400 ml chicken stock)or 6 fresh shiitake mushrooms
- 2 tbsp mirin, sake or dry sherry
- 1 tbsp soy sauce
- 100g cooked brown basmati rice
- 150g pumpkin, butternut squash or swede (cut into small cubes)
- 1 tbsp sesame seeds (toasted)
- 200g chestnuts (cooked, peeled)

Directions:
- Put the rice, pumpkin, chestnuts, soy sauce and mirin in a small casserole with a lid, lay the mushrooms on the surface stalk-side down. Pour the chicken stock over the rice to cover it by about 1/2 cm, bring to a simmer, cover and cook for 15 minutes or until the rice is tender. Sprinkle with sesame seeds before serving.

Fried Green Tomatoes

Ingredients:
- 4 or 5 medium green tomatoes
- 1/3 c. flour
- 3/4 tsp. salt
- dash of pepper (optional)
- 1/4 c. shortening

Directions:
- Wash tomatoes; remove stem ends.
- Cut crosswise into 1/2-inch slices.
- Combine flour, salt and pepper; dredge tomato slices with flour mixture.
- Brown quickly in shortening on one side; turn. Reduce heat and cook until slices are soft in center.
- Remove to hot platter; serve hot.
- Yields 4 to 5 servings.

Creamy Pralines

Ingredients:
- 3 c. packed light brown sugar
- 1/8 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. cream of tartar
- 1 c. milk
- 2 Tbsp. butter
- 2 1/4 c. pecan halves
- 1 tsp. vanilla

Directions:
- Combine sugar, cream of tartar, salt and milk.
- Stir over low heat until sugar dissolves.
- Cook to 236° to 238°; cool to 220°. Add butter, vanilla and pecans.
- Beat until creamy.
- Drop by spoonfuls on marble or wax paper.
- Makes 1 1/2 to 2 dozen.

Garlic Herb Wine Marinated Salmon

Ingredients:
- 1 (1 ounce) package McCormick Grill Mates Mexican Fiesta Marinade
- 14 cup vegetable oil or 14 cup olive oil
- 14 cup water
- 1 tablespoon white vinegar or 1 tablespoon balsamic vinegar
- 2 lbs salmon fillets

Directions:
- Mix Marinade Mix, oil, water and vinegar in small bowl.
- Place salmon in large resealable plastic bag or glass dish.
- Add marinade; turn to coat well.
- Refrigerate 15 minutes or longer for extra flavor.
- Remove salmon from marinade.
- Discard any remaining marinade.
- Grill over medium-high heat 6 to 7 minutes per side or fish flakes easily with a fork.

Jumbo Oatmeal Cookies

Ingredients:
- 1 1/4 c. margarine (2 1/2 sticks)
- 3/4 c. brown sugar
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 1 c. semi-sweet chocolate chips
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 1/2 c. flour
- 1 tsp. baking soda
- dash of salt
- 3 c. oats, uncooked
- 1 egg
- 1 c. chopped nuts (optional)

Directions:
- Heat oven to
- 375°.
- Beat
- margarine
- and
- sugars until light and fluffy.
- Beat
- in
- egg	and vanilla.
- Combine flour, baking soda and
- salt;
- add to margarine mixture, mixing well. Stir in oats and chocolate chips (and optional nuts).

Hash Brown Casserole

Ingredients:
- 1 stick butter or margarine
- 1 (10 3/4 oz.) can cream of chicken soup
- 2 to 3 c. sharp cheese
- 16 oz. container sour cream
- 2 lb. bag frozen hash browns
- 1 small box cornflake cereal

Directions:
- Combine all ingredients except for the cornflakes.
- Melt the margarine before mixing with other ingredients (soup doesn't need to be heated).
- Put into a 13 x 9 1/2-inch pan.
- Crumble cornflakes by hand and spread across top of casserole, approximately 1/2-inch thick.
- Bake covered at 350° for 1 hour. Take foil off of casserole and continue baking for approximately 15 to 20 minutes or until cornflakes are a golden brown.
- Serves 10 to 12.

Louisiana Yam Pie

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 1/4 tsp. cinnamon
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 3 eggs, well beaten
- 9-inch pie shell (unbaked)
- 1 1/2 mashed yams
- 2 Tbsp. margarine
- 1 c. Pet milk
- 1/2 tsp. lemon extract

Directions:
- Mix sugar, salt and cinnamon and mix with eggs; add margarine and mashed yams.
- Mix and add lemon extract and milk, mixing well at all times.
- Bake at 400° for 15 minutes; reduce to 375° and cook 30 minutes.

Frosty Tomato Cups(Doubles As A Salad)  

Ingredients:
- 3 (1 lb. 12 oz.) cans tomatoes, drained or 5 fresh medium tomatoes, chopped
- 1 1/2 c. green pepper strips
- 1 medium onion, cut into rings
- 1/3 c. oil
- 1 tsp. salt
- 2 Tbsp. vinegar
- 3/4 tsp. oregano
- 3/4 tsp. basil
- 1/4 tsp. pepper

Directions:
- Combine all ingredients, chill.
- Makes 8 servings.

Stew

Ingredients:
- 1 large fryer
- 3 lb. pork roast
- 6 to 8 large Irish potatoes, diced
- 2 large onions, chopped
- 2 cans Pride of Illinois cream-style corn
- 2 cans tomatoes
- 1 large can tomato juice
- 1 stick margarine (optional)
- salt and pepper to taste

Directions:
- Boil pork and chicken together.
- When done, cool and debone, pulling off excess fat.
- Work meat up together real good.
- Cook potatoes and onions where meat was cooked.
- After they are cooked, add other ingredients, except corn.
- Add corn not long before done.
- Best cooked several hours on low.

Quick Chicken Pot Pie

Ingredients:
- 1 can chicken
- 1 can cream of chicken soup
- 1 can Veg-All
- salt and pepper
- 1 can biscuits

Directions:
- Mix chicken, soup and Veg-All together.
- Season with salt and pepper.
- Pour in a casserole dish and layer with canned biscuits on top of the mixture.
- Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.

Prune Cake

Ingredients:
- 3 eggs
- 1 1/2 c. sugar
- 1 c. cooking oil
- 1 c. buttermilk
- 1 c. cooked, chopped prunes
- 1/2 c. chopped pecans
- 1 tsp. soda
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 1 tsp. nutmeg
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 tsp. allspice
- 2 c. flour
- Karo syrup or equivalent

Directions:
- Read all directions before starting!!

Char 's Taverns

Ingredients:
- 3 lbs hamburger
- 1 onion
- 1 (1 1/4 ounce) packageshillings Manwich sloppy joe mix
- 1 (8 ounce) can tomato sauce

Directions:
- Chop onion fine.
- Brown with ground beef.
- Drain fat off.
- Add tomato sauce and sauce mix.
- Add 1 cup water.
- Cook water off.
- Serve on hamburger buns that have been grilled if you want.

Chicken Noodle Soup

Ingredients:
- 1 whole chicken
- 1/2 c. barley
- 2 carrots
- 1 medium onion, chopped
- egg noodles
- salt and pepper to taste

Directions:
- Boil chicken and set meat aside to cool.
- Place all ingredients into broth.
- Debone chicken and place in pot; also add noodles.
- Finish cooking.
- Salt and pepper to taste.

Golden Coconut Almond Muffins

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1 cup shredded coconut
- 1/2 cup white sugar
- 1/3 cup chopped toasted almonds
- 1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder
- 3/4 teaspoon orange zest
- 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 3/4 cup unsweetened coconut milk
- 1/4 cup orange juice
- 1/4 cup extra virgin olive oil
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Lightly grease a 12 cup muffin pan.
- In a large bowl, mix flour, shredded coconut, sugar, almonds, baking powder, orange zest, baking soda, and salt.
- In a medium bowl, whisk together coconut milk, orange juice, olive oil, and vanilla extract. Pour into the flour mixture, and stir until just blended. Transfer to the prepared muffin pan.
- Bake 15 minutes in the preheated oven, until a knife inserted in the center of a muffin comes out clean. Turn onto a wire rack to cool before serving.

Chicken Casserole

Ingredients:
- 1 c. milk
- 1 can cream of chicken soup
- 1 can cream of celery
- 1 c. frozen peas
- 2 cans or 1 large boned chicken
- 1 c. instant rice

Directions:
- Put into greased dish.
- Bake at 350° for 45 to 60 minutes. Very good.

Rhubarb Coconut Pie

Ingredients:
- 3 egg yolks, slightly beaten
- 3/4 c. sugar
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1/4 c. water
- 4 Tbsp. flour
- 2 Tbsp. melted butter
- 4 c. fresh rhubarb, cut in 1/2-inch pieces
- 1 unbaked 9-inch pie shell
- 3 egg whites
- 1/3 c. sugar
- 3/4 c. shredded coconut

Directions:
- Combine egg yolks, 3/4 cup sugar, salt and water.
- Add flour and butter, blending well.
- Add rhubarb and mix thoroughly.
- Turn into unbaked pie shell.
- Bake in hot oven (425°) for 45 minutes or until filling and crust are done.

Pork Chop Bake

Ingredients:
- 8 pork chops
- 1 tsp. salt
- 8 slices onion
- 8 slices lemon
- 1/2 c. firmly packed brown sugar
- 3/4 c. catsup

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350°.
- Place pork chops in large baking dish and sprinkle with salt.
- Top each pork chop with onion slice and lemon slice.
- Mix brown sugar and catsup in small bowl and pour over pork chops.
- Cover.
- Bake at 350° for 1 hour, then uncover and bake for 15 minutes longer.

O'Brien Potatoes

Ingredients:
- 2 c. diced potatoes
- 1/4 c. finely chopped onion
- 1 tsp. parsley flakes
- 1/4 c. chopped pimientos
- 1/4 c. chopped green peppers
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1/4 c. butter, melted

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350°.
- Grease 1-quart casserole.
- Cook potatoes in a little boiling salted water 10 minutes or until just tender.
- Drain; turn into casserole.
- Add onion, parsley, pimientos and green peppers.
- Season with salt and pepper; toss lightly.
- Sprinkle with butter.
- Bake in a preheated oven 20 minutes.
- Serves 4.

Cheery Cherry Punch

Ingredients:
- 3 pkg. 3 oz each cherry gelatin
- 2 - 3 c. sugar
- 6 c. boiling water
- 1 - 46 oz can unsweetened pineapple juice
- 1 - 12 oz. can frozen orange juice concentrate
- 1 - 12 oz. can frozen lemonade concentrate
- 1 gallon cold water
- 2 liters ginger ale

Directions:
- Dissolve gelatin and sugar in boiling water.
- Add pineapple juice, concentrates and cold water.
- Mix well and freeze.
- Just before serving, add ginger ale and mix well.

Grandma Hazel'S Gin Fizz 

Ingredients:
- 1 cup Gin
- 1 quart Lemonade
- 1 quart Orange Juice
- 1 pint Half & Half
- .5 pint Whipping Cream
- 3 tablespoons Sugar
- 3 Egg Whites

Directions:
- 1. Whip the Whipping Cream
- 2. Whip the Egg Whites
- 3. Fold Whipped Cream and Egg Whites together with Sugar.
- 4. Combine Gin, Lemonade, Orange Juice and Half & Half with the Whipped items in a large bowl or pitcher
- 5. Add Ice now or later if you keep it refrigerated.

Veggie Bars

Ingredients:
- 2 (8 oz.) pkg. crescent dinner rolls
- 1 pkg. original Ranch dressing mix
- 2 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese
- 1/2 c. milk
- 1 c. green onion, chopped
- 1 c. grated carrots
- 1 c. broccoli florets, chopped
- 1 c. grated Cheddar cheese

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350°.
- Unroll dough on cookie sheet.
- Press dough together to make one sheet.
- Bake 10 minutes or until brown. Let cool; mix dressing with cream cheese.
- Stir in milk until spreadable.
- Spread on dough.
- Sprinkle with onion, broccoli and carrots.
- Sprinkle cheese on top.
- Let set for awhile before serving.
