Coconut Rice

Ingredients:
- 2 cups basmati rice (or long grained rice)
- 4 cups water
- 1 tablespoon canola oil (or veg oil)
- 1 inch cinnamon
- 3 cloves
- 2 cardamoms
- 14 teaspoon garlic
- 13 teaspoon turmeric
- salt
- 2 tablespoons of grated creamed coconut
- 12 medium onion, very finely chopped

Directions:
- Heat the oil and saute onions, cinnamon, cloves, cardamoms until onions are golden brown.
- Add the rice and stir till they look translucent (just a minute or two).
- Add water, salt, coconut, and turmeric.
- Bring to the point of boiling (when you see a bubble or two, turn the heat down to medium and cover and cook until all the water has been absorbed).
- Turn off the heat.
- Let it sit covered for about 15 min before serving.

Amaretto Dream Cupcakes

Ingredients:
- 3/4 cup butter, softened
- 1-1/2 cups packed brown sugar
- 2 large eggs
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1-1/2 teaspoons baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 cup buttermilk
- 1/4 cup amaretto
- 1/3 cup slivered almonds

Directions:
- In a large bowl, cream butter and brown sugar until light and fluffy. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each.
- Combine the flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt. Add to the creamed mixture alternately with buttermilk and amaretto, beating well after each addition. Stir in almonds.
- Fill paper-lined muffins cups two-thirds full. Bake at 375° for 14-16 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. Cool for 5 minutes before removing from pans to wire racks to cool completely. Frost cupcakes.

Southern Pineapple Ade

Ingredients:
- 2 pkg. presweetened lemon-lime Kool-Aid
- 1 (1 qt. 14 oz.) can pineapple juice
- 2 (10 oz.) bottles Sprite

Directions:
- Combine Kool-Aid and 3 quarts water; add juice.
- Pour over ice in large punch bowl.
- Add Sprite before serving.

Hot Broccoli Dip

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. finely chopped celery
- 1/2 c. finely chopped onion
- 2 Tbsp. margarine
- 1 lb. Velveeta cheese, cubed
- 1 (10 oz.) pkg. frozen chopped broccoli, thawed and drained
- 1/4 tsp. dried rosemary leaves, crushed

Directions:
- Saute celery and onions in margarine.
- Add cheese spread; stir over low heat until cheese is melted.
- Stir in remaining ingredients.
- Heat thoroughly, stirring constantly.
- Serve with vegetable dippers.
- Makes 3 cups.

Scalloped Potatoes

Ingredients:
- 1 c. sour cream
- 1 can condensed cream of chicken soup
- 1/4 c. butter
- 1/3 c. sliced green onions
- 1 1/2 c. shredded cheddar cheese
- 1 package frozen hash brown potatoes thawed
- 1/2 c. cracker crumbs
- salt and pepper

Directions:
- Mix sour cream, soup, butter, green onions and 1 c. cheese. Put in a greased 3 qt. casserole, gently stir in potatoes, salt and pepper.
- Top with remaining cheese and cracker crumbs.

Chinese Radish Salad

Ingredients:
- 1/2 cup radish, sliced thinly
- 1 carrot, sliced thinly
- 1 tablespoon soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon rice wine vinegar
- 1 tablespoon honey
- 1 teaspoon peanut oil
- 1/2 teaspoon hot pepper sauce (optional)
- 2 cups alfalfa sprouts (I use half lentil sprouts)
- salt and pepper

Directions:
- Combine radishes and carrot in a shallow container. Whisk the soy sauce, vinegar, honey, oil and hot pepper sauce together in a small bowl. Pour over the radishes and carrot. Cover and marinate in fridge for 1 hour minimum.
- Just before serving, place the alfalfa sprouts on a small serving dish and arrange the radishes and carrots on top. Salt and pepper to taste. Enjoy!
- Serves 4.

Chess Cake Or Caramel Brownies

Ingredients:
- 1 box light brown sugar
- 2 sticks butter or margarine
- 4 eggs
- 1 c. chopped nuts
- 2 c. flour
- 1 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 c. white sugar
- 1 tsp. vanilla

Directions:
- Melt brown sugar and butter together.
- Add white sugar and eggs, one at a time.
- Add dry ingredients, nuts and vanilla.
- Stir well.
- Bake in 9 x 13-inch pan about 30 minutes at 350°.
- When slightly cool, cut in squares.
- Can be rolled in powdered sugar.

Carmellized Shallots 

Ingredients:
- 6 tablespoons (3/4 stick) unsalted butter
- 2 pounds fresh shallots, peeled, with roots intact
- 3 tablespoons sugar
- 3 tablespoons good red wine vinegar
- 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt
- 1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
- 2 tablespoons chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley

Directions:
- Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
- 
- Melt the butter in a 12-inch ovenproof saute pan, add the shallots and sugar, and toss to coat. Cook over medium heat for 10 minutes, tossing occasionally, until the shallots start to brown. Add the vinegar, salt, and pepper and toss well.
- 
- Place the saute pan in the oven and roast for 15 to 30 minutes, depending on the size of the shallots, until they are tender. Season, to taste, sprinkle with parsley, and serve hot.

Seven Minute Frosting

Ingredients:
- 2 egg whites (unbeaten)
- 1 1/2 c. sugar
- 5 Tbsp. water
- 1 1/2 tsp. light corn syrup
- 1 tsp. vanilla

Directions:
- Combine egg whites, sugar, water and corn syrup in top of a double boiler, beating with rotary eggbeater until thoroughly mixed.
- Place over rapidly boiling water; beat constantly with rotary eggbeater and cook 7 minutes, or until frosting will stand in peaks.
- Remove from boiling water.
- Add vanilla; beat until thick enough to spread.
- Makes enough frosting to cover tops and sides of two 9-inch layers or 2 dozen cupcakes.

Wild Rice With Cucumber And Feta

Ingredients:
- 1 (8.5-ounce) package precooked wild rice (such as Archer Farms)
- 1 cup diced English cucumber
- 1 1/2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice
- 2 ounces crumbled feta cheese
- 1/2 teaspoon pepper
- 1/4 teaspoon salt

Directions:
- Prepare rice according to the package directions.
- Combine cooked rice, cucumber, olive oil, lemon juice, and crumbled feta cheese in a medium bowl; toss to coat. Stir in pepper and salt.

Pumpkin Spice Cake

Ingredients:
- 2 c. flour
- 2 tsp. baking powder
- 1 tsp. baking soda
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 1 3/4 c. sugar
- 4 eggs
- 2 c. pumpkin filling
- 1 c. oil
- 1/2 c. walnuts

Directions:
- Mix together the dry ingredients. Add eggs, pumpkin and oil. Blend in nuts. Grease and flour 9-inch cake pans.
- Bake for 30 minutes at 350°.
- You may use a 9 x 13-inch pan.

Mexican Chicken With Rice

Ingredients:
- 1 fryer, cut up or 4 to 5 chicken breasts
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1/2 c. chopped onion
- 1 c. rice, uncooked
- 1/2 c. chopped green pepper
- 1 small can stewed tomatoes or 1 small can tomato sauce
- 2 cloves garlic
- 1 1/2 to 2 c. chicken broth
- dash of red pepper flakes

Directions:
- Sprinkle chicken with salt and pepper;	brown
- in
- oil. Remove from pan.	Add onion, peppers,
- tomatoes,	red
- pepper flakes and garlic in skillet.	Stir in broth and
- bring
- to
- a boil.
- Add rice.
- Place rice mixture in bottom of
- 9 x 13-inch pan.
- Top with chicken pieces.
- Bake covered 1
- hour
- or until done at 375°.

Open House Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 c. mayo or 1/2 c. mayo and 1/2 c. Miracle Whip
- 1/4 c. apple cider vinegar
- 2/3 c. sugar
- 1/2 c. milk
- 2 Tbsp. poppy seed
- 1 head romaine lettuce
- 1 red onion, sliced
- 1 pt. strawberries, cut in half

Directions:
- Blend first 5 ingredients and refrigerate.
- Layer ingredients and pour dressing over or toss.

Coconut Chicken With Coriander

Ingredients:
- 1 onion, roughly chopped King Sooper's 1 lb For $0.99 thru 02/09
- 2 cloves garlic, crushed
- 1 red capsicum, sliced into strips Target 1 pkg For $2.99 thru 02/06
- 500g chicken fillets, sliced into strips King Sooper's 1 lb For $1.19 thru 02/09
- 1/3 cup KRAFT Crunchy Peanut Butter
- 200ml coconut milk
- 1/2 - 1 cup water
- 1 tablespoon gluten free sweet chilli sauce
- 1 bunch baby bok choy, trimmed Safeway 1 lb For $1.28 thru 02/09
- 1 tablespoon chopped coriander

Directions:
- Heat a wok or frying pan, add a little oil and stir fry onion, garlic and red capsicum for 3 minutes or until onion is soft.
- Add chicken in small amounts and stir fry until lightly brown.
- Stir in peanut butter, coconut milk, water, sweet chilli sauce and bok choy.
- Cook a further 3 minutes or until sauce boils and thickens slightly.
- Stir through the coriander and serve with rice or noodles.

Bumble Bee Kiss

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 oz white rum
- 3/4 oz honey
- 1 oz half and half cream

Directions:
- Shake and strain into a glass.
- Enjoy!

Peanut Butter Dressing

Ingredients:
- 1/4 c. peanut butter
- 1/3 c. salad oil
- 1/4 c. cider vinegar
- 1/2 c. salt
- 5 tsp. sugar
- 1/2 tsp. prepared mustard
- pinch of paprika
- pinch of hot red pepper

Directions:
- Put all ingredients in a small mixing bowl and beat until smooth with hand electric mixer.
- This is delicious on canned fruits or fresh bananas or apples.

Buttermilk Pie

Ingredients:
- 2 1/4 c. sugar
- 1 1/2 sticks butter
- 1/2 to 1 c. buttermilk
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 4 eggs
- 3 Tbsp. flour
- 1/4 tsp. coconut extract

Directions:
- Mix all together.
- Pour into unbaked pie shells. Bake at 400° until the pie doesn't shake.
- Makes 2 pies.

Apple Butter

Ingredients:
- 16 medium apples (about 6 pounds)
- 2 quarts water
- 1 12 quarts sweet apple cider (the dark cloudy kind)
- 1 12 lbs sugar (3 cups)
- 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 1 teaspoon ground allspice
- 1 teaspoon ground cloves

Directions:
- Wash and cut apples into small pieces (there should be about 4 quarts).
- In a large pot, place apples and cover with water, and cook until soft.
- Pour cooked apples and liquid into a food mill (or press them through a large hole sieve) which has been placed over a large bowl, to puree them and remove skins and seeds.
- Using the same pot you cooked the apples in, add the cider and bring it to a boil, add apple pulp and sugar; cook until mixture thickens, stirring to prevent scorching.
- Stir in all the spices and continue to cook the apple butter until it is thick enough for spreading.
- Pour into sterilized jars and seal.

Zucchini Muffins

Ingredients:
- 3 eggs
- 1 c. oil
- 2 tsp. vanilla
- 2 c. flour
- 1 1/2 c. sugar
- 2 tsp. baking soda
- 2 tsp. cinnamon
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1 c. grated zucchini
- 1 c. grated carrots
- 1 medium apple, grated
- 1 c. raisins
- 1/2 c. nut meats

Directions:
- Grease muffin tins (do not use paper cups).
- Beat the first 3 ingredients.
- Add the other ingredients; mix well.
- Fill muffin tins to the top; will not run over.
- Bake for 20 minutes at 350°.

Figs in Red Wine with Herbed Goat Cheese

Ingredients:
- 2 cups dry red wine
- 1/4 cup honey
- 1 cinnamon stick
- 8 fresh (about 1/2 pound) or 12 dried figs, halved lengthwise
- 1 cup walnuts, finely chopped
- 1 teaspoon chopped fresh thyme leaves
- 1 (3 1/2-ounce) log goat cheese
- Fresh thyme sprigs, to garnish

Directions:
- Figs: In a nonreactive medium pot combine the wine, honey, and cinnamon.
- Bring to a simmer, over low heat, and cook until slightly thickened, about 30 minutes.
- Add the figs and cook for 10 minutes.
- Set aside to cool slightly.
- Remove the cinnamon stick.
- Goat cheese: In a shallow bowl, mix together the walnuts and thyme.
- With damp hands, roll the goat cheese into 1-inch balls.
- Roll the balls into the nut mixture until coated.
- To serve: Spoon the figs into 2 glasses and drizzle with the wine syrup.
- Add the herbed goat cheese and serve.

Pumpkin Cheesecake Bars

Ingredients:
- 1 (16 oz.) pkg. pound cake mix
- 2 Tbsp. margarine, melted
- 1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese
- 2 c. (16 oz.) can pumpkin
- 1 (14 oz.) can sweetened condensed milk
- 3 eggs
- 4 tsp. pumpkin spice
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 c. chopped nuts

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350°.
- In large bowl on low, combine cake mix, 1 egg, margarine and 2 teaspoons pumpkin pie spice.
- Mix until crumbly.
- Press into bottom of 15 x 10-inch pan.
- Set aside.

Meat Loaf

Ingredients:
- 2 to 3 lb. ground beef or chuck
- 3 to 4 slices bread, crumbled
- 2 eggs
- 1 onion, finely chopped
- 1 c. milk
- nutmeg and pepper to taste

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients in order given.
- Place in 8-inch square pan.
- Bake at 350° for 1 to 1 1/2 hours.
- Drain off grease as necessary.

Spinach Hummus

Ingredients:
- 2 cloves garlic
- 2 large green onions, cut off green part
- 1 (15 1/2 oz.) can garbanzo beans, thoroughly drained
- 1 (10 oz.) pkg. frozen spinach, thawed but not squeezed dry
- 1/2 c. lemon juice
- 1/2 c. water
- 1/2 c. tahini paste
- 1/2 tsp. salt

Directions:
- Place garlic and green onion in food processor with metal blade.
- Process until minced.
- Add drained garbanzo beans and puree until smooth.
- Add spinach, lemon juice, water, tahini paste and salt.
- Process until mixed.

Hot Ham And Cheese Sandwiches

Ingredients:
- 1 or 2 pkg. small dinner rolls, fully cooked
- 1/2 to 1 lb. cooked ham, chopped in food processor
- 1/2 to 1 lb. Mozzarella cheese, shredded
- 1/2 stick margarine, melted
- 1 tsp. garlic powder
- 1/4 tsp. dry mustard
- poppy seed

Directions:
- Using a serrated knife, slice rolls horizontally.
- Try to keep rolls from breaking apart.
- Place bottom half of rolls on cookie sheet.
- Layer ham and cheese on rolls.
- Place top half of rolls over ham and cheese. Mix margarine, garlic powder and dry mustard and pour over top of rolls.
- Sprinkle tops generously with poppy seed.
- Bake in 350° oven just until cheese melts.
- Cut into individual servings and serve while warm.

Easy Pork And Asparagus Scaloppine

Ingredients:
- 1/3 cup wishbone lemon garlic and herb salad dressing
- 1/3 cup flour
- 1 lb boneless pork chop, thin cut and cut in half
- 1/2 cup chicken broth
- 2 tablespoons lemon garlic and herb salad dressing
- 3/4 lb fresh asparagus spear, trimmed and cut into 1-inch pieces

Directions:
- Heat a non-stick skillet over med. high heat.
- In separate bowls, place 1/3 cup dressing in one and flour in the other.
- Dip pork pieces into dressing; coat with flour. Add pork to skillet, cook 1 - 2 minutes on each side or until brown.
- Meanwhile, in a small bowl, mix broth and 2 tbsp of dressing.
- Reduce heat to medium, add broth mixture to skillet, moving pork with wooden spoon to scrape up any brown bits.
- Add asparagus; cover and cook 2 - 3 mintues or until asparagus is crisp tender and pork is cooked.
- Serve with buttered angel hair or fettuccine and a nice Caesar salad.
- *You could use chicken for a change, that's what I'm gonna try. :).

Pan Roasted Chicken With Garlic

Ingredients:
- 2 tsp. minced garlic
- 6 Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
- 6 Tbsp. lemon juice
- 1/2 c. water
- 2 tsp. dried oregano or parsley
- 3 Tbsp. melted butter
- 3/4 tsp. pepper
- pinch of cayenne
- 4 chicken breasts, halved, skinned and boned
- 1 loaf French bread (optional)

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 375°.
- In a medium size baking pan, mix the garlic, Worcestershire sauce, lemon juice, water, 1/2 of the oregano, melted butter, pepper and cayenne.
- Cross hatch smooth side of chicken breast with 1/4-inch deep cuts.
- Place chicken, scored side down, in pan.
- Spoon sauce over chicken to coat. Bake chicken, uncovered, for 20 minutes. Stir remaining oregano into sauce. Serve chicken, scored side up, and with a tablespoon of sauce poured over top of each. Serve with loaf of warm French bread and rice pilaf.

Sugar Cookies

Ingredients:
- 1 c. margarine
- 1 c. sugar
- 1 c. powdered sugar
- 1 c. vegetable oil
- 2 eggs
- 4 1/2 c. flour
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. baking soda
- 1 tsp. cream of tartar
- 1 Tbsp. vanilla

Directions:
- Cream margarine and sugars.
- Add oil and eggs.
- Sift together flour, salt, soda and cream of tartar.
- Add to sugar mixture. Add vanilla and mix well.
- Chill.
- Form into balls and place on ungreased cookie sheet.
- Press flat with bottom of glass which has been dipped in sugar.
- Bake at 350° for 10 to 12 minutes. Yields 6 dozen.

Johnny Cakes

Ingredients:
- 23 c. yellow cornmeal or semolina flour
- 13 c. all-purpose flour
- 2 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 1/2 tbsp. granulated sugar
- 1 large egg
- 1 1/4 c. milk
- 1 tsp. apple cider vinegar
- 1 tbsp. butter

Directions:
- Combine the first 5 ingredients in one bowl and the egg and milk in another.
- Gradually stir the wet ingredients into the dry.
- Rest for at least 30 minutes or overnight in the refrigerator.
- Stir in the melted butter.
- Heat a cast seasoned cast iron skillet or griddle over a high to medium-high heat.
- Grease the surface with butter.
- Drop 3 tablespoons to 1/3 of a cup of batter for each pancake.
- Turn when the bottom is golden brown and the top is riddled with holes.
- Cook until baked through.

Red Wine Cranberry Sauce

Ingredients:
- 1 package (12 ounces) fresh or frozen cranberries
- 1 cup sugar
- 1 cup water
- 1/2 cup dry red wine or grape juice

Directions:
- In a large saucepan, combine all ingredients; bring to a boil, stirring to dissolve sugar. Reduce heat to medium; cook, uncovered, until most of the berries pop, about 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
- Transfer to a bowl; cool slightly. Refrigerate, covered, until cold (sauce will thicken upon cooling).

Farmer'S Brownies

Ingredients:
- 1/4 c. cocoa
- 3/4 c. butter
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 2 eggs
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 c. hot water
- 1 tsp. baking soda
- 2 c. sugar
- 1/2 c. sour milk
- 2 1/2 c. flour

Directions:
- In a small bowl, mix cocoa, butter and hot water.
- Set aside. In a large bowl, mix sugar, eggs and sour milk. Add cocoa mixture and stir.
- Add vanilla. Sift together flour, salt and baking soda. Add to mixture and stir well.
- Pour into greased and floured 10 x 15-inch cookie sheet. Bake at 350° for 20 minutes.

'Sweet Tea' Sour

Ingredients:
- 2 ounces Rittenhouse Rye Whiksey
- 1 ounce Earl Grey Simple Syrup
- 1 ounce Lemon Juice
- 1 Egg White

Directions:
- For simple syrup: Combine 1 cup sugar and 1 cup water in a saucepan and bring to boil.
Add 1 tablespoon of loose earl grey tea, and a few sprigs of lavender if available.
Let steep for 20 minutes.
Strain, cool, and bottle.
- For cocktail: Combine whiskey, syrup, lemon juice, and egg white in a shaker. 
Forcefully dry shake for ~15 seconds.
Fill shaker with ice and shake for another 15 seconds - a beautiful egg cocktail should nearly have a head of froth as opposed to just a small layer on top.
Strain into a chilled coupe or cocktail glass.

Oven Roasted Rib-Eye Steak

Ingredients:
- 2 beef rib eye steaks
- steak seasoning, McCormick Steakhouse Grinder
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 2 pinches rosemary
- 2 pinches thyme
- 1/2 cup beef broth
- 2 tablespoons butter

Directions:
- Sprinkle steaks liberally with Mccormick seasoning on both sides. Place steak into bowl and roll in olive oil so that its oil over and both sides. Cover with saran wrap and let marinade at room temperature for 30 minutes.
- Preheat oven to 450°F Place steaks in shallow pan and place 1 Tb butter on each steak as well as beef broth, thyme and rosemary.
- Roast until one side is browned/sizzled then turn over until other side is browned/sizzled. Leave a bit longer for well-done.

Honeydew Rose Water Granita

Ingredients:
- 1/3 cup sugar
- 1/2 large honeydew melon, seeded, peeled, and cut into chunks
- 1 tablespoon rose water*

Directions:
- Combine sugar and 2/3 cup water in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil over high heat, then let cool.
- Whirl honeydew, syrup, and rose water in a blender until smooth.
- Pour puree into an 8-in. square baking pan. Cover with plastic wrap and freeze until mixture starts to freeze at edges but is still slushy, 2 to 3 hours. Stir mixture thoroughly, scraping sides down. Cover and freeze until solid, at least 7 hours.
- Scrape granita with a fork to make large flakes and spoon into chilled glasses or bowls.
- *Find with cocktail or baking supplies.

Roasted Garlic Tyrokavteri

Ingredients:
- 1 (6 ounce) jar roasted red peppers, drained and coarsely chopped
- 1/4 cup roasted garlic
- 1 teaspoon hot pepper sauce, or to taste
- 1/2 cup freshly squeezed lemon juice
- 1/4 teaspoon dried oregano
- 1/8 teaspoon ground white pepper
- 8 ounces crumbled feta
- 4 ounces cream cheese, softened
- 1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil
- 1/4 cup half-and-half (optional)

Directions:
- Place roasted red peppers, roasted garlic, hot pepper sauce, lemon juice, oregano, and white pepper into a blender; puree until smooth. Add feta and cream cheese, and puree until smooth.
- With blender running, slowly pour in olive oil until incorporated and thickened. Stir in half-and-half if needed to achieve a dip consistency. Cover and store in the refrigerator until ready to serve.

Country Biscuits

Ingredients:
- 2 c. Bisquick
- 3/4 c. buttermilk
- 1 stick butter

Directions:
- Mix the Bisquick and buttermilk together, then cut 1/2 stick of butter into small pieces.
- Then take the other 1/2 stick of butter and melt in a small bowl.
- Mix the butter into the Bisquick and buttermilk.
- Take a small amount of Bisquick and put on a cutting board, then roll dough out and cut biscuits up.
- (It should make 24.)
- Roll in butter, then put in pan and bake at 425° for 10 minutes or until done.

Coconut Brownie - Whole Wheat

Ingredients:
- 1/2 cup virgin coconut oil
- 2 eggs
- 3/4 cup whole wheat flour
- 1/3 cup cocoa powder
- 1/2 cup coconut sugar
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1 pinch salt
- 1/2 tea spoon baking powder
- 1/2 cup walnuts or pecans, chopped
- coconut flour optional

Directions:
- Pre-heat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (190 degrees C)
- Combine all the dry ingredients together, sieve
- Blend virgin coconut oil and eggs together
- Mix in the dry ingredients, and then the walnuts (or pecans)
- Pour the batter into a greased 8x8x2 inch tin, sprinkle coconut flour, bake for 30 minutes
- Cool to room temperature and cut into 16 pieces

Justin's roasted potatoes

Ingredients:
- 2 bags of baby potatoes
- 4 carrots
- 1/2 red onion
- 1 pack of bacon
- 2 cup shredded cheese

Directions:
- Cook bacon almost half way done save the bacon grease (fat)
- Chop potatoes into half or quarters, toss with herbs, spices and bacon grease in a BBQ safe dish place on BBQ start cooking on low to medium heat
- After 10 min add chopped bacon carrots and onion, mix it all around for even distrabution continue cooking for another 30 min on low to medium heat
- Continue mixing around so potatoes do not burn on the bottom of cooking dish
- When potatoes are done remove from heat and sprinkle shredded cheese on top allow cheese to melt and potatoes to cool
- Serve with any main course and enjoy :)

Sour Cherry Pickle

Ingredients:
- 1 cup sour cherries, not pitted
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1 cup good quality white vinegar, or as needed

Directions:
- Wash and drain the cherries, place them on a metal baking sheet, and set in the sun for 1 hour to be sure they are completely dry.
- Place cherries in a sterilized jar with a plastic lid; add salt. Pour in vinegar to fill the jar. Close lid tightly and set aside for taste and color to ripen, 3 to 4 weeks. Refrigerate.

Judy'S Green Bean Casserole

Ingredients:
- 2 cans green beans
- 1 can Campbell's beefy mushroom soup
- pepper
- 1 c. shredded Cheddar cheese
- 1/4 c. mayonnaise
- 1 egg
- 1 can Durkee fried onions

Directions:
- Mix green beans, soup, cheese, mayonnaise, egg, pepper to taste and 1/2 of the onions.
- Put in a 2-quart casserole dish. Cook at 350° for 30 minutes.
- Sprinkle the rest of onions on top and bake for 5 minutes.

Zucchini Tomato Casserole

Ingredients:
- 4 small zucchini or 4 medium summer squash, sliced thin
- 2 medium tomatoes, diced
- 1 medium onion, sliced very, very thin
- 1 garlic clove, finely minced
- 14 cup basil, chiffonaded
- 4 ounces goat cheese, crumbled
- salt and pepper, to taste

Directions:
- Spray a small casserole w olive oil.
- Layer zucchini, onions+garlic,, tomatoes, basil, and cheese as many times as needed, ending with cheese.
- Sprinkle w salt and pepper.
- Lightly sprinkle with olive oil and bake, covered, in preheated oven (350F), for 35-40 minutes.
- Remove foil ane bake for an additional 10, or until juices are bubbling and cheese begins to brown.
- Let sit for five minutes, serve,.
- *This would most likely be even better with a bit of freshly grated Parmesan or manchego on top -- .

The Elegant Hors D'Oeuvre'S Bacon-Wrapped Water Chestnuts

Ingredients:
- Bacon (1/2 slice for each water chestnut)
- Dijon mustard
- Brown sugar
- Water chestnuts
- Chutney (optional)

Directions:
- Cut bacon strips in half and lay them on a cookie sheet. Scoop some Dijon mustard into a small bowl and brown sugar into another. Spread each bacon slice with mustard, then sprinkle generously with brown sugar. Place a water chestnut on each slice, roll up, and secure with a toothpick. (Tip: If you're short a water chestnut, cut a big one in half!)
- To crisp all sides evenly, you can place the bacon-wrapped water chestnuts on a rack set above a baking sheet, but the rack isn't necessary. Bake 20 minutes in a 375°F oven, or until bacon is crisp. You can use the broiler to speed this up -- just watch them closely, and flip them as needed. Serve with a small bowl of chutney for dipping, or just eat them all as is.

Oven-Roasted Potatoes

Ingredients:
- 2 lb. small new potatoes, quartered
- 3 Tbsp. olive oil
- 3/4 tsp. salt
- 1/2 tsp. pepper
- 1/2 tsp. rosemary

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 450°.
- In large roasting pan, toss ingredients.
- Bake 40 minutes, stirring once, until potatoes are tender.

Pasta E Fagioli

Ingredients:
- 2 ounces olive oil
- 1 medium onion, coarsely chopped
- 2 garlic cloves, crushed
- 4 slices pancetta, chopped
- 2 green onions, chopped
- 12 teaspoon salt
- 1 pinch pepper
- 4 tablespoons tomato paste
- 4 cups chicken broth
- 1 (19 ounce) can romano beans
- 6 ounces ditali pasta
- 2 tablespoons parsley, chopped
- 14 cup romano cheese, grated

Directions:
- Heat oil in a soup pot and saute onions, garlic, pancetta, salt and pepper until golden, about 5 minutes.
- Stir in tomato paste, chicken broth and beans.
- Simmer 10 minutes.
- Cook pasta according to directions on the package.
- Drain and add to soup.
- Heat mixture for another 10 minutes.
- Ladle in bowls and top with grated cheese.
- Tip: Bacon can be used instead of pancetta but you won't get that same authentic flavour.

No Bake Chocolate Cookies

Ingredients:
- 2 c. sugar
- 1/4 c. cocoa
- 1/2 c. milk
- 1 stick margarine
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1/2 c. crunchy peanut butter
- 2 1/2 c. quick cook oatmeal

Directions:
- Bring sugar, cocoa, milk and margarine to boil over medium heat for 1 minute.
- Remove from heat.
- Add vanilla, peanut butter and oatmeal.
- Drop by spoonfuls onto waxed paper.
- Refrigerate for 30 minutes.

Zucchini Bites

Ingredients:
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 onion, finely chopped
- 3 slices bacon, finely chopped
- 1 large carrot, grated
- 1 large zucchini, grated
- 3 eggs
- 1/4 cup heavy cream
- 1 cup grated Parmesan cheese
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1/2 cup self-rising flour

Directions:
- Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 12 muffin miniature muffin pan.
- Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Stir in the onion and bacon. Cook until onion is translucent and bacon is browned, about 5 minutes. Stir in the carrot and zucchini; cook until they begin to soften, about 2 minutes. Transfer mixture to a bowl to cool.
- Beat the eggs, cream, and Parmesan cheese together in a large bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Stir egg mixture into cooled zucchini mixture; stir in flour. Spoon the batter evenly into the prepared muffin cups.
- Bake in preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, 15 to 20 minutes.

Quick Hollandaise

Ingredients:
- 3/4 c. mayonnaise
- 1/2 c. milk
- 1 Tbsp. lemon juice
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 tsp. pepper

Directions:
- Combine all ingredients in a pan.
- Heat slowly stirring constantly until hot.
- Makes 1 1/2 cups.

Luscious Lemonade

Ingredients:
- 1 c. sugar
- 1 c. lemon juice
- ice cubes
- 5 c. water
- lemon slices

Directions:
- Combine sugar, lemon juice and water.
- Stir to dissolve sugar.
- Serve over ice.
- Garnish with lemon slices.
- Serves 6.

Light Strawberry Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 box Light White cake mix
- 16 oz. frozen unsweetened strawberries, thawed, mashed and reserve 2 tsp. liquid
- 1/2 c. water
- 3 egg whites
- 1 tsp. strawberry extract
- 1/2 c. powdered sugar

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350°. Spray a 9X13 inch baking dish.

Edward Vii Sole

Ingredients:
- 4 sole fillets (about 1 1/2 lbs)
- salt & freshly ground black pepper
- 12 lb unsalted butter, softened
- 3 ounces salted almonds, chopped
- 14 lb fresh mushrooms, chopped
- 1 tablespoon fresh parsley, chopped
- 1 lemon
- 14 teaspoon nutmeg, freshly ground
- 12 cup dry white wine

Directions:
- Butter a baking dish large enough to hold the fillets in a single layer; preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
- In a bowl, combine butter, almonds, mushrooms, parsley, the juice of the lemon, salt and pepper, and nutmeg; spread over fillets.
- Add wine to dish.
- Place in oven until fish flakes easily, about 20 minutes.
- Serve in baking dish.

Shis Kabobs Recipe

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. oil
- 1/4 c. lemon juice
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon pepper
- 1/4 c. onion, minced
- 2 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce
- 1 clove garlic, mashed
- 1 teaspoon marjoram
- 1 teaspoon oregano
- 2 pound beef, cubed

Directions:
- Combine ingredients and mix well.
- Add in 2 pounds lean chuck, round or possibly sirloin, having been cut in 1 inch cubes, to the above marinade.
- Place in refrigerator and let stand overnight or possibly allow beef to marinate at room temperature for 3-4 hrs.
- Be sure beef is covered with marinade.

Rice Crackers with Goat Cheese and Edamame Recipe

Ingredients:
- 8 ounces frozen shelled edamame (about 1 3/4 cups)
- 24 rice crackers
- 5 ounces chevre (fresh goat cheese)
- 3 scallions, ends trimmed and very thinly sliced
- Hot chile oil

Directions:
- Bring a medium pot of water to a boil over high heat.
- Once water is boiling, add edamame and cook according to package directions.
- Drain beans and rinse with cold water until cool.
- Drain well, taste, and sprinkle with salt, if needed.
- Top each cracker with 1/2 teaspoon goat cheese, 3 to 5 edamame, a pinch of sliced scallions, and a few drops of chile oil.
- Serve.

Quik Turkey Pot Pie

Ingredients:
- 3 c. turkey (W/D) (leftover turkey)
- 1 can mushroom soup
- 1 c. cream of chicken soup
- 1 medium onion
- 1 can peas and carrots
- 1 Tbsp. seasoned salt
- 1 tsp. garlic
- 1 tsp. Greek seasoning
- 1 pie crust
- 1 small box Bisquick (2 c.)
- 2 small eggs
- 1/4 c. milk

Directions:
- Mix leftover turkey, soups, onion and seasonings.
- (You can also add peas and carrots.)
- Heat on stove for 10 minutes, then pour in pie crust.
- Mix Bisquick, eggs and milk; stir for 2 minutes.
- Pour over pie for the crust on top.
- Bake at 350° for 40 minutes.
- Let cool 10 minutes.

Aunt B'S Yeast Rolls

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 sticks oleo
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 1 egg
- dash of salt
- 1 pkg. dry yeast
- 2 c. warm water
- 4 c. self-rising flour

Directions:
- Cream together first 4 ingredients.
- Blend yeast and warm water and add to creamed mixture.
- Add flour, 1 cup at a time. Spray 12-hole muffin tin (even the top) with Pam.
- Fill muffin cups to top with batter.
- Bake at 400° for 12 to 15 minutes.

Sour Cream Cake

Ingredients:
- 3 c. sugar
- 2 sticks butter
- 6 eggs
- 3 c. Swans Down cake flour
- 1/4 tsp. baking soda
- 2 Tbsp. vanilla
- 1 c. sour cream

Directions:
- Have all ingredients at room temperature.

Baked Anna Potatoes

Ingredients:
- 4 idaho baking potatoes, peeled
- 2 medium yellow onions, thinly sliced
- 1 (14 1/2 ounce) can chicken broth
- 1/4 cup grated parmesan cheese
- salt and black pepper, to taste
- paprika, to taste

Directions:
- Partially slice potatoes, cutting 3/4 of the way through and in 1/8 inch slices.
- (Like a fan) Place onion in baking dish which you have sprayed with vegetable cooking spray.
- Add broth.
- Place potatoes on onion and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese, salt, black pepper and paprika.
- Bake, covered, at 375*F for 1 hour; remove cover and bake for an additional 15 minutes, until lightly browned.

Negroni Cocktail 

Ingredients:
- gin
- vermouth
- Campari

Directions:
- 1 part of each and stir w/ ice. strain into a coupe or rocks glass. If served on the rocks, use 1 large cube. Garnish w/ large lemon peel

Healthy Spinach Dip

Ingredients:
- 1/2 cup fat-free plain yogurt
- 1 ounce fat-free cream cheese
- 2 teaspoons thinly sliced green onion
- 2 teaspoons finely chopped sweet yellow pepper
- 2 teaspoons finely chopped sweet red pepper
- 2 teaspoons Italian salad dressing mix
- 1/8 teaspoon ground nutmeg
- 1 cup frozen leaf spinach, thawed and squeezed dry
- Radishes and carrot sticks

Directions:
- In a small bowl, combine the first seven ingredients; stir in spinach. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving. Serve with vegetables.

Louisiana Goulash

Ingredients:
- 3 1/4 cups chopped tomato
- 3/4 cup (1/4-inch-thick) slices celery
- 1/2 cup water
- 1/3 cup chopped onion
- 1/2 teaspoon paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon dried thyme
- 1/2 teaspoon dried rubbed sage
- 1/4 teaspoon ground red pepper
- 1/4 teaspoon Cajun seasoning
- 10 ounce andouille sausage, cut into 1/4-inch-thick slices
- 1 (14-ounce) can fat-free, less-sodium chicken broth
- 1 garlic clove, minced
- 1 1/4 cups uncooked long-grain brown rice
- 1/2 pound medium shrimp, peeled and deveined

Directions:
- Combine the first 12 ingredients in a Dutch oven; bring to a boil. Stir in rice; cover, reduce heat, and simmer 45 minutes or until rice is tender. Add shrimp; cook 3 minutes or until shrimp are done.

Small Chocolate Cat Biscuits

Ingredients:
- 1 egg
- 6 2/3 tablespoons powdered sugar
- 5 1/4 tablespoons butter
- 5/8 cup dark chocolate
- 1 5/8 cups flour
- 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
- salt

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350°F
- Mix egg and sugar in a bowl until mixture is pale.
- Melt butter and dark chocolate together over a double boiler.
- Separately, mix the flour, baking powder, and a pinch of salt together.
- Pour the melted chocolate into the egg and sugar mixture, and mix.
- Gradually, add to flour mixture.
- Knead by hand, form a big ball of dough.
- Roll out the dough, and cut out small shortbread cat cookies using cookie cutters.
- Arrange on a silicon mat or parchment paper lined baking sheet.
- Bake for 15 minutes.

Baked Potato With Sauteed Mushrooms And Onions

Ingredients:
- baked potato with sauteed onions and mushroom
- Ingredients
- 1 large potato
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 whole onion, sliced
- 1 cup whole mushroom
- 1 tablespoon Braggs amino acids
- pepper
- sea salt or kosher salt

Directions:
- Preheat Oven to 400 degrees.
- Wash and dry one large potato. Rub 1 tbsp olive oil onto the potato skin. Pierce potato skin with fork and wrap in foil (for crispy skin leave the foil open slightly at top). Cook the potato in the oven for 2-3 hours. 15 mins before the potato is done microwave the sliced onion for 4 mins on medium power. Heat one tablespoon of olive oil in a pan. Add mushrooms and cooked onions to the heated oil. Add 1 tablespoon Bragg's Amino Acids to the onion and mushroom mixture. Add pepper and sea salt to taste. Cover the pan and saute on medium heat for 3 mins.) Add onions an mushrooms to the baked potato. Enjoy!

Onion And Sour Cream Dip

Ingredients:
- 1 pkg. Lipton onion soup mix (dry)
- 1 pt. sour cream

Directions:
- Mix onion soup mix with sour cream just before serving.
- Serve with potato chips or crackers of your choice.

Special Potato Casserole

Ingredients:
- 1 (2 lb.) pkg. frozen hash brown potatoes, thawed
- 2 c. shredded sharp Cheddar cheese
- 1 c. sour cream
- 1 can cream of chicken soup
- 1/2 c. chopped onion
- 1 tsp. salt
- 3 c. crushed cornflakes
- 1/2 c. melted margarine

Directions:
- Combine potatoes, cheese, sour cream, soup, onion and salt in bowl; mix well.
- Spoon into 9 x 13-inch baking dish sprayed with nonstick cooking spray.
- Top with cornflake crumbs; drizzle with margarine.
- Bake at 350° for 1 hour.
- Yield:
- 15 servings.

Apple Dip

Ingredients:
- 1 (8 oz.) cream cheese
- 1/2 c. packed brown sugar
- apples

Directions:
- Soften cream cheese so it is easily mixed.
- Add brown sugar and mix well. Serve with sectioned apples or other fruit.

Pumpkin Dessert

Ingredients:
- 1 tube crackers, crushed
- 1 stick margarine, melted
- 1/3 c. sugar
- 1 small can pumpkin
- 1 3/4 c. milk
- 1 tsp. pumpkin pie spice
- 2 1/2 small pkg. instant vanilla pudding
- 1 (13 oz.) Cool Whip
- crushed nuts

Directions:
- Mix crackers, margarine and sugar.
- Pat into 9 x 13-inch pan. Mix pumpkin, milk, pie spice and instant pudding until smooth. Spread over cracker crust.
- Spread Cool Whip over top of pudding. Top with crushed nuts.
- This is good, easy and no cooking required.

Meatloaf Everyone Will Love

Ingredients:
- 1 12 lbs ground beef
- 1 12 lbs ground pork
- 2 eggs
- 5 12 ounces vegetable juice
- 34 cup ketchup
- 14 cup onion, chopped
- 34 cup oats
- 12 cup seasoned bread crumbs
- 3 tablespoons brown sugar
- 4 large garlic cloves, chopped
- 14 cup red pepper, finely chopped
- 14 cup carrot, shredded
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 14 teaspoon pepper
- 14 cup brown sugar
- 3 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce
- 1 14 cups ketchup

Directions:
- Combine meats in mixer, and mix together well, on low.
- Add remaining ingredients (except sauce ingredients).
- Place in two loaf pans.
- Bake at 350F degrees for 50 minutes.
- Prepare sauce for topping.
- Remove meatloaf from oven and add sauce topping.
- Bake additional 15 minutes.
- Let stand 5 minutes then Serve.

Triple Punch

Ingredients:
- 1 envelope
- 1 envelope KOOL-AID Tropical Punch Flavor Sugar-Sweetened Drink Mix
- 1 envelope KOOL-AID Cherry Flavor Sugar-Sweetened Drink Mix
- 3 quarts cold water
- 1 bottle (1 liter) chilled ginger ale

Directions:
- Empty soft drink mixes into large plastic or glass punch bowl.
- Add cold water; stir to dissolve.
- Just before serving, add ginger ale and ice ring.

No Bake Oatmeal Cookies

Ingredients:
- 2 c. sugar
- 3 Tbsp. cocoa
- 1 stick margarine
- 1/2 c. milk
- 1/2 c. peanut butter
- 3 c. quick cooking oats
- 1 tsp. vanilla

Directions:
- Mix sugar, cocoa, margarine and milk.
- Boil for 1 minute. Remove from heat.
- Add at once all remaining ingredients.
- Stir well.
- Drop onto wax paper.

French Toast Casserole

Ingredients:
- 1 c. brown sugar*
- 1/4 c. butter*
- 2 Tbsp. light corn syrup*
- 12 slices white or wheat bread
- 6 well-beaten eggs
- 1 1/2 c. milk
- 1 Tbsp. vanilla
- 1 1/4 tsp. salt
- dash of nutmeg
- 8 oz. cream cheese, softened

Directions:
- *Or use real maple syrup.

Lemon Chess Pie

Ingredients:
- 4 eggs
- 2 c. sugar
- 1/2 c. lemon juice
- 1/2 c. melted butter
- 1 Tbsp. corn meal
- 1 Tbsp. flour
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 unbaked pie shell

Directions:
- Beat eggs, then beat in sugar; mix well.
- Add other ingredients, beating well.
- Pour into pie shell.
- Bake at 350° for 40 minutes or until brown.

Smothered Steak

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 lb. round steak
- salt and pepper
- 1 can mushroom soup
- 1 Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
- 4 onions, sliced

Directions:
- Rub flour into steak.
- Brown on both sides. Season.
- Add soup and onions.
- Simmer about one hour.
- Add a little water as needed.

Vegetable Miso Soup

Ingredients:
- 12 tablespoon toasted sesame oil
- 2 slices gingerroot, peeled and chopped fine
- 2 garlic cloves, peeled and chopped fine
- 1 medium onion, sliced in 1/2-inch thick diagonols
- 2 medium carrots, sliced in 1/2 inch thick diagonols
- 3 cups vegetable stock
- 1 cup chopped swiss chard, can also use cabbage or 1 cup spinach
- 1 cup broccoli floret
- 6 ounces tofu, cut into 1-inch cubes (can also used baked tofu)
- 1 tablespoon miso
- fresh ground pepper

Directions:
- In a 2 qt soup pot, cook oil, ginger, garlic, onion, and carrots together for about 5 minutes.
- Add the soup stock and cook for 5 minutes on low heat.
- Add the Swiss chard (or other greens), broccoli, and tofu.
- Simmer 5 minutes on low.
- Remove 1/2 cup of the stock and mix it with the miso in a measuring cup.
- Stir until lumps dissolve.
- Return the miso mixture to the soup.
- Season with pepper; cook 1 more minute.

Crab Cakes

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. lump crab meat
- 2 eggs, cooked and mashed
- 2 Tbsp. fresh parsley
- 1 tsp. marjoram flakes
- 1 raw egg
- 1 Tbsp. salad dressing
- juice of 1/2 lemon

Directions:
- Clean crab meat.
- Put lemon juice over mix and then add rest of ingredients.
- Shape into balls.
- Beat 2 raw eggs.
- Dip crab balls into cracker meal, then into egg mixture and then back into cracker meal.
- Deep fry or put crab balls into crab shaped foil shells. Top with crumbs.
- Dot with butter and broil until crumbs brown.

Watermelon Margarita

Ingredients:
- 1 1/4 ounces tequila
- 1/2 ounce triple sec
- 1/2 ounce Midori melon liqueur
- 1/2 ounce grenadine
- 2 ounces prepared prepared sweet-and-sour mix
- 1 cup frozen seeded watermelon, balls
- 1 cup crushed ice
- granulated sugar

Directions:
- Note: Advance preparation requires that you pre-freeze your watermelon; be sure to remove all seeds!
- Rub rim of margarita glass with some sweet and sour mix and dip in granulated sugar.
- Process tequila, triple sec, Midori, grenadine, sweet and sour mix, watermelon, and ice in a blender until smooth.
- Pour into margarita glass.

Pasta And Beans

Ingredients:
- 1 1/4 cups uncooked pasta, i like penne
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 (14 ounce) cans tomatoes, undrained
- 1 (15 ounce) can kidney beans or (15 ounce) can garbanzo beans, drained
- 1 1/2 teaspoons italian seasoning
- 1 teaspoon sugar
- 1 (10 ounce) package fresh spinach, chopped
- 1/2 cup feta cheese
- 1/4 cup sliced ripe olives

Directions:
- Cook pasta according to pkg instructions.
- Meanwhile, heat oil in lg skillet or Dutch oven.
- Add garlic; cook and stir 1 minute.
- Add tomatoes, beans, Italian seasoning and sugar.
- Bring to a boil; reduce heat and simmer 10 minutes.
- Add spinach; cook 3 minutes.
- Put drained pasta on serving plates.
- Top with tomato mixture.
- Sprinkle with feta and olives.

Mustard Greens With Straw Mushrooms

Ingredients:
- 3 to 4 head Chinese mustard greens
- 3 Tbsp. peanut, vegetable or corn oil
- 1 1/2 tsp. sugar
- 1 (15 oz.) can straw mushrooms, drained
- 2 3/4 c. chicken broth
- 2 Tbsp. cornstarch

Directions:
- Discard tough outer leaves and cut off tough base end of each set of mustard greens.
- Also remove the soft leafy portion, leaving the firm center portions.
- Cut these pieces into 1 1/2-inch lengths.
- Wash and drain well.
- Boil a small amount of water (enough to later cover greens).
- Add the greens.
- Let the water return to a boil; drain greens and drop immediately into cold water, then drain well (this blanching tenderizes the tougher mustard greens).

Crock- Pot Macaroni And Cheese

Ingredients:
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1 1/2 c. skim milk
- 1/8 tsp. pepper
- 1 large can evaporated skim milk
- 1 1/2 c. shredded cheddar cheese
- 1 egg
- 2 c. uncooked macaroni

Directions:
- Spray crock pot with cooking spray.
- Combine milk, egg, salt and pepper.
- Mix with wire whisk.
- Add cheese and macaroni, stirring gently to mix.
- Cover and cook on low for 3 1/2 to 4 hours, or until custard is set and macaroni is tender.
- Serves 8.

Rick's Tea Party

Ingredients:
- 1 1/4 ounce Mighty Leaf Green Tea Tropical infused Absolut Vodka
- 1/2 ounce Benedictine Liqueur
- 1 ounce fresh lemon juice
- 3/4 ounce simple syrup
- Splash of soda

Directions:
- Combine ingredients with ice and shake.
- Strain into a highball glass of fresh ice.
- Top with the splash of soda.

Golden Potato Latkes 

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 lb yukon gold pots
- peeled & grated - 1 med sweet onion
- grated - 2 med shallots
- grated - 1/4 cup flour - 1 tsp salt - 1/2 tsp pepper - 1 lightly beaten egg - 8 tsp canola oil

Directions:
- spread grated pots, onions & shallots on clean dish towel or lg piece of cheesecloth - roll up & squeeze over sink to extract liquid - put in lg bowl - add flour, salt & pepper, toss to mix well - coat vegts c dry ingreds - add egg & 2 tsp oil to pot mix - toss well - heat 2 tsp oil in skillet on med/hi - use 1/4 cup to scoop pot mix making latkes in skillet - flatten ea mound into 3 " pancake - cook until crispy & light brown - transfer to baking sheet - when all latkes are fried & on baking sheets place in oven & bake until latkes are crispy & hot, about 10 mins.

Cocktail Wieners

Ingredients:
- approximately 1 c. grape jelly, melted
- approximately 1/2 c. prepared mustard (to taste)
- cocktail wieners or hot dogs, cut in 1-inch pieces

Directions:
- Heat and melt grape jelly.
- Add mustard to taste.
- Add wieners. Cook in crock-pot, low setting for at least 3 hours; stirring occasionally.

Nigella'S Chocolate Truffle Cake.

Ingredients:
- 200 g 70% dark chocolate
- 300 ml cream
- 30 ml brandy
- 30 ml cocoa powder (sieved)
- whipped cream, to serve with (optional)

Directions:
- Melt the chocolate in a glass bowl over some simmering water. The water must not keep boiling while the chocolate is melting.
- Now lightly heat the cream and brandy together. Pour into the melted chocolate. Stir well. Now add the cocoa powder mix well.
- Using a small baking pan layer with wax paper. Also grease the pan well. Now add the cake mixture. Place the cake in the fridge until firm, take the cake out just before you want to serve it. Place on a nice cake tray, there will be some chocolate sauce at the bottom. Serve with some whipped cream.

Berry Rum Punch

Ingredients:
- 1/2 cup mixed berries, such as strawberries, blueberries, and raspberries
- 1 ounce (2 tablespoons) coconut rum
- 1 ounce (2 tablespoons) light rum
- 1 ounce (2 tablespoons) simple syrup
- 1 ounce (2 tablespoons) fresh lime juice
- Ice, as needed
- Soda water
- 1 slice strawberry for garnish

Directions:
- Blend the mixed fruit, coconut rum, light rum, simple syrup, and lime juice in a large shaker with ice.
- Shake vigorously and pour over a glass full of ice.
- Top with a splash of soda water and garnish with strawberry slice.

Cheddar-Pear Cobbler

Ingredients:
- 6 medium pears, peeled, cored, and sliced (about 7 cups)
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
- 1 cup sugar
- 3 tablespoons all-purpose flour
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 1/2 teaspoon ground nutmeg
- Dash of salt
- 1 tablespoon butter or margarine

Directions:
- Toss pear slices with lemon juice in a large bowl; add sugar and next 4 ingredients, tossing gently to combine. Spoon pear mixture into a greased 10" x 6" x 2" baking dish; dot with butter.
- Roll Cheddar Cheese Pastry out on a lightly floured surface to a 10" x 6" rectangle; cut lengthwise into 1/2" strips. Arrange strips in a lattice design over pear mixture; trim excess pastry as needed.
- Bake at 350° for 1 hour or until pastry is golden.

Chicken Enchilada Pie

Ingredients:
- 1 (3 lb.) chicken
- 1 can cream of mushroom soup
- 1 can cream of chicken soup
- 1 (4 oz.) can chopped green chilies
- 1 tsp. chili powder
- 4 tsp. minced onion or 1/2 small chopped fresh onion
- 1/8 tsp. garlic powder
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1/4 tsp. Tabasco sauce
- 1 c. chicken broth
- 4 c. corn chips
- 8 oz. Cheddar cheese, grated

Directions:
- Cook and debone chicken.
- Reserve 1 cup of chicken broth. Combine soups, green chilies, spices and chicken broth over low heat until well blended.
- Preheat oven to 350°.
- Cover bottom of 2 1/2 or 3-quart casserole dish with 2 cups of corn chips.
- Spread 1/2 the chicken over this layer, then 1/2 the sauce and 1/2 of the cheese.
- Repeat, ending with cheese.
- Bake at 350° for 25 to 30 minutes.

Custard Pie

Ingredients:
- 4 slightly beaten eggs
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 2 1/2 c. milk, scalded
- 1 (9-inch) unbaked pastry shell (roll dough to less than 1/8-inch)

Directions:
- Mix egg, sugar, salt and vanilla thoroughly.
- Slowly stir in the hot milk.
- Pour at once into unbaked pastry shell.
- Top with nutmeg.
- Bake in hot oven at 475° for 5 minutes.
- Reduce heat to 425° and bake 10 to 15 minutes longer or until a knife inserted halfway between center and edge comes out clean.
- After you have mixed your hot milk with the rest of the ingredients, add your favorite fresh fruit or berries (3/4 to 1 cup) and bake.

Linguine with Tomatoes and Basil

Ingredients:
- 4 to 6 vine-ripened tomatoes, cut in 1/2"cubes
- 8 oz. Brie cheese, torn in irregular pieces
- 1/2 to 1 cup fresh basil leaves, cut into strips
- 3 cloves garlic, finely minced
- 1/2 to 3/4 cup olive oil
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- Fresh ground pepper, to taste
- Linguine

Directions:
- Combine ingredients at least 2 hours ahead, but you do not need to refrigerate it.
- Serve over hot linguine and enjoy!

Dinner Poppers

Ingredients:
- 4 bacon strips
- 4 chicken tenderloins
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/8 teaspoon pepper
- 2 teaspoons canola oil
- 4 poblano peppers
- 1-1/2 cups shredded cheddar cheese, divided
- 4 ounces cream cheese, cut into four strips

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350°. In a large skillet, cook bacon over medium heat until partially cooked but not crisp. Remove to paper towels to drain.
- Sprinkle chicken with salt and pepper. In a skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat; brown tenderloins on both sides. Cool slightly.
- Carefully cut a slit down the side of each pepper and remove seeds. Fill each with one tenderloin; top each with 2 tablespoons cheese and a strip of cream cheese. Close peppers; wrap with bacon and secure with toothpicks.
- Place on a foil-lined
- , slit side up. Top with remaining cheddar cheese; bake until browned and peppers are tender, 25-30 minutes. Remove toothpicks before serving.

Beautiful Fruit

Ingredients:
- 2 cans mandarin oranges
- 2 cans pineapple tidbits
- 1 jar maraschino cherries
- 2 bananas
- 1 (6 oz.) pkg. instant vanilla pudding

Directions:
- Drain juices and save.
- Put fruit in another bowl and set aside.
- Cut bananas into juice and let set for five minutes. Remove bananas and dissolve vanilla pudding in juice.
- Stir in fruit and refrigerate.
- Can be eaten on slice of plain cake or vanilla ice cream.
- Keeps well in covered container.

Low Cholesterol Low Salt Crispy Baked Chicken

Ingredients:
- 1 (2 1/2 to 3 lb.) chicken, cut up and skinned
- 1 c. skim milk
- 1 c. corn flakes, crushed
- 1 tsp. dried rosemary
- 1/8 to 1/4 tsp. pepper
- lemon slices and parsley flakes

Directions:
- Heat oven to 400°.
- Dip chicken in milk.
- In plastic bag or bowl, mix corn flakes, rosemary and pepper.
- Toss chicken in crumbs.
- Put
- chicken
- on
- lightly oiled baking sheet.
- Bake 45 minutes.
- Garnish with lemon and parsley.

Banana Nut Bread

Ingredients:
- 1/4 c. shortening
- 3/4 c. sugar
- 2 eggs or equivalent Egg Beaters
- 2 c. Jiffy baking mix
- 1 c. mashed ripe bananas (2 to 3 medium)
- 1/3 c. chopped nuts

Directions:
- Cream shortening and sugar.
- Combine remaining ingredients and mix until well blended. Pour into prepared pan.
- Bake about 55 minutes in a preheated oven at 350°.
- The pan should be a greased loaf pan (9 x 5-inch).
- Set to cool on a rack before slicing.

Green Tomato Relish

Ingredients:
- 4 c. ground onions
- 4 c. ground cabbage
- 10 green tomatoes
- 12 green peppers
- 6 red sweet peppers
- 1/2 c. salt
- 6 c. sugar
- 2 Tbsp. mustard seed
- 1 Tbsp. celery seed
- 1 1/2 tsp. turmeric
- 4 c. cider vinegar
- 2 c. water

Directions:
- Grind vegetables coarsely.
- Add salt; let set overnight. Rinse and drain.
- Combine remaining ingredients.
- Add to vegetables.
- Heat to boiling.
- Simmer 3 minutes.
- Put into hot sterilized jars.
- Process 15 minutes.
- Very good!

Cole Slaw

Ingredients:
- 1 medium head cabbage (firm cabbage)
- 1 carrot
- 2 eggs
- 1 c. sugar
- 1/2 c. vinegar
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 Tbsp. butter

Directions:
- Shred cabbage.
- Shred carrot.
- Combine eggs, sugar, vinegar, salt and butter.
- Cook over low heat until thick, stirring constantly.
- When cold, add 1/2 cup Carnation cream.
- Pour over cabbage.

Cheese-Onion Spread For Crackers

Ingredients:
- 8 oz. sharp cheese
- 6 oz. cream cheese
- 1/2 tsp. curry powder
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 3 Tbsp. sherry
- 10 oz. chutney
- 1/4 c. finely chopped green onions

Directions:
- Blend everything except chutney and onions with electric beaters or with a food processor.
- Spread in a shallow dish and chill until firm.
- Spread chopped chutney on top and sprinkle onions on top of chutney.

Three Bean Hot Dish

Ingredients:
- 1/2 lb. ground beef
- 1/2 lb. bacon, cut in small pieces
- 1/2 c. chopped onion
- 1 (16 oz.) can pork and beans
- 1 (16 oz.) can kidney beans, drained
- 1 (16 oz.) can butter beans, drained
- 1/2 c. catsup
- 1/2 c. brown sugar
- 1 tsp. dry mustard
- 2 Tbsp. white vinegar
- 1 tsp. salt
- dash of pepper

Directions:
- Brown ground beef in skillet; drain fat. Put beef in crock-pot. Brown bacon and onions; drain. Add to beef. Add all remaining ingredients to crock-pot. Stir well; cover and cook on low 4 to 6 hours.

Nana'S Pumpkin Bread

Ingredients:
- 3 1/2 c. flour
- 3 c. sugar
- 1 tsp. baking soda
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 1 tsp. nutmeg
- 1 c. melted margarine
- 4 eggs
- 2/3 c. water
- 1 (14 oz.) can pumpkin or 1 3/4 c. mashed

Directions:
- Combine wet ingredients with dry ingredients.
- Mix well. Grease loaf pan.
- Bake at 350° for 1 hour.

Marinated Tomatoes(Servings: 4)  

Ingredients:
- 4 large tomatoes, peeled and sliced
- 1 c. vegetable oil
- 1/4 c. wine vinegar
- 1/4 tsp. dry mustard
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. black pepper
- 1 large garlic clove, minced
- 1 Tbsp. fresh basil, chopped
- 2 sprigs fresh thyme, chopped
- 1 sprig fresh marjoram, chopped
- 1 Tbsp. minced scallion

Directions:
- Place tomato slices in serving bowl.
- Combine remaining ingredients and pour over tomatoes.
- Toss lightly.
- Chill for 1 hour or longer before serving.

Red Lobster Hush Puppies

Ingredients:
- 2 c. yellow corn meal
- 1 Tbsp. all-purpose flour
- 1/2 tsp. baking soda
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 egg, beaten
- 1 c. buttermilk
- 1/3 c. finely chopped onion
- vegetable oil for frying

Directions:
- Pour oil to a depth of 1/2-inch in a large, shallow skillet, and heat to 400°.
- In the meantime, mix dry ingredients together; stir in remaining ingredients.
- Drop mixture by spoonfuls into heated oil.
- Fry, turning, until brown.
- Remove and drain on paper towels.
- If needed, keep cooked hush puppies in a 300° oven until serving time.
- Makes 20 hush puppies.

Monster Cookies

Ingredients:
- 1 c. white sugar
- 1 c. brown sugar
- 1/2 c. butter
- 3 eggs
- 1 1/2 c. peanut butter
- 1 Tbsp. vanilla
- 2 tsp. baking soda
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 4 1/2 c. oatmeal
- 2 c. chocolate chips (option: 1/2 chocolate chips & 1/2 M&M's)
- 1 c. nuts (optional)

Directions:
- Cream sugar and butter. Add eggs and beat well. Beat in peanut butter, vanilla, baking soda and salt. Stir in oatmeal. Stir in chocolate chips and nuts. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350° for 10 minutes.

Kathryn'S Venison

Ingredients:
- 10 lb. ground venison
- 2/3 c. Morton Tender Quick salt
- 1 1/2 c. cooking oil
- 1 tsp. garlic salt
- 1 tsp. onion salt
- 5 tsp. black pepper
- 4 tsp. liquid smoke

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients thoroughly.
- Shape into 10 compact rolls, approximately 12-inches long (1 pound each).
- Place the rolls on a wire rack with a drip pan.
- Bake at 200° for 1 hour and 45 minutes.

Almost Tootsie Rolls

Ingredients:
- 2 tablespoons butter
- 2 tablespoons shortening
- 1 pinch salt
- 12 cup unsweetened cocoa powder
- 12 cup light corn syrup
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 1 cup non-fat powdered milk
- 3 12 cups powdered sugar

Directions:
- In a small saucepan or in the microwave melt the butter with shortening, cocoa powder and salt until completely melted.
- Transfer the mixture to a bowl; add in the remaining ingredients; mix well until blended (I start with a spoon then use my hands to finish mixing).
- Turn onto the counter or a board; knead until smooth (you will need a lot of hand powder for mixing this batter).
- Shape into desired-shaped logs, wrap in wax paper.
- These will harden and develop in flavor with sitting time.

Barley Soup With Root Vegetables

Ingredients:
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 3 medium leeks, white and pale green parts only, sliced (about 2 cups)
- 3 garlic cloves, minced (about 1 Tbs.)
- 1/3 cup pearl barley
- 2 vegetable bouillon cubes
- 3 medium carrots, diced (about 1 1/2 cups)
- 1 small celery root, peeled and diced (about 1 1/2 cups)
- 1/3 cup chopped fresh dill
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice

Directions:
- Heat oil in large pot over medium heat. Add leeks, and cook 5 minutes, or until softened, stirring often. Add garlic, and saute 30 seconds. Stir in barley. Add 7 cups water and bouillon cubes.
- Bring soup to a boil. Reduce heat to low, skim off any froth, cover and simmer 20 minutes.
- Add carrots and celery root. Cover, and simmer 20 to 25 minutes more, or until barley and vegetables are tender.
- Just before serving, stir in dill, lemon juice and black pepper to taste. Enjoy!

No Peek Chicken

Ingredients:
- 1 box Uncle Ben's wild rice
- 1 can cream of celery soup
- 1 tsp. parsley
- 1 can cream of mushroom soup
- 1 can cold water
- dash of curry powder

Directions:
- Lightly grease casserole dish.	Mix all ingredients and pour into casserole
- dish.
- Place
- 6 to 8 pieces of chicken on top of rice
- mixture.
- Sprinkle
- chicken
- with
- 1	package of Lipton onion soup	mix.
- Seal
- with
- foil and bake at 350° for 2 1/2 hours.
- Don't peek!!!! Serves 6.

Julie'S Brisket

Ingredients:
- 4 to 4 1/2 lb. brisket
- 1 garlic clove
- 2 sliced carrots
- 2 sliced onions
- 2 to 3 stalks celery
- horseradish
- 1/2 c. brown sugar
- 1 to 2 c. ketchup
- 1 c. consomme

Directions:
- Saute diced garlic clove and remove from pot.
- Put brisket; add carrots, celery and onions.
- Spread with horseradish. Sprinkle with brown sugar; add 1 cup consomme and roast covered about 3 hours in 350° oven.
- Spread with ketchup and brown sugar and brown at 450°.
- Cool.
- Skin fat, strain sauce or put through processor.
- Can be frozen.
- Defrost, slice and reheat.

Onion Roasted Potatoes

Ingredients:
- 1 envelope Lipton onion soup mix
- 2 lb. all-purpose potatoes, cut into small chunks
- 1/3 c. vegetable oil

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 450°.
- Add all ingredients to a large plastic bag.
- Close bag and shake until evenly coated.
- Empty potatoes into a shallow baking pan coated with Pam spray.
- Bake for 40 minutes or until potatoes are tender and golden brown.
- Makes 8 servings.

Peanut Blossoms

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. shortening
- 3/4 c. peanut butter
- 1/3 c. sugar
- 1/3 c. brown sugar
- 1 egg
- 2 Tbsp. milk
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 1/2 c. flour
- 1 tsp. baking soda
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 1 bag Hershey's Kisses

Directions:
- Cream shortening and peanut butter.
- Add sugar, egg, milk and vanilla.
- Beat well.
- Add remaining ingredients.
- Blend well. Shape dough in balls the size of walnuts and roll in sugar.
- Place on cookie sheet.
- Bake at 375° for 10 to 12 minutes.
- Remove from oven and immediately place 1 Kiss in center of each cookie.

Spinach & Arugula Salad W/ Mandarin Oranges, Chopped Almonds

Ingredients:
- 2 bunches arugula
- 2 bunches spinach
- 6 mandarin orange sections
- 12 cup chopped almonds
- 12 cup shaved fresh parmigiano
- 1 cup raspberry vinegar
- 1 cup olive oil
- 1 cup vegetable oil
- 1 cup pure maple syrup
- 1 tablespoon Dijon mustard
- 1 tablespoon chopped fresh tarragon
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1 teaspoon lime juice

Directions:
- Vinaigrette:.
- 1) Combine all ingredients and mix well in mixer or food processor.
- Mix until dressing thickens and is well blended.
- 2) Pour contents into a bottle with a cover.
- 3) Refrigerate for 15mins.
- Salad:.
- 1) Combine Arugula, and Spinach in large bowl and toss.
- 2) Divide the leaf mixtures and place like a flat mound on a white plate.
- 3) Place 3 pegs of the oranges on the salad mixture, sprinkle with the chopped almonds.
- SERVE w/ Vinaigrette on the side.

Granny Gibbs' Sugarless Muffins

Ingredients:
- 1 can pumpkin
- 4 eggs
- 2 tsp. vanilla
- 1 1/3 c. nonfat dry milk
- 3/4 c. flour
- 2 tsp. soda
- 13 packs Sweet 'N Low (not Equal)
- 1/2 c. raisins
- 1 whole apple, chopped
- 3 whole carrots, chopped fine
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 1 tsp. nutmeg

Directions:
- Mix the pumpkin, eggs, cinnamon, nutmeg and vanilla with mixer. Add the milk, flour, soda and Sweet 'N Low.
- Add raisins, apple and carrots.
- Spray pan with Pam; do not use paper cups.
- Bake at 350° for 25 minutes.

Hash Brown Potato Casserole

Ingredients:
- 2 lb. frozen hash browns
- 1/2 c. melted margarine
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/2 tsp. pepper
- 2 cans cream of chicken soup
- 1 pt. sour cream
- 1/2 c. chopped onions
- 10 oz. Cheddar cheese
- 1/2 c. melted margarine
- 2 c. crushed corn flakes

Directions:
- Thaw potatoes and combine with all other ingredients except 1/2 cup melted margarine and corn flakes.
- Put in large casserole dish. Combine the 1/2 cup melted margarine and corn flakes.
- Spread on top.
- Bake at 350° for 1 to 1 1/2 hours.

Apricot Margaritas

Ingredients:
- 1 (46 oz.) can apricot nectar
- 1 (6 oz.) can frozen lemonade concentrate, thawed
- 3/4 to 1 c. tequila
- 1/4 to 1/2 c. apricot brandy
- 4 c. crushed ice
- lemon slices (if desired)
- coarse salt (if desired)

Directions:
- In 4-quart, nonmetal container, combine apricot nectar, lemonade concentrate, tequila, brandy and ice.
- Cover.
- Freeze until of slush consistency, about 4 hours, stirring occasionally.

Caramel Apple Dip

Ingredients:
- 1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese
- 1 (3 oz.) pkg. cream cheese
- 3/4 c. confectioners powdered sugar
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- caramel topping
- chopped cashews
- apple slices

Directions:
- Mix cream cheese, sugar and vanilla until creamy. Spread in an 8-inch square baking dish.
- Pour caramel topping on top of cheese mixture. Cover caramel with chopped nuts.
- Serve with apple slices.

Apple Relish

Ingredients:
- 4 c. prepared fruit (about 3 lb. ripe apples)
- 7 c. (3 lb.) sugar
- 1/2 c. vinegar
- 1/2 c. finely chopped nuts
- 1/2 c. seedless raisins
- 1/2 bottle Certo fruit pectin

Directions:
- First, prepare the fruit. Core and grind about 3 pounds fully ripe apples.
- Measure 4 cups into a very large saucepan.

Vegetable Beef Soup

Ingredients:
- 2 c. beef cubes
- 1 large onion, chopped
- 2 cloves garlic, crushed
- 2 Tbsp. olive oil
- 3 1/2 c. water
- 2 (16 oz.) cans whole tomatoes (undrained)
- 2 medium potatoes, diced
- 1 1/2 c. celery, chopped
- 2 cans Campbell's tomato soup
- 1 lb. frozen pkg. of each of the following: corn, carrots, peas and string beans
- 1 tsp. oregano
- 1 tsp. pepper
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 1/2 c. elbow macaroni

Directions:
- In bottom of soup pot, saute beef, onion and garlic in olive oil until beef is brown (approximately 5 minutes).
- Add water and all remaining ingredients except macaroni.
- Add more water to completely cover vegetables.
- Bring to a boil.
- Add macaroni. Cook until macaroni is tender.
- Turn heat down to low and cover. Cook for at least 1 1/2 hours, stirring occasionally.

Maple-Mustard Glazed Pork Roast Recipe

Ingredients:
- 2-3 lb. boneless pork loin
- 2/3 cup maple syrup
- 3 tbsp. dijon mustard
- 2 tbsp. cider vinegar
- 2 tbsp. soy sauce
- Salt and pepper
- 1 lb. carrots, quartered
- 4-6 medium red potatoes, halved

Directions:
- Stir together maple syrup, mustard, vinegar, soy sauce, salt and pepper.
- Spread evenly over pork roast and place in a shallow pan.
- Add carrots and potatoes.
- Roast at 350 degrees until pork temp is 160 degrees and vegetables are done.
- Approx.
- 45 minutes to 1 1/4 hours.
- Remove and slice.

Speedy Chili Mac

Ingredients:
- 2 cups uncooked elbow macaroni
- 1-1/2 teaspoons dried minced onion
- 1 can (15 ounces) chili without beans
- 1 can (10-3/4 ounces) condensed cream of mushroom soup, undiluted
- 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese, divided

Directions:
- In a saucepan, cook macaroni in boiling water for 5 minutes. Stir in onion. Cook 1-2 minutes longer or until macaroni is tender; drain.
- In another saucepan, combine the chili and soup; heat through. Stir in macaroni and 3/4 cup of cheese. Transfer to a greased 11x7-in. baking dish. Cover and bake at 350° for 20 minutes. Uncover; sprinkle with remaining cheese. Bake 5-10 minutes longer or until cheese is melted.

Salmon Croquets

Ingredients:
- 1 large can salmon
- 4 eggs, separated
- 4 Tbsp. flour
- 1 onion, chopped
- 1/2 tsp. salt or to taste
- 1/2 tsp. black pepper or to taste

Directions:
- Combine all ingredients together.
- Take large amounts of mixture and form cakes.
- Place in hot oil and fry until brown.

Cilantro Cucumber Salad

Ingredients:
- 2 cucumbers
- 2 tablespoons fresh lime juice
- 1 teaspoon chili powder
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro

Directions:
- Peel cucumbers, slice lengthwise into quarters, and cut into 1 inch pieces; place in large bowl. Sprinkle with lime juice, chili powder, and salt; toss. Toss with cilantro. Refrigerate until chilled.

Dip For Strawberries

Ingredients:
- 8 oz. cream cheese
- 1 jar marshmallow cream
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 drop red food coloring (if desired)

Directions:
- Combine cream cheese with marshmallow cream.
- Add vanilla or other flavoring.
- Add food coloring if desired.
- Serve with fresh whole strawberries.

Holiday Pickled Shrimp

Ingredients:
- 2 pounds cooked medium shrimp, peeled and deveined
- 2 bay leaves
- 1 cup canola oil
- 1 cup red wine vinegar
- 3 tablespoons capers, drained
- 2 teaspoons celery seed
- 1-1/2 teaspoons seasoned salt
- 1/4 teaspoon hot pepper sauce
- 1 large red onion, thinly sliced
- 2 small lemons, thinly sliced

Directions:
- Place shrimp and bay leaves in an 11x7-in. dish. In a small bowl, whisk the oil, vinegar, capers, celery seed, seasoned salt and pepper sauce; pour over shrimp. Top with onion and lemons (dish will be full). Cover and refrigerate for 24 hours.
- Just before serving, drain and discard marinade and discard bay leaves.

green pepper spread Recipe ashleytisdalefan29

Ingredients:
- 1 package price chopper cream cheese softened
- 1/8 to 1/4 teaspoon of cayenne pepper
- 1/3 cup of salsa
- 1/4 cup chopped green peppers

Directions:
- in a medium bowl combine cheese, cayenne and salsa
- stir in green peppers
- chill, covered for two hours

Party Cheese Ball

Ingredients:
- 2 (8 oz.) pkg. Philadelphia Brand cream cheese, softened
- 2 c. Cheddar cheese
- 1 Tbsp. chopped pimento
- 1 Tbsp. chopped green pepper
- 1 Tbsp. chopped onion
- 2 tsp. Worcestershire sauce
- 1 tsp. lemon juice
- dash of ground red pepper
- dash of salt
- finely chopped pecans

Directions:
- Combine cream cheese and Cheddar cheese, mixing at medium speed on electric mixer until well blended.
- Add all remaining ingredients except pecans.
- Mix well.
- Chill.
- Shape into ball; roll in pecans.

Stuffed Pears

Ingredients:
- 2 small cans pear halves
- 8 oz. cream cheese
- 3/4 c. crushed pineapple
- 1/2 c. chopped nuts
- small jar cherries

Directions:
- Drain pears; place sliced side up on platter.
- Drain pineapple. Mix cream cheese, pineapple and nuts together; works best when cheese is at room temperature.
- Spoon into pears; top with cherry.

Summer Fruit Salad

Ingredients:
- 2 medium-size fresh peaches, peeled and thinly sliced
- 1 cup fresh blueberries
- 1 cup fresh raspberries
- 2 tablespoons powdered sugar
- 2 teaspoons lemon juice
- 2 teaspoons Grand Marnier or other orange-flavored liqueur
- 1/8 teaspoon ground cinnamon

Directions:
- Combine fruit in a large bowl. Combine sugar and remaining 3 ingredients in a small bowl, stirring well. Pour sugar mixture over fruit mixture, and toss gently. Cover and chill at least 30 minutes.

Chilorio(Pork Filling For Burritos)  

Ingredients:
- 2 lb. pork (shoulder or butt)
- 5 ancho chilies, dried
- 4 cloves garlic
- 1/2 c. liquid (water)
- 1/4 tsp. oregano
- 1/8 tsp. cumin
- vinegar or white wine

Directions:
- The Meat:
- Cut the pork into 1-inch cubes.
- Cover with water and cook for 45 minutes or until water has evaporated and the meat is barely browned.
- Remove meat from the pan and shred it with the tines of 2 forks.
- Save the fat that remains.

Strawberry Squares

Ingredients:
- 1 strawberry cake mix
- 2 eggs
- 1/3 c. oil
- 1 1/2 Tbsp. milk
- 1 c. powdered sugar

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350°.
- Mix together cake mix, eggs and oil until stiff.
- Spread the dough evenly in a lightly greased 9x13-inch pan.
- Bake 14 to 16 minutes.
- Mix the milk and powdered sugar.
- Drizzle the glaze over the squares.
- Serve warm or at room temperature.

Zucchini Relish

Ingredients:
- 5 c. grated zucchini
- 2 c. grated onions
- 6 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 1/4 c. white vinegar
- 2 1/4 c. sugar
- 2 tsp. nutmeg
- 2 tsp. dry mustard
- 1 1/2 tsp. turmeric
- 1 1/2 tsp. cornstarch
- 1/4 tsp. ground black pepper
- 1 tsp. celery salt
- 1 c. diced (1/8-inch) green pepper
- 1 c. diced (1/8-inch) red pepper

Directions:
- Place zucchini, onions and salt in a large bowl.
- Mix the ingredients well and cover.
- Refrigerate overnight.
- The next day, place mixture in a fine sieve; drain well, rinse under cold water and drain again for 1 hour.
- Place zucchini mixture in heavy soup pot with remaining ingredients.
- Bring to a boil; simmer, stirring occasionally, for 30 minutes.
- Cool to room temperature and refrigerate, covered.
- Will keep for up to 3 to 4 weeks.
- Yield: 5 cups.
- Good on hot dogs and sandwiches.

Sour Salad Dressing

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. Wish-Bone Italian dressing
- 2 Tbsp. ketchup
- 2 Tbsp. grated Parmesan cheese
- 1 level Tbsp. real mayonnaise

Directions:
- Blend on high speed for 10 seconds.
- Makes 2/3 cup; will keep long time.

Sam'S Skillet Feast

Ingredients:
- potatoes, sliced or cubed
- green peppers, sliced
- mushrooms, sliced
- garlic
- onions, sliced
- 3 eggs
- 3 Tbsp. olive oil

Directions:
- Put olive oil in frying pan.
- Put cut up potatoes, peppers, mushrooms, garlic and onions in frying pan.
- Cook until tender. Beat eggs and put over the mixture until set.

Gingerbread

Ingredients:
- 1 c. oil
- 1 c. sugar
- 1 c. molasses or sorghum
- 2 c. flour
- 1 pinch salt
- 3 eggs
- 2 tsp. soda
- 2 tsp. hot water
- 2 tsp. ginger
- 1 tsp. ginger
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 1 tsp. cloves
- 1 c. boiling water

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients.
- Pour into a 9 x 13-inch pan.
- Bake at 325° for 45 minutes.

Baked Chicken Salad

Ingredients:
- 2 (5 oz.) cans boned chicken (white meat), drained and rinsed (if it's packed in oil)
- 1 c. chopped celery
- 1/2 c. chopped pecans
- 3/4 c. mayonnaise
- 1 can cream of mushroom soup
- 2 hard-cooked eggs, smashed with fork
- 1 Tbsp. lemon juice
- salt and pepper

Directions:
- Mix all together.
- Bake at 450° for 15 minutes.

Christine's Best Ever Chocolate Chip Pecan Pie

Ingredients:
- 2 eggs
- 1 cup white sugar
- 12 cup flour
- 1 cup pecans, chopped
- 12 cup butter (melted and cooled to room temp)
- 1 cup chocolate chips
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 9 inches unbaked pie shells

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
- Combine all ingredients and mix well.
- Spread into pie shell.
- Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes.

Raw Vegan Gluten Free Granola

Ingredients:
- 4 cups Walnuts
- 1/2 teaspoons Celtic Sea Salt
- 1/2 cups Water
- 4 whole Dates, Pitted
- 5 whole Dried Apricots, Chopped
- 1/2 cups Dried Mulberries
- 1 teaspoon Cinnamon

Directions:
- 1.
- Soak walnuts and salt overnight in a large pyrex baking dish (9x13).
- 2.
- Rinse the walnuts, rinse the baking dish, then place the nuts back in the baking dish.
- 3.
- Place nuts in the oven on its lowest setting (135 degrees for our oven) and dehydrate the walnuts for 24 hours or until crispy.
- 4.
- Once nuts are dehydrated, remove from the oven and set aside.
- 5.
- Place dates and water in a food processor and pulse until a smooth paste forms.
- 6.
- Add walnuts, apricots, mulberries and cinnamon and pulse until coarse, like granola.
- 7.
- Place mixture in the oven in a large pyrex dish and dehydrate again for 24 hours or until crispy 8.
- Serve as a snack or as cereal with almond milk.

Warm Kale Salad With Prosciutto And Manchego

Ingredients:
- 1 bunch Kale
- 2 Tablespoons Olive Oil
- 2 teaspoons Garlic, Chopped
- 1 whole Pear, Sliced
- 4 slices Prosciutto
- 4 pieces Manchego Cheese, Shaved
- 1/4 cups Pistachios
- FOR THE DRESSING:
- 2/3 cups Olive Oil
- 1/3 cups Balsamic Vinegar
- 1 Tablespoon Honey
- 1 Tablespoon Water
- 1 teaspoon Grainy Mustard
- 2 cloves Garlic, Chopped

Directions:
- Wash kale well and remove leaves from the ribs. Discard ribs.
- Heat a skillet over medium-high heat. Add some olive oil and garlic. Saute garlic for a few minutes, being careful not to burn it.
- Add a big bunch of kale to the pan along with 1/4 cup of water. Cover with a lid and steam for 5 minutes or until water has evaporated. Toss with tongs and put into a bowl. Top with slices of pear, pieces of prosciutto, Manchego shavings and the pistachios.
- Add dressing ingredients to a small jar along with salt and pepper to taste and shake. Top salad with dressing.

Colors of Christmas

Ingredients:
- 1 lb whole green beans
- 14 1/2 oz diced tomatoes
- 1/4 cup dehydrated onions
- 1/3 tsp salt
- 1/3 tsp granulated garlic powder
- 1/3 cup butter
- 1/4 tsp ground black pepper

Directions:
- Heat butter add beans, onions, salt, pepper, and garlic.
- Simmer 3 minutes add tomatoes and cover
- Simmer 25 minutes covered.
- Remove from heat serve I hope you enjoy!

Chicken And Broccoli Saute

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. rigatoni
- 2 pkgs. broccoli spears
- 2 lbs. boneless chicken
- 1 red pepper
- 1/3 c. olive oil
- 1/4 c. margarine
- Italian seasoning
- garlic powder
- 1 small can sliced mushrooms
- 1 can cream of mushroom soup
- 1/4 c. Romano grated cheese
- 1/4 c. Parmesan grated cheese

Directions:
- Thaw broccoli and cut in half.
- Cut chicken into pieces.
- Chop red pepper.
- Saute chicken, red pepper and mushrooms in 1/3 cup of olive oil and 1/4 cup of margarine.
- Sprinkle with garlic powder and Italian seasoning.
- Add soup; stir and heat through.
- Boil 4 quarts of water; salt.
- Add rigatoni; cook 15 minutes, then add thawed broccoli and cook for 3 to 5 minutes longer.
- Drain in colander.
- Pour chicken mixture over rigatoni and broccoli.
- Add Romano and Parmesan cheese.
- Toss and serve.

Light Sugar Cinnamon Almonds

Ingredients:
- 3 14 cups whole almonds
- 34 cup sugar
- 34 cup Splenda granular
- 3 tablespoons cinnamon
- 1 egg white
- 1 12 teaspoons vanilla
- 18 teaspoon salt

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 300 degrees.
- Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
- In a bowl combine sugar and cinnamon.
- In another large bowl beat egg white until slightly frothy.
- Stir in vanilla and salt.
- Add almonds to egg mixture and toss to coat.
- Then pour cinnamon sugar mixture into almonds and toss to coat.
- Spread sugar coated almonds on lined baking sheet.
- Bake 25 minutes; stir after 10 minutes.
- Let cool and remove from pan.

Broiled Cheese Buns

Ingredients:
- 12 hot dog buns, halved
- 1 lb tillamook cheese, grated
- 1/4 cup olive oil
- 1 (8 ounce) can tomato sauce
- 5 green onions, with tops, chopped
- 1 (225 ml) jar stuffed olives, chopped
- 1 garlic clove, minced
- salt

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients together except hot dog buns.
- Spread mixture on halved buns.
- Bake in a 300 degree Fahrenheit oven for 5 minutes, then broil until lightly brown.
- Enjoy!

Chocolate Fudge Pudding

Ingredients:
- 1 c. plain flour
- 2 tsp. baking powder
- 1 tsp. salt
- 2/3 c. granulated sugar
- 6 Tbsp. cocoa
- 1/2 c. milk
- 2 Tbsp. melted butter
- 1/2 tsp. vanilla
- 1/2 c. pecans, chopped
- 1 c. brown sugar, packed

Directions:
- Requires no eggs.
- Sometimes I add one.

Mexican Dip

Ingredients:
- 1 large sour cream
- 1 bunch (3) green onions
- 1 bell pepper
- 8 oz. shredded Cheddar cheese
- 2 tomatoes, chopped
- 1 jar salsa

Directions:
- Put sour cream in bottom of dish.
- Chop green onions, bell pepper and tomatoes.
- Put on top of sour cream.
- Add shredded cheese on top.
- Add salsa right before serving.
- Great served with nacho chips.

Chocolate Pie

Ingredients:
- 2 1/2 c. sugar
- 4 Tbsp. cocoa
- 4 Tbsp. flour
- 1 stick margarine, melted
- 3 eggs
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 large can evaporated milk
- 2 unbaked pie shells (not deep)

Directions:
- Mix ingredients.
- Pour in pie shells. Bake at 350° for 45 minutes.

Oatmeal Pie

Ingredients:
- 2/3 c. margarine, melted
- 2/3 c. white sugar
- 2/3 c. white Karo syrup
- 2 eggs, beaten
- 2/3 c. uncooked oatmeal
- dash of salt

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients together. Pour into unbaked pie shell. Bake at 350° for 45 minutes.

White Russian Vegetable Soup Recipe

Ingredients:
- 2 c. diced beets
- 4 c. shredded cabbage
- 2 lbs. stew meat, cut in 2" - 3/4" cubes
- 2 lg. onions, diced
- 3 1/2 c. tomatoes
- 8 c. beef bouillon
- 3/4 c. fresh lemon juice
- 6 garlic cloves, chopped
- 1/4 c. minced parsley
- 1 sm. bay leaf, crumbled
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- 3 tbsp. sugar
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1 teaspoon pepper
- Lowfat sour cream

Directions:
- Cover stew meat with 8 c. of beef bouillon.
- Bring to a boil, turn back heat, cover and simmer for 1 hour.
- Add in vegetables, lemon juice and seasonings.
- Continue to cook for 1 more hour.
- Adjust seasonings.
- Serve with a generous spoonful of lowfat sour cream per serving.
- Yield: 12 c..

Cranberry Cream Pie

Ingredients:
- 2 (8 or 9-inch) pie shells, baked and cooled
- 8 oz. cream cheese, softened
- 16 oz. can jellied cranberry sauce
- frozen whipped topping, thawed
- 1 c. confectioners sugar
- whipped topping, thawed (for garnish)

Directions:
- Whip cream cheese until soft and fluffy.
- Beat in confectioners sugar.
- Stir in cranberry sauce; fold in whipped topping.
- Divide filling between the 2 pie shells.
- Freeze.

Cheesy Potato Beans Delight

Ingredients:
- 4 potatoes, unpeeled
- 3 (215 g) cans vegetarian baked beans
- 13 cup cheddar cheese, finely grated
- cooking oil

Directions:
- Wash the potatoes.
- Place in the oven.
- Bake at 100 degrees for 5 minutes.
- Change the side and bake for another 5 minutes.
- Remove from oven.
- Cut the potatoes into 4 parts.
- Scoop out the centre.
- Fill with baked beans and top with cheddar cheese.
- Place in the oven for 10 minutes or till the cheese melts and serve.

Go Bananas Crumb Bread

Ingredients:
- 1-3/4 cups all-purpose flour
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 1 teaspoon baking soda
- 3/4 teaspoon salt
- 3 medium bananas, mashed
- 1 cup sugar
- 2 eggs, lightly beaten
- 1/2 cup butter, melted
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1/3 cup packed brown sugar
- 3 tablespoons all-purpose flour
- 3 tablespoons sugar
- 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 2 tablespoons cold butter

Directions:
- In a large bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt. In a small bowl, whisk the bananas, sugar, eggs, butter and vanilla. Stir into dry ingredients just until moistened. Transfer to a greased 9x5-in. loaf pan.
- For topping, in a small bowl, combine the brown sugar, flour, sugar and cinnamon; cut in butter until crumbly. Sprinkle over batter.
- Bake at 350° for 50-55 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pan to a wire rack.

Mud Hens

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. butter
- 1 c. sugar
- 1 egg
- 1 yolk
- 1 1/2 c. flour
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. baking powder
- 1 tsp. vanilla

Directions:
- Mix together and spread in 9 x 13-inch pan.
- Beat 1 egg white; add 1
- cup	of
- light
- brown sugar and 1 cup of chopped nuts. Spread
- on top of first mixture.
- Bake 20 to 25 minutes at 325°.

Bluefish Cakes

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. or 2 c. cooked bluefish
- 2 slices white bread, crusts removed and bread crumbled
- 1 egg
- 1 1/2 Tbsp. mayonnaise
- 1 Tbsp. spicy mustard
- 1 Tbsp. fresh chopped parsley
- dash of Old Bay seasoning (seafood seasoning)
- oil for frying

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients together in a large bowl (except oil). Form mixture into cakes.
- Fry or saute fish cakes in hot oil until golden brown.

Betty Carter's Refrigerator Pickles

Ingredients:
- 12 pounds cucumbers very small
