- 1 each onions sliced
- 4 cups sugar
- 4 cups vinegar
- 1/2 cup salt
- 113 tablespoons celery seeds
- 113 tablespoons mustard seeds
- 113 teaspoons turmeric

Directions:
- Slice cucumbers and onion and place in gallon jars.
- Mix remaining ingredients well.
- Pour mixture over cucumbers.
- Screw lids on tightly.
- Place in refrigerator.
- Let stand 5 days before tasting.
- Will keep for a year.

Fast And Filling Tortellini Dinner(Serves 3 To 4)  

Ingredients:
- 1 pkg. frozen tortellini
- 2 pkg. Rondele or Alouette garlic and herb cheese
- 1 large handful sliced ham, cut into bits
- 6 to 8 oz. fresh mushrooms
- 2 Tbsp. to 1/3 c. Parmesan cheese
- butter or margarine

Directions:
- Cook tortellini according to package instructions.
- Meanwhile, cook mushrooms in butter over medium heat until well cooked but not at all crunchy.
- Drain tortellini.
- Return to pot.
- Dump in cheeses, mushrooms and ham.
- Toss until Rondele is melted.

Milnot Cheesecake

Ingredients:
- 1 small pkg. lemon jello
- 1 can Milnot
- 1 c. boiling water
- 3 Tbsp. lemon juice
- 8 oz. pkg. cream cheese
- 1 c. sugar
- 1 tsp. vanilla

Directions:
- Dissolve jello in water.
- Cream sugar and cream cheese together, then mix jello and cream cheese mixture together, adding vanilla and lemon juice.
- Whip Milnot, then fold into other mixture.
- Pour into a 9 x 12-inch graham cracker crust in a 9 x 12-inch pan.
- Chill until stiff and serve.

Marsala Cream

Ingredients:
- 1 shallot minced
- 1 tablespoon unsalted butter
- 1 cup marsala wine
- 1 teaspoon fresh thyme leaves
- 1 cup heavy cream
- 2 tablespoons unsalted butter cut into 1/4-in. cubes
- salt
- white pepper

Directions:
- Saute' shallot in the butter, covered, for 5 minutes. Add the marsala and thyme, and reduce until about 2 tablespoons of liquid remain.
- Add the cream, and continue simmering until reduced by half. Add the butter, and stir continuously, until fully emulsified. Season with salt and pepper. Set aside, keeping warm until ready to serve.

Delicious Cookies

Ingredients:
- 1 c. white sugar
- 1 c. brown sugar
- 1 c. margarine
- 1 c. oil
- 1 egg
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 tsp. cream of tartar
- 1 tsp. soda
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 c. Rice Krispies
- 1 c. flaked coconut
- 1 c. oatmeal
- 1/2 c. walnuts
- 3 3/4 c. flour

Directions:
- Mix in order. Press down with fork and flour. Bake at 350° for 12 to 15 minutes.

Parsley Dumplings 

Ingredients:
- Nonstick vegetable oil spray
- 1 cup all purpose flour
- 1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder
- 1/4 teaspoon coarse kosher salt
- 1 1/2 tablespoons butter, cut into 1/2-inch cubes
- 1/2 cup whole milk
- 2 tablespoons chopped fresh Italian parsley
- bamboo steamer or metal steamer rack.

Directions:
- Spray bamboo steamer basket or large metal steamer rack with nonstick spray. Add enough water to large skillet to reach depth of 1 inch. Bring water to boil; reduce to simmer.
- Meanwhile, whisk flour, baking powder, and kosher salt in medium bowl to blend. Using fingertips, rub butter into dry ingredients until incorporated. Add milk and chopped parsley and stir just to blend. Drop small walnut-size mounds of dough into prepared steamer basket, spacing dumplings apart. Set steamer basket atop simmering water and cover tightly. Steam dumplings until cooked through, about 10 minutes. DO AHEAD:

Candy Bar Pie

Ingredients:
- 1 c. milk
- 1 pkg unflavored gelatin (knox)
- 4-2 1/2 oz. milkyway bars
- 2-8 oz. cream cheese
- 2 tbsp. sugar
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 c. cool whip
- 1 10 in. crust (baked or graham crust)

Directions:
- Mix 1 cup milk and pkg of unflavored gelatin (knox) together. Stir over low heat till dissolved.
- Then add 4-2 1/2 oz milkyways (cut up).
- Stir till smooth---add cool whip.

Sauteed Sole with Grapefruit

Ingredients:
- 1 grapefruit
- 1 tablespoon butter
- 2 (5 ounce) sole fillets
- kosher salt
- freshly ground black pepper
- cayenne pepper
- 2 tablespoons shallots, minced
- 3 tablespoons chopped red bell peppers
- 2 tablespoons grapefruits
- 2 tablespoons orange juice
- 1 tablespoon chopped cilantro

Directions:
- Peel and section grapefruit.
- Save the juice that accumulates and add to the orange and grapefruit juice.
- Put butter in a non-stick skillet over medium heat.
- Season sole with salt, pepper and cayenne to taste.
- Add sole and cook about 3 minutes on each side, turning carefully.
- Remove when springy to the touch and keep warm.
- Add shallots and bell pepper and cook until shallots soften, about 3 minutes.
- Add grapefruit sections and juice.
- Bring to a boil and let reduce for a minute or two.
- Pour over fish and sprinkle with cilantro.

Porcupine Meatballs

Ingredients:
- 1 beaten egg
- 1 (10 3/4 oz.) can condensed tomato soup
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 1 tsp. Worcestershire sauce
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/4 c. Success rice
- 2 Tbsp. chopped onion
- 1 Tbsp. parsley flakes
- 1/8 tsp. pepper

Directions:
- In a bowl, combine egg and 1/4 cup soup.
- Stir in uncooked rice, onion, parsley flakes, salt and pepper.
- Add beef; mix well. Shape meat mixture into approximately 20 small balls.

Sweet Potato, Zucchini & Feta Mini Muffins 

Ingredients:
- 1 sweet potato medium, grated
- 1 medium zucchini grated
- 1 red onion medium, grated
- 1/2 cup cheese grated
- 100 grams feta crumbled
- 1/3 cup spelt flour
- 4 eggs

Directions:
- Combine all ingredients and spoon into mini muffin trays. (Tip: Use silicon trays to stop muffins sticking)
- Bake at 180°C for 15 minutes

Black Mission Fig Yogurt Salad Recipe

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. Plain non-fat yogurt
- 1/2 c. Diced black mission figs
- 1/2 c. Diced seedless cucumber
- 1/2 c. Diced red onion
- 1/2 c. Minced cilantro leaves Grated peel of 1/2 lime

Directions:
- Combine all the ingredients in a bowl and serve immediately or possibly chill till needed.
- Yield: 4 servings

Blueberry Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 can blueberries (not pie filling)
- 1 pkg. (large) raspberry jello
- 1 can crushed pineapple
- 1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese
- 8 oz. sour cream
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1/2 c. sugar

Directions:
- Put jello in bowl.
- Boil 2 cups of water.
- Pour over jello. Mix well.
- Stir in cans of blueberries and pineapple.
- Set in refrigerator and chill until firm.
- May set in freezer 30 minutes then set in refrigerator.
- Mix sour cream, vanilla, cream cheese and sugar until smooth.
- Spread over top of firm mixture. Sprinkle with chopped pecans.

Chicken And Broccoli

Ingredients:
- 6 chicken breasts, boiled and deboned
- 2 pkg. frozen broccoli or fresh broccoli, cooked and drained
- 1/2 c. mayo
- 1/4 tsp. curry powder
- 1 can cream of chicken soup
- 1 c. grated Parmesan cheese
- bread crumbs (use several slices stale bread, crusts removed)

Directions:
- Break up chicken and layer in lightly greased 9 x 13-inch pan with the broccoli over top of chicken.
- Make sauce of mayo, curry powder and soup.
- Mix together and pour sauce over chicken and broccoli.
- Top with cheese and bread crumbs.
- Bake at 350° for 1 hour.

Bible Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 c. Judges 5:25 (butter)
- 2 c. Jeremiah 6:20 (sugar)
- 2 tsp. 1 Samuel 14:25 (honey)
- 6 Jeremiah 17:11 (eggs)
- 1/2 c. Judges 4:19 (milk)
- 4 1/2 c. 1 Kings 4:22 (flour)
- 2 tsp. Amos 4:5 (salt)
- 1 c. 1 Samuel 30:12 (raisins)
- 1 c. Nahum 3:12 (figs)
- 2 Chronicles 9:9 (spices to taste)

Directions:
- Cream together the butter, sugar and honey.
- Beat eggs until frothy.
- Add milk to creamed mixture.
- Sift together salt and flour.
- Mix with the rest of the ingredients.
- Raisins and figs are chopped and lightly floured before adding.
- Beat a good 5 minutes.
- Bake in a 9 x 2 x 13-inch pan (greased) in a 375° oven for 30 minutes or until inserted toothpick comes out dry.

Salmon Patties

Ingredients:
- 1 c. bread crumbs, cracker crumbs or crushed cornflakes
- salt to taste
- 2 eggs
- 1/2 tsp. dry mustard
- 1/2 tsp. paprika
- few grains garlic salt
- small onion, diced

Directions:
- Combine all ingredients; fry in hot skillet, dropping by spoonfuls in hot grease, turning when brown.

A Taste Of Thanksgiving

Ingredients:
- 16 oz. frozen egg noodles
- 2 c. cooked turkey, diced
- 2 oz. pimento, chopped
- 10 oz. pkg. frozen peas and carrots
- 1 can cream of mushroom soup
- 1/2 c. milk
- 1 c. water
- 3 c. shredded Cheddar cheese

Directions:
- Cook noodles in boiling water for 20 minutes.
- Drain.
- Combine noodles, turkey, pimento and peas and carrots in large mixing bowl.
- In saucepan, combine soup, milk, water and cheese.
- Heat to boiling point, stirring frequently to prevent scorching.
- Pour cheese sauce over other ingredients and mix.
- Place entire noodle mixture into 9 x 13-inch baking dish.
- Bake at 375° for 30 minutes.
- Makes 8 servings.

Macaroni And Cheese

Ingredients:
- 1 pkg. sea shell macaroni
- 1 Tbsp. margarine
- 1/4 c. chopped onion
- 1 (2 oz.) jar diced pimento, drained
- 2 c. (8 oz.) shredded Cheddar cheese
- 1 (10 oz.) can cream of mushroom soup
- 1/2 c. mayonnaise
- 1 (2 oz.) jar sliced mushrooms, drained

Directions:
- Cook macaroni according to package directions and drain.
- Melt butter in small skillet; add onion and pimento.
- Saute until onion is tender.
- Combine macaroni, onion, mixture and remaining ingredients.
- Mix well.
- Spoon in lightly buttered casserole. Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.

Two Potato Sticks Recipe

Ingredients:
- 2 yellow gold potatoes (if unavailable, use 2 baking potatoes)
- 2 sweet potatoes
- 1/4 c. extra virgin olive oil
- 1 clove garlic, chopped
- 1 teaspoon minced fresh rosemary
- 1/2 teaspoon paprika
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/8 teaspoon pepper

Directions:
- Scrub gold and sweet potatoes; pat dry with paper towels.
- Pierce each with a fork several times.
- Arrange in circle in bottom of microwave oven.
- Microwave potatoes on high till tender, about 10-15 min, rearranging 2-3 times.
- Set potatoes aside to cold slightly.
- In microwaveable bowl, combine oil and remaining ingredients.
- Microwave on high 2 min.
- Preheat broiler.
- Cut potatoes lengthwise into thick wedges or possibly sticks.
- Arrange on broiler pan, brush with oil mix and broil till lightly browned.
- Serves 4.

Sausage Swirls

Ingredients:
- 2 (8 oz.) cans crescent rolls
- 1 lb. sausage (Jimmy Dean in rolls works best)
- Dijon mustard

Directions:
- Lay rolls in rectangular sheet on waxed paper and press seams closed.
- Top each with uncooked sausage.
- Spread Dijon mustard over sausage.
- Roll jelly roll style so as to create a long narrow roll.
- Freeze.
- Thaw enough to cut and slice approximately 1/2 inch each.
- Bake 15 to 20 minutes or until golden brown in 375° oven.

Fried Cabbage

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 sticks butter
- 1 med head of cabbage, chopped
- 1 med onion, chopped
- 6 - 8 slices bacon

Directions:
- Cut bacon into bite sized pieces.
- In large pot or Dutch oven, saute bacon and onion with butter until tender.
- Add cabbage and fry till done, stirring occasionally.
- You may need to add more butter depending on the flavor desired.

Sweet And Sour Bites

Ingredients:
- 1 (10 oz.) jar currant jelly
- 1 (6 oz.) jar prepared mustard
- 2 pkg. wieners (10/pkg.)

Directions:
- Cut each wiener 7 times for bite size pieces.
- Add wieners to sauce.
- Serve hot in fondue pot.
- Use toothpicks to serve.
- Makes about 160 pieces.

Cheesy Bacon Wrapped Breadsticks

Ingredients:
- 1 cup grated parmesan cheese
- 2 teaspoons garlic salt or 2 teaspoons garlic powder
- 1 teaspoon cayenne pepper
- 12 teaspoon of freshly grated nutmeg
- 24 slices bacon
- 24 long breadsticks

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350.
- Line cookie sheet with parchment paper.
- In a medium size mixing bowl, combine the parmesan, garlic salt, cayenne and nutmeg.
- GENTLY wrap each breadstick with a slice of bacon (so breadsticks dont break), then place wrapped bread sticks on a cookie sheet lined with parchment paper.
- If you break one, just cut bacon to fit and add to sheet.
- No one will care if the pieces are small.
- Bake for 15 minutes or until bacon is cooked to your liking.
- Next, roll the breadsticks in cheese & spices.
- Do this while bacon and breadsticks are still warm, then set aside and let cool.
- Can be made a day ahead and even taste great cold (hey, its bacon)!

Stir-Fried Okra

Ingredients:
- 2 c. sliced okra
- 1 onion, diced
- 1 green pepper, diced
- 1/2 c. diced celery
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 tsp. pepper
- 1/8 to 1/4 tsp. crushed thyme
- 3 Tbsp. oil (hot)
- 1 medium tomato, cut into 8 wedges
- soy sauce

Directions:
- Stir-fry the first 7 ingredients for 6 to 10 minutes.
- Add tomatoes and stir-fry 2 more minutes.
- Sprinkle with soy sauce.

Zucchini Ribbon Salad

Ingredients:
- 2 None medium zucchini and/or yellow squash, sliced into ribbons
- 3 None large carrots, peeled, sliced into ribbons
- 1 None large shallot, finely chopped
- 2 tbsp olive oil
- 1 tbsp white wine vinegar
- 1 tsp Dijon mustard

Directions:
- Combine zucchini, carrots and shallot. Whisk together olive oil, vinegar and mustard. Season then pour over vegetable mixture and toss to combine. Serve.

Stovetop Orzo Medley

Ingredients:
- 1-1/4 cups uncooked orzo pasta
- 2 shallots, finely chopped
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 3/4 pound fresh snow peas
- 1/2 pound assorted fresh mushrooms (such as portobello, button
- shiitake), thinly sliced
- 1/4 cup pine nuts
- 2 tablespoons butter
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon coarsely ground pepper
- 1/4 cup finely chopped sweet red pepper

Directions:
- Cook orzo according to package directions. Meanwhile, in a large skillet, saute shallots in oil for 2 minutes. Add peas and mushrooms; cook 3 minutes longer. Add pine nuts; cook and stir until vegetables are tender.
- Drain orzo; stir in the shallot mixture, butter, salt and pepper until blended. Sprinkle with red pepper.

Minestrone Soup

Ingredients:
- 3/4 c. sliced carrots
- 3/4 c. sliced celery
- 3/4 c. chopped onion
- 3/4 c. green beans
- 1/2 c. whole grain macaroni
- 1 c. sliced zucchini
- 1 qt. water
- 1 1/2 c. tomato puree
- 3/4 c. cooked kidney beans
- 2 1/2 Tbsp. chopped parsley
- 2 1/2 Tbsp. chopped scallion
- 1 tsp. basil
- 4 Tbsp. vegetable broth powder

Directions:
- Simmer all ingredients together until the carrots are tender. Serves 4.

Whiskey Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 pkg. French vanilla cake mix
- 1 pkg. instant vanilla pudding
- 4 eggs
- 1/2 c. oil
- 1/2 c. water
- 1/2 c. whiskey
- 1 c. chocolate chips
- 1 c. walnuts

Directions:
- Beat all ingredients (except chocolate chips and nuts) together for 2 minutes.
- Add chocolate chips and nuts and stir through batter.
- Pour into a greased and floured tube pan.
- Bake 45 to 55 minutes at 350°.
- Sprinkle with powdered sugar.

Chili-Lime Cream Sauce 

Ingredients:
- 1/4 cup dry white wine
- 1/4 cup fresh lime juice
- 1 tablespoon chopped peeled fresh ginger
- 1 tablespoon minced shallot
- 1/3 cup whipping cream
- 2 tablespoons chili-garlic sauce*
- 6 tablespoons (3/4 stick) unsalted butter, room temperature, cut into 1/2-inch pieces

Directions:
- Combine first 4 ingredients in heavy small saucepan. Boil over high heat until reduced by half, about 3 minutes. Add cream and boil until reduced by half, about 2 minutes. Reduce heat to low. Mix in chili-garlic sauce. Add butter, 1 piece at a time, whisking just until melted before adding next piece.
- *Available in the Asian foods section of many supermarkets and at Asian markets.

Quinoa-Oat Chocolate Chip Cookies

Ingredients:
- 14 tablespoons butter (at room temperature)
- 3/4 cup brown sugar
- 1/2 cup white sugar
- 2 eggs
- 1/2-1 tablespoons vanilla
- 1 cup white flour
- 1/2 cup white whole wheat flour or quinoa flour
- 1 teaspoon baking soda
- 3/4 teaspoon salt
- 1 cup quinoa flakes
- 1-1/2 cups chocolate chips (I use a mix of semi and bitter sweet)

Directions:
- Heat oven to 350 F.
- In a large bowl beat butter, oil and sugars until creamy. Then add eggs and vanilla. Beat well
- Add baking soda and salt and stir to combine. Next add flours. Once they are mixed in, add oats and quinoa flakes. Final addition is chocolate chips.

Cottage Cheese Bread Ii

Ingredients:
- 3/4 cup warm water (110 degrees F/45 degrees C)
- 1 cup cottage cheese, room temperature
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 1 egg
- 3 cups all-purpose flour
- 2 tablespoons white sugar
- 1/4 teaspoon baking soda
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1 3/4 teaspoons active dry yeast

Directions:
- Add the ingredients to the pan of your bread machine in the order suggested by the manufacturer, and Start. You can use more bread flour if the dough seems too sticky.

Cabbage Meatballs

Ingredients:
- 2 c. shredded cabbage
- 1 lb. ground meat
- 1/4 c. regular rice (uncooked)
- salt and pepper
- 2 cans tomato soup
- 1 can water

Directions:
- Mix first four ingredients together.
- Make meatballs. Put into skillet; add tomato soup and water.
- Simmer 1 1/2 hours or until done.
- Serves 4.

Idaho Spud Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 c. margarine, softened
- 2 c. sugar
- 2 eggs
- 1 c. cold mashed potatoes
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 2 c. flour
- 1/4 c. cocoa
- 1 tsp. soda
- 1 c. milk
- 1 c. chopped nuts

Directions:
- Cream margarine and sugar until fluffy.
- Add eggs, one at a time.
- Beat well after each addition.
- Blend in potatoes and vanilla.
- Combine flour, cocoa and baking soda.
- Add alternately with milk.
- Blend well after each addition.
- Stir in nuts.
- Bake in greased 13 x 9-inch pan at 350°
- for 40 to 50 minutes.
- Cool on wire rack.
- Frost with Granny's Good Frosting.

Mom'S Chocolate Chip Cookies 

Ingredients:
- 1/3 cup vegetable shortening
- 1/3 cup butter flavored shortening
- 1/2 cup sugar
- 1/2 cup brown sugar
- 1 egg
- 1 tsp. vanilla extract
- 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1/2 tsp. baking soda
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 cup chopped walnuts (optional)
- 6 oz. semi-sweet chocolate chips

Directions:
- Sift together flour, baking soda, and salt. Set aside.
- Cream both types of shortening together with both types of sugar in a mixer until light and fluffy.
- Reduce speed and slowly add egg and vanilla extract. Wait until fully incorporated.
- Slowly add dry ingredients.
- Reduce to slowest speed and stir in chocolate chips and nuts.
- Make into 1.5-inch balls and place on sheet pans lined with parchment.
- Bake for 8 minutes at 375 degrees or until golden brown around the edges.
- Move parchment sheets with cookies to cooling racks to cool completely.

Pound Cake

Ingredients:
- 2 sticks margarine, whipped
- 3 c. sugar
- 3 c. all-purpose flour
- 3 eggs
- 1/2 c. Wesson oil
- 1 Tbsp. baking powder
- 1 Tbsp. vanilla
- 1/4 Tbsp. salt
- 1 c. sweet milk

Directions:
- Cream the margarine.
- Add sugar and eggs one at a time.
- Mix half of the flour, half the milk, salt and baking powder.
- Add remainder of milk and flour and then the oil and vanilla.
- Beat 1 minute.
- Pour in 10-inch tube pan.
- Put in cool oven and bake at 325° for 1 1/2 hours.

Chili

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 1 onion, sliced
- 1 (1 lb. 13 oz.) can tomatoes
- 1 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 1/2 tsp. dry mustard
- 2 1/2 tsp. chili powder
- 1 small garlic clove
- 2 (15 1/2 oz.) cans red kidney beans

Directions:
- Brown meat.
- Drain off fat.
- Add all ingredients, except kidney beans.
- Simmer uncovered 2 to 3 hours.

Brunch Casserole For 8

Ingredients:
- 16 soft scrambled eggs
- 2 cans mushroom soup
- 3/4 c. milk
- 2 Tbsp. minced green onions
- 8 oz. sharp cheese
- 1 can sliced mushrooms
- 1/2 can water chestnuts
- 2 Tbsp. Parmesan cheese

Directions:
- Place scrambled eggs in buttered shallow baking dish.
- Add milk to mushroom soup.
- Add cheese and stir until melted.
- Pour over eggs the can of mushrooms, green onions, water chestnuts and Parmesan cheese.
- Place in 350° oven for 10 minutes or until thoroughly heated.

Tomato Delight

Ingredients:
- 1 medium tomato, sliced into 6 slices
- oregano
- mayonnaise
- 4 slices cooked, crumbled bacon
- 2 oz. sliced Muenster cheese

Directions:
- Sprinkle tomato slices with oregano.
- Put small amount of mayonnaise on each slice.
- Sprinkle with bacon; cover with cheese. Broil on cookie sheet until cheese is melted.

Good, Good Greenbeans

Ingredients:
- 2 (14.5 ounce) cans green beans, drained
- 1 (10 ounce) can mung bean sprouts, drained
- 1 red onion, sliced
- 1/2 cup vegetable oil
- 1/2 cup white sugar
- 1/2 cup distilled white vinegar
- 1 teaspoon garlic powder

Directions:
- Mix together vinegar, oil, sugar, and garlic powder. Add onion. Mix beans and bean sprouts into the vinegar and oil mixture. Cover and marinate overnight before serving.

Beefy Cheese Ball

Ingredients:
- 8 oz. cream cheese, softened
- 1 Tbsp. mayo
- 1/2 green bell pepper, chopped
- 1 (8 oz.) can crushed pineapple, drained
- 1 (4 oz.) pkg. chipped beef
- crackers

Directions:
- Mix cream cheese and mayo in bowl until smooth.
- Add next 3 ingredients.
- Shape into ball.
- Chill until firm.
- Serve with crackers.

Peach Ice Cream

Ingredients:
- 2 cups milk
- 3/4 cup sugar
- A 1-inch piece vanilla bean
- 3 egg yolks
- 1 1/2 pounds ripe peaches
- 2 tablespoons lemon juice

Directions:
- In a small noncorrosive heavy saucepan, warm the milk with the sugar and the vanilla bean.
- Whisk the eggs slightly and add a little of the hot milk to them.
- Mix them and add the remaining milk.
- Cook over low heat, stirring constantly until the custard is thick enough to coat the spoon.
- Do not cook too fast or the mixture will curdle.
- Remove from heat and cool.
- Meanwhile, peel the peaches and remove the pits.
- Coarsely puree the peaches with the lemon juice in a food processor.
- Set aside.
- Remove the vanilla bean from the custard.
- Mix the custard with the peach puree and freeze according to the manufacturer's directions for your ice cream maker.

Cheesecake Cupcakes

Ingredients:
- 18 vanilla wafers
- 16 oz. cream cheese
- 2 tsp. vanilla
- 2 eggs
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 1 can cherry pie filling

Directions:
- Line muffin tins with 18 cupcake liners.
- Put one vanilla wafer in the bottom of each cupcake liner.
- Beat the cream cheese, vanilla, eggs and sugar together for 5 minutes.
- Pour enough mixture over each of the vanilla wafers to fill the cupcake liners about 3/4 full.
- Bake at 375° for 12 to 15 minutes (cracks on top when done).
- Put cherry pie filling on top of each one. Refrigerate.

Super-Stuffed Game-Day Sandwich

Ingredients:
- 1 loaf white bread unsliced
- 1/2 cup Hellmann's or Best Foods Real Mayonnaise
- 1/2 cup wish-bone ranch dressing
- 4 ounces deli roast beef sliced
- 4 ounces sliced deli turkey breast
- 4 ounces cooked ham sliced
- 1/2 cup red onion thinly sliced
- 1/3 cup dill pickles slices
- 2 cups iceberg lettuce shredded
- 1 medium tomato thinly sliced

Directions:
- Cut off 1/3 of the bread lengthwise; reserve. Remove inside of bread, leaving 1-inch shell.
- Combine Hellmann's(R) or Best Foods(R) Real Mayonnaise with Dressing in small bowl. Evenly spread mayonnaise mixture in shell, then layer remaining ingredients. Replace bread top.
- Wrap tightly in plastic wrap or aluminum foil and chill 30 minutes or overnight.

Greek Chicken Easy Delicious

Ingredients:
- 12 teaspoon salt
- 12 teaspoon pepper
- 1 12 teaspoons all purpose Greek seasoning
- 4 boneless skinless chicken breasts
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 red bell pepper, chopped
- 1 small onion, thinly sliced
- 12 cup dry white wine
- 12 cup chicken broth
- 16 small black olives, pitted
- 4 cups rice, cooked
- 2 teaspoons fresh flat-leaf parsley, chopped

Directions:
- Combine first 3 ingredients; sprinkle evenly over chicken.
- Cook chicken in hot oil in a large ovenproof skillet over medium-high heat 5 minutes on each side or until browned.
- Remove chicken.
- Add bell pepper and onion to skillet; saute 5 minutes or until tender.
- Stir in wine and broth, stirring to loosen particles from bottom of pan.
- Stir in olives.
- Return chicken to skillet.
- Bring to a boil.
- Remove skillet from heat.
- Bake, covered, at 350 for 30 minutes or until chicken is done.
- Combine rice and chopped parsley.
- Serve chicken over rice.

Chicken Noodle Pilaf

Ingredients:
- 1 small onion, chopped
- 14 cup butter
- 1 cup uncooked rice
- 2 12 cups water
- 1 (2 1/2 ounce) packagedry chicken noodle soup mix
- 2 teaspoons dried parsley
- 12 teaspoon dried thyme
- 14 teaspoon rubbed sage

Directions:
- In a large pan, saute onion and rice until rice turns a light golden brown.
- Add remaining ingredients.
- Bring to a boil.
- Reduce heat, cover and simmer 15 minutes.
- Remove from heat and let stand, covered, about 10 minutes.

Salmon Thai Curry Noodle Soup

Ingredients:
- 1 cup coconut milk
- 2 tbsp red curry paste
- 1 liter stock
- 2 tsp fish sauce
- 2 cup soy noodle
- 1 bunch cooked salmon flake
- 1 kalamansi
- 1 bunch slice fresh red cili

Directions:
- bring stock to a boil then add thai red curry paste and coconut milk
- add fish sauce then add soy noodle simmer for 2 minute then off heat
- serve top garnish

Fresh Asparagus Sesame

Ingredients:
- 1 bunch fresh young asparagus
- 1 medium red bell pepper, cut in strips
- 1 Tbsp. fine virgin olive oil
- 1 Tbsp. butter
- few drops sesame oil
- 1 1/2 Tbsp. sesame seed
- salt to taste

Directions:
- Steam asparagus until tender-crisp (about 8 minutes).

Brown Sugar Chocolate Chip Cookies

Ingredients:
- 3/4 c. shortening (butter flavored Crisco)
- 1 1/4 c. firmly packed brown sugar
- 2 Tbsp. milk
- 1 Tbsp. vanilla
- 1 egg
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 3/4 c. all-purpose flour
- 3/4 tsp. baking soda
- 1 c. chocolate chips
- 1 c. pecans or walnuts (finely ground)

Directions:
- Cream together
- first
- 5 ingredients.
- Mix flour, salt, sugar and soda together.
- Add to sugar mixture gradually.
- Mix in chips and
- nuts.
- Drop
- by teaspoonfuls on ungreased cookie sheet.
- Bake at
- 375°
- for
- 10
- minutes
- for chewy cookies, 13 minutes for crisp cookies.
- Makes 3 1/2 to 4 dozen.

Butter Cake

Ingredients:
- 2 sticks butter
- 3 c. sugar
- 6 eggs
- 3 c. cake flour
- 1/2 pt. whipping cream
- 1 tsp. vanilla

Directions:
- Mix eggs, sugar and butter, then add vanilla flavoring and flour.
- Fold whipping cream in dough.
- Do not stir whipping cream in; fold in.
- Bake 45 minutes at 375°.

Mexican Dip

Ingredients:
- 4 fresh tomatoes, chopped fine
- 10 to 12 green onions, chopped
- 2 small cans chopped ripe olives
- 6 Tbsp. vegetable oil
- 3 Tbsp. red wine vinegar
- 2 tsp. garlic salt

Directions:
- Mix together and let set in the refrigerator overnight.
- Serve with Doritos.

Ritz Chocolate Cookies

Ingredients:
- 1 box Ritz crackers or Town House
- 1 jar peanut butter
- 2 bags summer chocolate wafers

Directions:
- Make cookies using 2 Ritz crackers, putting peanut butter between crackers.
- Then dip cookie in melted chocolate.
- Very good.

Strawberry Daiquiri

Ingredients:
- 2 ounces light rum
- 1 ounce Grand Marnier (optional)
- 1 12 tablespoons lime juice
- 3 tablespoons icing sugar
- 1 cup frozen unsweetened strawberries
- 1 cup ice

Directions:
- Place all ingredients in blender in order listed.
- Blend until desired consistency.

Striped Fruit Pops

Ingredients:
- 3/4 cup honey, divided
- 2 cups sliced fresh strawberries
- 12 plastic cups or Popsicle molds (3 ounces each)
- 6 kiwifruit, peeled and sliced
- 12 Popsicle sticks
- 1-1/3 cups sliced fresh ripe peaches

Directions:
- In a blender, combine 1/4 cup honey and strawberries; cover and process until blended. Pour into cups or molds. Freeze for 30 minutes or until firm.
- In a blender, combine 1/4 cup honey and kiwi; cover and process until blended. Pour over frozen strawberry layer; insert Popsicle sticks. Freeze until firm.
- Repeat with peaches and remaining honey; pour over kiwi layer. Freeze until firm.

Angel Food Poppy Seed Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 box Betty Crocker angel food cake mix
- 2 egg whites
- 1/3 c. poppy seed
- 1 1/4 c. water

Directions:
- Empty contents of angel food cake mix into mixing bowl.
- Add egg whites, poppy seed and water and bake according to directions on cake mix box.
- Frost with your favorite frosting.

Azteca Hominy Recipe

Ingredients:
- 1 can Spam luncheon meat - (12 ounce) cut 1/2" cubes
- 1 x onion minced
- 3 x jalapenos minced
- 1 can lima beans - (17 ounce) liquid removed
- 1 can hominy - (15 1/2 ounce) liquid removed
- 2 c. shredded Mozzarella cheese
- 1 tsp chili pwdr

Directions:
- Heat oven to 350 degrees.
- In skillet over medium-high heat, cook Spam, onion, and jalapenos 7 to 10 min or possibly till Spam is browned.
- In bowl, combine lima beans, hominy, cheese, and chili pwdr.
- Stir in Spam mix.
- Pour into greased 13- by 9-inch baking pan.
- Bake 15 to 20 min or possibly till thoroughly heated and cheese is melted.
- Serve with picante sauce.
- This recipe yields 4 servings.

Star Sandwich Appetizer

Ingredients:
- 2 1/4 c. Bisquick
- 1 green onion, chopped
- 1 Tbsp. chopped fresh parsley
- 1/2 tsp. dried sage
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 2/3 c. milk
- 1 Tbsp. butter, melted
- 1/4 c. honey mustard
- 1 c. spinach leaves or watercress leaves
- 16 thin slices turkey

Directions:
- Combine Bisquick, onion, parsley, sage and pepper.
- Stir in milk.
- Mix and roll out 1/4-inch thick.
- Cut out 16 stars.
- Place on ungreased baking sheet.
- Bake 10 minutes.
- Remove; brush with melted butter and cool.
- Split in half.
- Spread top half with mustard.
- Place turkey and greens on bottom.
- Put together and serve.

Busy Girl's Supper

Ingredients:
- 6 carrots
- 2 medium onions
- 1 lb round steak
- 6 small potatoes
- 14 teaspoon salt
- 14 teaspoon pepper
- 14 teaspoon garlic powder
- 1 (10 1/2 ounce) can tomato soup

Directions:
- Slice vegetables into one inch slices.
- Season to taste.
- Cut steak into two inch pieces.
- Arrange vegetables in a greased casserole dish; top with steak pieces.
- Pour undiluted tomato soup over top; cover.
- Cook in 375 degree oven for 1 hour and 15 minutes.

Triple Chocolate Popcorn

Ingredients:
- 20 cups of sweet popped popcorn
- 1 lb of tempered dark chocolate
- 1 lb of tempered milk chocolate
- 1 lb of tempered white chocolate

Directions:
- *Do not use microwave popcorn; either purchase already popped corn or pop using the stovetop or popcorn machine.
- Spread the sweet popcorn on a large tray.
- Carefully melt the dark chocolate in the microwave and drizzle onto the popcorn with a spoon.
- Follow the same directions with the milk chocolate and then the white chocolate.
- Allow to cool. Break into chunks and store in airtight container.

Nut Roll

Ingredients:
- 1 (7 oz.) jar Marshmallow Creme
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 3 1/2 c. powdered sugar
- 1 (1 lb.) pkg. caramels
- 4 c. chopped pecans

Directions:
- Combine Marshmallow Creme and vanilla and gradually knead in sugar.
- Shape into rolls about 1-inch in diameter.
- Wrap individually in plastic wrap and freeze for 6 hours.
- Melt caramels over hot water.
- Remove from heat, but keep warm.
- Dip rolls into caramels, then roll in nuts until well coated.
- Store cooled candy in a covered container.
- Yield:
- 20 pieces.

Hake With An Anchovy Vegetable Sauce

Ingredients:
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
- 1 onion peeled and chopped
- 1 carrot peeled and chopped
- 1 leek chopped
- 1 garlic clove peeled and minced
- 6 anchovies
- 1 tablespoon tomato puree
- 1 1/4 cups fish stock
- 4 loins hake, or ling cod loins
- salt
- ground black pepper

Directions:
- Add the vegetable oil to a skillet on low heat and saute the onion, carrot, leek, and garlic for 5 minutes.
- Add the anchovies and cook until they "melt." The anchovies should slowly disappear.
- Add the tomato puree and mix well. Add the stock and simmer for 10 minutes.
- You can either use an immersion blender to puree the sauce until smooth, or leave it chunky.
- Add the hake loins seasoned with salt and black pepper. Cover and cook on low heat until the fish flakes easily, about 10 minutes. Serve with the sauce.

Shrimp / Fish Jhol (Light) 

Ingredients:
- Turmeric
- Salt
- Oil
- Shrimp or Fish
- Green Chili
- Lanka Powder

Directions:
- Add turmeric, salt, and oil to shrimp or fish and 1/2 tsp of flour
- 
- Heat oil separately and add kalonji and green chili
- 
- Then add shrimp. Shrimp will then give out some water. Stir it from time to time to prevent burning.
- 
- Once most water has evaporated, mix water with turmeric and lanka powder and add to pan.
- 
- Then add boiled water for gravy.
- 
- Add cilantro at the end.

Simple Chicken Italiano

Ingredients:
- 3/4 lb. cut-up chicken
- 3/4 c. Italian dressing
- 16 oz. pkg. California style frozen vegetables
- 1/2 lb. hot cooked pasta
- 3 Tbsp. butter
- garlic powder to taste
- grated Parmesan cheese

Directions:
- In skillet combine chicken and half the Italian dressing. Saute chicken until it starts to brown.
- Add vegetables and remaining dressing.
- Cover.
- Simmer 7 to 9 minutes or until vegetables are tender.
- Toss pasta with garlic and butter.
- Serve vegetable and chicken over pasta.
- Sprinkle with Parmesan.
- Serves 4.

Potato Latkes Or Potato Pancakes

Ingredients:
- 4 large potatoes, grated and squeezed dry in paper towel *
- 1 large onion, grated
- 1/2 tsp. baking powder
- 1 tsp. salt or to taste
- 1/2 tsp. pepper or to taste
- 2 eggs, beaten
- 3 Tbsp. flour
- 1/2 c. vegetable oil or margarine

Directions:
- In a large bowl, blend grated potatoes and onion; stir in beaten eggs.
- Add flour, baking powder, salt and pepper.
- Mix thoroughly.
- Heat oil in frypan.
- Drop potato mixture in by tablespoonful.
- You may press cakes with spatula.
- Cook until golden brown and crusty on both sides.
- Drain on paper towels. Serve with bacon, applesauce or ham.
- Serves 6.

Dried Beef Cheese Ball

Ingredients:
- 2 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese
- 2 (3 oz.) pkg. dried beef
- 1 Tbsp. chives
- 1/2 tsp. garlic powder
- 1/2 tsp. Accent

Directions:
- Soften cheese with everything, except beef.
- Put beef in blender.
- Add half of beef to cheese mixture.
- Roll cheese ball in remaining beef.

Beef And Rice

Ingredients:
- 1 pkg. beef
- 1 box Minute rice
- 1 large onion
- 1 large pepper

Directions:
- Cook beef until done.
- Cook onion and pepper with beef.
- Put rice in pot.
- Cook on low heat until done.
- Salt and pepper to your taste.

Quick Hushpuppies

Ingredients:
- vegetable oil
- 1 (8 1/2 ounce) box corn muffin mix
- 1 cup pancake mix
- 1 (14 ounce) can cream-style corn
- 3 tablespoons chopped green onions

Directions:
- heat oil in deep saucepan to 375 degrees.
- In a large bowl, combine muffin mix, pancake mix and corn. Stir in onion.
- Drop tablespoons of dough into hot oil. Fry 2-4 minutes until golden brown.
- Place cooked hush puppies on a plate covered with paper towels to drain.

Easy Peanut Butter Chocolate Fudge

Ingredients:
- 1 (12 oz.) pkg. peanut butter chips
- 1 (14 oz.) can Eagle Brand sweetened condensed milk
- 1/4 c. margarine
- 1/2 c. chopped peanuts
- 1 pkg. semi-sweet chocolate chips

Directions:
- In large saucepan, melt peanut butter chips, 1 cup Eagle Brand milk and 2 tablespoons margarine.
- Stir occasionally.
- Remove from heat.
- Stir in peanuts.
- Spread mixture into wax paper lined 8-inch square pan.
- In small saucepan, melt chocolate chips, remaining Eagle Brand milk and margarine.
- Spread chocolate mixture on top of peanut butter mixture.
- (Chill 2 hours or until firm.)

Roman Bread

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. diced green onions
- 1/2 c. diced green pepper
- 1/2 c. diced tomatoes
- 1 slice Monterey Jack
- 1 slice Mozzarella, cheese
- 1 garlic roll, split

Directions:
- Place onions, peppers and tomatoes on the garlic roll (half). Top with cheese.
- Bake at 350° for 10 minutes.
- Serve with spaghetti or linguini.

Broccoli With Lemon Garlic Almond Butter

Ingredients:
- 1 head fresh broccoli, cut into florets
- 1/4 cup melted butter
- 2 smashed garlic cloves
- 2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice
- 1 teaspoon lemon, zest of
- 1/4 cup sliced almonds

Directions:
- Steam or boil broccoli until tender, about 8 minutes and drain.
- In a small saucepan, melt butter over medium low heat and add garlic.
- Remove from heat and let steep for about 5 minutes.
- Remove garlic, if desired, then stir in almonds and place over low heat again.
- Add lemon juice and zest and pour over hot broccoli.

Sausage Corn Skillet

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. well-seasoned lean pork sausage
- 1/2 c. chopped onions
- 1/2 c. chopped celery
- 1/2 c. chopped green pepper
- 1 c. uncooked rice
- 1 (10 oz.) pkg. frozen whole kernel corn
- 2 c. chicken broth

Directions:
- Form sausage into 12 balls.
- Lightly grease a 10-inch skillet. Add meat balls and cook over medium heat turning to brown evenly. Add onions, celery and pepper to skillet.
- Cook until vegetables are tender-crisp.
- Pour off drippings, if any.
- Add rice, corn and broth to pan.
- Bring to a boil; stir once or twice.
- Reduce heat, cover and simmer 15 minutes or until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed.
- Fluff with a fork.
- Makes 6 servings.

Crabmeat Cheese Ball

Ingredients:
- 6 1/2 oz. can crabmeat, drained
- 2 Tbsp. diced onion
- 2 Tbsp. lemon juice
- 1 tsp. Worcestershire
- 1 tsp. garlic powder
- 2 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese
- 2 Tbsp. horseradish
- 1 c. catsup

Directions:
- Pour over top of meatball and serve with crackers.

Fruit Dip

Ingredients:
- 1 large jar marshmallow cream
- 1 tall whipped cream cheese
- 2 tsp. nutmeg
- 2 tsp. cinnamon

Directions:
- Beat the marshmallow cream and cream cheese together and add nutmeg and cinnamon.
- Delicious dip for cut up fresh fruit.

Tofu And Pork Hash Casserole

Ingredients:
- 1 block tofu, mashed
- 1/4 lb. ground pork
- 1/2 c. chopped green onions
- 1/4 c. fine bread crumbs
- 2 eggs, beaten
- 2 Tbsp. shoyu
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 can cream of mushroom soup
- 1 small carrot, grated

Directions:
- Combine all ingredients.
- Pour into oiled casserole and bake in oven at 350° to 375° for 30 to 40 minutes.

Rock Cakes

Ingredients:
- 3 tablespoons butter
- 1/2 cup sugar
- 1 egg
- 2 cups self raising flour
- 1/2 cup mixed peel
- 3/4 cup sultana
- 1 teaspoon ground ginger
- 1/2 teaspoon mixed spice
- 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon
- 1/2 cup milk (or as needed to make a VERY stiff dough)

Directions:
- Cream butter and sugar, add the egg and beat well.
- Sift in the flour and spices, add the fruit and begin to add as much milk as you need to make a STIFF dough.
- Divide with a fork, and place small pieces on a greased biscuit tray.
- Bake in a quick oven for 15 minutes.
- *Ican only guess a quick oven would be 200-220c.

Dutch Slaw

Ingredients:
- 3 lb. cabbage, shredded
- 1 green pepper, chopped
- 1 medium onion, chopped
- 1 c. sugar
- 1 c. oil
- 1 c. vinegar
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. celery seed
- 1 tsp. dry mustard

Directions:
- Combine a 3-pound head cabbage, one chopped green pepper and one chopped medium onion.
- Cover with 1 cup sugar.
- With knife, poke holes through cabbage.
- Bring cooking oil, vinegar, salt, celery seed and dry mustard to a boil.
- Pour over cabbage and stir.

Spicy Dry Rub Wings

Ingredients:
- 20 chicken wings
- 1 cup Old Bay seasoning
- 2 teaspoons cayenne pepper
- 1 cup all purpose flour
- vegetable oil

Directions:
- Begin by separating the drummette from the rest of the wings, and discard the wing tip if you have full wings.
- Mix the Old Bay and cayenne in a large bowl, adjusting the cayenne if you want less spice.
- Take 4-6 wing pieces at a time and toss in the dry rub. Place the wings in a big bowl and let sit in the refrigerator for one hour.
- Toss the wings in the flour, coating the wing. Shake off the excess flour.
- Pour a thin layer of vegetable oil over a cookie sheet. Place the wings on the sheet and toss to coat.
- In a preheated 400 degree oven, cook the wings for 30 minutes without moving them so they develop a crispy crust. Flip and cook for 15 to 20 more minutes. Serve hot or cold.

Cotton Pickin' Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 yellow cake mix
- 4 eggs
- 1/2 c. Wesson oil
- 1 large instant vanilla pudding
- 12 oz. Cool Whip
- 1 can mandarin oranges, drained
- 1/2 c. water
- 1 c. chopped pecans
- 1 large can crushed pineapple, drained

Directions:
- Add eggs, oil and water to cake mix.
- Stir in oranges and pecans.
- Pour into 3 (8-inch) cake pans, greased and floured. Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.
- Cool completely before frosting. Mix Cool Whip, pineapple and pudding together for frosting.

Mound Candy

Ingredients:
- 1 can Eagle Brand milk
- 14 oz. bag coconut
- 1 (12 oz.) pkg. chocolate chips
- 1 box powdered sugar
- 1 stick margarine, softened
- 1/8 bar paraffin wax

Directions:
- Mix milk, coconut, sugar and margarine.
- Chill 2 hours.
- Form balls and chill 2 hours.

Snickerdoodles

Ingredients:
- 1 c. shortening
- 1 1/2 c. white sugar
- 2 eggs
- 2 3/4 c. all-purpose flour
- 2 tsp. cream of tartar
- 1 tsp. baking soda
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 2 Tbsp. sugar
- 2 Tbsp. cinnamon

Directions:
- Mix together shortening, 1 1/2 cups white sugar and eggs.
- Add flour, cream of tartar, soda, salt and vanilla.
- Mix well.
- Roll into walnut-size balls.
- Mix 2 tablespoons sugar and cinnamon in small bowl.
- Roll balls in this mixture.
- Place on ungreased cookie sheet.
- Bake at 375° for 8 to 10 minutes.

Pumpkin-Pecan Bread

Ingredients:
- 2 1/2 c. flour
- 1 c. whole wheat flour
- 3 c. sugar
- 2 tsp. baking soda
- 2 tsp. cinnamon
- 1 1/2 tsp. salt (optional)
- 1 tsp. nutmeg
- 1 c. oil
- 2/3 c. water
- 4 eggs
- 1 (16 oz.) can cooked, mashed pumpkin
- 1 c. chopped pecans

Directions:
- Heat oven to 350°.
- Grease bottom only of 2 (9 x 5-inch) loaf pans.
- Combine flour, whole wheat flour, sugar, baking soda, cinnamon, nutmeg and salt; mix well.
- In medium bowl, combine oil, water, eggs and pumpkin; mix well.
- Add to flour mixture; beat for 1 minute at medium speed.
- Fold in pecans.
- Pour batter into pans. Bake for 60 to 70 minutes, or until toothpick inserted in middle comes out clean.
- Cool 10 minutes; remove from pans.
- Cool on wire rack.

Seven-Up Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 box Duncan Hines pineapple cake mix
- 1 box pineapple or lemon instant pudding
- 1/2 c. Crisco oil
- 4 eggs
- 1 (10 oz.) bottle 7-Up

Directions:
- Mix and bake at 350°.
- Frost when cool.
- Double recipe to make 2 sheet cakes.

Coriander Salmon

Ingredients:
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/8 teaspoon pepper
- 1/2 teaspoon ground coriander
- 4 salmon fillets (6 ounces each)
- 2 teaspoons olive oil
- 2 garlic cloves, minced
- 2 teaspoons lime juice
- 1/4 to 1/2 teaspoon hot pepper sauce

Directions:
- In a small dish, combine the salt, pepper and coriander. Sprinkle over salmon. In a nonstick skillet, cook salmon in oil over medium heat for 4 minutes on each side. Add the garlic, lime juice and hot pepper sauce. Reduce heat; cover and cook 3-4 minutes longer or until fish flakes easily with a fork.

Apple Muesli with Goji Berries

Ingredients:
- 2 large apples
- 1 c. rolled oats, kamut, or spelt
- 3 tbsp. flax seeds
- 1 1/4 c. coconut water
- 1 1/4 c. plain 2-percent Greek yogurt
- 1/2 c. dried goji berries
- 2 tbsp. fresh mint leaves
- 3 tbsp. honey
- 1 pinch salt
- Fresh berries, granola, and chopped nuts
- granola
- Chopped nuts

Directions:
- Using a box grater set over a large bowl, coarsely grate the apples, stopping when you reach the core.
- Add the rolled oats, flax seeds, coconut water, yogurt, goji berries, and mint to the bowl and stir until thoroughly combined.
- Cover the muesli and refrigerate overnight.
- Mix the honey and salt into the muesli and spoon into bowls.
- Garnish with berries, granola, and nuts and serve.
- Looking for more breakfast recipes?
- Start the day with one of our French toast recipes, easy quiche recipes, or breakfast casserole recipes that feed the whole family.

Slow-Cooker Stuffed Shells

Ingredients:
- 1 carton (15 ounces) part-skim ricotta cheese
- 1 package (10 ounces) frozen chopped spinach, thawed and squeezed dry
- 2-1/2 cups shredded Italian cheese blend
- 1/2 cup diced red onion
- 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
- 2 teaspoons dried basil
- 1/2 teaspoon dried oregano
- 1/2 teaspoon dried thyme
- 2 jars (24 ounces each) roasted garlic Parmesan pasta sauce
- 2 cups water
- 1 package (12 ounces) jumbo pasta shells
- Optional: Additional shredded Italian cheese blend and sliced fresh basil

Directions:
- Mix first 8 ingredients (mixture will be stiff). In a greased 6-qt. slow cooker, mix 1 jar pasta sauce with water. Fill shells with ricotta mixture; layer in slow cooker. Top with remaining jar of pasta sauce.
- Cook, covered, on low until pasta is tender, 4-5 hours. If desired, serve with additional cheese and fresh basil.

Japanese Fruit Pie

Ingredients:
- 1 stick margarine, melted
- 1 c. sugar
- 1/2 c. chopped pecans
- 2 eggs, well beaten
- 1/2 c. chopped dates or raisins
- 1/2 c. coconut

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients together.
- Place mixture in an unbaked pie shell and bake 8 minutes at 400°, then bake for 25 to 30 minutes at 350°.

Heavenly Green Pea Soup

Ingredients:
- 1 c. split green peas (dried peas)
- 5 c. water
- 5 strips lean raw bacon, chopped fine
- 1/2 c. onion, chopped fine
- 1 clove garlic (whole)
- 1/2 c. celery, chopped small

Directions:
- Put all ingredients into large soup pot.
- Let boil for 10 minutes.
- Stir often.
- Reduce heat to simmer.
- Cook 30 to 40 minutes stirring often.
- When peas are mushy, add salt and pepper to taste and water if too thick.
- Soup may be frozen for future use.
- Remove garlic pod "if you can find it."
- "Bon appetite."

Corn Casserole

Ingredients:
- 1 stick butter, melted
- 2 eggs, beaten
- 1/4 c. flour
- 1/4 c. sugar
- 1 can whole kernel corn, drained
- 1 can cream-style corn

Directions:
- Mix well.
- Bake in a 1 1/2-quart dish at 350° for 1 hour.

Minted Cranberry-Lime Sparkletinis 

Ingredients:
- 1 1/4 cup fresh mint leaves, mottled
- 1/3 cup limeade concentrate
- 1/4 cup cranberry juice
- 1 cup vodka
- 1 cucumber, peeled and sliced into wheels
- 1 1/2 cup carbonated water
- Gold or silver fleck (optional; available from goldleafcompany.com)

Directions:
- In a pitcher combine the mint leaves, limeade concentrate, cranberry juice, and vodka and stir until combined; add the cucumbers and chill well, for at least 2 hours. Before service, strain out the mint leaves and cucumber, add the carbonated water and gold or silver fleck, stir gently and pour into martini glasses.

Crawfish Etouffee

Ingredients:
- 1 stick butter
- 2 medium onions, chopped
- 2 bunches shallots, chopped
- 2 medium bell peppers, chopped
- 2 lb. crawfish, peeled and deveined
- 2 cans cream of mushroom soup
- 1 can Ro-Tel tomatoes and chilies, diced

Directions:
- Saute onions, shallots and bell peppers in butter until soft. Add Ro-Tel tomatoes and chilies and simmer 10 minutes.
- Add crawfish and simmer 10 minutes.
- Add soup and simmer 30 minutes. Serve over rice.
- Serves 4 to 5.
- May substitute shrimp or chicken.

Our Favorite Vinaigrette

Ingredients:
- 2 tablespoons yellow mustard
- 13 cup red wine vinegar
- 13 cup balsamic vinegar
- 2 teaspoons garlic
- 2 teaspoons sugar
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1 teaspoon black pepper
- 1 cup olive oil

Directions:
- Measure mustard into a bowl.
- Whisk in vinegar, sugar, salt, pepper and herbs to taste.
- Continue to whisk mixture while slowly dribbling in olive oil until mixture thickens.
- You do not have to add full 1/2 cup if you want to reduce it.

Crunchy Burmese Ginger Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 cup Japanese-style pickled ginger, rinsed, drained and sliced into fine shreds
- 1/2 cup roasted or fried soybeans (available at Asian markets)
- 1/2 cup toasted pumpkin seeds (pepitas), or use additional soybeans
- 1/2 cup chopped roasted, unsalted peanuts
- 1/2 cup toasted white sesame seeds, or use additional peanuts
- 1 ripe tomato, preferably plum, seeded and sliced into thin wedges
- 1 heaping cup shredded Napa cabbage
- 1/4 cup fried shallots (see recipe)
- 2 tablespoons fresh lime juice, more to taste
- 2 tablespoons powdered dried shrimp, or 1 tablespoon fish sauce
- 2 tablespoons shallot oil (see recipe), more to taste
- Salt to taste

Directions:
- In a large bowl, combine all the ingredients except the shallot oil and salt.
- Toss together with your hands.
- Add oil and salt, mix again, and taste.
- Adjust the seasonings with lime juice, fish sauce, salt, and oil.

Real Caesar Dressing

Ingredients:
- 6 tablespoons olive oil
- 2 tablespoons lemon juice
- 2 tablespoons red wine vinegar
- 1/2 teaspoon sugar
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 2 anchovy fillets
- 3/4 cup shredded parmesan cheese
- 2 garlic cloves

Directions:
- Place all ingredients in a food processor and mix until well blended. Use dressing over fresh Romaine greens and garlic croutons.

Taco Pie

Ingredients:
- 1 lb hamburger
- 1 small onion, chopped
- taco seasoning or chili seasoning mix
- 1 cup sliced black olives
- 2 cups crushed taco chips
- 12 cup sour cream
- 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese
- 2 cups flour
- 34 cup warm water
- 2 teaspoons yeast
- 12 teaspoon salt
- 14 cup vegetable oil
- 12 cup dry oatmeal

Directions:
- Cook hamburger, add onions and add taco seasoning or chili seasoning to taste.
- Add olives and sour cream.
- Heat well.
- Crust:
- Dissolve yeast in warm water, add remaining ingredients and roll out to fit a large pie pan.
- Sprinkle one cup of crushed taco chips over the crust.
- Add meat mixture.
- Put remaining taco chips on top of the meat.
- Sprinkle the shredded cheese on top of the chips.
- Bake for 20 minutes at 375 degrees Fahrenheit.

Chicken And Stuffing Casserole

Ingredients:
- chicken breasts and thighs
- 1 pkg. Pepperidge Farm stuffing (seasoned)
- 1 c. evaporated milk
- 1 can cream of chicken soup

Directions:
- Boil chicken breasts and thighs in salted water.
- Save the broth.
- Pick off chicken and put in the bottom of a 9 x 13-inch baking pan.
- Saute an onion in butter.
- Prepare stuffing as directed, using broth instead of water to make moist.
- Mix milk and cream of chicken soup.
- Pour mixture over chicken.
- Next, place stuffing on top and pour broth over to keep moist.
- Bake 1/2 hour at 350° to heat thoroughly.
- Excellent to make a day ahead of time.

Pumpkin Dessert

Ingredients:
- 4 eggs, well beaten
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 1 can Eagle Brand milk
- 16 oz. canned pumpkin

Directions:
- Pour into well-greased and floured 9 x 13-inch pan.
- Sprinkle yellow cake mix over the mixture.
- Melt 2 sticks oleo and pour over cake.
- Add nuts.
- Bake at 350° for 1 hour.

Fruit Pizza

Ingredients:
- 1 roll Pillsbury sugar cookie
- 2 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese
- 2 tsp. vanilla
- 1 c. sugar
- 2 c. Five Alive juice
- fruit of choice *
- 1/2 c. lemon juice
- 1 c. sugar
- 1 c. water
- 6 tsp. cornstarch

Directions:
- *Suggestions:
- fresh pineapple, bananas sprinkled with Fruit-Fresh to prevent turning dark, kiwi, grapes, strawberries.

Hawaiian Pie(Makes Two 8-Inch Pies)  

Ingredients:
- 1 Tbsp. margarine
- 2 c. crushed pineapple
- 1 1/4 c. sugar
- 2 Tbsp. cornstarch
- 1 c. chopped walnuts
- 2 sliced bananas
- 1 small can coconut
- 16 oz. Cool Whip
- 2 pie crusts (8-inch)

Directions:
- Bake pie shells at 350° until brown.
- Cool.

Baked Flounder Recipe

Ingredients:
- 4 x Flounders
- 2 Tbsp. Finely minced parsley
- 2 Tbsp. Finely minced chives
- 2 Tbsp. Finely minced tarragon
- 1/4 tsp Nutmeg
- 1 x Glass white wine Salt and black pepper
- 2 ounce Butter
- 4 ounce Fresh white breadcrumbs Parsley sprigs to garnish

Directions:
- If necessary, 4 small plaice can be substituted for the flounders.
- Set oven to 450/F or possibly Mark 8.
- Wash and dry the flounders.
- Mix the herbs and nutmeg together.
- Butter an ovenproof dish and coat with the herb mix.
- Arrange the fish in the dish and pour the wine over.
- Season to taste.
- Heat 1 ounce.
- of butter, pour on to the fish and cover with the breadcrumbs.
- Dot with the remaining butter and bake for 10 to 15 min, near the top of the oven, so which the breadcrumbs brown, adding a little extra butter if they look dry.
- Serve, garnished with parsley sprigs.

Smoked Salmon And Quinoa Salad With Radishes And Beans

Ingredients:
- 1 can (14 Oz. Size) Red Beans
- 1/2 Red Onion, Chopped
- 10 Cherry Tomatoes, Halved
- 8 Radishes, Sliced And Halved
- 2 ounces, weight Baby Spinach
- 5 ounces, weight Smoked Salmon, Sliced
- 1/2 cups Quinoa, Cooked And Cooled
- FOR THE DRESSING:
- 2 Tablespoons Sesame Oil
- 1 teaspoon Soy Sauce
- 1 teaspoon Balsamic Vinegar
- 1 clove Garlic, Chopped

Directions:
- Place red beans, onion, tomatoes, radishes, spinach, smoked salmon, and quinoa in a bowl and toss well.
- For the dressing, combine sesame oil, soy sauce, balsamic vinegar, and garlic in a small jar with a lid and shake to blend. Pour the dressing over the salad and toss.

Baked Apples in 30 minutes

Ingredients:
- 4 each apples, granny smith
- .5 cup brown sugar
- 4 tablespoons butter
- 2 teaspoon cinnamon

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350F (180C).
- Scoop out core from apples, leaving bottom intact (so the yummy stuff will be held in)
- Stuff each apple with brown sugar and butter.
- Place in a shallow baking dish
- Top with cinnamon.
- Bake for 15 minutes, until sugar caramelizes and apples are tender.
- Yum!

Mexican Casserole

Ingredients:
- tortillas
- 1 1/2 lb. ground beef, browned
- 1 can Mexican style beans (hot chili beans)
- 1 can cream of chicken soup (undiluted)
- 1 can Ro-Tel
- 1 lb. Velveeta cheese, grated

Directions:
- Place layer of tortillas in shallow casserole dish.
- Layer ingredients and top with another layer of tortillas.
- Bake at 350° for 45 minutes
- or until tortillas brown.

Favorite Meat Loaf

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 lb. ground chuck
- 1 large onion, chopped
- 1 bell pepper, chopped
- 1 1/2 c. cracker crumbs (finely crushed)
- 1 egg, beaten well
- 1 small can tomato paste
- salt and pepper to taste

Directions:
- Place all ingredients in a large mixing bowl and mix well. Shape into loaf and cover top of loaf generously with catsup. Bake at 325° for 1 hour.
- Can be baked on broiler pan rack so grease will not be absorbed into loaf.
- Makes 10 servings.

Creamy Reuben Soup

Ingredients:
- 1 cup sauerkraut, well drained
- 1/2 cup onion, chopped
- 1/4 cup celery, chopped
- 3 tablespoons butter or 3 tablespoons margarine
- 1/4 cup unsifted flour
- 3 cups water
- 4 teaspoons beef bouillon or 4 beef bouillon cubes
- 1/2 lb cooked corned beef, shredded
- 3 cups half-and-half
- 1 (12 ounce) package swiss cheese, shredded
- 6 -8 slices rye bread or 6 -8 slices pumpernickel bread, toasted and cut into quarters

Directions:
- In a large saucepan cook onion and celery in butter until tender.
- Stir in flour until smooth.
- Gradually stir in water and bouillon and bring to a boil.
- Reduce heat and simmer uncovered, 5 minutes.
- Add corned beef, saurkraut, half and half, and 1 cup cheese.
- Cook for 30 minutes, until slightly thickened, stirring frequently.
- Ladle into 8 oven proof bowls.
- Top each with toasted bread and 1/2 cup of cheese.
- Broil until cheese melts.

Quickly Made Stir-Fried Bean Sprouts and Chinese Chives with Shio-Kombu

Ingredients:
- 1 bag Bean sprouts
- 1/3 bunch Chinese chives
- 1 tbsp Shio-kombu
- 1 dash Salt
- 1 Sesame oil

Directions:
- Rinse and drain the bean sprouts.
- Cut the chives into 2 to 3 cm pieces.
- Heat some sesame oil in a frying pan.
- Stir-fry the bean sprouts over high heat.
- When the bean sprouts are coated in oil, add the shio-kombu and continue stir-frying.
- Add the chives when the bean sprouts are cooked, and stir-fry together quickly.
- Taste and add a little salt if needed to finish.
- I used pricier soy bean sprouts this time.
- The texture is really nice.

The Little Death

Ingredients:
- 1 teaspoon dried damiana leaves
- 1 teaspoon sugar
- 1 1/2 ounces single-malt Scotch, not too smoky
- 2 teaspoons raspberry preserves
- 1/4 ounce fresh lemon juice
- Citrus zest strips, rose petals or raspberries, for garnish

Directions:
- Add the damiana and sugar to 1/2 cup boiling water.
- Cover for 2 minutes, strain and refrigerate until cool.
- Measure 3 ounces of the damiana tea into a cocktail shaker.
- (Cover and refrigerate the remainder for another use.)
- Add the Scotch, preserves and lemon juice with two big handfuls of ice and shake vigorously.
- Strain over ice into a Cognac snifter or an Old-Fashioned glass.
- Add the garnish of your choice.

Chicken And Rice

Ingredients:
- 1 c. raw rice
- 1 can cream of chicken soup
- 1 can water
- 1/4 to 1/2 can sherry wine
- pinch of thyme
- 1 tsp. instant minced onion
- 1 can mushrooms, drained
- 1 chicken, cut into serving pieces
- salt and pepper to taste

Directions:
- Take a package of 6 to 12 hot dogs.
- (Any brand will work equally well.)
- Remove from cellophane wrapper, place in quart pan of water.
- Bring to full boil; lower temperature and cover.
- Cook for 3 to 4 minutes.
- Remove from burner.
- Place hot dog on frankfurter roll and serve with relish of choice.
- Makes 6 to 12 portions.

Broccoli And Friend

Ingredients:
- 1 bunch broccoli, trimmed, stems peeled and cut into julienne strips
- 1 head cauliflower, cut into flowerets
- 4 Tbsp. butter or margarine
- 1/2 c. fresh bread crumbs
- 1/2 tsp. dried tarragon
- salt and pepper to taste
- dash of nutmeg
- 2 Tbsp. pimento strips

Directions:
- Plunge broccoli into boiling, salted water in vegetable steamer for 3 minutes.
- Remove at once and place in colander. Repeat with cauliflower and place in colander with broccoli.
- In a large skillet, melt butter until slightly brown (do not burn). Add bread crumbs and tarragon and cook 1 minute over medium heat. Toss in vegetables, seasonings and pimento.
- Stir gently to coat vegetables and taste for seasoning, correcting if necessary.
- Turn onto warmed platter or bowl.

Pickled Beans

Ingredients:
- 1 can kidney beans, undrained
- 1 can drained green beans
- 1 can drained yellow beans
- 2/3 c. sugar
- 1/3 c. oil
- 3/4 c. vinegar
- 1 chopped green pepper
- 1 chopped onion
- salt and pepper to taste

Directions:
- Combine all ingredients.
- Make a day ahead.
- Will last up to 2 weeks.

Pathrode

Ingredients:
- 4 whole To 5 Whole Colocasia Leaves, Prepared
- 2 cups Rice
- 3 cups Toor Dal
- 2 cups Grated Coconut
- 10 pieces Red Chili
- 1 slice Tamarind
- 2 pinches Hing Or Asafoetida
- Salt To Taste
- Coconut Oil, For Garnish

Directions:
- 1. Prepare the leaves by washing thoroughly with water and trimming the thick veins on the back.
- 2. Soak the rice and daal for 4-5 hours and grind to a paste (neither very coarse nor very fine).
- 3. Grind the coconut, chillies, tamarind and hing to a chutney consistency.
- 4. Mix both pastes and add salt to taste.
- 5. Rub the paste on the back of one leaf, then layer the second leaf and rub more paste. Arrange about 4-5 leaves this way.
- 6. Roll the layered leaves and steam it the way you would steam idlis (an Indian savory cake). It will take 30-35 minutes to cook properly.
- 7. Allow it to cook a little. Cut the pathrode into small rings and serve topped with a little coconut oil. It is yummy-licious.

Cream Puffs

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. butter or margarine
- 1 c. flour
- 1 c. boiling water
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 4 eggs

Directions:
- Melt butter in boiling water.
- Add flour and salt all at once; stir vigorously.
- Cook and stir until mixture forms a ball that doesn't separate.
- Remove from heat.
- Cool slightly.
- Add eggs, one at a time, beating after each until smooth.

Layered Indian Rice Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 cup long-grain rice
- 1/2 tsp curry powder
- 1 cup plain yogurt
- 2 sprigs cilantro, chopped
- 2 tbsp lime juice
- 1 tbsp lemon juice
- 3 tbsp olive oil
- 1/2-1 tsp sugar, according to taste
- 2 oz peanuts, chopped
- 2 None red peppers, deseeded, sliced into fine rings
- 1 bunch green onions, finely sliced
- 1 lb pineapple, peeled, cored, and cut into chunks

Directions:
- Cook the rice and curry powder in boiling salted water according to package instructions. Allow to cool.
- Mix the yogurt, cilantro, and lime juice. Season with salt and black pepper. In a separate bowl, mix the lemon juice, oil and sugar. Season with salt and black pepper.
- Add the rice and peanuts to the lemon juice mixture and stir well. Layer the rice mixture, peppers, green onions and pineapple alternately in 4 jars, drizzling the yogurt dressing between layers.

Beer Bread: Recipe

Ingredients:
- 1 can beer (room temp)
- 3 c. self rising flour
- 3 Tbsp. sugar

Directions:
- Mix flour and sugar in a bowl.
- Add in beer and mix well till all the flour is kneaded in.
- Pour dough into a well buttered loaf.
- Don't FLOUR PAN.
- Spread the mix to the edge of the pan.
- Bake for 1 hour at 350 degrees.

Jalapeno Cheese Bread (Bread Machine Version)

Ingredients:
- 1 1/8 cups luke warm water
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 2 tablespoons sugar
- 1/2 cup jack cheese shredded Monterrey
- 3 tablespoons jalapeno peppers chopped, more or less depending on your heat preference
- 3 cups bread flour I used all purpose as that is what I had on hand
- 1/2 tablespoon active dry yeast

Directions:
- Place ingredients in your bread machine according to the manufacturer directions.
- Set machine to 1-1/2 lb loaf on light-white setting.
- Press start and in a few hours you'll have a fresh tasty loaf of bread.

Great Gramma Flo’S Chocolate Chip Cookies

Ingredients:
- 1 cup Butter (salted)
- 1 cup White Sugar
- 1 cup Brown Sugar, Packed
- 1 teaspoon Vanilla Extract
- 3 whole Eggs
- 3-3/4 cups White Flour
- 1 teaspoon Baking Soda
- 1 teaspoon Baking Powder
- 1/2 teaspoons Salt
- 1 cup Chocolate Chips

Directions:
- 1.) Cream butter and sugars. Stir in vanilla. Add each egg, stirring after each addition.
- 2.) In separate bowl, whisk flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt.
- 3.)Pour dry mixture into wet, and stir until combined. Add in chocolate chips. Confession: I tend to use more than 1 cup of chocolate chips. Sometimes almost the entire bag.
- 4.) Bake at 350 degrees F for 8-10 minutes, or until cookies are just golden brown.
- Yields about 4 dozen cookies.

Apple Walnut Squares

Ingredients:
- 12 cup shortening
- 34 cup sugar
- 1 egg, slightly beaten
- 1 12 cups all-purpose flour
- 1 12 teaspoons baking soda
- 12 teaspoon salt
- 2 12 cups peeled tart apples, finely chopped
- 12 cup raisins
- 1 cup pecans, chopped
- 12 cup brown sugar (packed if you want it sweeter)
- 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract

Directions:
- Cream shortening and sugar in a mixing bowl.
- Add egg.
- Combine flour, baking soda and salt in another bowl.
- Gradually add to shortening mixture.
- Stir in apples and raisins.
- Spread batter into a 9x13 baking pan lined with parchment paper (if not using parchment paper, use a greased 9x13 pan).
- Combine brown sugar, pecans, cinnamon and vanilla; sprinkle over batter.
- Bake at 350 degrees F. for 30 minutes or until golden brown.
- Cool before cutting into squares.

Inexpensive Punch

Ingredients:
- 3 pkg. Kool-Aid (any red flavor)
- 1 1/2 c. sugar
- 6 qt. water
- 1 (6 oz.) can frozen orange juice concentrate
- 1 (No. 303) can pineapple juice
- 1 (28 oz.) bottle ginger ale

Directions:
- Dissolve Kool-Aid and sugar in water.
- Add orange juice and pineapple juice; mix.
- Chill.
- Add ginger ale just before serving.

Monte Cristo Triangles

Ingredients:
- 1/4 cup milk
- 4 eggs
- salt & pepper
- 10 slices white bread
- 1/4 pound deli ham sliced
- 1/4 pound deli turkey sliced
- 6 tablespoons butter
- mustard
- 1/4 pound gruyere cheese sliced

Directions:
- Beat eggs, milk, salt and pepper together in a medium bowl, set aside.
- Spread butter on one side of all bread slices.
- On 5 pieces of bread layer, on buttered side, 1 slice ham, 1 slice Gruyere, one slice of turkey and top with mustard.
- Place the remaining 5 bread slices on top of the prepared pieces.
- Pour egg batter, from step one, into a medium baking pan and soak each side of the sandwiches until all the edges and sides are moist.
- On a large skillet, heat 1 tsp butter. Cook each sandwich until both sides are golden brown.
- Remove sandwiches from heat, cut into triangular quarters.
- Serve with a toothpick and extra mustard for dipping.
- Makes 20 triangles.

Easy Beef Meal

Ingredients:
- 1 large onion, sliced
- 2 large green peppers, sliced
- 1 c. chopped mushrooms (optional)
- 1 (14 1/2 oz.) can stewed tomatoes
- salt and pepper
- 2 pkg. au jus gravy mix (dry)
- 2 lb. or more sirloin tips
- water
- 4 beef bouillon cubes
- noodles or rice

Directions:
- Place sirloin tips in bottom of pan.
- Add onion, peppers, mushrooms, stewed tomatoes and a sprinkle of salt and pepper. Spread the packages of gravy mix over ingredients to cover.
- Drop in the beef bouillon cubes.
- Add water to the point where the beef is covered.
- Stir all ingredients occasionally as they cook.
- Bake at 350° for 1 1/2 hours.
- Place beef dish over noodles or rice.

Peanut Jelly Bars

Ingredients:
- 3/4 c. butter
- 1 c. brown sugar
- 1 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 tsp. baking soda
- 1 1/2 c. flour
- 1 1/2 c. oatmeal
- 1/2 c. chopped peanuts
- 1 (10 oz.) jar jelly or preserves
- 1 1/2 c. oatmeal

Directions:
- Cream butter and sugar.
- Add flour, salt and soda.
- Mix well. Stir in oats and nuts.
- Press half of mixture into 9 x 13-inch pan.
- Spread with jelly.
- Cover with remaining crumb mixture. Bake at 400° for 25 minutes.
- Cool and cut into bars.

Orange-Glazed Carrots

Ingredients:
- 5 medium carrots, scraped and cut into diagonal slices
- 1/4 c. water
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1/4 c. orange juice
- 2 tsp. sugar
- 1 tsp. cornstarch
- 1 tsp. corn oil margarine, melted
- 1/4 tsp. ground ginger

Directions:
- Combine carrot slices, water and salt in a medium saucepan. Cover and cook over medium heat 15 minutes or just until tender (do not drain).
- Combine orange juice, sugar, cornstarch, margarine, and ginger, stirring until well blended.
- Pour over carrot slices in saucepan.

Pecan Squares

Ingredients:
- 1 c. butter, softened
- 2 c. flour
- 2/3 c. powdered sugar
- 2/3 c. butter
- 1/2 c. brown sugar
- 1/2 c. honey
- 1 Tbsp. heavy cream
- 3 1/2 c. pecans, coarsely chopped

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350°.
- Mix 1 cup butter with flour and powdered sugar just until crumbly.
- Pat into a 9 x 13-inch pan or 9 x 12-inch pan.
- Bake 20 minutes at 350°.

Breath Of Spring Delight

Ingredients:
- 1 (3 oz.) pkg. lime jello
- 1 large pkg. cream cheese
- 3 c. boiling water
- 24 large marshmallows
- 1 large can crushed pineapple, drained
- 1 c. chopped pecans
- 1 (3 oz.) pkg. lemon jello
- 2 Tbsp. vinegar

Directions:
- To boiling water, add jello and marshmallows.
- Stir until dissolved.
- Chill until consistency of egg whites.
- Cream the cheese.
- Add vinegar, pineapple and nuts.
- Fold into jello mixture.
- Chill until congealed.
- This salad will stand up well and has a bright spring color of green.

Chickpea Curry

Ingredients:
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
- 1 medium onion, diced
- 2 garlic cloves, minced
- 34 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 12 teaspoon ground cardamom
- 1 12 teaspoons ground cumin
- 34 teaspoon ground turmeric
- 2 teaspoons ground ginger
- 12 teaspoon cayenne pepper
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 3 medium potatoes, cubed
- 2 carrots, sliced
- 2 (15 ounce) cans chickpeas, drained
- 1 (14 1/2 ounce) can diced fire-roasted tomatoes
- 12 cup vegetable broth

Directions:
- Heat the vegetable oil in a pot over medium heat.
- Add onion and garlic.
- Saute until the onion is slightly softened.
- Add spices and saute a minute or two longer.
- Add potatoes, carrots, chickpeas, tomatoes, and vegetable broth.
- Simmer on low heat until potatoes are tender.
- Add additional vegetable broth if needed to cook the potatoes.

Toddler Baked Oatmeal

Ingredients:
- 1 cup rolled oats
- 1/2 cup whole milk
- 1 egg
- 2 tablespoons oil
- 1/2 cup applesauce
- 1/4 cup brown sugar
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350°F.
- Beat egg with milk.
- Stir in oil, applesauce, vanilla.
- Mix in oats, brown sugar and cinnamon.
- Pour into greased 5x9 loaf pan.
- Bake in 350 F oven for 30 minutes.

Joojeh Kabob

Ingredients:
- 1 large or 2 medium onions
- 1/2 pt. plain yogurt
- 1 bottle concentrated lemon juice
- 1 tube saffron
- chicken pieces

Directions:
- Grate the onions, keeping the juice.
- Mix the onions with the lemon juice and the yogurt in a shallow pan.
- Mixture should be deep enough to half cover chicken pieces.
- Marinate chicken for several hours or in the refrigerator overnight.
- Chicken should be turned over halfway through the marinating period.

Grilled Stuffed Turkey Burgers

Ingredients:
- 2 pounds turkey
- 1 eggs
- 1/2 cup fresh breadcrumbs
- 1/4 cup Wish-Bone Italian Dressing
- 1 tablespoon worcestershire sauce
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 4 ounces smoked gouda shredded, or mozzarella cheese, about 1/2 cup
- 8 rolls hamburger, split

Directions:
- Combine all ingredients except cheese and rolls in large bowl; cover and refrigerate 1 hour.
- Shape mixture into 16 patties. Evenly place cheese in center of each of 8 patties; top with remaining patties, sealing edges well.
- Grill or broil, turning once, 10 minutes or until done. Serve on rolls.

Breakfast Casserole

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. sausage, browned
- 3 slices browned bread cubes
- 6 eggs, beaten
- 2 Tbsp. milk
- Velveeta cheese

Directions:
- Beat the eggs with the milk.
- Mix all together, except Velveeta cheese, in a 9 x 9-inch casserole dish.
- Bake for 15 minutes at 350°.
- Top with Velveeta cheese; bake an additional 2 to 5 minutes, until melted.
- Yields 6 to 8 servings.

Fennel Vichyssoise With Smoked Salmon

Ingredients:
- 3 tablespoons butter
- 2 fennel bulbs, trimmed and chopped, fronds reserved for garnish
- 2 leeks, white part only, halved, rinsed and sliced
- 1 1/2 lbs russet potatoes, peeled and cubed
- 1 teaspoon fennel seed
- salt, and
- white pepper, to taste
- 5 -6 cups chicken stock
- 1 ounce smoked salmon, chopped, for garnish

Directions:
- Melt butter in a heavy pot.
- Add fennel, leek and fennel seeds until softened, about 8 minutes.
- Add potatoes and 5 cups stock.
- Bring to boil, lower to simmer and cook 12-15 minutes.
- Remove from heat and use an immersion blender to blend everything. (Alternately, you can add the soup to a blender in batches and return to the pot).
- Thin with extra stock if needed.
- Pour into bowls, garnish with smoked salmon and fennel fronds.

Chocolate Streusel Squares

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 c. flour
- 1 1/2 c. oats
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 1/2 c. brown sugar
- 1 tsp. baking powder
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1 c. oleo
- 1 c. preserves
- 1 c. semi-sweet chocolate pieces
- 1/4 c. nuts

Directions:
- Combine flour, oats, sugars, baking powder and salt.
- Cut in oleo until mixture is crumbly.
- Reserve 1 cup.
- Press remaining mixture into 9 x 13-inch pan.
- Bake 10 minutes.
- Spread preserves over crust.
- Sprinkle evenly with chocolate pieces.
- Combine reserved oat mixture and nuts.
- Sprinkle over chocolate pieces patting gently.
- Bake 30 to 35 minutes in 375° oven, until golden brown.
- Cool completely.
- Drizzle with melted chocolate if desired.
- Let chocolate set before cutting into bars.

Chili Turkey Hand Pies

Ingredients:
- 1 pound ground turkey
- 2 green onions finely sliced
- 3 tablespoons fresh mint leaves chopped
- 2 tablespoons sweet chili sauce plus extra to serve
- 1 tablespoon fish sauce
- 2 cloves garlic minced
- 1 Thai chili finely chopped
- 2 sheets puff pastry halved
- 1 egg beaten
- 1 tablespoon sesame seeds
- salad to serve

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 400°F. Line a baking tray with parchment paper.
- In a bowl, combine ground turkey, green onions, mint, chili sauce, fish sauce, garlic and chili pepper. Spoon 1/4 mixture over half of each puff pastry rectangle, leaving a 1/3 inch border. Brush edges with a little water then fold pastry over. Crimp edges with a fork to seal. Transfer to prepared tray, brush with beaten egg and sprinkle with sesame seeds. Bake for 20-25 mins, until golden brown and cooked through.
- Serve with salad.

Chicken and Vegie Soup, Quick and Easy

Ingredients:
- 1 liter water
- 6 chicken drumsticks
- 2 carrots, thickly sliced
- 1 onion, quartered
- 4 medium mushrooms, sliced
- 1 medium zucchini, thickly sliced
- 400 g potatoes, cubed
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- 1 teaspoon oregano
- 1 chicken stock cube
- salt and pepper

Directions:
- boil chicken in water for about 20 minutes
- add potatoes, carrots, onion, salt, pepper, paprika, stock cube and oregano, boil for a further 10 minutes.
- add mushrooms and zucchiniboil for a further 10, or until potato cubes are cooked.

Ginger Cookies

Ingredients:
- 1 c. sugar
- 1 1/2 c. shortening
- 2 eggs
- 1/2 c. molasses
- 2 tsp. soda
- 2 tsp. cloves
- 4 tsp. ginger
- 2 tsp. cinnamon
- 1 tsp. salt
- 3 1/2 to 4 c. flour

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients.
- Shape into balls; roll in sugar.
- Place 2-inches apart.
- Bake 12 to 15 minutes at 350°.

Prune Whip

Ingredients:
- 1 1/3 cups pitted prunes
- 1/3 cup water
- 1/3 cup white sugar
- 1 teaspoon lemon juice
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 6 egg whites
- 1/4 teaspoon cream of tartar

Directions:
- In a medium saucepan, simmer the prunes in water until soft, drain and puree. Combine the puree in a saucepan with the sugar and heat until the sugar dissolves. Add the lemon juice and vanilla.
- Beat the egg whites until frothy, add the cream of tarter, and beat until stiff. Fold the prune puree into the egg whites.
- Pour into a buttered and sugared 2 quart baking dish and bake in a preheated 300 degrees F (150 degrees C) oven until nicely browned. Refrigerate and serve chilled with whipping cream.

Country Sauteed Fiddleheads

Ingredients:
- 1 pound fiddleheads
- 1 1/2 teaspoons butter
- 1 tablespoon white vinegar
- 1 pinch salt and ground black pepper to taste

Directions:
- Rinse fiddleheads thoroughly; trim stems.
- Soak in cold salted water for 5 minutes; rinse again.
- Place fiddleheads in a large skillet; pour in enough water to cover and bring fiddleheads to a boil.
- Simmer for 10 minutes; drain.
- Melt butter in same skillet over medium low heat; stir in fiddleheads and toss to coat.
- Cook fiddleheads until tender, about 5 minutes.
- Stir vinegar into fiddleheads; season with salt and pepper.

Green Bean Casserole

Ingredients:
- 1 can green beans
- 1 can cream of mushroom soup
- black pepper to taste
- 1 can Durkee fried onions

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients using only 1/2 can of fried onions. Bake at 350 degrees for 35 minutes. Add the rest of the fried onions and bake 5 more minutes.

Sun-Dried Tomato Alfredo

Ingredients:
- 4 tablespoons butter
- 3 tablespoons all-purpose flour
- 1/2 cup milk
- 1/4 cup cream cheese
- 1/4 cup sun-dried tomato packed in oil, chopped
- 10 ounces frozen chopped spinach
- 1 (14 ounce) can artichoke hearts, quartered
- 1/4 cup parmesan cheese, grated
- 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
- 1/8 teaspoon black pepper
- salt, to taste
- pasta, cooked (shells or penne)

Directions:
- Melt butter in large skillet over medium-low heat, and whisk in flour to form a paste.
- Gradually stir in milk until well combined and somewhat thickened.
- Add cream cheese and stir until melted.
- Increase heat to medium, add sun-dried tomatoes, frozen spinach, artichoke hearts, garlic powder and pepper.
- Stir frequently for several minutes until hot and thickened. (if it seems too thick, add more milk).
- Reduce heat to low, stir in parmesan and cook (stirring frequently) for a minute or two more.
- Salt to taste and stir into individual bowls of pasta.

Frank's Spicy Shrimp Scampi

Ingredients:
- 1 lb uncooked shrimp, peeled and deveined
- 14 lb butter, 1 stick
- 14 cup fresh parsley, finely chopped
- 14 cup onion, finely chopped
- 1 tablespoon garlic, minced
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
- salt, to taste
- 14 teaspoon cayenne pepper, to taste
- 2 cups white rice

Directions:
- Start rice accordingly to package directions.
- Get a medium sized frying pan.
- Melt butter over medium-high heat.
- Add parsley and onions.
- Saute until onions are tender.
- Add lemon juice and garlic; stir.
- Continue to saute approximately another 5 minutes.
- Add shrimp, salt and cayenne pepper, stir to mix well.
- Saute until shrimp are opaque and turn pinkish, about 5 minutes.
- DO NOT OVERCOOK.

Coconut Easter Eggs

Ingredients:
- 1/2 pound butter
- 5 ounces cream cheese
- 2 packages sugar
- 2 teaspoons vanilla
- 1 dash salt
- 7 ounces shredded coconut
- 1 egg
- 8 ounces Baker's Semi-Sweet Chocolate
- 8 ounces bitter chocolate Baker's

Directions:
- Blend butter and cream cheese until light and creamy.
- Add egg; beat again.
- Add 1 box of sugar gradually.
- Beat in vanilla and salt.
- Add another box of sugar and beat.
- Add coconut and milk.
- Chill 1/2 hour, then form into eggs and chill again.

Greek Meatballs

Ingredients:
- 2 lb. very lean ground chuck
- 1 large egg, slightly beaten
- 1 onion, finely chopped
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 (12 oz.) bottle chili sauce
- 1 (10 oz.) jar grape jelly
- 1 Tbsp. lemon juice

Directions:
- Combine chili sauce, jelly and lemon juice in large pan; heat slowly.
- Make meatballs of desired size from the first 4 ingredients.
- Drop gently into boiling sauce.
- Simmer for 30 to 40 minutes.

Microwave Never Fail Fudge

Ingredients:
- 2 to 2 1/2 c. (1 lb.) powdered sugar
- 1/2 c. cocoa
- 1/2 c. butter or margarine
- 1/4 c. milk
- 1/2 c. chopped nuts
- 1 tsp. vanilla

Directions:
- Combine sugar, cocoa, butter and milk in a 2-quart measuring cup.
- Microwave for 2 to 3 minutes or until bubbly.
- Stir in vanilla and nuts.
- Spread in buttered 9-inch square pan.
- Cool.

Make Ahead Mashed Potatoes

Ingredients:
- 5 lb. potatoes, cooked and mashed
- 2 c. sour cream
- 2 (3 oz.) pkg. cream cheese
- salt and pepper to taste

Directions:
- Combine
- all ingredients, mixing well.	Place in casserole. Refrigerate until ready to use.
- Bake in preheated 350° oven for 30 minutes.
- May store in refrigerator for a week.

Mexican Rice Recipe

Ingredients:
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 cup chicken broth
- 3 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 1 cup uncooked long-grain rice
- 1/4 cup chopped onion
- 1 cup tomato sauce
- 1 teaspoon garlic salt
- 1 bay leaf

Directions:
- Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat and add rice.
- Cook, stirring constantly, until puffed and golden.
- While rice is cooking, sprinkle with salt and cumin.
- Stir in onions and cook until tender.
- Stir in bay leaf, tomato sauce and chicken broth; bring to a boil.
- Reduce heat to low, cover and simmer for 20 to 25 minutes.
- Fluff with a fork and remove bay leaf when done.

Easy Punch

Ingredients:
- 48 oz. can Del Monte pineapple juice
- 1/2 small box jello
- 2 c. sugar
- 2 Tbsp. citric acid

Directions:
- Put sugar, acid and jello in a gallon jug, adding enough water to mix.
- Add pineapple juice and finish filling with water.
- Add food coloring, if needed.
- Add 1/2 cup sugar, if needed.
- Freeze 24 hours.
- Thaw 1 to 2 hours before needed.
- Place in punch bowl and add 1 bottle of 7-Up.

Macaroni Salad

Ingredients:
- 2 c. cooked, cooled macaroni
- 1 c. chopped onion
- 2 c. peas
- 1 c. cubed cheese
- 1 c. chopped celery
- 2 chopped eggs
- 1 can cubed Spam
- 3/4 c. Miracle Whip
- dash of mustard
- salt
- pepper

Directions:
- Mix all together and enjoy.

Sweet Potato Salad

Ingredients:
- 3 medium sized sweet potatoes, boiled, cooled, peeled and diced
- 2 bananas, peeled and sliced
- 2 apples, cored and diced
- 1/3 c. crushed pineapple, drained
- 1/3 c. seedless raisins
- 1 Tbsp. honey
- 1 Tbsp. lemon juice
- 1 Tbsp. sugar
- 1/2 c. mayonnaise

Directions:
- Combine potatoes, bananas, apples, pineapple and raisins.
- Mix honey, lemon juice and mayonnaise and mix with first mixture. Makes 6 servings.

Blaukraut Recipe

Ingredients:
- red cabbage minced water
- 1 med onion
- 5 whl cloves to 6
- 1 x apple peeled and minced salt to taste vinegar to taste

Directions:
- Chop Red CabbagePut in pan w/water to just half cover cabbage Into 1 medium whole onion stick 5 or possibly 6 whole cloves & add in to the pot Add in 1 apple peeled and choppedBring to a boil and slowly start adding salt & vinegar to taste (cider or possibly balsamic vinegar)
- Add in a tiny bit of brown sugar to tasteSimmer until doneJust before serving thicken w/water & flour (optional)
- Leftovers may be frzn.
