Fish Filets On Spinach 

Ingredients:
- White fish
- lemon juice
- oil
- chopped onions
- spinach (1/2 lb / person)
- salt
- white pepper
- nutmeg
- sliced tomato
- grated cheese

Directions:
- Wash fish, pat dry, sprinkle w/ lemon juice, let stand 10 minutes.
- Heat oil, add onions, saute till soft, add fish - fry till lightly golden (few minutes).
- Remove fish and onions. Add spinich - cook till wilted (4 - 5 minutes).
- In greased dish add spinach and fish. Sprinkle w/ salt, pepper, and nutmeg. Top w/sliced tomatoe and cheese.
- Bake, 350, 15 minutes.

Classic Grecian Lamb Stew

Ingredients:
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 12 lbs lean lamb fillets, trimmed of fat and cut into 1 inch cubes
- 1 (8 ounce) can tomato sauce
- 2 whole cloves
- salt and pepper
- 1 small bay leaf, crumbled
- 34 cup consomme or 34 cup water or 34 cup dry red wine
- 2 tablespoons lemon juice
- 1 clove garlic, minced
- 1 cup diced onion
- 1 cup diced carrot
- 1 small turnip, diced
- 1 medium potato, diced
- 1 cup frozen green beans

Directions:
- Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat and quickly brown lamb on all sides.
- Add tomato sauce, cloves, salt, pepper, bay leaf, consomme or other liquid, lemon juice and garlic.
- Mix well, cover and let simmer 30 minutes.
- Mix onion, carrots, turnip and potatoes with meat.
- Cover and let cook until vegetables are tender, about 1 hour.
- Sprinkle frozen green beans over stew and cook 15-20 minutes.

Aunt Florie'S Red Velvet Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese
- 1/2 c. butter, softened
- 1 lb. box powdered sugar (confectioners sugar)
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 c. chopped nuts (optional, but black walnuts or pecans are preferred)
- 2 boxes Betty Crocker SuperMoist cake mix
- 6 extra-large or jumbo eggs
- 2/3 c. Crisco liquid vegetable oil
- 1 1/4 c. water
- 1 1/3 c. whole milk

Directions:
- You will also need a large piece of cardboard, aluminum foil and 1 large aluminum or stainless steel mixing bowl.

Baked Meatballs

Ingredients:
- 1 pound lean ground pork
- 1 pound ground beef round
- 1 1/2 cups finely chopped onions
- 1 cup fine dried bread crumbs
- 1 cup milk, water, or chicken broth
- 3 eggs, lightly beaten
- 1 cup finely minced fresh parsley
- 1 teaspoon dried thyme
- 1 teaspoon kosher salt
- 1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper

Directions:
- Position the oven racks so that one rack is in the center of the oven.
- Preheat the oven to convection roast at 400F.
- Cover a large, shallow baking pan with foil and coat with nonstick spray.
- In a large mixing bowl, combine all the ingredients together until well mixed.
- With a medium ice cream scoop, shape the meatballs and place them close together on the baking pan.
- Place the pan in the center of the oven and roast for 10 minutes, until the meatballs are cooked through and browned.
- To check for doneness, cut one meatball in halfit should be juicy and pinkish.
- Remove from the oven and serve.

Tropical Smoothie

Ingredients:
- 1 pint vanilla frozen yogurt
- 1 cup sliced mango
- 1 cup papaya, seeded and sliced
- 1 tablespoon pina colada nonalcoholic drink mix
- 14 cup crushed pineapple
- 12 cup skim milk

Directions:
- Place all ingredients in blender and blend till smooth.

Fruit Fool

Ingredients:
- 1 (21 oz.) can peach or apricot pie filling
- 2 c. whipped topping
- 1/2 c. flaked coconut, toasted (optional)
- fresh mint leaves (optional)

Directions:
- Combine pie filling and whipped topping.
- Spoon into individual dessert dishes.
- If desired, sprinkle each with coconut and/or garnish with mint.

Cute Heart-Shaped Fried Egg

Ingredients:
- 1/2 Nissui fish sausage
- 1 Egg
- 1 dash Oil
- 1 dash Salt and pepper

Directions:
- Cut the fish sausage into 4 pieces lengthwise.
- This lets you create 2 heart-shaped fried eggs.
- Make a heart shape with the sausages.
- Use a toothpick at the top and bottom to hold it in place.
- Place the upper one in a way that you can easily remove it later.
- Heat oil in a pan, and carefully crack open 2 eggs in the center of the sausage heart shapes.
- Season with salt and pepper as desired, then close with a lid and cook to your desired firmness.
- Transfer to a plate and remove the toothpicks and they're complete.

Easy Pumpkin Pie

Ingredients:
- 1 can (30 oz.) Libby's Easy Pumpkin Pie Mix
- 1 can (5 fl. oz.) Carnation Fat Free Evaporated Milk
- 2 large eggs, beaten
- 1 unbaked 9-inch deep dish pie shell

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 425F
- Mix pie mix, evaporated milk, and eggs in large bowl
- Pour into pie shell
- Bake for 15 minutes
- Reduce temperature to 350F and bake for an additional 50-60 minutes
- Cool on wire rack for 2 hours

Caramel Pecan Pinwheels

Ingredients:
- 1/3 c. caramel ice cream topping
- 2 Tbsp. melted margarine
- 1/3 c. pecan halves
- 1 pkg. refrigerated bread sticks

Directions:
- In a 9 x 1 1/2-inch round baking pan, stir together
- the ice cream topping and melted margarine. Sprinkle with the pecans. Separate, but do not uncoil, the bread sticks.
- Arrange coils atop caramel mixture.
- Bake at 350° for 20 to 25 minutes or until golden brown.
- Let stand for 2 to 3 minutes.
- Loosen sides and invert rolls onto a serving plate. Serve warm.
- Yields 8 servings.

Simple Glazes for Ham

Ingredients:
- 14 cup maple syrup
- 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour
- 1 tablespoon Dijon mustard
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
- 12 teaspoon ground ginger
- 12 cup honey
- 12 cup orange juice
- 1 cup brown sugar
- 12 cup apricot jam
- 12 cup pineapple juice
- 1 cup brown sugar
- 12 teaspoon dry mustard
- 1 -3 tablespoon horseradish
- 1 cup red currant jelly

Directions:
- MAPLE-GINGER GLAZE:.
- Combine maple syrup, flour, Dijon, lemon and ground ginger.
- Spoon glaze over ham during the last 15 -30 minutes of cooking.
- HONEY-ORANGE GLAZE:.
- Mix honey,and orange juice with brown sugar.
- Spoon glaze over ham during the last 15-30 minutes of cooking.
- PINEAPPLE-APRICOT GLAZE:.
- Combine apricot jam and pineapple juice with brown sugar.
- Spoon glaze over ham in the last 15-30 minutes of cooking.
- RED CURRANT GLAZE:.
- Stir dry mustard and horseradish into red currant jelly.
- Spoon jelly mixture over ham in the last 15-30 minutes of cooking .

Salmon Croquettes

Ingredients:
- 1 (16 oz.) can salmon
- 1 can cream of chicken soup
- 1/4 c. fine chopped onion
- 1 Tbsp. parsley
- 3 eggs
- 1/8 tsp. pepper
- 1 1/2 c. fine bread crumbs
- flour

Directions:
- Combine drained salmon, chicken soup, onion, parsley, 1 egg and 1/2 cup bread crumbs.
- Mix well and chill for one hour.
- Shape into 3 inch patties.
- Slightly beat the 2 remaining eggs.
- Roll patties in flour, dip into egg, then coat with remaining bread crumbs. Chill an additional 2 hours.
- Heat deep frying oil to 365°.
- Add 4 croquettes at a time and fry about 3 minutes or until golden. Drain on paper towels.
- Serve with cocktail or tartar sauce.

Wok-Seared Chicken With Asparagus and Pistachos

Ingredients:
- 1 tablespoon toasted sesame oil
- 1 12 lbs asparagus, trimmed and cut into 1-inch pieces
- 1 lb boneless skinless chicken breast, cut into bite-size pieces
- 4 scallions, trimmed and cut into 1-inch pieces
- 1 teaspoon ginger powder
- 1 tablespoon oyster sauce
- 1 teaspoon chili-garlic sauce
- 14 cup pistachios, shelled and coarsely chopped

Directions:
- Heat oil in wok or large skillet over high heat.
- Add asparagus and cook, stirring, for 2 minutes.
- Add chicken and cook, stirring, for 4 minutes.
- Stir in scallions, ginger powder, oyster sauce, and chili-garlic sauce.
- Cook, stirring, until the chicken is juicy and just cooked through, about 1-2 minutes.
- Stir in pistachios and serve over rice.

What To Do When Served Bad Red Wine...

Ingredients:
- 1 glass of bad red wine
- 1 splash coke or pepsi

Directions:
- If you have a glass of red that is just undrinkable, add a splash of cola and enjoy. It will be worlds apart from where you started. Oh and I don't even like cola but this works for wine!

Fantasy Fudge

Ingredients:
- 3 cups White Sugar
- 3/4 cups Margarine Or Butter
- 2/3 cups Evaporated Milk
- 12 ounces, weight Baking Chips, Chocolate Or Butterscotch, Etc.
- 1 jar (17 Oz. Jar) Marshmallow Creme
- 1 Tablespoon Vanilla (or Extract)
- 1 cup Chopped Nuts (optional)

Directions:
- Combine sugar, margarine/butter and evaporated milk in a heavy 2 1/2-quart saucepan. Bring to a full rolling boil, stirring constantly. Continue boiling and stirring for 5 minutes, over medium heat. Remove from heat, stir in baking chips until melted. Add marshmallow creme, vanilla and nuts; beat till blended. Pour into a greased 13x9 pan. Let cool. Serve!

Honey Baked Beans and Potato Skillet

Ingredients:
- 3 tablespoons olive oil, divided
- 2 large potatoes, peeled and diced
- salt and pepper, to taste
- 1 bell pepper, diced (green or red)
- 1 small onion, chopped
- 9 ounces frozen corn
- 1 tablespoon taco seasoning
- 28 ounces bush's honey baked beans
- 8 ounces finely shredded cheddar cheese
- 2 tablespoons chopped cilantro (optional)

Directions:
- Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in large nonstick skillet over medium to high heat; add potatoes.
- Add salt and pepper to taste.
- Fry potatoes for 10 to 12 minutes, stirring frequently.
- Transfer to bowl.
- Add remaining 1 tablespoon of olive oil to skillet; add bell pepper, onion and corn.
- Saute mixture over medium heat for about 6 minutes.
- Add taco seasoning, baked beans and potatoes; stir to combine.
- Continue to cook for another 3 to 5 minutes until heated through.
- Sprinkle with shredded cheese right before serving.
- If desired, garnish with chopped cilantro.

Smoky Gouda & Chicken Sandwiches

Ingredients:
- 1/4 cup garlic-herb mayonnaise, divided
- 8 slices country white bread (1/2 inch thick), toasted
- 2 cups shredded rotisserie chicken
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/8 teaspoon pepper
- 2 small peaches or medium plums, thinly sliced
- 4 slices smoked Gouda cheese

Directions:
- Preheat broiler. Spread 2 tablespoons mayonnaise over four slices toast; place on a foil-lined
- . Arrange chicken over top; sprinkle with salt and pepper. Layer with peaches and cheese.
- Broil 3-4 in. from heat 2-3 minutes or until cheese is melted. Spread remaining mayonnaise over remaining toast; place over tops.

Corn 'n Spaghetti

Ingredients:
- 1 can cream-style corn
- 1 can whole kernel corn
- 1 cup spaghetti, broken into 2 " pieces (uncooked)
- 1 cup cheese (Monteray Jack or other stringy cheese)
- 12 cup butter
- 4 tablespoons chopped onions
- 2 jalapeno peppers, chopped (Optional)

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350F degrees.
- Mix all the ingredients together in a buttered cassarole dish.
- Bake covered for 30 minutes.
- Uncover and bake for another 30 minutes.
- Serve.

Pork Chop Casserole

Ingredients:
- 6 to 8 pork chops, remove excess fat
- 4 to 6 potatoes, peeled and sliced
- 3 carrots, peeled and sliced
- 1 medium onion, peeled and sliced
- 1 can cream of mushroom soup
- butter
- salt and pepper to taste

Directions:
- Line baking dish with aluminum foil, leaving enough foil to cover pork chops and potatoes.
- Place pork chops on one end of dish, carrots and onion on other end.
- Dot potato-carrot mixture with butter.
- Cover.
- Bake at 350° for 30 minutes or until vegetables are soft and pork chops are done.
- Cover entire dish with cream of mushroom soup.
- Bake an additional 10 minutes.
- Salt and pepper.

Skillet Pizza

Ingredients:
- 1 can crescent dinner rolls (8)
- 1 jar pizza sauce (Pizza Quick)
- 1 lb. ground beef
- onion (small)
- bell pepper, pepperoni, ham, etc.
- 1 (8 oz.) pkg. Mozzarella cheese, grated

Directions:
- Cook ground beef and onion.
- Spread dinner rolls into large skillet.
- Spread 1/2 jar pizza sauce over rolls.
- Spread ground beef and onion.
- Spread 1/3 cup bell pepper, pepperoni, ham, etc. Add rest of pizza sauce.
- Sprinkle cheese on top.
- Cook on top of stove very slowly, until crust is brown and cheese is melted.

Lentil Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 (15 ounce) can lentils, drained and rinsed
- 1/4 cup carrot, grated
- 1/4 cup zucchini, grated
- 1 small green onion, finely sliced
- 1 tablespoon white wine vinegar
- 3 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil (or a little less if you like sour)
- 1/2 teaspoon cumin
- 1/4 teaspoon fresh ginger, grated
- 1/8 teaspoon chili powder (optional)

Directions:
- Prepare vegetables.
- Combine first four items in a salad bowl.
- Combine the remaining ingredients in a screw-top jar. Shake well and pour over salad. Marinate for 30 minutes before serving at room temperature.

T's sauce!!!

Ingredients:
- 3 oz worcestershire sauce
- 2 oz soy sauce
- 3 tbsp fish sauce
- 2/3 cup brown sugar
- 1/4 cup corn syrup
- 1/4 cup honey
- 2 tbsp favorite hot sauce
- 12 oz beer
- 2 1/2 tsp liquid smoke
- 1 tsp cayenne pepper
- 1 tsp cracked pepper
- 1 tsp onion powder
- 2 tsp garlic powder
- 2 tbsp chopped garlic
- tsp ground ginger( fresh if you have)
- 1 tsp ground coriander
- 1 tsp creole seasoning
- 1 tsp beef soup base or just bullion if you prefer.

Directions:
- Marinade whatever your gonna use this sauce on first the meat adds some extra yum ;-)
- I would marinade anywhere from 2 hrs to 24 hours the longer the more flavor.
- Thicker meat needs more.
- Now remove the meat and start cooking as recommended.
- Put everything into a sauce pan bring to a boil.
- Boil about 20 min.
- Reduce heat and simmer till reduced and thickened.
- You can do this while your cooking so long as it takes a good hour or so to cook.
- If not start before.

Cream Puff Shells

Ingredients:
- 1 c. all-purpose flour
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 c. butter or margarine
- 1 Tbsp. sugar
- 1 c. water
- 4 eggs (room temperature)

Directions:
- In small saucepan combine water, sugar, salt and butter. Bring to boil.
- Add flour all at once.
- Stir quickly to form large ball.
- Remove from heat.
- Cool 2 minutes.
- Put mixture in medium sized bowl and add eggs one at a time beating well after each addition.
- With small ice cream scoop measure a mound of dough on a nonstick baking sheet 3 inches apart.
- Bake 10 minutes at 400° and lower to 350° and bake 25 minutes more.
- Cool completely.
- Cut off 1/3 top and remove any soft part.
- Can be filled with pudding for dessert or chicken salad or tuna salad.

Easy-Meatball Sub

Ingredients:
- 14 cup breadcrumbs
- 1 French roll
- 1 12 cups spaghetti sauce
- 1 12 cups ground beef
- 12 cup mozzarella cheese
- 1 tablespoon seasoning

Directions:
- Combine ground beef and bread crumbs,add seasoning.
- Roll into meatballs, bite size.Heat sauce in a pot and add cooked meatballs when sauce is hot.
- Meanwhile heat bread in oven until crusty at 350 degrees.
- Cut bread in half and cover bottom half in cheese and place meatballs and sauce on top.
- Place other half of bread on top.
- Serve with extra sauce and cheese.

Veggie-Lovers Casserole

Ingredients:
- 5 cups chopped broccoli
- 1 12 cups chopped yellow squash
- 1 small red onion, chopped
- 2 carrots, peeled and chopped
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 cup light mayonnaise
- 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese, divided
- 12 cup fine dry breadcrumb
- 14 teaspoon paprika
- 12 teaspoon salt
- 14 teaspoon black pepper

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 325F In a large skillet cook broccoli, squash, onion and carrots in oil over medium-high heat 5-7 minutes or until crisp-tender.
- In a small bowl, stir together mayonnaise and 1/2 cup of the cheese; stir into vegetables.
- Turn vegetable mixture into a lightly greased 2-quart casserole dish.
- In a small bowl, stir together breadcrumbs, paprika, salt, pepper and remaining 1/2 cup cheese; sprinkle over vegetables.
- Bake 20-30 minutes or until topping is lightly browned.

Power-Out Blackberry Tart

Ingredients:
- 2 dozen blackberries, picked fresh from your yard
- 4 granola bars
- 20 Ritz crackers (for pie crust) (optional)
- 8 graham crackers (for pie crust) (optional)
- 14 cup water (optional)
- 1 teaspoon sugar (optional)
- 14 cup condensed milk (optional)

Directions:
- Mix water/condensed milk/Sugar in a pan on your camp stove until you have a gooey, purple, Blackberry-licious mess in a pan.
- If you are using 2000 calorie food bars, just spoon the toping onto a small piece of bar and you have a delicious dessert.
- If you are using ritz or graham crackers, just crumble and press them into any dish you have handy, ideally not more than an 1/8-1/4" thick.
- Spoon in pie filling and let cool, spoon onto plates for serving.

Applesauce Cake

Ingredients:
- 15 oz. box raisins
- 2 c. sugar
- 1 c. applesauce
- 1 c. fig preserves
- 3/4 c. Crisco shortening
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 tsp. allspice
- 1/2 tsp. nutmeg
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 4 c. flour, sifted
- 1 1/2 Tbsp. baking soda
- 1/2 c. hot water
- 2 pkg. black walnuts (optional)

Directions:
- Boil raisins for 20 minutes in 2 cups water.
- Remove from stove and add Crisco and 1 cup cold water.
- Set aside.

Cevisli Biber

Ingredients:
- 4 large red bell peppers
- 1 cup finely chopped walnuts
- 4 cloves garlic
- Salt
- Juice of 1/21 lemon
- 1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil
- Pinch of chili pepper or flakes

Directions:
- Roast the peppers by turning them under the broiler or in the hottest oven until their skins blacken and blister, then skin them and remove the seeds (see page 84).
- Blend the peppers to a paste in the food processor, add the rest of the ingredients, and blend very brieflyjust enough to mix them well.

Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough Truffles 

Ingredients:
- 1/2 can chickpeas or white beans, drained and rinsed
- 1 tsp pure vanilla extract
- scant 1/8 tsp salt
- scant 1/8 tsp baking soda
- 2 tablespoons nut butter or oil (If you use peanut butter, they'll have a slight "pb cookie dough" taste.)
- 1/3 cup brown sugar (
- 2 T chocolate chips, or more if desired
- 1-2 T rolled oats or quick oats (or flaxmeal)
- optional: 1 bag chocolate chips,
- optional: nondairy milk if needed, to thin it out chocolate sauce

Directions:
- Add all ingredients (except chocolate chips) to a food processor, and blend until very smooth.
- 
- Then mix in the chocolate chips and form balls. (I used a melon baller.)
- 
- You can eat these plain, but if you wish to cover them in chocolate, proceed thusly: Allow to chill in the fridge. Once chilled, melt chocolate chips with 2 tsp coconut oil (or shortening). Take the balls from the fridge and cover in chocolate, then return them to the fridge to harden.

Chorizo Pizza

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 cup gluten-free biscuit mix
- 1/2 cup Yellow cornmeal
- 1 cup water
- 6 oz chorizo
- 8 oz Tomato sauce
- 1/4 tsp salt
- 1 dash pepper
- 6 oz shredded Mozzarella

Directions:
- Mix biscuit mix, cornmeal, & water together until soft dough forms.
- Press into greased pie plate, bringing dough up the sides.
- Preheat oven to 425F.
- Cook chorizo in skillet until sausage is firm, about 10 minutes.
- Drain.
- Return to skillet.
- Add tomato sauce, salt, & pepper.
- Heat to boiling.
- Reduce heat.
- Simmer uncovered until slightly thickened, 5-7 minutes.
- Spread in crust.
- Sprinkle with cheese.
- Bake until crust is golden brown, 15-18 minutes.
- Let set 5 minutes, then serve.
- Notes: if you use regular biscuit mix, use half the amount of water.
- Note: if you choose you could add onions & Green chilies when you start cooking the meat.
- You could also top the whole pizza with olives before putting in oven.

Jam Cake(Layered Fruit Cake)  

Ingredients:
- 1 c. butter
- 2 c. sugar
- 1 c. blackberry jam without seeds
- 1 c. buttermilk
- 1 tsp. soda
- 1 tsp. nutmeg
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 1 tsp. allspice
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 2 1/2 c. flour
- 4 eggs
- 1 c. fresh coconut

Directions:
- Cream butter and sugar. Add eggs. Beat well. Sift dry ingredients. Add alternately buttermilk and flour into the egg mixture. Fold in jam, coconut and vanilla. Grease and flour 3 eight-inch pans. Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.

Peanut Butter And Jelly Sandwich

Ingredients:
- 2 slices white bread
- any flavor jelly (preferably grape)
- peanut butter

Directions:
- Take 1 slice bread and spread jelly on it, while smearing it on hands, shirt, table and floor.
- Put peanut butter on other slice of bread, same as jelly.
- Smash bread together and eat with a large glass of milk.
- Then call Mom to clean up mess.

Marinated Cucumbers 

Ingredients:
- 6 cups sliced cucumbers
- 1 cup sliced onions
- 2 cups granulated sugar (less if desired)
- 1 cup tarragon vinegar
- 2 tsp mustard seeds
- 2 tsp salt

Directions:
- Mix all together. Marinate in refrigerator for 24 hours. Keeps for weeks.

Hot Wings

Ingredients:
- wings
- 6 Tbsp. Louisiana hot sauce
- 1 Tbsp. butter
- 1 sprinkle crushed red pepper
- 1 sprinkle garlic salt

Directions:
- Grill your wings slowly to get them good and done.
- This is for about 12 wings, so just double as needed.
- In a large bowl, mix the hot sauce, butter, red pepper and garlic salt.
- After wings are cooked, put in this sauce and stir around good to get sauce on all of them.

Easy No Roll Pie Crust Recipe

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 c. flour
- 1 1/2 teaspoon sugar
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 c. salad oil
- 2 tbsp. cool lowfat milk

Directions:
- Mix dry ingredients with a fork in pie tin.
- Measure oil in a c., add in lowfat milk and whip with fork till white.
- Add in to dry ingredients, mix till blended.
- Press into place with fingers.
- Bake 12 to 15 min at 425 degrees or possibly fill and bake.
- A top crust may be rolled out between wax paper or possibly crumbled on top of filling.

Taco Dip

Ingredients:
- 2 lbs. ground beef
- 8oz.shredded Mozzarella cheese
- 1 jar taco sauce
- 1 can refried beans
- 1 can cheddar cheese soup

Directions:
- Cook and drain ground beef.
- Add remaining ingredients.
- Heat through in crockpot.

Lemon Curd

Ingredients:
- 5-1/3 ounces, weight Sugar
- 3 whole Large Lemons, Zest And Juice
- 3 whole Duck Eggs
- 3-5/8 ounces, weight Butter, cut into pieces

Directions:
- Combine the sugar and lemon zest in a pyrex bowl. In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs and lemon juice. Add the egg/juice mix to the sugar/zest and stir. Add the butter.
- Put the bowl over a pan of just simmering water and stir until the lemon curd thickens, about 20 minutes. Pour into sterilised jars (I use jars just out of the dishwasher-works just fine ). I made 2.5 very small (200 ml jars) with this recipe; it will fill 2 medium-sized jars. Keeps for several weeks in the fridge.

Salmon And Zucchini Fritters

Ingredients:
- 2 None medium zucchini, coarsely grated, excess liquid squeezed out
- 7 oz salmon fillet, skin and bones removed, finely chopped
- 1 tbsp lemon zest
- 2 tbsp fresh basil, finely chopped
- 2 tbsp fresh flat-leaf parsley, finely chopped
- 1/4 cup all-purpose flour
- 1/2 cup vegetable oil
- 2/3 cup sour cream
- 2 tbsp fresh dill, finely chopped
- 2 tbsp lemon juice
- 1 tbsp olive oil
- None None mixed greens, to serve
- None None lemon wedges, to serve

Directions:
- Combine zucchini, salmon, lemon zest, herbs and flour. Season. Shape into 12 patties. Cover with plastic wrap. Chill for 15 mins.
- Heat 1/4 cup vegetable oil in a large frying pan over medium heat. Working in batches, cook patties for 1-2 mins per side, or until golden brown and cooked through. Drain on paper towels.
- Meanwhile, whisk together sour cream, dill, lemon juice and olive oil. Season.
- Serve fritters with creamy dill sauce, mixed greens and lemon wedges.

Roast Water Fowl

Ingredients:
- 2 (1 1/4 lb.) wild ducks, oven-ready
- 1 onion, chopped
- 1 clove garlic, minced
- 2 Tbsp. unsalted butter
- 1 tsp. paprika
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. Tabasco sauce
- 1 lb. sliced bacon
- 4 c. cooked rice

Directions:
- Rub cavities of birds with onion and garlic.
- Combine butter, paprika, salt and Tabasco sauce; rub into duck skin.

Light Strawberry Cheesecake

Ingredients:
- 1/4 c. vanilla cookie crumbs
- 1 (24 oz.) low-fat cottage cheese
- 2 (8 oz.) pkg. fat-free cream cheese
- 1 c. sugar, divided
- 2 eggs
- 4 egg whites
- 1/8 tsp. cream of tartar

Directions:
- Coat bottom of 10-inch spring-form pan with cooking spray. Distribute cookie crumbs evenly across pan bottom.
- Set aside. Process cottage cheese and cream cheese until smooth.
- Add 3/4 cup sugar and whole eggs.
- Pour into large bowl and set aside.
- Beat egg whites and cream of tartar until foamy.
- Gradually blend in remaining sugar.
- Beat until stiff.
- Gently stir 1/4 egg white mixture into cheese mixture.
- Gently fold in remaining egg white mixture.
- Pour into pan.
- Bake at 325° for 50 minutes.
- Cool. Chill 8 hours.
- Glaze with following mixture.

Funnel Cakes

Ingredients:
- 3 eggs
- 1/3 c. sugar
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- confectioners sugar
- 2 c. milk
- 3 to 4 c. flour
- 1 Tbsp. baking powder

Directions:
- Beat eggs and add sugar and milk.
- Sift together half of the flour with salt and baking powder.
- Beat until smooth and add only as much more flour as needed.
- Batter should be thin enough to run through a funnel.
- Drop batter from funnel into deep hot fat (375°) using a swirling motion.
- Control the flow of batter using your finger.
- Cook 2 to 3 minutes until golden brown.
- Remove and drain on paper towels.
- Sprinkle with confectioners sugar or cinnamon sugar.
- Makes approximately 2 dozen.

Cinnamon Rolls

Ingredients:
- 1 c. buttermilk
- 1/4 c. sugar
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 c. oleo
- 1 egg
- 1 pkg. dry yeast
- 1/4 c. warm water
- 1 tsp. sugar
- 3 c. flour
- 1 tsp. vanilla or lemon flavor

Directions:
- Heat buttermilk (do not boil).
- Stir in sugar, salt and oleo; cool to lukewarm.
- Add beaten egg.
- Measure 1/4 cup of the very warm water.
- Add 1 teaspoon sugar; put in mixing bowl.
- Stir to dissolve.
- Add the buttermilk mixture to bowl and mix.
- Add flour; mix well.
- Melt 1 stick oleo.
- Roll dough into a rectangle; brush on melted oleo.
- Sprinkle on the brown sugar and cinnamon (may add raisins and/or pecans).
- Form into a roll and slice into 1 1/2-inch circles.
- Place on oiled cookie sheets; let rise until double in size (about 1 hour).
- Bake for 25 minutes, or until light brown, in a 350° oven.
- Ice with Powdered Sugar Icing.

Samp Recipe

Ingredients:
- 1 quart. hominy grits
- 1 c. white beans
- 2 pound salt pork
- Piece of corned beef or possibly ham bone

Directions:
- Samp porridge was a great Long Island dish from the 1640's to about 50 years ago.
- It was served in many homes and boarding houses for dinner on Sundays when cooking was not considered proper.
- It is a cheap and satisfying cool weather dish.

Wimpy'S Feet Toast

Ingredients:
- 1 loaf extra thin sliced bread, cut into desired shapes (triangles, strips, etc.)
- 2 sticks oleo
- garlic (lots), slivered or squeezed or garlic powder
- Parmesan cheese, pizza seasoning or Italian seasoning
- cayenne pepper (optional)

Directions:
- Place bread on cookie sheet and bake at 250° for 1 hour.
- Also place oleo and garlic
- in oven in covered Pyrex dish or measuring cup.
- By doing so, your oleo is ready when your toast is.
- Dribble oleo on toast.
- Sprinkle well with Parmesan cheese, pizza seasoning or Italian seasoning and lightly with cayenne pepper, if desired.
- Let cool a few minutes.
- Enjoy warm or store in airtight container.
- Great munchies!
- Also great with salads!

Creamy Raspberry Mallow Pie

Ingredients:
- 1 (3 ounce) package raspberry gelatin powder
- 1/2 cup boiling water
- 1/2 cup cold water
- 1 (10 ounce) package frozen raspberries
- 20 large marshmallows
- 1 (16 ounce) container Cool Whip
- 1 (9 inch) baked pastry shells

Directions:
- Dissolve jello powder in 1/2 cup boiling water.
- Stir in 1/2 cup cold water, chill until syrupy.
- Heat the raspberries and juice.
- Add the marshmallows,stir until they are melted.
- Chill until thick.
- Fold in 1/2 the Cool Whip and partially thickened jello.
- Pour into baked pie shell.
- Chill, top with remaining Cool Whip.
- Sprinkle a few droplets of red food coloring.
- Swirl with the tip of a knife.
- Optional: You may substitute strawberries if you wish.

Spiced Honeyed Apricots

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 cups water
- 1/3 cup turbinado sugar
- 2 tablespoons honey
- 2 strips orange zest
- 1 cinnamon stick
- 2 star anise pods
- 6 fresh apricots, pitted and halved
- 1-2 teaspoons fresh lemon juice

Directions:
- Simmer first 6 ingredients (through star anise) in a medium saucepan until reduced by half (15-20 minutes). Stir in the apricots, and simmer 3 minutes; cool to room temperature (about 1 hour). Remove star anise and cinnamon stick. Add lemon juice to taste.

Cheddar, Ham And Broccoli Bake

Ingredients:
- 1 Pasta Louigi macaroni and Cheddar dinner
- 1 c. cubed ham
- 1/2 c. chopped onions
- 1 can creamy onion soup
- 1/2 c. shredded Monterey Jack Cheese
- 1 c. broccoli florets
- 4 Tbsp. butter
- 1/2 c. milk

Directions:
- Cook noodles according to package directions. Set aside.
- In a large skillet, melt butter and saute ham, broccoli and onions until onions are translucent.
- Butter a 2-quart dish.
- Combine the noodles, creamy onion soup, milk, cheese packet, and the sauteed ham, broccoli and onions.
- Mix well.
- Bake uncovered at 350° for 20 minutes.
- Sprinkle the Monterey Jack cheese on top and return to oven for an additional 10 minutes.
- Serves 4.

Pineapple Cream Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 pkg. lime Jell-O
- 1 (3 oz.) pkg. cream cheese
- 1 small can evaporated milk
- 1 small can crushed pineapple
- 1/4 c. chopped nuts (optional)
- 1 c. boiling water

Directions:
- Dissolve lime Jell-O in 1 cup boiling water.
- Add cream cheese, crushing with fork until almost dissolved.
- Add pineapple, evaporated milk and nuts.
- Pour into mold and chill until set.

Cheerios Candy

Ingredients:
- 2 c. Cheerios
- 1 c. dry roasted unsalted peanuts
- 12 oz. white dipping chocolate

Directions:
- Melt chocolate, combine nuts & Cheerios.
- Spoon onto wax paper.

Chicken Dorito Casserole

Ingredients:
- 4 chicken breasts, boiled and pulled
- 1 can cream of mushroom soup
- 1 can cream of chicken soup
- 1 can Rotel tomatoes
- 1 tsp. chili powder
- 1 small onion, finely chopped
- 1 (9 oz.) bag shredded Mexican cheese
- 1 bag Dorito chips

Directions:
- In sauce pan, combine chicken, soups, Rotel, chili powder, onion and 1 cup lightly crushed Doritos.
- Cook on stove until warm, about 10 minutes.
- Cover the bottom of a 9-1/2x11-inch casserole dish with Doritos.
- Lightly crush until flat.
- Spread a layer of the soup mixture.
- Top with a layer of Doritos.
- Continue with layers, alternating, until gone.
- Top with cheese.
- Bake at 350 degrees for 30 to 45 minutes.

No Crust Coconut Pie

Ingredients:
- 1 3/4 c. sugar
- 4 eggs
- 1/2 stick margarine
- 1/2 c. self-rising flour
- 1 1/2 c. milk
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 (7 oz.) pkg. coconut

Directions:
- Beat eggs.
- Blend sugar and flour.
- Add to eggs.
- Add margarine, vanilla, milk and coconut.
- Put into two small or one large greased pie pan.
- Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.

Football Party Deviled Eggs

Ingredients:
- 12 whole Eggs
- 1/2 cups Mayonnaise
- 1 teaspoon Dry Mustard
- 1 teaspoon Pepper
- 1 teaspoon Cajun Seasoning

Directions:
- Hard-boil the eggs and let them cool, then peel and cut in half lengthwise.
- Scoop out the yolks and place in a bowl along with the mayonnaise, mustard, pepper, and Cajun seasoning.
- Combine the mixture until it forms a smooth paste, then spoon back into the hulled-out egg whites.
- Top each egg with a dusting of additional Cajun seasoning, and root on your favorite football team!

Caramel Corn

Ingredients:
- 1 c. brown sugar
- 1/2 c. oleo
- 1/4 c. corn syrup
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 tsp. baking soda
- 4 to 5 qt. popped corn

Directions:
- Combine all ingredients, except popcorn and baking soda. Bring to a boil for 2 minutes.
- Remove from heat.
- Stir in baking soda.
- Put popped popcorn in paper bag and pour syrup over.
- Stir and shake.
- Then put in microwave for 1 1/2 minutes.
- Remove and shake.
- Then put in microwave for 1 1/2 minutes more.
- Let cool in pan, then eat.

French Onion Pork Chops

Ingredients:
- 1 c. dry long grain rice
- 1/4 c. water
- 2 cans French onion soup
- 4 pork chops

Directions:
- Spray casserole dish with nonstick spray.
- Spread rice over bottom.
- Add water, then add 1 1/2 cans of soup.
- Salt and pepper pork chops and put on top.
- Add rest of soup.
- Bake 35 to 40 minutes at 350°.

Sesame Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 head red cabbage, shredded
- 8 Tbsp. slivered almonds, toasted
- 8 Tbsp. sesame seed, toasted
- 6 green onions, chopped
- 2 pkg. Ramen noodles

Directions:
- Mix cabbage and onions in large bowl.
- Add dressing.
- Break up noodles in small pieces.
- Add almonds, sesame seed and noodles just before serving.

Doughnut Muffins

Ingredients:
- 1/3 cup shortening
- 1 cup white sugar
- 1 egg
- 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 1/2 cup milk
- 1/2 cup white sugar
- 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease muffin cups or line with paper muffin liners.
- In a large bowl, cream together shortening and 1 cup sugar; beat in egg. Stir together flour, baking powder, salt and 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon. Stir flour into egg mixture alternately with milk. Spoon batter into prepared muffin cups.
- Bake in preheated oven for 20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into center of a muffin comes out clean. While muffins bake, combine 1/2 cup sugar and 1 teaspoon cinnamon. Remove muffins from pan and let cool for 5 minutes. While muffins are still warm, roll tops of muffins in cinnamon sugar mixture.

Broccoli And Shrimp Casserole

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. shrimp
- 1 medium onion
- 1 medium bell pepper
- 2 stalks celery
- 1 small box frozen broccoli
- 1 (8 oz.) jar Cheez Whiz
- 2 c. cooked rice
- 1 can mushroom soup
- 2 Tbsp. butter
- 1 1/2 c. milk

Directions:
- Chop onion, bell pepper and celery.
- Saute in butter until tender.
- Add mushroom soup, cheese, broccoli, cooked rice, milk and shrimp.
- Pour in 3-quart casserole dish.
- Cover; cook in microwave for 25 minutes, stirring every 10 minutes.

Poppy Seed Dressing

Ingredients:
- 3/4 c. sugar
- 1/3 c. cider vinegar
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. dry mustard
- 1 tsp. finely grated onion
- 1 c. vegetable oil
- 1 Tbsp. poppy seed

Directions:
- Combine
- first five ingredients in blender;
- beat until sugar dissolves.	Continue
- to beat, slowly adding oil.
- Stir in poppy seed.
- Cover and chill.
- Stir before serving.
- Yield: 1 3/4 cups.

Tomato, Cucumber and Clam Juice Spiced Up

Ingredients:
- 4 cups tomato juice (substitute veggie tomato type juices)
- 1 cup clam juice (optional)
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil (substitute olive oil)
- 1 tablespoon vinegar
- 12 teaspoon salt (optional)
- 12 teaspoon sugar (optional)
- 12 teaspoon paprika
- 1 teaspoon dry basil (optional 1 tablespoon fresh, chopped)
- 1 tablespoon hot sauce (substitute Tabasco type sauce)
- 2 Persian cucumbers (remove seeds, peel outer skin optional, chopped finely)
- 1 cup cracked ice
- 4 lemon wedges

Directions:
- In a large pitcher add all the ingredients except the lemon wedges, mix well.
- Pour into tall individual glasses and add a lemon wedge on the glass rim.
- Serve and enjoy.

Fennel Laced Celery Soup

Ingredients:
- 2 tablespoons butter or 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 4 cups diced celery
- 2 onions, finely chopped
- 1 fennel bulb, trimmed cored and chopped
- 4 garlic cloves, minced
- 1 teaspoon dried thyme
- 12 teaspoon sea salt
- 12 teaspoon cracked black pepper
- 6 cups chicken stock or 6 cups vegetable stock
- 1 potato, peeled and shredded
- finely chopped chives

Directions:
- In skillet, melt butter.
- Add celery, onions and fennel and cook, stirring, until softened, about 5 minutes.
- Add garlic, thyme, salt and pepper and cook for 1 minute.
- Add 2 cups of the stock.
- Transfer to crockpot.
- Add remaining stock and potato.
- Cover and cook on low for 6 hours.
- Puree using an immersion blender.
- Serve garnished with chives.

Peach/Blueberry Cobbler Recipe

Ingredients:
- 1 single pie crust
- 7-10 peaches, peeled and sliced
- 3/4 c. blueberries
- 3/4 c. sugar
- 2 tbsp. flour
- 1 egg
- 1/3 c. melted butter
- 3/4 c. flour
- 1/2 c. butter
- 1/2 c. sugar

Directions:
- Place pie crust in deep casserole dish.
- Put a layer of peaches, a layer of blueberries, a layer of peaches and then blueberries.
- Combine next 4 ingredients and pour over fruit.
- Blend next 3 ingredients and sprinkle over top.
- Bake 15 min at 400 degrees.
- Reduce heat to 300 degrees and bake for 35 more min or possibly till brown and bubbly.
- Serve hot.

Hawaiian Delight

Ingredients:
- 1 box yellow/lemon cake mix
- 1 (12 oz.) can mandarin slices
- 1 small tub Cool Whip
- 1 can crushed pineapple
- 1 box instant jello pudding

Directions:
- Cake:
- Mix cake as directed on box.
- Drain the mandarin slices and stir into cake batter.
- Pour into a 9 x 13-inch cake pan. Bake as directed on box.

Sweet Onion and Beans

Ingredients:
- 1 large sweet onion, diced
- 2 large green peppers, diced
- 3 garlic cloves, minced
- 1 (15 ounce) can pinto beans, rinsed and drained
- 1 (15 ounce) can black beans, rinsed and drained
- 3 large tomatoes, diced
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 tablespoon chili powder
- 1 teaspoon salt

Directions:
- Place olive oil in a frying pan and set to medium-high heat.
- Add salt, onion, and garlic, sweat them for about 3 minutes or until translucent.
- Add peppers, tomatoes, beans, and chili powder and saute for about 5 minutes.
- Ready to serve!

Salt And Vinegar Chicken

Ingredients:
- 2 cups cider vinegar
- 1 cup vegetable oil
- 1 egg, lightly beaten
- 3 teaspoons salt
- 1 teaspoon poultry seasoning
- 8 boneless chicken thighs, with skin

Directions:
- In a large bowl, mix the cider vinegar, vegetable oil, egg, salt, and poultry seasoning. Place the chicken thighs in the bowl, cover, and marinate in the refrigerator at least 1 hour.
- Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
- Arrange the chicken thighs in a baking dish, and cover with about 1/4 of the marinade mixture.
- Bake chicken 30 minutes in the preheated oven. Drain off the marinade so that the chicken skin will become crisp (a baster works well for extracting the marinade). Continue baking 15 minutes, or until chicken is no longer pink and juices run clear.

Cherry Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 c. Eagle Brand milk
- 1 c. cherry pie filling
- 1 small can crushed pineapple, drained
- 1/4 c. lemon juice (ReaLemon brand)
- 1 (9 oz.) bowl Cool Whip
- 1 c. chopped nuts
- 1/4 tsp. almond extract

Directions:
- Mix in the order given and refrigerate.

Baked Tomatoes

Ingredients:
- 6 large tomatoes, firm
- 2 garlic cloves, crushed
- 12 cup cheddar cheese, grated
- 14 cup onion, chopped
- 12 teaspoon basil
- 13 cup corn flake crumbs

Directions:
- slice tops off tomatoes and scoop out the pulp.
- set asice shells.
- mix tomato pulp with rest of ingredients.
- carefully stuff mixture into shells.
- dot with butter.
- bake in buttered baking dish at 400 degrees for 30 minutes.

Herbed Steak Rub

Ingredients:
- 1/2 cup dried thyme
- 1/2 cup dried basil
- 1/2 cup dried rosemary
- 2 1/2 tablespoons salt
- 2 1/2 tablespoons fresh ground pepper
- 2 tablespoons ground red pepper

Directions:
- Combine all ingredients in a small bowl, and crush with the back of a spoon. Store in an airtight container.
- Directions for gift card: Rub 1 to 1 1/2 teaspoons Herbed Steak Rub over a 6-ounce beef tenderloin steak. Brush an ovenproof skillet with 1 tablespoon olive oil, and place over medium-high heat until hot. Add steak, and cook 2 to 3 minutes on each side. Immediately place skillet in a 400° oven, and bake 8 to 10 minutes or until a meat thermometer inserted into the thickest portion registers 145° (medium-rare).
- Note: Rub may also be used on pork and chicken.

Danish Roast Pork With Prunes (Flaskesteg Med Svesker)

Ingredients:
- 4 -5 lbs pork loin
- 16 prunes, halved and pitted
- 2 teaspoons salt
- 1 teaspoon pepper
- 1/4 teaspoon ginger (optional)
- 3 tablespoons flour
- 1/4 cup prune juice
- 2 3/4 cups water
- salt and pepper
- 1 teaspoon red currant jelly

Directions:
- Cut deep slits in pork loin and insert prune halves.
- Rub with the salt, pepper, and ginger.
- Roast uncovered in a 325° oven for about 1.5 hours.
- When done, remove from roasting pan.
- Heat pan drippings; stir in the flour, then add the prune juice and water.
- Season with salt and pepper to taste and cook until thickened.
- Stir in the jelly and serve the gravy over the sliced pork.

Egg and Sausage Casserole

Ingredients:
- 4 cups of shredded monterey jack cheese
- 2 tablespoons flour
- 3 (4 ounce) cans green chilies
- 2 cups shredded cheddar cheese
- 1 lb pork sausage
- 12 eggs
- 1 cup milk

Directions:
- Brown sausage.
- In a large bowl, combine eggs and milk.
- Blend thoroughly.
- Mix cheese and flour together and place in bottom of 9 x 12 baking dish.
- Top with chilies, cheddar cheese, the browned sausage and egg mixture.
- Cover and refrigerate overnight so flavors can blend.
- Bake at 350 degrees for 50 minutes.

Bacon Muffins

Ingredients:
- 4 strips bacon
- vegetable oil as needed
- 2 c. flour
- 1 Tbsp. sugar
- 1 Tbsp. baking powder
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/8 tsp. pepper
- 1 large egg
- 1 c. milk

Directions:
- Cut bacon in 1/2-inch pieces.
- Cook bacon in saucepan until golden brown.
- Pour fat through strainer over measuring cup and add vegetable oil if needed to make 1/4 cup.
- Drain bacon on paper towel.
- Heat oven to 400°.
- Grease muffin cups.
- Mix flour, sugar, baking powder, salt and pepper in large bowl.
- Whisk egg, milk and bacon fat in small bowl until egg is well broken up.
- Add bacon and pour over dry ingredients.
- Fold with rubber spatula until dry ingredients are moistened.
- Scoop into pan.
- Bake 15 to 20 minutes.
- Let cool in pan 5 minutes.
- Turn onto rack.

Touchdown Pepperoni Pizza Sandwich

Ingredients:
- For one sandwich
- 2 slices Italian bread
- 2 teaspoons mayonnaise
- 2 teaspoons pizza sauce (or spaghetti sauce)
- 6 slices pepperoni
- 2 slices sharp cheddar cheese (or mozzarella)
- 1 tablespoon grated parmesan cheese (or Asiago)

Directions:
- Spread mayonnaise on one slice and pizza or spaghetti sauce on the other slice.
- Lay pepperoni slices on the pizza sauce and the cheese over the top of that.
- Sprinkle Parmesan on the mayonnaise slice.
- Pop both pieces into the toaster oven (or put together and use a panini maker) until cheese is bubbly and melted.
- Fold sides together, and serve while warm.
- VARIATION: try this with your favorite pizza toppings OR cheeses.
- SERVING SUGGESTION: Cut on point into four pieces and use as "appetizers" or little kid-wiches.

Chicken Pockets

Ingredients:
- 1/4 cup chopped onion King Sooper's 1 lb For $0.99 thru 02/09
- 1/4 cup chopped green pepper
- 1 tsp. oil
- 1 pkg. (6 oz.) OSCAR MAYER CARVING BOARD Flame Grilled Chicken Breast Strips, cut into 2-inch pieces
- 1 can (8 oz.) refrigerated crescent dinner rolls
- 1/4 cup KRAFT Shredded Cheddar Cheese

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 375F.
- Cook onion and pepper in hot oil in medium skillet until crisp-tender.
- Add chicken breast strips; mix well.
- Separate crescent dough into 4 rectangles.
- Firmly press perforations together to seal.
- Pat out each rectangle to 8x4-inch rectangle.
- Spoon chicken mixture onto one half of each rectangle; sprinkle evenly with cheese.
- Fold dough over filling to enclose.
- Press edges of dough together, then press with tines of fork to seal completely.
- Bake 12 minutes or until golden brown.
- Serve warm.

Tid Bits

Ingredients:
- 3 c. Bisquick
- 8 oz. hot sausage
- 8 oz. sharp cheese
- hot sauce (Texas Pete, etc.) to taste

Directions:
- Mix and shape.
- Bake at 375° for 15 to 20 minutes.

Three Bean Casserole

Ingredients:
- 1 large can lima beans, drained
- 1 large can kidney beans, drained
- 1 large can pork and beans
- 5 slices minced bacon
- 1 lb. hamburger
- 1 chopped onion
- 1/2 c. brown sugar
- 1/2 c. catsup
- 2 Tbsp. vinegar
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 can French fried onion rings

Directions:
- Drain lima and kidney beans.
- Mix with pork and beans.
- Brown bacon, hamburger and onion together.
- Drain well.
- Mix brown sugar, catsup, vinegar and salt.
- Mix everything together.
- Bake at 350° for 1 hour.
- Before the last 10 minutes add the French fried onion rings.

Hot Chicken Or Turkey Salad

Ingredients:
- 4 c. diced cooked meat
- 1 c. mayonnaise
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 c. diced celery
- 3/4 c. chopped almonds
- green pepper
- 1 can cream of chicken soup
- 2 hard-cooked eggs, chopped
- 3/4 c. potato chips, crushed

Directions:
- Combine all ingredients, except potato chips.
- Place in a greased 2 1/2-quart casserole.
- Top with chips.
- Bake at 350° for 25 minutes.

Strawberry-Amaretto Milk Shake

Ingredients:
- 2 cups sliced fresh strawberries
- 1/2 cup amaretto liqueur
- 2 tablespoons sugar
- 2 cups vanilla ice cream
- Garnishes: sweetened whipped cream, chopped fresh strawberries

Directions:
- Stir together sliced fresh strawberries, amaretto liqueur, and 2 Tbsp. sugar; let stand 20 minutes.
- Process strawberry mixture and ice cream in a blender until smooth, stopping to scrape down sides as needed. Serve immediately.

Hearty Vegetable Soup

Ingredients:
- 2 teaspoons olive oil
- 1 medium onion, chopped
- 12 cup green pepper, chopped
- 2 -3 garlic cloves, minced
- 1 cup canned corn, drained
- 4 cups vegetable stock
- 1 cup canned black beans, drained, rinsed
- 3 tablespoons brown rice
- 1 teaspoon chili sauce
- 1 cup tomatoes, chopped
- 2 12 teaspoons cornstarch
- 12 teaspoon paprika
- 12 teaspoon cumin
- salt and pepper

Directions:
- Heat olive oil, onion, green pepper, and garlic in a stock pot on medium heat.
- Stir until onions are transparent.
- Stir in corn and cook for about 5 minutes.
- Stir in vegetable stock, black beans, rice, and chili sauce.
- Bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer for about 15 minutes.
- Add tomatoes and cornstarch (dissolved in 1 Tablespoon water) and salt and pepper.
- Simmer until thickened and rice is cooked (about 20 to 25 minutes).
- Serve soup garnished with tortilla chips, sour cream, or cilantro or parsley.

Reverse Salsa: the Stand-In for Tomato Salsa

Ingredients:
- 3 cups chilies, stemmed, cut up into large chunks (I use red small Thai peppers, red jalapenos, and a few red Anaheims)
- 12 grapefruit, juice of
- 12 cup red onion, chopped coarsely
- 1 cup diced tomato (either canned or fresh)
- 2 garlic cloves
- 12 teaspoon Mexican oregano
- 14 teaspoon cumin powder
- 14 teaspoon black pepper
- 12 teaspoon salt
- 1 teaspoon rice wine vinegar (red pepper flavored)

Directions:
- Add all ingredients to an electric blender and blend until smooth.
- If using canned tomatoes, do not drain.
- **Important:** AVOID inhaling the salsa when you remove the lid from the blender.
- Adjust seasoning.
- Allow salsa to marinate a good 2-3 hours for best flavor.
- When ready to serve, put up plenty of warning signs around the neighborhood.
- Yield is estimated.
- Freezes well.

Pineapple Cake

Ingredients:
- 2 c. plain flour
- 2 c. sugar
- 2 eggs
- 2 tsp. soda
- 1 c. chopped pecans
- 1 large can undrained crushed pineapple

Directions:
- Mix together and pour into a 9 x 13-inch pan.
- The pan should be sprayed with Pam first.
- Bake at 350° for 30 to 40 minutes. Frost while warm.

Tuna Mousse

Ingredients:
- 2 envelopes unflavored gelatin
- 1/2 cup water
- 1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of mushroom soup
- 1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, softened
- 1 1/2 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce
- 1 cup mayonnaise
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1 teaspoon onion salt
- 1 teaspoon celery salt (optional)
- 1 (12.5 ounce) can water-packed tuna, drained

Directions:
- Line a mold, or pie pan with plastic wrap.
- In a small bowl, dissolve gelatin in water and set aside.
- In a large saucepan, heat soup and cream cheese until soft and smooth. Remove pan from heat.
- Mix gelatin mixture, Worcestershire sauce, mayonnaise, salt and pepper (to taste), onion salt, celery salt, and tuna fish into the soup and cheese saucepan. Stir mixture until smooth.
- Cover mold or pan and chill overnight. When ready to serve remove the tuna mousse from the mold and serve.

Halibut Puttanesca

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 cups tomato sauce, left over from Spaghetti and Meatballs or storebought
- 4 cloves garlic, minced
- 1/2 cup stuffed green olives, chopped
- 3 tablespoons drained capers
- 1/2 cup red wine
- 2 teaspoons anchovy paste
- 4 (5-ounce) halibut fillets
- Salt and ground black pepper
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh basil leaves

Directions:
- Add tomato sauce to a saucepan.
- Add garlic, olives, capers, wine and anchovy paste and bring mixture to a simmer for 5 minutes over medium heat.
- Meanwhile, season halibut on both sides with salt and black pepper.
- Add halibut fillets to sauce, cover and simmer 3 to 5 minutes, until fish is fork tender.

BBQ Dogs For the Adults

Ingredients:
- 10 heat and eat mini long rolls
- 10 chipolata sausages
- 1/2 cup KRAFT Smooth Peanut Butter
- 2 teaspoons oil
- 1 red onion, thinly sliced
- 2 teaspoons brown sugar
- baby rocket leaves, to serve

Directions:
- Bake rolls according to pack instructions.
- Cook sausages until golden brown and cooked through.
- Heat oil in a small saucepan and saute the onion until softened.
- Stir in the sugar and cook a further 3-4 minutes until caramelised and brown.
- Cut rolls 3/4 of the way down the centre almost to the bottom.
- Spread with peanut butter and top with some rocket, a sausage and onion.
- Serve immediately.

Mildred'S Favorite Rice Krispie Cookies

Ingredients:
- 1 c. oleo
- 1/2 c. egg substitute
- 1 c. brown sugar
- 1 c. white sugar
- 1 tsp. soda
- 1/2 cream of tartar
- 2 c. flour
- 2 c. oatmeal
- 2 c. Rice Krispies

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients well, except oatmeal and Rice Krispies. Mix together oatmeal and Rice Krispies and fold into other ingredients.
- Drop by teaspoonful onto greased cookie sheet.
- Bake at 375° for 12 to 14 minutes.
- Raisins and nuts may be added.

Potato Broccoli Cheese Soup

Ingredients:
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 4 tablespoons butter
- 1 teaspoon parsley
- 1 medium onion, chopped
- garlic clove, pressed or minced
- 4 large potatoes, baked, then chunked (baking size)
- 1 cup broccoli floret, chopped
- 6 cups broth, veggie or 6 cups chicken
- 2 cups milk
- 3 tablespoons chickpea flour (all purpose is fine if you cannot find)
- 1 cup Velveeta cheese, chunked or 1 cup cheddar cheese, shredded

Directions:
- Heat oil, melt butter.
- Soften onion & garlic in the blend, 8-10 minute
- Add parsley, potato, broccoli, and broth.
- Bring to a boil, simmer 30 minute
- Whisk milk and flour in separate bowl, set aside.
- Smash 1/3-1/2 of the potatoes with potato masher.
- Blend in milk mix, then add velveeta and melt.
- Turn off burner, and allow soup to thicken, about 5 minutes.

Missouri Corn Pudding

Ingredients:
- 3 eggs
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/2 tsp. pepper
- 1/2 c. brown sugar
- 1/2 c. melted margarine
- 1/2 c. milk
- 4 c. whole kernel corn

Directions:
- Whip together in baking dish all ingredients except corn. When well mixed, stir in the corn.
- Bake at 350° for 35 to 45 minutes until mixture is set.

No-Cook Lemon Freeze

Ingredients:
- 3/4 c. corn flake crumbs
- 2 Tbsp. sugar
- 1/4 c. melted margarine
- 2 eggs, separated
- 1 can Eagle Brand condensed milk
- 1/3 c. lemon juice
- 1/2 tsp. grated lemon peel
- 3 Tbsp. sugar

Directions:
- Combine crumbs, first sugar and butter in 8-inch pie pan or ice cube tray.
- Mix well; save 2 to 4 tablespoons for topping.

Marshall Field Ozark Pudding

Ingredients:
- 1/3 c. presifted flour
- 1 1/4 tsp. baking powder
- 1/8 tsp. salt
- 3/4 c. sugar
- 1 egg
- 1/2 c. chopped nuts
- 1/2 c. chopped apples
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 c. heavy cream, whipped

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 325°.
- Grease a 1-quart casserole.
- On a piece of waxed paper, sift together flour, baking powder and salt.
- In a mixing bowl, beat egg and sugar until light and creamy.
- Add flour mixture; blend well.
- Fold in apples, nuts and vanilla.
- Turn into casserole.
- Bake for 30 minutes.
- Serve with whipped cream or vanilla ice cream.

Rich Cooked Okara (Stewed Okara)

Ingredients:
- 250 grams Fresh okara
- 1 pack Shiitake mushrooms
- 1 Burdock root
- 5 cm Carrot
- 1/2 Konnyaku
- 2 Chikuwa
- 1 Aburaage
- 1 Thinly sliced green onion
- 100 ml Dashi stock
- 4 tbsp Sake
- 2 tbsp each Sugar, soy sauce, mirin
- 1/2 tsp Salt

Directions:
- Julienne the shiitake mushrooms and carrots, and cut the burdock root into long, thin shavings.
- Cut the konnyaku in half horizontally and then into thin strips.
- Slice the chikuwa into rounds, cut the aburaage in half horizontally and then into thin strips.
- Heat vegetable oil in a deep pot, and saute all of the vegetables and konnyaku except the green onions.
- Add the chikuwa and aburaage once the vegetables have softened, and saute some more.
- Once the oil has coated everything, add in the okara and ingredients, and stir while simmering.
- One the dish has thickened and become moist, add in the green onions, give it a quick stir, and it is done.

Sausage Calzones

Ingredients:
- 1 cup ricotta cheese
- 4 sausage links, chopped
- 12 cup mozzarella cheese
- 13 78 ounces pillsbury pizza dough
- 1 cup marinara sauce

Directions:
- Preheat oven 400.
- Mix cheeses and sausage.
- On large nonstick sprayed cookie sheet, unroll pizza dough.
- Cut to make four equal sections.
- Fill each dough square halfway with cheese and sausage mixture.
- Roll dough over & pinch edges to seal.
- Bake 25 minutes.
- Serve with warm marinara sauce.

Arizona Skillet Dinner

Ingredients:
- 2 Tbsp. Mazola corn oil
- 1 medium onion, chopped
- 1 medium green pepper, chopped
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 Tbsp. chili powder
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 tsp. ground cumin
- 1 (28 oz.) can whole tomatoes, undrained
- 1 (16 oz.) can kidney beans, rinsed and drained
- 1 (10 oz.) pkg. frozen corn kernels, thawed
- 8 oz. Mueller's elbow macaroni (about 1 3/4 c.), cooked and drained
- 1/2 c. (2 oz.) shredded Monterey Jack cheese (with jalapeno pepper)

Directions:
- In a large skillet, heat corn oil over medium-high heat.
- Add onion, green pepper, garlic, chili powder, salt and cumin.
- Saute 4 minutes or until vegetables are tender.
- Stir in tomatoes, breaking with a spoon.
- Add kidney beans and corn.
- Bring to a boil.
- Reduce heat and simmer 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
- Toss with elbows.
- Sprinkle with cheese.
- Makes 8 servings.

Summer Fruit Cream Freeze

Ingredients:
- 2-3 cups frozen seedless watermelon, cantaloupe or honeydew balls, or peeled, pitted and frozen peach slices, or whole frozen strawberries
- 1/2 cup heavy cream
- 1 tablespoon honey (optional)

Directions:
- Place fruit in the bowl of a food processor fitted with the metal blade. Pulse until fruit is a smooth but firm slush.
- With blade running, pour cream and honey, if using, through feed tube and process until well blended, about 15-20 seconds.
- Spoon into bowls and serve immediately.

Warm Barley and Pumpkin Salad

Ingredients:
- 4 cups peeled pumpkin cubes (1/2 inch)
- 1/3 cup Kraft Extra Virgin Olive Oil Greek Feta Dressing, divided
- 2-2/3 cups cooked barley
- 2 cups tightly packed baby arugula
- 1/2 cup Cracker Barrel Crumbled Feta Cheese with Oregano, Sun Dried Tomatoes and Black Pepper
- 1/2 cup chopped red onions
- 1/4 cup pepitas, toasted

Directions:
- Heat oven to 425 degrees F.
- Toss pumpkin with 2 Tbsp.
- dressing; spread onto parchment-covered rimmed baking sheet.
- Bake 30 min.
- or until pumpkin is tender, stirring after 15 min.
- Place pumpkin in large bowl.
- Add remaining ingredients, including remaining dressing; mix lightly.

Korean Short Ribs 

Ingredients:
- Beef Short ribs
- 2 cups low sodium soy sauce
- 1 cup brown sugar
- 1/2 cup water
- 1 cup green onions
- pepper
- 1 teaspoon sesame oil
- 1 to 2 teaspoons sesame seed

Directions:
- -cook short ribs in pan skillet with small amount of water garlic and onions.
- -combine all other ingredients (minus green onions) in a sauce pan until sauce is well incorporated.
- -when ribs are fully cooked. pour sauce into skillet with rib. allow to blend for few minutes on medium heat. Serve and sprinkle green onions/ chives over ribs.

Basil Tortellini Soup

Ingredients:
- 4 cups chicken broth
- 1 package (9 ounces) refrigerated cheese tortellini
- 1 can (15 ounces) cannellini beans, rinsed and drained
- 1 cup chopped fresh tomato
- 1/3 to 1/2 cup shredded fresh basil
- 1 to 2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/8 to 1/4 teaspoon pepper
- 1/3 cup shredded Parmesan cheese

Directions:
- In a large saucepan, bring broth to a boil. Add tortellini; cook until tender, 7-9 minutes. Stir in beans, tomato and basil. Reduce heat; simmer, uncovered, 5 minutes. Add vinegar, salt and pepper. Serve with cheese.

Microwave Chocolate Sundae

Ingredients:
- 1 c. flour
- 3/4 c. sugar
- 2 Tbsp. cocoa
- 2 tsp. baking soda
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1/2 c. milk
- 2 Tbsp. oil
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 c. nuts
- 1 c. brown sugar
- 1/4 c. cocoa
- 1 3/4 to 2 c. boiling water

Directions:
- Mix first 5 ingredients in 9 x 9 x 2-inch dish.
- Add milk, oil, vanilla and nuts.
- Mix to make batter.
- Sprinkle over this the brown sugar and cocoa combined.
- Gently pour boiling water over the top.
- Microwave for 8 to 10 minutes (High), turning dish after 4 minutes.
- Chocolate syrup will go to the bottom.
- Serve with ice cream and spoon sauce over ice cream.

Marinated Brussels Sprouts

Ingredients:
- 10 to 12 Brussels sprouts, washed
- 1/3 c. water
- 1/3 c. vinegar (white)
- 1/3 c. salad oil
- 1 pkg. dry Good Seasons Italian dressing

Directions:
- Scour a 1 pint jar.
- Boil Brussels sprouts 5 to 10 minutes, depending on size.
- Mix the water, vinegar and salad oil. Add the Italian dressing. Shake all well and pour over sprouts.
- Seal and store in refrigerator.

Green Chili Rice

Ingredients:
- 3 c. cooked rice, cooled
- 2 c. dairy sour cream
- 1/2 lb. shredded Monterey Jack cheese
- 6 oz. diced green chilies
- 1/4 c. grated Parmesan cheese
- 1 c. grated mild Cheddar cheese

Directions:
- Mix rice and sour cream. Spread 1/2 of this mixture in a 1 1/2-quart casserole. Sprinkle 1/2 of the Jack cheese over the top. Add the diced chilies, then cover with the remaining Jack cheese. Add remaining rice. Sprinkle with the Parmesan cheese and top with the Cheddar cheese. Bake in a preheated 350° oven for about 30 minutes or until heated through. This dish makes a great accompaniment for roast beef.

Persimmon Fudge

Ingredients:
- 1 c. persimmon pulp
- 6 c. sugar
- 2 1/2 c. milk
- 1/2 c. corn syrup
- 1/2 c. butter

Directions:
- Combine pulp, sugar, milk and syrup in large saucepan; cook slowly about 1 hour until it reaches soft ball stage.
- Cool to lukewarm, stirring often.
- Add butter; beat until thickens.
- Then add 1 cup nuts (optional); spread into buttered dish.

Morrocan Chicken

Ingredients:
- 1/3 c. flour
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 5 lb. chicken parts
- 3 Tbsp. oil
- 1 1/2 c. chopped onion
- 2 tsp. minced garlic
- 1 1/2 c. chicken broth
- 1 lemon, cut into wedges
- 1 tsp. cumin
- 1 tsp. ginger
- 2 tomatoes, cut into wedges
- parsley
- ripe olives (for garnish)

Directions:
- Mix flour, salt and pepper.
- Dredge chicken parts in mixture until covered.
- Heat vegetable oil in a skillet over high heat. Brown chicken in hot oil.
- Reduce heat and transfer chicken to a casserole or baking dish.
- Add chopped onion and garlic; cook about 4 minutes.
- Stir in chicken broth, lemon, cumin, ginger and a dash of pepper.
- Bring to boil and spoon over chicken.
- Arrange tomato wedges around chicken.
- Cover dish tightly with lid or foil.
- Bake 50 minutes at 375°.
- Remove lemon before serving. Garnish with parsley and black olives.
- Serve with rice.
- Serves 10.

Baked Potatoes (Stuffed)

Ingredients:
- 4 medium baking potatoes
- 1/2 c. sour cream
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 c. grated Cheddar cheese
- paprika (a sprinkle)

Directions:
- Bake potatoes on center rack of 450° preheated oven until soft.
- Cut thin slice lengthwise from top of each potato.
- Scoop out flesh; keep shell.
- Throw away top of each potato.
- Mash flesh with mixer and add sour cream and salt.
- Mix until fluffy.
- (Add a little milk, if you prefer it thinner).
- Add cheese and mix.

Watermelon Star Salad

Ingredients:
- lettuce leaf
- watermelon
- creamed cottage cheese
- blueberries

Directions:
- Wash and pat dry 1 leaf of lettuce with a paper towel.
- Place lettuce leaf on the salad plate.
- Cut 1/2 slice of watermelon into 5 wedges 1 inch thick.
- Trim red melon away from white part and green rind.
- On lettuce leaf, arrange melon in a circle with the points outward to form a star.
- Spoon 1/2 cup creamed cottage cheese into the center of the watermelon star.
- Wash and sprinkle 1 tablespoon blueberries over the cottage cheese.

Squash Pickles

Ingredients:
- 8 c. thinly sliced squash
- 2 c. thinly sliced onions
- 2 c. vinegar
- plain salt
- 2 tsp. celery seed
- 2 tsp. mustard seed
- 3 c. sugar

Directions:
- Combine squash and onions; sprinkle with salt.
- Let set for 1 hour.
- Drain off liquid.
- Mix vinegar, sugar, celery seed and mustard seed in a saucepan.
- Bring to a hard boil; then add squash and onions.
- Bring to a boil and then fill jars.

Zucchini Bread

Ingredients:
- 3 eggs
- 1 c. oil
- 1 1/2 c. white sugar
- 1 1/2 c. brown sugar
- 2 c. grated zucchini
- 3 tsp. vanilla
- 3 c. flour
- 1 1/2 tsp. baking powder
- 1 1/2 tsp. soda
- 1 1/2 tsp. salt
- 2 tsp. cinnamon
- 1 c. nuts, chopped

Directions:
- Cream the eggs, sugars and oil.
- Add vanilla and zucchini. Combine dry ingredients and add to creamed mixture. Fold in nuts. Bake 1 hour at 350°.
- Makes 2 large loaves or 6 small loaves.

Windy Chili

Ingredients:
- 2 Tbsp. oil
- 1 1/2 to 2 lb. ground round
- 1 (10 oz.) can French onion soup (not creamy-style)
- 1 Tbsp. chili powder
- 2 tsp. cumin
- 1/2 tsp. black pepper
- Tabasco sauce
- 1 (21 oz.) can red kidney beans (undrained)
- 1 (6 oz.) can tomato paste
- 1 (8 oz.) can tomato sauce

Directions:
- Brown meat.
- Blend onion soup and put with meat; simmer.
- Add chili powder, cumin, black pepper and a few drops of Tabasco sauce.
- Add kidney beans, tomato paste and tomato sauce.

Cabbage Patch Stew

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 2 medium onions, thinly sliced
- 1 1/2 c. coarsely chopped cabbage
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 to 2 tsp. chili powder
- Dumplings
- 1 (15 oz.) can kidney beans
- 1 c. water
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1/2 c. chopped celery
- 1 (16 oz.) can stewed tomatoes

Directions:
- Cook and stir ground beef in Dutch oven until brown; drain. Add onions, cabbage and celery; cook and stir until vegetables are light brown.
- Stir in tomatoes, kidney beans (with liquid), water, salt, pepper and chili powder.
- Heat to boiling; reduce heat. Prepare dumplings and drop by spoonfuls onto boiling stew.
- Cook, uncovered, over low heat, 10 minutes.
- Cover and cook 10 more minutes.
- Sprinkle dumplings with paprika, if desired.

Almond Popcorn Chews

Ingredients:
- 8 cups popcorn
- 2 cups
- 2/3 cup PLANTERS Almonds
- 1/2 cup light corn syrup
- 1/3 cup sugar

Directions:
- Combine popcorn, pretzel sticks and almonds in large bowl; set aside.
- Blend corn syrup, sugar and pudding mix in 2-quart microwavable bowl.
- Microwave at HIGH (100% power) for 1 1/2 to 2 minutes or until mixture boils; stir.
- Microwave 30 seconds more.
- Pour syrup mixture over popcorn mixture, tossing to coat well.
- Spread mixture on greased baking sheet; cool completely.
- Break into pieces; store in airtight container.

Patty Ann's Chess Cakes

Ingredients:
- 1/4 Lb butter
- 1 package cream cheese
- 1 cup flour, all-purpose sifted
- 1 each eggs lightly beaten
- 3/4 cup brown sugar
- 1 tablespoon butter melted
- 1/2 cup pecans finely chopped
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1 each eggs lightly beaten
- 3/4 cup sugar granulated
- 1 tablespoon butter melted
- 23 cup coconut shredded
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract

Directions:
- Oven 350F (180C).
- FOR PASTRY SHELLS: Make recipe of pie pastry, roll out and cut rounds to fit muffin cups.
- FOR CREAM CHEESE PASTRY: Mix together ingredients in medium bowl.
- Divide equally among muffin tins.
- Press in with fingers.
- FOR FILLINGS: Mix all ingredients well in small bowl.
- Place 1 teaspoon filling in each pastry-lined muffin cup.
- Bake in preheated oven at 350degrees F. for 20 minutes until done.
- Run tip of sharp knive around tart when done to loosen.
- Remove to wire racks to cool.
- Store in tin box between layers of wax paper.

Steak Marinade

Ingredients:
- 2 c. water
- 2 c. Italian dressing
- 1/4 c. soy sauce
- 1/4 tsp. paprika
- 1/4 tsp. garlic powder
- 1/4 tsp. ginger
- 1 tsp. minced onion, dried
- 1/8 c. sugar

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients, whisking well to incorporate sugar.
- Use marinade on any meat.
- Brush on steaks while grilling and right before serving.

Copper Penny Carrots

Ingredients:
- 2 lb. carrots
- 2 onions, sliced thin
- 1 bell pepper, chopped
- 1 can tomato soup
- 1/2 c. oil
- 3/4 c. vinegar
- 1 Tbsp. mustard seed
- 2/3 c. sugar
- 1 Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce

Directions:
- Slice carrots 1/4-inch thick and cook in boiling water until barely done; drain.
- Add onions and peppers.
- Mix other ingredients to make dressing.
- Pour over carrots and refrigerate overnight.

Easy Fried Shrimp

Ingredients:
- 1 lb fresh shrimp, peeled and deveined
- 1/2 box saltine crackers, crushed
- 2 -3 eggs, beaten with fork
- oil

Directions:
- Peel, devein and wash shrimp.
- In a medium bowl beat eggs with a fork until well blended.
- Put shrimp in eggs and mix so all shrimp is coated with eggs.
- Put saltine crackers in plastic bag and crush with rolling pin.
- Don't roll them too fine.
- Heat oil in pan.
- Add shrimp to the cracker crumbs, a few at a time and coat well.
- Drop into hot oil and fry until golden brown.
- Remove and drain on paper towels.
- Do not over cook as this toughens the shrimp.
- The amount of crackers and eggs you use depends on the amount of shrimp you want to fry.
- The more shrimp, the more crackers and eggs.
- Preparation time also depends on the amount of shrimp you are frying.

Porcupine Meatballs

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. hamburg
- 1 onion, diced
- 1/2 c. rice
- salt and pepper to taste
- 2 eggs
- 1 can tomato sauce
- 1/2 can water

Directions:
- Combine hamburg, onion, rice, salt, pepper and eggs.
- Mix water and half the tomato sauce into mixture.
- Shape into small balls.
- Layer in a baking pan.
- Pour remaining water and sauce over meatballs.
- Cover and bake 30 to 45 minutes at 350°.

Sour Cream Rhubarb Pie

Ingredients:
- 9-inch unbaked pastry pie shell
- 1 1/2 c. sugar
- 1 1/2 c. sour cream
- 1 1/2 c. rhubarb, diced
- 2 Tbsp. flour
- 3 egg yolks
- nutmeg
- 3 egg whites
- 6 Tbsp. sugar

Directions:
- Beat egg yolks slightly.
- Add sour cream, sugar, flour and rhubarb.
- Stir.
- Pour into 9-inch unbaked pastry pie shell. Sprinkle nutmeg lightly on top.
- Bake in 375° oven for 30 to 35 minutes.
- Beat the egg whites and sugar until peaks form.
- Remove pie from oven; spread with meringue.
- Return to oven and bake 10 minutes more, until meringue is brown.

Joy'S Poppy Seed Chicken

Ingredients:
- 1 pkg. Pepperidge Farm herbal stuffing
- 1/4 c. chicken broth
- 2 Tbsp. poppy seed
- 1 stick melted butter or margarine
- 2 to 3 c. cubed chicken
- 1 c. sour cream
- 2 cans cream of chicken soup
- 1 c. chicken broth

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350°.
- Mix first 4 ingredients and spread half of the mixture in a 9 x 13-inch dish.
- Next, put the cubed chicken on top of the stuffing.
- Mix the last 3 ingredients and put on top of the chicken.
- Top with the remaining stuffing.
- Bake, uncovered, for 30 minutes.
- Very yummy!

Chocolate Creams

Ingredients:
- 1 c. chopped walnuts
- 1 c. chopped pecans
- 1 stick butter
- 1 small jar cherries, drained and chopped
- 1 c. Eagle Brand milk
- 2 boxes powdered sugar
- 1 tsp. vanilla

Directions:
- Mix and roll into small balls.
- Place in refrigerator until hard.
- Melt 3/4 stick paraffin and large package chocolate chips (semi-sweet) in top of double boiler.
- Drop balls in chocolate and let cool on buttered wax paper or cookie sheet.

Corny Corn Bread

Ingredients:
- 1 c. meal (self-rising)
- 1/2 c. corn oil
- 1/3 c. sugar
- 1 c. creamed corn
- 1 c. sour cream
- 2 eggs

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients and bake at 400° for 30 minutes (until golden brown).
- Serve hot.

Peanut Butter Bars

Ingredients:
- 1 c. oleo (regular)
- 1 c. brown sugar
- 2 eggs
- 2/3 c. peanut butter
- 1 tsp. soda
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 2 c. flour
- 2 c. Mother's oats
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 c. regular sugar

Directions:
- Cream oleo and sugars; add peanut butter and remaining ingredients.
- Spread in greased cookie sheet with 1-inch side. Bake 25 minutes; remove from oven and immediately sprinkle with chocolate chips.
- As they melt, spread as icing; cool.

Boiled Spice Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 c. oleo
- 2 c. sugar
- 3 eggs
- 2 c. boiling water
- 3 c. flour
- 1 tsp. baking powder
- 2 tsp. soda
- 2 tsp. cinnamon
- 1/2 tsp. cloves
- 1 c. raisins
- 1/2 tsp. allspice

Directions:
- Put sugar, oleo, eggs, raisins, boiling water, soda, cinnamon, cloves and allspice in pan.
- Mix thoroughly and let come to a boil. Cool. When cool, add flour and baking powder.
- Bake in a 9 x 13-inch greased pan at 350° until done, about 25 minutes.

Chicken Casserole

Ingredients:
- 4 c. chicken, ham or turkey
- 2 1/2 c. spaghetti, cooked and drained
- 1/2 c. chopped green pepper
- 1 c. chopped onion
- 2 c. cream of mushroom soup
- 1 c. chicken broth
- 3 1/2 c. grated cheese

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients together well.
- Put in casserole dish and sprinkle with cheese.
- Bake at 350° for 45 minutes.

Moist Chocolate Cake

Ingredients:
- 2 c. sugar
- 1 1/2 sticks margarine
- 2 eggs or Egg Beaters
- 2 1/2 c. flour
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 c. cocoa
- 1 c. buttermilk (can use 1 c. skim milk with Tbsp. vinegar)
- 1 c. boiling water
- 2 tsp. baking soda

Directions:
- Cream together sugar and margarine.
- Add eggs and mix well. Sift into bowl the flour, salt and cocoa.
- Alternately add flour mixture and buttermilk to creamed batter, beating well between each addition.
- Then add boiling water that has had the 2 teaspoons of baking soda added to it.
- The batter will be runny. Beat well.
- Pour into greased pan.
- Bake 35 to 40 minutes at 325°.

Grilled Tilapia Fillets

Ingredients:
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 2 tablespoons lemon juice
- 1 tablespoon minced cilantro
- 1 teaspoon seasoning salt
- 4 tilapia fillets

Directions:
- In medium bowl, whisk together oil, lemon juice, cilantro and salt until well blended.
- Place fillets in a shallow baking dish and pour marinade over fillets.
- Cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
- Wrap fillets in foil and grill.

Apple Crisp

Ingredients:
- 6 Apples, cored & pared & sliced
- 1/2 c. Water
- 1/2 tsp. Cinnamon
- 1/2 tsp. Nutmeg
- 1 tsp. Vanilla
- 3/4 c. Sugar
- 2/3 c. Water
- 1/3 c. Butter

Directions:
- Work with your fingers until crumbly,
- Spread over apples, bake 30 minutes at 350°.
- Serve hot with cream.

Easy Stromboli

Ingredients:
- 2 cans Pillsbury All-Ready pizza crust or 2 loaves Rich's bread dough, partially thawed
- 1/3 lb. low-salt ham or honey ham
- 1/4 lb. hard salami
- 1/4 lb. slicing pepperoni
- 1/4 lb. low-salt Provolone cheese
- 1 medium onion, sliced thin
- 1 green pepper, sliced
- 1 lb. grated Mozzarella

Directions:
- Have all meats sliced thin at deli counter.

Nutty O's

Ingredients:
- 1 cup dark brown sugar, packed
- 1 cup dark corn syrup
- 12 cup butter or 12 cup margarine
- 12 cups Cheerios toasted oat cereal
- 2 cups pecan halves
- 1 cup whole almond

Directions:
- In large saucepan, heat brown sugar, corn syrup and butter until sugar is dissolved.
- Stir in cereal and nuts; mix well.
- Spread onto a well greased 15x10x1-inch baking pan.
- Bake at 325F for 15 minutes.
- Cool for 10 minutes.
- Stir to loosen from pan and then let cool completely.
- Store in airtight container.

Tater Tot Casserole

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. ground beef
- onions
- frozen peas
- frozen tater tots
- 2 cans cream of chicken soup, undiluted

Directions:
- Brown ground beef and drain, then put in bottom of casserole dish.
- Pour frozen peas on top.
- Bake tater tots for about 8 minutes and then put them on top of the peas.
- Pour the two cans of cream of chicken soup on top also.
- Bake uncovered for 30 to 40 minutes at 375°.

Slow Cooker Pot Roast

Ingredients:
- 1 roast beef (size: whatever you can fit into a 3 1/2 qt. crock pot)
- 1 package dried onion soup mix
- 2 cups (475 ml) water

Directions:
- Place roast in crock pot.
- Empty contents of onion soup package into crock pot.
- Pour water into crock pot.
- If using a frozen roast, set on high and let it cook all day.
- If using a refrigerated roast, set on high and cook for a half a day (or low if you've got all day).

Award Winning Food Author David Rosengarten At Grand Central Oyster Frenzy 

Ingredients:
- 2 teaspoon Green Tabasco sauce
- 1/4 cup Celery leaves
- 2 ounce Diced tomatillos
- 12 Oysters

Directions:
- 1. Place the Tabasco sauce, celery leaves and tomatillos in a food processor. Puree.
- 2. Shuck the oysters. Divide green sauce among the 12 oysters, and serve immediately.

Simple Crock-Pot Bratwurst Dinner

Ingredients:
- 1 lb uncooked bratwurst
- 1 lb yukon gold potato, in 1 . 5 inch chunks
- 1 onion, in 1 inch chunks
- 1 (14 ounce) can sauerkraut
- 1/2 cup water
- 1 teaspoon fresh ground black pepper
- 1 teaspoon dried parsley
- sour cream or mustard

Directions:
- Place potatoes in the bottom of the crockpot, followed by onion.
- Place whole (not cut up!) bratwurst over top of the onion and potatoes.
- Spoon sauerkraut over bratwurst, and then pour water over the sauerkraut.
- Sprinkle with black pepper and parsley.
- Cover with crock pot lid and cook on low for 8-10 hours.
- Serve with sour cream and/or mustard.

Mom's Beef Stroganoff

Ingredients:
- 1 12 lbs ground beef
- 1 chopped onion
- 1 garlic clove, chopped
- 2 cups sliced mushrooms
- beef base, paste (to taste (I like it beefy)
- 3 (10 1/2 ounce) cans beef consomme
- 12 cup sherry wine
- salt
- pepper
- 2 -3 tablespoons cornstarch
- 1 12 cups sour cream

Directions:
- Brown ground beef and onion.
- Add chopped garlic and cook for 1 minute.
- Add mushrooms, beef base,and consomme.
- Bring to a boil, then turn down the heat and simmer for 20-25 minutes.
- Taste, and adjust seasonings.
- Add sherry and simmer 5-10 more minutes.
- Mix cornstarch with water until smooth.
- Add a little bit at a time until desired thickness
- (should be quite thick, the sour cream will thin it down).
- When you achieve desired thickness, turn down the heat and add sour cream--do not let it boil.
- Serve over rice or noodles, with corn and a tossed green salad.

Raisin Oatmeal Mini Scones

Ingredients:
- 2/3 cup margarine, melted
- 1 1/2 cups quick oats
- egg substitute equivalent to 2 eggs
- 1 tsp. vanilla extract
- artificial sweetener equivalent to 1 cup of sugar
- 1 1/2 cups all purpose flour
- 1 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 cup skim milk
- 1/2 cup raisins

Directions:
- In a large bowl, combine margarine and oats.
- Stir in egg substitute, vanilla, and sweetener.
- Combine flour, baking powder, and salt.
- Add to oat mixture alternately with milk.
- Stir in raisins.
- Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto baking sheets coated with non stick cooking spray.
- Bake at 400 degrees for 12-15 minutes or until browned.

Chicken Cordon Bleu

Ingredients:
- 2 lb. chicken cutlets, sliced thin
- 1/2 c. Virginia baked ham
- 1/2 lb. Swiss cheese
- bread crumbs
- melted butter
- College Inn chicken broth

Directions:
- Pound chicken cutlets thin.
- Lay slice of ham and cheese on top of each cutlet and roll up.
- Hold closed with toothpicks or raw spaghetti. Roll in bread crumbs. Bake at 350° for 35 minutes. Pour melted butter over top.
- Bake another 15 minutes.

Honey Carrot Pie

Ingredients:
- 4 cups sliced carrots
- 2 eggs
- 1 cup evaporated milk
- 3/4 cup packed brown sugar
- 2 tablespoons honey
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 1/2 teaspoon ground nutmeg
- 1/4 teaspoon ground cloves
- 1/4 teaspoon ground allspice
- 1 single pie crust

Directions:
- Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Cook carrots in the boiling water until very tender, about 15 minutes. Drain and transfer to a blender. Cover and hold lid down; pulse a few times before leaving on to blend. Puree in batches until very smooth. Set aside to cool.
- Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
- Beat eggs in a large bowl. Add carrots, evaporated milk, brown sugar, honey, salt, cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves, and allspice; beat until smooth. Fit pie crust into a 9-inch pie dish and pour carrot mixture into pie crust.
- Bake in the preheated oven until a knife inserted into the center of the pie comes out clean, 40 to 45 minutes.

Cheese Balls

Ingredients:
- 2 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese
- 1 1/2 c. grated cheese
- 2 tsp. minced onions
- 1/2 c. chopped sweet pickles
- 1/2 c. chopped nuts (if desired)

Directions:
- Mix first four items and roll into ball.
- Roll ball onto nuts. Serve.

Creamed Chicken And Biscuits

Ingredients:
- 1/2 large onion
- 1 1/2 tsp. butter
- 4 c. chicken, cooked and chopped
- 10 3/4 oz. can cream of chicken soup
- 1 c. sour cream
- 1/2 c. milk
- 1/2 c. chopped pimento
- 1 c. shredded mild cheddar cheese, divided
- 6 frozen biscuits, thawed

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
- Grease the bottoms and sides of an 11 x 7 baking dish.
- Chop the onion.
- Heat butter in a small non-stick skillet over medium-high heat until melted.
- Stir in onion and saute until tender.

Squash Rolls

Ingredients:
- 1/4 c. shortening
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/2 c. scalded milk
- 1 yeast cake
- 1/2 c. warm water
- 1/2 c. summer squash, liquefied
- 3 c. flour
- 1/4 c. sugar
- 1/2 tsp. nutmeg
- mace or cinnamon

Directions:
- Mix ingredients as for any rolls.
- Knead until smooth.
- Let rise once.
- Punch down.
- Shape into rolls.
- Let rise until double in bulk.
- Bake at 400° about 20 minutes.

Clairmont Diner Coleslaw

Ingredients:
- 1 (5 lb.) head cabbage
- 3 cucumbers, peeled and sliced
- 2 green peppers, diced
- 1 large white Bermuda onion, sliced
- 2 carrots, sliced
- 2 c. white vinegar
- 1 1/2 c. oil
- 2/3 c. water
- 1 1/2 c. sugar
- 1/4 c. Kosher salt

Directions:
- Mix and marinate for 3 days.
- Stir often.

Banana Bread 5 Recipe

Ingredients:
- 1/4 c. buttermilk
- 1 x egg
- 1/4 c. unsalted butter or possibly canola oil
- 1 tsp vanilla extract
- 1/2 c. banana mashed
- 1 c. all-purpose flour
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 1/4 tsp salt
- 1/4 tsp baking soda
- 2 tsp double-acting baking pwdr

Directions:
- Load ingrediets according to your Manufacturer's instructions.
- Load vanilla; scoop in mashed bananan, scatter baking soda and pwdr over dry ingredients.
- Bake on your machine's quick cycle.

Fresh Apple Bread

Ingredients:
- 2 c. flour
- 1 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 c. butter
- 1 c. sugar
- 2 eggs
- 2 1/2 to 3 c. chopped apples
- 1/2 c. chopped nuts
- 1 tsp. vanilla

Directions:
- Sift together first 3 ingredients. Cream together butter, sugar and eggs. Add apples, nuts and vanilla to creamed ingredients. Stir in flour mixture. Pour into greased loaf pan. Sprinkle with topping. Bake at 350° for 1 hour.

Chinese Chicken Wings

Ingredients:
- 1 c. vegetable oil (Crisco)
- 1/2 c. soy sauce
- 1 tsp. ground ginger
- 1 Tbsp. lemon juice
- 2 tsp. garlic powder
- 4 lb. chicken wings

Directions:
- Combine all ingredients except chicken wings in large roasting pan.
- Wash chicken wings and cut into two pieces.
- Add to sauce. Marinate in refrigerator, turning several times.
- Leave in refrigerator overnight.
- Turn again before baking.
- Bake at 350° for 30 minutes, then at 450° for 15 minutes.
- Place under broiler a few minutes until brown and crispy.

Old-Fashioned Lemon Pie

Ingredients:
- 3 tablespoons flour
- 1 cup sugar
- 1 lemon, juice and rind of
