- 2 tablespoons butter, melted
- 2 eggs, separated
- 1 12 cups milk
- 1 pie crust (either storebought or your own recipe)

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 450F.
- Mix flour, sugar, lemon juice and rind, butter, beaten egg yolks and milk.
- Beat egg whites and fold into mixture.
- Pour into pastry shell, place on bottom shelf of oven and bake for ten minutes.
- Reduce heat to 350F and move pie to middle shelf; bake for 40 minutes longer.

Milky Way Ice Cream

Ingredients:
- 5 Milky Way candy bars
- 5 eggs, beaten
- 1 pt. half and half
- 2 1/4 c. sugar
- 1/2 pt. whipping cream
- 1 large can Pet milk

Directions:
- Mix eggs and sugar.
- Add liquids.
- Stir in chopped Milky Ways. Pour into ice cream freezer.

Exquisite Carrot & Zucchini Muffins

Ingredients:
- 1 cup whole wheat flour
- 3/4 cup white flour
- 1 cup brown sugar
- 1 1/2 teaspoons baking soda
- 1 1/2 teaspoons cinnamon
- 3/4 teaspoon salt
- 1 egg
- 2/3 cup milk
- 1/2 cup oil
- 2 teaspoons vanilla
- 1 small zucchini, shredded
- 1 medium carrot, shredded
- 1 cup chopped nuts (optional)

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350°F.
- Spray muffin pan with non-stick spray.
- In a large bowl, mix the flours, brown sugar, baking soda and salt.
- In a medium bowl, beat egg; stir in milk, oil and vanilla.
- Add egg mixture and remaining ingredients to flour mixture; stir until just moistened.
- Spoon evenly into muffin pan.
- Bake for 35 - 40 minutes until golden.

Spiked Orange Smoothie

Ingredients:
- 8 ounces frozen orange juice concentrate
- 1 ounce fat-free sugar-free vanilla pudding mix (recommended ( Jell-o)
- 1 (4 ounce) orange flavored yogurt (recommended ( Yoplait Orange Creme)
- 1 cup low-fat milk
- 1 cup vanilla vodka
- 1/4 cup orange-flavored liqueur
- 2 cups ice cubes

Directions:
- Combine all ingredients in a blender. Blend until smooth. Divide among glasses.

Pork Chop Casserole

Ingredients:
- 6 medium chops
- 1 small box Minute rice
- 1 envelope onion soup mix
- 1 can cream of chicken soup
- 2 cans milk

Directions:
- Brown seasoned and floured chops.
- Place in a baking dish; cover with dry rice.
- Mix soup with milk; pour over rice, being sure rice is completely covered with liquid.
- Sprinkle lightly with salt and pepper.
- Cover with foil.
- Bake at 350° for 1 hour and 15 minutes.

Broiled Pineapple With Rum Sauce

Ingredients:
- For Pineapple
- 1/4 cup granulated sugar
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 6 slices fresh pineapple or 6 wedges fresh pineapple
- For Sauce
- 2 tablespoons unsalted butter
- 1/2 cup brown sugar
- 1/4 cup dark rum
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract

Directions:
- TO PREPARE PINEAPPLE:
- Preheat the broiler.
- In a bowl, combine the sugar and cinnamon.
- Arrange the pineapple on a broiler tray and sprinkle the top with half of the sugar-cinnamon mixture.
- Broil for 5 minutes, or until the pineapple is lightly browned.
- Turn the pineapple over, sprinkle with the remaining sugar-cinnamon mixture, and broil for 5 minutes longer, or until lightly browned.
- Place the broiled pineapple on dessert plates.
- 2.	TO PREPARE SAUCE: In a saute pan over medium heat, melt the butter and brown sugar, then cook for 3 minutes. Add the rum and vanilla. Spoon the sauce on the pineapple and serve.

Mama's Clam Dip

Ingredients:
- 2 (6 ounce) cans clams (minced or drained)
- 1 (16 ounce) carton sour cream
- 12 teaspoon garlic powder
- 1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce
- 12 tablespoon lemon juice
- 12 teaspoon Tabasco sauce
- salt
- pepper

Directions:
- Put clams and sour cream into a mixing bowl.
- Add garlic powder,worcestershire sauce,lemon juice and tobasco sauce.
- Salt and pepper to taste.
- Stir until all ingredients are blended well.

Biscoff Granola Balls

Ingredients:
- 1/3 cups Honey
- 1/3 cups Biscoff Spread
- 2 Tablespoons Unsalted Butter
- 1 cup Rice Krispies Cereal
- 1 cup Rolled Oats
- 1/4 cups White Chocolate Chip Morsels

Directions:
- In a medium saucepan over medium heat, combine honey, Biscoff spread and unsalted butter until creamy and smooth. Remove from heat and stir in Rice Krispies and rolled oats. Fold in white chocolate chips.
- Roll into golfball-sized balls and place on wax paper. Chill in refrigerator for 15 minutes until set.

Macaroni And Cheese

Ingredients:
- 1 cup dry macaroni
- 1 cup cottage cheese
- 1 cup dairy sour cream
- 1 cup Velveeta cheese, cubed
- 1 cup sharp Cheddar cheese, shredded
- 2 eggs, beaten

Directions:
- Cook macaroni and drain. Combine cottage cheese, sour cream, Velveeta cheese, Cheddar cheese and eggs in buttered 2 1/2 qt. casserole. Add cooked macaroni, fold in thoroughly. Bake at 350° for 45 minutes.

Plum Pudding Recipe

Ingredients:
- 3 Large eggs
- 1 c. sugar
- 1/2 c. butter or possibly lard
- 1 c. plums or possibly more
- 1 teaspoon soda
- 3 tbsp. sour lowfat milk
- 1 c. flour
- Cinnamon flavoring

Directions:
- Cook in double boiler till thick.
- This was my mother's recipe, it's over 75 years old.

No Sugar Apple Pie

Ingredients:
- 2 9-inch pastry shells
- 2 c. peeled and sliced ripe cooking apples
- 1/2 c. frozen apple juice concentrate
- 1-1/2 tsp. Minute Tapioca
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 1 Tbsp. margarine

Directions:
- Heat apple juice concentrate in saucepan. Add apple slices. Cover and simmer until tender (only takes a few minutes). Stir in tapioca. Add cinnamon. Simmer until mixture begins to thicken. Pour filling into unbaked pie shell. Dot with margarine. Cover with pastry top. Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.

Peanut Brittle

Ingredients:
- 1 c. sugar
- 1/2 c. water
- 1/4 c. white syrup
- 1/2 tsp. margarine
- 1/8 tsp. soda
- 1 c. peanuts

Directions:
- Line electric skillet with heavy foil and preheat to 375°. Mix first 4 ingredients and cook and stir occasionally until golden brown. Add soda and stir vigorously. Add peanuts and continue stirring until medium brown. Remove foil from skillet. When cool, remove candy from foil.

Berry Flag Toast

Ingredients:
- 1 slice Whole Grain Bread
- 1 teaspoon Coconut Butter (sub Coconut Oil Or Butter)
- 1/4 cups Whole Milk Ricotta Cheese
- 1/8 teaspoons Finely Grated Lemon Peel
- 1/2 teaspoons Lemon Juice
- 9 whole Blueberries
- 4 whole Medium-sized Strawberries, Thinly Sliced

Directions:
- Spread coconut butter on bread and lightly toast in a toaster oven for 2 to 3 minutes or until golden brown.
- Mix together ricotta cheese, grated lemon peel and lemon juice. Spread ricotta mixture on toast.
- Decorate toast with berries. For the stars, arrange blueberries in 3 rows of three in the upper left corner. For the stripes, starting at the top of the toast arrange strawberry slices in three rows, slightly overlapping each slice. For the last row, cut strawberries slices in half lengthwise and arrange against the bottom edge of toast.

Marinated Carrots

Ingredients:
- 1 large pkg. carrots
- 1 small onion
- 1 medium bell pepper
- 3/4 c. salad oil
- 1 can tomato soup
- 3/4 c. white vinegar
- 1 Tbsp. mustard
- 1 tsp. black pepper
- 1 tsp. Worcestershire sauce
- 1 tsp. salt
- 3/4 c. sugar

Directions:
- Scrape and slice carrots (medium size slices, not too thin). Boil carrots until tender; drain.
- Slice onion into thin slices; cut bell pepper into strips.
- Mix onion, pepper and all other ingredients (except carrots) together.
- Pour this mixture into pot with drained carrots; bring to a boil.
- Cool a little and refrigerate.

Easy Sloppy Joes

Ingredients:
- 3 pounds ground beef
- 3 cups ketchup
- 2/3 cup sweet pickle relish
- 1 envelope onion soup mix
- 14 hamburger buns, split

Directions:
- In a Dutch oven, cook beef over medium heat until no longer pink; drain. Stir in the ketchup, relish and soup mix; heat through. Serve immediately on buns, or cool mixture before placing in a freezer container. Cover and freeze for up to 3 months.
- To use frozen sloppy joes: Thaw beef mixture in the refrigerator; place in a saucepan and heat through. Serve on buns.

Squash Cornbread

Ingredients:
- 2 large summer squash
- 4 eggs
- 1 (12 oz.) pkg. cottage cheese
- 1 box Jiffy cornbread mix
- 1 stick margarine

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients together and bake in a greased 9 x 13-inch pan at 350° for 20 to 25 minutes.
- Cut into squares.

Down and Dirty

Ingredients:
- tall glass
- ice
- 2 shots peach schnapps
- 2 shots cola
- orange juice

Directions:
- Put ice in glass.
- Add schnapps.
- Add cola.
- Top with orange juice.
- Stir, do not shake.
- Enjoy!

Queso Blanco Dip 

Ingredients:
- 1.25 lb block White American Cheese*, cut into 1-inch cubes
- 1 (4 oz) can diced green chilis
- 2 jalapenos, chopped
- 2/3 cup half and half (fat free is fine)
- 1/2 cup cold water

Directions:
- Toss all ingredients into a microwavable-safe bowl. Microwave on high for 5 minutes, stopping to stir after every minute. It might appear runny at first, but it will thicken up as it starts to cool down.
- 
- Serve immediately with tortilla chips.
- 
- Serves 10.

Cooked Dressing

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 Tbsp. butter, melted
- 1 1/2 Tbsp. flour
- 1 1/2 Tbsp. sugar
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. mustard
- few grains cayenne
- 3/4 c. milk
- 1/4 c. vinegar
- 2 egg yolks

Directions:
- Mix dry ingredients.
- Add egg yolks (slightly beaten), melted butter and milk.
- Very slowly, add the vinegar.
- Cook in top of double boiler until mixture thickens.
- Cool.
- Straining the dressing makes it fine grained.

red wine braised short ribs

Ingredients:
- 12 short ribs (about 3 1/2 lbs)
- 1 tbsp olive oil
- 1 salt and pepper
- 1 onion (diced)
- 3 clove garlic (minced)
- 2 tsp thyme leaves
- 3 tbsp flour
- 1 1/2 cup red wine
- 1 1/2 cup chicken broth
- 1 can petite diced tomatoes (14.5 oz)

Directions:
- adjust oven rack to lower middle position and preheat oven to 450
- coat ribs in oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper
- heat Dutch oven pot on medium-high heat
- cook ribs, turning only once, till browned on both sides.
- about 5-6 min
- drain all but 1 TB fat from pan and saute onions about 5 min
- add garlic and thyme, saute about 1 min
- stir in flour, then wine, followed by chicken broth and tomatoes
- return ribs to pot and bring to a simmer
- place foil over pot and cover with a lid.
- place pot in oven for about 1 1/2 hrs

Sweet Potato Pie

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 c. mashed, cooked or canned sweet potatoes
- 2 Tbsp. melted butter or margarine
- 1 tsp. powdered cinnamon
- 1/2 tsp. powdered allspice
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 3 Tbsp. brown sugar
- 1/2 c. honey (optional)
- 2 eggs, slightly beaten
- 1 c. cream or evaporated milk
- 1 (9-inch) pie pan

Directions:
- Set oven at 450°.
- Mix potatoes with the butter or magarine, cinnamon, allspice, salt, sugar and honey.
- Beat until foamy.
- Add eggs and cream or evaporated milk.
- Pour into the lined pie pan. Bake 12 minutes at 450°.
- Reduce heat to moderate, 350°, bake 20 to 30 minutes longer.

8-Layer Casserole

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. ground turkey or beef
- 15 oz. plus small can tomato sauce
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1/4 tsp. garlic powder
- 1 pkg. frozen chopped spinach
- 8 oz. medium egg noodles
- 4 oz. sour cream
- 8 oz. cream cheese
- 1/4 c. milk
- 1/4 c. Cheddar cheese, grated

Directions:
- One-half hour preparation, 15 minutes cooking.

Asparagus Casserole

Ingredients:
- 1 can spears or cut asparagus
- 1 can cream of chicken soup
- 1 c. grated cheese
- 1 stack saltine crackers

Directions:
- Drain asparagus; mix juice with soup. Layer crackers, asparagus and cheese. Pour soup mixture over top. Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.

Centennial Squares

Ingredients:
- 1 box graham wafer crumbs
- 1/4 c. butter
- 1/4 c. sugar
- 1 large pkg. chocolate chips
- 1 large pkg. butterscotch chips
- 1 large can Eagle Brand milk
- 1 c. chopped nuts
- 1 c. coconut

Directions:
- Mix graham wafer crumbs with butter and sugar to make crust. Spread on cookie sheet or shallow cake pan.
- Put layer of chocolate chips first, then butterscotch chips, coconut and nuts. Top with Eagle Brand evenly.
- Bake at 350° for 10 to 15 minutes or until lightly browned.
- Cool and cut into slices or squares.

Flaky Biscuits 

Ingredients:
- 2 C. Sifted Flour
- 1/2 tsp. Salt
- 1/2 tsp. Cream of Tartar
- 4 tsp. Baking Powder
- 2 tsp. Sugar
- 1/2 C. Butter
- 2/3 C. Milk

Directions:
- Mix together flour, salt, cream of tartar, baking powder and sugar. Cut in butter and add milk. Knead 8 to 10 times. Roll out to desired thickness. Cut in squares or biscuit rounds. Place on greased pan.
- 
- Bake 12 min at 425 degrees.

Northern-Style Dumplings

Ingredients:
- 1 c. flour
- 1 1/2 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 2 Tbsp. shortening
- 1/2 c. milk
- 1 egg beaten

Directions:
- Combine flour, salt and baking powder.
- Cut in shortening until mixture is crumbly.
- Pour in milk and add egg.
- Mix only until flour is dampened.
- Don't worry about lumps.
- Drop by spoonfuls on top of boiling meat or fruit.
- Cover tightly and steam for 12 minutes without raising cover.

Bourbon Cider Twist

Ingredients:
- 3 cups apple cider
- 8 ounces (1 cup) bourbon
- 1/4 cup fresh lime juice
- Lime wedges, for garnish
- Ice, as needed

Directions:
- Add the apple cider, bourbon, and the lime juice to a pitcher and stir.
- Pour over ice.
- Serve with a lime wedge.

Strawberry Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 pkg. white cake
- 1 small pkg. strawberry jello
- 4 eggs
- 3/4 c. water
- 3/4 c. oil
- 1 pkg. frozen strawberries
- 3/4 box powdered sugar

Directions:
- Mix first five ingredients well.
- Beat at least 2 minutes. Bake 35 to 40 minutes (glass) in a 325° oven or 40 to 50 minutes in a metal pan.

Chocolate Chip Pie

Ingredients:
- 1 c. sugar
- 1/2 c. flour
- 2 eggs, slightly beaten
- 1 stick margarine, melted
- 1 c. chopped pecans
- 1 (6 oz.) pkg. chocolate chips
- 1 tsp. vanilla

Directions:
- Mix sugar and flour; add remaining ingredients.
- Pour in unbaked 9-inch deep dish pie shell.
- Bake at 325° until firm.

Simple Fruit Salad

Ingredients:
- 3 apples
- 5 kiwis
- 3 oranges
- 2 oranges juice
- 1 tablespoon honey
- ground cinnamon to taste
- 1 cinnamon stick

Directions:
- Peel all the fruits, and slice in small pieces. Put in a bowl. Sprinkle with orange juice.
- Pour in the honey, sprinkle with ground cinnamon, and add cinnamon stick.
- Refrigerate.
- Serve cold. Before serving, mix well.

Strawberry Pie

Ingredients:
- 1 deep pie crust, baked
- 1 pt. sliced strawberries
- 1 c. water
- 1 c. sugar
- 3 Tbsp. cornstarch
- 1 small strawberry jello
- 1 small cool whip

Directions:
- Mix water, sugar, and cornstarch in saucepan, and cook until clear and thick.
- Then take off stove.
- Mix in jello with mixture, then pour over sliced strawberries in crust.
- Chill and cover with cool whip.

Baked Pork Chops And Apple Casserole Recipe

Ingredients:
- 6 x pork chops, about 1 inch thick
- 1 sm onion, coursely minced
- 1 tsp salt
- 1/8 tsp pepper
- 2 Tbsp. butter or possibly margerine
- 3 x apples, peeled, sliced, cored
- 1 c. water
- 3 Tbsp. brown sugar (maple syrup may be substituted about 1/3 c.)
- 1/2 tsp mustard

Directions:
- Saute/fry the onion in the butter/margerine till the onions are soft and semi transluent.
- Remove and save them for later.
- Brown the chops in the butter/magerine mix; season w/ the salt and pepper.
- Put the chops in a baking pan and add in the apples and add in the water.
- Then add in the brown sugar or possibly maple syrup, dry mustard, and the onions.
- Gently swirl the last ingredients thru-out the water.
- Cover w/ tin foil and bake for 1 hour; then remove the cover and brown for 15 more mins.

Breast Of Chicken Magnifique

Ingredients:
- 4 whole chicken breasts, split
- 2 Tbsp. shortening
- 2 cans condensed cream of chicken soup
- 2 c. sliced fresh mushrooms
- 1 large garlic clove, minced
- 1/8 tsp. crushed rosemary
- cooked long grain and wild rice, mixed
- thyme

Directions:
- Use large skillet.
- Brown chicken in shortening.
- Pour off fat.
- Stir in soup, mushrooms, garlic and seasonings.
- Cover and cook over low heat 30 minutes or until tender.
- Stir occasionally. Serve over rice.

Onion Pocket Bread

Ingredients:
- 1 1/3 c. warm water
- 1 Tbsp. salad oil
- 3 to 4 c. all-purpose flour
- 1 Tbsp. onion soup mix
- 1 pkg. active dry yeast
- 1 tsp. vegi salt
- cornmeal

Directions:
- Assemble doughmaker with small bowl.
- Heat water to 120°.
- In small bowl, place 1 1/2 cups flour, yeast, salt and sugar.
- Add water and oil; mix with doughmaker at setting #12 for 3 minutes. Gradually add enough remaining flour to form a stiff dough.
- Knead with doughmaker about 4 minutes until smooth and satiny.
- Place dough in a greased bowl, turning once to grease top.
- Cover and let rise in a warm place until doubled in bulk, about 1 hour.

Turkey Chili

Ingredients:
- Cooking spray
- 2 pounds ground turkey
- 2 (15-ounce) cans kidney beans, undrained
- 2 (14 1/2-ounce) cans no-salt-added whole tomatoes, undrained and chopped
- 2 (8-ounce) cans no-salt-added tomato sauce
- 1/2 cup chopped onion (about 1 small)
- 1/4 cup dry red wine
- 2 tablespoons chili powder
- 1 teaspoon dried parsley flakes
- 3/4 teaspoon dried basil
- 3/4 teaspoon dried oregano
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon black pepper
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 1/2 teaspoon ground red pepper
- 2 garlic cloves, minced
- 1 bay leaf
- Shredded reduced-fat Cheddar cheese (optional)

Directions:
- Coat a Dutch oven with cooking spray; place over medium heat until hot. Add turkey, and cook until browned, stirring until it crumbles.
- Add beans and next 14 ingredients; bring to a boil. Cover, reduce heat, and simmer 2 hours, stirring occasionally. Discard bay leaf. Top with cheese, if desired (cheese not included in analysis).

Cocktail Sauce

Ingredients:
- 3/4 cup catsup
- 1/4 cup chili sauce
- 1/4 cup horseradish
- 1/2 teaspoon hot sauce
- 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce
- 2 tablespoons lemon juice
- 1/16 teaspoon white pepper
- 1/16 teaspoon celery salt

Directions:
- Combine all ingredients and chill.

Orange Milkshake

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 cups orange juice
- 2 scoops vanilla ice cream
- 1/2 cup milk
- 2 teaspoons white sugar

Directions:
- Combine orange juice, ice cream, milk, and sugar in a blender; blend until smooth. Pour milkshake into a glass.

Egg Custard

Ingredients:
- 1 c. canned evaporated milk
- 3/4 c. whole milk
- 2 Tbsp. margarine
- 1 1/2 tsp. vanilla
- 3 eggs
- 5 Tbsp. flour (self-rising)
- 1 1/2 c. sugar
- dash of nutmeg

Directions:
- Mix all the ingredients in blender together.
- Pour into well-greased pie dish.
- Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.

Chicken (Pollo) Famiglia

Ingredients:
- 2 slices bacon, chopped
- 1 onion, chopped
- 1 carrot, chopped
- 1 stalk celery, chopped
- 3 tablespoons oil
- 8 chicken drumsticks
- 2 cups water
- 2 chicken stock cubes
- 240 g tomato paste
- 2 -3 fresh rosemary sprigs or 2 teaspoons dried rosemary
- 2 cups frozen broad beans
- salt & pepper

Directions:
- Heat 1 tblsp of the oil and saute the bacon & chopped vegetables for approx 5 mins, spoon into a large pot.
- Add the remaining oil to the pan & lightly brown the drumsticks, then add these to the pot, stir in remaining ingredients.
- Bring to the Boil, cover & simmer for 1 hour.

Spinach Balls

Ingredients:
- 2 (10 oz.) boxes frozen spinach
- 2 c. Pepperidge Farm herb stuffing (Stove Top stuffing is okay)
- 1 large onion, minced
- 4 eggs
- 1/2 c. Parmesan cheese
- 3/4 c. melted margarine

Directions:
- Cook spinach, then drain all water out.
- Mix all ingredients well.
- Roll into balls 1 inch in diameter.
- Bake at 300° for 15 or 20 minutes.
- Freeze or refrigerate for 1 or 2 days.
- Heat in microwave to warm.
- Yields 60 to 70 balls.

Orange Chicken And Stuffing

Ingredients:
- 6 boneless, skinless chicken breast halves
- 3 Tbsp. margarine
- salt and pepper
- 1 large onion, sliced
- 1 c. orange juice
- 2/3 c. water
- 1 (6 oz.) pkg. Stove Top chicken flavor stuffing mix

Directions:
- Brown chicken in margarine in large skillet over medium-high heat.
- Move chicken to side of skillet.
- Sprinkle with salt and pepper.
- Top each piece with orange slice.

Debbie Claire'S Cheesy Crock Pot Macaroni And Cheese

Ingredients:
- 1 lb macaroni noodles
- 1/4 cup butter
- 1 (10 1/2 ounce) can cheddar cheese soup
- 1 (5 ounce) can evaporated milk
- 1 tablespoon salt
- 2 eggs
- 8 -12 ounces sharp cheddar cheese

Directions:
- Cook noodles, drain.
- Add butter, salt, cheese soup, evaporated milk, and eggs.
- Mix well.
- Grate cheese.
- Save 3/4 cup and add the rest to the macaroni mixture.
- Mix well and pour into the crock pot.
- Put 3/4 cheese on top.
- Cover and cook on low for 2-2 1/2 hours.

Parmesan Chicken Tetrazzini

Ingredients:
- 8 ounces uncooked egg noodles
- 1/2 pound fresh mushrooms, sliced
- 1 small onion, chopped
- 1/4 cup butter, cubed
- 2 cups chicken broth
- 3 tablespoons cornstarch
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- Dash pepper
- 1 cup half-and-half cream
- 1/2 cup shredded mozzarella cheese
- 2 cups cubed cooked chicken
- 1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese

Directions:
- Cook noodles according to package directions; drain. In a large saucepan, saute mushrooms and onion in butter until tender. Stir in broth.
- Combine the cornstarch, salt, pepper and cream until smooth. Stir into the mushroom mixture. Bring to a boil; cook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened. Reduce heat; stir in mozzarella cheese until melted. Stir in chicken and noodles.
- Transfer to a greased 2-qt. baking dish. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 25-30 minutes or until lightly browned.

Curried Chicken Or Turkey Casserole

Ingredients:
- 1 small onion, finely chopped
- 2 tsp. curry powder
- 2 Tbsp. flour
- 1/2 c. mayonnaise
- 1/2 c. bread crumbs
- 2 Tbsp. margarine
- 2 1/2 c. broth or bouillon
- 2 c. chicken or turkey, diced
- 2 c. cooked rice
- 10 oz. pkg. frozen French style green beans, cooked
- 7 1/2 oz. can water chestnuts, sliced thin

Directions:
- Make sauce of the flour, mayonnaise, broth, onion and curry powder.
- Cook on low heat about 10 minutes.
- It should be slightly thickened.
- Layer other ingredients in this order:
- rice, turkey, beans and chestnuts.
- Pour the sauce over all.
- Sprinkle with bread crumbs and dot with margarine.
- Bake in 350° oven for about 30 minutes.

Banana Pudding

Ingredients:
- 3 c. cold milk
- 2 small pkg. instant vanilla pudding
- 1 can Eagle Brand milk
- 8 oz. carton frozen whipped topping
- 1/4 c. lemon juice
- 16 oz. pkg. vanilla wafers
- 8 to 9 bananas

Directions:
- Mix pudding mix with milk until smooth and thickened.
- Stir in Eagle Brand milk and whipped topping.
- Add lemon juice.
- Layer bananas with vanilla wafers in large bowl.
- Pour pudding mixture over all.
- Chill before serving.

Coastal Fried Chicken With Brown Crumb Gravy

Ingredients:
- 1 (3- to 3 1/2-pound) broiler-fryer, cut up
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon pepper
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- Vegetable oil
- Hot cooked rice

Directions:
- Sprinkle chicken with salt and pepper; dredge in flour.
- Heat 2 inches of oil in a large skillet to 350°; add chicken. Cover and fry 30 minutes or until golden brown, turning once. Reserve 2 tablespoons drippings in skillet for gravy. Drain chicken on paper towels. Serve with rice and Brown Crumb Gravy.

Sweet And Sour Beef

Ingredients:
- 1/2 to 1 lb. beef stew meat or hamburger
- salt and pepper to taste
- soy sauce
- 1 bag frozen Chinese veggies
- 3 to 4 heaping Tbsp. apricot jelly
- 1 to 2 Tbsp. cornstarch (in cold water)

Directions:
- In 10-inch skillet, brown meat, adding salt, pepper and soy sauce to taste. Drain excess grease. Add frozen veggies and as much water as the veggie bag recommends. Simmer with lid on. When veggies are nearly done, add jelly and cornstarch mixed in cold water. Stir regularly until sauce starts to gel. Serve over noodles or rice.

Baked Mango Chutney Brie Recipe

Ingredients:
- 1 x round (4 inches) Brie or possibly Camembert cheese
- 1/2 pkt (397 g pkg) frzn puff pastry, thawed
- 1/3 c. mango chutney
- 1 x egg, lightly beaten

Directions:
- Cut Brie in half horizontally into 2 rounds; set aside.
- On lightly floured surface, roll out pastry to 1/8-inch thickness; cut into 12-inch rounds.
- Place 1 of the cheese rounds in centre.
- Spread chutney over cheese; top with remaining cheese round.
- Fold pastry up over cheese, overlapping edge and sealing with some of the egg; brush top with remaining egg.
- (Make-ahead: Cover and chill for up to 4 hrs.)
- Place on rimmed baking sheet; bake in 400 F oven till golden brown and puffed, 25 to 30 min.
- Let stand for 20 min.
- To serve, cut into wedges with serrated knife.

Character Bento : 2 Octopus with 1 Sausage

Ingredients:
- 1 Vienna sausages (skinless)
- 4 seeds Black sesame seeds

Directions:
- Get a straw (6 mm or about average size), a pair of tweezers, and a toothpick ready.
- Cut the sausage diagonally.
- Poke a straw through and make the "mouth".
- Poke a toothpick and make a small hole where you want the eyes to be and use tweezers to insert a sesame seed into the hole for each eye.
- Prepare the feet.
- The center are the longest and the next are shorter.
- It takes 5 cuts in all.
- Cook.
- Roll over on each side and the feet will spread out.
- All done.
- I made 4 octopodes from 2 sausages.
- And with 11 sausages...

Asparagus Roll Appetizers

Ingredients:
- 12 slices fresh white bread
- 1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese
- 1 tablespoon crumbled wisconsin blue cheese
- 4 tablespoons sour cream
- 1/4 teaspoon dill weed
- 1/4 teaspoon white pepper
- 2 (10 ounce) cans asparagus spears, drained
- 3 tablespoons melted butter

Directions:
- Remove crusts from bread and flatten slices very thin with a rolling pin.
- With an electric mixer, blend cheeses, sour cream and seasonings together and spread on one side of bread slices.
- Place an asparagus spear on each bread slice and roll up jelly roll style.
- Brush each roll-up with melted butter.
- Cut roll-ups into bite-sized pieces (3 to 4 per roll up).
- Place seam side down on a cookie sheet and bake 5 to 10 minutes at 450 degrees until pieces are lightly browned.

Chicken Casserole

Ingredients:
- 1 chicken, cooked and deboned
- 2 cans cream of chicken soup
- 2 Tbsp. mayo
- 2 Tbsp. lemon juice
- 1 small onion
- Ritz crackers
- butter

Directions:
- Mix ingredients together.
- Crumble crackers over ingredients. Pour butter over crackers.
- Bake at 350° for 40 minutes.

Sugar Cookies

Ingredients:
- 1 c. Crisco
- 1 c. sugar
- 2 eggs
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 2 c. self-rising flour

Directions:
- Cream Crisco and sugar.
- Add eggs and vanilla.
- Mix.
- Add flour.
- Mix well.
- Drop on greased cookie sheet.
- Press down with fork dipped in water.
- Bake at 325° or 350° until brown.

Melon And Raspberry Compote

Ingredients:
- 3 cups cubed, peeled cantaloupe
- 1 1/2 cups fresh raspberries
- 1/2 cup apple juice
- 3 tablespoons lime juice
- 3 tablespoons honey
- lime slice (optional)

Directions:
- Combine first 5 ingredients in a medium bowl, toss gently.
- Cover and chill.
- Garnish with lime slices, if desired.

Linda Golden'S Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 head broccoli (florets only)
- 5 strips bacon, cooked crisp and crumbled
- 1 small onion, sliced in rings
- 1/2 c. raisins
- 1 c. mayonnaise
- 1/4 c. sugar
- 2 tsp. red wine vinegar
- 1/4 c. raisins

Directions:
- Mix first 4 ingredients and refrigerate overnight or at least 2 hours.

Strawberry-Avocado Salsa

Ingredients:
- 1 cup finely chopped strawberries
- 1/4 cup finely chopped peeled avocado
- 2 tablespoons finely chopped red onion
- 2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro
- 1/2 teaspoon grated lime rind
- 2 tablespoons fresh lime juice
- 2 teaspoons finely chopped seeded jalapeno pepper
- 1/4 teaspoon sugar

Directions:
- Combine all ingredients in a medium bowl; toss gently. Serve immediately.

Banana Split Smoothies

Ingredients:
- 2 medium ripe bananas
- 1 can (8 ounces) crushed pineapple, drained
- 1-1/2 cups milk
- 1/2 cup fresh or frozen unsweetened sliced strawberries
- 2 tablespoons honey
- 5 ice cubes
- Whipped topping, chocolate syrup and maraschino cherries

Directions:
- In a blender, combine the first five ingredients; cover and process until smooth. Gradually add ice, blending until slushy. Pour into chilled glasses. Garnish with whipped topping, chocolate syrup and cherries. Serve immediately.

Smoked Shrimp 

Ingredients:
- shrimp, size 26/30 or larger
- olive oil
- chili powder
- paprika
- ground bay
- ground thyme
- Tony Chacere's cajun seasoning
- garlic powder
- onion powder

Directions:
- Make a paste with the seasonings and toss the shrimp with it.
- 
- Smoke at around 250 degrees for 20 minutes or so.

Manhattan Potatoes

Ingredients:
- 8 c. cooked potatoes, diced
- 1/2 c. green pepper, chopped
- 1 small jar pimentos, chopped
- 2 medium onions, chopped
- 1 c. mild Cheddar cheese, shredded
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1/2 c. milk
- 1 can cream of celery soup

Directions:
- Mix
- potatoes, green pepper, pimentos, onions, salt and pepper and place
- in
- a greased 9 x 13-inch pan.
- Mix milk and soup together
- and pour over potato mixture.
- Top with cheese. Bake in a 350° oven for 30 minutes or until bubbly.

Mexican Stack-Ups

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 1/2 c. chopped onion
- 1 can condensed Cheddar cheese soup
- 1 soup can water
- 1 can condensed chili beef soup
- shredded Cheddar or Longhorn cheese
- 1/4 envelope enchilada sauce mix
- 1 pkg. frozen tortillas

Directions:
- Brown ground beef.
- Spoon off fat.
- Add onion, soups, enchilada sauce mix and water; heat to boiling.
- Reduce heat and simmer 5 minutes.
- Cut tortillas in half and line bottom of a 13 x 9-inch pan with them, then add 1/3 of meat mixture.
- Layer more tortillas and meat mixture, ending with meat on top.
- Bake at 350° for 15 minutes.
- Add cheese and heat until melted.

Great, Great Grandma Gillard'S Sour Cream Drop Cookies

Ingredients:
- 2 c. sugar
- 1 c. butter, melted
- 2 3/4 c. flour
- 1 (8 oz.) pkg. sour cream
- 1/2 tsp. baking soda
- 2 tsp. vanilla
- 2 eggs
- 1/2 tsp. salt

Directions:
- Mix ingredients together.
- Batter will be very stiff.
- Put in refrigerator to chill.
- Grease cookie sheet. Spoon batter onto cookie sheet.
- Bake at 400° about 10 minutes until light golden brown.
- Press top of cookie.
- It is done if no fingerprints appear.

Cola Chicken

Ingredients:
- 4 Skinless, Boneless Chicken Breasts
- 1 cup Ketchup
- 12 ounces, fluid Diet Coke

Directions:
- Put chicken in a non-stick skillet.
- Pour the ketchup and Diet Coke over the chicken.
- Bring to a boil over medium heat.
- Cover the skillet, reduce heat to a simmer and cook for 45 minutes.
- Preheat oven to 200 F.
- Uncover it the pan, remove the chicken and put it in an oven safe dish.
- Put chicken in a 200 F oven to keep warm.
- Turn up the heat on the sauce and continue to cook until the sauce becomes thick.
- Once its thickened your are readythis turns into the best BBQ sauce.
- Pour over the warmed chicken and serve.

Sausage-Cornbread Dressing

Ingredients:
- 2 cups cold water
- 6 cups cornbread crumbs
- 6 slices bread, cut into 1-inch cubes
- 1/4 cup water
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon pepper
- 1/2 cup butter or margarine
- 1/2 pound bulk pork sausage
- 2 cups chopped celery
- 1 medium onion, finely chopped

Directions:
- Place reserved giblets in saucepan with water; cover, and simmer 1 to 2 hours or until giblets are tender. Remove from broth, reserving 1 cup broth. Chop giblets; set aside.
- Combine cornbread and bread cubes in a large mixing bowl; add water, salt, and pepper. Set aside.
- Melt butter in a large skillet; add sausage, celery, and onion. Saute 3 minutes. Cover, and cook an additional 30 minutes or until sausage is browned and vegetables are tender; stir frequently. Remove from heat; stir into bread mixture. Add reserved giblet broth and giblets, mixing well.

Fr. Fischer'S Venison Stew

Ingredients:
- 2 1/2 lb. venison
- 1/2 c. flour
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1/3 c. oil
- 6 to 8 bouillon cubes
- 3 chopped onions
- 2 stalks celery
- 1 can stewed tomatoes
- 1 large bay leaf
- 3 1/2 c. water
- 4 to 5 potatoes, cut in bite size pieces
- 4 to 5 carrots, sliced
- 2 Tbsp. cornstarch

Directions:
- In a bowl, coat the meat with flour.
- In large pot, brown meat in oil.
- Add salt, pepper, onions, celery, bay leaf, stewed tomatoes and water.
- Simmer until meat is tender, about 1 1/2 to 2 hours.
- Take bay leaf out.
- Add potatoes and carrots; cover and cook until all vegetables are tender, about 25 minutes.
- Mix the cornstarch with 1/4 cup water; stir into stew and heat until it thickens, stirring constantly.

Chocolate-Peanut Butter Dream Cups

Ingredients:
- 8 chocolate wafer cookies, divided
- 2 Tbsp. creamy peanut butter
- 2 cups cold milk
- 1 pkg. (3.9 oz.) JELL-O Chocolate Flavor Instant Pudding

Directions:
- Place 1 wafer in each of 4 small dessert dishes.
- Chop remaining wafers.
- Place peanut butter in medium bowl.
- Gradually whisk in milk until blended.
- Add dry pudding mix; beat 2 min.
- Spoon over wafers in dessert dishes.
- Top with chopped wafers.

Kristine'S Famous Pesto And Cheese Bread 

Ingredients:
- 1/2 cup mayonnaise
- 1/2 cup freshly grated romano or parmesan cheese
- 2 teaspoons prepared pesto sauce
- 1/2 1 pound french bread loaf

Directions:
- Combine first 3 ingredients in small bowl. (can be prepared 1 day ahead, cover tightly and refrigerate)
- Preheat broiler. Halve bread lengthwise. Broil cut side up until beginning to brown. Spread each half generously with mayonnaise mixture. Broil until bubbling and beginning to brown, watching carefully. Cut crosswise into 1 1/2 inch pieces and serve.

Lasagne

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. hamburger
- 1 clove garlic, minced
- 1 Tbsp. dried basil
- 1 1/2 tsp. salt
- 2 eggs
- 3 c. Ricotta or cream-style cottage cheese
- 1/2 tsp. pepper
- 1 (16 oz.) can tomatoes
- 1/2 c. grated Parmesan cheese
- 2 Tbsp. parsley flakes
- 1 lb. shredded Mozzarella cheese
- 2 (6 oz.) cans tomato paste
- 10 oz. lasagna noodles

Directions:
- Brown meat slowly.
- Spoon off excess fat.
- Add garlic, basil, salt, tomatoes and tomato paste.
- Simmer uncovered 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
- Cook noodles in large amount of boiling water until tender.
- Drain.
- Rinse.
- Beat eggs; add remaining ingredients except Mozzarella.
- Layer half the noodles in a 9 x 13-inch baking dish.
- Spread with the Ricotta filling.
- Add half the Mozzarella cheese, then half the meat sauce.
- Repeat layers. Bake at 375° for 30 minutes.

Chicken Adobo

Ingredients:
- chicken (you may use a whole chicken or cut up or whatever pieces you prefer)
- 3/4 c. white vinegar
- 1/4 c. soy sauce
- 2 bay leaves
- 1 c. water
- garlic (optional)
- oregano (optional)
- black pepper to taste

Directions:
- If you like, remove skin from chicken.
- Rub pepper into chicken.
- Place in a non-aluminum pot.
- Mix vinegar and soy sauce together and pour over chicken.
- Mix a second batch of vinegar and soy sauce and pour over chicken.
- Pour the water over the chicken. (If the chicken is not covered, add just enough water to cover.) Add bay leaves and other spices, if desired.
- Bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer until tender.
- Serve with rice.

Fudge Squares Brownies

Ingredients:
- 1 c. butter or 2 sticks oleo
- 2 c. sugar
- 4 eggs or 1 c. Egg Beaters
- 1/2 c. cocoa
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1/2 c. Milnot
- 1 c. flour
- 2 c. chopped nuts

Directions:
- Mix and bake for 30 minutes in a moderate oven at 350°.
- When cool, they can be iced.

Spelt Bread Ii

Ingredients:
- 1 1/4 cups rice milk
- 2 tablespoons white sugar
- 2 tablespoons canola oil
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 4 cups spelt flour
- 2 1/2 teaspoons bread machine yeast

Directions:
- Place ingredients in the pan of the bread machine in the order recommended by the manufacturer. Select cycle; press Start.

Bbq Sauce For Fish Recipe

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. Catsup
- 1/4 c. Vinegar
- 1 tsp Minced dry onion
- 1 Tbsp. Worchestershire sauce
- 2 Tbsp. Lemon juice
- 2 Tbsp. Brown sugar
- 1/4 tsp Garlic pwdr
- 1/4 tsp Seasoned salt Pepper to taste

Directions:
- Combine all ingredients, cook till it simmers and put on fish.

Corn Meal Apricot Nut Cookies

Ingredients:
- 1 cup butter
- 1 12 cups sugar
- 2 eggs
- 1 teaspoon lemon extract
- 1 cup chopped dried apricot
- 12 cup finely-chopped walnuts or 12 cup pecans
- 3 cups cake flour, separated
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 1 teaspoon nutmeg
- 12 teaspoon salt
- 1 cup yellow cornmeal

Directions:
- Cream butter; add sugar, eggs and lemon extract.
- Beat well.
- Dredge apricots with 1/2 cup of the flour and add.
- Sift remaining flour with other dry ingredients and add; mix well.
- Add nuts if desired.
- Drop by teaspoonfuls onto greased (or use parchment paper) cookie sheet; flatten with a fork.
- Bake 10 to 12 minutes at 400F.

Meat Loaf

Ingredients:
- 2 lb. ground beef
- 1 1/2 c. milk
- 2/3 c. rolled oats, uncooked
- 1/2 c. finely chopped onions
- 2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 tsp. pepper
- 1/2 c. catsup

Directions:
- Mix well ground beef, milk, oats, onions, salt and pepper. With hand, shape into loaf in shallow ungreased baking pan (11 1/2 x 7 x 1 1/2-inches).
- Spread catsup over top. Bake uncovered at 350° for 1 hour or until brown.
- Let stand 10 minutes before serving.

Sally'S Christmas Shortbread

Ingredients:
- 1 cup unsalted butter, softened
- 1 cup dark brown sugar
- 1 1/2 tablespoons orange zest
- 2 tablespoons ground ginger
- 3/4 teaspoon ground cloves
- 1 teaspoon baking soda
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- confectioners' sugar

Directions:
- Beat butter, brown sugar, orange zest, ginger and cloves until fluffy.
- Stir in baking soda and flour.
- Divide dough in half.
- Press into (2) 8" round ungreased baking pans.
- Bake in a 350 degree fahrenheit oven for 25 minutes or until the tops are dry and cracked, and the edges are slightly higher than the center.
- Cool in the pans for 5 minutes.
- Cut into wedges.
- Prick each wedge with the tines of a fork.
- Cool and dust with confectioner's sugar.
- Store tightly covered.

12 Layer Ribbon Jello

Ingredients:
- 1 box each 3 oz. jello (cherry-orange)
- 2 boxes each lemon, lime and black raspberry

Directions:
- Take cherry jello
- and	dissolve
- with	1
- cup	boiling water. Separate into 2
- different
- bowls	1/2
- cup
- each.
- To first, add 1/2 cup sour cream and whip.
- Pour on bottom of 9 x 13-inch pan and let set
- up in refrigerator.
- To the remaining 1/2 cup of jello, add 3
- teaspoons of cold water.
- Pour on top of set up jello.
- Allow this	to set up.
- Repeat this with all kinds of jello in
- colors
- as follows:
- cherry, orange, lemon, lime, lemon and blue food
- coloring,
- added
- to
- make
- a
- blue color, then black raspberry.
- Top
- with Cool Whip and sprinkle with chocolate or multi-colored sprinkles.

"Fried" Chicken With Cucumber And Fennel Raita

Ingredients:
- 1 cup plain fat-free yogurt
- 1/2 cup (1/2-inch) diced cucumber
- 1/2 cup (1/2-inch) diced fennel bulb
- 1 teaspoon finely chopped fresh mint
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon coarsely ground black pepper
- 4 (6-ounce) skinless, boneless chicken breast halves
- 1/8 teaspoon salt
- Cooking spray
- 1/3 cup Italian-seasoned breadcrumbs
- 1 tablespoon olive oil

Directions:
- Combine first 6 ingredients in a medium bowl. Cover and chill.
- Place each chicken breast half between 2 sheets of heavy-duty plastic wrap; pound to 1/4-inch thickness using a meat mallet or rolling pin. Sprinkle chicken with 1/8 teaspoon salt; lightly coat both sides of chicken breast halves with cooking spray. Dredge in Italian-seasoned breadcrumbs.
- Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken; cook 2 minutes on each side or until done. Serve with yogurt mixture.

Baked Tilapia

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 lbs tilapia fillets
- 1/4 cup celery, chopped
- 1/4 cup onion, chopped
- 1/4 cup sweet red pepper, chopped
- 3 tablespoons butter
- 3 tablespoons flour
- salt and pepper
- 1 teaspoon fresh tarragon
- 1 teaspoon fresh basil
- 1/4 cup milk
- 1 cup mozzarella cheese, shredded

Directions:
- Saute the celery, onions and bell pepper in butter until the vegetables soften.
- Add flour, salt, pepper, tarragon, basil, and milk, stirring until blended.
- Cook sauce until it thickens, stirring constantly.
- Lower the heat and add cheese, stirring until the cheese just melts. Do NOT boil the cheese or it will get stringy.
- Rinse the tilapia fillets in cold salted water, then drain and pat dry.
- Arrange the fish in a single layer in an oblong baking dish.
- Spoon the sauce over all.
- Bake at 425°F for 8 to 10 minutes or until the fish flakes easily when tested with a fork.

Stuffed Mushrooms

Ingredients:
- 2 lb. fresh mushrooms
- 2 Tbsp. butter
- 1/3 c. onion, diced
- 1/2 c. mushrooms stems, diced
- 1 small box frozen spinach
- 1/2 lb. Monterey Jack cheese, grated
- 1/2 lb. sausage

Directions:
- Clean mushrooms, cutting off stems.
- Saute onions and stems in butter.
- Cook sausage and drain.
- In saucepan, cook spinach, then drain.
- Mix all ingredients.
- Stuff mushrooms.
- Place in shallow greased pan.
- Bake at 350° for 15 minutes.

Brownies

Ingredients:
- chocolate
- flour
- sugar
- butter
- milk

Directions:
- Put in chocolate, flour, sugar and butter.
- Cut it up.
- Put it in this little block.
- Put it in the oven on medium.
- Cook 30 minutes.
- Let it cool 10 minutes and give it to the people with milk.

Brownies

Ingredients:
- 1 c. sugar
- 1/2 c. margarine
- 4 eggs
- 1 c. flour
- 1/2 nuts
- 1 can (15 oz.) Hershey's chocolate syrup

Directions:
- Cream sugar and margarine together.
- Add eggs, beaten well. Add flour, nuts and Hershey's syrup.
- Pour in 13 x 9-inch baking dish or pan.
- Bake at 350° (in glass 325°) for 30 to 35 minutes. While warm, cover with miniature marshmallows.

Swamp Water

Ingredients:
- 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger apricot brandy
- 1 (1.5 fluid ounce) jigger lime flavored vodka
- 2 cups prepared lemonade
- 1 cup ice

Directions:
- In a tall glass over ice, combine apricot brandy, lime vodka and lemonade. Stir.

Cream Of Potato Soup

Ingredients:
- 5 medium-size potatoes
- 3 c. water
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 onion, minced
- 1 c. sweet cream

Directions:
- Boil and mash potatoes.
- Add water, salt and cream.
- Let come to a boil and serve at once with salt wafers.
- Serves 4 people.

Cheese Dip

Ingredients:
- 1 c. chopped onion
- 1 c. mayonnaise
- 1 c. grated Cheddar cheese

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients together.
- Bake at 325° for 30 minutes, until bubbly.
- Good served on Shredded Wheat squares.

Greek Salad

Ingredients:
- 3 tablespoons olive oil
- 2 tablespoons lemon juice
- 2 tablespoons oil-packed pitted black olives, drained and finely chopped
- 2 tablespoons chopped parsley
- 1 teaspoon sugar
- 1 teaspoon Dijon mustard
- 12 teaspoon dried oregano
- tomatoes, cubed
- 1 English cucumber, cubed
- 1 yellow bell pepper, seeded and cubed
- 34 cup feta cheese, diced
- 12 cup red onion, thinly sliced
- salt and pepper

Directions:
- In a salad bowl or a large bowl, combine all the dressing ingredients with a whisk.
- Add the salad ingredients and toss to combine.
- Season with salt and pepper.
- Place the salad in the refrigerator until ready to serve.
- Tips: For a milder onion flavour, let the onion soak in a bowl of cold water for about 10 minutes.

Corn Casserole

Ingredients:
- 1/2 medium green pepper
- 1 large onion
- 2 Tbsp. butter or margarine
- 1 pkg Jiffy corn muffin mix
- 1 can whole kernel corn and liquid
- 1 can cream style corn
- 2 eggs
- 1 pt. sour cream
- 1 c. grated cheese

Directions:
- Saute green pepper and onion in butter.

Cherry Rum Cake(From 1975 Edition)  

Ingredients:
- 1 pkg. yellow cake mix
- 1 (3 oz.) pkg. vanilla instant pudding mix
- 4 eggs
- 1/2 c. salad oil
- 1/2 c. water
- 1/4 c. rum
- 1/2 c. butter (1 stick)
- 1/2 c. brown sugar
- 1 c. maraschino cherries, drained
- 1 c. nuts

Directions:
- Heat oven to 325°.
- Place Bundt pan in oven with butter to melt.

Svyokla V Tomatnom Souse

Ingredients:
- 2 cups tomato sauce russian
- 1 each onions
- 1 pound carrots peeled
- 1 pound beets fresh and peeled
- 6 tablespoons olive oil
- 2 teaspoons sugar
- 1 tablespoon red wine vinegar

Directions:
- Grate the beets, carrots and onions together.
- Heat the olive oil in a large skillet.
- Add the shredded vegetables and saute over medium heat for 10 minutes.
- Stir in the tomato sauce, vinegar, and sugar.
- Continue to cook over medium heat srirring until the moisture evaporates, 20 minutes approx.
- Be sure to continue to stir so it won't stick and burn.
- Remove from heat, allow to cool to room temp then refrigerate for 3 to 6 hours.

Sour Cream Pound Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 yellow cake mix
- 1 small carton sour cream

Directions:
- Follow directions on cake mix box and add sour cream to prepared mix.
- Bake in greased Bundt pan at 350°.
- Serve plain or with your favorite glaze.

Lime-Pineapple Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 pkg. lime Jell-O
- 1 c. hot water
- 1/4 c. pineapple juice
- 1 c. crushed pineapple, drained
- 2 1/2 tsp. horseradish
- 1/2 c. mayonnaise
- 1 c. cottage cheese

Directions:
- Dissolve Jell-O in hot water.
- Chill.
- Add remaining ingredients and let set.

Glycerin Soap Bubbles

Ingredients:
- 2 Tbsp. dish detergent (Dawn works best)
- 1 Tbsp. glycerin
- 1 c. hot water

Directions:
- Put mixture in small jar.
- Add straws to blow.

Key Lime Pie

Ingredients:
- 4 eggs, separated
- 1 can condensed milk
- 1/2 c. lime juice

Directions:
- Beat egg whites until stiff and set aside.
- Beat egg yolks slightly and add milk and lime juice.
- Fold in half of egg whites and pour into baked pie shell.

Spinach Balls

Ingredients:
- 2 pkg. frozen chopped spinach, drain well
- 2 c. Pepperidge Farm herb stuffing mix (fine)
- 4 beaten eggs
- 1/2 lb. melted margarine
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 tsp. thyme
- 1 onion, chopped
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1/2 c. grated Parmesan cheese

Directions:
- Saute onion in margarine; mix all ingredients into onion (will be wet and moist).
- Shape into balls (size of walnuts).
- If hard to handle, set in refrigerator for awhile.
- Set on cookie sheet, will be a full sheet.
- Bake at 350° for 12 minutes.
- Can be frozen after baked, then heated on low temperature.

Basic Tortellini Pasta

Ingredients:
- 2 cups flour
- 1 pinch salt
- 3 eggs
- 1 tablespoon oil
- 1 tablespoon water

Directions:
- Mix flour and salt in a bowl.
- Create a well with the flour and salt.
- Whisk together the three eggs, oil and water thoroughly.
- Add wet ingredients little by little to center of flour well, mixing gradually until dough becomes a ball.
- Turn onto a lightly floured surface, and knead until ball is smooth and elastic.
- Add more water if necessary.
- Allow to rest for thirty minutes in a lightly oiled bowl, covered with plastic wrap.
- After thirty minutes, cut dough into circles that are approximately 2 inches in diameter.
- Place 1/2 to 3/4 tsp of filling in center of dough circle, fold over into a half moon shape, and then join edges around your finger, forming a circle shape.
- Cook tortellini in 2-3 batches, in hot salty boiling water for 6 minutes or until firm.
- Drain, and then add to sauce!

Easy Squash Casserole

Ingredients:
- 2 c. squash, mashed
- 1 can cream of chicken soup
- 2 medium carrots, shredded
- 1 small can pimentos, chopped
- 1 medium onion, chopped
- 1/2 pt. sour cream
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/2 tsp. black pepper
- 1 stick margarine, melted
- 1 pkg. poultry stuffing

Directions:
- Cook squash until tender.
- Drain and mash.
- Add remaining ingredients, except for margarine and stuffing. Mix stuffing with melted butter.
- Add 1/2 of mixture to rest of ingredients.
- Pour into medium casserole dish.
- Put rest of stuffing on top.
- Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.
- Serves 8 to 10.

Hot Chicken Salad

Ingredients:
- 2 c. cubed, cooked chicken
- 1 c. chopped almonds
- 2 tsp. salt
- 1 c. mayonnaise
- 2 c. chopped celery
- 1/2 c. chopped onion (green)
- 1 tsp. lime juice
- 1 c. potato chips, divided

Directions:
- Mix all the ingredients together except half of the potato chips.
- Place in a baking dish. Top with remaining chips, lightly crushed.
- Bake at 300° for 1/2 hour.

Sunset Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 (3 oz.) pkg. lime gelatin
- 1 c. hot water
- 1 c. cottage cheese
- 1/2 c. mayonnaise
- 1/2 c. celery, chopped
- 1/2 c. bell pepper, chopped
- 1/2 c. onion, chopped

Directions:
- Dissolve gelatin in hot water.
- Cool until partially congealed. Add the remaining ingredients.
- Pour into mold; chill until firm. Pretty served with carrot curls and radish roses.
- Serves 8 to 10.

Tenderloin And Dressing

Ingredients:
- 8 pieces pork or beef tenderloin
- salt and pepper to taste
- flour
- 3 Tbsp. oil
- 2 qt. bread cubes
- 1 to 2 tsp. sage
- 1 c. chopped onions
- 2 c. milk
- 4 eggs
- 2 c. hot water
- 1 can condensed cream of mushroom soup

Directions:
- Pound meat until flat and thin; season to taste.
- Dredge in flour and brown in hot oil.
- Place in a 9 x 13-inch pan.
- Combine bread cubes, sage, onions, milk, eggs, salt and pepper.
- Add hot water to skillet used to brown meat, scraping bottom of pan.
- Add to dressing.
- Spread dressing over meat.
- Cover with mushroom soup.
- Bake at 325° for 1 hour.
- Yield: 8 servings.

Pork Tonkatsu (Fried Breaded Pork) Recipe

Ingredients:
- 4 pork fillets or possibly steak, deboned (1 per serving)
- 4 tbsp. soy sauce
- 4 tbsp. Sake (Japanese rice wine)
- 1 garlic clove, crushed
- Healthy pinch black pepper
- 1 egg, beaten
- 1 green onion, minced
- 1 c. panko (Japanese bread crumbs)
- Peanut oil for frying

Directions:
- (Available at Japanese market, Pak N Save, and Fry's in Oriental section.)
- Lb.
- fillets till thin.
- Marinate for 1/2 hour in a mix of soy sauce, sake, garlic and pepper.
- Mix the beaten egg and green onion and dip each pork slice into the mix.
- Place the crumbs into the pork.
- Place on trays covered with wax paper and refrigeratefor 1 hour.

Butter Pecan Dessert

Ingredients:
- 1 c. flour
- 1 stick oleo, melted
- 1/2 c. ground nuts
- 1 (8 oz.) pkg. Philadelphia cream cheese
- 1 c. powdered sugar
- 1 c. Cool Whip
- 2 pkg. butter pecan instant pudding
- 3 c. milk
- Cool Whip for topping

Directions:
- Mix flour, melted oleo and 1/2 cup ground nuts well and press into a 9 x 13-inch pan.
- Bake in preheated oven at 350° for 15 minutes.

Whole Wheat Pancakes

Ingredients:
- 1 1/4 c. whole wheat flour
- 2 1/2 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/4 c. egg substitute
- 1 1/4 c. skim milk

Directions:
- Combine flour, baking powder and salt in mixing bowl.
- Mix together milk and egg substitute.
- Stir in flour mixture.
- (Batter will be lumpy.)
- Makes 8 servings.

Blueberry Oat Pancakes With Maple Yogurt

Ingredients:
- 1 cup old-fashioned rolled oats
- 1/2 cup low-fat cottage cheese
- 2 large eggs
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1 cup blueberries
- Cooking spray
- 3/4 cup plain low-fat Greek yogurt
- 1 tablespoon maple syrup

Directions:
- Combine oats, cottage cheese, eggs, and vanilla in a blender or food processor; process until smooth. Gently stir in the blueberries.
- Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Coat pan with cooking spray. Spoon about 2 tablespoons batter per pancake into pan. Cook 3 minutes or until tops are covered with bubbles and edges look cooked. Carefully turn pancakes over, and cook 3 more minutes or until golden.
- Combine yogurt and maple syrup; serve alongside pancakes.

Dad'S Italian Beef "Poor Boys"

Ingredients:
- 4 lbs roast
- 2 onions (sliced)
- 1/2 teaspoon onion salt
- 1/2 teaspoon garlic salt
- 1/2 teaspoon basil
- 1 teaspoon Accent seasoning
- 1/2 teaspoon oregano
- 1/2 teaspoon italian seasoning
- 1/2 teaspoon seasoning salt
- 2 bay leaves

Directions:
- fill pan half full with water and let roast and onions cook for 5-6 hours.
- Shred meat and let sit in fridge over night.
- Next day add all other ingredients and cook again.
- We let it cook in a crock pot on low all day and it's ready when we get home from work!
- Sometimes I cheat and sneak home for lunch and make a sandwich.

Oatmeal Crisp

Ingredients:
- 1 c. shortening
- 1 c. brown sugar
- 1 c. granulated sugar
- 2 eggs
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 1/2 c. flour
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. soda
- 2 handfuls of raisins
- 3 c. oats

Directions:
- Cream shortening and sugars.
- Add eggs and vanilla; mix well. Mix flour, salt and soda.
- Add to creamed mixture.
- Stir in oats and raisins.
- Mix well.
- Pour in ungreased cookie sheet and bake at 350° for 10 minutes or until lightly browned.

Easter Pizza Bread Recipe

Ingredients:
- 5 hard boiled Large eggs, sliced
- 1 to 1 1/2 lbs. Italian sausage (cooked and sliced)
- 1 pound Ricotta cheese
- Salt and pepper

Directions:
- Make dough according to box instructions, let raise 2 hrs covered.
- Grease medium size square pan.
- Roll dough out to cover bottom and sides of pan.
- Make a layer of sliced Large eggs, sausage and Ricotta then salt and pepper.
- Make another layer of Large eggs, sausage and ricotta.
- Put dough on top layer and healthy pinch sides closed.
- Let raise 2 hrs (covered).
- Preheat oven 350 degrees.
- Bake 25 to 30 min.
- Cold in pan, then remove and chill.

Diabetic Chicken Spaghetti

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 lb. skinned chicken breast
- 1/4 lb. uncooked spaghetti
- 1/2 can cream of mushroom soup (undiluted)
- 1/2 c. skim milk
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1 jar sliced mushrooms, drained

Directions:
- Combine chicken and water to cover in large skillet.
- Cover and boil.
- Reduce heat, simmer 15 to 20 minutes.
- Drain well. Chop chicken; set aside.
- Cook spaghetti as directed on package; drain and set aside.
- Combine soup, milk and seasoning in saucepan.
- Stir to blend.
- Layer spaghetti, chicken, soup mixture and mushrooms in a 12 x 8 x 2-inch baking dish coated with cooking spray.
- Bake at 325°
- for 30 to 45 minutes or until thoroughly heated.

Vivian'S Casserole

Ingredients:
- 1 to 3 c. veal or pork (leftover, cooked)
- 2 Tbsp. lemon juice
- salt and pepper
- 4 Tbsp. catsup
- 1 Tbsp. oil
- 1 Tbsp. minced onion
- 1 clove garlic, minced
- 8 oz. cooked noodles
- 1/4 c. sliced pimento
- 2 c. chicken broth
- 1 c. mushrooms (fresh or canned)
- 1 c. shredded Cheese

Directions:
- Combine meat, lemon, salt, pepper, catsup, oil, onion and garlic.
- Simmer slowly for about 20 to 30 minutes.
- Mix with noodles, etc.
- Bake at 325° but first sprinkle with cheese and crumbled potato chips.
- Bake until it bubbles.

Colcannon

Ingredients:
- 1 pound cabbage or kale, chopped
- 1/2 cup leeks or scallions, cleaned and chopped
- 1 cup milk or cream
- 2 pounds potatoes, peeled and cut up
- Salt and freshly ground pepper to taste
- 1/4 teaspoon mace
- 6 tablespoons butter, melted

Directions:
- Boil or steam cabbage until tender.
- Simmer leeks in enough milk to cover them, just until tender.
- Cook potatoes in boiling water for 20 minutes, or until done.
- Drain and mash well with salt, pepper, mace and remaining milk to keep them creamy.
- Fold in cooked cabbage and beat until fluffy.
- Divide into 4 to 6 servings, make a well in the center of each and pour in melted butter.

Peanut Brittle

Ingredients:
- 2/3 c. white Karo
- 1 1/2 c. sugar
- 2 c. peanuts (raw)
- 1 Tbsp. baking soda

Directions:
- Combine first 3 ingredients.
- Cook on medium heat until honey colored.
- Remove from heat and stir in soda.
- Pour on greased (margarine) cookie sheet or marble.
- Cool.
- Break into pieces.

Individual Cheesy Potatoes Gratin

Ingredients:
- 2 russet potatoes
- 1 cup half & half
- 2 tablespoons grated Parmesan cheese
- 1 cup shredded extra sharp cheddar cheese
- 1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese
- 1 garlic clove small, minced
- salt
- pepper

Directions:
- Carefully slice potatoes as thin as possible.
- Add slice potatoes to a bowl and pour the half & half on top.
- Sprinkle with cheddar cheese, parmesan cheese, garlic, and salt & pepper.
- Stir to coat the potatoes evenly.
- Generously butter your dish(es) because this will also be one of the flavorings, not just for greasing.
- Spoon your potatoes evenly into 2 small ramekins and flatten to make sure they're in an even layer.
- Bake in a pre-heated 375 degree oven for 40 minutes, then remove and sprinkle with mozzarella cheese and bake for an additional 15 minutes or until cheese is bubbly and golden brown.

Chocolate-Earl Grey Cake

Ingredients:
- 6 Earl Grey tea bags or 2 tablespoons loose Earl Grey
- 1 cup water
- 1/2 cup (1 stick) butter
- 3 eggs
- 2 cups granulated sugar
- 4 ounces unsweetened chocolate, melted and cooled
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1 teaspoon baking soda
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt
- 1/2 cup plain yogurt
- Confectioners' sugar

Directions:
- Heat oven to 350° F. Coat an 8-cup fluted tube pan with cooking spray. Brew the tea in the water 3 to 5 minutes. Remove the tea bags or strain the leaves and set the brewed tea aside. Using a mixer, beat the butter, eggs, and granulated sugar until fluffy. Blend in the chocolate. Beat in the flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt, yogurt, and brewed tea. Pour into pan. Bake 50 minutes or until a skewer inserted into the cake comes out with a few crumbs attached. Remove from oven and let stand 5 minutes. Turn out of pan and cool. Dust with confectioners' sugar.

Low Fat Honey Oat Scones

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 cups unbleached flour
- 1 cup quick oats
- 1 tablespoon baking powder
- 1/4 cup honey
- 3 tablespoons egg substitute
- 1/3 cup raisins or 1/3 cup dried cranberries
- 6 tablespoons fat-free buttermilk
- skim milk

Directions:
- Combine flour, oats, and baking powder, stir to mix well.
- Stir in honey, egg substitute, raisins or cranberries, and buttermilk to form a stiff dough.
- Form into a ball and turn on a floured surface into a 7 inch circle.
- Coat a baking sheet with nonstick spray.
- Place circle of dough on sheet, and use a sharp floured knife to cut into 12 wedges.
- Pull wedges apart slightly, and brush the tops with skim milk.
- Bake at 375 for 20 minutes or until lightly browned.
- Serve hot!

Chop Suey

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 lb. lean pork
- 1 large sliced onion
- 3 stalks celery
- 2 Tbsp. soy sauce
- 1/2 tsp. molasses
- salt and pepper to taste
- 2 Tbsp. cornstarch
- 2 c. bean sprouts
- 1 1/2 c. water or chicken broth
- cooked rice

Directions:
- Brown onion and meat.
- Add celery and bean sprouts.
- Mix chicken broth or water with soy sauce, molasses, salt and pepper. Add to mixture in skillet.
- Simmer until vegetables are just done. Mix cornstarch with a little water.
- Stir in.
- Cook until thickened and bubbly hot.
- Serve over rice on warmed plates.
- My mother, Elsie Pflaum Wood, served this often.

Cauliflower

Ingredients:
- 1 head cauliflower
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 3 Tbsp. margarine
- pepper to taste
- 1/2 tsp. nutmeg

Directions:
- Cook cauliflower about 2 minutes and take out of water, save about 1 cup of water it was cooked in.
- In bottom of pan add flour and butter.
- Let brown just a little.
- Add warm water that cauliflower was cooked in.
- Add salt and nutmeg; drop cauliflower back in and steam until tender, about 1 minute.

Savory Tomato Dressing

Ingredients:
- 12 tomatoes (large)
- 14 cup raw tahini (toasted works fine too)
- 6 tablespoons olive oil
- 6 tablespoons water
- 3 tablespoons nutritional yeast
- 1 tablespoon sesame seeds
- 12 teaspoon sea salt
- 1 tablespoon garlic
- 6 tablespoons apple cider vinegar
- 14 cup soy sauce

Directions:
- Combine all in a blender in order given and whiz together until blended.

Southern Style Tater Salad #5FIX

Ingredients:
- 1 (20 ounce) bag Simply Potatoes Diced Potatoes with Onion
- 14 cup mayonnaise
- 14 cup sour cream
- 14 cup diced celery
- 14 cup crumbled bacon

Directions:
- mix all ingredients, add preferred spices.
- Serve warm or cold.

Poppy Seed Dressing

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. sugar or 12 packs Equal
- 2/3 c. salad oil
- 1 to 2 Tbsp. poppy seed
- 1 tsp. salt

Directions:
- Put all ingredients in a jar and shake vigorously.

Bread Pudding

Ingredients:
- 7 slices white bread
- 1 12 cups milk
- 14 cup butter or 14 cup margarine
- 12 cup sugar
- 2 eggs, large,slightly beaten
- 14 teaspoon salt
- 1 teaspoon cinnamon
- 12 cup raisins
- 1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract

Directions:
- Slice bread into 1/2 inch cubes.
- Also use the crusts.
- Put in a medium size bowl.
- In a small bowl, mix together the sugar, salt, and cinnamon.
- Sprinkle the sugar mixture over the bread cubes.
- Add the raisins.
- Scald the milk with the butter.
- Pour the scalded milk and butter over the bread cubes.
- Mix lightly.
- Add the beaten eggs and vanilla.
- Mix again.
- Pour into a buttered 8x8 inch pan.
- Set the pan with the bread puddding into a larger outer pan and add about 1/2 inch of very hot water to the outer pan.
- Bake at 325 degrees until set, (When knife comes out clean) about 30-45 minutes.
- Cut into serving pieces when cooled.

Crab Bisque

Ingredients:
- 1 can crab meat
- 1/4 c. sherry
- 1 can condensed pea soup
- 1 can condensed tomato soup
- paprika to taste
- curry to taste
- 1 c. light cream

Directions:
- Marinate crab in sherry overnight.
- Next day, mix everything together and heat thoroughly.
- Serves 4.

Apple Crisp

Ingredients:
- 4 c. sliced apples
- 1/2 c. hot water
- 3/4 c. sugar
- 1/2 c. flour
- 4 Tbsp. butter

Directions:
- Put apples in an 8 x 8-inch baking pan and pour on hot water. Mix sugar and flour; cut in butter and pat mixture on apples. Bake at 375° for 30 minutes.

Shepherd'S Pie

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. chopped meat (beef)
- 4 to 6 carrots, cut up
- 2 to 3 celery stalks, cut up
- 1 onion, cut up
- 4 Tbsp. butter or margarine
- 1 clove garlic
- 1 (4 oz.) can tomato sauce
- thyme (to taste)
- A.1. sauce (to taste)
- salt (to taste)
- pepper (to taste)
- 3 to 4 potatoes, cooked and mashed

Directions:
- Brown meat, saute vegetables in butter with the garlic.
- Add rest of ingredients
- (except potatoes).
- Simmer to blend flavors, then put into casserole dish.
- Cover top of mixture with mashed potatoes.
- Bake at 350° for about 30 minutes or until potatoes are browned.

Relaxing Milk Bath

Ingredients:
- 1 cup salt
- 1 cup baking soda
- 1 cup nonfat dry milk powder

Directions:
- Add 1 cup of mixture to running bath. Can be stored in airtight container for up to 1 year.

Pomegranate Syrup

Ingredients:
- 1 cup Pomegranate Juice
- 1/2 cups Honey
- 2 teaspoons Pure Vanilla Extract
- 1 Tablespoon Butter

Directions:
- Combine ingredients in a heavy-bottomed sauce pan and bring to a gentle boil; reduce by half. Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

Chocolate Espresso Shortbread

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 cups flour
- 1/2 cup cocoa powder, Dutch-processed
- 2 tablespoons espresso (not instant, use the fine ground)
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
- 8 ounces butter
- 3/4 cup white sugar
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350.
- Whisk together flour, cocoa, espresso, salt and baking soda.
- Cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add vanilla and mix briefly.
- Add dry ingredients, put shield on mixer and start low. Mix till just blended.
- Roll dough into walnut sized balls. Place on silpat lined sheet and flatten slightly with hand or bottom of glass dipped in sugar.
- Bake about 12 minutes.
- Cool 5 minutes and tranfer to racks to cool completely.

Orange Asparagus Sauce

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. butter
- 1 1/4 tsp. Dijon mustard
- 1 1/3 c. orange juice
- 2 shallots
- 2 lb. asparagus

Directions:
- Mince shallots; saute in a little of the butter.
- Add the orange juice and mustard.
- Reduce to 2/3 cup (10 minutes).
- Cook asparagus.
- Reheat sauce, adding rest of butter, a chunk at a time. Serve over asparagus; garnish with orange slices.
- Good alternative to high cholesterol Hollandaise Sauce.

Salsa & Sour Cream Swirl

Ingredients:
- 1 cup TACO BELL Thick & Chunky Salsa, any variety
- 1 cup BREAKSTONE'S or KNUDSEN Sour Cream
- tortilla chips

Directions:
- Spoon salsa and sour cream into serving bowl.
- Swirl together lightly.
- Serve with tortilla chips.

Old-Fashioned Rice Pudding

Ingredients:
- 1 3/4 c. water
- 1/2 c. long grain rice
- 2 c. milk
- 2 large eggs, beaten
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1/2 c. raisins (optional)
- cinnamon

Directions:
- Bring water to boil.
- Stir in rice; cover and simmer until all water is absorbed.
- Add milk and boil gently, stirring occasionally until mixture thickens slightly, about 5 minutes. Combine eggs, sugar and vanilla in bowl.
- Gradually stir in rice mixture.
- Add raisins, if desired, then pour into a greased 1 1/2-quart casserole.
- Sprinkle cinnamon over the top.
- Place casserole in pan containing about 1-inch of hot water.
- Set both in oven preheated to 350°.
- Bake, uncovered, for 45 to 50 minutes. Serve warm or cold.
- Store, covered, in refrigerator.

Piadina - the Italian flat bread from Romagna Recipe cosmopolita

Ingredients:
- 500 g all-pourpose flour
- 2 teespoons salt
- 2 full fresh liquid cream tablespoons
- 300 milliliters of milk
- 15 g Baking powder ( 2 teespoons)

Directions:
- Mix and knead flour, chemical yeast, milk, salt and fresh cream.
- Knead the misture for about 4 or 5 minutes until it is smooth.
- The dought will be firm but not too dry or crumbly.
- Then divide it into equal portions, and shape them into balls (the size of a mandarin) cover with plastic wrap, and let rest at least 30 minutes before baking.
- Using rolling pin roll dought out until about 3 mm thick.
- Heat an iron pan (a fireproof stone is even better) until it is very hot and cook the each piadina on both sides, pricking them with a fork, 4 or 5 mnutes or until it is brown on each side
- Place on a wire rack while cooking remaining circles.
- Cover them with a cloth to keep them warm.
- Serve warm with salami, cheese and salad.

Chocolate Candy Cheesecake

Ingredients:
- 1 (9 oz.) pkg. chocolate wafer cookies, crushed
- 1/4 c. sugar
- 1/4 c. butter or margarine, melted
- 2 (2 oz.) chocolate coated, caramel peanut nougat bars, coarsely chopped
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 2 large eggs
- 3/4 c. semi-sweet chocolate morsels, melted
- 1 tsp. vanilla extract
- whipped cream or prepared whipped topping

Directions:
- Combine first 3 ingredients.
- Press mixture evenly onto bottom and 1 1/2-inches up sides of a 9-inch spring-form pan.
- Sprinkle chopped candy bars (chops easier if frozen first) evenly over bottom and set aside.

Ice Cream Bars

Ingredients:
- 2 C crushed cocoa krispies
- 1/3 C melted butter
- 1/2 C brown sugar
- 1/2 C chopped nuts, optional
- 1/2 C flaked coconut, optional
- 1 qt vanilla ice cream
- 1 jar hot fudge topping

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients together.
- Press half of mixture in bottom of 9x9 pan as a crust.
- Flatten.

Really Easy And Good  Ground Beef And Bean Bake

Ingredients:
- 7 -8 slices cooked bacon, chopped
- 1 1/2 lbs ground beef
- 1 large onion, chopped
- 2 -3 minced fresh garlic cloves
- 1 green bell pepper, coarslet chopped
- 2 tablespoons molasses
- 2 tablespoons brown sugar
- 1 teaspoon mustard powder
- 1/3 cup vinegar
- 1 (19 ounce) can tomatoes, chopped
- 1 (14 ounce) can kidney beans, drained and rinsed
- 1 (14 ounce) can lima beans, drained and rinsed
- 1 (14 ounce) can pork and beans
- 1 -2 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce
- salt and pepper, to tatse
- Tabasco sauce

Directions:
- In a frypan, brown the ground beef with onion and garlic; drain fat.
- Combine with all the remaining ingredients.
- Season with salt, pepper and tabasco sauce to taste.
- Set oven to 325 degrees.
- Transfer to a large casserole dish.
- Bake uncovered for 1-1/2 - 2 hours.

Beef Barley Soup In The Slow Cooker

Ingredients:
- 1 teaspoon oil
- 1 cup chopped onion
- 2 teaspoons finely chopped garlic
- 1 cup chopped mixed mushrooms
- 2 celery ribs, chopped
- 2 medium carrots, chopped
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon pepper
- 1 cup uncooked pearl barley
- 10 cups beef broth
- 1/2 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce
- 1 tablespoon beef powder bouillon
- 1 tablespoon chicken powder bouillon
- 1/4 teaspoon marmite
- 2 tablespoons tomato paste
- 1 cup green giant* frozen mixed vegetables
- 1 cup shredded cooked beef

Directions:
- Heat oil in 12-inch skillet over medium-high heat. Cook onion, garlic, mushrooms,celery, carrots. salt and pepper in oil 5 minutes.
- Spoon mixture into 6-quart slow cooker. Stir in vegetables, barley and broth, powders. Worcestershire sauce and Marmite.
- Cover and cook on Low heat setting 8 to 9 hours or on High for 4 hours.
- Increase heat setting to High. Stir in frozen vegetables,tomato paste and meat. Cover and cook 30 minutes.

Chocolate Chip Craisin Granola Bars

Ingredients:
- 2 cups Rolled Oats
- 1 cup Flour
- 1 cup Chocolate Chips
- 1/2 cups Craisins
- 1/2 cups Sunflower Seeds
- 1/2 cups Brown Sugar
- 1 teaspoon Cinnamon
- 1 Egg, Beaten
- 1/2 cups Yogurt
- 1 cup Canned Pumpkin
- 2 teaspoons Vanilla

Directions:
- 1. Preheat oven to 350°F and line a 9x13 pan with parchment paper.
- 2. Mix oats, flour, chocolate chips, chocolate chips, craisins, sunflower seeds, brown sugar, and cinnamon together.
- 3. Add the beaten egg, yogurt, pumpkin and vanilla. Mix until combined.
- 4. Spread in the pan and bake 15-20 minutes (or 20-25 if you prefer crispy bars).

Banana Split Dessert

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. oleo
- 2 c. graham cracker crumbs
- 2 eggs
- 2 c. powdered sugar
- 3/4 c. oleo (soft)
- 1 (20 oz.) can crushed pineapple, well drained
- 4 medium bananas, sliced
- 9 oz. Cool Whip
- 1/2 c. chopped pecans
- 4 oz. maraschino cherries

Directions:
- Combine oleo and crumbs. Pat into bottom of a 9 x 13-inch pan. Beat eggs 4 minutes. Add powdered sugar, butter and 1 teaspoon vanilla and beat 5 minutes more. Spread over crumbs and chill. Spread pineapple and sliced bananas over former. Top with nuts and cherries. Refrigerate 6 hours.

Hush Puppies

Ingredients:
- 3 eggs, beaten
- 3 c. corn meal
- 1 large onion, chopped
- 1 can beer
- 1 c. flour
- salt and pepper

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients in a large bowl.
- Spoon into hot oil.
- Cook until golden brown.

Condensed Milk

Ingredients:
- 1 c. hot water
- 2 c. sugar
- 4 c. powdered milk
- 1/4 c. butter

Directions:
- Combine all ingredients in a blender.
- Blend very well.
- Store in refrigerator or freeze.

Enchiladas 

Ingredients:
- Flour or wheat tortillas
- 1 lb. ground beef or chicken
- 1 can green or red enchilada sauce
- 1 pkg. cream cheese
- 1 pkg. shredded cheese

Directions:
- Melt cream cheese in microwave until very soft. Add half of can of enchilada sauce to cream cheese, reserve remainder.
- Cook beef or chicken and add to mixture.
- 
- Heat tortillas in microwave for about 20 seconds or until warm. Place mixture in tortillas and wrap.
- 
- Place enchiladas in baking dish.
- 
- Pour shredded cheese and remaining sauce over top.
- 
- Bake 20 minutes or until hot at 325 .

Joyce'S Joyful Brownies

Ingredients:
- 4 Tbsp cocoa
- 2 c. sugar
- 4 eggs
- 1-1/2 c. flour
- 2 stick melted margarine
- 1 Tbsp. vanilla
- nuts

Directions:
- Mix together and bake at 325° for 20-25 minutes.

Baked Parmesan Chicken 

Ingredients:
- 1/4 cup gluten free flour blend (or white whole wheat flour, or spelt flour, or all-purpose)
- 1/3 cup shredded or grated Parmesan cheese (the fresh kind, not the powdered type)
- 1/2 tsp black pepper
- 2 tsp paprika (or garlic powder, whatever your preference)
- 2-3 egg whites, beaten
- 4 x 4 oz (approx) chicken breasts

Directions:
- Preheat your oven to 350 degrees. Mist or spray a shallow baking dish with cooking spray or healthy oil.
- 
- Combine the flour, Parmesan cheese, pepper, paprika (or garlic powder) in a shallow dish. In a separate bowl, place the beaten egg white. Dip the chicken breasts in the egg white, then dredge in the flour/cheese mixture.
- 
- Place coated chicken in dish and bake for 45 min to 1 hr uncovered (cooking time depends on the size of your chicken breast). Do not flip halfway through. It will be done when the coating is browned, and when pierced, its no longer pink and the juices run clear.

Catfish Parmesan

Ingredients:
- 3/4 c. dry bread crumbs
- 3 Tbsp. grated Parmesan cheese
- 2 Tbsp. chopped fresh parsley
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. paprika
- 1/8 tsp. EACH pepper, dried oregano, and basil
- 6 fresh or frozen catfish fillets, 3 - 5 oz. each
- 1/2 c. butter, melted

Directions:
- In a shallow bowl, combine the bread crumbs, Parmesan cheese, parsley and seasonings.
- Dip catfish in butter, then in crumb mixture.
- Arrange in a greased 9 x 13 inch pan.
- Bake uncovered at 375° for 20-25 minutes, or until fish flakes easily with a fork. Serves 6.

Lahvosh Roll

Ingredients:
- 1 10 inch tortillas
- 1 4 oz. tub cream cheese with chives and onion
- 1/4 cup chopped, drained marinated artichoke hearts
- 2 Tbsp. diced pimentos
- 1 tsp. dried oregano, crushed
- 6 oz. thinly sliced Black Forest Ham
- 4 oz. sliced provolone cheese
- 1 large romaine leaf, rib removed.

Directions:
- Stir together cream cheese, artichoke hears, pimento, and oregano in a bowl.
- Spread tortilla with cream cheese mixture. Arrange ham over cream cheese.
- Place cheese slices in the center and lettuce leaf next to cheese.
- Roll up tortilla.

Grandma'S Tea Cakes

Ingredients:
- 2 sticks oleo
- 1/2 c. butter flavor Crisco
- 1 1/2 c. sugar
- 2 eggs
- 1 1/2 tsp. vanilla
- 3/4 tsp. soda
- 3 c. flour

Directions:
- Cream the oleo, Crisco and sugar until smooth.
- Beat in eggs. Sift together the flour and soda; add to creamed mixture.
- Form into a ball.
- Roll out on floured board to the thickness you desire and cut out.
- Bake at 375° for 10 to 12 minutes.
- Makes about 3 dozen, according to thickness.

Banana And Coconut Tart

Ingredients:
- 1 unbaked pie shell (or puff pastry)
- Filling
- 100 ml milk
- 80 g desiccated coconut
- 125 g sugar
- 2 eggs
- 1 fluid ounce rum
- 4 -5 bananas
- icing sugar, to decorate

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 375°F
- Put pastry case in a greased pie dish, or use puff pastry to line a pie dish.
- Cook blind for 15 minutes.
- Beat eggs, add coconut and sugar.
- Bring milk to boil and add little by little to mixture.
- Bring whole mixture to boil to thin.
- Remove from heat, add rum.
- Pour mixture over pastry, chop banana and arrange on top to decorate.
- Cook for 10 minutes in oven.
- Sprinkle with icing sugar and serve.
- Advice :.
- Try pouring a second shot of rum over the pie while hot, then flambeing at the table - be careful of your guests!

Biscuits

Ingredients:
- flour
- milk
- bowl
- shortening

Directions:
- Mix together in bowl.
- Roll the dough in your hands.
- Put in pan.
- Cook in oven 20 minutes.

Pumpkin Bread

Ingredients:
- 3 c. white sugar
- 1 c. salad oil
- 2 c. cooked pumpkin, mashed real good
- 1 tsp. baking powder
- 2 tsp. baking soda
- 1 c. water
- 4 eggs
- 1 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 1/2 tsp. nutmeg
- 4 tsp. pumpkin pie spice
- 3 1/2 c. flour
- 1 c. finely chopped pecans

Directions:
- Bake in loaf pans at 350° for 35 minutes.

Taco Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 head lettuce
- 2 to 3 tomatoes, diced
- 1 onion, chopped
- 1 cucumber, cut up
- 1 green pepper, cut up
- 2 c. shredded Cheddar cheese
- 1 large bag crushed Doritos
- 1 lb. hamburg
- 1 pkg. taco mix
- 1 large bottle Catalina salad dressing

Directions:
- Cook hamburg; drain grease.
- Add 3/4 cup water and taco mix. Put in large salad bowl.
- Add the lettuce, tomatoes, onion, cucumber, green pepper, cheese and Catalina dressing.
- Just before serving, add the crushed Doritos.

Hearty Stuffed Peppers

Ingredients:
- 1 envelope French's Idaho mashed potatoes
- 1 egg, slightly beaten
- 1/2 c. chopped onion
- 1 tsp. butter
- 1/2 lb. ground beef
- 5 to 6 green peppers
- tomato sauce

Directions:
- Prepare potatoes as directed, except reduce water to 1 1/4 cups; cool slightly.
- Stir in egg.
- Brown ground beef and onion; pour off excess fat.
- Stir beef into potatoes.
- Cut tops from peppers and remove seeds: simmer in small amount of water for 5 minutes; drain. Spoon potato filling into peppers and dot with butter.
- Bake at 350° for 20 to 30 minutes.
- Serve with tomato sauce.
- Makes 5 to 6 servings.

Boiled Cauliflower(Kokt Blomkaal)  

Ingredients:
- 1 head cauliflower
- 2 qt. water (or to cover)
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 3 Tbsp. melted butter
- finely chopped parsley

Directions:
- Remove cauliflower's large outer leaves.
- Cut the stalk off to about 1-inch and cut a deep cross on the end to make it cook quicker.
- Bring water and salt to boil.
- Put cauliflower in, head up, and boil for 3 minutes.
- Remove cauliflower from boiling water and pour cold water over it to cool it.
- (This keeps the cauliflower white.)
- Place cauliflower back into the boiling water, head down this time, and boil for about 20 minutes, being careful not to overcook.
- Serve cauliflower on a platter with melted butter poured over it and sprinkled with parsley.
- Save water and any leftovers for cauliflower soup.

7 Layer Dip

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. hamburger
- 1 can tomatoes with green chilies
- 1 c. sour cream
- 1 pkg. taco seasoning
- 1 c. diced tomatoes
- 1 pkg. shredded Cheddar cheese
- 1 pkg. Monterey Jack cheese
- 3 Tbsp. black olives, sliced
- 3 Tbsp. scallions

Directions:
- Brown hamburger and drain.
- Add can of tomatoes with green chili sauce and taco seasoning.
- Simmer until it thickens.
- Add this to baking pan and let cool completely.
- Then add layers as follows:
- sour cream, diced tomatoes, shredded Monterey Jack cheese, shredded Cheddar cheese, scallions, black olives.
- Bake at 350° until cheese bubbles.
- Enjoy!

Cheese And Macaroni Loaf

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. uncooked macaroni
- 1 c. milk
- 1 c. bread crumbs
- 2 Tbsp. chopped green peppers
- 1 Tbsp. chopped onion
- 1 Tbsp. chopped parsley
- 1/8 tsp. pepper
- 1 c. Longhorn cheese grated
- 1 Tbsp. butter

Directions:
- Cook and drain macaroni.
- Add remaining ingredients and place in greased baking dish.

Sweet Potato Casserole

Ingredients:
- 3 c. mashed sweet potatoes
- 1 c. granulated sugar
- 2 eggs, well beaten
- 1/3 stick margarine, melted
- 1/2 c. milk
- 1 tsp. vanilla

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients together and turn into a buttered casserole dish.

Carman'S Caper

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 lbs ground beef
- 1/2 cup chopped onion
- 1 1/2 teaspoons salt
- 1/4 teaspoon pepper
- 1/2 lb spaghetti or 1/2 lb pasta
- 1 (19 ounce) can tomatoes
- 1 (14 ounce) can mushroom soup
- 1 1/2 cups grated cheese (or as much as you want)

Directions:
- Brown beef and onions in frying pan, sprinkle with salt and pepper.
- Stir, put in casserole dish.
- Cook spaghetti according to directions on pkg and layer over meat.
- Add tomatoes, then mushroom soup.
- Cover with cheese.
- Bake uncovered at 350F for 30 mins until hot and cheese is melted.
- Cover halfway thru if cheese starts getting dry.

Chinese Coleslaw

Ingredients:
- 5 cups coarsely chopped Chinese or napa cabbage
- 1 cup shredded carrots
- 1/2 cup sliced green onions (1-inch pieces)
- 1 can (8 ounces) sliced water chestnuts, drained
- 2 tablespoons sesame seeds, toasted
- 1/4 cup vegetable oil
- 1 teaspoon sesame oil
- 2 tablespoons sugar
- 1 tablespoon minced fresh cilantro
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon pepper
- 1/2 teaspoon ground ginger
- 2 tablespoons white wine vinegar
- 1 tablespoon soy sauce

Directions:
- Toss all vegetables and sesame seeds to combine. In small bowl, whisk dressing ingredients. Pour dressing over cabbage mixture; toss to coat. Cover and refrigerate for 2 hours before serving; toss again before serving.

Grandmom B'S Stuffing

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. sweet Italian sausage
- 1 c. chopped celery
- 1 medium onion, chopped
- 1 garlic clove, chopped
- 6 to 8 slices cubed bread
- 4 eggs
- 1/2 c. grated Italian cheeses
- 1 Tbsp. butter or oil
- poultry seasoning
- salt and pepper

Directions:
- Remove sausage from casing and fry in butter or oil.
- Add celery, onion and garlic to sausage; cook approximately 1/2 hour. Beat eggs and cheese together.
- Add salt and pepper to taste. Stir egg mix to sausage mix and cook until eggs solidify.
- If too dry, add 1/2 cup chicken broth.
- If too wet, add bread crumbs or more bread cubes.

Frozen Strawberry Jam

Ingredients:
- 4 1/2 c. crushed berries
- 7 c. sugar

Directions:
