- The rest is the same as for jam.

Peanut Brittle

Ingredients:
- 2 cups sugar
- 1 cup white karo syrup
- 1 cup water
- 3 cups raw peanuts
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. butter
- 1 tsp. soda
- 1 tsp. vanilla

Directions:
- Combine sugar, syrup and water. Cook to soft-ball stage (238 degrees). Add peanuts and salt and cook to hard-crack stage (288 degrees); stirring constantly. Remove from heat; add vanilla and butter. Add soda; stir vigorously until foamy. Pour at once into greased pan.

Oven Home Fries

Ingredients:
- 2 medium baking potatoes
- Pam cooking spray
- salt and pepper to taste

Directions:
- Heat oven to 375°.
- Spray small rimmed cookie sheet with nonstick cooking spray.
- Scrub 2 medium size baking potatoes (about 6 ounces each); cut each into 8 lengthwise wedges.
- Arrange wedges in single layer on prepared cookie sheet.
- Spray lightly with nonstick cooking spray.
- Sprinkle with 1/8 teaspoon each salt and black pepper.
- Bake 25 to 30 minutes, turning wedges over halfway through cooking time.
- Makes 4 servings.

Homemade Baked Beans

Ingredients:
- 2 lb. Great Northern white beans
- 1 1/2 c. catsup
- 3 c. brown sugar
- 1/2 tsp. dry mustard
- 3 Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
- dash of powdered garlic
- 2 c. uncooked, diced bacon squares
- salt to taste

Directions:
- Cook beans in salted water until done.
- Mix all ingredients and add to cooked beans.
- Bake for 3 hours in very slow oven at 275°.
- Can be stored.

Country Ham Frittata

Ingredients:
- 150 each eggs
- - salt
- - black pepper
- 12-1/2 cups potatoes, cooked, chopped
- 1-1/2 qt. green onions, sliced
- 1-1/2 qt. butter
- 6-1/4 cups OSCAR MAYER Ham Bulk Water Added, chopped
- 1-1/2 qt. KRAFT 100% Shredded Parmesan Cheese - Full Moisture
- 2 Tbsp. ground sage

Directions:
- For one serving: Beat 3 eggs until foamy.
- Season with salt and pepper to taste; set aside.
- Saute 1/4 cup potatoes and 2 Tbsp.
- onions in 2 Tbsp.
- butter in 10-inch skillet 2 minutes.
- Add eggs; cook until egg mixture is almost set but top is still moist.
- Sprinkle with 2 Tbsp.
- ham, 2 Tbsp.
- cheese and 1/8 tsp.
- sage.
- Place under broiler.
- Broil until eggs are set.
- Serve immediately.

Barbecue Sauce

Ingredients:
- 3/4 c. ketchup
- 3/4 c. water
- 2 Tbsp. brown vinegar
- 2 Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
- dash of cayenne pepper
- 1 tsp. paprika
- 1/2 tsp. black pepper
- 1 tsp. chili powder
- 1/4 c. brown sugar
- 1 tsp. salt

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients and heat to dissolve sugar and salt.

Molasses Substitute

Ingredients:
- 34 cup sugar
- 1 14-1 13 cups water
- 12 teaspoon baking soda
- 2 teaspoons baking powder

Directions:
- 1.
- Boil water, sugar, baking soda, and baking powder.

Kecap Manis (Sweet Soy Sauce)

Ingredients:
- 2 1/2 cups white sugar
- 3 cups dark soy sauce
- 1/2 cup water
- 1/2 star anise pod
- 2 fresh curry leaves
- 1 (1 inch) piece fresh ginger root, sliced
- 4 cloves garlic, minced

Directions:
- Heat sugar in a heavy saucepan over medium-low heat until sugar becomes lightly brown. Slowly stir in soy sauce. Once the sugar and soy sauce are combined, stir in the water, star anise, curry leaves, ginger, and garlic. Increase heat and bring to a boil. Simmer until the sugar is dissolved, about 15 minutes. Remove from heat and cool. Strain sauce and pour into a lidded bottle or jar. Store in the refrigerator.

Smoked Turkey Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 large onion, chopped fine
- 2 medium potatoes, cooked, peeled and diced
- 1 c. cooked green beans
- 1 c. shredded smoked turkey breast, chopped fresh
- parsley
- paprika

Directions:
- In a bowl, mix together the onion, potatoes, beans and turkey. Add dressing to moisten the mixture, then add more dressing, if desired.
- Garnish with sprinkling of fresh parsley and a dash of paprika.

Chocolate Cake Truffles

Ingredients:
- 150 g dark chocolate
- 500 g unsalted butter
- 2 tablespoons cream
- 14 cup icing sugar
- 2 teaspoons rum
- 13 cup cocoa powder
- 14 cup drinking chocolate

Directions:
- Combine the chocolate, butter, cream, sifted icing sugar and rum in a small pan.
- Stir over low heat until chocolate and butter have melted; remove from heat.
- Transfer mixture to medium mixing bowl.
- Refrigerate for 15 minutes or until semi-set.
- Using electric beaters, beat the mixture until it is creamy.
- Roll heaped teaspoonfuls combined cocoa and drinking chocolate until coated.
- Refrigerate until firm.

Company Chicken Casserole

Ingredients:
- 3 large chicken breasts, skinned and halved
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 2 Tbsp. oil
- 1 can cream of chicken soup
- 3/4 c. white wine
- 4 oz. can mushrooms
- 2 Tbsp. chopped green pepper
- 1/4 tsp. ground thyme

Directions:
- Sprinkle salt and pepper on chicken and brown in oil.
- Put in baking dish.
- Blend soup in drippings in pan.
- Gradually stir in wine.
- Add rest of ingredients.
- Boil for 1 minute.
- Pour over chicken.
- Bake covered for 25 minutes, and uncovered for 30 minutes at 350°.

Hamburger Stuff

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. ground chuck, browned, drained and crumbled
- 1/2 medium onion, chopped
- 1 small clove garlic, chopped
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1 (12 oz.) bottle salsa
- 1 lb. Mexican cheese
- 6 large flour tortillas

Directions:
- Mix ground chuck, onion, garlic, salsa, salt and pepper. Cook until onions and garlic are tender. Layer meat mixture and flour tortillas until all are used. Sprinkle small amount of cheese between each layer. End with meat mixture. Sprinkle remaining cheese over top. Bake at 350° for approximately 30 minutes.

Diced Carrots and Turnips

Ingredients:
- 2 pounds carrots, cut into 1/2-inch dice
- 1 1/2 pounds turnips, peeled and cut into 1/2-inch dice
- 3 tablespoons unsalted butter
- freshly grated nutmeg to taste

Directions:
- In a kettle of boiling salted water cook the carrots for 3 minutes, add the turnips, and boil the vegetables for 3 to 5 minutes, or until they are tender.
- Drain the vegetables and transfer them to a serving dish.
- Add the butter, cut into bits, the nutmeg, and salt and pepper to taste and toss the mixture until the butter is melted.

Stuffed-Pepper Casserole

Ingredients:
- 6 medium green peppers
- 2 Tbsp. butter, melted
- 1/2 c. onion, chopped
- 1/2 c. celery, chopped
- 1 (20 oz.) can tomatoes (undrained)
- 1 (8 oz.) can tomato sauce
- 1 clove garlic, crushed
- 1 tsp. dried basil leaves
- 1 tsp. dried oregano leaves
- 2 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 tsp. pepper
- 1 egg
- 1 tsp. Worcestershire sauce
- 1 1/2 lb. ground chuck
- 1 1/2 c. cooked rice

Directions:
- Cut off tops of peppers; remove ribs and seeds. Chop edible portion of tops; set aside. Wash peppers. Place peppers in large kettle with 2 quarts salted water. Bring to boiling; cover. Reduce heat and simmer 5 minutes. Drain peppers; set aside.

Spaghetti with Broccoli, Tomato, and Roasted Peppers

Ingredients:
- 1 pound spaghetti
- 1 bunch broccoli (about 1 pound), trimmed and cut into 1-inch lengths; thick stems sliced thin
- 1/3 cup olive oil
- 2 garlic cloves, crushed
- 1 1/4 teaspoon crushed dried red pepper
- 1 medium tomato, cored and chopped (about 1 cup), or canned tomatoes, drained and chopped
- 1 jar (7 ounces) roasted red peppers, rinsed, drained, and cut into 1/8-inch-wide strips
- Grated Parmesan cheese

Directions:
- Cook spaghetti in plenty of boiling salted water for 3 minutes; add the broccoli; cook until spaghetti is al dente, or firm to the bite, and the broccoli is tender, about 7 to 10 minutes; drain.
- Heat the oil in a medium skillet; add the garlic and dried red pepper; saute 1 minute.
- Stir in the tomato; saute 5 minutes.
- Add the red peppers and heat through.
- Toss sauce with spaghetti and broccoli.
- Serve with grated cheese.

Black Eyed Pea Succotash Recipe

Ingredients:
- 1/2 large red onion, diced
- 1 red bell pepper, diced
- 1 green bell pepper, diced
- 4 tablespoons of olive oil, divided
- 2 cups corn kernels (thawed if frozen)
- 15.5 ounces black eyed peas, drained and rinsed
- 4 tablespoons lemon juice
- 4 tablespoons chopped fresh chives
- 1 teaspoon hot sauce
- Salt and pepper to taste
- For serving: 4 large red bell peppers

Directions:
- In a large skillet, heat 3 tablespoons of olive oil over medium high heat. Saute onion and bell peppers until softened, about 5 minutes. Add peas and corn. Saute until tender and heated through, about 3 minutes.
- In a large bowl, whisk together lemon juice, remaining olive oil, chives, and hot sauce. Stir in vegetables. Season with salt and pepper.
- To serve, cut each bell pepper in half and remove any ribs or seeds. Spoon succotash into bell pepper half. Garnish with leftover chives.

Applesauce Carrot Cake

Ingredients:
- 2 cups whole grain wheat flour
- 1/2 cup sugar
- 2 teaspoons baking soda
- 1 1/2 teaspoons cinnamon
- 1/2 teaspoon nutmeg
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 3/4 cup unsweetened applesauce
- 1/4 cup olive oil
- 3 large eggs
- 3 cups carrots, coarsely chopped

Directions:
- In a large mixing bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking soda, cinnamon, nutmeg and salt.
- In a separate small bowl, combine the applesauce, oil and eggs. Add to the flour mixture, stirring until the ingredients are well blended. Add the carrots and mix again.
- Pour the batter into a greased 9" tube pan, or use a 9" x 13" rectangular cake pan, or two bread loaf pans, or a cupcake pan.
- Bake the cake in a preheated 350° F oven for about 1 hour, 10 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the thickest part of the cake comes out clean. Set the cake on a wire rack for five minutes. Then, run a knife around the edges of the pan to loosen the cake, and turn the cake out onto the rack to cool.

Barbecue Ranch Salad

Ingredients:
- 12 qt. iceberg lettuce, torn
- 1-1/2 qt. tomatoes, seeded, chopped Safeway 1 lb For $1.29 thru 02/09
- 3 cups canned black beans, rinsed
- 1-1/2 cups frozen corn, thawed
- 1-1/2 cups Pure Kraft Refrigerated Barbecue Ranch Dressing
- 3 cups Kraft Shredded Medium Cheddar Cheese
- 1-1/2 cups fresh cilantro, chopped

Directions:
- For each serving: Combine 2 cups (500 mL) lettuce, 1/4 cup (60 mL) tomatoes, 2 Tbsp.
- (30 mL) beans and 1 Tbsp.
- (15 mL) corn.
- Add 1 Tbsp.
- (15 mL) dressing; mix lightly.
- Transfer to serving plate or bowl; top with 2 Tbsp.
- (30 mL) cheese and 1 Tbsp.
- (15 mL) cilantro.
- Serve immediately.

Prune Bread

Ingredients:
- 1 Tbsp. butter
- 1 c. sugar
- 1 egg, well beaten
- 1 c. stewed prunes
- 1 c. prune juice
- 1 c. white flour
- 1 1/2 c. whole wheat flour
- 1 tsp. baking soda, dissolved in a little hot water

Directions:
- Mix ingredients in order and put in a greased and floured bread pan.
- Bake 1 hour at 350°.

Herb-Rubbed Pork Roast

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 teaspoons salt
- 1 1/2 teaspoons celery salt
- 1 teaspoon onion powder
- 1 teaspoon garlic powder
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- 1 teaspoon pepper
- 1/2 teaspoon dill weed
- 1/2 teaspoon dried rosemary, crushed
- 1/2 teaspoon rubbed sage
- 4 lbs rolled boneless pork loin roast

Directions:
- In a small bowl, combine the seasonings; rub over roast.
- Place on a rack in a shallow roasting pan coated with nonstick cooking spray.
- Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 1-3/4 to 2 hours or until a meat thermometer reads 160°.
- Let stand for 10 minutes before slicing.

Rice Imperial

Ingredients:
- 2 c. cooked wine
- 2 pkg. unflavored gelatin
- 1 Tbsp. grated mandarin peel
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 2 c. milk
- 1 c. mandarin juice
- 1 c. sugar
- 4 eggs, separated
- 1 c. heavy cream, whipped

Directions:
- Combine rice and 1 1/2 cups milk in a saucepan; cook uncovered over medium heat, stirring frequently for about 20 minutes or until all milk is absorbed.
- Soften gelatin in mandarin juice, stir in mandarin peel.
- Combine 1/2 cup sugar and the remaining 1/2 cup milk, 1/4 teaspoon salt and slightly beaten egg yolks in a 2 1/2- quart saucepan.
- Cook over low heat, stirring constantly until sugar is dissolved and mixture coats a spoon.
- Add gelatin mixture and rice.
- Continue cooking, stirring constantly until gelatin is dissolved and mixture well blended.
- Cool, then chill.

How To Freeze Okra

Ingredients:
- okra

Directions:
- Cut up okra.
- Put in a 3-quart dish or bowl and microwave for 7 to 10 minutes on High.
- Cool and bag.
- When ready to cook, thaw okra; add meal, flour, salt and pepper and fry.

Rhubarb Crisp

Ingredients:
- 4 c. cut rhubarb, unpeeled (1/2 inch)
- 1 c. sugar
- 1/4 c. unsifted flour
- 1/2 tsp. cinnamon or more to taste
- 1/2 c. cold water
- red food coloring

Directions:
- Pour mixed dry ingredients over rhubarb pieces in a bowl.
- Add cold water and mix together.
- Add food coloring.
- Pour into a greased pan.
- Cover with topping.

Slaw That Keeps

Ingredients:
- 1 large head cabbage
- 2 c. sugar
- 1/2 c. water
- 1 red mango
- 1/2 tsp. celery seed
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 c. vinegar
- 1/2 bunch celery, chopped
- 1 green mango
- 1 tsp. mustard seed

Directions:
- Shred the cabbage and sprinkle with salt.
- Let stand for 2 hours.
- Squeeze out cabbage.
- Boil the sugar, vinegar and water. Let cool.
- Combine cabbage, celery and mangos which have been chopped.
- Add seed and dressing.
- Place in covered container and keep in refrigerator.

Chicken-N-Rice

Ingredients:
- 1 can cream of mushroom soup
- 1 can cream of chicken soup
- 4 chicken breasts, skinned and split
- white wine
- wild rice

Directions:
- Mix soups in baking pan (13 x 9-inches).
- Use empty soup can to measure 1 can of wine and 1 can of rice.
- Add to soups.
- Lay chicken on top.
- Cover.
- Bake 1 hour at 350°.
- Uncover and stir. Bake 1 more hour.

Malted Milk Rounds

Ingredients:
- 2 c. packed brown sugar
- 1 c. butter or margarine, softened
- 1/3 c. sour cream
- 2 eggs
- 2 tsp. vanilla
- 4 c. all-purpose flour
- 3/4 c. plain malted milk powder
- 2 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 tsp. baking soda
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- Malted Milk Frosting (follows)

Directions:
- Heat oven to 375°.
- Mix brown sugar, margarine, sour cream, eggs and vanilla.
- Stir in flour, malted milk powder, baking soda, baking powder and salt.

Shrimp Or Crawfish Etouffee(For A Crowd!)  

Ingredients:
- 6 lb. shrimp or crawfish
- 2 blocks butter
- 3 cups chopped onions
- 1-1/2 cup chopped celery
- 2 chopped bell peppers
- 4 to 5 pods garlic, minced
- 3 cups chopped shallots
- 3 lemons, squeezed
- 1/2 cup cornstarch
- 3 cans Rotel
- 3 cans cream of mushroom soup
- 3 (8-oz.) cans mushrooms

Directions:
- Saute chopped seasonings in 1 block butter.
- Add lemon juice. Process Rotel in food processor.
- Add Rotel, mushrooms and soup. Add 5 cups water.
- Place peeled shrimp or crawfish in pot with 1 block butter and saute until firm.
- Add to mixture and cook on medium heat.
- Mix 1/2 cup cornstarch in 1 cup water.
- Add to etouffee.
- Cook 30 minutes more.
- Serve hot over rice.

Fruit Dip

Ingredients:
- 2 c. pineapple juice
- 2 Tbsp. Clear Jell
- 9 oz. Cool Whip
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 8 oz. cream cheese

Directions:
- Cook pineapple juice, sugar and Clear Jell until thick. When cooled, add cream cheese and Cool Whip.
- Mix together until creamy.

Persimmon Lassi Recipe

Ingredients:
- 2 medium-sized, ripe persimmons, quartered, core removed (see note)
- 1 tablespoon fresh juice from 1 lime
- 1 tablespoon agave nectar or simple syrup (see note)
- 1 cup plain yogurt, preferably full-fat
- 5 ice cubes

Directions:
- Add persimmons, lime juice, and agave to blender and blend on high until completely smooth, about 1 minute. Add yogurt and ice and blend on high until smooth, about 30 seconds more. Transfer to one or two glasses and serve immediately.

Hawaiian Pork Steaks For The Crock Pot!

Ingredients:
- 4 pork shoulder steaks, cut 1/2-inch thick
- 1 tablespoon oil
- 1 (8 ounce) can crushed pineapple
- 1/2 cup green pepper, chopped
- 1/2 cup brown sugar, packed
- 2 tablespoons quick-cooking tapioca
- 2 tablespoons ketchup
- 1 tablespoon soy sauce
- 1/2 teaspoon dry mustard
- 2 cups cooked rice, hot

Directions:
- Trim fat from steaks. In a large skillet, brown steaks on both sides in hot oil. Drain off fat. Transfer steaks to slow cooker.
- In a bowl, combine undrained pineapple, green pepper, brown sugar, tapioca, ketchup, soy sauce and dry mustard. Pour over steaks.
- Cover and cook on low for 7-8 hours or on high for 3 1/2-4 hours. Serve meat and sauce over hot rice.
- Enjoy!

Whole Meal Dinner(Crock-Pot)  

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 lb. hamburger
- 5 or 6 medium potatoes, diced
- 3 medium carrots, cut medium
- onions to desired flavor
- 1 can tomato soup

Directions:
- Put raw hamburger in the bottom of the crock-pot.
- Put diced potatoes, cut carrots and onions on top of burger.
- Pour soup over and crock during the day.

Cathedral Stained Glass Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 box each: red, green and orange Jell-O
- 1 box lemon Jell-O
- 1 pt. whipping cream
- 2 Tbsp. sugar
- 1 tsp. vanilla

Directions:
- Fix the first 3 boxes of colored Jell-O and let them jell.
- Cut into small irregular pieces (keeping each color separate).
- Fix the box of lemon Jell-O, using only 1/2 the specified amount of water. After dissolving the Jell-O, add ice cubes to make up the difference in the 1/2 water you omitted.
- Stir until the mixture begins to thicken.
- Whip the cream and after removing any remaining ice cubes that are in the lemon Jell-O, add the lemon Jell-O and the whipped cream together.
- Then add the cubed red/green/orange Jell-O to this mixture and stir carefully, so as not to break the pieces or make them run together.

Granola

Ingredients:
- 4 cups oats
- 1/2 cup raisins
- 1/2 cup bran flakes
- 1/2 cup coconut
- 1/4 cup dried cranberries
- 1/4 cup wheat germ
- 1/4 cup cornmeal
- 1/4 cup sunflower seeds
- 1/4 cup walnuts
- 1/4 cup almonds
- 1/4 cup corn oil
- 1/3 cup honey
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 325 degrees F.
- In a large baking pan, mix together the oats, raisins, bran, coconut, cranberries, wheat germ, cornmeal, sunflower seeds, walnuts, and almonds.
- Add the corn oil, honey, and vanilla and mix well.
- Spread the granola out on the pan in an even layer and bake until the granola is golden brown, about 45 minutes.
- Allow the granola to cool, and then serve topped with fresh fruit and milk or yogurt.

Cajun Barbecue Butter Recipe

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 lb Butter, unsalted,softened
- 1 Tbsp. Cayenne pepper
- 1 Tbsp. Pepper
- 2 tsp Salt
- 1 Tbsp. Red pepper, crushed
- 1 Tbsp. Thyme
- 1 Tbsp. Basil
- 1 tsp Oregano
- 1 1/2 ounce Garlic, chopped
- 2 Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce

Directions:
- Whip butter till smooth.
- Add in remaining ingredients and blend completely.
- Put into a storage container and refrigeratetill needed.

The Recipe(Sauce)  

Ingredients:
- 3 c. sugar
- 4 c. water
- 10 Tbsp. instant coffee
- 1 1/2 c. vodka
- 1/2 c. brandy
- 3 Tbsp. vanilla

Directions:
- Simmer sugar, water and instant coffee 30 minutes in a large saucepan.
- Cool.
- Add vodka, brandy and vanilla.
- Refrigerate. Use 1 cup of the syrup to 1 quart of vanilla ice cream.
- Blend just until mixed and serve in footed goblets along with a short straw.
- Chill goblets in freezer.
- Makes a super gift.

Santa's Spiced Walnuts

Ingredients:
- 14 cup water
- 1 cup sugar
- 14 teaspoon nutmeg
- 14 teaspoon ginger
- 1 teaspoon cinnamon
- 1 (1 lb) bag walnuts

Directions:
- In a large skillet put water, sugar and spices.
- Allow to boil and thicken.
- Put walnuts in pan and coat them with mixture.
- Spread out on a flat surface, separate and let them cool.

Chocolate-Peanut Butter Pizza

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. margarine
- 1 egg
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 1/2 tsp. vanilla
- 1/2 c. peanut butter
- 1 1/2 c. flour
- 2 c. mini marshmallows
- 6 oz. chocolate chips
- chopped nuts

Directions:
- Spray a large pizza pan.
- Mix the first 6 ingredients and bake for 10 minutes at 375°.
- Add the remaining ingredients to the partially baked crust.
- Continue to bake 5 to 8 minutes.

Biscuit Pudding

Ingredients:
- 6 to 8 biscuits, sliced
- 3 c. milk
- 4 eggs
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1/2 tsp. cinnamon
- 1/4 tsp. nutmeg
- additional sugar
- additional cinnamon

Directions:
- Place sliced biscuits in a 9 x 13 x 2-inch baking dish.
- Mix remaining ingredients well.
- Pour over biscuits.
- Sprinkle with additional cinnamon and sugar.
- Bake at 350° for 45 to 50 minutes. Serve with sauce.

Helen Doyle'S Irish Soda Bread

Ingredients:
- 3 cups all-purpose flour
- 1 cup raisins
- 1/4 cup sugar
- 1 tablespoon caraway seeds
- 2 teaspoons baking powder
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
- 1 1/2 cups nonfat buttermilk
- Vegetable cooking spray

Directions:
- Combine first 7 ingredients in a large bowl; stir well. Add buttermilk; stir well until a dough forms. Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface, and knead lightly 3 to 4 times. Pat dough into an 8-inch round cakepan coated with cooking spray. Bake at 350° for 45 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean and bread is golden. Let cool in pan 5 minutes; loosen edges of bread with a knife. Remove from pan; let cool on a wire rack. Cut into wedges.

Puffy Dessert Omelet

Ingredients:
- 6 large eggs, separated
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 cup sugar
- 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour
- 2 teaspoons grated lemon zest
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 2 tablespoons butter
- 1 pint fresh strawberries, sliced and sweetened
- Whipped cream

Directions:
- In a bowl, beat egg whites with salt until stiff peaks form; set aside. In another bowl, beat the egg yolks, sugar, flour, lemon zest and vanilla until smooth. Fold in egg whites. In a 10-in. ovenproof skillet, melt butter over medium-low heat. Add egg mixture. Cook without stirring for 6-7 minutes or until bottom is golden brown. Remove from the heat. Broil 4 in. from the heat for 1 minute or just until top is golden (watch carefully). Fold omelet in half; transfer to a serving platter. Top with strawberries and whipped cream.

Cajun Beef Brisket

Ingredients:
- 1 fresh beef brisket (1-1/4 to 1-1/2 pounds)
- 2 teaspoons Creole or Cajun seasoning
- 1 teaspoon garlic salt
- 1 teaspoon lemon-pepper seasoning
- 1 teaspoon dried parsley flakes
- 1 bay leaf
- 2/3 cup tomato sauce
- 1/4 cup sugar
- 1/4 cup packed brown sugar
- 1 to 2 teaspoons Liquid Smoke, optional
- 1/8 teaspoon hot pepper sauce

Directions:
- Place meat, fat side up, in a greased 11x7-in. baking dish. In a bowl, combine the Creole seasoning, garlic salt, lemon-pepper and parsley. Rub over meat. Add bay leaf. Cover and bake at 350° for about 2-1/2 hours or until meat is just tender. Drain and discard juices. Discard bay leaf.
- In a saucepan, combine the tomato sauce, sugar, brown sugar, liquid smoke if desired and hot pepper sauce. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Pour over meat. Cover and bake 30 minutes longer or until the meat is tender and sauce is heated through.

Rhubarb Cranberry Compote With Apples, Pears And A Splash Of Bitters

Ingredients:
- 1 bunch washed and cut rhubarb
- 2 peeled, cored and sliced pears
- 2 peeled, cored and sliced apples
- 1 1/2 cups fresh cranberries
- 1/2 cup apple cider
- 2 tablespoons sugar, to taste
- 2 teaspoons Angostura bitters
- 1 tablespoon fresh orange zest

Directions:
- In a sauce pan, combine the apple cider, sugar and orange zest and bring to a near boil.
- Add the apples and pears and cook over medium heat for 5-7 minutes, then add the rhubarb and continue to cook for a few minutes longer until it starts to soften. At this point, toss in the cranberries and bitters. The cranberries will be done when they start to burst. (1 to 2 minutes over med-high heat.) Taste and add more sugar and bitters if necessary.
- Spoon over your favorite ice cream when cooled a bit and enjoy.

Creamy Potato Soup Recipe

Ingredients:
- 1 lg. onion
- 2 tbsp. fat, butter
- 1 tbsp. salt
- 1 1/2 c. dry instant mashed potato flakes

Directions:
- Chop the onion.
- Put into large pan with fat.
- Cook till onion is tender.
- Add in lowfat milk and salt.
- Heat just to a boil.
- Remove from heat.
- Stir in flakes.
- Serve warm.
- Makes 6, 1 c. servings.

Potato Chip Cookies

Ingredients:
- 1 c. margarine
- 1 c. white sugar
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 tsp. baking soda
- 1 (6 oz.) pkg. butterscotch morsels
- 1 c. brown sugar
- 2 eggs
- 2 1/2 c. flour
- 2 c. coarsely crushed potato chips

Directions:
- Cream together margarine and sugars.
- Add eggs and vanilla; beat well.
- Sift flour and soda together and add to creamed mixture.
- Then add crushed potato chips and butterscotch morsels. Drop by teaspoon on a greased cookie sheet about 2 inches apart. Bake at 375° for 10 minutes.
- Makes approximately 3 dozen cookies.

Hershey Bar Pie

Ingredients:
- 1 pie shell, baked
- 20 large marshmallows
- 6 Hershey bars with almonds
- 1/2 c. milk
- 2 (1/2 pt.) whipping cream

Directions:
- Bake pie shell in oven at 375° for 12 minutes or until golden brown; cool.
- Melt the marshmallows and 1/2 cup milk over low heat.
- Take off burner.
- Add 5 Hershey bars with almonds; let cool.
- Whip 1/2 pint whipping cream; fold into cooled mixture. Pour into baked pie shell.
- Whip the second 1/2 pint whipping cream.
- Add 3 tablespoons sugar and 1/2 teaspoon vanilla.
- Spread over first mixture.
- Grate 1 candy bar; sprinkle over top.
- Serves 8.

Stuffed Portabello Mushrooms

Ingredients:
- 2 medium Portabello mushrooms
- 1/4 c. Prosciutto ham, thinly sliced
- 1/4 c. fresh basil leaves
- 3/4 c. whole pimentos
- 1/2 c. shredded Monterey Jack cheese
- 1/2 c. shredded Cheddar cheese
- 1 (8 oz.) bottle Caesar dressing

Directions:
- Remove stem and skin mushroom caps by grabbing edge with thumb and forefinger and pulling.
- Put caps in small bowl and pour dressing over.
- Marinate 2 hours in refrigerator.
- Shake off excess dressing and put mushroom caps, round side down, in baking dish.
- Divide remaining ingredients and layer half in each cap starting with basil, followed by Prosciutto ham and Monterey Jack and Cheddar cheeses.
- Slice pimentos 1/2-inch thick and crisscross over top of stuffed caps.
- Bake at 400° for 5 minutes.
- Makes 2 servings.

Breakfast Drink

Ingredients:
- 1 banana
- 1 c. yogurt
- 1 c. orange juice
- 1 c. strawberries
- 1/2 tsp. vanilla
- 1 tsp. honey

Directions:
- Blend all of the ingredients in a blender.
- Pour into 3 (10 ounce) glasses.
- Garnish with fresh mint, if available.

Big Spender Cocktail Recipe

Ingredients:
- 3/4 ounce anejo tequila
- 3/4 ounce blood orange juice
- 1/2 ounce Clement Creole Shrubb liqueur (see note in intro)
- Ice
- 1 1/2 ounces sparkling rose wine
- Orange twist (optional)
- Orange zest (optional)

Directions:
- Combine the tequila, blood orange juice, and liqueur in a bar glass with ice; stir to chill.
- Strain into a chilled champagne glass and top with the sparkling rose.
- Garnish with an orange twist and a flamed orange zest (if using) and serve.

Macaroni And Cheese

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 lb. ziti
- 2 Tbsp. butter
- 6 oz. fresh mushrooms, sliced
- 3 c. heavy cream
- 3 egg yolks
- 1/4 lb. Mozzarella, shredded
- 1 1/3 c. Parmesan cheese
- salt and pepper

Directions:
- Heat butter; brown mushrooms slightly.
- Heat cream in a separate pan.
- Take off heat; stir in egg yolks vigorously, a little at a time.
- Still stirring, add Mozzarella and 1 cup Parmesan.
- Salt and pepper to taste.
- Add cream and cheese mixture to ziti and mushrooms.
- Sprinkle remaining Parmesan on casserole. Bake in preheated 400° oven for 15 minutes.

Walnut Chicken

Ingredients:
- 3 chicken breast halves
- 2 1/2 Tbsp. soy sauce
- 3/4 c. condensed chicken broth
- 2 tsp. cornstarch
- 3 Tbsp. oil (or more)
- 1 c. sliced celery
- 1 c. onion in wedges
- 1/4 c. green pepper strips
- 1/2 c. cashews
- 1 1/2 c. snow peas or 1 pkg. frozen
- 1 1/2 c. sliced mushrooms
- ginger to taste

Directions:
- Toss meat with 1 1/2 teaspoons soy sauce; set aside.
- Combine broth with cornstarch and rest of soy sauce. Heat 1 tablespoon oil.
- Add meat and stir-fry.
- Remove meat.
- Add remaining oil and vegetables; stir-fry.
- Add broth mixture to vegetables and boil. Add meat and nuts.
- Heat 1 minute.
- Add ginger.

Strawberry Wine Punch

Ingredients:
- 2 (10 ounce) packages frozen sliced strawberries in syrup, thawed
- 2 (6 ounce) cans frozen lemonade concentrate, thawed
- 2 quarts rose wine, chilled
- 1 quart club soda, chilled

Directions:
- Combine strawberries, lemonade and wine in a punch bowl.
- Slowly, pour in the club soda and stir gently.

Enchiladas

Ingredients:
- 1-1 1/2 lb ground beef
- 1 small onion
- 1 pkg 10 count flour or corn tortilla
- 1 can rotel
- 1/3 c milk
- 1 pkg taco seasoning
- 2 pkg mexican cheese
- 1 can mushroom soup
- dash of worcestershire sauce

Directions:
- Brown ground beef and onion, drain. mix beef mixture, soup, rotel, seasoning, milk and worcestershire sauce together. Put cheese in tortilla shells and roll; place in buttered 9x13 casserole pan. Pour beef mixture over, pour extra cheese on top. Bake 350° for 30 min. Top with lettuce, tomato, black olives and sour cream.

Sweet Potato Pie

Ingredients:
- 2 c. cooked, mashed sweet potatoes
- 1 stick margarine (1/2 c.)
- 1/4 c. milk
- 1 1/4 c. sugar
- 1 egg, beaten
- 1 tsp. vanilla

Directions:
- Boil sweet potatoes in clear water until tender.
- Peel while warm.
- Put in large mixer bowl and, while warm, mash at low speed. Add butter, sugar, egg, milk and vanilla.
- Pour into unbaked pie shell and bake at 350° until well set and lightly browned, about 30 to 40 minutes.

Sweet Potato Crisp

Ingredients:
- 12 sweet potatoes
- 1/4 c. flour
- 1 1/2 tsp. freshly ground black pepper
- 3/4 c. butter
- 1/2 c. brown sugar
- 1/4 c. heavy cream
- 1/4 c. finely chopped nuts

Directions:
- Cook sweet potatoes; peel and slice crosswise, about 3/8 inch thick.
- Spread in a buttered, large but shallow baking-serving dish.
- Cut butter into flour and brown sugar.
- Add pepper, cream and nuts; mix well.
- Sprinkle over potato slices.

Juicy Meat Loaf

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 lb. ground beef
- 3/4 c. uncooked oats
- 2 eggs, beaten
- 1/4 c. chopped onion
- 2 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1 c. tomato sauce
- potatoes, peeled and quartered
- carrots, peeled
- 1 c. Italian tomato soup

Directions:
- Combine first 7 ingredients; surround meat loaf with potatoes and carrots.
- Pour can of tomato soup over meat loaf.
- Cook at 350° for 1 to 1 1/2 hours or until potatoes and carrots are done.

Ice Cream and Berry Sponge

Ingredients:
- 500 ml ice cream, softened, any flavour
- 1 sponge cake, double layer, unfilled
- 250 g berries, for decoration
- 60 g milk chocolate, grated, for decoration

Directions:
- Soften ice cream in fridge for about 10 minutes.
- Place one layer of sponge on serving dish.
- Spread 2/3 of ice cream over this layer.
- Top with next layer of cake and then spread remaining ice cream over it.
- Decorate with an assortment of berries and chocolate.
- Cover with plastic wrap.
- Place in airtight container and freeze till needed.

Chocolate Almond Torte

Ingredients:
- 4 oz. semi-sweet chocolate
- 8 Tbsp. butter (1 stick)
- 2/3 c. sugar
- 3 eggs
- 1 2/3 c. ground almonds (about 8 oz.)
- 1 tsp. vanilla extract
- 1/4 tsp. almond extract
- confectioners sugar

Directions:
- In a large heavy saucepan, over medium heat, melt the chocolate with the butter.
- Mix in the sugar with a whisk, followed by the eggs, almonds, vanilla and almond extracts. Spray an 8-inch layer pan with spray shortening; line the bottom of the pan with parchment or wax paper.
- Spray with more shortening and dust with flour.
- Turn the batter into the prepared pan and bake in a preheated 375° oven for 25 minutes.
- Cool in pan on rack for 20 minutes.
- Turn cake out of pan and peel off paper. Finish cooling.
- Dust with confectioners sugar.
- Makes 12 servings.

Barbecue Brisket

Ingredients:
- 3 to 4 lb. beef brisket
- 1 tsp. onion, garlic and celery powder
- 1 tsp. black pepper
- 2 tsp. liquid smoke
- 2 Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce

Directions:
- Combine spices and seasonings and pour over meat.
- Marinate overnight in closed container in icebox.
- Cook 3 to 4 hours at 300°.
- The last hour pour one cup of Kraft hot barbecue sauce. When done take from oven and slice; ready to eat.
- Use the mild sauce if you like.

Sauerkraut Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 large can sauerkraut
- 1/4 c. chopped onion
- 1/4 c. chopped celery
- 1/4 c. chopped green pepper
- 1 c. sugar
- 1/2 c. vinegar

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients together.
- Refrigerate for several hours before serving.

Bacon-Corn Chowder

Ingredients:
- 1/2 lb. sliced bacon, cut in 1-inch pieces
- 2 small onions, sliced
- 1 Tbsp. flour
- 1 c. water
- 2 c. diced potatoes
- 1/2 c. chopped celery
- 2 bay leaves
- 2 cans creamed corn
- 1 c. milk
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper

Directions:
- Fry bacon until crisp.
- Drain.
- Saute onion in drippings for about 5 minutes.
- Blend in flour and mix to a smooth paste. Gradually add water and stir until smooth.
- Add potatoes, celery and bay leaves.
- Cover and cook over low heat.
- Blend in corn, milk, seasonings and bacon.
- Heat and serve.

Baked 4 Bean Casserole

Ingredients:
- 1 can pork and beans
- 1 can kidney beans
- 1 can lima beans
- 1 can butter beans
- 1 c. brown sugar
- 1 lb. bacon, cut into 1-inch pieces
- 1/2 c. vinegar
- 1 tsp. garlic salt
- 1 tsp. dry mustard
- 2 large onions, chopped

Directions:
- Mix beans with juices and all other ingredients in a baking dish.
- Cook, uncovered, for 3 1/2 hours in a 325° oven.
- Great for a potluck.

Lemon Sugar Cookies

Ingredients:
- 3 c. unsifted flour
- 2 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 2 c. sugar
- 1 c. shortening
- 2 eggs
- 1/4 c. ReaLemon lemon juice
- additional sugar

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350°.
- Stir together the flour, baking powder and salt; set aside.
- In a large mixer bowl, beat the sugar and shortening until fluffy.
- Beat in eggs.
- Stir in dry ingredients, then ReaLemon brand; mix well.
- Chill 2 hours.
- Shape into 1 1/4-inch balls.
- Roll in additional sugar.
- Place 2 inches apart on greased baking sheet; flatten.
- Bake 8 to 10 minutes or until lightly browned.
- Makes 8 dozen.

Bisquick Cinnamon Scones

Ingredients:
- 2 cups Bisquick baking mix
- 1/3 cup milk
- 1 egg
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 3 tablespoons sugar
- 1 teaspoon cinnamon

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 425.
- Mix together all ingredients well.
- Take large rounded tablespoons of mixture and drop onto a non--greased pan.
- Bake for 10-12 minutes.

Dena'S Delirious Bean Dip

Ingredients:
- 1 large can Rosarita beans
- 1 pt. sour cream
- 1 c. guacamole (if avocados not in season, use store bought avocado sauce)
- 1 c. Longhorn cheese, grated
- 1 diced tomato
- 1 can black olives, sliced
- 1/4 c. chopped green onions
- 1 bag tortilla chips

Directions:
- Place beans in a 9-inch glass casserole.
- Layer with sour cream and guacamole.
- Add grated cheese followed by tomatoes and black olives.
- Add remaining ingredients.
- Chill for one hour. Serve dip with the tortilla chips and enjoy!

Raisin Ice Water Pickles

Ingredients:
- 2 qt. cucumbers
- 1/4 c. salt
- 2 to 3 trays ice cubes
- 3/4 c. raisins
- 2 1/2 c. vinegar
- 2 1/2 c. sugar
- 2 tsp. celery seed
- 2 tsp. turmeric
- 1 tsp. ground cloves
- onion rings if desired
- red peppers if desired

Directions:
- Slice cucumbers as for bread and butter pickles.
- Sprinkle salt over top.
- Add ice cubes to cover.
- Let stand 3 hours (add onion and red pepper, if desired).
- Drain well.
- Put raisins in enough water to barely cover.
- Add all other ingredients.
- Pour over cucumbers and bring to a boil.
- When green color goes, pack in jars and seal.
- Be sure some raisins get in each jar.

Peachy, Pineapple Cooler with a Ginger Zinger

Ingredients:
- 3 ripe peaches, sliced
- 2 cups ripe pineapple, cubed
- 1 cup pineapple-orange juice
- 1 teaspoon pickled ginger, chopped
- 1 tray ice cube
- 1 tablespoon honey, to taste
- 4 12 fluid ounces coconut rum (Can be ommitted)

Directions:
- Put all ingredients into blender.
- Blend very well, stopping to stir when necessary, until smoothie consistency is reached!

Mexican Dip

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 1/2 c. onion, chopped
- 1 clove garlic, mashed
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 (8 oz.) can tomato sauce
- 1/4 c. catsup
- 1/2 tsp. oregano, crushed
- 1 tsp. sugar
- 1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese
- 1/3 c. Parmesan cheese or 1 small jalapeno pepper (optional)

Directions:
- Brown ground beef, onion, garlic and salt; drain and add remaining ingredients. Heat in crock-pot.

Edinberg Squares

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. oil
- 1/2 c. brown sugar
- 1 c. flour
- 1 1/2 c. oats
- 2 c. any thickened fruit mixture (apples, peaches or berries)

Directions:
- Cream together oil and brown sugar.
- Add oats and flour. Divide this mixture in half.
- Press one half of the mixture on the bottom of an 8 x 8-inch square pan.
- Put in thickened fruit. Sprinkle the rest of the crumble mixture on top of the thickened fruit.
- Bake at 350° for 40 minutes.

Hush Puppies

Ingredients:
- 2 c. corn meal
- 1 Tbsp. flour
- 1 tsp. soda
- 1 tsp. baking powder
- 1 Tbsp. salt
- 1 whole egg
- 6 Tbsp. chopped onion
- 2 c. buttermilk

Directions:
- Mix and sift all dry ingredients.
- Add chopped onion.
- Combine the beaten egg with the milk; add to dry ingredients.
- Drop by spoonfuls into deep, hot grease where fish are cooking.
- When done, they will float.
- Drain well.

Crunchy Cabbage Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 package (3 ounces) chicken ramen noodles
- 1/2 cup canola oil
- 3 tablespoons cider vinegar
- 2 tablespoons sugar
- 1/2 teaspoon dried oregano
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon pepper
- 5 cups shredded green cabbage
- 3/4 cup chopped green pepper
- 3/4 cup chopped sweet red pepper
- 1/2 cup shredded red cabbage
- 1/2 cup shredded carrot
- 1/2 cup chopped green onions
- 1/2 cup slivered almonds, toasted
- 2 tablespoons sesame seeds, toasted

Directions:
- Break noodles; set aside. In a jar with a tight-fitting lid, combine the oil, vinegar, sugar, oregano, salt, pepper and half of the contents from the noodle seasoning packet; shake well. (Discard remaining seasoning or save for another use.)
- In a large bowl, combine the remaining ingredients. Add noodles and dressing; toss to coat. Serve immediately.

Brownies

Ingredients:
- 3/4 c. flour
- 1 c. sugar
- 1/3 c. cocoa
- 1/2 tsp salt
- 1/2 c. crisco
- 2 eggs
- 1 tsp vanilla

Directions:
- Mix together and pour into greased and floured 8 in. pan. Bake at 350° for 25 min. Best when cool.

Green Pea Casserole

Ingredients:
- 1 c. onions, chopped
- 1 c. celery, chopped
- 1 c. green pepper, chopped
- 4 oz. pimiento, chopped
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1 stick butter
- 1 can sliced water chestnuts, save liquid
- 4 c. frozen peas
- 1 can mushroom soup
- bread crumbs to garnish

Directions:
- Saute onions, celery and green pepper in butter.
- Drain water chestnuts, saving liquid to dilute soup.
- Remove sauteed vegetables from skillet and combine with other ingredients.
- Mix well.
- Pour into greased casserole.
- Sprinkle crumbs over and bake 20 minutes at 350°.
- Serves 8 generously.

Christmas Cranberry Appetizer

Ingredients:
- 1 tablespoon butter
- 2 cups thinly sliced onions
- 1/4 cup balsamic vinegar
- 1/2 cup dried cranberries
- 1 tablespoon sugar
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon grated orange rind
- 16 crackers
- 8 ounces reduced-fat cream cheese

Directions:
- Melt butter in a pan over medium heat. Add onions and saute 15 to 18 minutes, or until golden and tender.
- Stir in vinegar, cranberries, sugar, salt, and orange rind; Cook, stirring occasionally, 2 to 4 minutes or until liquid is reduced to about 2 tablespoons.
- Spread cream cheese onto the crackers.
- Top each with cranberry compote.

Buffalo Chip Cookies

Ingredients:
- 1 c. shortening
- 1 c. butter or margarine
- 2 c. brown sugar
- 2 c. sugar
- 2 tsp. vanilla
- 4 eggs
- 4 c. flour
- 2 tsp. soda
- 2 tsp. baking powder
- 2 c. uncooked oatmeal
- 1 c. cornflakes
- 1 c. nuts
- 1 c. coconut
- 2 c. chocolate chips

Directions:
- Use a very large mixing bowl.
- Mix together shortening and margarine.
- Blend in sugars, vanilla and eggs.
- Sift together flour, soda and baking powder; add to mixture.
- Add remaining ingredients.

Mexican Casserole

Ingredients:
- 1 pkg. flour tortillas
- 1 whole chicken
- 2 cans Ro-Tel, drain juice
- 2 big cartons sour cream

Directions:
- Boil chicken, then tear in small pieces.
- Keep chicken broth. Mix Ro-Tel and sour cream.
- In baking dish, dip tortilla in chicken broth and lay in pan; add some chicken, then sour cream mixture, then some cheese.
- Repeat 2 more times.
- When ready to eat, may want to put some salsa on yours.

Creme De Menthe Bars

Ingredients:
- 1/2 cup butter or 1/2 cup oleo
- 4 tablespoons cocoa
- 1/2 cup powdered sugar
- 1 beaten egg
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 2 cups crushed graham crackers
- 1 1/2 cups chopped nuts
- 1 cup coconut
- 1 1/2 cups butter
- 3 tablespoons creme de menthe
- 2 teaspoons dry instant vanilla pudding
- 2 cups powdered sugar
- 1/4 cup butter
- 1 cup chocolate chips

Directions:
- Melt the 1/2 cup butter and cocoa, let cool. Then add the 1/2 cup powdered sugar, beaten egg, vanilla, graham cracker crumbs, nuts and coconut. Put in 9 x 13 pan and refrigerate.
- Melt 1 1/2 cup butter, creme de menthe, pudding, 2 cups powdered sugar. Beat until smooth and spread over crust. Refrigerate until set.
- Melt the 1/4 cup butter and chocolate chips. Spread on top. Refrigerate until firm. Cut into small bars and enjoy!

Citrus Szechuan Noodle Bowl Sauce

Ingredients:
- 2 1/2 cups orange juice (preferably fresh-squeezed)
- 1 cup pineapple juice
- 3/4 cup soy sauce
- 1/4 cup brown sugar
- 3 tablespoons squeezed lemon juice
- 2 tablespoons hot chili sauce (or more, if you want this dish to be at all spicy...see review by Amanda in Oz)
- 2 tablespoons molasses
- 2 tablespoons rice wine vinegar
- 1 1/2 teaspoons ginger powder
- 3 tablespoons cornstarch
- 1/2 cup water

Directions:
- In a two quart saucepan, combine all ingredients except cornstarch and water; place over medium high heat and stir occasionally until mixture begins to simmer.
- Blend cornstarch into water and add to sauce.
- Bring to a full boil, stirring often, for at least one minute or until thickened.
- Remove from heat and serve over the vegetables, noodles and protein of your choice.

Cheese Souffle

Ingredients:
- 1 Tbsp. butter
- 1 Tbsp. flour
- pinch of salt
- 1/2 c. milk
- 1/4 c. shredded processed cheese
- 1 egg yolk, beaten
- 1 egg white, beaten stiff

Directions:
- Melt the butter.
- Blend in the flour; add the salt.
- Add the milk; stir smooth.
- Add the cheese; stir until cheese melts. Cool.
- Fold in the beaten egg yolk.
- Fold in the beaten egg white. Bake in ungreased casserole at 300° for 1 hour.
- Serves 1.

Blueberry White Chocolate Chip Cookies

Ingredients:
- 2/3 cup unsalted butter, melted
- 2 cup brown sugar, lightly packed
- 2 eggs
- 2 tbsp hot water
- 1 cup dried blueberries
- 1/2 cup white chocolate chips
- 2 2/3 cup flour
- 1 tsp baking powder
- 1 tsp baking soda
- 1/4 tsp salt

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 375F Fahrenheit.
- Combine melted butter, brown sugar, eggs and hot water and mix well.
- Stir in remaining dry ingredients.
- Mix in dried blueberries and white chocolate chips.
- Drop by tablespoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets.
- Bake for 8-10 minutes or until lightly browned.

Avocado, Tomato And Hearts Of Palm Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 can 14 Oz. Hearts Of Palm, Sliced
- 1 whole Tomato, Thinly Sliced
- 1 whole Avocado, Quartered And Sliced
- 1/4 cups Extra Virgin Olive Oil
- 1 Tablespoon Fresh Orange Juice
- 1 Tablespoon Fresh Lime Juice
- Salt To Taste
- Pepper To Taste

Directions:
- On a platter, arrange the hearts of palm, tomato, and avocado slices in a single overlapping layer.
- Sprinkle with salt and pepper.
- Whisk together oil and juices and drizzle over the salad.

Mac And Cheese

Ingredients:
- 1 pkg. macaroni
- Cheddar cheese
- 1/3 c. milk

Directions:
- Cook and drain macaroni.
- Butter Pyrex dish.
- Place a layer of Cheddar cheese, layer macaroni, layer of cheese, etc.
- Finish with layer of cheese.
- Add about 1/3 cup milk to complete.
- Bake at 375° for about 45 minutes or until cheese is golden and bubbly.

Ww 1 Point - Sausage Balls

Ingredients:
- 1 lb kraft cracker barrell 2% cheddar cheese
- 3 cups Bisquick reduced-fat baking mix
- 1 lb jennie-o italian lean turkey sausage, hot

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients well.
- Roll into 60-70 sausage balls.
- Bake at 400* for 13-15 minutes.
- 1 Point per sausage ball.

Easy Chili

Ingredients:
- 1 c. diced onion
- 1 lb. ground beef or turkey
- 2 cans Bush's chili beans
- 1 can tomato soup
- 1 to 2 cans tomatoes, diced
- 2 (15 oz.) cans tomato sauce
- 1 pkg. Schilling chili seasoning

Directions:
- Brown onions and ground beef or turkey (microwave; drain well).
- Add canned ingredients and seasoning mix.
- Salt and pepper to taste.
- Put in crock-pot and cook.
- Top with sour cream, shredded Cheddar and diced green onions.

Helado De Mango(Mango Sherbet)  

Ingredients:
- 1 c. water
- 1/2 c. sugar
- dash of salt
- 2 mangos, peeled and sliced
- 1/2 c. light cream
- 1/4 c. lemon juice
- 2 egg whites
- 1/4 c. sugar

Directions:
- In a saucepan, combine water, 1/2 cup sugar and salt.
- Cook for 5 minutes; cool.
- In blender container, combine mangos and cream.
- Cover; blend until smooth.
- Stir in cooled syrup and lemon juice.
- Freeze in one 6-cup or two 3-cup freezer trays until partially frozen.

French Onion Soup

Ingredients:
- 1/4 c. butter
- 8 c. thinly sliced onions
- 1 1/2 tsp. salt
- 3 Tbsp. flour
- 3 cans beef consomme
- 4 cans water
- freshly ground pepper to taste
- French bread, sliced 1/2-inch thick and toasted
- Mozzarella cheese slices

Directions:
- Saute butter and onions until golden brown.
- Sprinkle flour over onions and stir until blended.
- Remove from heat.
- Pour consomme and water in pan and bring to a boil.
- Add onion mixture and reduce heat to low.
- Cover soup and simmer for 40 minutes. When serving, add piece of French bread to soup bowl and top with Mozzarella cheese.
- Bake or broil to melt cheese.

Spice-Braised Pot Roast

Ingredients:
- 1 boneless beef chuck roast (2-1/2 pounds)
- 1 can (14-1/2 ounces) diced tomatoes, undrained
- 1 medium onion, chopped
- 1/4 cup white vinegar
- 3 tablespoons tomato puree
- 1 tablespoon poppy seeds
- 1 bay leaf
- 2-1/4 teaspoons sugar
- 2 teaspoons Dijon mustard
- 2 garlic cloves, minced
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon ground ginger
- 1/2 teaspoon dried rosemary, crushed
- 1/2 teaspoon lemon juice
- 1/4 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1/4 teaspoon ground turmeric
- 1/4 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes
- 1/8 teaspoon ground cloves
- Hot cooked egg noodles

Directions:
- Place roast in a 5-qt. slow cooker. Mix all remaining ingredients except noodles; pour over roast. Cook, covered, on low until meat is tender, 7-9 hours.
- Discard bay leaf. If desired, skim fat and thicken cooking juices. Serve pot roast with noodles and juices.

New York Strip With Watercress Salad 

Ingredients:
- 2 thick-cut NY strips
- 2 bags watercress
- 1 cup red wine
- 3 tablespoons soy sauce
- 4 cloves garlic
- EVOO
- Salt
- Pepper

Directions:
- MARINADE
- Combine 1 cup of wine with 4 cloves minced garlic and 3 tablespoons of soy sauce
- 
- Add strips to freezer bag with marinade. Remove air. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours.
- 
- Wash and dry watercress. Remove desired amount of stems. Set aside.
- 
- Coat strips with EVOO and S & P. Grill strips to desired temp on a hot grill. Let rest for 10 minutes.
- 
- Add salt to taste and EVOO to watercress and toss.
- 
- Serve steak with salad.
- 
- Enjoy.

Quick Veggie Stew

Ingredients:
- 1 qt. sugarless commercial spaghetti sauce or tomato sauce
- 1 lb. tofu, cubed
- 4 c. diced zucchini (1/2 to 3/4-inch pieces)
- 1 bell pepper, diced
- 2 c. broken string beans
- 1/2 lb. mushrooms, split
- 1/2 lb. cheese, grated

Directions:
- Turn medium heat on under large pot with your favorite sugarless sauce in it and leave on as you cut and add next 5 ingredients (should take about 5 minutes).
- When all vegetables are added, cover and simmer 10 to 15 minutes, until sauce begins to boil.
- Gently stir in grated cheese or sprinkle on surface of vegetables.
- Cover and cook just until cheese melts.

Essence of Peach Soup

Ingredients:
- 2 cantaloupes
- 1 peach, peeled and pitted
- 1 cup peach nectar
- 1/2 cup Rhine, White Zinfandel or other fruity wine
- Juice of 1 lime
- 4 Tbs. toasted pine nuts for garnish
- 1 cup raspberries for garnish
- Mint leaves for garnish

Directions:
- Slice cantaloupes in half crosswise, leaving flat ends intact.
- Scoop out seeds, and remove flesh from both melons, leaving an inner layer.
- Use flesh from 1/2 melon only, reserving remainder for another use.
- Place melon flesh, peach, peach nectar, wine and lime juice in blender, and process until smooth.
- Pour into container, and refrigerate until chilled.
- To serve, pour about 1 cup soup into each melon half, and garnish with pine nuts, raspberries and mint leaves.

Creamy Alfredo Sauce

Ingredients:
- 3 tsp. butter or margarine
- 1 c. light cream
- 1/3 c. grated Parmesan cheese
- 1/8 tsp. pepper
- pinch of ground nutmeg
- 1 (16 oz.) box linguine, cooked according to pkg. directions and drained

Directions:
- In medium saucepan over medium-low heat, melt butter.
- Add cream.
- Cover and simmer 2 minutes.
- Stir in cheese, pepper and nutmeg.
- Serve over hot cooked pasta.
- Makes about 1 cup sauce.

Big Mac Sauce

Ingredients:
- 1/4 cup Miracle Whip
- 1/4 cup mayonnaise
- 2 tablespoons orange French dressing
- 1/2 tablespoon sweet relish
- 2 teaspoons dill relish
- 1 teaspoon sugar
- 1 teaspoon dried onion
- 1 teaspoon white vinegar
- 1 teaspoon ketchup
- 1/8 teaspoon salt

Directions:
- Mix everything very well a small container. Cover, and refrigerate at LEAST 1 hour before using.

Spanish Noodles

Ingredients:
- 1 large onion, chopped
- 1 green pepper, chopped
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 1 (1 lb. 12 oz.) can tomatoes
- 4 oz. egg noodles
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1 tsp. chili powder (amount to suit taste)
- 1 c. water
- American or Cheddar cheese (amount to suite taste)

Directions:
- Saute ground meat until it is browned. Add onion and pepper, stirring until both are slightly cooked. Add the tomatoes (use whole tomatoes which you mash up; it makes it better), salt, pepper, chili powder and water. Cook for a few minutes, then add noodles and cook until the noodles are almost tender. Put half the mixture in a 2 1/2-quart casserole, Pyrex, or flat dish that will hold that amount, that has been sprayed with Pam. Top with cheese. Put remainder of meat mixture in casserole and top with rest of cheese. Bake at 350° until the casserole is thoroughly heated (approximately 25 to 30 minutes) and all the cheese is melted. Serve with green salad and garlic bread or corn bread.

Peanut Butter Balls

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 c. peanut butter
- 1 c. margarine, melted
- 5 1/4 c. powdered sugar (about)
- 1 (6 oz.) pkg. chocolate chips
- 1/4 cake paraffin wax

Directions:
- Put peanut butter in bowl.
- Add melted margarine and mix well. Add powdered sugar until you can no longer mix with your hands. Roll into balls and lay
- on cookie sheet covered with wax paper.

Beef Stroganoff

Ingredients:
- 2 lb. round steak, cut into 1/4-inch strips
- 3 Tbsp. olive or vegetable oil
- 3/4 lb. mushrooms, sliced
- 2 Tbsp. flour
- 1/2 c. water
- salt and pepper
- 1 large onion, chopped
- 2 Tbsp. tomato paste or 2 medium tomatoes, chopped
- 1/2 c. dry sherry or dry red wine
- 1 pt. sour cream

Directions:
- Cut beef into strips 1/4 inch wide and 1 inch long.
- Brown meat in oil.
- Push meat to one side and add mushrooms and onion. Saute until onion is soft.
- Mix into meat mixture.
- Stir in tomato paste (or tomatoes).
- Sprinkle flour over all and blend well.
- Add sherry or wine and stir until a gravy is formed.
- Season to taste. Cover and simmer until meat is tender (about 45 minutes).
- Add sour cream just before serving.
- Heat through but do not boil. Serve over egg noodles.
- Serves 4 hungry people unless you have another side dish, then it could stretch to feed 6.

Caramel Peanut Butter Smoothie

Ingredients:
- 2 apples, peeled, cored and thinly sliced
- 2 bananas
- 6 ounces low-fat vanilla yogurt
- 34 cup marzetti caramel apple dip
- 12 cup peanut butter
- 2 cups ice cubes

Directions:
- Process apples, bananas, yogurt, dip, peanut butter and ice in blender until smooth, stopping once to scrape down the sides.
- Top with slice of strawberry and drizzle of caramel, if desired.
- Serve immediately.
- Note: You can use T. Marzetti Old Fashioned, Light or Fat Free Caramel Apple Dip.

Bread Pudding With Jack Daniels Sauce

Ingredients:
- 1 lb stale bread (loaf)
- 1 1/3 cups milk
- 3 eggs
- 4 ounces evaporated milk
- 1/4 cup butter
- 2/3 cup sugar
- 2 teaspoons vanilla
- nutmeg
- 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon
- 1/3 cup butter (cut into pieces)
- Sauce:
- 1/4 cup sugar
- 1/4 cup water
- 1/4 cup butter
- 1 ounce Jack Daniels Black Label Mix
- sugar
- water

Directions:
- Cube bread.
- Set aside in a large mixing bowl.
- Combine all ingredients except butter.
- Mix well and pour over bread.
- Soak bread in milk mixture for 15 minutes.
- Pour into a 13x9 buttered pan.
- Top bread mixture, with cut up butter.
- Bake at 325 for 60-90 minutes or until pudding mixture has risen 1 inch.
- Serve warm Sauce over bread pudding.
- Sauce
- combine ingredients and add sugar and water until dissolved.
- Add butter, and simmer until melted.
- Cook over high heat of 2 minutes.
- Add Jack Daniels, and simmer for 3-5 minutes.

Crock pot chicken and dumplings

Ingredients:
- 4 chicken leg quarters
- 2 chopped carrots
- 1 cup chopped onion
- 2 can biscuts
- 1 tbsp chopped garlic
- 1 1/2 can rotel
- 1 cup water
- 1 tbsp black pepper
- 1 tbsp celery flakes
- 3 tbsp butter

Directions:
- Put leg quarters and water in crock pot, cook on high for about an hour
- Add in butter, garlic, onion, rotel, carrots, pepper, butter, and celery flakes
- Let cook for about 3 or 4 more hours
- Use tongs to beging pulling out the leg quarters one at a time to debone them and add meat back to crock pot
- Let cook for about 45 more min
- Tear biscuits into quarter sized peices and add to crock pot ..( it helps if you push them under the juice with a spoon to keep them from sticking to each other
- Allow to cook for another 45 min to cook dumplings
- Mix slightly and enjoy

TSR Version of Taco Bell Fire Sauce by Todd Wilbur

Ingredients:
- 1 (6 ounce) can tomato paste
- 3 cups water
- 3 tablespoons vinegar
- 3 tablespoons canned jalapeno slices, finely minced
- 1 tablespoon chili powder
- 1 tablespoon dried onion flakes
- 2 teaspoons salt
- 2 teaspoons cornstarch
- 1 teaspoon cayenne pepper
- 1 teaspoon sugar
- 14 teaspoon onion powder
- 1 dash garlic powder

Directions:
- Combine the tomato paste with the water in a medium saucepan and whisk until smooth.
- Add the remaining ingredients and stir until combined.
- Heat mixture over medium high heat until it begins to boil.
- Continue to cook for about 3 minutes, stirring often.
- Remove from heat.
- When sauce has cooled, pour it into a sealed container and refrigerate.

Teri's Candied Yams

Ingredients:
- 5 (16 ounce) cans candied yams
- 1 cup sugar
- 12 teaspoon salt
- 14 cup butter
- 12 cup evaporated milk
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 1 egg
- 1 teaspoon cinnamon
- 1 cup brown sugar
- 1 cup chopped pecans
- 12 cup flour
- 14 cup melted butter

Directions:
- Combine all filling ingredients.
- Put in casserole dish.
- Mix all toping ingredients.
- Put on top of filling in casserole dish.
- Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour.

Bacon, Mushroom & Sun Dried Tomato Pasta Sauce

Ingredients:
- 250 g whole wheat linguine or 250 g other pastas, of your choice
- 6 slices bacon, chopped
- 12 medium mushrooms, sliced
- 3 hot chili peppers, seeded,deveined and chopped
- 1 teaspoon dried basil
- 6 sun-dried tomatoes packed in oil, drained & chopped
- 3/4 cup mild salsa, your choice
- salt & pepper
- parmesan cheese

Directions:
- Cook Pasta according to instructions, plan to have it ready just as the sauce is finished.
- Fry chopped bacon until almost crisp, drain fat.
- Add mushrooms and saute for apprx 5 minutes.
- Add Chilies, basil, sundried tomatoes and saute until heated through apprx 5 minutes.
- Add salsa heat until bubbling.
- Pour over drained cooked pasta & toss.
- Sprinkle with parmesan cheese & I hope enjoy.

Shoo Fly Pie Cake

Ingredients:
- 4 cups flour
- 2 cups brown sugar
- 34 cup butter
- 2 cups boiling water
- 1 cup dark molasses
- 1 teaspoon baking soda

Directions:
- Mix together the flour and brown sugar in a large bowl.
- Slowly mix in the butter.
- Set aside one cup of this mix for topping the cake.
- In another bowl mix together the boiling water, molasses, and baking soda.
- Slowly stir this mixture in to the dry mix bowl.
- Grease and flour a 9x13 pan.
- Pour the mixture into the pan and top with the remaining crumb topping.
- Bake at 350 degrees for 40 - 45 minutes.

Fudge Sauce

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. butter
- 2 1/4 c. powdered sugar
- 2/3 c. evaporated milk
- 6 single squares unsweetened chocolate

Directions:
- Mix all the ingredients.
- Allow mixture to melt in a pan over hot water for 30 minutes. Do not stir.
- Remove from heat and beat with a mixer. Store in the refrigerator.
- Thin with cream as needed.

24 Hour Salad

Ingredients:
- Old Fashion Fruit Dressing
- 1 c. (17 oz.) pitted dark sweet cherries, drained
- 2 c. (13 1/2 oz. each) pineapple chunks, drained (reserve 2 Tbsp. syrup)
- 3 oranges, pared, sectioned and cut up
- 1 c. miniature marshmallows

Directions:
- Prepare Old Fashioned Fruit Dressing.
- Mix fruits and marshmallows; toss with dressing.
- Cover and refrigerate at least 12 hours.
- Refrigerate leftover salad immediately.

Sugar Cookies

Ingredients:
- 2 c. flour
- 2 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 c. butter
- 1 c. sugar
- 1 egg
- 2 tsp. water
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. vanilla

Directions:
- Cream butter and sugar; add egg.
- Mix flour and baking powder in gradually.
- Add water and vanilla.
- Roll into balls.
- Roll into sugar.
- Press with a fork dipped in sugar.
- Bake on ungreased baking sheet.
- Bake at 350° for about 8 minutes.

Heavy on the Garlic Hummus

Ingredients:
- 2 (15 ounce) cans garbanzo beans, drained
- 12 cup tahini paste
- 12 cup lemon juice
- 6 teaspoons minced garlic
- 3 teaspoons ground cumin
- 14 teaspoon ground cayenne pepper
- 1 teaspoon white pepper
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 14 cup olive oil
- water, for thinning
- 14 cup minced parsley
- additional oil, for drizzling
- paprika

Directions:
- Place all ingredients except oil and parsely in food processor.
- Blend until smooth.
- Slowly add 1/4 cup olive oil and continue processing until mixed well.
- If mixture is too stiff add water a little at a time until it reaches a smooth and creamy consistency (you don't want it runny).
- Remove from processor and add parsley.
- Chill for at least four hours.
- Spread on plate in a thin layer.
- Drizzle additional oil on top.
- Sprinkle with paprika and served with pita bread.

Barry Tea

Ingredients:
- 4 level tsp. instant tea
- 1 1/2 c. boiling water
- 3/4 c. sugar
- 1/4 c. pineapple juice
- 1/8 c. grape juice
- 1/2 fresh lemon

Directions:
- Put tea in boiling water.
- Let set until clear.
- Pour into half gallon pitcher.
- Add sugar and dissolve.
- Add cold water until the pitcher is 3/4 full, then add pineapple juice, grape juice and fresh lemon.
- Serve with ice or hot.

Steak Marinade

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. teriyaki sauce
- 1/2 c. honey
- 1/2 c. Saucy Susan or apricot preserves
- 1/2 c. red wine vinegar
- 1/2 c. soy or Worcestershire
- 1/4 c. ketchup
- 1/2 c. Crisco oil
- 2 Tbsp. minced onion
- 1 Tbsp. garlic powder
- pepper to taste
- 2 Tbsp. Gulden's mustard
- 1/4 c. water

Directions:
- Mix first 4 ingredients thoroughly.
- Add all remaining ingredients.
- Marinate meat in sauce overnight.
- Yields enough marinade for 2 large London broils.

Witte'S Pudding Pie

Ingredients:
- 2 c. milk
- 1 pt. vanilla ice cream
- graham cracker pie crust
- 2 pkg. instant chocolate pudding mix
- 1 carton Cool Whip
- chocolate morsels

Directions:
- Mix milk, ice cream and pudding mix in a bowl.
- Pour into an already graham pie crust.
- Put in fridge for 2 hours.
- Take out of fridge.
- Top with Cool Whip and chocolate morsels.
- Serve immediately.
- Yummy, yummy, good!

Easy Pot Roast

Ingredients:
- 4 pounds boneless chuck roast
- 2 cups water
- 1 (1 ounce) package dry onion and mushroom soup mix
- 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce
- 3 potatoes, peeled and chopped
- 2 stalks celery, chopped
- 2 carrots, chopped

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
- Score roast on top and sides, and place in a medium sized oven bag. Combine water, soup mix, and Worcestershire sauce; pour over roast. Arrange vegetables around meat. Place oven bag on a roasting pan.
- Place roast in oven, and immediately reduce heat to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C). Bake for 1 1/2 hours for medium well done, or adjust time for desired doneness.

Biberli Cookies

Ingredients:
- 2 cups honey
- 1/2 cup sugar
- 4 1/2 cups flour
- 3 teaspoons cinnamon
- 1 1/2 teaspoons cloves
- 1 1/2 teaspoons anise
- nutmeg
- Filling
- 1 1/2 cups sugar
- 3 egg whites
- 3 -4 cups nuts, chopped finely

Directions:
- Filling:
- Beat egg wites until stiff. Add sugar and nuts gradually.
- Heat honey and sugar, bring to a boil.
- Take off heat and add flour and spices.
- Quickly roll out and cut into triangle shapes.
- Put small amt of filling in center of each triangle and fold up edges.
- Dough must be worked quickly and kept warm during rolling and filling process.
- Bake about 15-20 minutes at 350A°F.
- Store in airtight container at least 4 weeks. A piece of bread or apple will hasten ripening.

Lo-Cal Zucchini Puff

Ingredients:
- 4 c. diced zucchini
- 1 c. lite Bisquick
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/2 tsp. pepper
- 1/2 tsp. oregano
- 1/2 c. lo-cal grated Cheddar, divided
- 1/2 c. chopped onion
- 3/4 c. Egg Beaters
- 1/3 c. melted diet oleo

Directions:
- Stir together eggs, oil and oleo and add to Bisquick.
- Mix in rest of ingredients and 1/2 of the cheese.
- Pour into a 2-quart casserole sprayed with Pam.
- Top with remaining cheese.
- Bake at 350° for 50 to 60 minutes.
- Very good! Stuffing-like recipe.

Chocolate Mint Cookies

Ingredients:
- 1 c. softened margarine
- 2 1/2 c. flour
- 1 tsp. peppermint flavoring
- chocolate candy melts or bark and semi-sweet chocolate chips or squares to taste (approximately 1 c.)
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 1/2 tsp. vanilla extract
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 egg
- green food coloring

Directions:
- Cream
- margarine
- and
- sugar.
- Add
- flavorings and egg; mix well.
- Mix	in flour and salt to form a soft dough.
- Shape cookies with a cookie press onto ungreased cookie sheet.
- Bake at
- 400° for 6 to 9 minutes.
- Cool cookies.	Melt equal parts sweet chocolate
- and semi-sweet chocolate in microwave.
- Coat cookies by dipping in chocolate.
- Dry on waxed paper.
- (Hint: If chocolate is too thick, thin with melted vegetable shortening.)

Avocado Orange Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 head lettuce
- 2 avocados, peeled and sliced
- 3 fresh oranges, peeled and sliced
- 3/4 c. mayo
- 1/4 c. fresh orange juice
- 1/2 tsp. paprika
- 1/2 tsp. salt

Directions:
- Line serving bowl with lettuce leaves.
- Arrange layers of avocado and orange slices on top.
- Combine mayonnaise, orange juice, paprika and salt in small bowl and mix well.
- Pour over salad.

Kari's Squishy Summer Squash

Ingredients:
- 2 medium summer squash, slice
- saltine crackers, 1 package crushed
- 1 medium onion, chopped
- salt and pepper
- 8 ounces Velveeta cheese, sliced
- 12 cup butter or 12 cup margarine
- 2 cups milk
- cooking spray

Directions:
- Pre-heat oven to 375.
- Spray casserole dish (glass works best) with cooking spray.
- Start with a layer of 1/3 of the squash, sprinkle with salt and pepper.
- Add 1/3 of the onion, 1/3 of the velveeta and 1/3 of the cracker crumbs.
- Dot with butter.
- Start layering process over.
- Once all layers are added, pour milk over, cover and bake for 25-30 minutes.
- Remove cover and bake 15-20 minutes more.

Rolls

Ingredients:
- 6 c. plain flour
- 1 c. sugar
- 1 pkg. dry yeast
- 1 c. lukewarm water
- 1/2 c. Wesson oil or Crisco
- 1 tsp. salt

Directions:
- Mix like biscuits. Let rise double. Punch down; roll and cut. Put in greased/oiled pan. Let rise. Bake at 350°.

Chicken Ratatouille

Ingredients:
- 4 boneless skinless chicken breast halves
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 small eggplant, cubed
- 2 small zucchini, sliced
- 1 onion, sliced
- 1/2 lb mushroom, sliced
- 1 green pepper, sliced
- 1 large tomatoes, cubed
- 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
- 1 teaspoon dried parsley
- 1 teaspoon basil
- 1/2 teaspoon pepper
- 1/2 cup part-skim mozzarella cheese, shredded

Directions:
- Saute chicken in oil about 2 minutes per side.
- Add eggplant, zucchini, onion, mushrooms, and green pepper.
- Cook 10 minutes.
- Add tomato and remaining ingredients except.
- cheese and simmer 3-5 minutes more.
- Arrange chicken on top of vegetables and sprinkle cheese over chicken.
- Cook 1 more minute until cheese melts.
- Serve over barley or rice.

Italian Potatoes

Ingredients:
- 4 medium potatoes
- 4 Tbsp. Italian salad dressing
- salt and pepper to taste

Directions:
- Cut potatoes into thin slices.
- Place in microwave dish. Drizzle with Italian dressing.
- Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Cover and cook on High for 10 to 12 minutes or until potatoes are tender.

White Fudge

Ingredients:
- 1 can condensed milk
- 1 lb. light brown sugar
- 1 large pat butter
- 3 Tbsp. milk
- 1 c. walnuts
- 1 jar marshmallow cream

Directions:
- Cook first 4 ingredients until boiling point, then cook 10 more minutes.
- Take off stove and add jar of marshmallow cream and nuts. Place in greased pan.

Veggie Casserole

Ingredients:
- 1 (8 oz.) bag mixed veggies (corn, peas, carrots, green beans), steamed
- 1 c. celery
- 1 c. onions
- 1 c. Cheddar cheese
- 1 c. mayonnaise

Directions:
- Mix above ingredients.
- Bake at 350° for 30 minutes, until bubbly.

Vietnamese Lime-Chicken Patties

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. ground chicken
- 13 c. chopped scallions
- 13 c. Chopped cilantro
- 1/4 c. plain breadcrumbs
- 1 small lime
- 1 tbsp. fish sauce
- 2 serrano chiles
- 1 tsp. garlic paste
- 1 tsp. kosher salt
- vegetable oil

Directions:
- Combine all ingredients (except vegetable oil) and shape into 8 patties.
- Brush with vegetable oil and cook in a nonstick skillet over medium heat, 4 to 5 minutes per side until cooked through.
- Side idea: white rice or packaged sesame or peanut noodles.

Banana Punch

Ingredients:
- 1 large can pineapple juice
- 1 large can orange juice
- 6 c. water
- 4 c. sugar
- juice of 2 lemons
- 5 bananas, blended in the blender

Directions:
- Heat water and sugar until sugar is dissolved. Mix with other ingredients and freeze in cubes or rings until needed. Before using, let thaw to form slush. Place in punch bowl and add 2 or 3 large bottles of ginger ale.

Paksiw na pata or knuckles,pigs feet

Ingredients:
- 1 kilogram pata or pigs feet..or knuckles
- 1 cup of water
- 1/2 cup vinegar
- 1 cup soy sauce
- 1 clove garlic chopped
- 1 dash of pepper to taste
- 2 packages banana flower
- 1/4 cup sugar
- 1 piece of star anis

Directions:
- in a casserole combined all the ingredients,except the banana flower
- simmer the pata for about 1hour and 30 mins.on a medium fire, or until the pata is tendered ,stir occasionaly, let the sauce be caramelized..
- once cooked put the banana flower then simmer again for about 5 mins.

Lebkuchen

Ingredients:
- 2 3/4 c. flour
- 1/2 tsp. soda
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 1/2 tsp. cloves
- 1/2 tsp. nutmeg
- 1/2 c. finely chopped candied fruit
- 1/2 c. finely chopped nuts
- 1 c. Karo (blue label)
- 3/4 c. brown sugar, firmly packed
- 1 Tbsp. lemon juice
- 1 egg, slightly beaten

Directions:
- Sift together flour, soda and spices.
- Stir in candied fruit and nuts.
- Add Karo, sugar, lemon juice and rind (if desired) to beaten egg; mix well.
- Stir in flour-fruit mixture.
- Divide dough in half and turn out on well-greased and floured baking sheets. Moisten hands and flatten to 1/8-inch thickness (dough will rise during baking).
- Bake in hot oven at 400° for 12 to 15 minutes or until lightly brown.

Amaretto Fruit Dip

Ingredients:
- 2 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese
- 3/8 c. sour cream
- 3/8 c. sugar

Directions:
- Mix together; add Amaretto to taste.
- Serve with favorite fruits.
- Top with almonds.
- Low-fat substitutions work great.

Sausage Ring 1

Ingredients:
- 2 lb. sausage (turkey sausage has less fat)
- 2 eggs
- 1 1/2 c. cracker crumbs
- 1/2 c. milk
- 1/4 c. diced onions
- 1 c. apples, chopped (leave peel on!)

Directions:
- Combine all ingredients and mold into a ring.
- Bake at 350° for 1 hour or bake at 350° for 1/2 hour.
- Freeze.
- Thaw and bake for 1/2 hour at 350°.

Punch Bowl Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 prepared angel food cake
- 2 regular pkg. instant vanilla pudding, prepared
- 4 cans fruit or equivalent of fresh fruit
- 1 large whipped cream

Directions:
- Pinch 1/2 angel food cake into large pieces into a large bowl, cover with 1/2 fruit.
- Cover with 1/2 pudding, then repeat with remainder of angel food cake, fruit and pudding.
- Top with whipped cream and garnish with nuts or fruit.

Easy Brownies

Ingredients:
- 1 cup Unsalted Butter
- 2 cups White Sugar
- 1/2 cups Unsweetened Cocoa Powder
- 1 teaspoon Vanilla Extract
- 4 whole Eggs
- 1-1/2 cup All-purpose Flour
- 1/2 teaspoons Baking Powder
- 1/2 teaspoons Salt

Directions:
- Melt the butter and mix all ingredients together in a large bowl, or a bowl of a stand mixer until well combined.
- Bake at 350 degrees F for 25 minutes in a 9 x 13 inch greased pan.

Vegetable Chili

Ingredients:
- 2 c. coarsley chopped onion
- 1 c. chopped green pepper
- 1 c. fresh carrots, cut in 1 1/2-inch lengths and quartered
- 1 (16 oz.) can shelled beans (or pinto beans)
- 2 Tbsp. corn oil
- 1 (6 oz.) can mushroom pieces
- 1 (6 oz.) can tomato paste
- 1 Tbsp. chili powder
- 1 tsp. minced garlic
- 1 1/2 tsp. oregano
- 1/2 tsp. cumin
- 1/2 tsp. black pepper
- 1 tsp. sweet basil
- 1 c. water

Directions:
- Saute onion and pepper in oil until onion becomes transparent. Add carrots, beans, mushroom pieces, tomato paste, water and spices.
- Cook at low heat until carrot pieces are tender, about 1 hour.
- Serve over steamed rice or dry toast points.
- Serves four, with about half left for a second meal.
- Sometimes it seems more flavorful at the second meal, when it's been reheated.

Golden Granola

Ingredients:
- 1/4 cup maple syrup, or to taste
- 3 tablespoons nut butter of choice (I use tahini)
- 1 tablespoon cinnamon, ground
- 1/2 teaspoon allspice, ground
- 2 teaspoons cardamom, ground
- 1/2 teaspoon cloves, ground
- 1 tablespoon ginger, ground
- 2 teaspoons turmeric, ground
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 2 cups rolled oats
- 1/2 cup cashews ( or nuts and/or seeds of choice)
- 2 tablespoons chia seeds

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350F.
- In a large bowl, mix the maple syrup, avocado oil, spices and salt until combined.
- Add the chia seeds and then the oats and nuts.
- Place on lined baking tray ( I like to use a Silpat to make sure the cooking is as even as possible and the cleanup is quicker).
Bake until fragrant and golden brown on the edges, approximately 20-30 min or 10-15min with a convection oven.
- Enjoy! Store in an airtight container to keep it nice and crunchy!

Cinnamon Apples

Ingredients:
- 2 lb. cooking apples, cored, peeled and sliced
- 2/3 c. water
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 1 Tbsp. cornstarch
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 3 to 4 drops red food coloring

Directions:
- In saucepan combine all ingredients except apples.
- Bring to a boil until thickened.
- Pour over apples and bake at 350° for 1/2 hour, or until apples are tender.

Oriental Coleslaw

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 tablespoons olive oil
- 3 tablespoons lemon juice
- 1 1/2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar
- 1/2 cup rice vinegar
- 1 1/2 teaspoons maple syrup
- 3/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black ground pepper
- 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper or to taste
- 6 cups red cabbage thinly sliced
- 1 cup parsley chopped
- 3 tablespoons cilantro chopped
- 1 cup red onions minced

Directions:
- In a large bowl, combine oil, lemon juice, vinegars, maple syrup, salt, black pepper, and cayenne.
- Toss with cabbage; let stand at room temperature for 1 hour.
- Taste for seasoning and adjust if necessary, toss in parsley, cilantro and red onion.
- Serve at room temperature.

Nutella Dip 

Ingredients:
- 80 cream cheese z, 226g
- 5 3/16 tablespoons Nutella
- 3 tablespoons icing sugar
- 13/16 cup double cream

Directions:
- Whisk double cream until stiff peaks form
- In a separate bowl, mix together the cream cheese and icing sugar, then add the Nutella and mix.
- Finally, fold in the whipped cream and serve with strawberries.

Hot Chicken Salad Spread

Ingredients:
- 1 chicken
- 1 beaten egg
- 5 to 6 soda crackers
- broth
- salt to taste

Directions:
- Cook chicken until done.
- Skin and debone chicken.
- Grind meat.
- Add beaten egg, soda crackers, plenty of broth and enough salt to taste.
- Mix real good.

Linguine With Sauce Verde

Ingredients:
- 1 (10 oz.) pkg. chopped spinach
- 1 c. chicken broth
- mustard
- 3/4 c. skim milk Ricotta cheese
- juice
- 1/2 c. parsley
- 1/3 c. grated Parmesan cheese
- 1/2 tsp. dried basil
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- shrimp or lobster
- 1 large garlic clove
- parsley, minced
- 1 (16 oz.) linguine
- 1/2 c. toasted, slivered almonds

Directions:
- Process, except pasta and almonds, in a food blender.
- Heat to taste.
- Cook pasta as directed on package.
- Serve linguine with sauce and almonds, tossed to coat.
- Makes 8 servings.
- Contains 320 calories.

Hot Milk Cake

Ingredients:
- 2 c. sugar
- 3 eggs, beaten
- 1/4 lb. margarine*
- 1 c. milk
- 2 c. flour*
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 2 tsp. baking powder

Directions:
- Beat eggs and sugar, mixing well.
- Sift flour and baking powder and add to egg-sugar mixture.
- Heat butter and milk, add to mixture.
- Add vanilla.
- Place in
- large
- tube
- pan.
- Bake at 375° for 40 to 45 minutes.
- Cool before removing.

Ugly Duckling Pudding Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 box yellow cake mix
- 1 box instant lemon pudding
- 1 (16 oz.) can fruit cocktail including syrup
- 1 c. coconut
- 4 eggs
- 1/4 c. oil
- 1/2 c. firmly packed brown sugar (optional)
- 1/2 c. chopped nuts (optional)

Directions:
- Blend all ingredients, except brown sugar and nuts, in a large mixing bowl.
- Beat 4 minutes at medium speed.
- Pour into a greased and floured 13 x 9-inch pan.
- Sprinkle brown sugar and nuts on top.
- Bake at 325° for 45 minutes or until cake springs back when lightly touched and pulls away from sides of pan. (Do not underbake.)
- Cool in pan for 15 minutes.
- Spoon on hot Butter Glaze.

Italian Blt Sandwiches

Ingredients:
- 8 ounces Italian bread
- 1/4 cup Italian dressing
- 1/3 cup shredded parmesan cheese
- 1/2 cup mayonnaise
- 1/2 cup mustard
- 1/2 lb thinly sliced salami
- 1/2 lb thinly sliced mortadella or 1/2 lb bologna
- 1/2 lb thinly sliced provolone cheese
- romaine lettuce
- 3 plum tomatoes, sliced
- 1/2 lb bacon, cooked and cut in half

Directions:
- Cut bread diagonally into 8 slices. Arrange slices on baking sheet. Brush slices evenly with italian dressing and sprinkle with parmesan cheese.
- Bake at 375 for 6 minutes or until lightly toasted.
- Stir together mayonnaise and mustard in small bowl. Spread mixture on untoasted sides of each piece of bread.
- On four slices layer with salami, mortadella, provolone, lettuce, tomato and bacon. Then top with remaining 4 bread slices mayonnaise side down. Secure with toothpicks if desired.

Circus Pie

Ingredients:
- 1 box animal crackers
- 1/2 packages Cool Whip
- 1 box Funfetti Cake Mix
- 1/2 packages plain yogurt
- 1 cup Sliced Strawberries

Directions:
- mix the cool whip, yogurt and cake mix in a bowl
- crush animal crackers and form a layer on the bottom of a small square baking pan
- pour bowl mixture over your layer and smooth evenly
- add a single layer of whole animal crackers
- add layer of sliced strawberries
- refrigerate.
- done.

Ham & Cheese Stuffed Potato

Ingredients:
- 4 hot baked potatoes
- 2 cups chopped broccoli florets
- 1 cup KRAFT Finely Shredded Cheddar Cheese
- 1 cup chopped OSCAR MAYER Boiled Ham

Directions:
- Split baked potatoes.
- Place on microwaveable plate.
- Combine broccoli, cheese and ham; spoon evenly over potatoes.
- Microwave on HIGH 3 min.
- or until cheese is melted, rotating plate after 1-1/2 min.

Cherry Coffee Cake

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. oleo or butter
- 1 c. sugar
- 2 eggs
- 1 c. sour cream
- 1/2 tsp. soda
- 1/2 tsp. baking powder
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 2 c. flour

Directions:
- Cream shortening, sugar, eggs and vanilla.
- Measure flour and sift together flour, soda, baking powder and salt.
- Combine with first mixture along with sour cream.
- Spread half of batter in bottom of 9 x 13-inch pan, greased and floured.
- On top of this spread 1 can Thank You cherry pie filling, then spread remaining batter over this.

Honey Mustard Chicken Wings With Sesame Seed

Ingredients:
- 7 chicken wings or 14 chicken drumettes
- 1/2 c. honey
- 1 Tbsp. soy sauce
- 2 tsp. Dijon mustard
- 1/2 c. unhulled sesame seed
- 1/2 tsp. paprika

Directions:
- Marinate the chicken pieces for at least 2 hours or overnight. Cook when guests arrive.
- If using chicken wings, separate them at the joints into 3 sections.
- Discard tips or save for stock. Place chicken in shallow dish.
- In a 1-cup glass measure, combine honey, soy sauce and mustard.
- Stir to blend well.
- Cook on High 1 minute.
- Brush chicken wings with honey mixture.
- Roll wings in sesame seed to coat lightly.
- Sprinkle with paprika.
- Arrange on a shallow 9-inch plate, like spokes on a wheel, with thickest portion facing outside of dish.

Mom'S Chili

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 3 cans red kidney beans
- 1 onion, diced
- 1 green pepper, diced
- 1 can tomato juice
- chili powder

Directions:
- Brown ground beef, onion and green pepper together.
- Drain. Add tomato juice, beans and chili powder.
- Cook slowly for 1 hour or until mixture thickens.

Corn Salad(Serves 8 To 10)  

Ingredients:
- 2 cans Mexican corn, drained
- 1/2 c. chopped onion
- 1/2 c. green bell peppers
- 1/2 c. mayonnaise
- 1/2 c. Catalina dressing

Directions:
- Mix the ingredients together.
- Refrigerate for 2 hours or more.
- Just before serving, add 3 cups Fritos and toss.

Quick & Easy Cornbread

Ingredients:
- 1 cup All-purpose Flour
- 1 cup Corn Meal
- 1/4 cups Granulated White Sugar
- 1/4 cups Brown Sugar, Packed
- 3-1/2 teaspoons Baking Powder
- 1 whole Egg
- 1 cup Milk
- 1/4 cups Canola Oil
- 1-1/2 teaspoon Salt

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 400°F. Grease an 8"x8" pan or place liners in a muffin tin. In a large bowl, combine all ingredients and whisk together. Pour into the greased pan. If making muffins, fill each muffin cup just over halfway.
- Bake 25-30 minutes until top of cornbread is golden brown or until toothpick comes out clean. (For muffins, check at 20 minutes.)
- Serve with butter or drizzled with honey.
- Adapted from All Recipes.

Pizza Snacks

Ingredients:
- 1/2 lb. Italian sausage
- 1 tsp. oregano
- 1 clove garlic, minced
- 1 (8 oz.) pkg. biscuits
- 1 c. (4 oz.) sharp American cheese, shredded
- 1/4 c. Parmesan cheese
- 1 can tomato paste

Directions:
- Brown sausage.
- Drain.
- Add oregano and garlic.
- Grease a baking sheet.
- Flatten biscuits to 4-inch circles with floured custard cup.
- Fill with tomato paste and sausage.
- Sprinkle with cheese.
- Bake at 425° for about 10 minutes.

Fresh Peach Pie

Ingredients:
- 1 c. sugar
- 2 Tbsp. cornstarch
- 1 c. water
- 1 (3 oz.) pkg. peach flavored jello
- 3 c. sliced peeled ripe peaches
- 1 (9-inch) baked pie shell
- whipped cream (optional)

Directions:
- In a saucepan combine sugar, cornstarch and water until smooth.
