- Cook and stir over medium heat until bubbly and thickened.
- Remove from the heat; stir in jello until dissolved. Cool.
- Arrange peaches in cooled, baked crust.
- Pour filling over peaches.
- Chill until set, about 2 hours.
- Serve with whipped cream, if desired.

Banana Nut Salad

Ingredients:
- 1/8 tsp. salt
- 1/4 c. sugar *
- 2 Tbsp. cornstarch
- 1/4 c. cider vinegar
- 1 egg, beaten
- 1 c. water
- bananas (at least 3 medium)
- Grape-Nuts

Directions:
- Place layer of sliced bananas in dish and cover with layer of sauce; sprinkle with Grape-Nuts cereal.
- Continue with layers until you have completed three.
- Be sure the top is covered completely with Grape-Nuts.
- Chill 1 hour before serving.
- Use at least 3 medium bananas.

Chicken Lettuce Wraps

Ingredients:
- 4-1/2 cups KRAFT Lime Cilantro Vinaigrette
- 1 cup cilantro, chopped
- 1/2 cup chili-garlic sauce
- 3 qt. cooked chicken, shredded Whole Foods 1 lb For $3.99 thru 02/09
- 48 each Bibb lettuce leaves
- 4 each red peppers, each cut into 18 strips
- 4 each mangos, each cut into 18 strips Whole Foods 2 ea For $4.00 thru 02/09
- 3 cups shiitake mushrooms, sliced, sauteed,
- 1/2 cup green onions, chopped
- to taste salt and black pepper

Directions:
- Mix vinaigrette, cilantro and chili-garlic sauce.
- Pour 1-1/2 cups of the dressing mixture (or 1 Tbsp.
- of the dressing mixture for trial recipe) over chicken in large bowl; mix lightly.
- For each serving: Top 1 lettuce leaf with 3 each pepper and mango strips, 1 Tbsp.
- mushrooms, about 1 oz.
- chicken and 1/2 tsp.
- onions; roll up.
- Repeat to make second wrap.
- Serve with 2 Tbsp.
- of the remaining dressing mixture in ramekin as a dipping sauce.

Spiced Apple Cider 

Ingredients:
- 1 c. brown sugar
- 1 small can lemonade
- 1 small can orange juice
- 1 gallon apple cider
- 1 tsp. ground nutmeg
- 1 tsp whole cloves
- 1 tsp. whole allspice
- 24 cinnamon sticks
- Cheesecloth

Directions:
- Cook the brown sugar, lemonade, orange juice, cider, and nutmeg in a large saucepan. Tie cloves and allspice in a cheesecloth bag and add to mixture. Let steep and taste to find desired flavor. Once desired flavor is obtained, remove and discard cheesecloth.
- 
- Place cinnamon sticks in each cup. Pour in cider and serve hot.
- 
- Makes about five quarts.

Chocolate Chess Pie

Ingredients:
- 3 eggs, beaten
- 1 1/2 c. sugar
- 2 Tbsp. all-purpose flour
- 3 1/2 Tbsp. cocoa
- 1/4 c. butter or margarine, melted
- 1/2 c. evaporated milk
- 1 tsp. vanilla extract
- 1 (9-inch) unbaked pastry shell

Directions:
- Bake pastry shell at 350° for 5 minutes. Combine eggs and remaining ingredients in a medium bowl and stir well. Spoon egg mixture evenly into pastry. Bake at 350° for 45 minutes.

Three Cheese Chicken Penne Bake

Ingredients:
- 1 12 cups multigrain penne pasta, uncooked
- 1 (283 g) packagefresh baby spinach leaves, washed
- 1 lb chicken breast, boneless, skinless, cubed
- 1 teaspoon dried basil
- 1 12 cups tomato sauce
- 1 (350 ml) can diced tomatoes, drained
- 14 cup cream cheese
- 2 cups mozzarella cheese, shredded
- 14 cup parmesan cheese, grated

Directions:
- Heat oven to 375F Cook pasta, adding spinach in last minute of cooking.
- Cook and stir chicken and basil in large non-stick skillet over medium heat, for about 4 minutes.
- Add pasta sauce and tomatoes, brign to boil.
- Simmer over medium for 5 minutes.
- Stir in cream cheese.
- Drain pasta mixture, combine with chicken mixture and 1/2 of the mozzarella cheese.
- Transfer to 2-L baking dish.
- Bake 20 minutes, sprinkle with remaining cheeses, bake 5 minutes.

Aunt Dot'S Favorite Lemon Sponge Pie

Ingredients:
- 1/4 c. soft butter
- 1 c. sugar
- 3 eggs, separated
- 3 Tbsp. flour
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 6 Tbsp. lemon juice
- 1 tsp. grated lemon rind
- 2 c. milk
- pastry for 10-inch pie plate

Directions:
- Line a 10-inch pie plate with pastry.
- Separate eggs and beat the whites until they hold up in peaks.
- Add about 1/4 cup of the sugar.
- Cream the butter.
- Add salt and remaining sugar.
- Add unbeaten egg yolks; beat well.
- Add the flour, lemon juice and lemon rind.
- Add milk, then fold in beaten whites.
- Pour into unbaked pastry.
- Bake at 425° for 15 minutes.
- Reduce heat to 325°; continue to bake for 25 minutes.
- Place pie on rack to cool. Serves 6.

Apple Sauce Cake from Rumford's Complete Cookbook -1934, adapted by Rebecca Sackheim and Leah Ellias. .

Ingredients:
- 1 1/4 cup sugar
- 2 1/2 cup flour
- 1/2 tsp salt
- 1/2 tsp allspice
- 1/2 tsp ground cloves
- 1 tsp ground cinnamon
- 2 tbsp cocoa
- 2 tsp baking soda
- 2/3 cup Butter
- 2 eggs
- 2 cup applesauce
- 1/2 cup chopped raisins (OPTIONAL)

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350F
- Sift together all dry ingredients EXCEPT SUGAR, set aside.
- Beat the butter and sugar together, add the eggs, then the apple sauce, and lastly the rest of the dry ingredients.
- Beat very thoroughly and bake in a moderate oven (350) for 45 minutes.
- If liked, a cup of chopped seeded raisins may be added to the cake batter.

Sour Cream Rhubarb Crumb Pie

Ingredients:
- 1 10 inch pie pastry
- Filling
- 4 cups fresh rhubarb, cubed
- 1 1/2 cups granulated sugar
- 1/3 cup all-purpose flour
- 1 cup sour cream
- Crumb Topping
- 1/2 cup all-purpose flour
- 1/2 cup brown sugar
- 1/4 cup soft butter

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 450F degrees.
- Arrange rhubarb in unbaked pie shell.
- Mix together granulated sugar and 1/3 cup flour.
- Stir in sour cream and pour evenly over rhubarb.
- Combine crumb ingredients and sprinkle over filling.
- Bake at 450 degrees for 15 minutes, then reduce temperature to 350F degrees and bake an additional 30 minutes or until fruit is tender, filling is set and crumbs are golden brown.

Pretzel Salad

Ingredients:
- 2 c. broken pretzels
- 3/4 c. butter, melted
- 3 Tbsp. sugar
- 1 (8 oz.) cream cheese
- 1 c. sugar
- 1 (8 oz.) Cool Whip
- 1 large pkg. strawberry jello
- 1 1/2 c. hot water
- 1 1/2 c. cold water
- 1 c. chopped apples
- 1 c. chopped pecans

Directions:
- Mix pretzels, butter and 3 tablespoons of sugar in a 9 x 13-inch pan.
- Bake for 8 minutes.
- Cool.

Monkey Bread

Ingredients:
- 1/4 c. sugar
- 2 Tbsp. cinnamon
- 30 canned biscuits, cut in quarters
- 1 stick margarine
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 1 or 2 Tbsp. cinnamon

Directions:
- Coat biscuits in cinnamon and sugar; drop in greased Bundt pan. Melt together margarine, sugar and cinnamon; pour over biscuits. Bake 25 minutes at 350°.

Crock Pot Apple Crisp

Ingredients:
- 8 cup peeled, sliced apples
- 3/4 cup brown sugar
- 1/2 cup flour
- 1/2 cup quick oats
- 2 tsp cinnamon
- 2/3 cup softened butter/margarine

Directions:
- Place Apple slices in crock pot, turn on high.
- Mix remaining ingredients and pour on topics the apples.
- Do not stir.
- Cover and cook on low approximately 6 hours.

Seashells With Basil, Tomatoes, And Garlic

Ingredients:
- 1/3 cup extra-virgin olive oil
- 2 large garlic cloves, finely chopped
- About 3/4 tsp. kosher salt
- 1 1/4 pounds (1 qt.) small cherry and teardrop tomatoes
- 3/4 pound medium seashell pasta
- 1/2 cup shaved parmesan cheese
- 1/2 cup thinly sliced fresh basil leaves

Directions:
- Combine oil, garlic, and 3/4 tsp. salt in a large bowl. Chop 1 cup of the tomatoes and add to bowl. Cut remaining tomatoes in half and stir into mixture; let stand about 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
- Meanwhile, cook pasta as package directs in a large pot of salted boiling water.
- Drain pasta, saving 1 cup water. Toss pasta with tomato mixture, then with cheese and all but 1 tbsp. basil. Mix in a little pasta water if needed for a looser texture. Sprinkle remaining basil on top and season with salt.

Fruit Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 can peach pie filling
- 1 can chunk pineapple
- 1 can peaches, chopped
- 1 can pears, chopped
- 1 medium jar cherries, chopped
- 3 c. seedless grapes (any color)

Directions:
- Drain fruit and mix all ingredients together and refrigerate overnight.

One Hour Yeast Rolls

Ingredients:
- 1 pkg. dry yeast
- 1 c. warm water
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 Tbsp. sugar
- 1 Tbsp. Wesson oil
- flour

Directions:
- Dissolve yeast in water.
- Add salt, sugar and oil.
- Add enough flour to make a
- real
- stiff dough.
- Let stand about 15 minutes. Make out rolls.
- Let
- rise
- to double in size.
- Bake at 400°. Makes about 14 rolls.

Pecan Tassies

Ingredients:
- 12 cup butter, softened
- 3 ounces cream cheese, softened
- 1 cup flour
- 1 beaten egg
- 34 cup brown sugar
- 1 tablespoon margarine, softened
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 1 dash salt
- 12 cup chopped pecans

Directions:
- For the Dough -
- Preheat oven to 325.
- Blend Butter and cream cheese.
- Stir in the flour.
- Cover and CHILL for 1 hour.
- On floured surface roll dough 1/8 inch thick.
- cut into 3 in rounds.
- pat into tart tins or mini muffin pans (makes 24).
- For the filling - In small bowl stir together egg, brown sugar, butter, vanilla and salt until smooth.
- Spoon 1 teaspoon pecans in pastry cup (muffin pan).
- Fill about 3/4 the way full with the brown sugar mixture.
- You can also add the pecans to the mixture and just spoon into the tart tins.
- Bake 325 degree about 25 minutes.
- Cover and store in fridge.

Mashed Potato Candy

Ingredients:
- mashed potatoes
- powdered sugar
- peanut butter or caramel

Directions:
- To
- 1/4 cup mashed potatoes add powdered sugar gradually, mixing
- well until well blended and about the texture and consistency
- of
- pie
- dough that can be rolled out. (Approximately
- 1
- pound
- powdered
- sugar.)
- Roll
- out and spread with peanut butter
- or
- caramel.
- Roll
- up
- as for a jelly roll and slice after chilling.

Frito Casserole

Ingredients:
- 2 lb. ground beef
- 1 small chopped onion
- 1 small can chopped green chiles
- 1 can cream of chicken soup
- 1/2 lb. grated Cheddar cheese
- 1/2 to 3/4 lb. Fritos

Directions:
- Brown meat with onion. Add chiles and soup. Cover bottom of a 9 x 13-inch pan with Fritos.
- Pour in meat mixture.
- Top with Fritos.
- Bake at 350° until set. Top with cheese.
- Bake until melted.

Cornflake-Coated Baked French Toast

Ingredients:
- 2 large eggs
- 1/2 cup 2% milk
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1 cup cornflake crumbs
- 6 slices Texas toast
- 1/4 cup butter, melted
- 2/3 cup sugar
- 1/3 cup light corn syrup
- 2 tablespoons water
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 1/3 cup evaporated milk or 2% milk
- 1-1/2 teaspoons butter
- 1/4 teaspoon almond extract

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 450°. In a shallow bowl, whisk eggs, milk, salt and vanilla until blended. Place cornflake crumbs in another shallow bowl. Dip both sides of bread in egg mixture, then in cornflake crumbs, patting to help coating adhere.
- Place in a greased 15x10x1-in. baking pan. Drizzle with melted butter. Bake 10-12 minutes or until golden brown.
- For syrup, in a small saucepan, combine sugar, corn syrup, water and cinnamon; bring to a boil. Cook and stir 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in milk, butter and extract. Serve with French toast.

Smoky Salmon Spread

Ingredients:
- 1 can (large 14.75 Oz. Can) Red Salmon
- 8 ounces, weight Cream Cheese
- 1 Tablespoon Lemon Juice
- 1/2 teaspoons Liquid Smoke
- 18 teaspoons Salt
- 1 dash Cayenne Pepper
- 1 dash Pepper
- 1 dash Smoked Paprika
- 1/2 cups Chopped Walnuts
- 1/4 cups Finely Chopped Parsley

Directions:
- Let cream cheese come to room temperature to soften.
- Drain, clean and flake salmon; combine with softened cream cheese, lemon juice, liquid smoke and seasonings.
- Mix completely.
- Chill for several hours.
- Shape into two logs; roll in combined nuts and parsley.
- Chill before serving.

Sharon'S Special Sugar Cookies

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 c. confectioners sugar, sifted
- 1 c. butter
- 1 egg
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1/2 tsp. almond flavoring
- 2 1/2 c. all-purpose flour
- 1 tsp. cream of tartar
- 1 tsp. baking soda

Directions:
- Cream sugar and butter. Add egg and flavoring. Mix thoroughly. Sift dry ingredients. Stir all ingredients together. Refrigerate for 2 to 3 hours.

Roasted Chicken Au Jus

Ingredients:
- 1 (1 ounce) envelopelipton recipe secrets onion and mushroom soup mix
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 2 12-3 lbs chicken, cut into serving pieces
- 12 cup hot water

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 425.
- In large bowl, combine Onion Mushroom Soup Mix and oil; add chicken and toss until evenly coated.
- In a broiler pan, without the rack, arrange chicken.
- Place chicken in oven and bake, basting occasionally, 40 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink.
- Remove chicken to serving platter.
- Add hot water to pan and stir, scraping brown bits from bottom of pan.
- Serve sauce over chicken.

Lentil Soup

Ingredients:
- 3 oz. vegetable oil
- 3 oz. diced bacon
- 3/4 c. diced carrots
- 3/4 c. diced onions
- 3/4 c. diced celery
- 3/4 c. all-purpose flour
- 3 1/2 qt. water
- 1 c. lentils
- 2 tsp. salt
- 2 tsp. seasoned salt
- 2 bay leaves
- 1 tsp. white thyme
- 1/4 c. beef base
- pinch of nutmeg
- pinch of white pepper
- 3/4 c. diced potatoes

Directions:
- In
- a
- large saucepan, saute the bacon, carrots, onions and celery in oil until the onion and celery are transparent. Add flour;
- stir constantly.
- Slowly add water.
- Add remaining ingredients.
- Simmer approximately 3 hours.

Frozen Pickles

Ingredients:
- 2 qt. sliced cucumbers
- 2 Tbsp. salt
- 2 medium onions
- 1 1/2 c. vinegar
- 1 1/2 c. sugar

Directions:
- Slice cucumbers very thin (do not peel).
- Mix cucumbers, salt and onions and let set for 2 hours.
- Drain and squeeze pickles.

Banana Pudding

Ingredients:
- 8 large bananas
- 1 large pkg. vanilla instant pudding
- 3 c. milk
- 1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese, softened
- 1 can Eagle Brand milk (condensed)
- 2 tsp. vanilla
- 1 large pkg. Cool Whip
- 1 box vanilla wafers

Directions:
- Beat pudding with milk until thick.
- Add cream cheese, condensed milk and vanilla until well blended.
- Fold in half the Cool Whip (leave some for the top).
- In a large bowl, layer wafers, bananas and then pudding mix.
- Top with the rest of the Cool Whip; refrigerate.

Angel Biscuits

Ingredients:
- 2 1/2 c. flour
- 1 tsp. baking powder
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/8 c. sugar
- 1/2 c. Crisco
- 1 pkg. dry yeast
- 1/4 c. warm water
- 1 c. buttermilk

Directions:
- Dissolve yeast in warm water.
- Mix dry ingredients.
- Cut in Crisco.
- Stir in buttermilk and yeast.
- Refrigerate or roll out on a floured cloth and cut with a biscuit cutter.
- Bake 10 to 12 minutes in a 400° oven on a greased cookie sheet.

Tollhouse Pie

Ingredients:
- 2 eggs
- 1/2 c. flour
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 1/2 c. brown sugar
- 1 c. butter, melted and cooled
- 6 oz. chocolate chips
- 1 c. chopped nuts
- 9-inch unbaked pie shell

Directions:
- In large bowl, beat eggs until foamy.
- Add flour, sugar and brown sugar; beat until well blended.
- Blend in melted butter. Stir in chocolate chips and walnuts.
- Pour into pie shell.
- Bake at 325° for 1 hour.
- Serves 6.

Cashew Chicken

Ingredients:
- 1 chicken, cut in bite-size pieces and salted
- 2 eggs
- 1/4 pt. milk
- 1 small can oysters, drained
- water
- 1 tsp. cornstarch
- 1 to 2 drops Kitchen Bouquet

Directions:
- Mix eggs and milk together.
- Dip chicken in milk and egg mixture, then in flour.
- Drop into deep fat fryer (350°) about 6 to 7 minutes or until batter is golden brown.
- Take them out and put in Pyrex dish in oven to keep warm.

Graham Cracker Pie

Ingredients:
- 16 crackers, rolled fine
- 1 tsp. flour
- 1/2 c. shortening (part butter melted)
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 1 tsp. cinnamon

Directions:
- Pack in pie plate and heat in low oven.
- Reserve a few crumbs for top of meringue.

Taylor'S Barbecue Chicken

Ingredients:
- 1 (29 oz.) can tomato sauce
- 1 finely chopped small onion
- 1 1/2 cloves garlic, minced
- 2 1/2 Tbsp. mustard
- 1/2 c. molasses
- 2 Tbsp. liquid smoke
- salt and pepper to taste
- 4 chicken breasts and 8 legs

Directions:
- Cut chicken breasts in half; skin legs and 8 thighs (optional). Bring to boil in 4-quart pan for 15 to 25 minutes.
- Remove and place in shallow pan.
- Cover with sauce.
- Grill or broil until brown.

Alligator Sauce Piquant

Ingredients:
- 2 lb. alligator, boneless and cubed *
- 4 onions, diced
- 1 c. parsley, chopped
- 4 stalks celery, chopped
- 1 bell pepper, diced
- 1 c. catsup
- 2 Tbsp. Heinz steak sauce
- 2 Tbsp. soy sauce
- 2 Tbsp. Louisiana hot sauce
- 2 Tbsp. cornstarch
- 1 tsp. salt
- 2 tsp. red pepper (ground)
- 1/4 c. cooking oil

Directions:
- *Alligator must be free of all fat; also dark meat is the best (leg and body meat), boneless.

Hot Buttered Rum

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. margarine (with corn oil)
- 2 lb. brown sugar
- 3 eggs
- 1 heaping tsp. cinnamon
- 1 heaping tsp. nutmeg
- 1 heaping tsp. allspice
- 1 heaping tsp. cloves

Directions:
- Melt margarine; add spices.
- Place sugar in bowl and add margarine.
- Add eggs, one at a time.
- Beat, with a mixer, for 30 minutes on medium speed.
- Seal in jar.
- Keep in fridge.

Irish Soda Bread Muffins

Ingredients:
- 2-1/4 cups all-purpose flour
- 1/2 cup plus 1 tablespoon sugar, divided
- 2 teaspoons baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon baking soda
- 1 teaspoon caraway seeds
- 1 large egg
- 1 cup buttermilk
- 1/4 cup butter, melted
- 1/4 cup canola oil
- 3/4 cup dried currants or raisins

Directions:
- In a large bowl, combine the flour, 1/2 cup sugar, baking powder, salt, baking soda and caraway seeds. In another bowl, beat the egg, buttermilk, butter and oil. Stir into dry ingredients just until moistened. Fold in currants.
- Fill greased muffin cups three-fourths full. Sprinkle with remaining sugar. Bake at 400° for 15 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool for 5 minutes before removing from pan to wire rack. Serve warm.

Roasted Salmon With Wasabi Cream

Ingredients:
- olive oil
- 1 3/4 lbs salmon fillets (wild king recommended)
- sea salt
- 6 teaspoons wasabi powder
- 1 cup sour cream

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 300 degrees. Sprinkle a large roasting pan with olive oil. Lay the salmon in the pan with the skin-side down. Rub a thin slick of oil over the salmon and season with salt. Roast until just cooked through, 20 to 30 minutes.
- Meanwhile, dissolve wasabi powder in 8 teaspoons of water. Whisk into sour cream and season to taste with salt. Add more wasabi if desired. Serve with salmon.

Easy Red Bean Soup Made with Store-Bought Anko

Ingredients:
- 400 grams Anko (koshi-an or tsubu-an)
- 200 ml Water
- 1 tbsp Black sugar
- 4 pinch Salt
- 1 Mochi

Directions:
- In a small pot, combine the anko, water, and black sugar.
- Then simmer over a low heat.
- Grill the mochi.
- Pour some of the anko soup into a soup bowl.
- Top with the grilled mochi.
- Then, pour some more soup on top.
- Add a pinch of salt to finish, and serve.

Pork Barbecue

Ingredients:
- 4 lb. pork loin roast
- 1 bottle catsup
- 1 large onion, chopped
- grated celery
- 1 tsp. salt
- pepper
- garlic salt
- dash of chili powder
- oregano

Directions:
- Boil pork until tender, remove fat and bones.
- Shred pork and add other ingredients.
- Cook for about 3 hours on low heat until thick.
- Add water when necessary.
- Can use beef or leftover ham or roast chicken.

Mexicana Brunch Pie

Ingredients:
- 5 eggs, beaten
- 2 Tbsp. butter or margarine, melted
- 1/4 c. flour
- 1/2 tsp. baking powder
- 1 (8 oz.) carton Ricotta cheese
- 1 (8 oz.) pkg. shredded Monterey Jack cheese
- 1 (4 oz.) can chopped green chiles, drained

Directions:
- Combine first 4 ingredients in a mixing bowl; beat well at medium speed of an electric mixer.
- Stir in remaining ingredients and pour into a well-greased 9-inch pie plate.
- Bake at 400° for 10 minutes; reduce heat to 350° and bake about 20 minutes or until set.
- Cut into wedges to serve.

Gluhwein (Mulled Wine)

Ingredients:
- 1/2 cup water
- 1/2 cup sugar
- 2 whole cloves
- 2 cinnamon sticks
- 1 orange
- 1 (750 ml) bottle red table wine (Pinot Noir, Merlot, Shiraz, etc.)

Directions:
- Mix water, sugar, cinnamon, cloves, wine, and the juice of the orange together in a heavy pot.
- Bring up the heat, but do not boil.
- Add the orange peel and simmer 15 minutes.
- Serve immediately in preheated mugs.

Lasagna

Ingredients:
- 3 lb. ground beef
- 30 oz. Ragu spaghetti sauce (extra garlic, tomatoes and onions)
- 1 small container small curd cottage cheese
- 6 c. Mozzarella cheese
- 2 c. mild Cheddar cheese
- 2 c. sharp Cheddar cheese
- 9 lasagna noodles

Directions:
- Brown and season ground beef and drain.
- Add spaghetti sauce and simmer while cooking noodles.
- Layer noodles, beef, cottage cheese and 1/3 of cheeses.
- Repeat twice more and top with last of Mozzarella cheese.
- Bake at 350° for 35 minutes.

Sausage Roll

Ingredients:
- 1 pkg. Rich's frozen loaf bread, thawed
- 4 c. grated Mozzarella cheese
- 2 lb. sausage, cooked and drained
- 2 (10 oz.) pkg. frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained
- 1 egg white

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 375°.
- Lightly flour surface and roll each loaf to an 11 x 8-inch rectangle.
- Place sausage down the middle of loaf.
- Layer 2 cups cheese and 1/2 of meat and spinach on both loaves.
- Gently fold ends of bread over and pinch to seal.
- Roll over onto 2 cookie sheets; pinched ends should be on bottom.
- Brush egg white mixture over loaves.
- Bake for 35 minutes until golden brown.
- Makes 2 rolls.

Prune Cake

Ingredients:
- 2 c. flour
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. soda
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 1 1/2 c. sugar
- 3 eggs
- 1 c. salad oil
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 c. cooked prunes
- 1 c. buttermilk
- 1 c. nuts

Directions:
- Sift together flour, salt, soda and cinnamon; set aside.
- Mix thoroughly the sugar, eggs, oil, vanilla and buttermilk.
- Add flour mixture; fold in cooked prunes and nuts.
- Bake 45 minutes to 1 hour in a 325° oven.
- Place batter into greased baking pan.

Saltine Candy

Ingredients:
- 1 pkg. saltine crackers
- 2 sticks butter
- 1 c. sugar
- 1 large bag semi-sweet chocolate bits
- 1/2 c. chopped nuts

Directions:
- Line cookie sheet with tinfoil.
- Butter tinfoil.
- Line cookie sheet with saltines close together.

Hot Jambalaya

Ingredients:
- 1 to 2 lb. shelled cooked shrimp
- 1 lb. thin sliced smoked ring sausage
- 1 lb. cubed lean ham
- 1 c. chopped celery
- 1 c. chopped bell pepper
- 1 c. chopped onion
- 1/4 c. chopped green onion
- 1 (16 oz.) can diced tomatoes plus juice
- 1 can Ro-Tel plus juice
- 4 Tbsp. butter
- 2 1/2 c. uncooked rice
- 3 tsp. Creole season
- 2 tsp. minced garlic
- 2 3/4 c. chicken broth

Directions:
- Saute ham, sausage and vegetables in butter until soft.
- Stir in stock, tomatoes, Ro-Tel and seasoning.
- Bring to a boil and add rice.
- Cook until rice has absorbed liquid, 40 minutes for whole grain rice or you may use Minute rice and reduce time.
- Stir in steamed shelled shrimp.
- Have the deli department of your grocery steam shrimp to save time.

Roasted Quail

Ingredients:
- 2 quail per person
- salt and pepper
- butter or margarine
- chicken broth

Directions:
- Wipe birds with damp cloth.
- Rub generously with butter, salt and pepper, inside and out.
- Brown in very hot oven, 450° to 500° for 5 minutes.
- Reduce heat to 350°; add a little chicken broth and steam 20 to 25 minutes.
- The steaming keeps birds moist and helps hold flavor.

Peanutty Fruit Pizza

Ingredients:
- 9 inches refrigerated pie crusts
- 1/2 cup skippy natural creamy peanut butter spread
- 1/3 cup strawberries reduced sugar, spread
- 1 1/2 cups fruit assorted cut-up

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 425°.
- Arrange pie crust on baking sheet. Fold 1/2-inch of edge over to form a thicker edge. Bake 10 minutes or until golden brown; let cool slightly.
- Evenly spread Skippy(R) Natural Creamy Peanut Butter Spread, then strawberry spread on crust. Evenly top with fruit. To serve, cut into wedges.

Sausage Skillet Dinner

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. smoked sausage or hot dogs
- 4 to 5 medium potatoes, pared and sliced 1/2-inch thick
- 1 medium onion, sliced
- 8 c. (about 1 1/2 lb.) thinly sliced cabbage
- 2 Tbsp. butter or margarine
- 2 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 3/4 c. boiling water
- 1/4 c. grated Parmesan cheese

Directions:
- Cut sausages into 2-inch pieces.
- Place sliced potatoes in large frying pan.
- Add a layer of onion slices and a layer of cabbage.
- Add butter, salt and pepper to boiling water.
- Stir to melt butter and pour over vegetables.
- Place sausage pieces on top and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.
- Cover tightly and cook slowly 25 minutes or until vegetables are done.
- Makes 4 to 5 servings.

Lemonade Concentrate

Ingredients:
- 375 grams caster sugar
- 250 ml water
- 375 ml fresh lemon juice

Directions:
- Heat sugar and water in a pan until the sugar dissolves and the liquid is clear
- Cool for 10 minutes then stir in lemon juice.
- Use as required or freeze upto 6 months.

Chanda'S Good Good Casserole

Ingredients:
- 1 can cream of mushroom soup
- 1 can cream of chicken soup
- 1 can whole kernel corn, drained
- 1 small carton sour cream
- 1 small jar pimentos
- 1 1/2 lb. ground meat
- 1 small onion, chopped
- 8 oz. pkg. thin egg noodles
- 1/2 c. bread crumbs
- 3 Tbsp. butter, melted

Directions:
- Brown meat and onions.
- Cook noodles and drain.
- Mix all ingredients together in large bowl and pour into 9 x 13-inch baking dish.
- Brown bread crumbs with butter in frying pan until crispy brown.
- Sprinkle over casserole.
- Bake at 350° for 25 to 30 minutes.

Nutritional Yeast Gravy

Ingredients:
- 4 tablespoons butter
- 4 tablespoons flour
- 1/4 cup miso
- 1/4 cup nutritional yeast
- 3 1/2 cups water (approx)

Directions:
- Combine the miso and yeast in a large measuring cup and add water until there is 4 cups; stir.
- Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat and slowly whisk in flour.
- Then whisk in liquid about a 1/4 cup at a time. Heat until thick.

Golden Milk (Anti-Inflammation Drink)

Ingredients:
- 2 cups Unsweetened Organic Coconut (or Almond) Milk
- 1 Tablespoon Peeled, Grated Fresh Ginger
- 1 Tablespoon Peeled, Grated Fresh Turmeric
- 4 whole Black Peppercorns
- 2 teaspoons Cinnamon
- 2 teaspoons Raw Local Honey

Directions:
- In a medium saucepan, heat coconut milk, ginger, turmeric, and peppercorns. Bring mixture to a simmer. Simmer covered for 10 minutes.
- Add cinnamon and honey. Strain between cups. Serve warm.

Candied Yams And Cranberries

Ingredients:
- 2 cans yams or sweet potatoes
- 1/2 c. butter
- 3/4 c. brown sugar, packed
- 2 c. fresh cranberries
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/8 tsp. pepper

Directions:
- Place yams in 2-quart casserole.
- In medium saucepan, melt butter.
- Add sugar, cranberries, salt and pepper.
- Cook, stirring constantly, over medium heat until cranberries pop and sugar dissolves.
- Pour over yams in casserole.
- (Can be refrigerated and baked later at this point.)
- Cover and bake in 350° oven for 30 minutes.
- (Add 10 to 15 minutes to baking time if yam casserole has been refrigerated.)

Raymond'S Pecan Pie

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. brown sugar, firmly packed
- 1 c. granulated sugar
- 1 Tbsp. flour
- 1 stick butter
- 2 Tbsp. milk
- 2 eggs
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 c. chopped pecans

Directions:
- Mix sugars and flour.
- Beat in eggs, milk and flavoring.
- Add melted margarine and pecans.
- Bake in unbaked pie shell 40 to 50 minutes at
- 350°.

Double Chocolate Crumb Bars

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. butter or margarine
- 3/4 c. sugar
- 2 eggs
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 3/4 c. flour
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 c. ground nuts
- 2 Tbsp. cocoa
- 2 c. miniature marshmallows
- 1 c. chocolate chips
- 1 c. creamy peanut butter
- 1 1/2 c. Rice Krispies

Directions:
- Cream butter and sugar.
- Beat in vanilla and eggs.
- Add flour, salt, baking powder, nuts and cocoa to creamed mixture.
- Spread in bottom of greased 9 x 13-inch pan and bake at 350° for 15 minutes. Sprinkle marshmallows evenly on top.
- Bake 3 minutes more; cool.

Rye Bread Spinach Dip

Ingredients:
- 1 c. sour cream
- 1 c. mayonnaise
- 3 to 4 green onions, finely chopped
- 1 pkg. Knorr vegetable soup mix
- 1 (10 oz.) pkg. frozen chopped spinach, thawed, rinsed, drained and squeezed dry

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients and chill.
- Cut out center of round loaf of rye bread to form bowl.
- Fill emptied round rye with chilled dip.
- Cut up removed bread to dip with.

tater tot casserole

Ingredients:
- 32 oz tater tots
- 1 can Cream of chicken soup
- 16 oz sour cream
- 1 cup grated cheese

Directions:
- preheat oven 350F
- grease 9x13 dish
- arrange tater tots on dish
- mix soup, sour cream, and cheese
- pour sauce on tots
- add more cheese on top if you want
- bake for 45- 60 min

Sour Cream Noodle Casserole

Ingredients:
- 2 lb. ground beef
- 2 cans tomato sauce
- salt and garlic salt to taste
- 1 (12 oz.) pkg. cooked egg noodles
- 1 (16 oz.) cottage cheese
- 1 (8 oz.) sour cream
- 2 c. grated Cheddar cheese

Directions:
- Brown meat. Drain. Add tomato sauce and seasoning. Cook and drain noodles. Add cottage cheese, sour cream and garlic salt to noodles. Mix gently. Put 1/2 noodle mix into greased 9 x 13 pan. Top with 1/2 meat sauce. Repeat and top with cheese. Bake at 350° for 30 to 40 minutes.

Fruit Dip

Ingredients:
- 8 oz. cream cheese
- 2 tsp. lemon juice
- 1/2 c. whipping cream
- 1/4 c. sugar

Directions:
- Mix together and use with any kind of fruit.

Zesty Meatballs

Ingredients:
- 3 lb. ground chuck
- 3 medium onions, finely chopped
- 1 1/3 c. soft bread crumbs
- 1 1/2 tsp. salt
- 3/4 tsp. black pepper
- 1 1/2 tsp. chili powder
- 1/4 c. plus 2 Tbsp. milk
- 3/4 c. Worcestershire sauce
- 3/4 c. sugar
- 1/4 c. plus 2 Tbsp. cider vinegar
- 3 (8 oz.) cans tomato sauce

Directions:
- Combine first 7 ingredients, mixing well.
- Shape into 1-inch balls.
- Cook meatballs in skillet until lightly browned; drain. Place meatballs in 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking dish.

Shrimp Bruschetta Topping

Ingredients:
- 1 clove garlic, minced
- 1/4 cup KRAFT Balsamic Vinaigrette Dressing
- 1 lb. frozen uncooked cleaned small shrimp, thawed Safeway 1 lb For $8.99 thru 02/09
- 2 green onions, chopped
- 1 tomato, chopped Safeway 1 lb For $1.29 thru 02/09
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley
- 1/2 cup ATHENOS Crumbled Feta Cheese with Basil & Tomato
- woven wheat crackers

Directions:
- Cook garlic in dressing in large skillet on medium-high heat 30 sec.
- Stir in shrimp and onions; cook 6 to 8 min.
- or until shrimp turn pink.
- Add tomatoes and parsley; stir.
- Cook 2 to 4 min.
- or until heated through, stirring occasionally.
- Top with cheese.
- Serve with crackers.

Carrot Soup

Ingredients:
- 2 Tbsp. oil
- 1 large onion
- 2 cloves garlic
- 1 tsp. thyme, marjoram, salt and pepper
- 8 c. chicken broth
- 6 large potatoes
- 8 to 10 large carrots
- 1/2 c. milk

Directions:
- In large pot, pour oil and heat slightly.
- Add chopped onion and minced garlic.
- Add peeled, cut-up carrots and potatoes. Sprinkle with salt, pepper, marjoram and thyme.
- Toss vegetables; cover pot and cook for 30 minutes or until vegetables are slightly soft.
- Pour 8 cups of chicken broth over vegetables and cook for 20 minutes.
- Puree soup in blender and return to pot; add milk and heat slightly.

King Ranch Chicken

Ingredients:
- 4 to 5 chicken breasts, stewed, boned and chopped
- 1 onion, chopped
- 1 green or red pepper
- 1 pkg. corn tortillas
- chicken stock
- 1/2 lb. shredded Cheddar cheese
- 1 1/2 tsp. chili powder
- garlic salt to taste
- 1 can cream of chicken soup
- 1 can cream of mushroom soup
- 1 (10 oz.) can Ro-Tel tomatoes, crushed

Directions:
- Combine chicken, onions and green pepper.
- Layer alternately with tortillas which have been dipped into hot chicken stock just long enough to soften, in a 3-quart buttered casserole dish.
- Top with grated cheese, chili powder and garlic salt.
- On top, add the the following in order and layer: chicken soup, mushroom soup and tomatoes.
- Bake at 350° for 30 to 45 minutes.

Pumpkin-Pecan Pie

Ingredients:
- 1 (9-inch) unbaked pie shell
- 4 eggs
- 2 c. pumpkin
- 1 c. sugar
- 1/2 c. dark corn syrup
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1/2 tsp. cinnamon
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1 c. chopped nuts

Directions:
- Mix all together, except pecans.
- Pour into shell.
- Top with pecans.
- Bake at 350° for 40 minutes or until set.

Chess Pie

Ingredients:
- 3 eggs
- 1 stick butter
- 1 1/2 c. white sugar
- 1 Tbsp. vinegar
- 1 tsp. vanilla

Directions:
- Melt butter; set aside.
- Combine other ingredients; add butter.
- Put in unbaked pie crust.
- Bake at 350° for 30 to 35 minutes.

Tomato Salsa with Green Onions

Ingredients:
- 3 tomatoes (1 lb.), chopped
- 1/4 cup finely chopped red onions
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro
- 1/4 cup KRAFT Italian Vinaigrette Dressing made with Extra Virgin Olive Oil
- 2 green onions, chopped
- 1 jalapeno pepper, seeded, finely chopped
- 1 Tbsp. lemon juice Safeway 4 ct For $5.00 thru 02/09
- 1/2 tsp. garlic powder

Directions:
- Combine ingredients.

Fruit Bread

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. butter
- 1 c. sugar
- 2 eggs
- 2 c. flour
- 1 tsp. baking soda
- 1 c. mashed ripe bananas
- 1/4 c. chopped maraschino cherries
- 1/3 c. chocolate chips
- 1/2 c. chopped pecans

Directions:
- Cream butter and sugar together and add eggs and beat well. Sift flour and baking soda and add alternately with bananas to egg mixture.
- Mix in remaining ingredients.
- Pour into oiled loaf pan and bake at 350° for 1 hour.
- While still warm, drizzle with powdered sugar icing.

A Highly Nourishing Salad! Carrot and Chikuwa Tossed in Sesame-Mayo

Ingredients:
- 1 small Carrot
- 3 Chikuwa
- 2 tbsp Mayonnaise (calorie-reduced type)
- 3 tbsp Yogurt
- 2 tbsp White ground sesame seeds
- 2 pinch Salt

Directions:
- Julienne the carrots, wrap in paper towels, then wrap again in plastic wrap.
- Microwave for 1 min at 600w.
- Julienne the chikuwa.
- Add the carrots and chikuwa to the rest of the ingredients and toss.

Beef Stroganoff

Ingredients:
- 1/4 c. butter or margarine
- 4 Tbsp. flour
- 3 (10 1/2 oz. each) cans condensed beef stock
- 1/4 c. butter or margarine
- 2 lb. sirloin steak, cut in 1/4-inch strips
- 2 c. sliced fresh mushrooms
- 1/4 c. finely chopped onion
- pinch of garlic powder
- pinch of chopped parsley
- 1/4 c. sherry or red wine
- 1/4 c. tomato puree
- 1 c. dairy sour cream

Directions:
- For the gravy, brown the 1/4 cup of butter with the flour in a 3-quart saucepan, then add condensed beef stock and cook on low heat, about 5 minutes.
- Heat 1/4 cup butter in a large skillet and quickly brown sirloin strips.
- Add sliced mushrooms, chopped onion, garlic powder and parsley and cook about 15 minutes or until brown, then add the gravy mixture, sherry and tomato puree.
- Cook until meat is tendered, uncovered, stirring occasionally, then stir in the dairy sour cream and bring almost to a boil.
- Serve stroganoff over buttered noodles.

Boston Cookies

Ingredients:
- 1 c. flour
- 1/2 tsp. cinnamon
- 1/4 tsp. baking soda
- dash of salt
- 1/4 c. butter or margarine, softened
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 1 egg, well beaten
- 1/2 c. chopped nuts (your choice)
- 1/2 c. raisins

Directions:
- Stir together flour, cinnamon, baking soda and salt; set aside.
- In medium bowl, cream butter and gradually add sugar, creaming well.
- Beat in egg.
- Thoroughly blend in flour mixture. Stir in nuts and raisins.
- Drop by teaspoonfuls 1-inch apart on greased cookie sheet.
- Bake at 350° for 10 to 12 minutes or until delicately brown.

Pumpkin Bars

Ingredients:
- 1 c. cooking oil
- 2 c. sugar
- 4 eggs, beaten until creamy
- 2 c. pumpkin puree
- 2 tsp. cinnamon
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. baking soda
- 2 tsp. baking powder
- 2 c. flour
- 1 c. chopped walnuts (optional)

Directions:
- Mix ingredients together and bake at 350° for 25 minutes on a well-greased and floured cookie sheet with lip.

Shrimp Kisses

Ingredients:
- 1 (8 ounce) package Monterey Jack cheese, cut into strips
- 40 large shrimp - peeled, deveined and butterflied
- 20 slices bacon, cut in half

Directions:
- Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (220 degrees C).
- Place a small piece of cheese into the butterflied opening of each shrimp. Wrap half of a slice of bacon around each one to conceal the cheese, securing with toothpicks. Place on a cookie sheet.
- Bake for 10 to 15 minutes in the preheated oven, until bacon is browned.

Cream Cheese Brownies

Ingredients:
- 1 pkg. (4 oz.) cream cheese
- 1 egg
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 2 Tbsp. flour
- 1/2 c. maraschino cherries, well drained and cut up

Directions:
- Beat cream cheese and egg well. Blend in sugar and flour, gradually beating until well blended. Stir in cherries. Set aside.

Skillet Chicken

Ingredients:
- 2 tablespoons margarine or 2 tablespoons butter
- 1 1/2 boneless skinless chicken thighs or 1 1/2 boneless skinless chicken breasts
- 1 cup water
- 1 package vegetable soup mix (dry variety)
- 1/4 teaspoon dill weed
- 1/2 cup sour cream

Directions:
- Use large skillet, medium high heat, melt butter.
- Add chicken and brown turning occasionally, about five minutes.
- Stir dill, soup mix and water into skillet.
- Bring to a boil, cover and reduce heat, simmer stirring occasionally 10 minutes or until chicken is tender.
- Place chicken on a large plate.
- Remove skillet from the heat, stir in sour cream.
- Spoon sauce over the chicken.
- Serve with cooked noodles or rice.

Seaton Chocolate Chip Cookies

Ingredients:
- 1 c. butter
- 1 1/4 c. solid shortening
- 1 2/3 c. brown sugar
- 1 2/3 c. sugar
- 5 eggs
- 1 1/2 tsp. vanilla
- 6 c. flour
- 1 1/2 tsp. baking soda
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 2 c. chocolate chips

Directions:
- Cream shortening, butter and sugars.
- Add eggs and vanilla; mix well.
- Blend in the dry ingredients.
- Add chocolate chips.

Poppy Seed Bread

Ingredients:
- 4 c. sifted flour
- 2 c. sugar
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 Tbsp. plus 1 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 c. poppy seed
- 1 1/2 c. vegetable oil
- 12 oz. can evaporated milk
- 3 eggs, beaten
- 2 tsp. vanilla

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350°.
- Butter 2 medium loaf pans.
- In large bowl, combine flour, sugar, salt, baking powder and poppy seed. In another bowl, combine oil, milk, eggs and vanilla.
- Add this to dry mixture and mix well.
- Divide between the pans and bake for 50 minutes.

Peanut Butter Rice Chex

Ingredients:
- 1 (12 oz.) box Rice Chex
- 1 stick butter or margarine
- 1 c. peanut butter (not crunchy)
- 1 (6 or 8 oz.) pkg. peanut butter chips
- 1 box powdered confectioners sugar

Directions:
- Melt butter, peanut butter and chips together over low heat. Coat Chex with mixture.
- Put in bread sack or Ziploc bag.
- Add sugar and shake to coat.

Scalloped Pineapple

Ingredients:
- 5 c. cubed bread (without ends)
- 2 c. sugar
- 1/2 c. milk
- 1 1/2 sticks oleo, softened
- 3 eggs
- 1 (20 oz.) can crushed pineapple with juice

Directions:
- Cream sugar and oleo in bowl.
- Add eggs and milk; mix well before adding pineapple.
- Just before baking, pour mixture over bread cubes in a separate bowl; mix well.
- Bake at 350° for 45 minutes in a large greased casserole dish.

Ricotta Cheesechake 

Ingredients:
- 3 pounds Ricotta chesse (whole)
- 12 eggs
- 1 1/2 cups sugar
- 1 tablespoon vanilla extract
- 1 med. orange (zest)
- 1 lemon (zest)
- 12 oz. chocolate chips
- oz. of bourbon (optional)

Directions:
- preheat oven to 350 degrees.
- Seperate 12 eggs. Whip whites to a stiff peak. In a large bowl mix together Ricotta, sugar, vanilla, egg yolks and orange and lemon zests.
- Fold in egg whites then chocolate chips. Bake in 10 in.
- spring pan covered for 45 min. then uncovered for 45 min.

Anna'S Broccoli Corn Bread

Ingredients:
- 1 box Jiffy corn muffin mix
- 1 medium onion, chopped
- 4 eggs, well beaten
- 1 (10 oz.) box frozen broccoli, chopped and thawed
- 6 oz. cottage cheese (low-fat)
- 1 stick margarine, melted

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients well.
- Bake for 30 minutes at 400°, or until brown.

Potato Soup

Ingredients:
- 1 pound sausage
- 8 green onions
- 1 c. chopped celery
- 3/4 package hash browns
- 1 can cream of chicken soup
- 1 can cream of mushroom soup
- 2 cans chicken broth

Directions:
- Brown sausage and green onions. Drain off fat. Add celery and cook 2-3 minutes.
- Add soups and chicken broth.
- Cook until blended.
- Add frozen hash browns and cook for about 1 hour.
- Salt and pepper to taste.
- Put in crock pot for 1 to 1 1/2 hours.

Beef Nachos Casserole

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 1 jar chunky salsa (12 oz.)
- 1 1/2 c. whole kernel corn, drained
- 3/4 c. Miracle Whip salad dressing
- 1 Tbsp. chili powder
- 2 c. crushed tortilla chips, divided
- 3/4 c. ripe olives
- 2 c. grated cheese, divided (Colby and Monterey Jack)

Directions:
- Brown meat and drain.
- Stir in salsa, corn, salad dressing and chili powder.
- Layer 1/2 of the meat mixture, chips and cheese into 2-quart casserole dish.
- Repeat layers.
- Bake 20 minutes at 350°.

Orange-Mint Peas

Ingredients:
- 2 tablespoons butter
- 3 cups fresh early green peas (may substitute 3 c. frozen peas)
- 1 tablespoon grated orange rind
- 2 tablespoons fresh orange juice
- 1 tablespoon chopped of fresh mint
- 1/2 teaspoon salt (to taste)
- 1/4 teaspoon pepper (to taste)
- orange rind twists

Directions:
- Melt butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat; add in peas, rind, and juice.
- Cook, stirring occasionally, 8-10 minutes or until thoroughly heated.
- Stir in fresh mint, salt, and pepper.
- Garnish with orange rind curls.

Taco Soup

Ingredients:
- 2 chicken breasts, cubed
- 1 large onion, chopped
- 2-16 oz. can chicken broth
- 1-16 oz. can pinto beans
- 1-16 oz. can black eye peas
- 1-16 oz. whole kernel corn
- 1 can Rotel tomatoes
- 1-16 oz. can diced tomatoes
- 1 envelope Taco Seasoning Mix
- 1 envelop Hidden Valley Ranch Dressing Mix
- Salt and pepper to taste

Directions:
- Cook chicken and onion in broth.
- Add remaining ingredients and simmer 30 minutes.

Baked Salmon Cakes

Ingredients:
- 1 (15 1/2 oz.) can salmon, drained
- 1 small onion, finely chopped
- 1 egg
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 2/3 c. milk
- 1 Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
- 1 tsp. lemon juice
- 1 c. soft bread crumbs (for topping)

Directions:
- In large bowl, break salmon into small chunks with a fork. Remove skin if desired.
- Add remaining ingredients, except bread crumbs.
- Mix well.
- Spoon into muffin pans.
- It will make 12 muffins.
- Sprinkle bread crumbs on top of each muffin.
- Bake at 400° for 20 minutes.
- Serves 6.

Cheesy Chicken And Broccoli

Ingredients:
- 2 to 3 c. chicken (bite size)
- 10 oz. pkg. broccoli
- 2 c. milk
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 16 oz. cream cheese
- 1/2 c. Parmesan cheese
- 1 can French fried onion rings
- 3/4 c. grated Cheddar cheese

Directions:
- Oil a large casserole dish and arrange cooked, chopped broccoli.
- Mix cream cheese, salt, milk and half of the Cheddar and Parmesan cheeses in blender.
- Pour half over the broccoli. Layer chicken on top of broccoli and cheese sauce.
- Layer onion rings and then remaining cheese sauce.
- Top with remaining Cheddar and Parmesan cheeses.
- Bake at 350° for 30 minutes, uncovered.

Easy Baked Turkey

Ingredients:
- 1 turkey
- 1 stick oleo, melted

Directions:
- Baste turkey with oleo, wrap tightly in foil.
- Place in covered roaster pan.
- Bake at 475° for 1 1/2 hours.
- Turn oven off.
- Do not open oven door for 8 hours.
- Turkey will be done and extra juicy.
- This will not work if oven door is opened.

Marinated Turkey

Ingredients:
- 1 cup fresh lemon juice
- 3/4 cup pure maple syrup
- 1/2 cup corn oil
- 6 shallots mediums, thinly sliced
- 6 garlic cloves thinly sliced
- 4 thyme sprigs Fresh
- 3 bay leaves Imported
- 2 teaspoons grated lemon zest Finely
- 1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
- 10 pounds turkey

Directions:
- Combine all the ingredients except the turkey in a sturdy 2 gallon plastic bag.
- Add the turkey to the bag, squeeze out as much air as possible and seal the bag.
- Distribute the marinade evenly over and inside the turkey.
- Set the turkey, breast side down, in a bowl in the rfrigerator and marinate for 24 hours, turning occasionally.
- Wipe the shallots and garlic from the turkey before cooking and pat dry.
- Roast as normal. Strained marinade can be used in the gravy if desired.

Mama'S Tea Cakes

Ingredients:
- 2 sticks margarine
- 2 c. sugar
- 1 egg
- 3 c. plain flour
- 1/2 tsp. baking powder
- 1 tsp. of your favorite flavoring

Directions:
- Mix
- all
- ingredients.
- Cover and refrigerate overnight. Roll in small balls and pat thin on cookie sheet.
- Bake at 350° until browned.

Little Pig Souffle

Ingredients:
- 4 eggs
- 6 slices bread, cubed
- 2 c. milk
- 2 c. grated cheese
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 lb. link sausage, cooked and sliced
- 1 tsp. dry mustard

Directions:
- In 9x13-inch casserole dish, layer bread cubes, sausage and cheese.
- Beat eggs well, add milk, salt and mustard.
- Pour over casserole and let stand overnight in refrigerator.
- Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour.
- Serve immediately.
- Serves 6 to 8.

Scalloped Pineapple

Ingredients:
- 2 scant c. sugar
- 1/2 c. soft butter
- 2 eggs
- 1/2 c. milk
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 qt. bread cubes
- 1 large can pineapple chunks (juice included)
- 1/2 c. brown sugar
- 1/2 c. pecans

Directions:
- Mix sugar and butter.
- Add eggs and mix well.
- Stir in pineapple with juice; add vanilla and milk.
- Fold in bread cubes. Put into buttered 9 x 12-inch pan.
- Sprinkle top with mixture of brown sugar and pecans.
- Bake at 350° for 40 to 50 minutes.

Hank's Incredible Egg Rolls

Ingredients:
- 5 -6 pork chops, boiled 20 minutes,remove bones
- 2 packages bean sprouts, soak for 1 hour and squeeze out water,tear apart (ALSO KNOWN AS CELLOPHANE NOODLES)
- 1 package fresh shiitake mushroom (any mushroom works)
- 2 bunches green onions
- 1 head bok choy
- 1 can water chestnut
- 2 eggs
- 1 tablespoon Accent seasoning
- 1 tablespoon oyster sauce
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce (OR MORE)
- 2 packages egg roll wraps

Directions:
- CHOP ONIONS, BOK CHOY, MEAT, CHESTNUTS& MUSHROOMS IN FOOD PROCESSOR.
- MIX WITH REMAINING INGREDIENTS.
- YOU MAY ADD A DASH OF CHINESE 5 SPICE POWDER IF YOU LIKE IT.
- FILL EGG ROLL WRAPPERS& DEEP FRY 'TIL GOLDEN BROWN AT ABOUT 350 DEGREES.
- IF YOU FRY IT TOO HOT, THE OUTSIDE GETS DONE TOO FAST.
- FRY AS YOU ROLL.
- IF YOU ROLL TOO MANY BEFORE FRYING, THEY WILL STICK TO YOUR SURFACE AND TEAR APART!
- ENJOY WITH EITHER CHINESE HOT MUSTARD OR SWEET& SOUR SAUCE.
- THESE ARE GREAT!

Pecan Pie Bars

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 c. all-purpose flour
- 1/2 c. (1 stick) butter
- 1/4 c. brown sugar

Directions:
- Mix flour, butter and sugar in small bowl.
- Press into prepared pan.
- Bake 12 to 15 minutes in a 13 x 9 pan.

Eire-Koekjes (Egg Cookies)

Ingredients:
- 2 eggs
- 1/2 c. sugar
- dash of salt
- 3/4 c. flour
- little lemon, orange peel or vanilla

Directions:
- Beat eggs and sugar 10 to 15 minutes until thick.
- Add salt and sift flour over this.
- Fold in carefully.
- Grease and flour cookie sheet.
- Drop cookies several inches apart.
- Bake at 350°. Keep them light of color.

Beef Barbecue For Canning

Ingredients:
- 10 lb. ground beef
- 5 c. chopped onions
- 1/4 c. salt
- 1 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1 c. vinegar
- 3/4 c. prepared mustard
- 1 1/2 c. brown sugar
- 1/2 c. Worcestershire sauce
- 5 c. catsup

Directions:
- Brown hamburger and onions.
- Add other ingredients and 4 cups beef broth or water (or more, if necessary).
- Steam 10 minutes and pack in jars.
- Seal.
- Makes about 9 quarts.
- Boil about 2 hours in hot water bath.

White Cheddar And Jalapeno Polenta

Ingredients:
- 6 cups chicken stock
- 2 cups polenta (cornmeal)
- 6 ounces cheddar cheese
- 1/8 cup chopped jalapenos or 1/8 cup sliced jalapeno
- 2 tablespoons butter
- sea salt
- fresh ground pepper

Directions:
- Bring stock to boil in large pot over high heat.
- Whisk in polenta in a steady stream and decrease heat to medium.
- Cook, stirring with a wooden spoon, constantly until mixture begins to thicken, approximately 10 minutes or till thickened.
- Add cheese and peppers. Cook 2 minutes.
- Stir in butter and salt and pepper to taste.
- Remove from heat and adjust consistency by thinning with more stock if needed.

Potato Bake

Ingredients:
- 5 medium potatoes
- 1 c. cream of chicken soup
- 1/2 (8 oz.) carton sour cream
- 1 small onion, chopped
- 1/2 c. Parmesan cheese
- 1 c. hard-cooked eggs, chopped
- 1 Tbsp. parsley
- salt and pepper

Directions:
- Cook potatoes until almost done; dice.
- Mix all other ingredients.
- Put in a 2 or 3-quart casserole dish.
- Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.

Oreo Truffles

Ingredients:
- 1 package Double-Stuffed Oreos
- 4 ounces cream cheese, softened
- 1 12oz bag milk chocolate chips
- 1 cup white chocolate chips

Directions:
- Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and set aside.
- Place half of Oreos in a food processor and process into fine crumbs. Transfer crumbs to a large bowl, and repeat with the second half of Oreos.
- Add cream cheese and work crumbs into cream cheese with a rubber spatula. Texture should resemble damp sand and be able to hold it's shape when rolled into a ball.
- Roll Oreo mixture into 1-inch balls and place on prepared baking sheet. Freeze for 1-2 hours, or until truffles have hardened.
- Melt chocolate chips in a microwave-safe bowl according to package directions. Dip truffles in chocolate, spooning chocolate over truffles to cover if necessary, and remove with a fork. Place truffles back on the baking sheet. Once chocolate has set, trim any puddles or trails of chocolate with a sharp knife.

Barbecue Shrimp Recipe

Ingredients:
- 3 lbs. lg. shrimp, heads on
- 1 teaspoon liquid crab boil
- 2 lemons
- 1 orange
- 2 sticks butter
- 6 cloves garlic, sliced
- 1 lg. onion, sliced
- 6 tbsp. salt
- 1 teaspoon cayenne pepper

Directions:
- Slice lemon and orange.
- Heat butter and add in all ingredients except shrimp, and saute/fry till tender.
- Remove from heat and cold.
- Pour over shrimp and marinate several hrs.
- Bake in 425 degree oven till all shrimp are pink; turn frequently.
- Takes about 15 min.
- Serve with French bread, as an appetizer or possibly main dish.
- Serves 6.

Tomato Relish

Ingredients:
- 2 to 3 large fresh tomatoes
- 1 large onion
- 1/4 c. pickle relish
- 1/4 c. vinegar
- pinch of sugar

Directions:
- Combine all ingredients in a bowl.
- Pour vinegar over mixture. Let flavors blend at least 1 hour.
- Delicious when eaten with black-eyed peas or collard greens.

Chicken Amandine

Ingredients:
- 3 Tbsp. butter
- 3/4 c. sliced almonds
- 1/2 tsp. salt and pepper
- 1 tsp. lemon pepper
- 1 tsp. rosemary
- 1/3 c. all-purpose flour
- 6 chicken breasts
- 1 1/2 Tbsp. salad oil

Directions:
- In skillet, melt 1 1/2 tablespoons butter.
- Add almonds and cook until brown.
- Remove and set aside.
- In flat dish, combine all seasonings.
- Coat chicken in flour; pour over seasonings.

Mango Martini

Ingredients:
- 3 tablespoons Grey Goose Vodka
- 1 tablespoon triple sec
- 10 ounces mangos Fresh, or frozen thaw them before using

Directions:
- Mix the Vodka with Triple Sec in a martini shaker or container.
- Puree the mangos and add them to the Vodka and Triple sec. Let them infuse together in the refrigerator until ready to use.
- Add crushed ice to the Vodka Mango mixture, shake well and stir into cold glasses.
- If less pulp is desired, add cranberry juice to the mix and strain when ready to enjoy it.

Rancho De Chimayo Veggie Green Chili

Ingredients:
- 4 cups vegetable broth or 4 cups water
- 2 cups chopped roasted green chili peppers
- 2 medium tomatoes, diced
- 2 teaspoons onions, grated
- 2 garlic cloves, minced
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 white pepper
- 2 tablespoons cornstarch, dissolved in 2 t

Directions:
- Combine all ingredients except the cornstarch in a large saucepan and bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce the mixture for 2 hours until the tomatoes are dissolved.
- Add the cornstarch. Reduce the heat to a simmer and cook for 5 to 10 minutes. The sauce should be thickened but quite pourable with no taste of raw cornstarch.

Pansy Pound Cake

Ingredients:
- 2 sticks butter
- 1/2 c. Crisco
- 3 c. sugar
- 5 eggs
- 3 c. flour
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 c. milk
- 2 tsp. lemon extract

Directions:
- You do not use baking powder in this cake.
- Don't use self-rising flour.
- Cream mixture until smooth.
- Bake in a 325° oven for 1 hour and 15 to 20 minutes.

Thumbprint Cookies Recipe

Ingredients:
- 1 c. (2 sticks) butter, softened
- 1/4 c. sugar
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 2 c. all-purpose flour
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- Jam or possibly jelly

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
- Mix butter, sugar, vanilla and beat till creamy.
- Gradually add in flour and salt.
- Mix well.
- Shape rounded teaspoonfuls into balls and place on ungreased cookie sheet.
- Indent center with thumb.
- Fill each with 1/4 tsp.
- preserves.
- Bake 20 min or possibly till edges are lightly browned.
- Store when cold in airtight container.
- Makes 2 1/2 dozen.

Marinated Carrots

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. carrots, sliced and barely cooked
- 1 to 1 1/2 green peppers, sliced
- 1 onion, sliced

Directions:
- Cook carrots slightly, drain, cool and add onion and green pepper.
- Make sauce.

Extra Rich Peanut Butter Fudge

Ingredients:
- 2 cups sugar
- 2/3 cup milk
- 2 cups miniature marshmallows
- 1 cup crunchy peanut butter
- 1 teaspoon vanilla

Directions:
- Combine sugar and milk in saucepan.
- Cook to soft ball stage. Add remaining ingredients, stirring until blended.
- Pour into 8-inch greased square pan and cool.
- Cut into squares.

Sugar Glazed Peanuts Or Pecans

Ingredients:
- 3 c. shelled nuts (pecans or peanuts)
- 1/2 c. water
- 1 c. sugar

Directions:
- Mix on top of stove on high until water evaporates.
- Put in shallow pan and bake at 300° for 30 minutes.

Best Tropical Muffins 

Ingredients:
- Muffins:
- 1 1/2 cups all purpose flour
- 1/2 cup honey or sugar
- 1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon ginger
- 1 egg
- 1/2 cup milk
- 1/2 cup butter
- Filling:
- 1 jar guava jam
- Icing:
- Grand Mariner
- confectioners sugar
- Topping:
- coconut flakes

Directions:
- 1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
- 2. Blend together all muffin ingredients in big bowl.
- 3. Spoon equal amounts of batter into each baking cup and be sure the bottom is covered, using about 2/3 of the batter.
- 4. Drop a spoon of jam onto batter, trying to keep the jam in the middle.
- 5. Cover jam with remaining batter.
- 6. Bake for 25 minutes.
- 7. While muffins are baking, mix Grand Mainer and confectioner's sugar in small bowl.
- 8. When muffins are ready, spoon some icing over each and sprinkle with coconut flakes.

Tomato Cream Gratin

Ingredients:
- 1 to 2 Tomatoes
- 5 tbsp White sauce
- 1 Melting cheese
- 1 dash Parmesan cheese
- 1 pinch Black pepper
- 1 pinch Dried parsley

Directions:
- Wash the tomatoes and wipe off the water.
- Remove the stems and slice thinly.
- Put the white sauce in a heatproof dish, and place the tomatoes on top.
- Top with the melting cheese, Parmesan, black pepper and dried parsley.
- Bake in the oven at 200C for 15-20 minutes to finish.

Easy Hamburger Casserole

Ingredients:
- 1 lb ground beef
- 1 (12 ounce) box macaroni shells and cheese
- 1 onion (chopped)
- 1 (2 cup) package cheddar cheese (Shredded)
- 1 (10 ounce) can cream of chicken soup
- 1 tablespoon garlic

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350.
- Add ground beef and onions to skillet and fully cook.
- Cook shells in a pot of water.
- Drain water out and mix in cheese.Set aside.
- Drain ground beef and add cream of chicken soup and garlic to the skillet with the beef. Simmer on low for 5 minutes.
- Layer ground beef and shells and cheese in a casserole dish, starting with the beef. Between each layer add a little shredded cheese.
- Add rest of cheese to the top when dish is full.
- Place in oven till cheese is melted.
- Remove from oven, let stand for 5 to 10 minutes, and serve.

Anytime Quiche

Ingredients:
- 5 eggs
- 1 c. milk or half and half
- 1 c. broccoli florets
- 1 c. shredded Swiss cheese
- 1 c. ham chunks
- pepper to taste
- 1 unbaked pie crust

Directions:
- In a pie plate, place an unbaked pie crust.
- Add ham and broccoli; arrange into bottom of crust.
- Sprinkle with cheese. Whisk eggs with milk or half and half and pour over mixture.
- Bake 40 minutes at 350° or until top becomes light brown.
- Eat anytime.

Pink Lemonade Icebox Pie

Ingredients:
- 1 can frozen pink lemonade
- 1 medium container Cool Whip
- 1 prepared 9-inch graham cracker pie crust

Directions:
- Set out pink lemonade until softened to room temperature.
- Mix in large bowl softened pink lemonade and Cool Whip; mix until smooth.
- Pour mixture into pie crust; place in top of refrigerator for 1 hour.
- Serve with Cool Whip topping.

Crab Dip

Ingredients:
- 8 oz. pkg. cream cheese
- 1 dash of Tabasco sauce
- 1 stick butter
- 1/2 tsp. garlic powder
- 1 lb. white crabmeat
- 1/4 tsp. white pepper
- 1 small onion, finely chopped

Directions:
- In a double boiler, melt the cream cheese and butter.
- Add the crabmeat and seasonings.
- Serve in a chafing dish to keep warm. Good with dip-size corn chips, in pastry shells or crackers.

Easy Roasted Asparagus

Ingredients:
- 1 bunch Asparagus, Trimmed
- 2 cloves Garlic, Sliced Thin
- 1 Tablespoon Olive Oil
- 1 pinch Salt
- 1 pinch Pepper

Directions:
- Spread asparagus in a single layer on a baking sheet. Drizzle evenly with remaining ingredients.
- Bake at 375°F for 10-15 minutes.

Beth's Fruited Chicken Salad Recipe

Ingredients:
- 4 c. minced cooked chicken
- 2 c. minced celery
- 2 c. halved seedless red or possibly green grapes
- 1 (15 ounce.) can pineapple tidbits, liquid removed
- 1 (11 ounce.) can mandarin oranges, liquid removed
- 1 c. toasted slivered almonds
- 1/2 c. mayonnaise
- 1/2 c. lowfat sour cream
- 2 tbsp. lemon juice
- 1/8 teaspoon salt
- 1/8 teaspoon white pepper

Directions:
- Combine first 6 ingredients and toss.
- Mix mayonnaise, lowfat sour cream, lemon juice, salt, and white pepper.
- Add in to chicken mix and stir well.
- Chill.
- To serve, arrange escarole around edge of Cheese Tart Shells; spoon chicken mix on top.

Orange Fluff

Ingredients:
- 1 large Cool Whip (low fat)
- 1 large orange jello (dry)
- 24 oz. cottage cheese (no fat)
- 1 can pineapple tidbits
- 1 small mandarin oranges

Directions:
- Mix all 5 ingredients together with spoon.

Red & White Namasu salad (kids' friendly)

Ingredients:
- 1 carrot
- 1/3 to 1/2 daikon radish (*depends on the size of the daikon)
- 2/3 Tbs salt
- 3/4 Tbs sugar
- 3 Tbs vinegar

Directions:
- Cut the carrot and radish in thin strips (julienne).
- The texture is better when you slice the carrot/radish and then julienne diagonally.
- Sprinkle the salt and mix well.
- Leave for about 10 minutes.
- Drain the water and add the sugar and vinegar and mix together.
- You can also add yuzu peel if you like.
- In Japan, you can find this "gentle vinegar (Yasashii O-su)", which is less acidic and child-friendly.
- This vinegar already contains some sugar, salt and other seasonings so you can reduce the amount of salt and sugar a little.

Sparkling Raspberry Lemonade

Ingredients:
- 1 pt. raspberries
- 1 3/4 c. sugar
- 2 c. vodka
- 4 c. water
- 1 qt. Classic Homemade Lemonade
- ice
- 1 bottle sparkling water

Directions:
- Bring water, raspberries, and sugar to boil in a large saucepan, stirring occasionally, until sugar dissolves.
- Reduce heat, and let simmer for 15 minutes.
- Strain mixture through a fine sieve, pressing gently on berries to release juices; discard solids.
- Let syrup cool completely.
- Combine syrup and lemonade in a large pitcher.
- Divide among 16 ice-filled glasses.
- Top each with sparkling water, and vodka if using.
- Garnish with fresh raspberries.
- Looking for cocktail recipes?
- Try our top fruity drink recipes, retro cocktails, or punch recipes.

Mandarin Orange Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 yellow cake mix
- 1 can mandarin oranges (not drained)
- 4 eggs
- 1/2 c. oil
- 1 box vanilla pudding
- 1 (8 oz.) Cool Whip
- 1 can crushed pineapple (not drained)

Directions:
- Preheat
- oven
- to 350°.
- Grease 3 round cake pans.
- Mix all ingredients in a large bowl 2 minutes.
- Divide batter into 3 pans.
- Bake
- 20
- to 25 minutes.
- Cool completely and frost. Refrigerate.

Curry Vegetable Dip

Ingredients:
- 1 c. mayonnaise
- 1 c. sour cream
- 1 Tbsp. vinegar
- 1 Tbsp. chopped onion
- 1 tsp. garlic salt
- 1 tsp. curry powder
- 1 tsp. horseradish

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients together and chill.

Easy Rocky Road

Ingredients:
- 2 c. (12 oz. pkg.) Hershey semi-sweet chocolate chips
- 1/4 c. (1/2 stick) butter/margarine
- 2 Tbsp. shortening
- 3 c. miniature marshmallows
- 1/2 c. chopped nuts

Directions:
- Butter 8-inch square pan.
- In large microwave-safe bowl, place chocolate chips, butter and shortening.
- Microwave at High (100%) for 1 to 1 1/2 minutes just until chocolate chips are melted and mixture is smooth when stirred.
- Add marshmallows and nuts.
- Blend well.
- Spread even in prepared pan.
- Cover and refrigerate until firm.
- Cut into 2-inch squares.
- Makes 16 squares.

Cream Cheese Frosting

Ingredients:
- 8 ounces cream cheese, at room temperature
- 2 tablespoons butter, at room temperature
- 34 cup granulated sugar
- 1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- milk (optional, if icing is too thick)

Directions:
- Combine cream cheese, butter, lemon juice and vanilla.
- Beat in sugar.
- Beat until sugar has dissolved.
- If icing is too thick, add up to two tablespoonfuls of milk to thin.

Frozen Pumpkin Dessert

Ingredients:
- 1 (11 or 11 3/4 oz.) pkg. no-bake cheesecake mix
- 1/4 c. margarine
- 1 qt. butter pecan or vanilla ice cream, softened
- 3/4 c. milk
- 3/4 c. canned pumpkin

Directions:
- In 4 cup Wonderlier bowl, combine graham cracker crumbs from cheesecake mix and margarine.
- Press crumb mixture into bottom of modular mates container.
- Spread softened ice cream over crust. Apply seal.
- Freeze while preparing pumpkin cheesecake mixture. In small mixing bowl, combine cheesecake filling mix and milk. Beat at medium speed for 3 minutes.
- Spread cheesecake mixture over ice cream layer in modular mates rectangular container. Apply seal; freeze several hours until firm.

Garlicky Chicken Casserole

Ingredients:
- 12 cup onion, chopped
- 2 garlic cloves, pressed
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 2 (12 ounce) cans chicken, drained (or use cooked and shredded chicken, probably about 2 large breasts)
- 10 34 ounces cream of mushroom soup
- 10 ounces rotel, drained
- 4 -6 tablespoons whipping cream
- 12 cup shredded cheddar cheese
- salt and pepper
- shredded cheddar cheese (garnish)
- sour cream (garnish)

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350.
- In a skillet over medium heat, saute onion and garlic in oil until onion is translucent.
- Combine the onion mixture and remaining ingredients in a large mixing bowl; stir well.
- Pour mixture into a lightly greased 13x9" baking dish.
- Bake for 20-25 minutes.
- Garnish as desired.

Peppercorn Beef Kabobs

Ingredients:
- 1 lb boneless beef top sirloin steak, cut 1 inch thick cubed
- 1 12 teaspoons black peppercorns, crushed
- 12 teaspoon salt
- 12 teaspoon paprika
- 1 garlic clove, minced
- 1 medium onion, cut into 12 wedges
- cherry tomatoes, halves (optional)

Directions:
- Cut beef steak into 1-inch cubes.
- Combine peppercorns, salt, paprika, and garlic in shallow dish.
- Add beef; toss to coat.
- Thread an equal number of beef pieces onto each of four 12-inch skewers along with 3 onion wedges.
- Place kabobs on rack in broiler pan.
- Broil 3 to 4 inches from heat source.
- Broil 9 to 12 minutes, turning occasionally.
- Garnish with tomatoes, if desired.

Vegetable Bread

Ingredients:
- 3 cans Biscuits
- 1 cup Butter
- 3/4 cups Chopped Onion
- 3/4 cups Chopped Pepper (green Or Red)
- 3/4 cups Chopped Celery
- 1/2 pounds Bacon, Fried And Crumbled
- 3/4 cups Grated Cheddar Cheese

Directions:
- Cut biscuits into quarters and place in a large bowl.
- Saute onions, peppers, and celery in butter for about 10 minutes. Do not drain.
- Mix veggies, cheese, and bacon with quartered biscuits.
- Spoon into bundt pan. Bake in a preheated 350 degree oven for 30 to 35 minutes.
- Invert onto a serving plate, and enjoy!

Savory Herb Mayonnaise 

Ingredients:
- 1/2 cup mayonnaise
- 1 T Italian Parsley, chopped
- 2 or 3 green onions, chopped
- 1 1 t Dijon mustard
- pinch of salt and fresh ground blk pepper

Directions:
- Process until blended and creamy. Store in refrigerator.

Pickled Grapes With Chile And Rosemary

Ingredients:
- 6 cups red seedless grapes
- 2 cups white wine vinegar
- 1 cup water
- 2 tablespoons kosher salt
- 2 teaspoons sugar
- 3 cloves garlic peeled and crushed
- 1 sprig rosemary
- 1/2 teaspoon red chile flakes

Directions:
- Pack grapes into 3 pint-size jars.
- Pour vinegar and water into a saucepan over medium-high heat. Add salt, sugar, garlic, rosemary, and chile flakes.
- When mixture begins to simmer, remove from heat and divide the brine among the jars.
- Cover loosely and let cool to room temperature.
- Cover tightly and chill in refrigerator at least one hour before serving.
- Pickled grapes will keep in the refrigerator about 2 weeks.

Quick Muffins

Ingredients:
- 1 c. self-rising flour
- 1/2 c. milk
- 2 Tbsp. mayonnaise

Directions:
- Drop from spoon into muffin pan.
- Bake at 400° for 12 minutes.

Jiggly and Soft Bavarois

Ingredients:
- 150 ml Heavy cream
- 200 ml Milk
- 2 large Egg yolk
- 35 grams Sugar
- 4 drops Vanilla essence
- 6 grams Gelatin
- 1 1/2 tbsp Water to soak gelatin
- 1 Kiwi fruits (or strawberries)

Directions:
- Prepare the ingredients.
- Add gelatin in water.
- Soak for 10 minutes to soften fully.
- Add milk and sugar to a pot, and stir to dissolve over low heat.
- Add softened gelatin when it's nearly boiling and mix thoroughly until everything is fully dissolved.
- Beat the egg yolks.
- When the mixture from step 2 has cooled down slightly, add the yolks and mix thoroughly.
- Add heavy cream and vanilla essence.
- Mix well (do not whisk).
- Pour into desired cups and chill in the fridge for 30 minutes.
- Top with kiwi fruits, and chill again for over 3 hours.
- It's even more rich if chilled overnight!
- Here's an orange bavarois that my 10 year old daughter made.
- We added 3 medium-sized egg yolks.

Chocolate Roll

Ingredients:
- 6 eggs
- 1 c. sugar
- 4 Tbsp. cocoa
- 1/2 tsp. baking powder
- 6 Tbsp. flour
- 1 c. whipping cream
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- pinch of salt

Directions:
- Separate eggs and beat egg yolks with 1 cup sugar.
- Add the cocoa, baking powder and flour.
- Beat egg whites until stiff and add vanilla and salt.
- Fold the cocoa mixture into the beaten egg whites and pour into a well-greased 11 x 16-inch cookie sheet. Bake in 350° oven for 25 minutes.

Tomato & Gorgonzola Soup

Ingredients:
- 1/2 cup onion, diced
- 1/4 cup celery, diced
- 1/4 cup carrot, diced
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 1 garlic clove, minced
- 28 ounces canned tomatoes, chopped and undrained
- 2 tablespoons tomato paste
- 1 cup water
- 1 tablespoon fresh basil, minced
- 1 teaspoon granulated sugar
- 4 ounces gorgonzola, crumbled

Directions:
- In a heavy pot saute the onion, celery and carrot in the oil until the onion is soft, about 7 minutes.
- Stir in the garlic and saute briefly, about 30 seconds.
- Add the tomatoes and their juices, tomato paste, water, basil and sugar. Bring to a simmer and cook until carrots are tender.
- Remove from the heat, add the gorgonzola, cover and let sit for 3 minutes, stir to blend. Salt and pepper to taste.

Cookie Pie

Ingredients:
- 1 box yellow cake mix (do not use cake mix with pudding)
- 2 eggs
- 1 c. oil
- 1/4 c. brown sugar
- 1 c. chocolate chips
- 1 c. nuts

Directions:
- Mix
- first
- 4 ingredients, then add chocolate chips and nuts. Bake
- at
- 350° for 20 minutes in 2 (9-inch) pie plates. Do not bake over 20 minutes.

Mulled Cider

Ingredients:
- 1/2 gallon apple cider
- 1 cinnamon stick
- 1 orange, cut into 1/2-inch slices
- 6 cloves

Directions:
- Press cloves into orange slices.
- Combine ingredients in a large pot and simmer for 20 minutes

Chocolate Chip Macadamia Nut Muffins

Ingredients:
- 1 12 cups flour
- 1 teaspoon baking soda
- 14 teaspoon salt
- 13 cup butter, melted
- 23 cup sour cream
- 14 cup corn syrup
- 1 egg
- 1 12 cups chocolate chips
- 3 12 ounces macadamia nuts, quartered
- 12 whole macadamia nuts

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 375 degrees .
- Combine flour, baking soda and salt in a large bowl.
- In a medium bowl mix the melted butter, sour cream, corn syrup and egg.
- Make a well in the dry ingredients and add the wet ingredients.
- Stir in the chocolate chips and macadamia nuts.
- Line muffin pans with paper muffin cups.
- Fill muffin cups with batter.
- Place a whole macadamia nut on top of each muffin.
- Bake at 375 degrees for 15 minutes.

Bella'S Whole Wheat Belgian Waffles

Ingredients:
- 2 cups whole wheat flour
- 1/4 cup sugar
- 3 teaspoons baking powder
- 3/4 teaspoon salt
- 2 cups milk
- 3 eggs
- 1/3 cup vegetable oil
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract

Directions:
- Combine flour, sugar, baking powder and salt in a bowl.
- Add milk, eggs and oil to the dry ingredients and mix until combined.
- Use approximately 1/3 cup of batter per waffle.
- Bake on waffle iron as per manufacturers instructions.
- Note: My original posting of this recipe did not include salt. I didn't really miss having salt in this recipe, but I thought the first reviewer of this recipe probably had a point about blandness, so I amended the recipe to include 3/4 teaspoon of salt. Other comments have prompted me to add vanilla to the recipe, with wonderful results. Thanks for your comments!

Tutti-Frutti Pudding Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 (16 oz.) can fruit cocktail
- 1 c. flour
- 1 c. sugar
- 1 tsp. baking soda
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 egg, well beaten
- 3/4 c. chopped pecans
- 1/4 c. brown sugar
- 1 c. whipped cream or topping (optional)

Directions:
- Drain fruit cocktail; reserve 1/2 cup liquid. Combine next 4 ingredients.
- Beat egg until thick and lemon colored.
- Add drained fruit cocktail and 1/2 cup reserved liquid.
- Stir in flour mixture. Turn into an 8-inch greased and floured pan. Combine nuts and brown sugar.
- Mix well and sprinkle over top.
- Bake at 350° for 30 to 40 minutes or until a wooden toothpick inserted comes out clean.
- Serve warm with whipped cream or other topping.

Grilled Oysters With Spinach and Pine Nuts

Ingredients:
- 24 oysters, on the half shell rinsed if gritty and excess water removed
- 13 cup fresh breadcrumb, made from day old bread (use gf if required)
- 50 g unsalted butter (1 3/4 oz)
- 10 english spinach leaves, blanched then drained on paper and finely chopped
- 2 tablespoons parmesan cheese, grated (8 teaspoons)
- 2 tablespoons flat leaf parsley, chopped
- 1 tablespoon chives, snipped
- 1 tablespoon pine nuts
- 1 lemon, zested (.or peel finely grated)

Directions:
- Line a baking tray with rosk salt or you can use crumpled aluminium foil.
- Preheat grill (broiler) to high.
- Place oysters on top of the salt or foil (this will hold the oysters steady).
- Add the breadcrumbs to a bowl and use your fingertips to rub in the butter.
- Add the remaining ingredients and mix well.
- Spoon mixture on top of the oysters.
- Grill for 2 to 3 minutes, or until the topping is golden.
- serve immediately.

Garlicky Guacamole Appetizer Dip

Ingredients:
- 2 avocados
- 1/4 cup KRAFT Spicy Ranch Dressing
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1/4 cup finely chopped red peppers

Directions:
- Mash avocados in medium bowl.
- Add dressing and garlic; mix well.
- Sprinkle with peppers.

Chocolate Chunk Macadamia Nut Cookies

Ingredients:
- 34 cup granulated sugar
- 34 cup brown sugar, packed
- 12 cup unsalted butter, room temperture
- 12 cup shortening
- 1 egg
- 2 teaspoons vanilla
- 2 12 cups flour
- 1 teaspoon baking soda
- 1 14 cups semisweet chocolate chunks
- 34 cup macadamia nuts, halved

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 375*F. Do not grease baking sheets.
- In a large mixing bowl, cream the sugars, shortning and butter, until light and fluffy.
- Beat in the egg and vanilla.
- Add the flour and baking soda; mix thoroughly.
- Fold in chocolate chunks, and nuts.
- Blend well.
- Drop by large rounded tablespoons 3 inches apart on a ungreased baking sheet.
- Lightly press the cookiewih the bottom of a drinking glass to flatten slightly, and bake 10-12 minutes or until lightly browned.
- Remove cookies and cool on a wire rack.

Pumpkin Chip Muffins

Ingredients:
- 1 2/3 c. flour
- 1 c. sugar
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 1 tsp. baking soda
- 1 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 2 eggs
- 1 c. pumpkin
- 1/2 c. melted margarine
- 1 c. chocolate chips

Directions:
- In a large bowl combine flour, sugar, cinnamon, baking soda, baking powder and salt.
- In another bowl beat eggs pumpkin and butter.
- Stir into dry ingredients just until blended, fold in chips.
- Greased or paper-lined muffin cups, bake at 350° for 20-25 minutes.
- Cool for 5 minutes before removing from pan.

Joe'S Vegetable Medley

Ingredients:
- 1 (13 ounce) can whole kernel corn
- 1 (13 ounce) can cut green beans, drained
- 1/2 cup chopped celery
- 1/4 cup chopped green pepper
- 1/2 cup chopped onion
- 1/2 cup cheez whiz
- 1/2 cup sour cream
- 1 (10 ounce) can cream of celery soup
- salt and pepper to taste

Directions:
- Combine all ingredients in 3 quart casserole. Cover in cracker crumbs and bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes.

Peach Strawberry Sauce

Ingredients:
- 1 (15 ounce) can peach slices in juice
- 1/4 cup sugar
- 1 tablespoon cornstarch
- 1/2 teaspoon almond flavoring
- 4 -6 large fresh strawberries, sliced

Directions:
- Drain juice from peaches into a saucepan.
- Combine sugar and cornstarch; stir in to juice.
- Cook over medium-low heat until thickened.
- Add almond flavoring, reserved peach slices, and sliced strawberries; heat through.

Earth Friendly Polishing Cleanser

Ingredients:
- 1 (500 g) box baking soda
- water, as needed
- dish cloth

Directions:
- Sprinkle your sink or pot with the baking soda.
- Moisten your dish cloth with water and scrub until shiny.
- Rinse and enjoy the glow.

Turkey Noodle Soup

Ingredients:
- 9 cups homemade turkey or chicken broth
- 4 medium carrots, shredded
- 3 celery ribs, sliced
- 1 medium onion, chopped
- 1 teaspoon rubbed sage
- 1/2 teaspoon pepper
- 3 whole cloves
- 1 bay leaf
- 2 cups diced cooked turkey
- 1 cup uncooked macaroni
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley

Directions:
- In a large kettle or Dutch oven, combine the first six ingredients. Tie cloves and bay leaf in a cheesecloth bag and add to kettle; bring to a boil. Reduce heat; cover and simmer for 1 hour. Add turkey, macaroni and parsley; cover and simmer for 15-20 minutes or until the macaroni is tender and the soup is heated through. Discard spice bag.

Sugar Cookies

Ingredients:
- 2 cups sugar
- 1 cup oleo
- 1 cup oil
- 2 eggs
- 5 cups flour
- 2 teaspoons baking soda
- 2 teaspoons cream of tartar
- 12 teaspoon salt
- 2 teaspoons vanilla

Directions:
- Mix sugar, oleo, oil, eggs, and vanilla; set aside.
- Mix all remaining ingredients.
- Mix dry ingredients into sugar mixture.
- Roll into small balls and press with glass that has been dipped in water and then in sugar.
- Bake 8-10 minutes at 350.

Pound Cake

Ingredients:
- 4 c. all-purpose flour
- 3 c. sugar
- 3 sticks butter
- 1 c. milk
- 1 Tbsp. walnut extract
- 1 Tbsp. vanilla
- 1 tsp. almond extract
- 8 eggs
- 2 tsp. baking powder

Directions:
- Cream softened butter and sugar until light in a mixer bowl (beat on medium speed of electric mixer until well creamed, about 5 minutes).
- Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each. Sift flour and baking powder together twice.
- Add to cream mixture alternately with milk, beating after each addition.
- Add flavoring and continue to beat 5 minutes to make batter light and fluffy.

Chicken And Spaghetti

Ingredients:
- 1 chicken, cooked, skinned and chopped
- 1 bell pepper, chopped
- 4 celery ribs, chopped
- 1 can tomatoes
- salt
- pepper
- Italian seasoning
- bay leaf
- 1/2 pkg. spaghetti (1 lb. size)

Directions:
- Cook chicken and save broth.
- Remove chicken to cool in order to remove skin and chop.
- Add the rest of ingredients to broth. Simmer until done.
- Add chicken and uncooked spaghetti.
- Cook until spaghetti is done.

Dolly Bread

Ingredients:
- 1 can cream style corn
- 1 green bell pepper
- 1 medium onion
- 2 c. Cheddar cheese, grated
- 1/2 c. oil
- 3 eggs, beaten
- 2 c. self-rising corn meal mix
- 8 oz. sour cream
- 1/4 c. sugar

Directions:
- Pour a little oil in skillet.
- Sprinkle with corn meal.
- Bake at 400°.

Peach Crumble

Ingredients:
- 1 (29 oz.) can Hunt's peach slices, drained
- 3/4 c. brown sugar
- 1/2 c. flour
- 1 1/2 tsp. cinnamon
- 1/4 c. butter

Directions:
- Arrange peach slices in greased shallow baking pan.
- Blend remaining ingredients until crumbly.
- Sprinkle over peaches.
- Bake at 375° for 25 minutes; serve warm or cold.

Rotel Cheese Dip

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. Velveeta cheese
- 1 can diced Ro-Tel tomatoes
- 1 lb. hamburger or Wolf chili

Directions:
- Melt cheese; add chili or browned hamburger.
- Add Ro-Tel and stir.
- Makes great dip for tortilla chips.

Crab Cheese Appetizer

Ingredients:
- 12 oz. cream cheese
- 1 Tbsp. lemon juice
- 1 to 2 Tbsp. grated onion
- 2 Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
- 2 Tbsp. mayonnaise
- dash of garlic
- 6 oz. chili sauce
- 7 1/2 oz. flaked crab
- parsley

Directions:
- Blend cream cheese, lemon juice, grated onion, Worcestershire sauce, mayonnaise and garlic.
- Spread on 16-inch diameter plate (small pizza pan or use 10-inch pie plate for thicker).
- Cover with chili sauce and flaked crab.
- Sprinkle with parsley.
- Serve with crackers.
- (Can also use can of shrimp or tuna for topping.)

Date Dessert

Ingredients:
- 14 crushed Unida Bisquit, unsalted
- 1 c. sugar
- 4 oz. dates, cut up
- 3/4 c. chopped nuts
- 3 egg whites, beaten stiff
- 1 tsp. vanilla

Directions:
- Beat egg
- whites
- stiff
- and fold in all other ingredients. Bake in
- square
- 8	or
- 9-inch pan at 350° for 30 to 40 minutes.

Plain Ole Italian Bread Abm

Ingredients:
- 1 1/3 cups warm water (110 degrees)
- 1 1/2 teaspoons olive oil
- 1 tablespoon brown sugar
- 4 cups bread flour
- 1 1/2 teaspoons salt
- 2 1/4 teaspoons active dry yeast

Directions:
- Place Water, Olive Oil, Brown Sugar, 2 Cups of the Flour, and then Salt in the pan of the bread machine. Then add the remainder 2 Cups of the Flour (make a little well) and add Yeast.
- Use the French Bread Setting, Medium Crust, 2 lb loaf.
- As the dough is forming you may want to check and scrape the sides a time or two.
- Let the machine do its thing and enjoy the aroma!

Bread pudding

Ingredients:
- stale bread
- butter
- sultana
- apple
- milk egg
- sugar
- golden syrup
- nutmeg

Directions:
- soak the bread in milk until all soggy.
- Squeeze out all the milk and add the melted butter sultanas, chopped apple, beaten eggs, sugar syrup and nutmeg.
- You then just pour all this into a baking dish and bake for about an hour till all cooked.
- Grill the top to make it crispy.

Molasses Cookies With Raisin Filling

Ingredients:
- 1 cup sugar
- 1 cup molasses
- 1 cup shortening
- 2/3 cup boiling water
- 2 teaspoons baking soda
- 2 teaspoons vanilla
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1 teaspoon ginger
- 1 teaspoon cinnamon
- 5 cups flour
- Filling
- 2 cups seedless raisins
- 1 tablespoon flour
- 3/4 cup brown sugar
- 1 cup water

Directions:
- Mix sugar into shortening.
- Add molasses and hot water, mix well.
- Add other ingredients, mixing flour til batter is soft but not sticky.
- On a well floured surface, roll out to 1/4" thickness. Cookies are best when they are thick and large.
- Cook at 250 til edges brown (about 10-12 minutes).
- In saucepan, cook filling ingredients til quite thick (about 10 minutes). When cookies cool, use filling to make sandwiches.

Three Day Iceberg Cucumber Pickles

Ingredients:
- 7 lb. large cucumbers
- 2 1/2 c. lime
- 1/4 lb. alum
- 2 qt . white vinegar
- 1 Tbsp. salt
- 2 Tbsp. mixed spices
- 5 lb. sugar
- water

Directions:
- First
- Day:
- 7:00 a.m.	Weigh 7 pounds large cucumbers; peel, remove
- seeds
- and cut into long sticks.
- Soak in 2 1/2 cups lime mixed with 2 gallons of water.
