- Soak 24 hours.

Maritime Salmon

Ingredients:
- Kraft Regular BarBQ Sauce
- Dijon mustard
- salmon steaks Walmart Supercenter 1 lb For $5.00 thru 02/14
- maple syrup

Directions:
- Mix 1 cup Kraft Original BBQ Sauce with 3 Tbsp.
- maple syrup and 1 Tbsp.
- Dijon mustard until well blended.
- Pour over 4 (4 oz.
- each) salmon steaks or fillets in shallow glass or plastic dish; cover.
- Refrigerate up to 1 hour to marinate.
- Remove salmon from marinade; discard marinade.
- Preheat barbecue to high heat.
- Grill salmon 10 to 15 min.
- or until flakes easily with fork, turning after 5 min.

Squash Dressing

Ingredients:
- 2 c. sliced yellow squash, cooked and drained
- 2 c. crumbled cornbread
- 1 can cream of chicken soup
- 1 small onion, chopped
- 1/2 c. melted butter
- 3 eggs, beaten
- sage to taste (around 1/2 tsp.)

Directions:
- Stir all together and cook at 350° in a buttered casserole for 40 minutes.

Favorite Crock-Pot Chili

Ingredients:
- 2 (16 oz.) cans red kidney beans, drained
- 2 (14 1/2 oz.) cans tomatoes
- 2 lb. coarsely ground beef, browned and drained
- 2 medium onions, chopped
- 1 green pepper, chopped
- 2 cloves garlic, crushed
- 3 Tbsp. chili powder
- 1 tsp. pepper
- 1 tsp. cumin
- salt to taste

Directions:
- Put all ingredients in crock-pot in order listed.
- Stir once. Cover and cook on low 10 to 12 hours (high 5 to 6 hours).

New England Pumpkin Pie

Ingredients:
- 15 ounces prepared pumpkin (or cooked equivalent )
- 3/4 cup brown sugar
- 1/4 cup sugar
- 1/8 teaspoon ground cloves
- 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon
- 1 teaspoon ginger
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 2 extra large eggs (well beaten0)
- 5 ounces heavy cream
- 5 ounces evaporated milk
- 1 (9 inch) deep dish pie shells

Directions:
- 1 Mix first * ingredients in Large Bowl. Mixing Well.
- 2 combine evaporated milk and Cream.
- 3 Combine all ingredients and mix low until combined.
- 4 Pour into ( inch deep dish pie shell.
- 5 brush sides with pumpkin filling to avoid burning.
- 6 Bake at 425 degrees for 15 minutes.
- 7 Reduce Temperature to 350 degrees for 30-35 minutes.
- 8 Pie is done when knife comes out clean from near center.
- 9 let cool on wire wrack until completely cool.

Mexican Chicken Skillet

Ingredients:
- 1 (6 1/2 ounce) box Mexican-style Rice-A-Roni
- 1 lb boneless chicken breast, cubed
- 1 (11 ounce) can Mexican-style corn
- 1 (15 1/2 ounce) can chili beans

Directions:
- Brown chicken in skillet on medium heat till no longer pink.
- Set aside.
- Prepare Mexican rice-a-ronie according to package directions.
- Once Rice is done add Chicken, Beans, and Corn.
- Simmer until warmed through.
- Add toppings as desired.

Yellow Squash with Wild Mushrooms

Ingredients:
- 2 tablespoons unsalted butter
- 8 ounces shiitake mushrooms
- 1 teaspoon minced garlic
- 1 tablespoon chopped fresh thyme
- 3 medium yellow squash, sliced lengthwise paper-thin on a mandoline
- Kosher salt
- Black pepper

Directions:
- In a large skillet, melt the butter over moderately high heat.
- Add the mushrooms, garlic, and thyme, and cook until the mushrooms are browned and tender, about 5 minutes.
- Add the squash, salt and pepper and saute for 3 minutes.
- Serve immediately.

Apple Dumplings

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 c. sugar or less
- 1 1/2 c. water
- 1/4 tsp. cinnamon
- 1/4 tsp. nutmeg
- 10 drops red food coloring
- 3 Tbsp. margarine
- 2 c. sifted flour
- 2 tsp. baking powder
- 1 tsp. salt
- 2/3 c. shortening
- 1/2 c. milk
- 6 apples, sliced

Directions:
- Combine sugar, water, cinnamon, nutmeg and food coloring; bring to boil.
- Add butter and cool.
- Sift flour, baking powder and salt; cut into 6-inch squares.
- Place apples in each square. Sprinkle with sugar, cinnamon and nutmeg; dot with butter.
- Fold corners to center.

Spinach Casserole

Ingredients:
- 3 pkg. frozen, chopped spinach
- 1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese
- 1 can cream of chicken soup
- 1 c. French fried onion rings

Directions:
- Cook and drain spinach. Stir in the cream cheese until melted. Add the chicken soup and top with onion rings.
- Bake 5 to 10 minutes.

Marinated Green Bean & Cheese Salad

Ingredients:
- 2 cups young green string beans
- 12 teaspoon dry mustard
- 12 cup red wine vinegar
- 14 teaspoon water
- 1 teaspoon sugar
- 14 teaspoon salt
- 12 teaspoon dried oregano, crushed
- 12 teaspoon dried tarragon, crushed
- 14 teaspoon fresh ground black pepper
- 12 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce
- 12 cup chopped red onion
- 6 ounces reduced-fat monterey jack cheese, diced (1 1/2 cups)

Directions:
- Remove the ends of strings from the beans.
- Steam them just until crispy-tender, and then place them under cold running water to stop the cooking.
- Drain thoroughly and set aside.
- Combine the dry mustard with 1 tablespoon of the vinegar and stir until completely dissolved.
- Add all the remaining ingredients except the cooked beans, onion and cheese, and mix well.
- Combine the beans, onion and cheese in a nonaluminum bowl and pour the marinade over them.
- Mix well, cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.

Corn Flake Candy

Ingredients:
- 1 c. white Karo syrup
- 1 c. sugar
- 1 (12 oz.) jar crunchy peanut butter
- 6 c. corn flakes

Directions:
- Mix syrup, sugar and peanut butter.
- Cook over medium heat to a bubbling boil.
- Add corn flakes.
- Spoon drop onto wax paper.

Irish Potato Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 c. butter
- 2 c. sugar
- 4 Tbsp. cocoa
- 1/2 c. milk
- 2 c. flour
- 4 eggs
- 1 tsp. baking powder
- 1 tsp. each: cloves, nutmeg, cinnamon, allspice and vanilla
- pinch of salt
- 1 c. hot mashed potatoes

Directions:
- Cream butter and sugar.
- Add eggs and beat well.
- Sift together flour, cocoa, baking powder and spices.
- Add milk and flour mixture alternately.
- Beat well.
- Add hot mashed potatoes, chopped pecans and vanilla last.
- Bake in 3 (9-inch) layer pans at 350° for 25 to 30 minutes or in Bundt or tube pan at 350° for 1 hour.

Creamy Red Pepper Dip

Ingredients:
- 7 ounces sweet roasted red peppers, drained and chopped
- 1 garlic clove, pressed
- 1 tablespoon fresh basil leaf, thinly sliced
- 1 cup sour cream
- 1 cup fat-free mayonnaise
- 12 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce
- 18 teaspoon salt
- 1 large green peppers or 1 large red bell pepper

Directions:
- Drain roasted peppers; pat dry.
- Using food chopper, chop roasted peppers; place in classic 2-quart bowl.
- Press garlic into bowl, with a garlic press.
- Slice basil leaves.
- Add basil, sour cream, mayonnaise, worcestershire sauce, and salt; mix well.
- Cut top off of green pepper.
- Remove membranes and seeds.
- Fill with dip.
- Serve it assorted cut up vegetables.

Real Good Pie

Ingredients:
- 1 c. crushed pineapple, drained
- 3/4 stick oleo, melted
- 3 eggs
- 3 Tbsp. flour
- 1 c. coconut
- 1 1/2 c. sugar
- 1 (9-inch) unbaked pie shell

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients and pour mixture into pie shell and bake at 350° for 1 hour or until set and browned.

7 Layered Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 head lettuce, torn into small pieces
- radishes to make a layer
- green onions to make a layer
- 2 cucumbers, sliced
- 1 1/2 c. shredded Cheddar cheese
- 1 c. frozen peas
- 1 lb. bacon, fried crisp and crumbled
- any vegetables you like in your salad
- 1 1/2 c. Miracle Whip
- 1/2 carton sour cream

Directions:
- Put layers in this
- order in 9 x 13-inch pan:
- lettuce, peas, radishes, green
- onions and cucumbers.
- Mix Miracle Whip and sour cream.
- Seal
- in
- lettuce and vegetables with Miracle Whip mixture.
- Top with cheese and bacon.

Granny'S Pound Cake

Ingredients:
- 7 large or 8 medium eggs, separated
- 2 2/3 c. sugar
- 2 sticks margarine or 1/2 lb. butter, melted
- 1 c. Crisco
- 3 1/2 c. sifted plain flour
- 1/2 c. coffee cream or Pet milk
- 1 Tbsp. vanilla

Directions:
- Beat egg whites with 6 tablespoons sugar and refrigerate while mixing cake.
- Cream sugar, butter and Crisco.
- Add egg yolks and blend on medium speed of mixer, then on lowest speed, add in flour, milk and vanilla.
- Mix well.
- Quickly add egg whites and fold in.
- Bake in tube pan (10-inch)) at 325° for 1 hour and 10 minutes.

Gooey Butter Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 yellow cake mix
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 2 eggs
- 1/2 cup butter or margarine
- 8 ounces cheese Creme, softened
- 1 pound powdered sugar
- 2 eggs

Directions:
- Mix cake ingredients, and place in a greased 9x13 pan. Mixture should be thick like cookie dough.
- Mix topping ingredients and pour over the cake mixture. Bake at 350 for 35 minutes. Cake will drop as it cools, this is normal. Top by sprinkling with powdered sugar. For a delicious variation, use a lemon cake mix instead of the yellow one. This cake is VERY rich.

Beef Stroganoff

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 to 2 lb. round steak, cut into bite-size pieces
- 1/2 c. chopped onion
- 1 can cream of mushroom soup
- 4 oz. mushrooms
- 1 c. water
- 1/2 tsp. garlic powder
- 8 oz. sour cream
- 2 to 3 tsp. cornstarch

Directions:
- Brown steak in small amount of cooking oil.
- Add onions, soup, mushrooms and seasonings.
- Simmer until meat is tender (covered). Thicken gravy to desired consistency by adding cornstarch in small amount of water.
- Just before serving, stir in sour cream while still hot.
- (Do not boil, sour cream will curdle.)
- Serve over cooked rice or noodles.

Grandma Warnken'S Candy Clusters

Ingredients:
- 4 1/2 c. Cap'n Crunch peanut butter cereal
- 1 1/2 c. small colored marshmallows
- 1 1/2 c. Spanish peanuts
- 1 1/2 lb. white almond bark

Directions:
- Melt bark over hot water.
- Remove and add cereal and nuts. Wait 5 minutes, then add marshmallows.
- Drop by spoonfuls onto greased cookie sheet.

Pumpkin Ghoul Whip

Ingredients:
- 1 gal. Cold milk
- 4-2/3 cups JELL-O Vanilla Instant Pudding
- 1 DREAM WHIP Whipped Topping Mix
- 1-1/2 qt. Canned pumpkin
- 2 Tbsp. pumpkin pie spice
- 1 qt. chocolate decorating icing or frosting
- 56 each candy spiders

Directions:
- Place milk, pudding mix, whipped topping mix, pumpkin and pumpkin pie spice in bowl of electric mixer fitted with wire whip attachment.
- Beat on low speed 30 seconds or just until moistened.
- Scrape bowl.
- Beat on medium speed 5 to 8 minutes or until well blended.
- Spoon into 56 individual serving dishes (or 7 dishes for trial recipe).
- Refrigerate until ready to serve.
- Decorate each with decorating icing and candy spider to resemble spider web.

Chocolate Delight

Ingredients:
- 1 c. flour
- 1 Tbsp. sugar
- 1 stick melted butter
- 1 c. chopped nuts

Directions:
- Blend all well.
- Put into an 8 x 11-inch pan.
- Bake at 350° for 15 to 20 minutes.
- Cool.

Lemon Pineapple Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 pkg. lemon or orange supreme cake mix without pudding
- 3 1/2 oz. pkg. instant coconut cream pudding
- 3/4 c. vegetable oil
- 4 eggs
- 12 oz. can lemon-lime carbonated beverage

Directions:
- Combine first 3 ingredients; beat at medium speed of an electric mixer until well blended.
- Add eggs, one at a time, beating after each addition.
- Add lemon-lime beverage; mix well. Pour batter into 3 greased and floured 9-inch cake pans.
- Bake at 350° for 35 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean.
- Cool in pans 10 minutes; remove from pans, let cool completely.
- Spread Pineapple Topping between layers and on top of cake.

Sesame Baked Chicken

Ingredients:
- 1 chicken bouillon cube
- 3/4 c. boiling water
- 1 tsp. curry powder
- 3/4 tsp. salt
- 3/4 tsp. garlic powder
- 3/4 tsp. dry mustard
- 3 tsp. water
- 3/4 tsp. paprika
- 4 (10 oz.) chicken breasts, skins removed
- 3 tsp. sesame seed

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350°.
- Dissolve bouillon in boiling water. Combine bouillon with seasonings; mix well.
- Rub into chicken. Place skinned side down in casserole dish.
- Bake at 350° for 30 minutes, basting with accumulated liquid.
- Increase heat to 400°. Turn chicken and sprinkle with sesame seeds.
- Bake 10 minutes more for crispness.

Spatchcocked Herb-Roasted Turkey

Ingredients:
- 1 turkey (12 to 14 pounds)
- 3 tablespoons kosher salt
- 2 teaspoons coarsely ground pepper
- 1 tablespoon minced fresh rosemary
- 1 tablespoon minced fresh thyme
- 1 tablespoon minced fresh sage

Directions:
- Place turkey with its breast side down and tail end facing you on a work surface. Using kitchen shears, cut along each side of backbone; remove and save for making gravy. Turn turkey over so breast side is up; flatten by pressing down firmly on breastbone until it cracks. Twist and tuck wings under to secure in place.
- Mix remaining ingredients; rub onto all sides of turkey. Transfer turkey to a rack in a foil-lined rimmed baking pan. Refrigerate, uncovered, overnight.
- Preheat oven to 450°. Remove turkey from refrigerator while oven heats. Roast until a thermometer inserted in thickest part of thigh reads 170°-175°, 1-1/4 to 1-1/2 hours. Remove turkey from oven; let stand 15 minutes before carving.

Peach Skillet Pie

Ingredients:
- 2 c. sifted all-purpose flour
- 1 tsp. salt
- 4 tsp. baking powder
- 6 Tbsp. shortening
- 1/2 to 2/3 c. milk
- 8 or 10 peeled fresh peaches
- 3/4 c. sugar
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 tsp. cinnamon
- 2 Tbsp. butter

Directions:
- Mix ingredients.
- Roll out 1/8-inch thick on lightly floured board.
- Pat into heavy skillet, letting dough hang over sides. Fill in with fresh peaches.
- Sprinkle with mixture of sugar, salt, cinnamon and butter.
- Fold extra dough toward center, leaving center uncovered.
- Bake 10 minutes at 450°, then 25 minutes at 275°.

Tricia's crock pot venison

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 packages venison
- 1 can cream of mushroom soup
- 1 can beef consume
- 1/2 cup red wine
- 3 tbsp worcestershire sauce
- 3 each bay leaf
- 1 each salt, pepper, basil, all spice, dried chives, onion powder, garlic powder. and what ever other favorite spice u like

Directions:
- throw everything together in the crock pot, cook on high for an hour, then turn to low and cook another 4 to 5 hours depending on how thick your venison is.
- You could also add fresh onion, mushrooms and garlic to the pot if you would like to at the start of cooking.

Property Management At Low Cost

Ingredients:
- independent financial services Melbourne
- Property Management At Low Cost

Directions:
- independent financial services Melbourne

Crunchy Apple Crisp

Ingredients:
- 1 can Thank You apple pie filling
- 1/4 c. all-purpose flour
- 1 c. quick or old fashioned oats
- 1/3 c. brown sugar
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 1/4 tsp. nutmeg
- 1/3 c. butter or margarine, melted

Directions:
- Place apple pie filling in shallow 1-quart baking dish.
- In a bowl, combine flour, oats, brown sugar, salt and spices.
- Add butter; mix well.
- Spread topping evenly over pie filling.
- Bake in a 375° oven for about 30 minutes.
- Serve warm or cold with or without ice cream.
- Serves 6.

Pasta With Primavera Sauce

Ingredients:
- 1 small c. broccoli florets
- 1 small zucchini, sliced
- 1 small sweet red pepper, cut in strips
- 1/2 c. Chinese snow peas
- 1/4 c. butter or margarine
- 1 c. half and half, warmed
- fresh ground pepper to taste
- 1 lb. linguini, cooked and drained
- grated Parmesan cheese

Directions:
- In a large skillet, saute broccoli, zucchini, red pepper and snow peas in butter until tender-crisp.
- Add half and half and pepper; cook briefly until slightly reduced.
- Serve over linguini; sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.
- Makes 4 servings.

Any-Time-Of-The-Day Ham And Cheese Pinwheels

Ingredients:
- 1 pound store-bought pizza dough
- Whole-grain mustard
- 6 ounces deli ham
- 1 package shredded mild cheddar

Directions:
- Preheat your oven to 375°F.
- On a lightly floured surface, roll out the pizza dough as close to a 1/2-inch thick rectangle as possible. Use a butter knife or a pastry brush to smear as much or as little mustard onto the dough as you like. (If you don't like mustard, feel free to use ketchup.) Sprinkle the ham and cheese evenly over the mustard.
- Starting with the edge nearest you, begin rolling the dough. Once it is all rolled up, pinch the edges of the dough along the seam to prevent it from unraveling. Use a sharp knife to cut 6 to 8, 2-inch thick pieces. Evenly space the pinwheels on a greased baking sheet and place in the oven.
- Bake for 12 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from oven and let cool for 5 minutes before serving.

Onion Pot Roast (Slow Cooker)

Ingredients:
- 1 (4 lb) boneless beef chuck roast
- 1 tablespoon oil
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 12 teaspoon pepper
- 6 medium onions, sliced
- 1 12 cups beef broth
- 34 cup beer (you can use nonalcoholic)
- 2 tablespoons packed brown sugar
- 3 tablespoons Dijon mustard

Directions:
- Trim excess fat from beef.
- Heat oil in 10-inch skillet over medium-high heat.
- Cook beef in oil about 10 minutes, turning occasionally, until brown on all sides.
- Sprinkle with salt and pepper.
- Place onions in large slow cooker.
- Place beef on top of onions.
- Mix remaining ingredients; pour over beef and onions.
- Cover and cook on low heat setting 8 to 10 hours or until beef is tender.
- Remove beef and onions from cooker, using slotted spoon.
- Cut beef into slices.
- Serve beef with juices.

Squash Casserole

Ingredients:
- 4 c. cooked dice squash
- 1 small bag corn bread stuffing
- 1 c. cream of mushroom
- 1 12 oz sour cream
- 1 onion chopped
- 1 12 oz frozen mix vegetables
- 1 stick butter

Directions:
- Boil squash and onion till tender.
- Just before draining, put frozen vegetables in water to thaw out.
- Mix butter and stuffing in large bowl and put in microwave till butter melts.
- Mix squash, vegetables, onion, soup and sour cream together.
- Make layer of 1/2 stuffing in dish, layer of vegetables mix; top with other half of stuffing mix.

Quick Apple Dessert

Ingredients:
- 5 c. chopped apples
- 1 c. water
- 1 (3 oz.) pkg. raspberry jello
- 1 c. flour
- 1 c. sugar
- 1 stick oleo or butter
- ice cream

Directions:
- Mix flour, sugar and oleo until crumbly.
- Pour apples in buttered baking dish, 8 x 8-inch.
- Sprinkle jello over apples and pour water over apples and jello.
- Next sprinkle flour mixture over apples.
- Bake 40 minutes in a 350° oven or until apples are tender and topping is golden brown.
- Can be served with ice cream.

Granny Cord'S Old Fashioned Tea Cakes

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. butter
- 1 c. sugar
- 1/2 c. buttermilk
- 1 egg
- 1 tsp. soda
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- flour

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients together in a bowl of flour as you would to make biscuits.
- Roll out on a board and cut with a round cookie cutter.
- Place on a greased cookie sheet and bake at 400° until golden brown.

Roasted Chicken With Fresh Herbs And Garlic 

Ingredients:
- 30 g fresh thyme, 1/2 chopped, 1/2 left whole
- 30 g fresh sage, 1/2 chopped, 1/2 left whole
- 15 g fresh flat-leaf parsley, 1/2 chopped, 1/2 left whole
- 1 None chicken (about 1.25kg)
- 100 ml olive oil
- 20 cloves garlic, unpeeled
- 2 sticks celery, finely chopped
- 1 sprig fresh rosemary
- None None French bread, to serve

Directions:
- Preheat the oven to 300°F. Using kitchen string, tie the whole sprigs of thyme, sage and parsley together into a bunch. Sprinkle the inside of the chicken with salt and place the herbs inside. Tie the legs and wings with kitchen string.
- To cook the chicken, heat the oil in a Dutch oven and saute the garlic, celery, rosemary and chopped herbs for 1 min. Add the chicken and baste with the herb mixture. Season with salt and black pepper and cover with a lid or aluminum foil. Roast for 2 hours, or until the juices run clear. Serve with French bread.

Oven Fried Pork Chops

Ingredients:
- 3 Tbsp. margarine or butter
- 1 egg, beaten
- 2 Tbsp. milk
- 1 c. corn bread stuffing mix
- 4 pork loin chops (about 1 1/2 lb.), cut 1/2-inch thick

Directions:
- Set oven to 425°.
- Place margarine or butter in a 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking pan.
- Place pan in the oven about 3 minutes or until margarine melts.
- Stir together egg and milk.
- Dip pork chops in egg mixture.
- Coat with stuffing mix.
- Place chops on top of melted margarine in pan.
- Bake 20 minutes.
- Turn.
- Bake 10 to 15 minutes more or until pork is no longer pink.

Skillet Date Balls

Ingredients:
- 1/4 lb. butter
- 1 egg
- 1 c. sugar
- 1 c. dates
- 2 c. Rice Krispies
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 3/4 c. nuts

Directions:
- Melt butter in skillet.
- Add chopped dates.
- Combine sugar and egg, then add to skillet mixture.
- Stir over low heat 3 to 5 mintues.
- Turn off heat.
- Add vanilla, nuts and Rice Krispies. Cool slightly, then form into balls size of walnuts.
- Roll in powdered sugar or coconut.

shrimp ceviche

Ingredients:
- 1/2 red onion
- 3 cup medium shrimp
- 2 limes juiced
- 1 chili pepper
- 1/2 cup cilantro leaves
- 3 large avacados
- 1 cup fresh pineapple chopped
- 1 dash salt
- 1 dash pepper

Directions:
- slice onion very thin
- place onion in bowl of cold salted water
- cook shrimp for 1or 2 minutes drain and rinse with cold water
- finely mince pepper removing seeds and veins
- place chili and shrimp in bowl with lime juice
- cut one avacado and pineapple into bite size pieces
- drain and rinse onions and toss all ingredients
- chill for 15 minutes

Helosie Fast Slaw

Ingredients:
- 1 (1 lb) package coleslaw mix
- 1/4 cup Italian dressing (or 1/2 cup)
- 1/2 teaspoon celery seed
- 1/2 teaspoon dill
- 1 teaspoon soy sauce

Directions:
- Put the dressing and seasonings in a large plastic zip bag.
- Add the cabbage.
- Close the bag and shake, shake, shake.
- Taste better if you refrigerate for several hours (turning the bag every 30 minutes or so to distribute the dressing).

Best Bean Dip

Ingredients:
- 2 cans bean dip
- 1 pt. sour cream
- 1 pkg. taco mix
- 1/2 tomato, diced
- 1/2 green pepper, diced

Directions:
- Spread bean dip on a serving platter.
- Mix together the sour cream and taco mix.
- Spread over bean dip until well covered. Garnish top with diced tomato and green pepper.
- Serve with corn chips.

Ham And Cheese Ball

Ingredients:
- 1 can deviled ham
- 1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese
- dash of Worcestershire
- 1 Tbsp. chopped onion
- 1 tsp. horseradish

Directions:
- Soften cream cheese.
- Using mixer, slightly cream the cheese, then add the remaining ingredients.
- Chill.
- If desired, roll in chopped nuts and shape into a ball before serving.

Oatmeal Pie

Ingredients:
- 1 stick butter
- 1/2 c. brown sugar
- 1/2 c. white sugar
- 1/4 c. Quick oats
- 1/4 c. coconut
- 2 eggs
- 1/2 tsp. vanilla
- 1/4 c. dark syrup

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients and bake 45 minutes in
- a 350° oven.

"You Should Taste These" Potatoes

Ingredients:
- 8 medium-size potatoes, boiled in jackets
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1 lb. Velveeta cheese
- 1/2 c. green onion, chopped
- 1 c. sour cream or real mayonnaise
- 1/2 lb. bacon, cooked, drained and crumbled

Directions:
- Boil potatoes just until peeling turns loose.
- (You can boil longer to save baking time in oven.)
- Chunk the potatoes in a 9 x 13-inch pan and salt and pepper to taste.
- Combine all other ingredients (except bacon).
- Pour over potatoes.
- Add crumbled bacon on top.
- Bake at 325° for 1 hour.

Poached and Roasted Asparagus with Parmesan Cheese

Ingredients:
- 2 pounds jumbo asparagus
- Water
- 2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice
- Salt and pepper
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1/2 teaspoon fresh lemon juice
- 1 cup Parmesan cheese
- 1 tablespoon ground black pepper

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 450 degrees.
- Clean asparagus by trimming lower 2 inches or so of tough asparagus bottom and peel remainder of stalk to within 2 inches of tip.
- Tie asparagus into small bundles for easier handling.
- In a pot, combine water, lemon juice, salt, and pepper and bring to a boil.
- Add asparagus and poach for 3 minutes.
- Drain asparagus and submerge in ice water to stop blanching process.
- Asparagus may be drained and held at this point for future use.
- Place drained asparagus in baking dish and drizzle with olive oil and lemon juice.
- Sprinkle Parmesan cheese and black pepper over asparagus and place in oven.
- Roast until cheese melts.
- Serve immediately.

Lemonade Pies

Ingredients:
- 1 sm. can of frozen lemonade
- 12 oz. tub cool whip
- 1 can sweetened condensed milk
- lemon juice
- 2 graham cracker pie crusts

Directions:
- Stir cool whip and sweetened condensed milk together until blended, add lemonade and beat until smooth.
- Add some lemon juice if you want the pies tart.
- Pour into graham cracker pie crust and put in refrigerator for at least 2 hours before serving.
- Better if overnight.

Mayonnaise Biscuits

Ingredients:
- 1 1/4 c. self-rising flour
- 1/4 tsp. soda
- 1 1/4 tsp. baking powder
- 2 Tbsp. mayonnaise
- buttermilk (to mix, stiff enough to drop from spoon)

Directions:
- Drop on a greased pan.
- Cook at 450°.

Peanut Butter Cookies

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. margarine
- 1/2 c. peanut butter
- 1/2 c. granulated sugar
- 1/2 c. brown sugar
- 1 egg or 2 egg whites or egg substitute to equal 1 egg
- 1/2 tsp. vanilla extract
- 1/2 tsp. baking soda
- 1 c. flour

Directions:
- Cream together the margarine and peanut butter. Add white and brown sugar.
- Stir in egg, vanilla, flour and baking soda.
- Place dough, a teaspoon at a time, on cookie sheet.
- Press each spoonful flat with a floured fork. Bake at 350° for 10 minutes. Cool a minute or two before removing from cookie sheet.
- Yields 5 dozen.

Barbecue Hamburgers

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. hamburger
- 1 small onion, chopped
- 4 c. diced celery
- 2 Tbsp. shortening
- 4 Tbsp. lemon juice
- 2 Tbsp. vinegar
- 3 Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
- 1 c. catsup
- 3 or 4 Tbsp. brown sugar
- 1/2 Tbsp. mustard

Directions:
- Brown meat and onion.
- In separate pan, place 1 tablespoon shortening, celery, lemon juice, vinegar, Worcestershire sauce, catsup, brown sugar and mustard.
- Cook 1/2 hour.
- Combine with cooked meat.

Tater Swiss Omelet

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. butter
- 6 medium potatoes
- 12 slices bacon, cooked and cubed
- 1 (4 oz.) can mushrooms, sliced and drained
- 1 c. shredded Swiss cheese
- 6 eggs, separated

Directions:
- Melt butter in large frying pan.
- Add potatoes and fry until brown.
- Place in 9-inch square baking dish.
- Sprinkle with cooked and crumbled bacon.
- Stir together egg yolks, mushrooms and cheese.
- Beat egg whites until stiff, but not dry.
- Fold cheese mixture into whites.
- Pour over bacon.
- Bake in preheated oven at 350° for 25 to 30 minutes or until set.
- Serves 6.

Vegetable Dip

Ingredients:
- 2 c. sour cream
- 1/2 to 1 c. mayonnaise
- 1 Tbsp. dill weed
- 1 tsp. Accent
- 1 Tbsp. parsley flakes
- 1 Tbsp. chives
- 1 Tbsp. Season-All

Directions:
- Mix well. Serve with raw vegetables.

Mom'S Carne Guisada

Ingredients:
- 2 pounds round steak, cut into bite size pieces
- 1 tablespoon garlic powder
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- salt and pepper to taste
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1/8 cup all-purpose flour
- 2 cups water
- 1 onion, sliced
- 1 green bell pepper, chopped

Directions:
- Season the meat with the garlic powder, cumin and salt and pepper to taste. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add the meat and saute for 5 to 10 minutes, or until browned on all sides.
- Add the flour, stirring well, and saute for 1 more minute. Gradually add the water, making sure to crush any flour lumps. Then add the onion and green bell pepper, reduce heat to low and simmer for 15 to 20 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Party Cheese Ball

Ingredients:
- 2 (8 oz.) pkg. Philadelphia cream cheese
- 2 c. (8 oz.) shredded sharp Cheddar cheese
- 1 Tbsp. each of chopped pimento, chopped onion and chopped green pepper
- 1 tsp. Worcestershire sauce
- 1 tsp. lemon juice
- finely chopped pecans or walnuts

Directions:
- Combine softened cream cheese and Cheddar cheese, mixing until well blended.
- Add remaining ingredients; mix well.
- Chill well. Shape into a ball.
- Roll in chopped pecans or walnuts.

Pecan Pralines

Ingredients:
- 1 pkg. butterscotch pudding
- 1 c. granulated sugar
- 1/2 c. brown sugar
- 1/2 c. evaporated milk
- 1 lb. butter
- 1/2 lb. pecans

Directions:
- Cook and stir until the sugar dissolves, then add pecans. Boil for 3 to 5 minutes, until soft ball forms when dropped in cold water.
- Beat until thick and still shiny.
- Quickly drop by the teaspoon on waxed paper.

citrus weight loss smoothie

Ingredients:
- 1 tbsp linseeds
- 4 tbsp pro biotic yogurt
- 2 large oranges
- 1 large lemon
- 150 ml orange juice

Directions:
- peel fruit and put all ingredients in blender.
- blend for 3minutes
- this makes one pint,drink over a ten minute period at least a half hour before a meal for 7days to loose 5 pounds or more!
- repeat once a month to combat water weight gain.
- this recipe came from a circuit training course i took and it helped me to loose 7pounds.

Lemon Bisque

Ingredients:
- 1 1/4 c. boiling water
- 1/3 c. sugar
- 1 large can chilled evaporated milk
- 1 pkg. lemon jello
- juice of 1 lemon
- dash of salt
- graham cracker crumbs

Directions:
- Mix water, jello, sugar and lemon juice.
- Let stand until cold and just starts to set.
- Then whip jello mixture, milk and salt in a large bowl until stiff.

Sweet Curd Cake With Raisins

Ingredients:
- 500 g low fat curds (Eastern European)
- 3 egg whites
- 3 dessert spoons semolina
- 3 -4 dessert spoons white sugar
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1/2 cup raisins

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 190C.
- In the bowl add curd and press it with the fork to get rid of large crumbs.
- Add egg whites and mix together with the curd.
- Add semolina, white sugar, baking powder, vannila extract and mix well to form a smooth mixture. You can also leave it crumbled for the texture
- Stir in the raisins.
- Place the mixture in the square or rounded baking tray covered with parchment paper and bake till the top forms golden brown.

Dill Pickles

Ingredients:
- garlic cloves, peeled
- fresh dill
- powdered alum
- pickling cucumbers
- white vinegar
- salt

Directions:
- Prepare cucumbers as you like them:
- spears, slices, whole.
- In bottom of each quart jar, put one whole garlic clove, 1 sprig of fresh dill and 1/2 teaspoon of alum.
- Fill jar with cucumbers, packing tightly.
- Place one more garlic clove and 1 sprig of fresh dill on top of jar.
- Fill with prepared water*.
- Process by home canning method.
- Let set for 3 months before serving.

Chicken Spaghetti

Ingredients:
- 2 c. cooked spaghetti
- 1/4 c. onion
- 1/4 c. pimento
- 1/4 c. bell pepper
- 2 c. cooked, cubed chicken
- 1 c. chicken broth
- 1 1/2 c. Cheddar cheese
- 1 can cream of mushroom soup
- salt and pepper to taste

Directions:
- Mix together; sprinkle more grated cheese on top.
- Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.
- Serves 6 to 8.

Triple Berry Mimosa

Ingredients:
- 1/4 cup blackberry
- 1/4 cup strawberry, leaves and top removed
- 1/4 cup raspberries
- 1 cup orange juice
- 750 ml champagne

Directions:
- If you have a juicer yay for you - add blackberries, strawberries, and raspberries to your juicer and juice into a small cup. Pour 1-2 tablespoons of orange juice into your juicer while it's running after juicing the berries. Juiced berries have a thicker texture so the orange juice helps to push out more of the berry juice. You should end up with 1/4 cup to 1/2 cup of juice.
- If you don't have a juicer then do what I do and run your berries through a blender on grind and then strain them using a fine sieve.
- Distribute berry juice among 4 glasses, add 1/4 cup of orange juice to each glass, and top with champagne.
- Garnish with a few fresh berries and serve!

Pancakes With Peach Syrup

Ingredients:
- favorite pancake mix
- 3 tablespoons butter
- 4 tablespoons maple syrup
- 2 large peaches, sliced
- couple dashes cinnamon

Directions:
- Mix up your favorite pancake mix and start cooking.
- Add the butter and maple syrup to a medium size skillet and heat until the butter melts. Stir in the peach slices and reduce heat to medium-low. Sprinkle a little cinnamon over the top. Stirring often, cook for 7 to 9 minutes, or until the peaches have darkened slightly and softened. Remove from the heat until pancakes are ready for the "Peach Syrup.".
- Serve Pancakes with Peach Syrup.

Cranberry-Sweet Potato Bake

Ingredients:
- 1 12 lbs sweet potatoes, peeled and cut into 1/2-inch cubes
- 1 cup cranberries
- 1 large apple, peeled and cut into 1/2-inch cubes
- 14 cup melted butter or 14 cup margarine
- 12 cup raisins
- 12 cup sugar
- 1 12 teaspoons cinnamon
- 12 teaspoon nutmeg
- 12 cup cranberry juice cocktail
- 13 cup pecan halves, toasted

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
- Combine sweet potatoes, cranberries, apple and raisins in a large mixing bowl.
- Combine butter, sugar and spices in a separate bowl.
- Add to sweet potato mixture, tossing to coat.
- Place in a shallow 2-quart casserole dish.
- Pour cranberry juice over top of casserole.
- Cover and bake for 50 minutes or until potatoes are almost soft, stirring occasionally.
- Stir in pecans and cook, uncovered, 10 more minutes or until potatoes are tender.
- Let casserole sit 10 minutes before serving.

Mexican Shepherd'S Pie

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 4 slices bacon
- 1 can whole kernel corn, drained
- 1 c. Minute rice (uncooked)
- 1/2 c. each chopped onion and peppers
- 1 can tomato soup

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 375°.
- In a loaf pan, spread and layer ingredients in the following order: rice, corn, onion and peppers, ground beef, tomato soup and bacon strips.
- Bake for 45 minutes or until ground beef is cooked through.
- Feeds 4.

Broccoli Casserole

Ingredients:
- 1 box frozen chopped broccoli
- 1 jar Cheez Whiz
- 1 c. uncooked Minute rice
- 1 can cream of mushroom soup
- 1 c. water
- butter

Directions:
- Thaw broccoli.
- Mix all ingredients together (cheese may be melted in microwave before adding).
- Grease casserole dish with butter; add mixture.
- Microwave on High (covered) for 20 minutes. Let cool 15 to 20 minutes.

Strawberry Pineapple Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 large strawberry Jell-O
- 1 c. fruit juice
- 1 pt. frozen strawberries
- 1 can crushed pineapple
- 1 (8 oz.) sour cream
- 1 c. chopped pecans

Directions:
- Drain pineapple and strawberries.
- Save juice for your Jell-O. Heat juice to a boil.
- Pour into Jell-O to dissolve.
- Pour in pineapple, strawberries and pecans into Jell-O; mix well.
- Pour half into bowl.
- Let set.
- After set, pour half of salad into a bowl and spread with sour cream.
- Pour rest of Jell-O mixture over sour cream and let set 30 minutes or until firm.

Crock Pot Pizza Recipe

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 lbs. grnd beef
- Onion
- 1 sm. jar spaghetti sauce
- 1 sm. jar pizza sauce
- 8 ounce. pkg. Kluski noodles
- 8 ounce. pkg. Cheddar cheese
- 8 ounce. pkg. Mozzarella cheese

Directions:
- Brown grnd beef with onion.
- Fold in spaghetti sauce and pizza sauce.
- Cook and drain kluski noodles according to package directions.
- Layer in crock pot: noodles, grnd beef sauce, cheese, noodles, beef sauce, cheese.
- Put crock pot on low at least 1 hour to heat cheese and keep hot.

Hot Cheese Dip

Ingredients:
- 1 can Manhandler's chili beef soup
- 1 can Cheddar cheese soup
- 1 lb. Monterey Jack cheese, cubed
- 1 can diced green chili peppers

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients together and bake at 350° for 30 minutes. Stir after 15 minutes.
- Serve hot.

No-Oil Salad Dressing #2

Ingredients:
- 14 teaspoon salt
- 14 teaspoon mustard
- 18 teaspoon pepper
- 2 tablespoons sugar
- 1 tablespoon finely chopped onion
- 2 tablespoons vinegar
- 2 tablespoons lemon juice

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients.
- Keep Refrigerated.

Pumpkin Soup

Ingredients:
- 14 cup butter
- 12 cup onion, chopped
- 14 teaspoon ground ginger
- 14 teaspoon ground nutmeg
- 18 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 3 cups chicken broth
- 2 cups pumpkin puree, canned
- 1 cup half-and-half
- 2 tablespoons brandy
- salt, to taste
- pepper, to taste

Directions:
- Saute onion in butter until transparent.
- Blend in spices and broth.
- Bring to a boil.
- Stir in pumpkin puree and half-and-half.
- Reduce heat and cook until soup is heated through but NOT boiling, stirring occasionally.
- Blend in brandy.
- Salt and pepper to taste.
- Serve hot.

Spicy Macaroni Casserole

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. ground pork sausage
- 1/2 c. chopped onion
- 3/4 c. chopped celery
- 2 cans tomato sauce
- 1/2 tsp. basil
- 2 c. cooked elbow macaroni
- 8 oz. sliced Mozzarella cheese

Directions:
- Brown sausage and drain fat.
- Add onion and celery and cook lightly.
- Add tomato sauce, basil and macaroni.
- Place half of sausage mixture in 1 1/2-quart casserole dish, cover with half of the cheese.
- Repeat layers.
- Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.

Peppermint Patties

Ingredients:
- 3/4 cup sweetened condensed milk
- 1 1/2 teaspoons peppermint extract
- 4 cups confectioners' sugar
- 3 cups semisweet chocolate chips
- 2 teaspoons shortening

Directions:
- In a large mixing bowl, combine condensed milk and peppermint extract. Beat in enough confectioners' sugar, a little at a time, to form a stiff dough that is no longer sticky. Form into 1 inch balls, then place on waxed paper and flatten with fingers to form patties. Let patties dry at room temperature two hours, turning once.
- In a medium saucepan over low heat, melt chocolate with shortening, stirring often. Remove from heat. Dip patties, one at a time, into chocolate by laying them on the tines of a fork and lowering the fork into the liquid. Let cool on waxed paper until set.

Mashed Potatoes

Ingredients:
- 2 pounds Yukon Gold potatoes, washed and scrubbed
- 4 -6 tablespoons butter, softened
- 1/2 cup warm milk
- Salt and pepper, to taste

Directions:
- Place potatoes in a large pot and cover with salted cold water.
- Bring to a boil and reduce heat so that potatoes continue to simmer.
- Cook potatoes until tender about 20-30 minutes depending on size of potatoes.
- Drain potatoes and return to hot pot and shake to dry off.
- Carefully peel potatoes and pass through a food mill or ricer.
- Stir warm milk and softened butter into potatoes until smoothy and creamy and a desirable consistency.
- Season with salt and pepper.
- Serve immediately.
- To hold potatoes for service: reheat riced or pureed potatoes in microwave and add milk and butter right before serving.

Grandma'S Cheese Log

Ingredients:
- 8 oz. soft cream cheese
- 1 small jar dried beef, chopped
- 1/2 small jar pure horseradish

Directions:
- Mix together cream cheese and horseradish and roll into a ball.
- Place chopped dried beef on wax paper and roll cheese ball in beef to coat.
- Wrap cheese ball in wax paper and chill for several hours.
- Serve with crackers.

Crunchy Cauliflower And Tomato Salad

Ingredients:
- 1/3 cup extra-virgin olive oil
- 3 tablespoons white wine vinegar
- 1 teaspoon fresh lemon juice, or more to taste
- salt and ground black pepper to taste
- 1 large head cauliflower, chopped small
- 1/4 cup minced red onion
- 1/4 cup minced fresh parsley
- 2 garlic cloves, minced
- 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved, or more to taste

Directions:
- Whisk olive oil, vinegar, lemon juice, salt, and pepper together in a bowl until dressing is smooth.
- Mix cauliflower, red onion, parsley, and garlic together in a large bowl. Drizzle dressing over cauliflower mixture; toss to coat. Gently fold tomatoes into salad. Chill salad in refrigerator up to 3 hours before serving.

Dairy Free Cheesecake

Ingredients:
- 1 graham cracker pie crust
- 2 (8 ounce) containers tofutti better-than-cream-cheese
- 2 eggs
- 1/4 cup sugar
- 1 teaspoon lemon juice
- 1 teaspoon vanilla

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients (except shell) in a food processor until well blended.
- Put mixture in pie shell.
- Bake at 350°F for 45 minutes.

Pringles Candies

Ingredients:
- 2 cans (6.4 Oz. Can) Pringles Potato Chips
- 2 cups Chopped Pecans
- 1 pound Almond Bark

Directions:
- Crush chips slightly and mix with pecans. Melt the almond bark in a double boiler. Stir nut-and-chip mixture into almond bark and drop onto waxed paper or parchment paper with a small cookie scoop or teaspoon.

Dill Dip

Ingredients:
- 1 c. sour cream
- 2 Tbsp. dill weed (not seed)
- 2 Tbsp. minced onion
- 1 c. salad dressing
- 2 Tbsp. parsley flakes
- 2 tsp. salt

Directions:
- Mix together and let stand 24 hours.

Baked Macaroni And Cheese

Ingredients:
- 1 (8 oz.) pkg. enriched elbow macaroni
- 1/4 c. butter or margarine
- 1/4 c. flour
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/8 tsp. pepper
- 2 c. (8 oz.) grated Cheddar cheese
- 2 c. milk

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 375°.
- Cook macaroni as package label directs; drain.
- Meanwhile, melt butter in saucepan.
- Remove from heat; stir in flour, salt and pepper until smooth.
- Gradually stir in milk; bring to boiling, stirring constantly.
- Reduce heat and simmer 1 minute.
- Remove from heat; stir in 1 1/2 cups cheese and the macaroni.
- Pour into 1 1/2-quart casserole.
- Sprinkle remaining cheese on top.
- Bake, uncovered, 20 minutes or until top is golden brown.
- Makes 4 to 6 servings.

Tuna Cookies

Ingredients:
- 2 cans tuna (including juice)
- 2 eggs
- 1 Tbsp. shortening
- 1 1/2 c. Bisquick

Directions:
- Blend tuna, eggs and shortening.
- Add Bisquick.
- Blend and add just enough milk to make a thick batter.
- Drop by spoonfuls on a baking sheet.
- Bake at 350° for 20 minutes.

Crab And Asparagus Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 pounds fresh asparagus trimmed
- 2 heads butter lettuce washed and dried
- 1/2 cantaloupe sliced into 12 thin wedges
- 3/4 pound crab meat
- 3 tablespoons fresh mint leaves minced
- 1 teaspoon fresh ginger minced
- 1 cup white wine vinegar
- 1/4 olive oil or more
- 1 teaspoon dijon mustard
- 1/4 teaspoon sugar
- salt to taste

Directions:
- Fill a large bowl with ice water and set aside.
- In a large pan of simmering water, cook asparagus until tender, 30 seconds to 3 minutes, depending on size of asparagus.
- Immerse cooked asparagus in ice water until cool; drain and pat dry.
- For dressing: combine mint, ginger, vinegar, oil, mustard and sugar in a small bowl. Whisk until thoroughly combined.
- Divide lettuce leaves among 6 plates, Fan 1/6 of the asparagus and 2 melon wedges over each bed of lettuce. Top salads with crabmeat. Drizzle with dressing and serve immediately.

Vegetable Pizza

Ingredients:
- 1 pkg. crescent rolls
- 1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese
- 4 oz. sour cream
- chopped vegetables *
- shredded cheese

Directions:
- *Some suggestions: broccoli, carrots, cauliflower, tomatoes and green onion.

Dietetic Strawberry Pie

Ingredients:
- 1 c. unsweetened white grape juice
- 1 c. water
- 1 pt. strawberries
- 1 small pkg. sugar-free jello
- 2 Tbsp. cornstarch
- 1 (9-inch) unbaked pie shell

Directions:
- Combine grape juice, water and cornstarch in a saucepan.
- Cook over medium heat until clear.
- Mixture will not thicken.
- Remove from heat.
- Stir in jello until dissolved.
- Chill in bowl in refrigerator until partially set.
- Stir in strawberries.
- Spoon into pie shell.
- Chill in refrigerator for 2 to 3 hours, until set.

Gado Gado Salad

Ingredients:
- 2 tablespoons oil
- 12 small onion, finely chopped
- 1 clove garlic, chopped
- 12 zest and lemon, juice of
- 1 teaspoon chili powder or 12 teaspoon chili flakes
- 2 teaspoons brown sugar
- 1 tomatoes, chopped
- 3 -5 green onions
- 1 tablespoon soy sauce
- 14 cup peanut butter
- 12 cup coconut cream
- 14 cup water
- 12 cabbage, shredded
- 1 carrot, grated
- 12 cup bean sprouts
- 1 can beet, drained and chopped
- 12 cucumber, sliced
- 2 hard-boiled eggs, cut into wedges
- shrimp crackers

Directions:
- Heat the oil, onion, garlic, ginger, lemon, chili, sugar, soy, peanut butter and coconut in a saucepan over medium heat.
- Add the water and stir until well-blended, about 2 minutes.
- Toss all of the vegetables together and arrange on a serving plate.
- Place the eggs on top, and pour the sauce over.
- Serve with shrimp crackers scattered around the salad.

Pan-Seared Flat Iron Steak

Ingredients:
- 1 (1-lb.) flat iron steak
- 2 teaspoons Montreal steak seasoning
- 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil

Directions:
- Rub steak evenly with steak seasoning and salt.
- Cook in hot oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat 4 to 5 minutes on each side or to desired degree of doneness. Let stand 5 minutes. Cut diagonally across the grain into thin strips.
- Note: For testing purposes only, we used McCormick Grill Mates Montreal Steak Seasoning.

Sad Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 box brown sugar
- 2 sticks margarine
- 1/2 c. white sugar
- 3 eggs (add 1 at a time)
- 2 c. self-rising flour
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 c. nuts

Directions:
- Melt brown sugar, margarine and white sugar.
- Stir ingredients just until mixed.
- Bake at 350° for 40 minutes in a 9 x 13-inch pan.

Whipped Potatoes

Ingredients:
- 6 servings instant potatoes
- 4 oz. cream cheese (room temperature)
- 1 egg
- 2 Tbsp. onions
- 1 Tbsp. parsley

Directions:
- Grease a 1-quart baking dish.
- Make potatoes; stir well.
- Beat the cream cheese with fork.
- Stir into potatoes.
- Add egg, onion and parsley.
- Put all ingredients into a greased bowl.
- Top with paprika.
- Bake at 350° for approximately 1 hour.

Bacon-Wrapped Pork with Mango Salsa

Ingredients:
- 1 pork tenderloin (1 lb.), cut into 4 pieces
- 4 slices OSCAR MAYER Bacon Rite Aid 2 For $7.00 thru 02/06
- 1/4 cup KRAFT Zesty Italian Dressing
- 1 mango, chopped
- 1/2 cup finely chopped red peppers
- 1 green onion, finely chopped
- 1 Tbsp. chopped fresh cilantro
- 1 Tbsp. fresh lime juice Safeway 3 ct For $1.00 thru 02/09

Directions:
- Press each meat piece into 3-1/2-inch medallion.
- Wrap bacon slice around edge of each medallion, secure with wooden toothpicks.
- Heat large heavy skillet sprayed with cooking spray on high heat.
- Add meat; cook on medium-high heat 5 min.
- on each side or until done (145 degrees F).
- Meanwhile, combine remaining ingredients.
- Remove and discard toothpicks from meat.
- Let meat stand 3 min.
- Serve topped with mango mixture.

Chocolate Pound Cake 

Ingredients:
- 5 eggs
- 3 cups cake flour
- 3 cups sugar
- 1/2 cup cocoa
- 1/2 cup vegetable shortening
- 2 sticks margarine
- 1 1/2 cups milk
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1 teaspoon vanilla

Directions:
- Cream shortening at low speed until light.
- Add sugar & cream at medium spped until the consistency of whipped cream.
- Beat in eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.
- Sift flour, cocoa, salt & baking powder together.
- Add milk & dry ingredients alternately, beating thoroughly.
- Bake in greased tube pan at 350 until done, about 1 1/2 hours.

Glenda'S Crab Pie 

Ingredients:
- single crust pie shell
- 1/2lb crab meat (about 11/2 c)
- 1c shredded swiss cheese (4oz)
- 1c shredded cheddar cheese (4oz)
- 1/2 sm green pepper, chopped (1/2c)
- 4 scallions, chopped fine (1/2c)
- 1T minced, drained pimiento
- 2 lg eggs, beaten lightly
- 1/2c milk
- 2T all purpose flour
- 1/2t salt
- 1/4t freshly ground black pepper
- 1/4t Tabasco

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
- Fit pie shell into a 9" glass pie plate (11/2 qt), crimping edge decorativly. Prick shell in several places with a fork and chill 30 min.
- In large bowl mix together all remaining ingredients.
- Line shell with foil and fill with pie wieghts or raw rice. Bake shell in middle of oven 10 minutes. Remove foil and rice carefully and spread crab meat mixture in shell. Bake pie in middle of oven 40 to 45 minutes or until golden and set. Cool pie on rack 10 minutes and serve warm.

Firefly Juice (Punch)

Ingredients:
- 1 (64 ounce) carton pineapple-orange juice
- 1 (2 liter) bottle Sprite (or 7-Up, Sierra Mist, etc.)
- 1 (7 ounce) canwhipped cream, spray can (RediWhip)
- 1 cup yellow candy sprinkles

Directions:
- Mix equal parts of pineapple-orange juice and Sprite and stir gently.
- Top of a spritz of whipped cream and sprinkles.
- A straw is helpful.
- Enjoy your firefly juice!

Chocolate Chip Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 box chocolate cake mix
- 1 box chocolate instant pudding
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 4 eggs
- 1/4 c. water
- 1/2 c. oil
- 1/2 c. chocolate chips
- 1 jar caramel

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients and bake at 350° for 45 minutes.
- When done, punch holes in cake.	Let cool.
- Top with Cool Whip and sprinkle chocolate chips on top of Cool Whip.

orange lacquered duck

Ingredients:
- 2 cups orange juice
- 2 oranges, zest of
- 1 cup chicken stock
- 3 inches ginger, grated
- 4 duck breasts, fat trimmed
- 4 yams
- 2 bunches baby bok choy
- 1 tablespoon sesame oil

Directions:
- combine first 4 ingredients in a saucepan.
- boil until reduced to 3/4 cup.
- set aside.
- meanwhile boil yams in water until almost fork tender, 15 minutes.
- cool, peel, and cut into 1/4" slices.
- in a skillet sear duck, breast side down until brown.
- flip duck, add yam slices and add oj reduction.
- cook 8 minutes more or until liquid is reduced by half.
- in a separate pan saute bok choy in sesame oil for 1-2 minutes.
- to serve: fan duck breasts over yams, with bok choy.
- drizzle with pan juices.

Cajun Cocktail Sauce (It'S Hot!!)

Ingredients:
- 2 (14 ounce) bottles of hot catsup
- 1 (12 ounce) bottle chili sauce
- 1 (5 ounce) jar cream-style horseradish
- 1 lemon, juice of, fresh
- 1 teaspoon salt (or more, depending on your taste)
- 1 teaspoon ground black pepper
- 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce
- 2 tablespoons Italian salad dressing
- 1 tablespoon fines herbes

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients together.
- Chill before serving.
- Add a"pinch" of fines herbes to sprinkle on top at serving time.
- Store in refrigerator in a glass jar or container.

Chocolate Pudding Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 cup flour
- 34 cup sugar
- 2 tablespoons cocoa
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 12 teaspoon salt
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 2 tablespoons oil
- 12 cup milk
- 12 cup sugar
- 14 cup cocoa
- 12 cup chopped nuts (optional)

Directions:
- Boil 2 cups of water.
- In a 2 1/2 quart greased casserole combine flour, sugar, first amount of cocoa, baking powder and salt.
- Add vanilla, oil and milk.
- Mix until well combined.
- Stir in nuts, if using.
- Spread out evenly.
- Combine second amounts of sugar and cocoa and sprinkle over top of cake.
- Gently pour boiling water over top.
- Cook on high in a microwave for 9 minutes.

Corn Bread

Ingredients:
- 3/4 c. regular flour
- 2/3 c. corn meal
- 1 1/2 tsp. baking powder
- 1 Tbsp. sugar
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 egg, slightly beaten
- 1/4 c. Crisco oil
- 3/4 c. sweet milk

Directions:
- Blend flour and corn meal along with baking powder, sugar and salt.
- Add oil, plus beaten egg.
- Stir in milk.
- Stir briskly. Pour in sprayed 8 x 8-inch pan.
- Bake 20 minutes at 350°, then brown top under broiler.

Kulfi

Ingredients:
- 2 1/2 cups whole milk
- 3 None cardamom pods, crushed
- 2 cups heavy cream
- 2 tbsp honey
- 1/2 cup ground almonds
- 1/4 cup shelled pistachio nuts, finely chopped
- 2 drops green food color
- None None Shelled pistachio nuts, coarsely chopped, to decorate

Directions:
- Place the milk and cardamom in a heavy-bottomed saucepan on high heat. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low; simmer for 6-7 mins until reduced to 2 cups. Stir in the cream. Simmer, stirring frequently, until reduced to 2 1/2 cups. Check the quantity with a measuring cup. Remove cardamom.
- Stir in honey, ground almonds, pistachios and food color. Divide among four 2/3-cup kulfi molds (available in most Indian grocers) or ramekins. Place molds on a baking pan.
- Freeze for about 5 hours until frozen. To unmold, wipe outside of mold with a hot damp cloth. Invert onto serving plates. Serve immediately, sprinkled with chopped pistachio nuts.

Chocolate Chip Spice Cookies

Ingredients:
- 2 eggs
- 1/2 c. brown sugar
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 3/8 c. shortening
- 1/2 c. milk
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 c. chocolate chips
- 1 tsp. salt
- 2 tsp. cinnamon
- 1 tsp. allspice
- 1/2 tsp. cloves
- 1/2 tsp. nutmeg
- 2 c. flour
- 2 tsp. baking powder

Directions:
- Preheat oven at 375°.
- Cream together eggs, both sugars and shortening and set aside.
- Combine spices, flour and baking powder.
- Add vanilla and milk and mix in remaining ingredients. Spoon onto ungreased cookie sheet.
- Bake 8 to 10 minutes.

Better Than Sex Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 box yellow cake mix
- 1 (20 oz.) can crushed pineapple
- 1 c. sugar
- 1 small pkg. vanilla instant pudding
- 1 c. chopped pecans
- 1 c. coconut

Directions:
- Cook cake as the box
- says
- in	13 x 2-inch pan. Simmer pineapple and sugar.
- Punch
- holes	in cake and pour pineapple over this.	Cool.
- Mix
- pudding
- as
- directed
- and spread over this; add 1/2 of
- coconut
- to
- pudding
- before you spread over pineapple.	Spread Cool Whip
- over	this
- and add chopped nuts and remainder of coconut.
- Refrigerate.

Baked Spinach

Ingredients:
- 1 (10 ounce) package frozen chopped spinach
- 1 small tomatoes, diced
- 2 green onions, chopped
- 1 stalk celery, chopped
- 1 egg, beaten
- 10 -12 soda crackers, crunched
- 20 g packages dry vegetable soup mix
- 1 (10 ounce) can cream of celery soup or 1 (10 ounce) can cream of mushroom soup

Directions:
- Defrost the spinach until you can squeeze the excess juice out of it.
- Put it in a bowl and combine with all the rest of the ingredients.
- Put into a greased and covered casserole dish and put in 325 degree oven for 1/2-3/4 minutes.

Sweet Jalapeno Chicken

Ingredients:
- 4 bone-in chicken breast halves, with skin
- 6 tablespoons honey
- 6 tablespoons Dijon mustard or 6 tablespoons honey mustard
- 6 tablespoons jalapeno jelly, preferably the red colored one
- salt and black pepper

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
- In a small bowl, mix together honey, mustard and jalapeno jelly.
- Place chicken breasts in a baking dish; sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste, and pour honey-mustard-jelly sauce over all, coating well.
- Bake uncovered for about 1 hour, basting occasionally, until chicken juices run clear and meat is no longer pink.

Chicken Pot Pie

Ingredients:
- 1 chicken, cooked and boned
- 1 1/2 c. chicken broth
- 1 can cream of celery soup
- 1 stick margarine
- 1 c. milk
- 1 c. flour
- 1 1/2 tsp. baking powder

Directions:
- Place pieces of chicken in greased casserole.
- Mix soup with broth and spread over chicken.
- Melt margarine in milk, then add flour and baking soda.
- Pour over casserole.
- Bake at 350° for 1 hour.

Pork Chops with Warm Berry Sauce

Ingredients:
- 4 boneless pork chops (1 lb.), 3/4 inch thick
- 1/4 cup sugar-free seedless raspberry jam
- 1 Tbsp. balsamic vinegar
- 2 Tbsp. GREY POUPON Dijon Mustard
- 1 tsp. orange zest Safeway 1 lb For $0.79 thru 02/09
- 1/2 tsp. dried thyme leaves

Directions:
- Heat large heavy nonstick skillet on medium-high heat.
- Add chops; cook 4 to 5 min.
- on each side or until done (145 degrees F), covering after turning.
- Transfer chops to plate; cover to keep warm.
- Add remaining ingredients to skillet; mix well.
- Cook and stir on medium-low heat 1 min.
- or until heated through.
- Pour sauce over chops.

Dill Onion Rings

Ingredients:
- 1 large Bermuda onion
- 1/4 c. water
- 1/4 tsp. dill weed or dill seed
- 1/2 c. white vinegar
- 2 tsp. salt
- liquid no calorie sweetener (6 tsp.) or 1/2 c. sugar

Directions:
- Peel and cut onion into thin crosswise slices.
- Separate into rings.
- Place in small bowl. Combine vinegar, water, salt, dill weed and sugar in saucepan.
- Heat to boiling.
- Pour over onion rings; cover tightly and chill at least 1 hour to blend flavors. The liquid can be reheated and used on another onion.

Molasses Gingerbread

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. butter, softened
- 1 c. dark brown sugar
- 1 c. molasses
- 2 eggs, beaten lightly
- 1 1/2 tsp. baking soda
- 1 c. hot water
- 3 c. flour
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 1 tsp. ground ginger
- 1/2 tsp. ground cloves
- 1/2 c. raisins (optional)

Directions:
- Cream butter and sugar.
- Blend in molasses until smooth.
- Stir in eggs and beat well.
- Dissolve the soda in cup of hot water and stir into molasses mixture.
- Sift together flour, salt and spices. Stir gradually into molasses mixture until well blended.
- Add raisins.
- Bake in greased 8 x 8-inch pan in 350° oven 25 to 30 minutes.

Spiced Prunes

Ingredients:
- 4 cups prunes
- 1 7/8 cups tea cold steeped
- 2 9/16 cups white wine vinegar
- 2 1/4 cups sugar caster
- 1 cinnamon stick
- 1 teaspoon cloves
- 10 allspice berries

Directions:
- In a large bowl, cover prunes with tea and let stand 12 hours.
- In a large saucepan cook prunes and liquid over low heat for 15-20 minutes until prunes are plump.
- In a large saucepan, bring vinegar, sugar and spices to the boil. Reduce heat and simmer 5 minutes. Add prunes and liquid and simmer 5 minutes. Using a slotted spoon, pack hot prunes into hot jars and pour over hot syrup.
- Cover and seal.

Homemade Yeast Rolls

Ingredients:
- 9 c. all-purpose flour
- 1 Tbsp. salt
- 1/2 c. shortening (Crisco)
- 4 eggs, beaten
- 2 dry yeast (do not use quick or fast rising yeast)
- 2 c. hot tap water
- 1 c. sugar

Directions:
- Mix yeast, sugar and warm water together until sugar and yeast dissolve.
- Set aside.
- Mix flour, salt and Crisco together very well and knead 5 to 10 minutes.
- Lightly grease top and sides of dough; cover and let rise in warm place until 3 times its original size.
- Roll out about 1-inch thick; spread entire dough with soft butter and cut with a biscuit cutter.
- Fold into 1/2 moon and place in greased pan.
- Let rise again until double its size before baking at 350° about 15 to 20 minutes or until golden brown.

Refried Anasazi Beans

Ingredients:
- 1/2 lb dried anasazi beans
- 3 slices bacon, chopped
- 2 tablespoons onions, finely chopped
- 2 tablespoons green peppers, finely chopped
- 1 clove garlic, crushed
- 1/2 teaspoon chili powder

Directions:
- Cook beans at a gentle boil in 3 cups water, covered, until tender, about 1 1/2 hours.
- Drain beans and save liquid.
- Saute onion, green pepper, garlic and bacon; mash beans together with sauteed mixture, adding a little liquid at a time, until bean mixture is smooth.
- Can be frozen.

Mrs. Field'S Chocolate Chip Cookies

Ingredients:
- 2 1/4 c. flour
- 1 tsp. baking soda
- 1 c. brown sugar
- 1/2 c. granulated sugar
- 2 eggs, slightly beaten
- 2 tsp. vanilla
- 12 oz. chocolate chips
- 1 c. chopped nuts
- 1 c. butter flavored Crisco

Directions:
- Combine dry ingredients. Cut in Crisco. Mixture will be crumbly.
- Combine beaten eggs and vanilla.
- Add to mixture, stirring only until combined.
- Add chips and nuts.

Whipped Jello Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 small pkg. red Jell-O
- 1 1/2 c. pecans
- 2 large bananas, sliced
- 1 c. drained white grapes or fruit cocktail
- 1/2 pt. whipping cream
- 1 c. chopped apple with peeling
- 1 c. drained chunk pineapple

Directions:
- Jell the jello medium thick and whip with electric blender until light and frothy.
- Add the already whipped cream and other ingredients.
- Fold gently.
- Pile lightly into dessert dish and serve with plain sugar cookie.

Marinated Shrimp

Ingredients:
- 2 1/2 lb. shrimp
- 1/2 c. celery tops
- 3 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/4 c. mixed pickling spices
- 1 pt. sliced onions
- 7 or 8 bay leaves
- 1 1/4 c. salad oil
- 3/4 c. white vinegar
- 2 1/2 tsp. salt
- 2 1/2 Tbsp. capers (with juice)
- dash of Tabasco sauce

Directions:
- Boil shrimp in enough water to cover. Add celery tops, salt and spices. Cook 10 to 12 minutes. Drain shrimp and cool with cold water.
- Peel under cold running water.
- Alternate shrimp and sliced onions in shallow dish.
- Combine remaining ingredients and pour over shrimp and onions.
- Keep in refrigerator at least 24 hours before serving.

Cheesy Meat Loaf

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 lb. ground beef
- 1 egg
- 1 1/2 c. fresh bread crumbs
- 1 (8 oz.) can tomato sauce
- 1 c. shredded American cheese
- 1/2 c. finely chopped onions
- 1/4 c. finely chopped green peppers
- 1/2 tsp. thyme leaves, crushed
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper

Directions:
- Combine all ingredients in a medium mixing bowl; blend thoroughly.
- Spread mixture evenly in a glass loaf dish.
- Cover with wax paper.
- Microwave at power level "High" for 18 to 20 minutes or until center is no longer pink when fork or knife is inserted.
- Let stand, covered, for 5 minutes before serving.

Oatmeal Cookies

Ingredients:
- 1 c. packed brown sugar
- 3/4 c. shortening (I use 1/4 c. margarine and 1/2 c. Crisco)
- 1/2 c. granulated sugar
- 1 egg
- 1/4 c. water
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 3 c. oatmeal, uncooked
- 1 c. flour
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/2 tsp. baking soda

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350°.
- Beat together shortening, sugars, egg, water and vanilla until creamy.
- Add combined remaining ingredients; mix well.
- Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto greased cookie sheet.
- Bake at 350° for 12 to 15 minutes.
- For variety, add chopped nuts, raisins, chocolate chips or coconut.
- Makes about 5 dozen cookies.

Orange Juice Smoothie

Ingredients:
- 1 cup milk
- 1 cup water
- 1 tsp vanilla
- 1/4 cup sugar
- 14 *crushed* ice cubes
- 2 1/2 cup orange juice

Directions:
- Blend ingredients until achieved desired thickness/smoothness

Creamy Tuna Deluxe

Ingredients:
- 1 (7 1/4 ounce) package Kraft macaroni and cheese
- 34 cup milk
- 1 tablespoon margarine
- 12 cup onion (chopped)
- 14 cup green pepper (chopped)
- 1 (10 3/4 ounce) can condensed cream of celery soup
- 1 (6 ounce) can tuna, drained, flaked
- 1 (4 ounce) can mushrooms, drained
- 1 (2 ounce) jar diced pimentos, drained

Directions:
- Prepare Macaroni & cheese in large saucepan as directed on package, increasing milk to 3/4 cup.
- melt margarine in medium skillet on medium heat.
- Add onions and peppers; cook and stir until tender.
- add onion mixture to the prepared Dinner along with the remaining ingredients; mix lightly.
- Cook until heated through, stirring occasionally.

Strawberry Rhubarb Crumble

Ingredients:
- Topping
- 3/4 cup flour
- 2/3 cup firmly packed brown sugar
- 1/3 cup chopped almonds
- 1/2 cup butter, softened
- Filling
- 3 pints fresh strawberries
- 2 lbs fresh rhubarb, cut in 1 in pieces
- 1 1/4 cups sugar
- 3 tablespoons dry tapioca
- 2 teaspoons freshly grated orange rind

Directions:
- Topping: Mix all ingredients in a bowl.
- Stir just until mixture becomes crumbly.
- Filling: Cut strawberries in 1/4's; place in lg bowl.
- Stir in remaining ingredients and let stand 15 minutes.
- Lightly butter shallow 3qt baking dish.
- Pour filling into dish.
- Sprinkle with topping.
- Bake at 350* until bubbling (60-70 min).
- Cool on wire rack.

Party Onion Dip

Ingredients:
- 2 blocks (8 Oz. Block) Cream Cheese, Softened
- 1/2 cups Milk
- 1 can (10 3/4 Oz.) Condensed Cream Of Mushroom Soup
- 4 Tablespoons Minced Dried Onion
- 2 teaspoons Worcestershire Sauce
- 1/2 teaspoons Garlic Salt
- Assorted Chips, To Serve

Directions:
- In a large bowl, beat the cream cheese, milk and soup until well blended.
- Add the rest of the ingredients; mix well.
- Refrigerate for at least 4 hours.
- Serve with chips of your choice.

Chipped Beef Chicken

Ingredients:
- 1 (3 oz.) pkg. chipped beef
- 1 can condensed cream of mushroom soup or use 1/2 can soup and 1/2 c. sour cream
- 6 chicken breast halves, skinned and boned

Directions:
- Line bottom of a casserole with the chipped beef.
- Place chicken breasts on top of the chipped beef.
- Cover with soup. Cover and bake at 350° for 3 hours.
- Serves 6.

Instant Potato Soup Mix

Ingredients:
- 1 3/4 cups instant mashed potatoes
- 1 1/2 cups dry milk
- 2 tablespoons instant chicken bouillon
- 2 teaspoons dried onion flakes
- 1 teaspoon dried parsley
- 1/4 teaspoon white pepper
- 1/4 teaspoon dried thyme
- 1/8 teaspoon turmeric
- 1 1/2 teaspoons seasoning salt

Directions:
- Combine all ingrediants in a bowl and mix. Place in a 1 quart canning jar to store.
- Directions to attach to jar:.
- Shake well before using.
- To serve: place 1/2°C soup mix in a large bowl or mug and add 1°C boiling water.
- Stir until smooth.

Lemon Delight

Ingredients:
- 1 1/4 sticks margarine
- 1 1/2 c. pecans, chopped
- 1 1/2 c. flour
- 1 c. powdered sugar
- 1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese
- 1 large tub Cool Whip (16 oz.)
- 2 boxes instant pie filling (lemon or chocolate)
- 3 c. milk
- red and green cherries

Directions:
- Melt the margarine and mix in 1 cup pecans and flour; place in a 9 x 13-inch pan and bake 15 minutes at 400°.
- Cool for
- about 15 minutes.

Jello Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 (3 oz.) pkg. orange jello
- 2 (3 oz.) pkg. vanilla tapioca pudding
- 3 c. water
- 1 medium size can mandarin oranges, drained
- 1 medium size can crushed pineapple, drained
- 1 pkg. Dream Whip, whipped

Directions:
- Add jello and tapioca to water.
- Bring to a boil.
- Cool.
- Add oranges, pineapple and whipped Dream Whip.
- Refrigerate at least 2 hours before serving.

Green Stuff (Lime Jello, Cream Cheese, Pineapple, Cool Whip)

Ingredients:
- 1 cup hot water
- 1 cup ice cube (optional)
- 1 (5 ounce) package Jello gelatin
- 1 (8 ounce) container Cool Whip
- 1 (10 ounce) can crushed pineapple, drained
- 1 (8 ounce) cream cheese, softened

Directions:
- Dissolve jello in hot water. If in a hurry add ice cubes to set a litte faster.
- Mix cream cheese and pineapple in large bowl.
- Add jello.
- Beat until blended.
- Add Cool Whip or any whipped topping and beat for 2 minutes or well blended.
- Pour into large glass pan or bowl and chill at least four hours. I've been known to use the freezer when in a hurry and it works out fine.
- Enjoy!

Chicken Salad Pie

Ingredients:
- 1 baked pie shell
- 2 c. cooked, diced chicken
- 3/4 c. grated Cheddar cheese
- 1/2 c. diced celery
- 1/2 c. crushed pineapple, drained
- 1/2 c. slivered almonds or chopped pecans
- 1/2 tsp. paprika
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 c. mayonnaise
- 1/4 c. mayonnaise
- 1/2 c. whipped topping

Directions:
- Sprinkle 1/2 cup grated carrots around edge of crust.

Tabbuli(Parsley Salad)  

Ingredients:
- 3/4 c. fine ground wheat (can be purchased from any health food store)
- 1 bundle mint
- 4 bundles parsley
- 1 bundle green onions
- 3 tomatoes
- olive oil to taste
- juice of 3 lemons or to taste

Directions:
- Soak wheat for approximately 1/2 hour.
- Wash first.
- Chop all the vegetables as fine as possible.
- All except the tomatoes can be chopped in a blender by adding water, then draining.
- Pour the olive oil and the lemon juice over the mixture and mix well.
- This can be served over lettuce, cabbage or fresh grape leaves.
- Or stuff cherry tomatoes with this mixture.

Strawberry Bread

Ingredients:
- 1 3/4 c. sugar
- 1 1/4 c. vegetable oil
- 4 eggs, beaten
- 3 c. self-rising flour
- 2 (10 oz.) pkg. sliced strawberries (undrained)
- 2 Tbsp. lemon juice
- 2 Tbsp. cinnamon
- 1/2 tsp. ginger
- 1 c. chopped nuts

Directions:
- Mix sugar, oil and eggs, then add strawberries and lemon juice.
- In a separate bowl, sift together flour and spices. Gradually stir dry ingredients into strawberry mixture.
- Mix thoroughly.
- Add nuts and pour batter into two greased loaf pans. Bake in oven at 350° for 1 hour.

Lemon Fruit Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. butter
- 2 1/2 c. sugar
- 4 c. flour
- 1 tsp. (rounded) baking powder
- 6 eggs
- 2 oz. bottle lemon extract
- 1 lb. chopped pecans
- 1 lb. chopped walnuts
- 1 1/4 lb. red and green cherries
- 1 1/2 lb. red, green and white pineapple

Directions:
- Cream butter and sugar; add eggs and lemon extract.
- Add 3 cups flour and baking powder.
- Mix 1 cup flour with fruit.
- Add fruit and nuts to other mixture.
- Bake 2 hours and 15 minutes at 250°.

Veal In Onion Gravy

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 lbs veal cutlets, thinly sliced
- flour
- 3 tablespoons butter
- 1 large onion, thinly sliced
- 1 tablespoon prepared mustard
- 1 teaspoon horseradish
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1/8 teaspoon pepper
- 2 tablespoons lemon juice
- 1 cup chicken bouillon

Directions:
- Cut veal into serving pieces and roll in flour. Brown quickly on both sides in butter in a heavy skillet.
- Remove veal and brown onion. Return veal to skillet with remaining ingredients.
- Cover and simmer 30 minutes.

The World'S Easiest Basic Enchilada Sauce

Ingredients:
- 1 (15 ounce) can Hormel chili without beans (NO OTHER BRAND)
- 1 (16 ounce) jar mild Pace Picante Sauce (NO OTHER BRAND, and don't confuse Pace salsa with Pace picante)

Directions:
- Combine the two.
- You're finished!
- Pour over purchased frozen enchiladas or burritos (or your own homemade)and top with cheese.
- Bake at 350 til heated through.
- Tell everyone at the table you have spent years perfecting this complicated sauce.
- If your kids don't like "those icky green pepper things and onions" simply puree the Pace picante in a blender then add to the Hormel chili. They will never know and it also makes for a smoother texture. Additionally, I have used Hormel 99% Fat Free Turkey Chili with excellent results. Then- your enchilada sauce is almost totally fat free. Can't beat that!

Pineapple Cranberry Sauce with Chiles and Cilantro

Ingredients:
- Basic cranberry sauce
- 1 1/2 cups 1/3-inch cubes peeled cored fresh pineapple
- 2 thinly sliced jalapeno chiles
- 2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro

Directions:
- Combine all ingredients for basic cranberry sauce in heavy medium saucepan.
- Add pineapple and chiles.
- Cook, cool, and store mixture as directed for basic cranberry sauce .
- Stir in cilantro just before serving.

Zucchini Cake

Ingredients:
- 3 c. sugar
- 1 1/2 c. vegetable oil
- 3 c. grated zucchini
- 4 eggs
- 1/2 c. nuts (optional)
- 3 c. flour
- 1 1/2 tsp. baking powder
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 1/2 tsp. cinnamon
- 1 tsp. soda

Directions:
- Mix sugar and oil.
- Add squash and eggs.
- Blend well.
- Sift dry ingredients and add to mixture.
- Mix well scraping bowl.
- Add nuts if desired.
- Bake in a 9 x 13-inch pan or 2 small pans which have been greased and floured for 1 hour at 350°.

Spiced Roasted Potatoes

Ingredients:
- 6 medium red potatoes, cut into
- 2 tbsp taco seasoning
- 2 tbsp canola oil
- 1 inch thick pieces

Directions:
- In a large resealable plastic bag, combine all ingredients; shake to coat.
- Place potatoes in a 9 inch square baking pan coated with nonstick cooking spray.
- Bake, uncovered, at 450F for 25 to 30 minutes or until tender, stirring once.

Baked Potatoes With Pancetta and Gorgonzola

Ingredients:
- 4 potatoes
- 100 g pancetta
- 150 g double cream
- 100 g gorgonzola
- oil

Directions:
- The potatoes need to be baked in their skins as in my recipe for 'The Perfect Baked Potato'.
- Dice the pancetta into small cubes.
- If you can't get pancetta then use streaky bacon instead.
- Dice the Gorgonzola.
- Now fry the pancetta until it's fat is a nice golden colour, using a little oil if necessary.
- Stir in the cream and the Gorgonzola.
- Leave to bubble gently over a low heat for a minute or two.
- Split the jacket potatoes and pour in the creamy sauce.
- Serve immediately.

Scratch Brownies

Ingredients:
- 3/4 c. butter or oleo
- 1 1/2 c. sugar
- 1 1/2 tsp. vanilla
- 3 eggs
- 3/4 c. flour
- 1/2 c. cocoa
- 1/2 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 tsp. salt

Directions:
- Blend melted butter or oleo, sugar and vanilla in a bowl.
- Add eggs.
- Beat well with spoon. Combine flour, cocoa, baking powder and salt.
- Bake at 350° for 40 to 45 minutes.

Banana Split Dessert No Bake Recipe

Ingredients:
- 2 c. graham cracker crumbs
- 2 sticks butter
- 2 c. sifted confectioners' sugar
- 2 Large eggs
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 4-5 bananas
- 1 can liquid removed crushed pineapples
- 1 lg. Cold Whip
- 1/2 c. minced walnuts

Directions:
- 1.
- Combine 2 c. graham cracker crumbs with 1 stick of butter.
- Spread into ungreased pan and chill.
- 2.
- Combine 2 c. sifted confectioners' sugar with 1 stick butter, 2 Large eggs and 1 tsp.
- vanilla extract.
- Beat about 5 min till fluffy.
- Spread over first mix.
- 3.
- Slice 4-5 bananas over the cream mix.
- 4.
- Spread 1 can of liquid removed crushed pineapple over bananas.
- 5.
- Spread a large Cold Whip over pineapple.
- Sprinkle minced nuts on Cold Whip.
- Keep refrigerated.

Chicken Stuffed Shells

Ingredients:
- 2 chicken breasts
- 1 box chicken Stove Top stuffing mix
- 1 box cooked jumbo shells (approximately 30)
- 1 c. Miracle Whip
- 4 cans cream of chicken soup

Directions:
- Cook chicken breasts and cut into small chunks.
- Cook stuffing as directed.
- Mix chicken and Miracle Whip with stuffing and fill shells.
- Mix 4 cans of soup with 3 cans of water.
- Place half of soup in pan and then place stuffed shells in pan.
- Pour remaining soup over shells.
- Bake at 350° for 60 minutes.

Sweet And Spicy Ham And Cheese Panini

Ingredients:
- 2 Slices of Rosemary Artisian Bread
- 1 teaspoon Orange Marmalade
- 1 teaspoon Dijon Mustard
- 2 Thin Slices of Fresh Pear (Your Choice)
- 2 Thin Slices of Deli Style Ham
- 1 ounce Gruyere Cheese
- Butter for Toasting

Directions:
- Place two slices of bread onto a plate. On one slice, spread the Dijon mustard and on the other slice spread the orange marmalade. Use more or less than a teaspoon, depending on size of bread and your personal preference.
- Now place two large, but thin slices of pear on top of the orange marmalade and then add the two slices of ham and the one ounce of cheese on top. Now put the other slice on top, dijon mustard side down.
- Butter the outsides of the sandwich and either place in a panini press or on a saute pan on medium - high heat. Grill until the cheese is melted and the outside of the sandwich is golden and toasted. Slice in half and serve immediately.

Quick Chicken

Ingredients:
- 1 or 2 cooked chickens from Rini Rego's

Directions:
- Place in roasting pan. Pour water over chicken (about 1/4 inch) to keep moist. Put foil over pan.
- Bake at 400° for 20 minutes or until hot.
- Boil noodles, strain.
- Add margarine (fat-free) and Parmesan cheese; mix together.

Steak Teriyaki

Ingredients:
- 1/2 tsp. garlic powder
- 1/2 tsp. ginger
- 1 Tbsp. brown sugar
- 1 Tbsp. salad oil
- 2 tsp. water
- 1/4 c. soy sauce
- flank steak

Directions:
- Mix ingredients together.
- Marinate flank steak at least one hour in sauce.
- Broil steak until medium rare.
- Heat remaining sauce; pour over steak and serve.

Texas Relish

Ingredients:
- 1 (16 oz.) French cut string beans, drained
- 1 (16 oz.) Shoe Peg corn, drained
- 1 can tiny peas, drained
- 1 c. chopped celery
- 1 c. chopped green pepper
- 1 c. chopped onion
- 1 jar pimentos
- 1 tsp. anise

Directions:
- Combine all ingredients in large bowl.

Broccoli/Orange Salad

Ingredients:
- 4 cups broccoli florets (about 1 1/2 lbs. fresh broccoli)
- 1 small purple onion (thinly sliced and separated into rings)
- 12 cup raisins
- 12 cup pecan pieces (toasted)
- 34 cup mayonnaise (or Miracle Whip)
- 14 cup sugar
- 1 12 tablespoons white vinegar
- 11 ounces mandarin oranges, drained

Directions:
- Combine broccoli, onion, raisins and pecans and set aside.
- Mix mayonnaise, sugar and vinegar.
- Add mayo mixture to broccoli and stir.
- Gently fold in mandarin oranges.
- Chill at least 3 hours.

Hot Chocolate Mix

Ingredients:
- 12 qt. box powdered milk
- 2 lb. box Nestle Quik
- 1 lb. box powdered sugar
- 1 lb. jar Cremora

Directions:
- Mix ingredients well in large container.
- Keep tightly sealed in jars.
- Fill cup 1/2 full with chocolate mixture; add boiling water to fill cup and stir well.

Sweet And Sour Turnips

Ingredients:
- 3 medium turnips, peeled and sliced
- 1 tsp. salt
- 4 slices bacon, diced
- 1 egg, beaten
- 1/4 c. sugar
- 1/4 c. vinegar

Directions:
- Place turnips in a saucepan; cover with water.
- Add salt and bring to boil; cover and cook 15 to 20 minutes, or until tender. Drain and set aside.
- Fry bacon in skillet until crisp.
- Combine egg, sugar and vinegar in a small mixing bowl, mixing well; stir into bacon and drippings.
- Pour bacon mixture over turnips and toss gently.
- Yields about 4 servings.

Baked Jack Corn Recipe

Ingredients:
- 2 lrg Large eggs -- lightly beaten
- 1 1/2 c. lowfat sour cream
- 2 c. fresh corn kernels
- 8 ounce Monterey jack cheese -- cut into 1/2 inch cubes
- 1/2 c. soft bread crumbs
- 4 1/2 ounce minced green chiles -- liquid removed
- 1/2 tsp salt
- 1/4 tsp grnd black pepper
- 1/2 c. shredded Cheddar cheese

Directions:
- Combine Large eggs and lowfat sour cream in a large bowl; stir in corn and next 5 ingredients.
- Pour into a greased 10 inch quiche dish or possibly 2-qt baking dish.
- Bake, uncovered, at 350 degrees F. for 35 min or possibly till a knife inserted in center comes out clean.
- Sprinkle with Cheddar cheese, and bake 5 more min.
- Let stand 10 min before serving.
- 6 servings.

Stuffed Rouladen

Ingredients:
- precut rouladen beef (Available at most meat counters)
- 1 (6 ounce) box Stove Top stuffing mix
- 1 (680 ml) can pasta sauce (any flavour)
- hot sauce
- salt
- pepper
- garlic powder

Directions:
- Prepare your stove top stuffing as instructed on package- making it with the maximum amount of liquid. Allow it to cool for about 10 minutes.
- Unroll one slice of rouldaden at a time- and flatten it with the heel of your hand Place a generous amount of stuffing at the large end of the rouladen Roll the Rouladen so that the stuffing reaches both sides but does not fall out Place each one side by side in your cooking dish
- Mix your hot sauce with the pasta sauce Pour the sauce mixture over the rolled rouladen sprinkle with salt, pepper and garlic powder.
- Bake in a 350 degree pre heated oven for 45 minutes to 1hour
- Remove the rouladen with a spatula- and slice the rolls.
- Scoop the excess pasta sauce over the sliced rolls and serve.

Star-Fruit Chips 

Ingredients:
- 2 firm-ripe yellow star fruit (sometimes called carambola;1/2 lb total)
- 2 cups sugar
- 2 cups water
- an adjustable-blade slicer; a 17- by 11-inch nonstick bakeware liner such as Silpat

Directions:
- Slice star fruit crosswise with slicer into 1/16-inch-thick slices.
- Bring sugar and water to a boil in a 2-quart heavy saucepan, stirring until sugar is dissolved. Add star fruit, then remove from heat and let stand, uncovered, 15 minutes. Pour star fruit into a sieve set over a bowl and drain 15 minutes. Reserve syrup for
- .
- Put oven rack in middle position and preheat oven to 200°F. Put liner on a large (17- by 11-inch) baking sheet, then arrange star-fruit slices in 1 layer on liner (discard extra along with any broken slices). Bake until dry, 1 to 1 1/4 hours. Immediately transfer chips to a rack to cool.

Veg-All Casserole

Ingredients:
- 2 cans Veg-All, drained
- 1 can water chestnuts, chopped
- 1 c. chopped onion
- 1 c. grated cheese
- 1 c. mayonnaise
- salt and pepper to taste

Directions:
- Mix all together in a casserole dish.
- Use bread crumbs or crushed Ritz crackers on top.
- Bake at 350° for 45 minutes.

Butterscotch-Peanut Fudge

Ingredients:
- 1 (11-ounce) package butterscotch morsels
- 1 (14-ounce) can sweetened condensed milk
- 1 1/2 cups miniature marshmallows
- 2/3 cup chunky peanut butter
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1/8 teaspoon salt
- 1 cup chopped dry-roasted peanuts

Directions:
- Cook first 3 ingredients in a small heavy saucepan over medium heat, stirring constantly, 5 to 6 minutes or until smooth; remove from heat. Stir in chunky peanut butter, vanilla extract, and salt until blended; stir in chopped peanuts. Pour into a buttered 9-inch square pan. Chill until firm; cut into squares. Store fudge in refrigerator.
- NOTE: For ease, microwave first 3 ingredients in a 2-quart microwave-safe bowl at HIGH 2 to 3 minutes or until melted, stirring twice.

Slush Punch

Ingredients:
- 1 pkg. strawberry Jell-O
- 1 pkg. orange Kool-Aid
- 2 c. hot water
- 2 c. sugar
- 1 large can unsweetened pineapple juice
- 2 qt. cold water
- 6 Tbsp. lemon juice

Directions:
- Dissolve Jell-O in hot water, then add other ingredients, stirring as you add them.
- Set in freezer for approximately 8 to 9 hours.
- Stir hourly after the first 4 hours.
- This recipe makes 1 gallon and 8 gallons serves 150 people.

Herb Cream on Soba Pasta

Ingredients:
- 4 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 cup peeled and julienned carrot
- 12 cup chopped fresh cilantro
- 1 cup sliced scallion
- 4 cups chopped cauliflower
- 4 cups chopped broccoli
- 4 12 cups milk
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 12 teaspoon black pepper
- 12 cup cornstarch
- 12 cup chopped watercress (optional)
