- 6 cups cooked soba noodles (or pasta of your choice)

Directions:
- Heat the oil in a large saucepan.
- Saute the carrots, cilantro, and scallions for 2 minutes.
- Add the cauliflower and broccoli and saute for 4 to 5 minutes, stirring constantly.
- To the vegetables, add 4 cups of milk and the salt and pepper.
- Bring to a simmer.
- Mix the remaining 1/2 cup milk and the cornstarch together until smooth.
- Add it to the vegetables to create a smooth sauce.
- Stir the chopped watercress into the sauce and set aside for 2 minutes.
- Spoon the sauce over the pasta and serve immediately.

Century Plaza Low-Calorie Buttermilk Dressing

Ingredients:
- 1 12 cups cottage cheese, low-fat
- 34 cup buttermilk, low-fat
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
- 14 teaspoon white pepper
- 12 teaspoon salt
- 1 tablespoon green onion, minced
- 1 tablespoon parsley, chopped

Directions:
- Place cottage cheese, buttermilk, lemon juice, white pepper and salt in a blender container.
- Blend until smooth, if too thick add more buttermilk.
- Stir in green onions and parsley.
- Serve.

Miso Glazed Halibut

Ingredients:
- 6 ounces halibut fillets
- salt, to taste
- 2 1/4 teaspoons miso
- 3/4 teaspoon mirin
- 3/8 teaspoon sake

Directions:
- Remove the fish from the refrigerator, and salt it lightly. Set aside while preparing the miso mixture.
- Combine the miso, mirin and sake in a small bowl, mixing until well combined.
- Pread the miso mixture on all sides of the fish (except the skin side) and set aside for 20 minutes at room temperature. If your kitchen is very warm (summer, heat wave), you could refrigerate for up to an hour.
- Preheat your broiler, setting the rack so that your fish will be about 3 inches below the heat source.
- When hot, broil the fish for 5-6 minutes, until the miso glaze is golden brown, and the fish is cooked through.

Swiss Chocolate Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 box Duncan Hines Swiss chocolate
- 1 c. vegetable oil
- 1 1/2 c. milk
- 3 eggs
- 1 large box instant vanilla pudding

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients together.
- Beat until smooth.
- Put into sprayed cake pans.
- After cake cooks, cut cakes in half.
- Frost cake.

Biscuits & Gravy Recipe

Ingredients:
- 2 tbsp. butter
- 2 tbsp. flour
- 2 c. lowfat milk, heated
- 3 breakfast sausage
- Salt & white pepper to taste
- Warm biscuits

Directions:
- Heat butter in a medium saucepan.
- Add in flour and cook over low heat, stirring constantly for 8-10 min.
- Don't allow mix to brown.
- Gradually add in warm lowfat milk to butter-flour mix, stirring constantly with a whisk, till sauce is thickened and smooth.
- Simmer for 5 min.
- Strain and keep hot.
- Remove skin and cut sausages into small pcs.
- Brown in skillet till cooked.
- Drain off fat and add in sausage to strained warm gravy.
- Reheat.
- Add in salt and pepper to taste.
- Serve over split, warm biscuits.
- Yield: 3 c..

Buttery Melt A Ways Recipe

Ingredients:
- 1 c. Butter or possibly margarine
- 1/2 c. C and H Powdered Sugar
- 2 1/4 c. Sifted cake flour
- 1/4 tsp Salt
- 1 tsp Vanilla C and H Powdered Sugar

Directions:
- Cream together butter and sugar till light and fluffy.
- Blend in flour, salt, and vanilla.
- Drop by teaspoonfuls 2 inches apart on ungreased cookie sheet.
- Bake in 375 degree oven till set but not brown 12 to 15 min.
- Remove to rack and sprinkle with powdered sugar.

Gingerbread Cupcakes With Pumpkin Cream Cheese Frosting

Ingredients:
- 1 box prepared gingerbread mix, prepared to packaged directions
- 1 egg (for mix)
- 1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese
- 1/2 cup canned pumpkin puree
- 1/4 teaspoon grated nutmeg
- 1 orange, zest of (optional)
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 3 1/2 cups confectioners' sugar
- shaved crystallized ginger, for garnish (optional)

Directions:
- Preheat Oven 375 degrees F.
- Divide prepared cake mix into nonstick muffin tins or you may use muffin wrappers, sprayed with oil.
- Bake for 20 minutes.
- Batter will make 8 to 10 muffins depending on size of tin used.
- Beat cream cheese, pumpkin orange zest and vanilla with hand mixer at medium speed.
- Beat in sugar until frosting is fluffy.
- Frost Cupcakes and garnish as you please.

Sausage And Cheese Balls Breakfast Scramble

Ingredients:
- 6 sausage, and cheese balls
- 2 large eggs, well beaten
- 3 tablespoons margarine or 3 tablespoons butter, divided
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper

Directions:
- Take and cut each sausage ball into 4 pieces.
- Lightly brown in 1 Tablespoon of margarine over medium heat.
- Add remaining margarine and let melt, then add beaten egg and scramble until eggs are done to your liking.
- Serve with your favorite style of potatoes and enjoy :) !

Fresh Steamed Green Beans With Wasabi Dipping Sauce

Ingredients:
- 3 lbs fresh green beans, trimmed
- 1 cup Miracle Whip (mayonnaise-type salad dressing)
- 4 teaspoons soy sauce
- 1 1/2 teaspoons sugar
- 2 teaspoons lemon juice
- 2 teaspoons wasabi paste

Directions:
- Steam green beans to the desired degree of doneness.
- Pour into a colander and rinse under cold running water for a few seconds to stop cooking process.
- Drain and pat dry.
- Whisk the salad dressing, soy sauce, sugar, lemon juice and wasabi paste in a bowl until the sugar is dissolved. Serve with the green beans for dipping.

Martha'S Vegetable Beef Soup

Ingredients:
- 1/2 pound ground beef
- 1 (14.5 ounce) can stewed tomatoes
- 1 (8 ounce) can tomato sauce
- 2 cups water
- 1 (10 ounce) package frozen mixed vegetables
- 1/4 cup dry onion soup mix
- 1 teaspoon white sugar

Directions:
- In a large pot over medium high heat, saute the ground beef for about 5 minutes, or until browned. Drain off excess fat.
- Add the tomatoes, sauce, water, vegetables, soup mix and sugar. Bring to a boil and reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer for 20 minutes.

Italian Grilled Tuna

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 pounds tuna steaks
- 2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice
- 1/2 cup roasted red peppers diced
- 1/2 cup scallions sliced
- 2 tablespoons fresh oregano minced
- 2 tablespoons Italian parsley minced fresh
- 1 cup balsamic vinegar
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- salt to taste
- freshly ground black pepper to taste

Directions:
- Combine the tuna steaks and lemon juice and marinate for 15 minutes. Prepare an outside grill with an oiled rack set 6 inches above the heat source. On a gas grill, set the heat to medium.
- Grill or broil the tuna 6 inches from the heat source for 4 to 5 minutes on each side. Combine all remaining ingredients in a saucepan and bring to a boil. Pour the sauce over the tuna steaks to serve.

Saudi Samboosak

Ingredients:
- 3 cups flour
- 2 grated onions
- 1 1/2 cups oil
- 1 teaspoon ground black pepper
- 1 teaspoon bread spices (fennel seeds, poppy seeds, etc.)
- 1/4 ounce yeast
- 1 teaspoon cumin
- oil (for frying)
- water
- 1 lb ground beef or 1 lb ground lamb

Directions:
- Put the flour in a deep bowl, add the bread spices and salt. Add the oil and rub with fingertips. Add water and a pinch of salt a little at a time, mixing thoroughly until dough is binding.
- Divide into small pieces, place on a tray and put in a warm place for one hour.
- Put ground meat, onion, salt, pepper and cumin in a frying pan and cook over low heat. Cool.
- Roll each piece of dough into a round, about 1/16 inch thick. Place a tablespoon of meat in the center of each round and seal then twist the edges.
- Heat the oil and deep fry the samboosak on both sides.
- Serve hot.

Perfect Soft Boiled Eggs

Ingredients:
- 2 eggs
- 1 teaspoon butter

Directions:
- Bring a pot of water to a simmer (small bubbles, not a rapid boil).
- Add eggs, cold from the fridge, and cook for seven minutes. Adjust heat to keep a consistent temperature going.
- Remove eggs from water and enjoy with butter and salt and pepper.

Cole Slaw Superb

Ingredients:
- 1/2 cabbage (about 5 c.)
- 1/2 medium onion, finely grated
- 1 c. coarsely grated carrots
- 1 small green pepper, finely sliced
- 1 tsp. salt
- 2 1/2 Tbsp. sugar
- 2 1/2 Tbsp. white wine vinegar
- 1 1/3 c. mayonnaise

Directions:
- Cut cabbage in half.
- Then half again to make wedges.
- Cut on the diagonal into thin strips.
- Mix with onion and carrots. Combine green pepper with salt, sugar, vinegar and mayonnaise. Toss with slaw and refrigerate at least one hour

Mississippi Mud Cake

Ingredients:
- 2 c. sugar
- 1/3 c. cocoa
- 1 c. chopped nuts
- 1 1/2 c. flour
- 1 c. shortening
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 4 eggs
- 3 tsp. vanilla
- 1/2 (10 oz.) pkg. miniature marshmallows

Directions:
- Cream sugar and shortening.
- Add eggs and beat by hand.
- Sift flour, cocoa and salt.
- Add nuts and vanilla.
- Pour into greased and floured 9 x 12-inch pan.
- Bake at 300° for 30 to 35 minutes. Remove from oven; pour on marshmallows and return to 350° oven for 10 minutes.

Lighter Fudgy Brownies

Ingredients:
- 1 cup sugar
- 1/2 cup baking cocoa
- 6 tablespoons fat-free plain or vanilla yogurt
- 2 egg whites
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1/2 cup all-purpose flour
- 1/4 cup chopped walnuts
- Confectioners' sugar

Directions:
- In a large bowl, combine the sugar, cocoa and yogurt. Stir in egg whites and vanilla. Gradually stir in flour and nuts just until combined.
- Pour into an 8-in. square baking pan that has been coated with cooking spray. Bake at 350° for 25-28 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Dust with confectioners' sugar.

Coconut Leftover Bars

Ingredients:
- stale bread
- sweetened condensed milk
- coconut

Directions:
- Cut bread into strips 1 inch wide, 1 inch thick, and 3 inches long.
- Dip in condensed milk and roll in coconut.
- Place on greased baking sheet in a hot oven (425 degrees F.).
- Until delicately browned.

Easiest Penne With Vodka

Ingredients:
- 2 tablespoons butter
- 13 cup vodka
- 12 teaspoon seasoned pepper or 12 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes
- 1 dash cayenne
- 1 (14 1/2 ounce) can diced tomatoes
- 12 teaspoon salt
- 12 cup heavy cream or 12 cup whipping cream
- 14 cup freshly grated parmesan cheese
- 1 lb penne, cooked according to package directions,drained

Directions:
- Heat butter in large skillet over medium-low heat.
- Stir in vodka, seasoned or crushed red pepper, and cayenne; heat gently for two minutes.
- Carefully add tomatoes and salt.
- Increase heat to high and cook until mixture thickens, about 5 minutes.
- Lower heat, and stir in heavy cream and Parmesan cheese.
- Add the penne, and toss with sauce.

Carrot-Lemongrass Soup

Ingredients:
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 tablespoon unsalted butter
- 1 cup onion, chopped
- 1 tablespoon kosher salt
- 2 lbs carrots
- 2 tablespoons lemongrass
- 1 tablespoon ginger
- 1 (14 ounce) can coconut milk
- 4 cups vegetable broth

Directions:
- "Heat a large soup pot over medium heat. When hot, add the butter and oil. When the butter has melted, add the onion, season with salt, and cook for five minutes, stirring occasionally, until the onion begins to soften. Add the carrots, lemongrass, and ginger, stir, and cover. Cook for ten minutes. Add the coconut milk and broth, bring the soup to a simmer, and simmer over low heat until the carrots are cooked through, about 20 to 25 minutes. Carefully puree the soup in a food processor or blender (or using an immersion blender). Return the soup to the pot, season to taste with salt, and serve hot.".

Double Chocolate Chip Cookies

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 c. butter
- 3 c. sugar
- 4 eggs
- 4 tsp. vanilla
- 4 c. flour
- 1 1/2 c. cocoa
- 2 tsp. soda
- 1 tsp. salt
- 2 c. chopped nuts
- 1 (12 oz.) bag chocolate chips
- 1 (12 oz.) bag vanilla or white chocolate chips

Directions:
- Cream butter and sugar.
- Add eggs and vanilla.
- Combine dry ingredients and add to creamed mixture.
- When well mixed, add nuts and chips.
- Bake at 350° for 8 to 10 minutes.
- Drop by teaspoonful on ungreased cookie sheet.
- Don't overbake.

Red pepper stuffed chicken

Ingredients:
- 3 piece chicken breasts
- 1 red pepper
- 1 fresh mozzarella
- 8 Fresh basil
- 2 tbsp Cajun seasoning

Directions:
- cut the red pepper into small strips
- Butterfly the chicken breasts and season it with the Cajun seasoning on both sides
- Preheat cast iron pan Valkyrie in the fresh mozzarella so it will fit into the chicken
- stuff the chicken with red pepper and fresh mozzarella come up with a little basil inside
- Cook it on high heat for 2 or 3 minutes on each side, in the cast iron pan
- Once off of the stove, put in baking pan and the rest of the red pepper any vacant spaces
- Cook in oven cook in oven at 350 for 25 minutes
- Remove and put fresh mozzarella and a pinch of basil on top and cook until cheese is melted

Hot Fudge Sauce

Ingredients:
- 1/3 c. water
- 2 sq. (1 oz. each) unsweetened or semi-sweet chocolate
- 1/2 c. sugar
- dash of salt
- 3 Tbsp. butter or margarine
- 1/4 tsp. vanilla

Directions:
- Place water and chocolate in a small saucepan.
- Cook over low heat, stirring constantly until chocolate is melted.
- Remove from heat, stir in sugar and salt. Return to medium heat and cook about 8 minutes or until thick, stirring constantly.
- Remove from heat. Beat in margarine and vanilla.
- Serve hot over ice cream.

Smoothies

Ingredients:
- 1 c. plain low-fat yogurt
- 5 strawberries
- 3 ice cubes
- 1 c. pineapple juice
- 1 banana

Directions:
- Puree in blender until smooth and serve.
- Makes 3 medium servings at 130 calories per serving.

Quick Tuna Casserole

Ingredients:
- 1 pkg. macaroni and cheese
- 1 can cream of mushroom soup
- 1 (9 oz.) can tuna, drained
- 1 (10 oz.) can peas, drained

Directions:
- Prepare macaroni and cheese according to directions. Stir in soup, tuna and peas. Mix well. Heat until bubbly.

A.M. Gorp Recipe

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. round toasted oat cereal
- 1/2 c. bite-sized square wheat cereal
- 1/2 c. crunchy corn bran cereal
- 1 Tbsp. dry banana chips
- 1 Tbsp. dry cranberries
- 1 Tbsp. raisins

Directions:
- Serves 1
- Combine all in a small food storage bag.
- NOTES : I love this stuff, but am stunned which it has so much fat in it.
- All the cereals have less than 1 gram of fat at 1 c., so the fat is coming from the banana chips.
- Why do they have fat in them

Fried Apples

Ingredients:
- 1/4 cup real butter
- 6 tart apples, cored, sliced
- 1 teaspoon lemon juice
- 1/4 cup dark brown sugar, packed
- 1/8 teaspoon salt
- 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 1 dash ground nutmeg

Directions:
- In a large skillet, melt butter.
- Place apples evenly over skillet bottom.
- Sprinkle lemon juice over them, then brown sugar, then salt.
- Cover and cook over low heat for 15 minutes until apples are tender.
- Sprinkle with cinnamon and nutmeg.

Ranch Style Dressing

Ingredients:
- 1 c. mayonnaise
- 6 Tbsp. milk
- 1/3 tsp. onion powder
- 1/3 tsp. garlic powder
- 1 tsp. dried parsley flakes
- 1 tsp. dried chives
- 1/8 tsp. dry mustard
- 1 Tbsp. lemon juice
- dash of salt

Directions:
- Blend everything together in a blender.
- Taste best after 1 day so flavors may blend.

Vegie Bites

Ingredients:
- 2 cans crescent dinner rolls
- 2 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese
- 1/4 c. mayonnaise
- 1 (1 oz.) envelope Ranch salad dressing mix
- 1 sweet red pepper
- 1 sweet green pepper
- 1/2 head broccoli
- 1/2 c. mushrooms (Delores uses canned ends and pieces)
- 3/4 c. shredded Cheddar cheese

Directions:
- Press rolls in lightly greased pan.
- Bake at 350° for 7 to 10 minutes.
- Let cool.
- Cream the cream cheese, mayonnaise and salad dressing mix.
- Spread over cool crust.
- Chop red pepper, green pepper, broccoli and mushrooms.
- Put this on top of the cream cheese.
- Sprinkle cheese over the top.
- Use more if you wish. Refrigerate for 8 hours before serving.

Fruit Punch

Ingredients:
- 4 1/2 qt. unsweetened pineapple juice
- juice of 12 lemons
- juice of 12 oranges
- juice of 5 limes
- 3 c. sugar
- 1 1/2 c. mint leaves
- 6 qt. dry ginger ale
- 3 qt. plain soda water
- 1 pt. fresh strawberries, quartered

Directions:
- Combine pineapple, lemon, orange and lime juices, sugar and 1/2 of crushed mint leaves.
- Chill.
- Just before serving, add ginger ale, soda water, whole mint leaves and quartered strawberries.
- Pour over large cake of ice in punch bowl.
- Yields 75 cups.

Child'S Favorite Milk Shake

Ingredients:
- 6 scoops ice cream (any flavor)
- 1/2 c. milk
- 2 bananas

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients in blender and blend until thick.
- If shake is too thick, add 1/8 cup of milk and reblend.

Fruit Pizza

Ingredients:
- 1 pkg. cookie dough (sugar cookie)
- 18 oz. pkg. cream cheese
- 1/2 container Cool Whip

Directions:
- Spread cookie dough on a lightly greased pizza pan.
- Bake and cool.
- Combine cream cheese and Cool Whip.
- Spread mixture on cool cookie crust.
- Then top with fruit.

Fast Eggs

Ingredients:
- 2 eggs
- 1 tablespoon butter or ghee
- 3 slices bacon cut up in 1 inch strips
- 2 tablespoons grossly chopped zucchini
- 1 ounce crumbled blue cheese

Directions:
- Using preferably a non-stick pan, melt your butter or ghee adding the bacon and zucchini, cooking at medium/ high heat till bacon and zucchini are almost done.
- Throw in your eggs that you have already whisked while your pan is sizzling.
- Let them cook until almost done in the mode of an omelette and add that tangy blue cheese over. Fold and serve.

Leona'S Zucchini Bread

Ingredients:
- 3 eggs
- 2 c. sugar
- 1 c. oil
- 2 c. flour
- 2 Tbsp. cinnamon
- 1/4 tsp. baking powder
- 2 tsp. soda
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 c. chopped nuts
- 2 c. grated squash
- 2 Tbsp. vanilla

Directions:
- Beat eggs and sugar.
- Add oil.
- Mix in flour, cinnamon, baking powder, soda and salt.
- Fold in nuts, vanilla and squash. Grease and flour 2 loaf pans.
- Bake at 350° for 1 hour.

Rhubarb Jam

Ingredients:
- 6 lb. Rhubarb
- 6 lb. Lump sugar
- 3 lemons

Directions:
- Wipe the rhubarb dry and put into preserving pan with sugar, cutting the rhubarb up first.
- Mince the lemon rind and add other ingredients, keep stirring to prevent the rhubarb from burning.
- When sugar is quite dissolved let the jam boil quickly for 3/4 of an hour.

Granola

Ingredients:
- 2 1/2 c. oatmeal (old-fashioned), uncooked
- 1/4 c. wheat germ
- 1/3 c. chunky peanut butter
- 1/2 c. coconut (optional)
- 1/4 c. honey
- 1/2 tsp. vanilla
- 2 Tbsp. vegetable oil
- 3/4 c. raisins

Directions:
- Stir together oatmeal, wheat germ and coconut.
- Heat oil and honey, stirring occasionally.
- Remove from heat; add vanilla and peanut butter.
- Blend well.
- Pour over dry ingredients and mix well.
- Spread on cookie sheet with sides.
- Bake at 225° for one hour.
- Cool.
- Break apart and stir in raisins with hands.
- Store tightly covered.

Cold Bisque Of Tomato and Sorrel

Ingredients:
- 2 tablespoons cooking oil
- 3/4 cup chopped onion
- 3 cups sorrel leaves (no stems), packed
- 6 medium-ripe tomatoes, peeled, seeded and chopped (about 2 pounds)
- 1 1/2 cups heavy cream
- Salt and freshly ground pepper
- 2 tablespoons chopped chives

Directions:
- Heat oil in a heavy saucepan.
- Add onion and cook until the onion is translucent but not brown.
- Wash sorrel leaves and add to the pan with moisture still clinging to them.
- Cover tightly and cook over low heat until the sorrel is wilted and has turned a dull olive green.
- Place contents of the pan in a blender or food processor and blend until smooth.
- Add tomatoes and blend until smooth.
- Transfer to a bowl and stir in the cream.
- Season to taste with salt and pepper and chill thoroughly before serving.
- Garnish each serving with chopped chives.

Nancy'S Fettucini

Ingredients:
- 1 pkg. fettucini noodles, cooked, but still firm
- 8 oz. sour cream
- 2 c. mushroom soup
- 4 oz. grated Cheddar cheese
- 4 oz. Jack cheese (Monterey)
- 4 oz. Mozzarella cheese
- 1 medium box Parmesan cheese (spaghetti)
- salt and pepper to taste

Directions:
- Mix well together sour cream, mushroom soup, salt and pepper. Melt together the Cheddar, Jack and Mozzarella cheeses.
- Add to sour cream and mushroom soup mixture.
- Add warm noodles.
- Blend together and add Parmesan cheese.
- Stir until well mixed.
- Serve with salad and garlic bread.

Spiced Pear Jam

Ingredients:
- 8 c. chopped or coarsely ground peeled pears (5 1/2 lb.)
- 4 c. sugar
- 1 tsp. ground cinnamon
- 1/4 tsp. ground cloves

Directions:
- Combine all ingredients in a large heavy pot.
- Simmer uncovered for 1 1/2 to 2 hours or until thickened.
- Stir frequently.
- Remove from heat and skim off foam.
- Pour hot jam into hot jars leaving 1/4-inch space.
- Adjust caps.
- Process for 10 minutes in boiling water.
- Yield:
- 6 half pints.

Microwave Peanut Butter Fudge

Ingredients:
- 2 sticks margarine
- 1 lb. powdered sugar
- 2/3 c. peanut butter
- 1 tsp. vanilla

Directions:
- Melt margarine and peanut butter in the microwave.
- Stir in powdered sugar and vanilla.
- When completely blended, press into an 8 x 8 x 2-inch pan.
- Chill and cut into pieces.

Pizza Snake

Ingredients:
- 1 tube (11 ounces) refrigerated crusty French loaf
- 1 jar (14 ounces) pizza sauce, divided
- 1 cup shredded part-skim mozzarella cheese
- 1 cup sliced fresh mushrooms
- 25 slices pepperoni
- 1 large egg, lightly beaten
- Assorted food coloring
- New paintbrushes

Directions:
- Unroll the French loaf dough into a large rectangle; spread with 1 cup pizza sauce to within 1 in. of edges. Sprinkle with cheese and mushrooms. Cut a forked tongue from a pepperoni slice; refrigerate. Layer remaining pepperoni over cheese and mushrooms.
- Roll up jelly-roll style, starting with a long side; pinch seam to seal and tuck ends under. Place seam side down on a greased
- and shape like an "S." Divide egg among several small bowls; tint with food coloring as desired. Paint snake as desired with egg wash.
- Bake at 350° for 25-30 minutes or until golden brown. Cut a small hole for the mouth; insert pepperoni tongue. Warm remaining pizza sauce; serve on the side.

Ham And Broccoli Royale

Ingredients:
- 1 c. uncooked regular rice
- 2 (10 oz.) pkg. broccoli spears
- 6 Tbsp. margarine or butter (3/4 stick)
- 2 c. fresh bread crumbs (4 slices)
- 2 large onions, chopped fine (2 c.)
- 3 Tbsp. flour
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 3 c. milk
- 1 1/2 lb. cooked ham, cubed (4 c.)
- 1 (8 oz.) pkg. white American cheese

Directions:
- Cook rice; follow label directions.
- Spoon into greased baking dish (13 x 9 x 2-inch).
- Cook broccoli, following directions; drain.
- Place single layer over rice in baking dish.

Best Crock-Pot Bean Dip Ever!!!

Ingredients:
- 1 (15 ounce) can kidney beans
- 1 (15 ounce) can pinto beans
- 1 (15 ounce) can lima beans
- 1 (15 ounce) can white hominy (white canned corn)
- 1 (15 ounce) can diced tomatoes (any flavor)
- 1 (1 1/4 ounce) packet ranch dressing mix
- 1 (1 1/4 ounce) packet taco seasoning mix
- 1 lb ground turkey or 1 lb beef

Directions:
- Brown meat and drain - add to crockpot.
- Drain contents of all cans and add to crockpot.
- Add 2 packets of seasoning - taco and ranch.
- Cook on low or high until beans are soft'ish.
- Serve with chips, sprinkle with cheese and sour cream.
- I've added a bunch of different things in the past --
- 1 4oz can green chiles.
- Black beans.
- jalapenos.
- I've added cheese to the dip before serving to melt into dip.
- White beans.
- Anything else!

Crock Pot Chicken Lizzy

Ingredients:
- 1 medium onion, finely chopped
- 30 ml sunflower oil
- 500 g boneless skinless chicken breasts
- 250 g ready-to-eat dried apricots, cut in half
- 250 ml organic vegetable stock
- 250 ml apple juice
- 2 12 ml ground cinnamon
- 75 g ground almonds
- 100 ml double cream

Directions:
- Gently fry finely chopped onion in sunflower oil until golden.
- Add chicken breasts and brown lightly on both sides.
- Transfer meat and onions to pre-heated crock pot.
- Pour over stock and apple juice.
- Stir in chopped dried apricots.
- Stir in ground cinnamon.
- Cover and cook on Auto 4-5 hours.
- When meat is tender, remove chicken from crock pot and cut in chunks.
- Stir ground almonds and cream into sauce.
- Return chicken to crock pot and reheat before serving.

Catalina Chicken

Ingredients:
- 1 (16 oz.) bottle Catalina dressing
- 1 pkg. Lipton onion soup mix
- 1 small jar apricot preserves
- 1 cut-up fryer

Directions:
- Place chicken in 9 x 13-inch pan or casserole dish.
- Mix all ingredients together and pour over chicken.
- Cover pan with foil and bake at 350° for 1 hour or until brown and tender.

Scalloped Mushrooms

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. mushrooms
- 1/4 lb. crackers
- 1 1/4 c. milk
- 1 tsp. salt
- pepper to taste
- 1/4 stick margarine

Directions:
- Wash mushrooms and cut into small pieces.
- Put in bowl.
- Crush crackers over the mushrooms.
- Season and pour milk over mushrooms and crackers.
- Mix and pour into buttered casserole.
- Dot with margarine and bake in 350° oven for 45 to 60 minutes.

Raisin Bran Muffins

Ingredients:
- 1 large box Raisin Bran cereal
- 1 qt. buttermilk
- 1 1/2 c. oil
- 2 tsp. salt
- 4 beaten eggs
- 5 c. flour
- 2 c. sugar
- 5 tsp. soda

Directions:
- Mix dry ingredients first, then add all other ingredients. Refrigerate 6 hours before baking at 350° for 15 to 20 minutes.

Toffee Chocolate Spoons

Ingredients:
- 1 cup sugar
- 4 oz milk chocolate, melted
- None None Hot milk, to serve

Directions:
- Line 2 baking pans with parchment paper. Combine sugar and 1/2 cup water in small saucepan. Stir on medium heat, without boiling, until sugar has dissolved. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low; simmer, uncovered, without stirring, until toffee is golden brown. Remove from heat; let stand for 2 mins.
- Spoon toffee onto prepared pans in 10 spoon shapes, about 5 inches long. Let stand at room temperature until set.
- Dip toffee spoons into chocolate; return to pans. Let stand at room temperature until set.
- Use spoons to stir mugs of hot milk to make hot chocolate.

Banana Poppy Seed Pancakes

Ingredients:
- 1 cup whole wheat flour
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 4 teaspoons baking powder
- 2 teaspoons poppy seeds
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 2 eggs
- 2 cups milk
- 2 ripe bananas, mashed
- 1/4 cup coconut oil, melted
- 2 tablespoons honey
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1/2 cup fresh blueberries (optional)

Directions:
- Whisk whole wheat flour, all-purpose flour, baking powder, poppy seeds, and salt together in a bowl.
- Beat eggs in a large bowl. Add milk, bananas, coconut oil, honey, and vanilla extract; whisk together. Pour in flour mixture and stir until just combined.
- Preheat a lightly oiled griddle on medium-low heat. Ladle batter 1/4 cup at a time onto the prepared griddle, sprinkling a few blueberries over each pancake. Cook until bubbles start to appear and edges are dry, about 3 minutes. Flip and cook until other side is browned, about 2 minutes.

Vegetable Medley

Ingredients:
- 2 lb. frozen broccoli
- 2 lb. frozen cauliflower
- 2 lb. frozen carrots
- 2 cans cream of mushroom soup
- 1 lb. sharp Cheddar cheese
- bread crumbs (unflavored)

Directions:
- Thaw vegetables. While vegetables are thawing, prepare sauce in pot. Add cream of mushroom soup to pot while slowly adding Cheddar cheese to get an even mix.
- Keep this at a low heat. Add vegetables to a casserole dish.
- (You may wish to parboil vegetables but this is not necessary.)
- Add cheese and soup sauce to vegetables.
- Add browned bread crumbs in butter as topping. Bake for 45 minutes at 350°.

Roast Pork Soup

Ingredients:
- 3 cups cubed cooked pork roast
- 2 medium potatoes, peeled and chopped
- 1 large onion, chopped
- 1 can (15 ounces) navy beans, rinsed and drained
- 1 can (14-1/2 ounces) Italian diced tomatoes, undrained
- 4 cups water
- 1/2 cup unsweetened apple juice
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon pepper
- Minced fresh basil

Directions:
- In a soup kettle or Dutch oven, combine the first 9 ingredients. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat; cover and simmer until vegetables are crisp-tender, 45 minutes. Sprinkle with basil.

Ribbon Sandwich

Ingredients:
- 2 large cucumbers
- 3 stalks celery
- 1 medium onion
- 2 bell peppers
- 2 carrots

Directions:
- Blend all this together, drain off all juice.
- Add salt and pepper to taste.
- Mix together with 3 blocks of cream cheese and 1 or 2 tbsp. mayonnaise.
- Mix well.
- Stack on 3 pieces of bread; trim off edge and cut with electric knife like finger sandwiches.

Kringla

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 c. sugar
- 1 egg, beaten
- 2 1/2 c. dairy sour cream
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 2 tsp. baking soda
- 4 1/2 c. sifted flour

Directions:
- Combine sugar, egg, baking soda and flour.
- Blend thoroughly into sugar mixture.
- Divide dough thoroughly into sugar mixture. Divide dough in half.
- Form each half into a long roll.
- (If kitchen is warm, refrigerate 1 roll until ready to use.)
- Cut off a narrow strip of dough.
- Roll lightly with hands on lightly floured surface, into pencil-like strip, 7 to 8-inches long.
- Form a figure 8 by pinching ends together tightly.
- Bring pinched ends to center of the ring and tuck the pinched ends under.
- Place on lightly greased baking sheet.
- Bake in preheated 350° oven for 12 to 15 minutes or until golden brown.
- Makes 6 to 7 dozen.

Stuffed Potato Boats

Ingredients:
- 4 large baking potatoes
- 1 pkg. (6 oz.) OSCAR MAYER Smoked Ham, chopped
- 1 cup frozen corn, thawed
- 8 frozen broccoli florets, thawed
- 4 KRAFT 2% Milk Singles Target 2 For $5.00 thru 02/06

Directions:
- Prick potatoes with fork.
- Microwave on HIGH 15 min.
- or until tender.
- Place 1 potato on each of 4 microwaveable serving plates.
- Cut potatoes lengthwise in half; top with remaining ingredients.
- Microwave, in batches, 2 min.
- or until toppings are heated through and 2% Milk Singles are melted.

Red Satin Punch

Ingredients:
- 2 pt. cranberry juice cocktail
- 1 qt. apple juice
- 3 qt. 7-Up soda

Directions:
- Chill apple juice and cranberry juice until icy.
- Combine with cold 7-Up just before serving.

Hard Candy Or Rock Candy

Ingredients:
- 4 c. sugar
- 1 1/3 c. light corn syrup
- 2 2/3 c. water
- 10 to 12 drops peppermint oil or flavoring of choice
- vegetable coloring

Directions:
- Mix sugar, corn syrup and water in 2-quart saucepan.
- Cook over low heat, stirring until sugar is dissolved and mixture boils. Continue boiling without stirring until small amount is very brittle when dropped into water or 310° or hard crack on candy thermometer.
- Cook slowly at end so syrup will not discolor. Remove from heat.
- Add flavoring and coloring.
- Stir only to mix. Pour on cookie pans, lightly greased.
- Let mixture cool to hard. Break up candy.
- Keep cool in summer.

Aunt Sarah Buckner'S Chicken And Dumplings

Ingredients:
- 1 hen or fat fryer
- chicken broth
- dumplings
- salt and pepper to taste

Directions:
- Cook chicken until done, remove from broth, remove skin and debone.
- If there's not enough broth, add 1 can chicken broth or cream of chicken soup.

Strawberry Cream Cheese Dip

Ingredients:
- 1/2 cup fat free cream cheese
- 7 teaspoons strawberry all-fruit spread
- 7 teaspoons skim milk
- 1/2 cup light whipped topping

Directions:
- In a mixing bowl, combine cream cheese, strawberry spread, and milk.
- Using an electric mixer, blend until smooth.
- Gently but thoroughly fold in whipped topping.
- Chill until serving time.

Fruity Chicken Salad 

Ingredients:
- 2 cans (10 ounces each) chunk white chicken in broth, drained
- 1/2 cup reduced-fat mayonnaise
- 1/2 cup red seedless grapes, each cut in half
- 1/3 cup chopped celery
- 1/4 cup sliced almonds, toasted (toasting optional)
- Salt and pepper, to taste
- 1 can (15 ounces) Mandarin oranges, drained

Directions:
- Preparation Time: Approximately 10 minutes
- 
- Preparation:
- Combine chicken and mayonnaise in a medium bowl. Stir in grapes, celery and almonds. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Just before serving, gently stir in oranges.
- Servings: 6
- 
- Nutritional Information Per Serving: Calories 260; Total fat 17g; Saturated fat 4g; Cholesterol 65mg; Sodium 540mg; Total Carbohydrate 14g; Fiber 3g; Protein 15g; Vitamin A 20%DV*; Vitamin C 45%DV; Calcium 6%DV; Iron 10%DV
- 
- *Daily Value

Pecan Chewy Cake

Ingredients:
- 2 c. light brown sugar (1 box)
- 5 medium eggs or 4 extra large eggs
- 2 c. self-rising flour
- 2 c. broken pecans, lightly floured

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350°. Spray or grease two 6 x 10 baking pans or one 9 x 12 baking pan.

Golden Oatmeal Muffins

Ingredients:
- 1 packages Duncan Hines Most Deluxe butter recipe golden cake mix
- 1 cup quick-cooking oats
- 1/4 tsp salt
- 3/4 cup milk
- 2 large eggs (slightly beaten)
- 2 tbsp butter or margarine (melted)
- 1 honey or jam

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 400.
- Grease a 24 muffin cup pan or line each one with a paper muffin cup.
- Combine the dry cake mix, oats, and salt in a bowl.
- Beat together milk, eggs, and butter.
- Add the liquid ingredients to the dry ingredients, stirring just until moistened.
- Spoon into muffin cups, filling 2/3 full.
- Bake at 400 for 13 minutes or until golden brown.
- Serve with honey or jam.

Wedding Punch-Red

Ingredients:
- 1 bottle Hawaiian punch
- 2 qt pineapple juice
- 6 cups sugar
- 6 pkg. raspberry kool-aid
- 8 pt raspberry sherbet
- 4 quarts 7- up or ginger ale

Directions:
- Mix first 4 ingredients.
- Chill when ready to serve.
- Add sherbet and 7 - up.
- Yield: 60 servings.

* Barbecue Meatballs *

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. lean ground beef
- 1 c. minced onion
- 1 egg
- 1/4 c. milk
- 1/4 c. bread crumbs
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 2 Tbsp. oil
- 2 (8 oz.) cans tomato sauce
- 1/4 c. molasses or brown sugar
- 2 Tbsp. vinegar
- 1 tsp. seasoned salt

Directions:
- Combine first 7 ingredients and shape into 12 meatballs. Brown in oil in skillet; remove excess fat.
- Combine remaining ingredients and pour over meatballs.
- Simmer over low heat 10 to 15 minutes, turning frequently, until meatballs are well glazed. Serve over rice or noodles as desired.
- Makes 4 servings.

Pecan Coffee Cake

Ingredients:
- 2 c. brown sugar
- 2 c. flour
- 1/2 c. shortening (butter and Crisco or margarine)
- 1 c. buttermilk
- 1 tsp. soda
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 egg
- 1/2 c. chopped pecans

Directions:
- Mix sugar, flour and shortening together as you would pie crust.
- Take out 1/2 cup mixture; save for topping.
- To the remainder, add the buttermilk and teaspoon of soda which has been dissolved in a tablespoon of warm water, vanilla, salt and egg. Beat together.
- Turn into buttered pan approximately 9 1/2 inches square.
- Sprinkle over top the 1/2 cup of crumbs and 1/2 cup chopped pecans.
- Bake at 400° for 45 minutes.
- Best served slightly warm.
- (Serves 12.)

Red and White Bean Salad

Ingredients:
- 3 plum tomatoes
- 1 md. cucumber
- 1 can Great Northern beans, rinsed and drained
- 1 can red kidney beans, rinsed and drained
- 2 tbsp. dried parsley
- 2 tbsp. white wine vinegar
- 1 tbsp. olive
- salad oil
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper

Directions:
- Discard seeds from plum tomatoes; dice tomatoes.
- Peel cucumber, leaving some green on.
- Discard seeds from cucumber; dice.
- Combine all ingredients in medium bowl.

Wild Rice Soup Ii

Ingredients:
- 1/2 cup dry lentils
- 3 cups water
- 1 (6 ounce) package uncooked wild rice
- 1 (14.5 ounce) can vegetable broth
- 1 (10 ounce) package frozen mixed vegetables
- 1 cup milk
- 1 1/2 cups shredded American cheese

Directions:
- Rinse and sort lentils, discarding any debris or blemished lentils.
- Combine lentils and water in a medium saucepan. Bring to a boil; cover, reduce heat to low and simmer for 5 minutes. Let stand for 1 hour, covered. Drain and rinse lentils.
- Using a medium saucepan cook rice according to package directions.
- In a medium stock pot add lentils, cooked rice, vegetable broth, frozen mixed vegetables, milk and American cheese. Bring to a boil; reduce heat to low and simmer, uncovered for 20 minutes. Garnish as desired.

Orange Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 (3 oz.) box orange jello
- 1 (8 oz.) carton cottage cheese
- 1 small can mandarin oranges
- 1 (15 oz.) can pineapple, drained

Directions:
- Mix orange jello, cottage cheese and drained pineapple.
- Place in 6 x 9-inch dish.
- Place mandarin oranges on top.
- Chill in refrigerator.

Hot Apple Cider

Ingredients:
- 1 lemon, sliced
- 1 orange, sliced
- 8 cinnamon sticks
- 1 Tbsp. whole cloves
- 1 Tbsp. allspice
- 1 1/2 Tbsp. honey
- 1 gal. apple cider

Directions:
- Put lemon, orange, spices and honey in the coffeepot basket, then pour the cider over it; let it perk.

Potatoes Romanoff

Ingredients:
- 6 large potatoes
- 1 bunch green onions, cut
- 1 1/2 c. sharp Cheddar cheese, shredded
- 1 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- paprika
- 1 pt. sour cream

Directions:
- Cook potatoes, peel and cut into a large bowl.
- Stir in sour cream, onions, 1 cup cheese, salt and pepper.
- Turn mixture into buttered 2-quart casserole.
- Top with remaining cheese and sprinkle with paprika.
- Refrigerate several hours or overnight.
- Bake, uncovered, for 30 to 40 minutes at 350°.
- Serves 8 to 10.

Butterscotch Morsel Pound Cake

Ingredients:
- 2 sticks oleo
- 1 c. sour cream
- 3 c. plain flour
- 6 large eggs
- 1 c. pecans, floured
- 2 tsp. baking powder
- 1 tsp. almond flavoring
- 1 pkg. butterscotch morsels, floured

Directions:
- Mix ingredients, adding eggs one at a time.
- Beat well after each egg.
- Bake for 1 1/2 hours at 300°, starting in cold oven.

Crunchy & Slightly Sweet Cinnamon Cookies

Ingredients:
- 100 grams Cake flour
- 3 tsp Cinnamon
- 20 grams Sugar
- 30 grams Salted butter
- 2 tbsp Milk

Directions:
- Melt the butter in the microwave (about 20 seconds) and then mix in the sugar.
- Mix in the milk.
- Mix in the cinnamon.
- I love cinnamon, so I used 2 teaspoons.
- Add the flour and mix until no longer powdery, but don't over mix it.
- You don't need to sift the flour.
- It should look like this.
- Sandwich the dough between plastic wrap and roll out to 3-4 mm thickness.
- Cut out cookies with your preferred cookie cutters.
- Bake in an oven heated to 180C for 20-25 minutes.
- All done!

Tomato, Lime & Tortilla Soup

Ingredients:
- 1 cup chopped onions
- 4 large garlic cloves, minced
- 3 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin seeds
- 1/2 teaspoon ground oregano
- 3 1/2 cups chopped tomatoes
- 3 cups stock (vegetable, chicken, turkey)
- 1/3 cup fresh lime juice

Directions:
- In a soup pot, saute the onions and garlic in oil for about 5 minutes. Add the cumin and oregano and saute for a few more minutes.
- Add the chopped tomatoes and sprinkle with a pinch of salt. Cover the pot and cook gently for about 15 minutes.
- Add the stock and simmer, covered, for 15 minutes.
- Add the lime juice. Add crumbled tortilla chips, chicken, or cheese to top off the soup.

Cream Cheese Chicken Chili

Ingredients:
- 1 can Black Beans
- 1 can corn
- 1 can Rotel
- 1 envelope Ranch Dressing mix
- 1 tsp Cumin
- 1 tbsp Chili Power
- 1 tsp Onion powder
- 1 packages Cream Cheese
- 2 lb Chicken Breast

Directions:
- Place chicken on bottom of crock pot
- Drain and rinse can of black beans.
- I didn't rinse for the little juice left adds flavor.
- Pour can of corn without draining
- Pour Rotel without draining and the black beans
- Mix seasonings and ranch in separate bowl then add to pot and stir together.
- Place cream cheese on top, cover and cook 6-8 hours or 10 hours if chicken is frozen.
- Use 2 forks and shred chicken.
- Stir cream cheese into chili and serve hot.
- I'd double ingredients because this is a great tasting meal.

Thick And Chewy Pizza Dough

Ingredients:
- 1 pkg. active dry yeast
- 1 c. lukewarm water
- 3 to 3 1/4 c. bread flour
- 1 tsp. salt

Directions:
- Dissolve
- yeast
- in water.
- Combine 2 1/2 cups of flour and the
- salt.	Stir
- in
- the
- yeast mixture.
- Knead the dough about 10	minutes,
- working
- in
- 1/2 to 3/4 cup
- more flour so that the dough is still soft but not sticky.

Gallehers Meat Loaf

Ingredients:
- 3 lb. ground beef
- 1 egg
- 1/2 c. Italian bread crumbs
- 2 dashes of Worcestershire sauce
- 1 medium onion, chopped
- 1/8 c. parsley flakes
- salt and pepper to taste
- 2 large cans tomato sauce
- potatoes, carrots and onions, cut in chunks

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients, except tomato sauce and potatoes, carrot and onion chunks. Shape into meat loaf. Use a roasting pan with a lid. Place meat loaf in center of pan. Place potatoes, carrots and onion chunks around meat loaf. Pour tomato sauce over all. Bake at 400° for 30 minutes; reduce heat to 350° and bake until carrots are done.

Lum'S Ollieburger

Ingredients:
- 2 lbs ground chuck
- 3 tablespoons lemon juice
- 1 1/2 teaspoons seasoning salt
- 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce
- 1 tablespoon soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon A.1. Original Sauce
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
- 1/2 cup beef broth
- 1 teaspoon Heinz 57 steak sauce
- 1/4 teaspoon garlic salt
- 1 teaspoon white vinegar

Directions:
- Shape the ground chuck into 6 patties, approximately 3/4" thick.
- Combine all other ingredients in a resealable bag and mix well. Add the patties and marinate, refrigerated, 12 hours or overnight.
- Grill, panfry or broil to your desired degree of doneness.
- Remove from heat, pass the napkins and enjoy!
- NOTE: Prep time does not includes marinating time.

Stovetop Apple Butter

Ingredients:
- 6 to 7 pounds tart apples, unpeeled and quartered
- 3 cups water
- 3-1/2 cups sugar
- 1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 1 cinnamon stick (3 inches)

Directions:
- In a 6- to 8-qt. heavy kettle, bring apples and water to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until apples are tender. Press cooked apples through a colander or food mill. Discard peels.
- Return pureed apples to the kettle. Stir in the remaining ingredients. Simmer, uncovered, stirring frequently, until the consistency is very thick and the color is dark brown, about 8 hours. Freeze in containers.

Watermelon Tomato Salad

Ingredients:
- 10 cups cubed seedless watermelon
- 2 pints yellow grape red pear tomatoes
- 1 medium red onion, chopped
- 12 cup minced fresh parsley
- 12 cup fresh minced basil
- 14 cup lime juice

Directions:
- In a large bowl, combine the watermelon, toatoes and onion.
- In a small bowl, combine the parsley, basil and lime jice.
- Pour over watermelon mixture and toss to coat.
- Refrigerate until serving.

Cilantro And Lime Butter

Ingredients:
- 1 cup unsalted butter
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro
- 1 1/2 tablespoons lime juice
- 1/2 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes
- salt to taste

Directions:
- In a mixing bowl, cream butter. Mix in cilantro, lime juice, and red pepper flakes. Season with salt to taste. Cover, and chill for at least 1 hour.

Mocha Acorns

Ingredients:
- 1 cup sweet butter
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 3/4 cup brown sugar
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 2-1/2 cup all-purpose flour
- 6 oz. semisweet chocolate pieces, melted
- 1 tsp. cocoa
- 1 tsp. instant coffee
- 1 cup pecans, finely chopped

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 325F.
- Grease cookie sheets.
- Cream butter and brown sugar.
- Add the sifted flour, cocoa, instant coffee, vanilla and salt.
- Mix well.
- Roll into 4 long rolls about 1-inch in diameter.
- Cut into 3/4-inch sections and roll each into a ball.
- With fingertips, press each ball slightly onto the cookie sheet to make a flat base and pinch the top to make a point (balls shouldn't be more than 3/4-inch in diameter.)
- Bake for 10 to 12 minutes.
- While warm, dip the wide end of the balls into chocolate and roll in the pecans.
- Place in paper candy cups.

southern tater salad

Ingredients:
- 8 taters
- 4 boiled eggs
- 1/2 large onion
- 1 mayo
- 1 tbsp mustard
- 1 salt and pepper to taste
- 1 whole pickle
- 2 tbsp pickle juice

Directions:
- boil taters till tender not mushy
- boil eggs and peel
- mash taters and eggs with a tater masher so that they are chunky
- add onions,diced pickle,pickle juice, and mayo mix toss till desired consistency
- mix in mustard
- add salt and pepper for tast
- cover and refrigerate

Cheesy Spinach Pinwheels

Ingredients:
- 1 (8 oz.) can Pillsbury crescent rolls
- 4 (1 oz.) slices thinly sliced ham
- 1/3 c. gourmet spreadable cheese with garlic and herbs
- 1/2 c. packed spinach leaves

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 375°. Separate dough into 4 rectangles on smooth side of cutting board. Press seams to seal. Using spatula, spread each rectangle with about 1 1/2 tablespoons of cheese to within 1/4-inch of edges. Top with 1 slice ham and spinach leaves. Starting at short side, roll up each rectangle; pinch edges to seal. Cut each roll crosswise into 6 slices for a total of 24 slices. Place cut side down. Bake 12 to 15 minutes or until golden brown. Remove and serve warm. Yield: 24 pinwheels.

Layered Nacho Dip

Ingredients:
- 17 oz. can refried pinto beans
- 4 oz. can chiles, chopped
- 1 medium onion, chopped finely
- 1/2 c. black olives, chopped
- 1 Tbsp. chili powder
- 1 mashed avocado
- 1 Tbsp. lemon juice
- 1 clove garlic, crushed
- taco sauce to taste
- 1 c. sour cream
- 1 c. grated Monterey Jack/Colby cheese

Directions:
- Layer ingredients in 1-quart casserole.
- For the bottom layer, combine pinto beans, chiles, onion, black olives and chili powder. For the next layer, combine avocado, lemon juice, garlic and taco sauce.
- Next spread sour cream over.
- Top with grated Monterey Jack/Colby cheese.
- Bake at 350° for 20 minutes or until bubbly.

Scandinavian Apple Cake

Ingredients:
- 4 large tart apples
- 1 c. sugar
- 1 c. chopped nuts
- 2/3 c. melted butter
- 2 eggs, beaten
- 2 tsp. vanilla
- 2 c. all-purpose flour
- 2 tsp. baking soda
- 2 tsp. cinnamon
- 2 tsp. allspice
- 1 tsp. cardamon
- 1/2 tsp. salt

Directions:
- Peel, core and chop apples; combine apples, sugar, nuts and butter in a large bowl.
- Stir in eggs; add vanilla.
- Sift together all dry ingredients and add to apple mixture, stirring until blended.
- Preheat oven to 350°.
- Grease 2 (8-inch) square cake pans.
- Divide batter between pans and bake 45 to 50 minutes or until toothpick comes out clean.
- Cool.
- Can also be baked in a 9 x 13-inch dish; bake 50 to 60 minutes.

Louisiana Cornbread Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 (18 1/4 ounce) box yellow cake mix
- 4 eggs
- 3/4 cup water
- 3 ounces lemon Jell-O gelatin
- 3/4 cup oil
- 1 teaspoon lemon extract
- 1/2 cup margarine, melted
- 1 cup powdered sugar
- 1/4 cup lemon juice

Directions:
- Combine cake mix, eggs, water, jello, oil and lemon extract and bake in a 9 x 13 pan at 300 degrees for 40 minutes.
- When done, take a fork and poke holes all over the top of the cake.
- Combine margarine, powdered sugar and lemon juice and pour over hot cake.

Oriental Fresh Tomato And Cucumber Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. (2 large) fresh tomatoes
- 1/3 c. sliced scallions
- 1 Tbsp. soy sauce
- 1/4 tsp. crushed red pepper
- 1 Tbsp. toasted sesame seed
- 1 medium cucumber
- 1 Tbsp. dark oriental sesame oil
- 1/4 tsp. sugar

Directions:
- Tomatoes should be fully ripe and at room temperature.
- Core and dice the tomatoes to make about 2 cups.
- Place in medium bowl. Peel and halve cucumber lengthwise; seed and slice (makes about 3/4 cup).
- Add cucumbers and scallions to tomatoes.
- Toss gently. In a small bowl, combine sesame oil, soy sauce, red pepper and sugar.
- Pour over tomato mixture; toss.
- Sprinkle with sesame seed.
- Makes three cups.

Chocolate-Caramel-Marshmallow Sandwiches

Ingredients:
- 6 ounces caramel squares (about 20)
- 1 12 tablespoons water
- 20 large marshmallows
- 1 (9 ounce) package chocolate wafer cookies (40 thin cookies)
- 1 tablespoon powdered sugar (optional)

Directions:
- Combine caramels with water in microwave-safe bowl.
- Microwave, uncovered, on high power until melted and bubbling, about 1 1/2 minutes.
- Stir until mixture is smooth.
- Press firmly on each marshmallow to flatten.
- Place on fork and roll in caramel until completely coated, letting excess drip off.
- With another fork, push marshmallow off onto flat (bottom) side of 1 chocolate cookie.
- Set second cookie flat side down on top to make a sandwich.
- Repeat with remaining mallows and cookies.
- Sprinkle tops with powdered sugar- optional, but makes them look quite pretty.
- Let stand until caramel has set, about 30 minutes.

Apple Chocolate Chip Cake

Ingredients:
- 3/4 cups Oil
- 1 cup Sugar
- 2 whole Eggs
- 2 cups Flour
- 1 teaspoon Baking Soda
- 1 pinch Salt
- 2 teaspoons Vanilla Extract
- 3/4 cups Chocolate Chips (or More If You'd Like)
- 3 cups Apple, peeled and diced (about 3 medium apples-I used Macintosh apples)

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease and flour a bundt pan.
- In a large bowl, mix together oil, sugar and eggs. In a small bowl, combine flour, baking soda and salt. Add the flour mixture to the sugar mixture. Add the vanilla and stir to combine. Fold in the chocolate chips and apples.
- Bake for 1 hour. Check for doneness after 45 or 50 minutes. Let the cake cool completely before removing from the bundt pan.
- Enjoy.

Date-Sweetened Quinoa Porridge

Ingredients:
- 1 cup quinoa, rinsed
- 1/4 cup pitted dates, diced
- 1 teaspoon cinnamon
- 1/4 teaspoon nutmeg
- 1 cup water
- 1 1/2 cup skim milk, plus more for serving
- Kosher salt
- 1/4 cup chopped toasted pecans

Directions:
- In a medium saucepan, combine the quinoa with the dates, cinnamon and nutmeg.
- Add the water, milk and a pinch of salt and bring to a boil.
- Cover and cook over low heat until the liquid has been absorbed and the quinoa is tender, about 15 minutes.
- Divide the porridge into bowls, sprinkle with the pecans and serve.

Apple Cake

Ingredients:
- 3/4 c. natural applesauce
- 2 c. sugar
- 3 eggs (3/4 c. quick eggs)
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 2 c. self-rising flour
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 1/2 tsp. nutmeg
- 1/2 tsp. soda
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 3 c. shredded apples

Directions:
- Bake in a greased and floured tube pan for 1 hour at 325°.

Gail'S Banana Nut Bread

Ingredients:
- 3/4 c. margarine
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 1 1/3 c. mashed bananas (3 medium)
- 2 eggs, well beaten
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 2 c. sifted flour
- 1 tsp. baking powder
- 3/4 tsp. salt
- 1/2 c. buttermilk
- 3/4 c. chopped walnuts

Directions:
- Combine butter and sugar thoroughly.
- Blend in bananas, eggs and vanilla.
- Sift flour, baking soda and salt.
- Add to banana mixture, alternating after each addition.
- Add nuts; mix.
- Pour into greased and floured 9 x 5 x 3-inch loaf pan.
- Bake at 350° for 1 to 1 1/4 hours.

Easy Bruschetta

Ingredients:
- 1 loaf (1 lb.) French bread or baguette, cut into 24 slices
- 1/2 cup KRAFT Italian Dressing
- 1/2 cup KRAFT Grated Parmesan Cheese
- 2 large tomatoes, chopped
- 2 green onions, chopped

Directions:
- Preheat broiler.
- Place bread slices on rack of broiler pan.
- Broil, 4 to 6 inches from heat, 2 minutes on each side or until golden brown on both sides.
- Mix dressing and cheese.
- Reserve 1/4 cup of the dressing mixture.
- Spread remaining dressing mixture onto one side of the toasted bread slices.
- Broil, dressing side up, an additional 1 to 2 minutes or until golden brown.
- Toss tomatoes and onions with the reserved 1/4 cup dressing mixture; spoon evenly over bread slices.

Apricot Mold

Ingredients:
- 1 (6 oz.) pkg. apricot Jell-O
- 2 c. boiling water
- 16 oz. sour cream
- 1 large can crushed pineapple, drained

Directions:
- To the pineapple juice, add water to total 1 1/2 cups. Dissolve Jell-O with the 2 cups of boiling water.
- Add pineapple juice.
- Let Jell-O set until almost firm. Stir in sour cream and beat until smooth. Add crushed pineapple.
- Mix and pour into mold.

Blueberry Jam(Sugar-Free)  

Ingredients:
- 1/2 (6 oz.) can frozen apple juice concentrate, thawed
- 1 envelope plain gelatin
- 5 c. fresh or frozen blueberries
- 1 Tbsp. lemon juice
- 1/4 tsp. ground nutmeg
- 1/8 tsp. ground cinnamon

Directions:
- Pour the apple juice concentrate into a saucepan.
- Sprinkle with gelatin and allow to soften for several minutes.

Mushroom Cheese Appetizers

Ingredients:
- 2 c. bisquick baking mix
- 1/2 c. cold water
- 1/4 lb. bulk pork sausage
- 1/4 c. finely chopped green onion with tops
- 3/4 c. mayo or salad dressing
- 35 medium mushrooms (1 lb)
- 2 c. shredded cheddar cheese (8 oz.)
- paprika

Directions:
- Heat oven to 350 degrees.
- Grease 13 x 9 x 2 pan.
- Mix baking mix and water until soft dough forms; beat vigorously 20 strokes. Press dough in bottom of pan with floured hands.
- Cook and stir sausage in skillet until brown.
- Drain.
- Mix sausage, onions and mayo.
- Remove stems of mushrooms.
- Finely chop stems of mushrooms. Stir into sausage mixture.
- Fill mushroom caps with sausage mixture.
- Place mushrooms in a row on the dough in the pan; sprinkle with cheese and paprika.
- Cover pan loosely with aluminum foil.
- Bake 20 minutes; remove foil.
- Bake until cheese is bubbly, 5-10 minutes.

Easy-Cheesy-Best Macaroni And Cheese

Ingredients:
- 8 oz. elbow macaroni or assorted pasta (shells, spirals and wagon wheels; 2 c.)
- 1 Tbsp. butter or margarine, soft
- 1 egg, well beaten
- 1 tsp. dry mustard
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/8 tsp. ground nutmeg
- 1 Tbsp. boiling water
- 1 c. milk
- 3 c. shredded sharp Cheddar cheese (12 oz.)
- 1/4 c. grated onion
- paprika

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350°.
- Lightly grease a 1 1/2-quart casserole dish.
- Cook macaroni or pasta in boiling water until tender, but firm to bite.
- Drain and return to saucepan.
- Stir in butter and egg.
- In large bowl, combine mustard, salt and nutmeg with the tablespoon of boiling water.
- Stir in milk, 2 1/2 cups cheese, onion and macaroni or pasta.
- Pour macaroni mixture into casserole dish.
- Top with remaining cheese and sprinkle with paprika.
- Bake for 1 hour or until well browned top crust has formed.

Granola For Breakfast

Ingredients:
- 2 tablespoons vegetable or light olive oil
- 100 milliliters maple syrup
- 3 tablespoons runny honey
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 300g rolled oats
- 50g sunflower seeds
- 50g pumpkin seeds
- 100g chopped nuts of your choice
- 20g desiccated coconut
- 50g dried cranberries

Directions:
- Preheat the oven to 150c. Mix the first 8 ingredients together in a large bowl. Spread over two baking sheets and put in the oven for 10 minutes. Remove from the oven, divide the coconut between the two and mix well. Return to the oven for a further 10 minutes, when golden remove and allow to cool. Add the cranberries, mix and put it all in an airtight jar or tin.

Peanut Butter Soup

Ingredients:
- 12 lb ground beef
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
- 1 small onion, chopped fine
- 1 stalk celery, chopped fine
- 2 carrots, diced 1/4 inch
- 2 medium potatoes, cubed
- 1 cup smooth peanut butter
- 2 boneless beef cubes
- 1 (1 lb) can tomato paste
- 12 cup peanuts
- 4 cups water
- salt and pepper

Directions:
- Brown the beef in vegetable oil.
- Add the next 4 ingredients and brown.
- Add remaining ingredients and bring to a boil.
- Reduce heat to medium low and simmer for 1/2 hour or until the potatoes are fork tender.

Sweet Potato Falafel

Ingredients:
- 2 cloves garlic, peeled
- 1/2 red onion
- 1 cup peeled and mashed cooked sweet potato (1 med/large sweet potato)
- 1 14-oz. can garbanzo beans, drained and rinsed
- 1/2 cup fresh parsley leaves
- 1/2 cup whole wheat breadcrumbs, divided
- 1 teaspoon cumin
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1 teaspoon pepper
- 1/2 teaspoon paprika

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350F. Line a sheet pan with parchment paper.
- In a food processor, pulse the onion and garlic until finely chopped. Add sweet potato, beans, parsley, 1/4 cup breadcrumbs, and spices. Pulse until a well-combined dough forms.
- Pour remaining breadcrumbs into a bowl. Scoop about 1/4 cup of dough and roll into a ball. Roll each ball in the breadcrumbs. Repeat to make about 12 balls.
- Place coated falafel balls on the lined sheet pan. Using the palm of your hand, slightly flatten each ball.
- Bake for 30 minutes, flipping once after 15 minutes.

Leftover Roast And Rice Casserole

Ingredients:
- 1 Tbsp. or more margarine
- 1 medium/small onion, chopped
- 1 can tomatoes
- 1 Tbsp. brown sugar
- 1 tsp. chili powder
- 1 tsp. dry mustard
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 2 tsp. vinegar
- 2 whole cloves
- 1 bay leaf
- cooked rice
- parsley, chopped
- cubed, cooked beef or pork

Directions:
- Melt margarine in large skillet; add onion and saute over low heat for 10 minutes.
- Stir in canned tomatoes with juice.
- Add next 8 ingredients.
- Heat to boiling; reduce heat; add cubed, cooked beef or pork.
- Simmer covered 45 minutes.
- Serve over cooked rice.
- Add parsley if desired.

Cheesy Onion Roll-Ups

Ingredients:
- 1 cup (8 oz.) sour cream
- 1 pkg. (8 oz.) cream cheese, softened
- 1/2 cup cheddar cheese, finely shredded
- 3/4 cup green onions, sliced
- 1 tbsp. lime juice
- 1 tbsp. jalapeno pepper, minced and shredded
- 1 pkg. (10 oz.) flour tortillas
- Picante sauce, to taste

Directions:
- Combine the first six ingredients in a bowl; mix well.
- Spread on one side of tortillas and roll up tightly.
- Wrap and refrigerate for at least 1 hour.
- Serve as a main course or slice into 1-inch pieces to serve as an appetizer.
- Serve with picante sauce.

Appelflappen

Ingredients:
- 175 g self raising flour
- 5 apples, peeled
- 175 g milk
- 1 egg
- 50 g sugar
- 1 teaspoon cinnamon

Directions:
- Drill the core out of the apples and cut them in four slices.
- Mix the sugar with the cinnamon and sprinkle over the apples.
- Leave the half an hour.
- Make batter out of flour, milk and egg.
- Dip the apple slices in the batter and deep fry them at 180 degrees Celsius.

Easy Cheesy Turkey Loaf

Ingredients:
- 1 lightly beaten egg or 2 egg whites
- 1/2 c. skim milk
- 1 lb. ground turkey
- salt or garlic salt to taste
- 3/4 c. rolled oats
- 1 small onion, peeled and finely chopped
- 1/2 c. shredded extra sharp American or Cheddar cheese
- 3 Tbsp. catsup

Directions:
- Combine ingredients except catsup.
- Mix lightly and place in a nonstick loaf pan.
- Spread top with catsup.
- Bake in a preheated oven at 350° for 1 hour.
- Yields 6 servings; 221 calories per serving.

Bagels Galore (Roasted Bell Peppers And Onions) Recipe

Ingredients:
- 2 x Plain bagels, cut in half
- 1 x Red bell pepper
- 2 1/2 x Inch thick slices of red Onion If the onion is Small, make which 4 pcs Black pepper Non-fat cream cheese (optional, I like it with And without)

Directions:
- Cut red bell pepper lengthwise into four pcs, clean out, and place on piece of aluminum foil into toaster oven together with the onions.
- At 400F bake for about 20 min, or possibly till bell pepper is soft and skin bliste ring.
- Take out peppers and put bagel halfs into toaster oven.
- Remove skins from red peppers.
- By the time you are done, the bagels are toasted .
- Arrange bagels open-faced on plate.
- Put onions on two of the halfs.
- Put a bit of cream cheese and 2 pcs of roasted bell peppers on the other two .
- Sprinkle black pepper onto the bell peppers.
- Eat while still warm.

Puppy Chow

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. butter
- 1/2 c. creamy peanut butter
- 1 c. chocolate chips
- 7 c. Rice Chex cereal
- 3 c. powdered sugar

Directions:
- Melt butter, peanut butter and chocolate chips in microwave for 2 minutes. Put cereal in a bowl and pour chocolate over it. Mix well. Put powdered sugar in a brown paper bag.
- Pour Chex mixture into bag and shake up. Then eat.

Rachel'S Fruit Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 c. Brazil nuts
- 2 c. walnuts
- 1 c. pecans
- 1 lb. pitted dates, cut in half
- 1 (8 oz.) jar maraschino cherries, drained
- 3/4 c. flour
- 3/4 c. sugar
- 1/2 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 3 eggs, well beaten

Directions:
- Chop nuts.
- Place all nuts, drained cherries and dates in a large bowl.
- Sift flour, baking powder, salt and sugar together. Coat the fruit and nuts with dry ingredients.
- Add vanilla to eggs and pour over coated fruit and nuts; mix well.

Taco Cups

Ingredients:
- 1 lb Ground beef
- 1/2 Onion, diced
- 1 as needed Shredded sharp cheddar
- 12 Egg roll wrappers
- 1 as needed BBQ sauce
- 1 as needed Medium taco sauce
- 1 as needed Salt and pepper
- 1 tbsp Paprika
- 1 tbsp Chili powder
- 1 tsp Garlic powder
- 1 tsp Onion powder

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350
- Brown ground beef with salt, pepper, onion powder, garlic powder, paprika, chili powder and diced onions
- Squeeze BBQ sauce into cooked meat.
- I do once around the pan
- Spray muffin tin with non-stick cooking spray
- Place one egg roll wrapper in each muffin slot.
- You can leave whole or fold in half
- Spoon beef evenly into each cup
- Put about a teaspoon of taco sauce on top of each
- Sprinkle on as much cheddar cheese as desired
- Bake for 8-10 minutes until golden brown
- Makes 12 taco cups

Sriracha Cocktail Sauce

Ingredients:
- 12 cup ketchup
- 2 tablespoons sriracha sauce
- 1 teaspoon wasabi paste
- 12 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce
- 1 teaspoon lemon juice
- salt and pepper

Directions:
- In a medium bowl combine all ingredients.Season to taste and serve chilled.Store the cocktail sauce in a airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.
- It can also be frozen for later use.

Punch Bowl Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 large Cool Whip
- 1 (16 oz.) sour cream
- 1 box powdered sugar
- 1 can evaporated milk
- 3 boxes strawberries (milk carton)
- strawberry glaze (topping)
- 2 (8 oz.) angel food cakes

Directions:
- Mix first 6 ingredients together.
- Tear cake into small pieces and fold in with other ingredients lightly.

Lighter, But Scrumptious Oatmeal Raisin Muffins :)

Ingredients:
- 1 cup oats
- 1 cup skim milk
- 1/2 cup all-purpose flour
- 1/2 cup wheat flour
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 1 teaspoon baking soda
- 1 dash salt
- 1 teaspoon cinnamon (optional)
- 1 eggs or 2 egg whites
- 1/2 cup sugar
- 1/2 cup applesauce
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1/2 - 2/3 cup raisins

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit.
- Spray 12 cup muffin pan.
- Combine oats and milk in a small bowl, let stand.
- Sift together the flours and all dry ingredients.
- Mix together the egg, sugar, applesauce, and vanilla.
- Mix the oats and milk mixture into the egg mixture.
- Fold in the dry ingredients.
- Fold in raisins.
- Transfer into prepared pan.
- Bake 15 to 20 minutes for muffin tin.
- Take out, ENJOY!

Asian Mini Chicken Loaves

Ingredients:
- 1 lb ground chicken or 1 lb turkey
- 2 green onions, chopped
- 1 clove garlic, minced
- 2 tablespoons soy sauce
- 14 cup chili sauce or 14 cup ketchup
- 2 tablespoons fine dry breadcrumbs
- 1 teaspoon gingerroot
- 14 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes or 14 teaspoon black pepper
- 4 hard-boiled eggs

Directions:
- Combine ground chicken, green onions, garlic, chili sauce, soy sauce, bread crumbs ginger root and pepper flakes and mix well.
- Divide into four portions.
- Shape chicken mixture around eggs until completely enclosed.
- Place on greased baking sheet and bake at 400 degrees F for aboaut 20 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink inside.

Lemon-Orange-Ginger Vinaigrette

Ingredients:
- 1 whole Lemon (washed, Zest And Juice)
- 1 whole Valencia Orange (washed, Zest And Juice)
- 1 Tablespoon Fresh Grated Ginger Root
- 1/2 teaspoons Onion Powder
- 1/2 teaspoons Sea Salt
- 3/4 teaspoons Black Pepper
- 1 teaspoon Canola Oil
- 1-1/2 teaspoon Balsamic Vinegar

Directions:
- Add all ingredients into a bowl and whisk well to incorporate. Place in an airtight jar or container and refrigerate until ready to use. Shake well before serving. Enjoy!

Shoe Peg Corn Casserole

Ingredients:
- 1 (12 oz.) can Shoe Peg corn, drained
- 1/2 c. chopped onion
- 1 (10 3/4 oz.) can cream of celery soup
- 1/2 c. sour cream
- 1/2 c. slivered almonds
- 1/2 c. grated cheese
- 1 roll Ritz crackers
- 1 stick oleo, melted

Directions:
- Combine corn, onion, cheese, soups and sour cream.
- Place in a greased 8 1/4 x 4 1/4-inch or 9 x 5-inch casserole dish.
- Mix together crackers, almonds and melted margarine.
- Spread topping over vegetable mix.
- Bake at 350° for 35 minutes.
- May be made ahead and refrigerated.

Easy Breakfast Casserole

Ingredients:
- 6 slices white bread
- 1 lb. pork sausage
- 1 1/2 c. shredded Cheddar cheese
- 2 c. milk
- 6 eggs
- 1/2 tsp. salt

Directions:
- Cut bread in small cubes.
- Place in bottom of a 9 x 13-inch baking dish.
- Cook sausage; drain and crumble over bread. Sprinkle cheese on sausage.
- Beat eggs with milk, salt and pepper to taste.
- Pour over cheese.
- Cover and place in refrigerator overnight.
- Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 30 to 45 minutes or until brown.

No Bake Cookies #2

Ingredients:
- 2 c. sugar
- 1/4 c. cocoa
- 1/2 stick butter
- 1/2 c. milk
- 1/2 c. peanut butter
- 2 c. oats
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- dash of salt

Directions:
- Prepare wax paper or foil on table.
- In a pot, mix 2 cups sugar, cocoa, butter and milk.
- Bring to a boil and boil 1 1/2 minutes (no longer, no less), then cut fire off and add 1/2 cup peanut butter, oats, vanilla and dash of salt.
- Sift and spoon out on wax paper or foil.

Copper Penny Carrots

Ingredients:
- 4 lb. carrots or 4 cans
- 1 bell pepper
- 1 onion
- 1 c. celery
- 1 can tomato soup
- 1/2 c. vinegar
- 1/2 c. oil
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 1 tsp. woo
- 1 tsp. mustard
- salt and pepper

Directions:
- Mix carrots, bell pepper, onion and celery.
- Mix tomato soup, vinegar, oil, sugar, salt, pepper, woo and mustard.
- Pour over first 4 ingredients. Marinate overnight.

Eight Layer Jello Salad

Ingredients:
- 2 (3 oz.) pkg. black cherry or blackberry Jell-O
- 2 (3 oz.) pkg. cherry or raspberry Jell-O
- 2 (3 oz.) pkg. lemon or orange Jell-O
- 2 (3 oz.) pkg. lime Jell-O
- 2 (13 oz.) cans evaporated milk

Directions:
- Use a 9 x 13-inch glass dish, if possible, as this is a pretty salad.
- Add 1 1/2 cups of boiling water to first package of Jell-O (black cherry or blackberry).
- Pour into dish to set.

Brown Rice

Ingredients:
- 1/2 stick margarine
- 1 can onion soup
- 1 can beef consomme soup
- 1 c. long grain rice

Directions:
- Melt margarine in glass casserole dish.
- Stir in soups and rice.
- Cover; bake for 1 hour at 325°.
- Serves 4 to 6.

Kim'S Delight

Ingredients:
- 1 graham cracker crust pie shell
- 1 c. sugar
- 1 (8 oz.) cream cheese
- 1 medium size Cool Whip
- 1 small can crushed pineapple, drained
- 1 c. pecans or almonds

Directions:
- Mix the sugar and cream cheese fully. Combine pecans, Cool Whip and pineapple to mixture. Fill the pie crust with the filling. Put in the refrigerator about 30 minutes. Serve and enjoy.

Instructions For Meyer Lemon Cheesecake 

Ingredients:
- See the recipe

Directions:
- 1. Prepare the cheesecake. Preheat oven to 325. Place a 13x9 pan on the lower third rack of oven and fill it halfway with water. place another rack over it. Spray a 9 in spring form pan with nonstick spray
- 2. ina large bowl blen creamcheese until smooth. Mix in sugar and salt and blend 2 minutes. Add eggs one at a time. Mix in sour cream, whipping cream and vanilla. bake 40-45 minutes.place pan in freezer and freeze 5 hr
- 3. Cake layers: Oven 350, spray 2 9 in pans. Whisk the flour, sugar, baking powder and salt. Add eggs, buttermilk, butter shortening, zest and juice. combine on low, 1 min.Scrape sides, and beat on high 2 min. Add soda and vanilla, beat on low 30 sec. Divide batter, bake 25 to 3o mins.

Lebkucken

Ingredients:
- 3 c. white sugar
- 1 1/2 c. oleo
- 2 lb. mixed peel (candied fruit)
- 1 Tbsp. cloves
- 1 Tbsp. baking soda, dissolved in 1 c. hot water
- flour (enough to handle)
- 2 c. strained honey
- 1 c. walnut meats
- 3 eggs
- 1 Tbsp. cinnamon

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients together. Let stand 4 days. Roll out. Cut with cookie cutters. Brush with egg white. Decorate with extra candied peel. Bake in 350° oven until light brown.

Family Biscuits

Ingredients:
- 2 c. flour
- 3 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 5 Tbsp. butter Crisco
- Approximately 2/3 c. milk

Directions:
- Mix ingredients. (I use my hands.)
- Knead on a floured board, roll out and cut with a biscuit cutter or a glass.
- Bake at 425°.

Homemade Doughnuts

Ingredients:
- 1 pkg. refrigerator biscuits
- 1/2 c. vegetable oil
- 1/2 c. table sugar
- 1 tsp. cinnamon

Directions:
- Heat the oil in a large skillet.
- Open the biscuit container and separate the biscuits.
- Tear a hole in the center of each one. Place the biscuits in the hot oil for 2 minutes.
- When the underside is browned, turn them over with a slotted spoon.
- Brown the other side for 2 minutes.
- Remove the doughnuts from the skillet and drain them on a paper towel.
- (Oil that remains may be recycled by pouring back into the original container once it has cooled off.) Put the sugar and cinnamon in a large plastic bag. Add 2 cooked doughnuts into the bag and shake until they are coated.
- Repeat until all doughnuts have been covered.

Aunt Edie Vandale'S Raisin Pie

Ingredients:
- 2 c. raisins
- 2 c. water
- 1/2 c. brown sugar, packed
- 2 Tbsp. cornstarch
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 1/8 tsp. salt
- 1 Tbsp. lemon juice
- 1 Tbsp. butter
- dough for 2 crust pie

Directions:
- Boil raisins in 1 3/4 cups water for 5 minutes.
- Combine brown sugar, cornstarch, cinnamon and salt.
- Moisten with remaining 1/2 cup water.
- Add to raisins and stir until mixture boils.
- Remove from heat.
- Add lemon and butter.
- Pour into unbaked 9-inch shell. Top with crust. Bake at 425° for 25 minutes.

Tomato-Rosemary Pan Sauce

Ingredients:
- 1/4 cup low-sodium canned chicken broth
- 1/4 cup dry vermouth or dry white wine
- 4 canned tomatoes, chopped
- 1/2 teaspoon minced fresh rosemary
- 1 tablespoon butter

Directions:
- Combine broth, vermouth, tomatoes and rosemary in a measuring cup.
- Pour contents of the measuring cup into a heated skillet; boil until liquid is reduced by about half.
- Tilt skillet so that the liquid is at one side of the pan, then whisk in butter until sauce is smooth.
- Spoon sauce over cooked steaks and serve immediately.

Raspberry Cream Pie

Ingredients:
- 1 Tbsp. sugar
- 2 Tbsp. flour
- pie shell, unbaked
- 1 egg
- 1 Tbsp. cornstarch
- 3/4 c. sugar
- 3/4 c. milk
- 1 pt. raspberries
- Cool Whip

Directions:
- Mix and put 1 tablespoon sugar and flour into bottom of unbaked pie shell.
- Beat egg and add cornstarch, 3/4 cup sugar and milk.
- Put into shell.
- Drop raspberries on top.
- Bake at 400° for 40 minutes.
- Top with Cool Whip.

Date Sticks

Ingredients:
- 1 c. chopped nuts
- 1 c. sugar
- 2 eggs
- 2 tsp. baking powder
- 1 c. chopped dates
- 1 c. flour
- pinch of salt
- 1 tsp. vanilla

Directions:
- Sift together flour, sugar, baking powder and salt.
- Add 2 eggs and beat well.
- Add nuts, dates and vanilla.
- Spread on a well-greased and floured pan and bake 25 minutes at 350°. Cut in sticks and roll in powdered sugar.
- Makes about 36 sticks.

Reuben Meatloaf

Ingredients:
- 1 egg, beaten
- 1 onion, chopped
- 1/4 cup sweet pickle relish
- 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce
- 1 cup soft rye breadcrumbs
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon pepper
- 2 lbs ground beef
- 1/4 cup thousand island dressing
- 1 cup sauerkraut, drained
- 1 cup shredded swiss cheese

Directions:
- In a large bowl, combine first seven ingredients--mix well.
- Crumble beef over mixture. On foil, pat meat mixture into 14 x 10 rectangle.
- Spread with dressing, top with sauerkraut and 1/2 cup of the swiss cheese.
- Roll up into a log lengthwise--seal the seams.
- Place into a large baking pan.
- Bake at 350 degrees for 50-55 minutes--near end of baking top with remaining 1/2 cup of swiss cheese and bake until melted.

Coq Au Vin

Ingredients:
- 8 medium skinless, boneless, chicken breast halves, cut into 1 inch pieces
- 1/2 c. chopped onion
- 3 c. sliced mushrooms
- 2 Tbsp. margarine or butter
- 1/4 c. dry white wine
- 1/2 tsp. dried tarragon, crushed
- 1/2 tsp. white pepper
- 1/8 tsp. salt
- 8 lasagna noodles, cooked and drained
- 8 oz. cream cheese, cut up
- 1/2 c. sour cream
- 2 Tbsp. all-purpose flour
- 1/2 c. half-and-half
- 4 oz. Gruyere cheese, shredded
- 4 oz. Muenster cheese, shredded
- 3 Tbsp. slivered almonds

Directions:
- In large skillet, cook onion and mushrooms in butter over medium-high heat for 4 to 5 minutes or until tender.
- Add chicken, wine, tarragon, pepper, and salt.
- Bring just to boiling; reduce heat.
- Cover and simmer for 5 minutes.
- Remove from heat.

Easy Homemade Mustard

Ingredients:
- 2 eggs
- 5 tablespoons white vinegar
- 3 tablespoons evaporated milk, or more as needed
- 8 teaspoons ground yellow mustard
- 2 teaspoons all-purpose flour
- 2 teaspoons white sugar
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1 teaspoon margarine

Directions:
- Beat eggs, vinegar, evaporated milk, ground yellow mustard, flour, sugar, salt, and margarine together in a small pot until smooth; cook over low heat until simmering and slightly thickened, about 5 minutes. Cool to room temperature before storing in refrigerator.

Summertime Spaghetti Squash

Ingredients:
- 1 (3- to 3 1/2-pound) spaghetti squash
- 1/2 cup (packed) fresh basil leaves
- 2 tablespoons freshly grated Parmesan or Romano cheese
- 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil
- 1/4 cup pine nuts, toasted
- 1 garlic clove, minced
- Salt and freshly ground black pepper

Directions:
- Prick the squash in 3 or 4 places with a fork, put it on a plate, and loosely cover it with plastic wrap.
- Microwave at full power for 9 minutes.
- Let the squash stand, still covered, for another 5 minutes.
- Meanwhile, make the pesto.
- Put the basil, cheese, oil, pine nuts, garlic, and salt and pepper to taste in a food processor and pulse until well combined.
- Halve the squash and scrape out the seeds.
- Using a fork, scoop the pulp into a large bowl.
- Add pesto to taste and toss to combine.

Roast Beef With Blue Cheese Cream

Ingredients:
- 1 whole beef tenderloin (5-6 pounds)
- 1 cup Dijon mustard
- salt and fresh pepper
- 1/2 cup mayonnaise
- 1/2 cup sour cream
- 4 -5 teaspoons horseradish
- 4 -5 ounces gorgonzola, crumbled
- 1/2 lemon, juice of
- 1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce
- salt and pepper

Directions:
- Trim the tenderloin. Tie if desired. Rub with salt and pepper and mustard well.
- Put into a roaster. Preheat oven to 500 degrees.
- Bake for 35 minutes, or until medium-rare.
- For dressing, combine all ingredients. Make two hours before serving, keep at room temperature.
- Slice fillet after a short rest and accompany with sauce.

Overnight Fruit Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 c. seedless grapes, halved
- 1 c. cherries, pitted
- 6 marshmallows, cut in eighths
- 1/8 lb. cashew nuts, chopped
- 1 c. diced pineapple
- 1 egg
- 1 Tbsp. sugar
- 2 Tbsp. cream
- juice of 1/2 lemon
- 1/2 c. heavy cream, whipped

Directions:
- Combine fruits, marshmallows and nuts. Beat egg until light and foamy. Add sugar gradually.
- Blend in light cream and lemon juice.
- Place egg mixture in a saucepan and cook over low heat until the sauce is smooth and thickened, stirring constantly. Cool.
- Fold in whipped cream.
- Pour over combined fruit and mix lightly.
- Chill overnight in refrigerator.
- Makes about 6 servings.

The Realtor'S Baked Sweet Potato Chips

Ingredients:
- 1 sweet potato
- olive oil, spray
- sea salt
- pepper

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350.
- Peel the sweet potato and slice it with a vegetable peeler into thin strips.
- Lay them out on a parchment lined tray. Keep them seperate and not touching in a single layer.
- Spray them lightly with olive oil.
- Sprinkle with sea salt and pepper.
- Bake them about 20 minutes or until browned and crispy. Turn the tray about halfway through.
- Keep your eye on them and adjust the cooking time to acheive the desired crispy texture.
- Cool slightly and enjoy!

Chocolate Coconut Crunchers

Ingredients:
- 1 pkg. German chocolate cake mix
- 1 c. butter, softened
- 2 eggs
- 1 c. coconut
- 1 c. chopped walnuts
- 1 c. crushed corn flakes or other cereal flakes
- 1 c. rolled oats
- 1 c. semi-sweet chocolate chips
- 1 to 2 Tbsp. sugar

Directions:
- Heat oven to 350°.
- In large bowl, combine cake mix, butter and eggs; mix well. Add coconut, walnuts, corn flakes, rolled oats and chocolate chips; mix well. Drop dough by rounded teaspoonfuls 2-inches apart onto ungreased cookie sheets. Flatten with glass dipped in sugar. Bake 8 to 10 minutes or until set. Cool 1 minute; remove from cookie sheet. Makes 4 to 5 dozen.

My Grandmother's Wrapped Burdock

Ingredients:
- 2 Burdock root
- 20 slice Thinly sliced pork
- 1 tbsp Soy sauce
- 1/3 tsp Dashi stock granules
- 1 tbsp Mirin
- 50 ml Sake
- 3 tbsp Soy sauce
- 3 tbsp Mirin
- 1 tbsp Sugar

Directions:
- Scrape off the skin of the burdock root with a knife.
- If the burdock is quite thick, cut it vertically into two.
- If the burdock is rather thin, leave as is.
- Cut into 5 cm lengths.
- Put the Step 1 burdock into a pot and fill with water until just covered.
- Add the ingredients and turn on the heat.
- Boil until the burdock is soft.
- When the burdock has become soft, remove from the water and wrap with the pork.
- If the pork is long, cut it in half.
- (I used shabu shabu type pork in the photo and one slice was just right.)
- Fry Step 3 in a frying pan with the seam end on the bottom.
- When the meat begins color, add the ingredients and simmer until the liquid evaporates.

Broccoli Quiche

Ingredients:
- 1 (9-inch) pie crust (unbaked)
- 5 oz. can evaporated milk
- 4 medium-size eggs
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1 1/2 c. broccoli, cut fine
- 1 c. cubed ham or turkey ham
- 1 c. shredded Cheddar cheese

Directions:
- Cook broccoli 3 to 4 minutes; drain.
- Beat eggs and milk together.
- Mix broccoli and ham; place in crust.
- Pour egg mixture over broccoli.
- Sprinkle cheese on top.
- Bake at 400° for 10 minutes, then bake at 325° for 20 to 30 minutes more.

Christmas Fruit Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 box Duncan Hines spice cake mix
- 1/4 c. oil
- 1 egg
- 1 lb. candied cherries, cut up fine
- 1 lb. candied pineapple, cut up fine
- 1 box dates, chopped
- 1 pt. figs, cut up and juice if needed
- 1 c. nuts (more if needed)

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350°.
- Mix well all ingredients together.
- Use paper liners in tiny muffin pans.
- Bake 18 minutes.
- May be frozen in sealed containers.

Fast Fruity Strawberry Delight

Ingredients:
- 3/4 cup boiling water
- 1 pkg. (3 oz.) JELL-O Strawberry Flavor Gelatin
- 2 cups frozen strawberries
- 3/4 cup thawed COOL WHIP Whipped Topping

Directions:
- Add boiling water to gelatin mix in medium bowl; stir 2 min.
- until completely dissolved.
- Add strawberries; stir until gelatin starts to thicken.
- Pour 1/2 cup gelatin mixture into separate medium bowl.
- Add COOL WHIP; whisk just until blended.
- Spoon into dessert cups; top with remaining gelatin mixture.
- Refrigerate 15 min.
- or until firm.

Smoked Salmon Spread

Ingredients:
- 1 can salmon (Prelate is best)
- 2 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese
- 1/2 small onion
- 3 drops liquid smoke
- 3 shakes each: paprika and garlic powder
- 1/2 lemon
- 1 tsp. dill weed
- fresh parsley

Directions:
- Remove bone and skin from salmon.
- Put onion and juice of 1/4 to 1/2 lemon in blender.
- Mix all ingredients.
- Sprinkle crushed pecans on top.
- Serve with parsley.

Refrigerator White Rolls

Ingredients:
- 1 pkg. dry yeast
- 1/4 c. warm water
- 3/4 c. milk, scalded
- 1/4 c. shortening
- 1/4 c. sugar
- 1 tsp. salt
- 3 c. flour
- 1 egg, beaten

Directions:
- Soften yeast in warm water.
- Combine milk, shortening, sugar and salt.
- Cool to lukewarm.
- Add 1 cup of the flour.
- Beat well. Beat in yeast mixture and the egg.
- Add remaining flour; mix well.
- Place in greased bowl, turning dough once.
- Cover.
- Store in refrigerator at least 2 hours or until needed.
- About 1 1/2 to 2 hours before serving time, shape dough on well-floured surface. Let rise in warm place until doubled (about 1 1/4 hours).
- Bake at 400° for 12 to 15 minutes.
- Makes 16 rolls.

Wassail - Crowd Size(Serve Immediately.  Serves 50 To 75 Cups.)  

Ingredients:
- 2 gal. apple cider
- 2 qt. orange juice
- 2 c. brown sugar
- 4 sticks cinnamon
- 4 tsp. whole cloves
- 4 tsp. whole allspice
- dash of nutmeg

Directions:
- Pour apple cider and orange juice into a large coffee pot. Mix remaining ingredients and place in perk basket.
- Let coffee pot perk as it would for coffee.
- You may half ingredients for home 30-cup coffee maker.

Orange Rice Medley

Ingredients:
- 1/2 cup chopped onion
