- 1/2 cup chopped green pepper
- 1/2 cup chopped sweet red pepper
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 cup uncooked long grain rice
- 1-1/2 cups chicken broth
- 1/2 cup orange juice
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- Dash pepper
- 1 can (11 ounces) mandarin oranges, drained and coarsely chopped

Directions:
- In a saucepan over medium heat, saute onion and peppers in oil until tender. Add rice; stir until lightly browned. Add broth, orange juice, salt and pepper; bring to a boil. Reduce heat; cover and simmer for 15-20 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Stir in oranges.

Easy Spiced Cookies

Ingredients:
- 1 (19 ounce) box spice cake mix (Betty Crocker Super Moist)
- 1/2 cup oil
- 2 large eggs
- 1 teaspoon cinnamon
- 1/2 teaspoon nutmeg
- 1/2 teaspoon ginger
- cinnamon-sugar mixture (optional)

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350°.
- Stir (by hand) the first 6 ingredients in a large bowl until dough forms.
- Shape dough into 1" balls.
- Roll balls in cinnamon and sugar and place 2 inches apart on ungreased cookie sheets.
- Bake for 8-10 minutes or until center is JUST SET.
- Remove from pans after a minute or so and cool on wire racks.

Cream Of Broccoli Soup

Ingredients:
- 1 bunch broccoli (about 1 1/2 lb.)
- 4 Tbsp. butter or margarine
- 1 medium/large onion, chopped (1/2 c.)
- 1 clove garlic, minced
- 1/4 to 1/3 c. chopped celery
- 1 can chicken broth (1 1/2 c.)
- 2 Tbsp. chopped parsley
- 1/4 tsp. white pepper
- 1 1/2 c. milk
- 1 tsp. lemon juice
- 1/2 c. heavy cream

Directions:
- Wash broccoli; cut off and discard heavy stems. Slice and set aside 1 cup flowerets.
- Chop remaining broccoli which will make about 4 cups. Set aside.
- Melt butter in a large pan or Dutch oven.
- Saute onion, garlic and celery in butter about 2 minutes. Add chopped broccoli, chicken broth, parsley and white pepper. Cook, covered, about 10 minutes or until broccoli is just tender. Puree in blender with milk until smooth. Return to cooking pan. Stir in lemon juice and whisk in heavy cream. Cook flowerets until crisp-tender, about 3 minutes. Add to soup; taste. Add salt if necessary.
- Heat.

Hong Kong Pork Chops

Ingredients:
- 6 pork chops
- 2 Tbsp. salad oil
- 1 onion, thinly sliced
- 1/4 c. soy sauce
- 1/4 c. sherry (optional)
- 2 Tbsp. lemon juice
- 2 small cans mushrooms and liquid
- 1/4 tsp. ground ginger
- 1/4 tsp. garlic powder
- 1/2 c. sliced celery
- 1/2 green pepper, chopped

Directions:
- Season chops; brown in oil.
- Cover with onion slices.
- Combine soy sauce, sherry, lemon juice, mushrooms, ginger and garlic powder.
- Pour over chops.
- Bake, covered, for 35 minutes in a 350° oven.
- Add remaining ingredients.
- Bake, uncovered, 15 more minutes.
- Serve with rice or mashed potatoes.

Sweet-and-Sour Cherries with Bay Leaves

Ingredients:
- 1/2 pound sour cherries
- 20 black peppercorns, crushed
- 2 bay leaves
- 1/2 cup white-wine vinegar
- 1/2 cup sugar

Directions:
- Wash the cherries and lay them on a dry cloth.
- Snip off the nubby ends of the stems with scissors.
- Using a needle, prick each cherry two or three times and drop it into a one-pint canning jar.
- Toss in the crushed peppercorns and tuck the bay leaves among the cherries.
- Bring the vinegar, sugar and 1/3 cup water to a boil in a small pan, stirring to dissolve the sugar.
- Cover the cherries with the liquid, close the jar and let cool before refrigerating.
- The cherries will be ready to eat in two or three days.
- Serve with chicken-liver mousse, duck, salami or other charcuterie.

Grammy Dorothys Brownies

Ingredients:
- 12 cup shortening
- 1 cup granulated sugar
- 2 large eggs, beaten
- 2 ounces unsweetened chocolate, melted
- 34 cup sifted cake flour
- 14 teaspoon baking powder
- 14 teaspoon salt
- 34 cup chopped nuts

Directions:
- Work shortening with spoon until fluffy and creamy.
- Gradually add sugar, while continually working with spoon until light.
- Add eggs and the melted chocolate.
- Mix and sift the flour, baking powder and salt, and add, along with the nuts.
- Mix well, and turn into a greased 8x8 square pan.
- Bake at 350 for 30-35 minutes.

Potato Sausage Supper

Ingredients:
- 4 medium potatoes, peeled and sliced
- 1 pound smoked kielbasa or Polish sausage, cut into 1/2-inch slices
- 2 medium onions, sliced and separated into rings
- 1 can (10-3/4 ounces) condensed cheddar cheese soup, undiluted
- 1 can (10-3/4 ounces) condensed cream of celery soup, undiluted
- 1 package (10 ounces) frozen peas, thawed

Directions:
- In a greased 5-qt. slow cooker; layer a third of each of the potatoes, sausage, onions and cheese soup. Repeat layers twice.
- Pour celery soup over the top. Cook, covered, on low until potatoes are tender, 5-6 hours. Add peas and cook 30 minutes longer.

Sugar Cookies For Cut-Outs

Ingredients:
- 2/3 c. butter
- 1 1/4 c. sugar
- 2 eggs
- 1 Tbsp. milk
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 3 c. flour
- 2 tsp. baking powder
- 1 tsp. salt

Directions:
- Cream together the butter, sugar, eggs, milk and vanilla. Combine the flour, baking powder and salt.
- Add to creamed mixture. Mix well.
- Chill batter at least 3 hours.
- Preheat oven to 375°. Roll out, cut and decorate as desired.
- Bake on ungreased cookie sheet 8 to 10 minutes.

The Best Chip Dip!

Ingredients:
- 8 oz. soft cream cheese
- 1 jar dried beef
- 4 scallions, diced

Directions:
- Make this dip a day before serving to let the flavors blend well.
- Shred dried beef.
- Mix cream cheese with shredded dried beef and diced scallions.
- Refrigerate.

Apple Fritters

Ingredients:
- 2 large eggs
- 2 teaspoons granulated sugar
- 23 cup milk
- 1 teaspoon vegetable oil
- 1 teaspoon lemon juice
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 14 teaspoon salt
- 5 -6 apples, peeled,cored and sliced thin

Directions:
- Beat eggs in a large bowl.
- Beat in sugar, milk, oil and lemon juice.
- In a small bowl, combine flour, baking powder and salt.
- Stir dry ingredients into batter.
- Refrigerate batter for one hour.
- Add apple slices to batter.
- Heat oil for deep frying to 370, preheat oven to 250.
- Drop large tablespoons of batter into hot oil and fry until golden.
- Drain on paper towels.
- Keep fritters warm on a rack on a cookie sheet in oven.
- Serve with maple syrup drizzled over top.

Ginger Simple Syrup 

Ingredients:
- 1 cup sugar
- 1 cup water
- 1 piece (about 10 inches long and 4 ounces; or use several small pieces) fresh ginger, peeled and cut into very thin rounds

Directions:
- Bring the sugar and water to a boil in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat, stirring to dissolve sugar. Add ginger; bring to a simmer. Remove from heat, and let steep 30 minutes. Pour syrup through a fine sieve into an airtight container; discard ginger. Refrigerate up to 1 month.

Beef On Noodles Or Rice

Ingredients:
- stir-fry beef or stew meat, cut in small pieces
- 1 tsp. cooking oil
- 3 c. hot water
- 1 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/8 tsp. pepper
- onion, chopped (optional)
- 1/2 tsp. brown bouquet sauce
- 1 beef bouillon cube
- 1 bay leaf
- 1/2 c. cold water
- 2 Tbsp. flour

Directions:
- Brown beef in Dutch oven in cooking oil.
- Add 3 cups hot water, 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/8 teaspoon pepper.
- Heat to boiling.
- Reduce heat; cover and simmer for about 20 to 30 minutes (until beef is tender).
- Add onion, bouquet sauce, bouillon cube and bay leaf.
- Cover and simmer until onion is tender (about 10 minutes).
- Shake cold water and flour in covered container; stir into beef mixture slowly.
- Heat to boiling, stirring constantly. Boil and stir 1 minute.
- Prepare noodles or rice according to package directions.
- Serve beef over the noodles or rice.

Banana Nut Bread

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 c. Wesson oil
- 2 1/2 c. sugar
- 3 eggs
- 1 1/2 c. crushed bananas
- 6 Tbsp. buttermilk
- 1 c. black walnuts
- 2 tsp. soda
- 1 tsp. salt
- 3 c. all-purpose flour

Directions:
- Mix and bake in an ungreased angel food pan for 1 hour and 20 minutes at 325°.
- Do not grease pan.

Lemon Garlic Shrimp Skewers

Ingredients:
- 2 tablespoons sea salt
- 2 tablespoons sugar
- 2 lbs peeled shrimp
- 14 cup olive oil
- 14 cup parsley
- 1 tablespoon grated lemon peel
- 3 minced garlic cloves
- fresh ground pepper, to taste

Directions:
- Mix salt and sugar and toss shrimp.
- Chill for one hour.
- Rinse and drain.
- Mix remaining ingredients with the shrimp.
- Put on skewers and grill just until pink.

Buttermilk Panna Cotta With Blueberry Sauce

Ingredients:
- 2 envelopes unflavored gelatin
- 1/2 cup cold water
- 1 1/2 cups low-fat buttermilk
- 3/4 cup fat-free sour cream
- 2/3 cup fat-free sweetened condensed milk
- 1 pint blueberries
- 1/2 cup port wine
- 3 tablespoons sugar
- 1/4 teaspoon salt

Directions:
- Sprinkle gelatin over cold water in a small saucepan; let stand 1 minute. Cook over low heat, stirring until gelatin dissolves, about 2 minutes.
- Combine gelatin mixture, buttermilk, sour cream, and sweetened condensed milk in a large bowl; stir until smooth. Pour mixture evenly into 6 (6-ounce) custard cups or ramekins. Cover and chill 1 hour or until set.
- Combine blueberries and remaining ingredients in a medium saucepan; bring to a boil. Reduce heat, and simmer 3 to 4 minutes or until slightly thick. Cover and chill.
- To serve, unmold custard cups onto individual dessert dishes. Top with blueberry sauce.

Minestrone (Meatless)(Low In Fat, Crock-Pot Recipe)  

Ingredients:
- 1 c. water
- 3 c. chicken broth
- 1 medium onion, diced
- 2 carrots, sliced
- 2 stalks celery with tops, sliced
- 1 (14 1/2 oz.) can tomatoes
- 2 tsp. salt
- 1 (10 oz.) pkg. frozen mixed vegetables
- 1/2 c. shredded cabbage
- 1 Tbsp. dried basil
- 1 clove garlic, minced
- 1/2 c. vermicelli or elbow macaroni
- 1 (16 oz.) can kidney beans
- 1 tsp. oregano
- 1 zucchini, sliced

Directions:
- Place all ingredients in crock-pot except zucchini.
- Stir to mix thoroughly.
- Cover and cook on low 10 to 16 hours (high 4 to 6 hours).
- During last hour, add zucchini.
- Turn crock-pot to high and cook 1 hour.
- Ladle into bowls and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.

Apple Kuchen Squares

Ingredients:
- Bottom
- 2 cups flour
- 2 teaspoons baking powder
- 3/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 cup shredded coconut
- 1/4 cup oatmeal
- 1 cup sugar
- 3/4 cup margarine, melted
- Filling
- 1 (20 ounce) can apple pie filling
- 1 teaspoon cinnamon
- 1/2 cup sugar
- Topping
- 1/2 cup sour cream
- 1 egg

Directions:
- Mix the dry ingredients for the bottom.
- Add the margarine and mix well.
- Press into 9x13 pan and bake 10 minutes at 325.
- Combine filling ingredients and spread evenly over bottom once its done in the oven.
- Whisk together sour cream and egg and drizzle over top of filling.
- Bake at 325 for another 20 minutes.
- Cool and cut.

Breaded Pork Chops

Ingredients:
- 4 c. soft bread crumbs
- 1 chopped onion
- 1 chopped green pepper
- 1 Tbsp. chopped parsley
- 1 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. celery salt
- 2 eggs, beaten
- 2 to 4 Tbsp. water
- 6 pork chops (about 1 1/2 lb.)

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients, except pork chops and water.
- Place the chops in a pan 9 or 10-inches in diameter.
- On top of each chop, place some of the bread mixture.
- If chops are to be baked for 3 hours at 275° then put 2 tablespoons of water in pan.
- If chops are to be baked for 4 to 5 hours at 250°, then put 4 tablespoons of water in pan.
- Cover and bake.
- Serve hot.
- Serves 6.

Herbed Dijon Roast

Ingredients:
- 12 cup Dijon mustard
- 2 tablespoons chopped flat leaf parsley
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 tablespoon meat seasoning (like Chef Paul Prudhomme's Magic Seasoning)
- 1 (3 lb) beef eye round

Directions:
- Heat oven to 350 degrees.
- In bowl, combine first 4 ingredients.
- Rub mixture over beef.
- Place beef on rack set in roasting pan.
- Roast 1-1/2 hours, or until thermometer inserted in beef reads 145 degrees for medium-rare.
- Transfer to serving plate.
- Let sit 15 minutes before slicing.

Pasta With Tomatoes, Black Olives And Capers

Ingredients:
- 1 lb spaghetti or 1 lb linguine
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 3 medium garlic cloves, minced
- 1 small onion, coarsely chopped
- 1 (16 ounce) can no-salt-added whole tomatoes, with their juice
- 1 cup about 48 medium pitted black olives, drained, rinsed and chopped into about 4 pieces each
- 3 tablespoons capers, drained and rinsed
- 1 tablespoon balsamic vinegar
- 1 tablespoon tomato paste
- 2 teaspoons sugar
- 1/2 tablespoon dried oregano

Directions:
- Prepare pasta according to package instructions.
- In a large skillet, heat olive oil and saute onions till they start to turn clear.
- Add the garlic and saute briefly. Don't let it brown.
- Add the tomatoes, breaking them up with your hands or a spoon.
- Stir in the rest of the ingredients.
- Simmer for about 5 to 10 minutes. Sauce will thicken slightly but still should have liquid.

Grilled-Vegetable Salad With Cilantro Dressing

Ingredients:
- 2 medium zucchini, sliced
- 2 medium yellow squash, sliced
- 1 medium sweet onion, sliced lenghtwise
- 1 red bell pepper, sliced lenghtwise
- 1 yellow bell pepper, sliced lengthwise
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1/4 cup olive oil
- 1/2 cup fresh cilantro leaves, loosely packed
- 3 tablespoons fresh-squeezed lime juice
- 2 teaspoons canned chipotle peppers, chopped, in adobo sauce
- 1 garlic clove, chopped
- 3/4 teaspoon salt

Directions:
- Heat the grill to high. Toss zucchini, squash, onion, bell peppers, and 1 tablespoons of the olive oil together.
- Grill veggies until crisp-tender, 3-5 minutes.
- Puree cilantro, remaining olive oil, lime juice, chipotle peppers, garlic, and salt in a food proscessor, or blender; toss with veggies.

Pancetta Tomato Bibb Lettuce With Homemade Blue Cheese Dressing

Ingredients:
- 1 head Bibb Or Butterhead Lettuce
- 6 slices Pancetta Rounds Or Pieces Of Bacon
- 1 Tablespoon Pancetta Drippings
- 8 whole Plum Tomatoes, Halved
- 1-1/2 cup Sour Cream
- 3 Tablespoons Milk
- 2 Tablespoons Apple Cider Vinegar
- 1 whole Green Onion, Chopped Fine
- 1 cup Crumbled Blue Cheese
- 1/4 cups Milk To Thin Dressing If Needed

Directions:
- Pan fry pancetta over medium heat until crisp. Crumble up pancetta. Slice tomatoes. Place several leaves of lettuce on luncheon plates. Mix remaining ingredients together well, mashing blue cheese into the dressing slightly to release flavor. Use the last 1/4 cup of milk to thin dressing to preference. Spoon dressing over leaves. Scatter tomatoes and pancetta crumbles over dressing. Enjoy!

Chicken Pizzaiola

Ingredients:
- 2 lb. chicken breasts and thighs
- 4 large baking potatoes, quartered
- 1 large onion, sliced
- 1 can peas, drained
- 4 Tbsp. Parmesan cheese
- 1 can mushrooms, drained
- 1 large can plum tomatoes
- 4 Tbsp. olive oil
- 1 tsp. oregano
- salt and pepper

Directions:
- Arrange chicken, potatoes, peas, onion and mushrooms in a roasting pan.
- Pour tomatoes over top.
- Add salt, pepper, olive oil and cheese.
- Bake in a preheated oven at 375° for 1 hour and 15 minutes.
- Serves 4.

Mrs Wilkes Savannah Red Rice

Ingredients:
- 4 slices lean bacon
- 2 medium onions, chopped
- 2 medium green bell- bell peppers, seeded and chopped
- 2 cups cooked long-grain rice
- 1 (16 ounce) can stewed tomatoes, juices included
- 1 cup tomato juice
- salt and pepper
- Tabasco sauce, to your taste

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 325 degrees f.
- in a large skillet, fry the bacon over moderate heat till almost crisp and drain on paper towels, reserving grease in the skillet.
- crumble bacon, add the onions and bell peppers to the skillet and cook, stirring, till slightly brown, about 10 minutes.
- add the rice, tomatoes, plus the their juices, and tomatoe juice, salt and pepper, and tabasco sauce and cook,stirring,5 minutes longer.
- scrape the mixture into a greases 2- quart casserole dish and bake, covered, till the rice is slightly dry about 30 minutes -- and serve with your main dish.

Poor Man'S Steak

Ingredients:
- 3 lb. hamburger
- 1 c. water
- 1 c. cracker crumbs
- 1 small can mushroom soup
- 2 Tbsp. chopped onion
- salt and pepper to taste

Directions:
- Mix together hamburger, cracker crumbs and water.
- Pat into a jelly roll pan (about 1-inch thick) and put into the refrigerator overnight to chill well.

Spicy Pizza Sub Sandwiches

Ingredients:
- 2 submarine sandwich buns
- 8 ounces Canadian bacon
- 8 ounces sliced pepperoni
- 4 ounces mozzarella cheese, thinley sliced
- 14 ounces mom's spaghetti sauce
- 4 ounces sliced jalapenos

Directions:
- Split roll and layer with cheese, meats, and sauce.
- Top with jalepenos if desired.
- Use leftover sauce for dipping.

Cottage Cheese Hotcakes 

Ingredients:
- 3 eggs, separated
- 3/4 cup cottage cheese
- 1/4 cup flour
- 1/4 teaspoon salt

Directions:
- Beat egg yolks until thick. Add cottage cheese and beat well. Stir in flour and salt. Fold in stiffly beaten egg whites.
- 
- Fry on 360 degree griddle. Make each hotcake about 3 inches in diameter.
- 
- Serve with fresh berries or jam.

Low-Fat Pumpkin Scones

Ingredients:
- 2 1/2 cups self-raising flour
- 1/2 cup sugar
- 1 tablespoon butter
- 1 cup cooked pumpkin
- 1 egg, lightly beaten
- 1 pinch salt
- 50 ml milk
- canola cooking spray

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 220°C.
- Cream butter and sugar together.
- In a large bowl, place flour and salt.
- Add the egg, pumpkin, creamed butter and sugar and milk to dry mixture and mix with a wooden spoon until just combined.
- Depending on the wetness of the mixture, you may need to add a little more milk.
- Lightly grease muffin tray with canola spray and spoon mixture into tray.
- Bake at 220C for 10-15 mins, or until tops of muffins spring back when lightly touched.

Triple Chocolate Chip Cookies

Ingredients:
- 3/4 cup white sugar
- 1 cup light brown sugar
- 1 cup butter, softened
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 2 large eggs
- 3 cups flour
- 3/4 teaspoon baking soda
- 1 cup semi-sweet chocolate chips
- 1 cup milk chocolate chips
- 1 cup white chocolate chips
- 1 cup nuts (optional)

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350F and line cookie sheets with parchment paper.
- Cream sugars and butter until light.
- Add eggs and vanilla, beat until fluffy.
- Sift dry ingredients and add to butter mixture, mixing well.
- Mix in chips and nuts, if using.
- Drop spoonfuls of batter onto cookie sheets and bake 10-12 minutes.
- Cookies should brown but remain soft.
- Cool on wire racks.
- These freeze very well.

Baked Bean Soup

Ingredients:
- 1 (1 lb. 12 oz. size) baked beans
- 6 slices cooked bacon, chopped
- 2 Tbsp. bacon drippings
- 2 Tbsp. finely chopped onion
- 1 (1 lb. size) can stewed tomatoes
- 1 Tbsp. brown sugar
- 1 Tbsp. vinegar
- 1 tsp. seasoned salt

Directions:
- Combine all ingredients in slow cooking pot.
- Cover and cook (slow) on low for 4 to 6 hours.
- Makes 5 to 6 servings.

Bean Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. can green beans
- 1 lb. can yellow beans
- 1 lb. can red kidney beans
- 1 lb. can chickpeas
- 2 cans whole mushrooms
- 1 medium chopped pepper
- 1 medium chopped onion
- 2 stalks chopped celery
- 1 c. sugar
- 1 1/2 c. vinegar
- 2/3 c. salad oil

Directions:
- Heat sugar and vinegar to boiling; remove from heat and add oil.
- Pour over ingredients.
- Best if made a day ahead.

Lime Punch

Ingredients:
- 1 pkg. lime Kool-Aid or 1 pkg. lime jello
- 2 c. sugar
- 1 qt. hot water
- 1 qt. cold water
- 1 (46 oz.) can pineapple juice
- juice of 2 lemons
- 2 qt. ginger ale

Directions:
- Dissolve jello and
- sugar in hot water.
- Add cold water, pineapple juice and lemon juice.
- When ready to serve, add ginger ale.

Allspiced Cider Recipe

Ingredients:
- 1 Tbsp. Whole allspice
- 1 x Cinnamon stick (3 inch)
- 3 c. Apple cider
- 1 c. Orange juice
- 1/2 x Lemon, sliced
- 1 tsp Honey
- 1/4 c. Brandy

Directions:
- Tie allspice in a piece of cheesecloth.
- Place in a medium saucepan along with cinnamon stick, cider, orange juice, lemon slices and honey.
- Bring to a boil.
- Reduce heat and simmer, covered, 5 min.
- Remove spice bag.
- Stir in brandy.
- Serve with a cinnamon stick in each c., if you like.
- Makes 6servings.

Dill Dip

Ingredients:
- 1 c. sour cream
- 1 c. Hellmann's mayonnaise
- 2 Tbsp. dill weed
- 2 Tbsp. minced onion
- 2 tsp. Lawry's seasoned salt

Directions:
- Mix together and use as vegetable dip.

Kim'S Chicken Pie

Ingredients:
- 1 whole boiled chicken, cooked, skinned, boned and cut up
- 1 c. chicken broth
- 1 can cream of celery soup
- 1 large onion
- 1/2 stick margarine
- 1 1/2 c. milk
- 1 c. flour
- 1 can Veg-All vegetables

Directions:
- Combine chicken, broth, soup, onion and Veg-All in casserole dish.
- Dot with margarine.
- Mix milk and flour and pour over top; bake for 45 minutes at 350°.

Fresh Berry Sauce

Ingredients:
- 1 cup chopped fresh strawberries
- 1 cup fresh raspberry
- 3 tablespoons confectioners' sugar
- 1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice

Directions:
- In food processor, combine strawberries and raspberries and process until smooth.
- Add sugar and process to blend.
- Strain sauce through fine-mesh sieve over medium bowl.
- Discard seeds.
- Stir lemon juice into sauce.
- Serve right away or refrigerate up to 3 days.

Pumpkin Gingersnap Ice Cream Pie

Ingredients:
- 1-1/2 cups crushed gingersnap cookies (about 30 cookies)
- 2 tablespoons ground walnuts
- 1 tablespoon canola oil
- 4 cups reduced-fat vanilla ice cream, softened if necessary
- 1 cup canned pumpkin pie filling
- Pumpkin pie spice

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350°. In a small bowl, mix crushed cookies and walnuts; stir in oil. Press onto bottom and up sides of an ungreased 9-in. pie plate. Bake 8-10 minutes or until set. Cool completely on a wire rack.
- In a large bowl, mix ice cream and pie filling until blended. Spread into prepared crust; sprinkle with pie spice. Freeze, covered, 8 hours or overnight.

Cinnamon Spiral Bread

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. warm water
- 1 pkg. dry yeast
- 2 c. milk
- 2 c. quick cooking oats
- 1/4 c. brown sugar, packed
- 2 Tbsp. soft shortening
- 1 Tbsp. salt
- 1 c. raisins
- 5 1/2 to 6 c. flour

Directions:
- Dissolve yeast in warm water in a mixing bowl.
- Stir in milk, oats, brown sugar, shortening, salt, raisins and half the flour. Mix with a spoon until smooth.
- Add rest of flour and mix with hands.
- Turn onto lightly floured board.
- Knead until smooth and elastic, about 5 minutes.
- Round up in a greased bowl; bring greased side up.
- Let rise until double in a warm place (1 1/2 to 2 hours).
- Divide dough into 2 parts and shape into balls.
- Roll each into a 15 x 8-inch oblong.
- Sprinkle with mixture of 1/2 cup sugar and 2 teaspoons cinnamon, setting aside 2 tablespoons of mixture.
- Roll up like jelly roll, sealing tightly at ends.

Trey'S Favorite Stir-Fry

Ingredients:
- 3 boneless chicken breasts
- 1 large onion
- 1 green pepper
- 1 can bamboo shoots
- 1 can water chestnuts
- 1 zucchini, cubed
- 1 pkg. mushrooms, sliced
- cornstarch
- soy sauce to taste
- garlic

Directions:
- Cut chicken in small strips and coat in cornstarch.
- Cut all veggies into small pieces or cubes.
- Stir-fry coated chicken in light oil until white in color.
- Add squash and green pepper, then add onion and mushrooms.
- Stir in bamboo shoots and water chestnuts.
- Add soy sauce and garlic to taste.
- Simmer for about 5 minutes.
- Serve with rice.

Easy Four Step Punch

Ingredients:
- 2 bottles 7-Up soda
- 1/2 gal. Hawaiian Punch juice
- 1 c. sugar
- slices of lemons
- slices of oranges

Directions:
- Pour 7-up soda into a large bowl or punch bowl.
- Add Hawaiian Punch juice and sugar; mix well.
- Add slices of lemons and oranges on the top.
- Add ice last.
- Makes enough for 15 to 20 people.

Kraut And Cabbage Rolls

Ingredients:
- 1 roll good sausage
- 1 medium chopped onion
- 1/4 c. chopped green pepper
- 2 eggs
- 1 c. rice (uncooked)
- 1/2 c. celery
- 8 cabbage leaves
- 2 (16 oz.) cans sauerkraut

Directions:
- Mix everything but cabbage and kraut.
- Divide in 8 portions. Place on cabbage leaves.
- Roll up.
- Secure with toothpicks.
- In a Dutch oven, place 1 can of sauerkraut and place cabbage rolls. Then other can of sauerkraut.
- Put water on top, up about 3/4. Bring to a boil; then cover and reduce heat to simmer.
- Cook about 2 hours.
- Serve with corn muffins.

Jan Hagel

Ingredients:
- 1 c. butter or margarine
- 1 c. sugar
- 2 c. flour
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 egg yolk
- beaten egg white
- 1/4 c. sugar
- chopped nuts
- 1/2 tsp. cinnamon

Directions:
- Bake at 350° for 20 minutes.

Yellow Rice And Chicken

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 c. saffron-tinted rice
- 3 chicken breasts
- 6 chicken thighs
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1 can condensed cream of chicken soup
- 1 can condensed cream of celery soup
- 1 can condensed cream of mushroom soup
- 2 1/2 c. milk
- 1 1/2 c. crushed potato chips
- 1/2 c. melted butter or margarine
- 1/8 tsp. paprika

Directions:
- Place rice in bottom of well-greased 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking pan.
- (Regular white rice may be used, but yellow rice is attractive.)
- Cut chicken breasts in halves.
- Arrange chicken pieces over rice, preferably in one layer.
- Sprinkle with salt and pepper.
- Blend the three kinds of soup together with milk.
- Pour over chicken; top with potato chips and then pour butter over all. Sprinkle with paprika.
- Bake in slow oven (325°) for 2 hours or until tender.
- Makes 8 servings.

Chocolate Oatmeal Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 c. boiling water
- 1 c. quick oatmeal
- 2/3 c. Crisco
- 6 Tbsp. cocoa
- 1 1/2 c. flour
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. baking soda
- 1 c. white sugar
- 1 c. brown sugar
- 3 eggs
- 2 tsp. vanilla

Directions:
- Stir oatmeal, cocoa and Crisco into boiling water.
- Let set 20 minutes.
- Combine flour, white and brown sugar, baking soda, salt, eggs and vanilla in large mixing bowl.
- Beat well.
- Add oatmeal mixture, mixing thoroughly.
- Grease and flour 9 x 13-inch pan.
- Pour batter into pan.
- Bake 35 to 40 minutes at 350°.

Easy Cream Cheese Cookies

Ingredients:
- 1/4 cup butter, softened
- 1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, softened
- 1 egg
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1 (18 1/4 ounce) box yellow cake mix
- 1 cup semi-sweet chocolate chips

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
- Cream butter and cream cheese in a medium sized mixing bowl with an electric mixer for about 2 minutes or until creamy.
- Add egg and vanilla extract. Blend together.
- Add cake mix and stir.
- Fold in chocolate chips.
- Form cookie mix into 1.5 inch balls and place on ungreased cookie sheet about 2 inches apart.
- Bake for approximately 10-12 minutes or until edges start to turn golden brown.

Mama Mia Cubes

Ingredients:
- 8 slices baked ham or 8 slices boiled ham
- 1 medium cantaloupe
- pretzel sticks or toothpick

Directions:
- Cut ham into 1" wide strips, and cut the cantaloupe into cubes.
- Wrap a strip of ham around each cube and secure with a toothpick.
- Chill and serve.

Crock Pot French Dip

Ingredients:
- 1 (1 1/4 ounce) package au jus sauce
- 1 (5/8 ounce) package Good Seasons Italian dressing
- 1 (14 ounce) can beef broth
- 1 (14 ounce) can water (use empty beef broth can)
- 3 -4 lbs rolled rib roast

Directions:
- Put all in crock pot and cook 6-8 hours on low.

Mexican Cornbread

Ingredients:
- 1 c. yellow cornmeal
- 1 c. butter milk
- 1 c. cream style corn
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 1 c. grated cheddar cheese
- 1 onion chopped
- 2 eggs
- 2 jalapeno peppers chopped fine
- 1/4 tsp. baking soda
- 1 tsp. salt or to taste

Directions:
- Brown ground beef and onions.
- Drain meat.
- Add all other ingredients.
- Mix well; place in 8 inch iron skillet.
- Bake at 375 degrees for one hour.

Crab Dressing for Baked Fish

Ingredients:
- 1 medium fish (your choice, our favorite is salmon)
- 2 cups cubed bread
- 12 cup butter (melted)
- 12 cup celery (chopped)
- 12 cup onion (chopped)
- 14 cup green pepper (chopped)
- 12 cup crabmeat
- 3 eggs (beaten)
- 1 teaspoon salt (or to taste)
- 1 teaspoon dry mustard
- 18 teaspoon black pepper (may add a dash of cayenne if desired)

Directions:
- In large pan melt butter and lightly saute the chopped celery,onion and green pepper.
- In large bowl mix remaining listed ingredients - add the sauteed vegetables mixing ingredients together.
- If desired salt, pepper and seasoning of choice inside and outside of the fish - place on foil.
- Stuff, cover with foil and seal edges - I like to double wrap.
- Bake 45 - 60 minutes in 400 oven.
- ( I use a touch less oven heat).

Hungry Man'S Casserole

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 lb. ground beef
- 2 tsp. salt
- 2 tsp. sugar
- 1 (16 oz.) can tomatoes
- 1 (8 oz.) can tomato sauce
- 2 cloves garlic, crushed
- pepper to taste
- 1 (8 oz.) pkg. thin noodles, cooked
- 1 c. sour cream
- 3 oz. cream cheese, softened
- 3 green onions (with tops), chopped
- grated cheese (optional)

Directions:
- Brown ground beef in skillet, stirring until crumbly.
- Pour off drippings.
- Add next 6 ingredients, mixing well.
- Cook for 10 minutes. Combine remaining ingredients except grated cheese in bowl, mixing well.
- Layer noodle mixture and ground beef mixture alternately in greased casserole until all ingredients are used. Top with cheese.
- Bake at 350° for 30 to 35 minutes.

Cornbread Casserole

Ingredients:
- 1 (8 1/2 oz) box Jiffy corn muffin mix (add 1 tsp. sugar)
- 1 egg
- 1/3 c. milk
- 12-16 oz Colby/Longhorn cheese
- 1 small jar Ragu spaghetti sauce
- 1-2 lb. hamburger
- 1 small jar of mushrooms

Directions:
- Brown meat; drain grease; mix meat, Ragu, mushrooms, and cheese (grated or cubed).
- Place in a rectangular baking dish. Pour cornbread batter over hamburger mixture.

Baked Apples

Ingredients:
- 4 large apples
- 1/4 c. brown sugar, packed
- 2 Tbsp. nuts or raisins, chopped
- 1/4 tsp. cinnamon
- 2 Tbsp. butter
- 1/4 c. water

Directions:
- Core apples leaving small plug in peel, skin 1 inch from top. Combine sugar, nuts and cinnamon.
- Fill apples with mixture. Arrange apples in microwave dish.
- Dot with butter and sprinkle with water.
- Cover with plastic wrap.
- Cook on high 7 to 9 minutes. Let stand 5 minutes.

Kosher Dill Pickles

Ingredients:
- 4 lb. small cucumbers
- 6 Tbsp. pickling salt
- 3 c. cider vinegar
- 3 c. water
- 21 peppercorns
- 7 fresh dill heads
- 14 cloves garlic

Directions:
- Wash cucumbers.
- Pack in pint jars.
- Place 3 peppercorns and 2 large garlic cloves and 1 head fresh dill in each jar.

Peach Cream Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 angel food cake (frozen)
- 1 can Eagle Brand sweetened condensed milk
- 1 c. cold water
- 1 pkg. instant vanilla pudding (3 1/2 oz.)
- 1 tsp. almond extract
- 2 c. whipping cream, whipped
- 4 c. sliced fresh peaches or 1 (20 oz.) pkg. frozen sliced peaches, thawed

Directions:
- Cut cake into 1/4-inch slices.
- Arrange half the slices on bottom of 13 x 9-inch baking dish.

Broccoli Cheese Chicken

Ingredients:
- 1 Tbsp. margarine
- 4 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves
- 1 c. Campbell's broccoli cheese soup
- 1/3 c. water or milk
- 1/8 tsp. pepper
- 2 c. broccoli

Directions:
- In skillet over medium heat in hot margarine, cook chicken for 10 minutes or until golden brown.
- Spoon off fat.
- Stir in soup, water and pepper.
- Heat to boiling.
- Add broccoli.
- Reduce heat to low; cover and simmer 10 minutes or until chicken is fork-tender.

Corned Beef Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 can corned beef, broken up
- 1 can beef consomme
- 1 c. hot water
- 1 (3 oz.) lemon jello
- 1 c. chopped celery
- 1/2 c. chopped green pepper
- 1 small onion, chopped (size of walnut)
- 3 hard-boiled eggs
- 1 c. mayonnaise

Directions:
- Blend all together.
- Put in pan and let sit in refrigerator until firm.
- Serves 12 to 15.
- Good for a luncheon.

Potatoes With Cream Sauce

Ingredients:
- 3 Tbsp. margarine
- 3 Tbsp. chopped celery
- 3 Tbsp. chopped bell pepper
- 3 Tbsp. chopped onion
- 2 Tbsp. flour
- 1/4 tsp. black pepper
- 1/4 tsp. Season-All
- 1 (16 oz.) can white, sliced potatoes
- 1 (6 oz.) can evaporated milk
- 3 slices American cheese
- 2 Tbsp. pimento (optional)

Directions:
- In a large skillet, melt margarine.
- Add and saute celery, bell pepper and onion.
- After well sauteed, add flour, black pepper and Season-All; stir well.
- Add the water from can of potatoes and can of milk; mix well.
- If too thick, add a little water.
- Add cheese and stir.
- Add sliced potatoes and pimento, if desired.
- Mix all very well.
- Pour into a baking dish and bake until bubbly.

Ladies Luncheon Chicken

Ingredients:
- 1 1/4 c. mayonnaise
- 2 Tbsp. soy sauce
- 16 oz. can light seedless grapes
- 20 oz. can pineapple chunks, drained
- 4 c. chicken, cooked and cubed
- 1 c. diced celery
- 1/2 tsp. curry powder
- 1 Tbsp. lemon juice
- 1/2 c. almonds, sliced and toasted

Directions:
- Mix mayonnaise, curry powder, soy sauce and lemon juice in small bowl.
- Drain grapes and pineapple.
- Combine chicken, celery, grapes, almonds and pineapple in large bowl.
- Add mayonnaise mixture and mix well.
- Chill several hours before serving.
- Serves 8 to 10.
- Serve with salad greens.

Beer Biscuit

Ingredients:
- 2 c. Bisquick
- 1/4 c. sugar
- 1 c. beer

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients well.
- Pour into greased muffin tins and bake at 400° until done (depends on the size of muffin tins).

Thai Dressing 

Ingredients:
- 4 cloves garlic, peeled, crushed and minced
- 1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced
- 4 inches fresh ginger, peeled and grated
- 2 Tbsp. tamarind concentrate
- 2 lemons juiced
- 4 Tbsp. coconut sugar
- 2 Tbsp, fresh chopped coriander
- 1/4 c. olive oil

Directions:
- Combine ingredients in a food processor and pulse until well combined. Serve with salad or fresh cooked vegetables.

Tex-Mex Chicken & Rice - Ww

Ingredients:
- 2 cups converted rice, uncooked, Uncle Ben's
- 28 ounces diced tomatoes, Hunt's
- 6 ounces tomato paste
- 2 14 ounces taco seasoning mix
- 1 lb boneless skinless chicken breast (cut in 1/2-inch cubes)
- 2 medium onions (chopped)
- 1 medium green bell pepper (chopped)
- 4 ounces green chilies (diced)
- 34 teaspoon garlic pepper seasoning

Directions:
- In a slow cooker mix together all ingredients except the chiles and garlic pepper.
- Cover and cook on low heat for 4 to 4 1/2 hours or until the rice is tender and the chicken is white throughout; do not overcook or the rice will be mushy.
- Stir in the chiles and garlic pepper.
- Serve at once.

Beer Bread

Ingredients:
- 1 (12 oz.) can of beer (room temperature)
- 3 c. self-rising flour
- 3 Tbsp. sugar

Directions:
- Combine all ingredients.
- Mix well and put in bread loaf pan. Bake at 350°
- for 1 hour or until done.

Chicken By Alice

Ingredients:
- 1 pkg. chicken pieces, skinned
- 1 large bottle Thousand Island Dressing
- 1 pkg. onion soup mix
- 1 medium jar apricot preserves

Directions:
- Arrange chicken in a baking dish.
- Pour dressing over the chicken.
- Mix preserves and soup mix and pour over chicken. Bake at 350° until chicken is done.

Turkey Club Sandwich

Ingredients:
- 1 Tbsp. MIRACLE WHIP Dressing
- 1 tsp. OSCAR MAYER Real Bacon Bits
- 2 slices multi-grain bread
- 1 lettuce leaf
- 6 slices OSCAR MAYER Deli Fresh Smoked Turkey Breast
- 2 thin tomato slices King Sooper's 1 lb For $0.99 thru 02/09
- 1 KRAFT Singles

Directions:
- Mix dressing and bacon; spread onto 1 bread slice.
- Fill bread slices with remaining ingredients.

Pancetta Crusted Mini Quiche

Ingredients:
- 24 slices Pancetta, Thinly Sliced
- 1/2 cups Grated Gruyere (or Fontina) Cheese
- 13 cups Minced Chives
- 1 Egg Yolk
- 2 Eggs
- 1/2 cups Cream
- 1/2 cups Whole Milk
- 1/2 teaspoons Freshly Ground Black Pepper
- 1/4 teaspoons Kosher Salt

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Grease a mini muffin pan really well with butter or olive oil.
- Put 1 slice of pancetta in each muffin cup, lightly pushing and folding to make it fit.
- Place 1 teaspoon or so of cheese in each pancetta cup.
- Add a big sprinkle of chives to each cup.
- In a medium-sized bowl (I like the Pyrex measuring cup for this), combine the remaining ingredients and whisk until well mixed.
- Slowly pour the egg mixture into a pancetta cup until it comes nearly to the top of the tin.
- Repeat with the remaining pancetta cups.
- Bake for 30 minutes until browned and puffy.
- Allow to cool for 2 minutes before removing from the pan.
- Serve hot, cold, or at room temperature.

Welliver'S Cream Of Onion Soup

Ingredients:
- 1/4 cup butter or 1/4 cup margarine
- 1 cup onion, chopped
- 1/4 cup green onion, thinly sliced
- 1/4 cup flour
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon pepper
- 4 cups milk
- 1/2 cup chicken broth
- 1 1/2 cups half-and-half or 1 1/2 cups light cream
- crouton (optional)

Directions:
- In a 3-quart saucepan, melt butter or margarine; add onions.
- Cover and cook over medium-low heat for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally, until onions are very tender.
- Stir in the flour, salt and pepper. Add milk and chicken broth. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir for 1 minutes more.
- Add cream. Cook and stir till heated through.
- Top with croutons, if desired.

Pork Chops With Green Beans And Potatoes

Ingredients:
- 6 center-cut pork chops, with bone-in
- 4 potatoes, quartered
- 2 (14 1/2 ounce) cans cut green beans
- 1 large onion, sliced
- salt
- pepper
- vegetable oil

Directions:
- -Pre-heat oven to 400 degrees.
- -Heat about 1/2" oil in a 12" skillet.
- -Brown pork chops in oil; about 5 minutes per side.
- -Use 2 corning ware dishes: Between the 2 dishes divide 1/4 teaspoons salt and 1/4 tsp pepper.
- -Put 3 pork chops in each dish.
- -Add potatoes, green beans, onions and oil from skillet.
- -Add more salt and pepper on top of everything. Probably 1/4 tsp salt and 1/4 tsp pepper.
- -Cover with aluminum foil. Bake for 1 hour.

Hot Mocha Sauce

Ingredients:
- 3 Tbsp. unsalted butter
- 3 oz. unsweetened chocolate
- 1/2 c. strong coffee
- 1/4 c. light corn syrup
- 1 c. sugar
- pinch of salt
- 1 tsp. vanilla

Directions:
- In a saucepan, melt butter and chocolate.
- Stir in coffee, corn syrup, sugar and salt.
- Bring the mixture to a boil.
- Boil the sauce gently, without stirring, until thick and smooth, about 10 minutes.
- Stir in vanilla.
- Serve hot over ice cream, cheesecake or pound cake.

Turnovers(Method:  Foil Packet)  

Ingredients:
- 1 (6 count) pkg. English muffins
- 1 stick butter or margarine (1/4 lb.)
- sandwich filling (cheese, tuna and cheese, ham and cheese, bacon, cheese and tomatoes, etc.) or dessert filling (apple, cherry, peach or your favorite canned pie filling)

Directions:
- Scrape out the center of both sides of an English muffin, taking care not to scrape a hole into the muffin.
- Fill one half of muffin with your favorite sandwich or dessert filling.
- Cover the filled half with the other half; butter both halves on the outside.
- Wrap muffin in foil, using the drugstore wrap method. Place on coals for 3 to 5 minutes per side.

Spinach Casserole

Ingredients:
- 1 pkg. frozen chopped spinach
- 6 eggs, stirred
- 2 lb. cottage cheese
- 8 oz. Old English cheese
- 1 stick margarine
- 6 Tbsp. flour
- onion, diced (optional)

Directions:
- Drain spinach well and squeeze.
- Add eggs, cottage cheese, Old English cheese and flour.
- Place in casserole.
- Slice margarine and place on top.
- Bake at 350° about 1 hour.

Hot Dog and Bologna Kabobs

Ingredients:
- 1 OSCAR MAYER Light Beef Frank
- 1 slice OSCAR MAYER Light Bologna

Directions:
- Heat grill to medium heat.
- Cut frank crosswise into 6 pieces, and bologna into 6 strips.
- Roll up bologna strips to resemble coils.
- Thread franks and bologna alternately onto 2 skewers.
- Grill 5 to 10 min.
- or until kabobs are lightly browned and heated through, turning occasionally.

Quick Coffee Cake

Ingredients:
- 4 eggs, beaten well
- 1 c. sugar
- 1 c. oil
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. baking powder
- 2 c. flour
- 1 can pie filling (any flavor)

Directions:
- Beat eggs.
- Add sugar and oil; beat well.
- Add vanilla, salt, baking powder and flour.
- Beat well and spread half of mixture in greased 13 x 9-inch pan.
- Spread with pie filling, then put rest of batter over the berries.
- (Batter will be thick so spoon top batter over the whole thing and spread evenly.)
- Bake 30 to 35 minutes at 350°.

Okie Dokie Artichokie Dip

Ingredients:
- 2 cans (14 1/2 Oz. Size) Artichokes, Quartered
- 8 ounces, weight Shredded Mozzarella Cheese
- 8 ounces, weight Shredded Jalapeno Jack Cheese
- 8 ounces, weight Cream Cheese
- 1 can (4 Oz. Size) Diced Hatch Green Chiles
- Hot Sauce, Optional

Directions:
- Chop the artichokes.
- Place them and all of the remaining ingredients in a crock pot (add hot sauce to taste) and stir to combine.
- Turn crock pot on low for 30 to 40 minutes or until thoroughly heated.
- Serve with Triscuits or cubed sourdough bread.

Daiquiri Punch

Ingredients:
- 4 small cans limeade
- 4 cans dark rum
- 4 blenders full of ice

Directions:
- Put 1 can limeade, 1 can rum and ice in a blender.
- Blend on high speed for 1 1/2 minutes.
- Pour into a punch bowl.
- Repeat 4 times.
- Designate a driver before serving.

Cake Mix Cookies

Ingredients:
- 1 box white cake mix
- 1 box (small) instant pudding mix
- 1 egg
- 1 c. oil
- 1/2 pkg. chocolate chips

Directions:
- Mix well,
- roll
- into small balls.
- Put on cookie sheet, mash with fork.
- Cook at 250° until light brown.

Benedictine Sandwiches Recipe

Ingredients:
- 1 medium cucumber, peeled and seeded
- 8 ounces cream cheese, softened
- 1/2 medium onion, finely grated
- Dash salt
- Dash white pepper
- Green food coloring
- 18 slices bread

Directions:
- Grate cucumber pulp. Use cheesecloth or a dish towel to squeeze out juice.
- Combine cucumber with cream cheese, onion, salt and white pepper; mix thoroughly.
- Add a very small amount (2 drops) of food coloring; just enough to turn the spread a pale green.
- Divide spread among 9 slices of bread and top with other 9 slices.
- Remove crusts and slice sandwiches diagonally.

Quick Pasta And Bean Soup

Ingredients:
- 1 Tbsp. oil
- 1 c. chopped yellow onion
- 1 c. chopped celery
- 1/2 c. chopped green onion
- 1/2 c. chopped carrots
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 3 cans chicken broth or 5 1/2 c. homemade chicken broth, skimmed
- 1 can Northern beans, drained
- 1 can white navy beans, drained
- 1 can diced, peeled tomatoes, chopped (undrained)
- 1 can white potatoes, chopped and drained
- 1 tsp. oregano
- 1 tsp. basil
- 1/2 tsp. pepper
- 2 bay leaves
- 1 c. small shell macaroni (uncooked)
- 1 c. shredded Swiss cheese
- fresh parsley

Directions:
- Heat oil in stockpot until hot.
- Add yellow onion, celery, green onion, carrots and garlic.
- Cook over medium heat until hot, about 4 to 5 minutes.
- Add broth, beans, tomatoes, potatoes and spices.
- Bring to a boil.
- Add macaroni.
- Reduce heat and cook 15 minutes or until macaroni and vegetables are tender.
- Remove bay leaves.
- Spoon into bowls and sprinkle with Swiss cheese and parsley.

The Best Lime Fluff

Ingredients:
- 1 small pkg. lime jello
- 2 c. cottage cheese
- 1 can crushed pineapple (15 1/2 oz.), well drained
- 1 medium size container Cool Whip

Directions:
- Mix pineapple and cottage cheese, then sprinkle in dry jello mix.
- Add Cool Whip and mix until well blended.
- Chill and serve.

Crepes Fritzgerald

Ingredients:
- 24 dessert crepes
- 16 ounces sour cream
- 16 ounces cream cheese
- 6 cups fresh strawberries, halved
- butter
- sugar
- 1 cup kirsch
- 1 cup strawberry liqueur

Directions:
- Filling:.
- Mix sour cream and cream cheese.
- Roll crepes with mix in center.
- You may do this in advance.
- Refrigerate until needed.
- If you refrigerated let crepes sit at room temp until center is warm if you don't like a cool center and warm topping.
- Topping:.
- Place strawberries in large bowl, dot with butter and sweeten with sugar.
- Heat kirsch and strawberry liqueur in large skillet then add the sweetened strawberries.
- Pour over serving of crepes.
- Note you can flame in skillet.

Easy Fudge

Ingredients:
- 2 c. sugar
- 1 small can evaporated milk
- 11 large marshmallows
- 6 oz. chocolate chips
- nuts (optional)

Directions:
- Combine sugar, milk and marshmallows.
- Stir well and cook on medium high.
- When marshmallows begin to boil, time 5 minutes, stirring frequently.
- Remove from heat and pour chocolate chips in hot syrup mixture.
- Beat mixture until chips dissolve (use a wooden spoon).
- Beat about 1 to 2 minutes longer and pour into buttered dish.
- When cool, cut into pieces.
- Makes about 2 pounds.

Sausage Dip

Ingredients:
- 1/2 lb. pork sausage
- 1/2 lb. ground beef or additional pork sausage
- 1 lb. Velveeta cheese, melted
- 1/2 c. minced onion
- 1/2 c. jalapeno relish
- 1/2 c. cream of mushroom soup
- 1/2 tsp. garlic powder

Directions:
- Lightly brown meat and drain. Add remaining ingredients in order given.
- Mix well.
- Keep warm in electric skillet or crock-pot.
- Makes 12 servings.
- May be frozen.

Molasses Oatmeal Cookies

Ingredients:
- 12 cup shortening
- 1 cup brown sugar
- 2 eggs, well beaten
- 12 cup molasses
- 1 34 cups flour
- 1 teaspoon baking soda
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1 teaspoon nutmeg
- 2 cups rolled oats
- 1 cup seeded raisins

Directions:
- Cream shortening, add sugar gradually.
- Blend in eggs and molasses.
- Sift flour, baking soda, salt and nutmeg.
- Add rolled oats.
- Stir into the shortening mixture.
- Mix in chopped raisins.
- Drop by teaspoon on a greased cooking sheet.
- Bake at 375F for approximately 10 minutes.

Garlic Roasted Mashed Potatoes

Ingredients:
- 4 garlic cloves
- 4 lb. baking potatoes, peeled and sliced
- 1 1/2 t. salt
- 1 T. olive oil
- 1/2 c. butter
- 1 c. milk
- 1/2 t. pepper

Directions:
- Place garlic on a square of aluminum foil; drizzle with oil, and wrap in foil.
- Bake at 425 degrees for 30 min; remove from oven, and set aside.
- Cook potatoes in boiling water to cover 15-20 min. or until tender; drain and transfer to a large mixing bowl. Add butter and remaining ingredients; beat at medium speed until fluffy.
- Cut off pointed ends of garlic; squeeze pulp from garlic cloves, and stir into mashed potatoes.
- Serves 8. Very good!

Macrobiotic Cut-Out Cookies

Ingredients:
- 100 grams Cake flour
- 30 grams Rice flour
- 40 grams Katakuriko
- 1 dash Salt
- 6 tbsp Beet sugar
- 3 tbsp Water
- 4 tbsp Olive oil

Directions:
- Add the ingredients to a bowl and mix well.
- Heat the beet sugar and water in a pan, and mix well.
- When the beet sugar has dissolved, remove from heat, add the mixture to the bowl from Step 1, and combine well with a spatula.
- Add the olive oil to the bowl from Step 3 and the dough is ready.
- Cut out the cookies.
- Dust your work surface (with cake flour) and place the dough.
- Roll out the dough with a rolling pin.
- Cut into shapes with any cookie cutter of your choice.
- Place cookies on a baking pan lined with parchment paper.
- Bake in the oven at 180C for 15 minutes, and the cookies are done.

Buffalo Chicken Dip

Ingredients:
- 3 cooked chicken breasts, diced
- 8-oz. pkg. cream cheese, softened
- 15-oz. jar blue cheese salad dressing
- 12-oz. bottle hot pepper sauce
- 12-oz. pkg. shredded Cheddar cheese
- Celery sticks
- Tortilla chips

Directions:
- Combine chicken, cream cheese, salad dressing and hot sauce; spread in a lightly greased 3-quart casserole dish. Sprinkle with Cheddar cheese.
- Bake at 350 degrees until bubbly and heated through, about 20 minutes.
- Serve with celery sticks and tortilla chips.

Lemon and Soy Scented Tuna Slices

Ingredients:
- 1 teaspoon unsalted butter or 1 teaspoon duck fat
- 6 ounces yellow fin tuna
- 1 lemon, cut in 10 slices
- 1 teaspoon soy sauce
- 1 teaspoon minced green onion
- 12 teaspoon toasted sesame seeds
- 14 teaspoon toasted sesame oil

Directions:
- In skillet, melt butter over medium high heat.
- Sear tuna on all sides for 15-20 minutes per side.
- Remove from heat and slice into 10 slices.
- Set aside.
- Arrange lemon slices on platter.
- Place tuna slices on top of lemon and sprinkle with soy sauce, green onions, sesame seeds and oil.

Savory Coleslaw

Ingredients:
- 1 cabbage, shredded
- 2 small carrots, grated
- 1 red pepper, finely diced
- 1 cucumber, peeled, finely diced
- 1/4 red onion, finely diced
- 2 stalks celery, finely diced
- Dressing
- 1 1/4 cups light mayonnaise
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 2 tablespoons wine vinegar
- 2 teaspoons Dijon mustard
- 1/2 teaspoon sugar
- fresh ground black pepper

Directions:
- Add all the cut vegetables to a large bowl.
- Whisk the dressing ingredients together, pour over the coleslaw and mix well.
- Chill for about an hour before serving.

Peanut Butter Fudge Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 chocolate cake mix
- 1 1/2 c. peanut butter
- 1 1/2 Tbsp. peanut oil
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 1/4 c. cocoa
- 6 Tbsp. butter
- 1 box powdered sugar
- 1 tsp. vanilla

Directions:
- Bake cake mix according to directions on box; use a 9 x 13-inch pan.
- In a small bowl, mix peanut butter and peanut oil until smooth.
- Spread on cake.

Coconut Pudding

Ingredients:
- 1 cup sugar
- 5 tablespoons cornstarch
- 1/4 teaspoon table salt
- 1 3/4 cups milk
- 1 1/2 cups heavy cream
- 1 (13.5-oz.) can unsweetened coconut milk
- 1/4 cup butter, cut into 1/2-inch pieces
- 2 teaspoons vanilla bean paste
- Sweetened whipped cream
- Garnish: toasted flaked coconut

Directions:
- Whisk together first 3 ingredients in a large heavy saucepan; whisk in milk and next 2 ingredients. Bring mixture to a boil over medium heat, whisking constantly. Boil 1 minute, whisking constantly. Remove from heat.
- Whisk in butter and vanilla bean paste. Spoon pudding into serving dishes; cover and chill 4 hours. Dollop with sweetened whipped cream.

Banana  Bread(Low Fat Version)  

Ingredients:
- 2 1/2 c. sifted flour
- 1 tsp. baking soda
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 2/3 c. I Can't Believe It's Not Butter
- 1 1/2 c. Splenda
- Egg Beaters to equal 2 eggs
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 3 or 4 large ripe bananas, mashed

Directions:
- Measure and sift together flour, baking soda, and salt. Cream butter, add sugar. Cream butter and sugar together. Add eggs and vanilla. Stir until thoroughly mixed. Stir in mashed bananas. Fold in dry ingredients. Spray 2 small loaf pans with Pam. Pour in mixture. Bake at 325° for 55-60 minutes.

Popcorn With Rosemary Infused Oil

Ingredients:
- 1 cup popcorn
- salt
- Rosemary Infused Oil use 1/2 cup plus 2 T
- 1 cup olive oil
- 5 -6 sprigs fresh rosemary (each about 5 inches long)

Directions:
- Stir in popcorn kernels and 1/2 cup of the oil in a heavy large pot; cover and cook over medium heat until kernels have poped, shaking the pot halfway through cooking, about 3 minutes.
- Immediately transfer the popcorn to a large serving bowl; toss the popcorn with the remaining 2 tablespoons oil.
- sprinkle with salt, to taste, and serve.
- Rosemary Infused Oil:Combine the oil with rosemary in a heavy small saucepan; cook over medium-low heat for about 5 minutes.
- Remove from heat and let cool to room temperature; transfer the sprigs to a 4-ounce bottle or crute; add oil and seal with lid; refrigerate for up to 1 month.

Walnut-Lentil Sandwiches

Ingredients:
- For the Walnut Lentil Spread
- 1/4 cup Walnuts, chopped
- 1 cup French lentils, cooked
- 2 scallions, (white and green part), chopped
- 1 clove garlic, roughly chopped
- 1 tablespoon Dijon mustard
- 1 teaspoon red wine vinegar
- 1 tablespoon soy sauce
- water
- To Assemble Sandwiches
- 6 slices whole grain bread
- 1 tomato, sliced
- 1 small cucumber, peeled and sliced
- 1 bunch alfalfa sprouts
- 3 large lettuce leaves

Directions:
- Place walnuts in a dry skillet and toast over medium-high heat until you can smell the walnuts, about 2-3 minutes.
- Place all ingredients except water in a food processor, and blend until creamy smooth. Drizzle water if mixture is too thick.
- Place spread on 6 slices bread, add vegetables assemble sandwiches with 2 slices of bread each. Enjoy!

Danish Rugbrod Rolls

Ingredients:
- 2 1/16 tablespoons fresh yeast
- 1 1/4 cups water lukewarm
- 1 1/4 cups seeds crushed rye
- 6 3/4 tablespoons sunflower seeds
- 1 bottle beer Danish amber, 2.5% alcohol
- 1 1/4 cups yogurt
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 5 7/8 cups rye flour
- 1 5/8 cups all-purpose flour
- oats for decoration

Directions:
- In a bowl combine the yeast and warm water, stir to dissolve the yeast.
- Add the rye seeds and let stand for 6 hours.
- Add sunflower seeds, beer, yogurt, salt, and flours, and knead in the food processor for 10 minutes.
- Let the dough rest, covered with a cloth for at least 40 minutes.
- Refrigerate overnight.
- The next day, preheat the oven to 180 degrees Celsius.
- Make 12 balls of dough, roll them in your hands to get a slightly more elongated shape then roll them in the oats.
- Arrange rolls on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
- Bake for 30 minutes.

Pineapple Orange Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 yellow cake mix
- 4 eggs
- 1/2 c. oil
- 1 (16 oz.) can mandarin oranges plus juice

Directions:
- Beat together all ingredients for 4 minutes.
- Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.

Garbanzo and Rice Salad

Ingredients:
- 2 cups chickpeas (garbanzo beans) drained
- 2 cups sweet bell peppers green
- 1/2 cup red onion diced
- 1/2 teaspoon dill weed
- 2 cups brown rice cooked
- 2 medium tomatoes coarsely diced
- 4 tablespoons white wine vinegar
- 1 x salt and black pepper optional

Directions:
- Combine all ingredients.
- Toss well and refrigerate overnight.
- Toss several times during refrigeration period and just before serving.

Fudge

Ingredients:
- 2 c. sugar
- 3 Tbsp. cocoa
- 2/3 c. milk
- 4 Tbsp. Karo
- dash of salt
- 1 stick butter
- 2 tsp. vanilla
- 1 or 2 c. pecans

Directions:
- Mix sugar, cocoa, milk, Karo and salt.
- Cook until hard ball forms when small amount is dropped in cup of cold water.
- When hard ball forms, take off the fire and put pan in cold water.
- Add butter and vanilla.
- Beat until stiff, then add pecans.
- Put in buttered platter.
- Cut into squares.
- Enjoy.

Banana Pudding

Ingredients:
- 3 small boxes vanilla instant Jell-O pudding
- 1 small carton sour cream
- 1 (8 oz.) cream cheese
- 1 (8 oz.) Cool Whip
- vanilla wafers
- bananas

Directions:
- Mix Jell-O pudding and milk.
- Beat well.
- Add cream cheese and
- sour cream; blend them.
- Add 1/2 Cool Whip.
- Mix well.
- Put layer of vanilla wafers and bananas; add 1/2 of mixture.
- Then layer vanilla wafers and bananas and rest of mixture.
- Top with other half of Cool Whip.

Biscuit Mix

Ingredients:
- 4 c. all purpose flour
- 4 tsp. sugar
- 1 tsp. salt
- 2 1/2 tbsp. baking powder
- 1 tsp. cream of tartar
- 1/2 c. dry milk powder
- 3/4 c. + 2 tbsp. shortening

Directions:
- In large bowl sift dry ingredients together 3 times.
- Cut in shortening.
- Pack loosely in airtight container and store in fridge.
- For each 1 cup mix, add 1/3 cup water; stir to blend. May also be used for pancakes by adding 1 egg.
- Keeps a long time when stored in refrigerator.

Earthquake Chocolate Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 c. chopped nuts
- 1 c. coconut
- 1 German chocolate cake mix, mixed according to directions
- 1 stick melted margarine
- 8 oz. cream cheese
- 1 box powdered sugar

Directions:
- Grease a 9 x 13-inch pan.
- Spread chopped nuts in bottom of pan.
- Spread coconut over nuts.
- Pour cake mix over nuts and coconut.

Earthquake Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 (18 ounce) German chocolate cake mix
- 1 1/4 cups water (or as called for by the cake mix directions)
- 3 eggs (or as called for by the cake mix directions)
- 1/2 cup oil (or as called for by the cake mix directions)
- 1 cup coconut
- 1 cup pecan pieces
- 1/2 cup margarine, softened
- 8 ounces cream cheese, softened
- 1 lb powdered sugar
- 1 teaspoon vanilla

Directions:
- spray 9x13" pan with oil and set oven to 350°F.
- spread the coconut and pecan pieces evenly on the bottom of pan.
- prepare the cake mix according to directions on box, and pour over coconut and pecan pieces
- mix well together: margarine, cream cheese, vanilla and powered sugar.
- spoon over cake in dollops, no need to spread evenly.
- bake for approx 40-50 minutes.
- check with toothpick for doneness.
- cake will be cracked on top, but should be a moist cake.

Layered Twenty-Four Hour Salad

Ingredients:
- 3 c. shredded iceberg lettuce or any combination of lettuce
- 2 c. grated carrots
- 1 stalk celery, diced
- 1 c. finely diced onions
- 1 1/2 c. frozen Birds Eye green peas
- salt and pepper to taste
- 2 c. Alpine Lace nonfat Mozzarella cheese, grated
- 1 can sliced water chestnuts, drained
- 1/4 c. Parmesan cheese
- 1 qt. Kraft fat-free mayonnaise or Miracle Whip

Directions:
- In a very large salad bowl, line the bottom with bite size pieces of lettuce.
- Cover the lettuce with carrots, celery, onions, water chestnuts and peas.
- Spread the quart of mayonnaise on top as if you are icing a cake.
- Sprinkle Mozzarella and Parmesan cheeses on top.
- Cover and refrigerate for 24 hours. Serves 16.

Pizza Casserole

Ingredients:
- 1 to 2 lb. ground beef
- 1 onion, diced
- 1 green pepper, diced
- 1 small can mushrooms
- 1 c. Cheddar cheese soup
- 1 c. pizza sauce
- 1 pkg. Mozzarella cheese
- 1 small pkg. spaghetti

Directions:
- Brown the ground beef, onions and pepper together.
- Add the mushrooms.
- Stir in the cheese soup and pizza sauce.
- Cook the spaghetti until tender; drain and mix with the previous mixture and spread in a rectangular baking dish.
- Sprinkle on the Mozzarella cheese.
- Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.
- Let set for 5 minutes before serving.

Whisper

Ingredients:
- ice, as needed
- 2 cups milk
- 6 fluid ounces vodka
- 1 (6 ounce) can frozen lemonade concentrate

Directions:
- Fill your blender pitcher with ice. Pour milk, vodka, and lemonade concentrate over the ice; blend until smooth.

Sweet Relish

Ingredients:
- 1 medium cucumber, pared, seeded and diced
- 1 tsp. coarse salt
- 1/2 c. cider vinegar
- 1/4 c. minced red bell pepper
- 1/2 c. minced onion
- 1 Tbsp. sugar
- 1/4 tsp. celery seed
- 1/2 tsp. dry mustard

Directions:
- In medium glass bowl, toss cucumber and salt; cover and refrigerate 8 hours. Drain, then rinse in colander. In medium non-reactive saucepan, combine all ingredients, except mustard. Cook over low heat, stirring often, 20 minutes; stir in mustard. Cool to room temperature; store, covered, up to 2 weeks in refrigerator. Makes 1 1/4 cups.
- Multiply recipe x 10 (10 times) for canning. Put in hot jars while hot and add hot sterilized lids.

Mama'S Bar-B-Que (Barbecue) Chicken

Ingredients:
- 1 chicken, cut in pieces
- 1/4 cup salad oil
- 1 large onion, chopped
- 1/2 cup celery, chopped
- 1 cup ketchup
- 1 cup water
- 1/4 cup lemon juice
- 2 tablespoons brown sugar
- 2 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce
- 2 tablespoons vinegar
- 1 teaspoon salt

Directions:
- Brown chicken pieces slowly in salad oil and remove from skillet.
- In same skillet cook onion and celery just until tender, but not browned.
- Add remaining ingredients and simmer for 5 minutes.
- Place chicken in baking pan and pour sauce over all pieces.
- Bake uncovered in 325 degree oven for approximately 1 hour. Baste with sauce after 30 minutes and just before serving.

Chicken And Rice Dish

Ingredients:
- 1 pkg. yellow rice (with seasoning)
- 4 chicken breasts
- 1 can cream of chicken soup
- salt and pepper to taste (optional)

Directions:
- Mix soup, 1/2 can of water and rice in bowl (may need more water). Layer rice mixture in bottom of casserole dish.
- Bury chicken breasts in rice mixture. Bake at 350° for approximately 30 minutes or until rice is fluffy and chicken is tender.

Stuffed Snapper Fillets

Ingredients:
- 4 red snapper fillets, skin on and deboned
- 1/2 lb. crabmeat, flaked or chopped
- 1/2 onion, diced fine
- 2 c. Italian bread crumbs
- 1/2 can cream of celery soup, add more if needed to hold together
- 4 cloves garlic, crushed
- 1/4 tsp. Tabasco sauce
- juice of 1 lemon
- 1 egg, beaten
- 1/2 tsp. Worcestershire sauce
- 1 tsp. dry mustard
- 1 Tbsp. butter
- 1/4 tsp. salt and pepper

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients together and mound on the flesh side of the snapper fillet. Place on greased sheet pan, skin side down. Bake in preheated oven at 350° for 20 to 30 minutes until fillet is flaky and stuffing has browned.

Carrots And Brussels Sprouts 

Ingredients:
- 2 tablespoons chopped shallot (from 1 medium)
- 3 tablespoons unsalted butter, divided
- 1 pound carrots, cut diagonally into 1/2-inch-thick pieces
- 1 pound Brussels sprouts, halved lengthwise
- 1/3 cup water
- 1 tablespoon cider vinegar

Directions:
- Cook shallot in 2 tablespoons butter in a 12-inch heavy skillet over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally, until softened, 1 to 2 minutes. Add carrots, Brussels sprouts, 3/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/2 teaspoon pepper and cook, stirring occasionally, until vegetables begin to brown, 3 to 4 minutes.
- Add water and cover skillet, then cook over medium-high heat until vegetables are tender, 5 to 8 minutes. Stir in vinegar, remaining tablespoon butter, and salt and pepper to taste.

Spicy Chicken (Serves 4)

Ingredients:
- 6 boneless skinless chicken breasts
- 12 cup chopped green onion
- 4 cups frank's hot sauce

Directions:
- Pour good quality vegetable oil in deep fryer, pre heat to approx 375-400.
- Wash chicken breats and dry.
- Cut chicken breasts into 3/4" cubes.
- Chop green onion(chives).
- depending on size of deep fryer, add half of the total cubed chicken in deep fryer frying for approx 8 minutes per batch.
- When finished, place chicken in bowl, coat in sauce and toss.
- Place on dish and sprinkle green onion or chives on top.

Mary'S Baked Beans

Ingredients:
- 2 lbs ground beef, browned
- 1 lb bacon, cooked and cut up
- 1 small yellow onion, finely chopped
- 2/3 cup brown sugar
- 2/3 cup white sugar
- 1/2 cup catsup
- 1/2 cup barbecue sauce
- 4 tablespoons molasses
- 4 tablespoons mustard
- 2 tablespoons salt
- 1 tablespoon pepper
- 1 teaspoon chili powder
- 3 (15 1/2 ounce) cans beans, any 3 kinds

Directions:
- Mix all together and put them in a crock pot.
- High to cook under 1-2 hours; Low to cook all day!

Caramel Pecan Clusters

Ingredients:
- 1/2 lb. caramels
- 2 Tbsp. cream
- 1 1/4 c. small pecan halves
- dipping chocolate, melted and cooled

Directions:
- Melt caramels; add cream and stir until smooth.
- Add pecans to mixture and drop by teaspoonfuls onto greased cookie sheet.
- Let stand until firm (will set quicker in fridge).
- Pour a teaspoon of the melted cooled chocolate over each cluster and let stand until chocolate is firm.

Artichoke Squares

Ingredients:
- 2 jars marinated artichoke hearts, drained and chopped
- 4 beaten eggs
- 1/2 c. chopped onion
- 6 crushed saltine crackers
- 1/2 lb. grated Cheddar cheese

Directions:
- Saute onions in oil from jars of artichoke hearts.
- Add remaining ingredients, stirring well after each.
- Season with salt and pepper.
- Pour into an 8 x 8-inch pan.
- Bake at 325° for 35 to 40 minutes.

Hamburger Upside-Down Pie

Ingredients:
- 1/4 c. minced onion
- 1/2 c. chopped green pepper
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 2 Tbsp. oil
- 1 (8 oz.) can tomato sauce
- 2 Tbsp. ketchup
- 1 tsp. chili powder or more to taste
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper

Directions:
- Heat oven to 400°.
- In a skillet, saute onion, pepper and beef in oil until brown.
- Add tomato sauce and remaining ingredients; mix well.
- Turn into a 2-quart casserole dish.
- Cover with cornbread topping (use box of Jiffy corn muffin mix, mixed as directed on box and use for topping).
- Bake 25 minutes at 400°. Turn onto serving plate at once with topping side down.
- Serves 6.

Honolulu Soy Kabobs Recipe

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. soy sauce
- 1/2 c. pineapple juice
- 1/4 c. oil
- 1 teaspoon dry mustard
- 1 tbsp. brown sugar
- 1 teaspoon garlic salt
- 1/4 teaspoon pepper
- Chicken breast, cubed

Directions:
- Simmer all ingredients 10 min.
- Cold.
- Thread cubed chicken with chunks of pineapple, green pepper, mushrooms, cherry tomatoes, water chestnuts on skewers.
- Broil or possibly cook on grill, baste occasionally with marinade.
- Delicious.

Hawaiian Chicken Breasts

Ingredients:
- 6 chicken breasts, skinned and boned
- 1/2 c. soy sauce
- 1 c. crushed pineapple
- 1 bell pepper
- 4 Tbsp. brown sugar

Directions:
- Marinate chicken in soy sauce.
- Place in a baking dish. Sprinkle with brown sugar.
- Pour remaining soy sauce over chicken. Bake, uncovered, for 1/2 hour at 350°.
- Uncover.
- Add pepper and pineapple.
- Bake 1/2 hour longer.
- Serves 6.

Country Style Steak-In-The-Pot

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. round steak
- 1/2 c. flour
- 1/4 c. shortening
- 1/4 c. chopped onion
- 1 can cream of mushroom soup
- 1 c. water

Directions:
- Cut steak into serving portions.
- Coat with flour.
- Brown on both sides in shortening in a skillet.
- Place in a crock-pot. Sprinkle onion over steak.
- Add soup and water to pan drippings in skillet; mix well.
- Pour over steak.
- Cook on low for 6 hours or until tender.
- Yield:
- 4 servings.

Gorgonzola And Green Bean Salad With Pine Nuts

Ingredients:
- 12 oz. green beans, ends trimmed
- 1/2 c. toasted pine nuts
- 1 c. crumbled Gorgonzola or any Blue cheese
- 1 1/2 Tbsp. red wine vinegar
- 3 Tbsp. olive oil
- 1/2 clove garlic, finely minced
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1 head radicchio (if desired)

Directions:
- Cook green beans; cut in 1/2 or 1/3.
- Toast pine nuts.
- Mix vinegar, oil, garlic, salt and pepper until well blended.
- Toss with beans in the dressing and add the cheese and nuts.
- Separate the leaves of radicchio.
- Wash and dry.
- Arrange on salad plates and spoon the bean salad on top.

Fruit Shakes

Ingredients:
- 1/4 c. milk
- 1/4 c. orange juice
- 1/2 banana
- 1 tsp. honey
- dash of vanilla

Directions:
- Mix 1/4 cup each of milk and orange juice with 1/2 banana, honey and a dash of vanilla in blender.

Cheese Ball

Ingredients:
- 1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese
- 1 (2 oz.) pkg. shredded Mozzarella
- 1 (2 oz.) pkg. shredded Cheddar
- 1 small onion, chopped fine
- 1 pkg. corned beef, chopped
- 1/2 c. chopped pecans

Directions:
- Let cheeses get soft (room temperature). Mix all ingredients together; form into a ball and roll in chopped pecans. Refrigerate.
- Before serving,
- let set at room temperature for a while.

Smoked Salmon

Ingredients:
- 4 slices bacon, chopped
- 12 lb smoked salmon
- 12 lb smoked oysters
- 6 egg yolks
- 2 12 teaspoons water
- 1 cup vegetable oil
- 2 12 tablespoons lemon juice
- 1 bunch watercress

Directions:
- Fry the chopped bacon bits until crisp.
- Drain and set aside.
- Slice the salmon thinly and roll into tight fingers.
- Arrange the salmon and oysters attractively on a bronze serving platter (or platter of your choice).
- In a blender or food processor, beat the egg yolks and water.
- With the machine running on low speed, gradually add the vegetable oil and lemon juice, beating until smooth and creamy.
- Blanch the watercress in boiling water for a few seconds, then, drop into blender with creamed mixture.
- Puree until very, very smooth.
- Pour the watercress cream into a bowl.
- To eat, dip a salmon roll or oyster first into the watercress cream, then into the bacon bits.

Honeydew in Lemon Thyme Syrup

Ingredients:
- 1 cup water
- 1/2 cup sugar
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh lemon thyme
- 1 1/2 firm-ripe honeydew melons, seeded and cut lengthwise into 1 1/2-inch-wide wedges
- Garnish: tender lemon thyme sprigs; lemon wedges

Directions:
- Bring water, sugar, and lemon thyme to a boil in a 1-quart heavy saucepan over moderate heat, stirring until sugar is dissolved.
- Boil syrup until reduced to about 3/4 cup, 5 to 10 minutes.
- Remove pan from heat and steep syrup, covered, 30 minutes.
- Pour through a sieve into a bowl, pressing on and discarding thyme.
- While syrup steeps, remove rind from honeydew wedges, then halve each wedge crosswise on a slight diagonal.
- Put melon in a shallow bowl and drizzle with syrup.

Pumpkin Cake

Ingredients:
- 2 c. sugar
- 1 c. oil
- 2 tsp. soda
- 2 tsp. cinnamon
- 4 eggs
- 2 c. self-rising flour
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 2 c. pumpkin

Directions:
- Beat eggs; add oil and pumpkin.
- Add all other dry ingredients.
- Mix well.
- Bake at 350° for 30 to 35 minutes.

Grilled Picante BBQ Chicken

Ingredients:
- 34 cup Pace Picante Sauce
- 14 cup barbecue sauce
- 6 chicken breast halves, boneless, skinless

Directions:
- Stir the picante sauce and the barbecue sauce in a small bowl.
- Reserve 1/2 cup picante sauce mixture for grilling.
- Set aside remaining picante sauce mixture to serve with chicken.
- Lightly oil the grill rack and heat the grill to medium.
- Grill the chicken for 15 minutes or until it's cooked through, turning and brushing often with the reserved picante sauce mixture during grilling.
- Discard any remaining picante sauce mixture.
- Serve the chicken with the reserved picante sauce mixture.
- TIP: This simple basting sauce also makes a zesty dipping sauce for chicken wings or nuggets.

Lasagna

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. Lasagna Noodles
- 4 Eggs
- 1 1/2 c. Mozzarella Cheese
- 1 1/2 lbs. Ground Chuck
- 2 (6-8 oz.) cans Tomato Sauce
- 1 1/2 lbs. small curd Cottage Cheese
- 1 1/2 c. Parmesan Cheese
- 1/4 c. Parsley Flakes
- 1 lg. jar Spaghetti Sauce

Directions:
- Mix together the 4 well-beaten eggs, parsley flakes and the three cheeses.
- Set aside.
- Fry the ground chuck and drain.
- Mix into the fried ground chuck the salt, pepper, spaghetti sauce and tomato sauce.
- Cook the noodles according to the package directions and drain.
- In a 9x12 inch pan layer the noodles, meat with sauce and the cheese mixture, ending with cheese mixture on top.
- Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour.
- Serves 8.

Mee Maw'S Chocolate Chippers(Sue B. King Wanjura)  

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. Crisco
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 1 egg
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1/4 c. brown sugar
- 1 c. sifted all-purpose flour
- 1/2 tsp. soda
- 3/4 tsp. salt
- 1 c. (6 oz.) semi-sweet chocolate chips
- 1 c. chopped walnuts

Directions:
- Cream Crisco, sugar, egg and vanilla until fluffy.
- Sift together dry ingredients; stir into creamed mixture.
- Stir in chocolate chips and nuts.
- Drop by teaspoon 2 inches apart onto greased cookie sheet.
- Bake at 375° for 10 to 12 minutes.
- Yields approximately 3 dozen.

Miami Barbecued Shrimp

Ingredients:
- 2 lbs fresh medium shrimp, shelled and deveined
- 1 tablespoon minced onion
- 2 garlic cloves, minced
- 3 tablespoons butter, melted
- 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce
- 1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice
- 1 tablespoon Old Bay Seasoning
- 1 teaspoon medium-hot paprika
- Tabasco sauce, to taste
- salt
- fresh ground black pepper

Directions:
- Preheat the oven to 325.
- In a big bowl, combine the shrimp, onions, and garlic and toss well.
- Add the remaining ingredients and toss until the shrimp are well coated.
- Arrange the shrimp in a single layer in a large, shallow roasting pan and bake about 20 minutes or until the shrimp turn pink, turning them over once or twice.
- Transfer the shrimp to a large platter and serve piping hot.

Slow-Cooker Cranberry Chili Meatballs

Ingredients:
- 16 ounces cranberry sauce, whole-berry
- 3/4 cup chili sauce
- 1/4 cup water
- 2 lbs frozen meatballs, completely thawed

Directions:
- Put cranberry sauce, chili sauce and water in slow-cooker and stir to combine.
- Add meatballs and stir to coat them with the sauce.
- Cover and cook on low 3-4 hours, until bubbly and meatballs are heated through.
- Stir; serve warm from the cooker.
- Tip: Add 2 packed tablspoons brown sugar and t teaspoon of lemon juice to the sauce for a sweet-sour variatin.

Country Cole Slaw

Ingredients:
- 1 medium cabbage head, chopped fine
- 2 medium tomatoes
- 1 small onion, cut in small pieces
- 1 carrot, finely chopped
- 1/2 c. Miracle Whip mayonnaise
- 2 tsp. sugar

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients together.

Peach Dessert

Ingredients:
- 1 cup flour
- 12 cup brown sugar
- 12 cup chopped pecans
- 12 cup butter, melted
- 8 ounces cream cheese, softened
- 12 cup confectioners' sugar
- 8 ounces Cool Whip
- 3 ounces peach Jell-O
- 1 cup boiling water
- 4 -6 cups sliced peaches

Directions:
- First Layer: Mix and stir above ingredients to make a crumbly mixture.
- Spread in a greased 9x13 baking pan.
- Bake at 350F until brown (about 15 minutes).
- Cool and add second layer.
- Second Layer: Mix cream cheese and sugar with electric mixer until smooth; fold in Cool Whip.
- Add this mixture on top of 1st layer
- Third Layer: Mix Jello and boiling water.
- Cool Jello.
- Add peaches.
- Pour over 2nd layer.
- Refrigerate until firm.
- Optional: Top with Cool Whip and sprinkle with nuts.

Pork And Potato Scallop

Ingredients:
- 4 c. thinly sliced potatoes (5 medium)
- 4 (1/2-inch thick) pork chops
- 1 (10 1/2 oz.) can cream of mushroom soup (undiluted)
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/8 tsp. pepper
- 1/4 tsp. celery seed
- 1 medium onion, sliced and separated into rings

Directions:
- Heat oven to 375°.
- Brown pork chops in greased skillet. Prepare potatoes.
- Blend soup, salt, pepper and celery seed. Arrange a layer of potatoes and onion in greased 2-quart baking dish, then cover with a portion of sauce.
- Repeat layers until all are used, ending with sauce.
- Place chops on top; sprinkle with salt, pepper and paprika.
- Bake, covered, at 375° for 1 hour or until meat and potatoes are tender.

Green Beans Almondine

Ingredients:
- 2 cups Fresh Green Beans
- 1 cup Fresh Whole Mushrooms
- 3 Tablespoons Sliced Almonds
- 2 Tablespoons Butter
- 1 Tablespoon Minced Garlic
- 1 pinch Salt

Directions:
- Take two cups or about two handfuls (or what looks like about two servings) of fresh, already trimmed, washed green beans. Throw into a heated skillet. Put about a tablespoon or two of butter, 1 cup of mushrooms and the sliced almonds. Saute until it is browning nicely and the green beans are cooking well. Throw in some minced garlic and pinch of salt. If you throw the garlic in at the beginning it will probably burn by the time it is done. This all took maybe 20 minutes. It was a really quick dish!
- Be careful not to overcook your green beans because then you lose some of the crunch that is so good when they are fresh. Feel free to add whatever else you would like. Onions also make a great addition. Substitute fat-free butter and other healthier ingredients if necessary.

Easy Mexican Lasagne

Ingredients:
- 1 pound GROUND BEEF
- 1 packet LASAGNE NOODLES
- 3 15 ounces CANS OF PETITE DICED TOMATOES WITH GREEN CHILIES
- 1 packet TACO SEASONING
- 1 27 ounces CAN OF WHOLE GREEN CHILIES
- 16 ounces PACKAGE OF MEXICAN 4 CHEESE BLEND

Directions:
- BROWN MEAT WITH TACO SEASONING.
- ADD 2 CANS TOMATOES WITH CHILIES AND SIMMER ABOUT 20 MINUTES.
- ADD 1/2 CAN TOMATOES TO BOTTOM OF THE 9X13 DISH, TOP WITH LASAGNE NOODLES UNCOOKED.
- ADD SOME MEAT MIXTURE AND LAYER CHILIES AFTER OPENING THEM UP FLAT.
- ADD A COUPLE OF HANDFULS OF CHEESE AND REPEAT LAYERS. TOP WITH REMAINING TOMATOES AND CHEESE, COVER WITH FOIL.
- BAKE AT 350 DEGREES FOR 30 MINUTES, THEN UNCOVER AND CONTINUE BAKING FOR 15 MINUTES APPROXIMATELY.

French Style Peas  & Mint

Ingredients:
- 1 baby cos lettuce, shredded
- 20 g butter
- 1 tablespoon plain flour
- 1 cup chicken stock
- 1 1/2 cups frozen peas
- 2 tablespoons of fresh mint, chopped

Directions:
- Melt butter in pot over medium heat.
- Stir in flour till smooth and cook 1 minute.
- Slowly whisk in chicken stock.
- Stir till thick.
- Stir in peas and shredded lettuce.
- Cook 3 minutes till lettuce wilts.
- Add mint and serve.

Chocolate Pudding

Ingredients:
- chocolate black pudding in a box from the closet
- just a little bit of milk

Directions:
- Put chocolate and milk in a bowl.
- Stir with a mixer.
- Put in refrigerator for 3 minutes.
- Put in dishes.
- Eat.
- "When Daddy and I make chocolate pudding, it tastes chocolate good."

Tangy Cheese-Topped Spuds

Ingredients:
- 1 package (8 ounces) cream cheese, softened
- 1 cup sour cream
- 1/4 cup finely chopped onion
- 2 tablespoons prepared horseradish
- 1 to 2 tablespoons lemon juice
- 2 tablespoons minced fresh parsley
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 4 hot baked potatoes
- 1/2 cup shredded sharp cheddar cheese

Directions:
- In a large bowl, blend cream cheese and sour cream until smooth. Add onion, horseradish, lemon juice, parsley and salt; mix well.
- With a sharp knife, cut an X in the top of each potato; fluff pulp with a fork. Top with cream cheese mixture; sprinkle with cheese.

Chili-Lime Almonds

Ingredients:
- 2 tablespoons butter
- 2 tablespoons chili powder
- 1 tablespoon lime juice
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 2 cups almonds

Directions:
- Melt first four ingredients in pan.
- Add almonds, and stir.
- Take off the heat and let sit until cool (about 15 minutes).
- Enjoy!

Taffy Apple Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 Tbsp. flour
- 1 egg
- 1 (8 oz.) can crushed pineapple (reserve juice)
- 4 c. Red Delicious apples, chopped
- 1 c. salted peanuts
- 1 (8 oz.) carton Cool Whip
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 2 Tbsp. apple cider vinegar

Directions:
- Combine flour and sugar; mix. Beat egg and add to flour and sugar mixture. Add vinegar and reserved pineapple juice.
- Cook and stir in 1 1/2 or 2-quart saucepan on low heat until thick, 3 to 5 minutes. Cool.

Chicken Parmesan Burgers

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. ground chicken
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1/2 tsp. Italian seasoning
- 1/2 cup panko bread crumbs
- 2 Tbsp. KRAFT Grated Parmesan Cheese
- 2 Tbsp. olive oil
- 1/4 cup CLASSICO Tomato and Basil Pasta Sauce
- 4 KRAFT Provolone Cheese Slices
- 8 fresh basil leaves
- 4 hamburger buns

Directions:
- Mix chicken, garlic and Italian seasoning just until blended; shape into 4 (1/2-inch-thick) patties.
- Combine bread crumbs and Parmesan in pie plate.
- Add chicken patties, 1 at a time, turning to evenly coat both sides of each patty.
- Heat oil in large skillet on medium heat.
- Add patties; cook 5 to 7 min.
- on each side or until done (165 degrees F).
- Top burgers with sauce and provolone; cover.
- Cook 1 to 2 min.
- or until provolone is melted.
- Top with basil.
- Serve in buns.

Just Like Fried Ice Cream

Ingredients:
- 2 c. any flavor ice cream
- 1 1/4 c. almond cluster multigrain cereal, coarsely crushed
- 2 tsp. margarine or butter, melted
- 4 tsp. honey
- 1/4 tsp. ground cinnamon

Directions:
- Using a large ice cream scoop, make four 1/2 cup scoops of ice cream. Place in a shallow pan. Cover and store in the freezer until firm.

Peter Paul Mounds Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 box Duncan Hines devil's food cake mix
- 2 eggs
- 1/2 stick butter
- 1 c. buttermilk
- 20 large marshmallows

Directions:
- Mix all together.
- Make 3 layers.
- Bake at 350° for 25 to 30 minutes.
- Cut each layer in half.

Grandma Evans' Sugar Cookies

Ingredients:
- 2 eggs
- 1 c. sugar
- 1 c. powdered sugar
- 1 c. butter or margarine
- 1 c. salad oil
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 tsp. soda
- 4 1/2 c. flour

Directions:
- Beat well first six ingredients.
- Fold in dry ingredients. Chill.
- Roll into walnut sized balls.
- Flatten with a glass.
- Bake about 10 minutes or until lightly browned in a 350° oven.

Tomato Salsa

Ingredients:
- 1 cup Tomato Sauce
- 1/2 tbsp Soya Sauce
- 1 tbsp Vinegar
- 1/2 cup Chopped onion
- 1 cup Chopped capsicum
- 1/2 tbsp Chat masala
- 1 tbsp Red chilli powder
- 1 tbsp Paprika
- 1/2 tbsp Oregano
- 1 tbsp Salt
- 1 tbsp Sugar
- 1 tbsp Ginger
- 1/2 tbsp Chopped Green chilli
- 1/2 tbsp Lemon juice
- 2 tbsp Peanuts
- 1/2 cup Cheese

Directions:
- Add tomato ketchup
- Add soya sauce,vinegar,lemon juice
- Add chopped onions and capsicum
- Add red chilli powder,chat masala,salt,paprika,oregano,sugar
- Add ginger,green chilli
- Add peanuts,cheese
- Optional : Serve with paratha or thepla,my recipe given below

Barbecued Country Style Ribs

Ingredients:
- 4 lb. spare ribs
- water
- 1/3 c. orange marmalade
- 1/4 c. lemon juice
- 1/4 c. soy sauce
- 1 clove garlic
- 2 tsp. cornstarch
- 2 Tbsp. water

Directions:
- Place ribs in large pan.
- Add enough water to cover.
- Heat to boiling.
- Reduce heat, cook 30 minutes.
- Remove ribs, drain.
- Place on grill, cook about 50 minutes turning frequently.
- Prepare orange sauce below.
- Spoon sauce on ribs, cook 5 minutes.
- Turn.
- Spoon sauce on ribs.
- Bake 5 minutes longer.

Monkey Bread

Ingredients:
- 3 cans biscuits
- 1/2 c. white sugar
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 1 tsp. nutmeg
- 1 stick butter
- 1 c. brown sugar

Directions:
- Can add some pecans.
