Sassafras Rice Casserole

Ingredients:
- 3 to 4 c. cooked rice (I prefer brown rice)
- 1/2 lb. smoked Cheddar, grated
- 1 c. chopped walnuts or pecans
- 1 c. peas
- 1/2 to 1 tsp. minced garlic
- 1/2 c. evaporated milk, or less as needed

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350°.
- Combine all ingredients except milk. Place in a 9 x 9-inch baking dish and pour milk around the sides of the dish.
- Bake 20 to 30 minutes until brown at edges.
- May top with cayenne or paprika to taste.

Spaghetti And Meat Balls

Ingredients:
- 2 lb. ground beef
- 1 onion, grated
- 1 Tbsp. parsley
- 1/2 tsp. oregano
- 1 Tbsp. oil

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients except oil.
- Make meat balls 1 to 1 1/2 inches in diameter.
- Fry in oil until brown on all sides.
- When done, set aside.

Bisquick Broccoli Quiche

Ingredients:
- 1 package broccoli chopped, thawed
- 1 cup cheddar cheese grated
- onion chopped
- 3 eggs
- 3/4 cup bisquick
- 1 1/2 cups milk

Directions:
- Mix three ingredients together (eggs, Bisquick and milk) - either mix in blender for 30 seconds or hand mix with a whisk.
- Grease bottom of Pyrex glass 10 inch pie pan.
- Place chopped broccoli in pie pan.
- Spread on bottom.
- Place onion and Cheddar cheese on top of broccoli.
- Pour milk mixture in pie pan over broccoli and cheese.
- Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until knife placed in center comes out clean.

Wilted Greens

Ingredients:
- 2 tsp. olive oil or vegetable oil
- 1 head napa cabbage (Chinese cabbage)
- 2 green onions
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 bag prewashed spinach
- 1 clove garlic

Directions:
- In nonstick 12-inch skillet or 5-quart Dutch oven, heat 1 teaspoon olive oil over medium-high heat until hot.
- Add napa cabbage, green onions, and 1/4 teaspoon salt and cook 5 minutes or until cabbage is wilted, stirring occasionally.
- Remove cabbage mixture to medium bowl.
- In same skillet or Dutch oven, in remaining 1 teaspoon olive oil, cook half of spinach until wilted, about 2 minutes.
- Add crushed garlic, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and remaining spinach.
- Cook, stirring constantly, until spinach is wilted, about 2 minutes longer.
- Return cabbage mixture to skillet, heat through, stirring occasionally.

Gingered Carrot Salad

Ingredients:
- 2 cups carrots, grated or shredded
- 1 cup grated jicama
- 1/4 cup finely minced scallion
- 1/2 tablespoon grated fresh ginger
- 5 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 4 tablespoons rice vinegar
- 1 tablespoon Asian sesame oil
- Salt and freshly ground black pepper

Directions:
- Place carrot, jicama, scallion and ginger in a bowl and mix well.
- Beat vegetable oil and vinegar together.
- Beat in sesame oil.
- Pour dressing over carrot mixture and season with salt and pepper.
- Allow to marinate several hours before serving.
- Serve plain or on a bed of lettuce.

German Potato Salad

Ingredients:
- 8 large potatoes
- 1 onion, chopped
- 8 slices bacon, chopped
- 4 dill pickles, chopped
- 1 c. mayonnaise
- 1/2 c. white vinegar
- 1/2 c. cream
- 1 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. sugar
- 1 tsp. pepper
- 2 tsp. prepared mustard

Directions:
- Boil potatoes in their skins until tender.
- Drain well, peel and break up into small chunks with a wooden spoon.
- In a skillet, saute onions
- and
- bacon
- until browned.
- Remove from heat and stir
- in
- the
- remaining ingredients.
- Pour over warm potatoes. Mix well and serve.
- Makes 8 servings.

Baharat Recipe

Ingredients:
- 1/4 c. black peppercorns
- 1/4 c. whole allspice
- 2 tsp grnd cinnamon
- 1 tsp freshly-grated nutmeg

Directions:
- Grind peppercorns and allspice together and blend with cinnamon and nutmeg.
- Store in tightly closed jar away from sunlight.
- This recipe yields 1/2 c..
- Comments: Baharat means spices in Arabic.
- It is an all-purpose spice mix used in Lebanon, Syria, Jordan and Palestine and found in many prepared savory dishes.
- Yield: 1/2 c.

Butterfinger pudding dessert

Ingredients:
- 1 premade angel food cake
- 1 box instant butterscotch pudding
- 1 1/2 milk
- 2 container of cool whip
- 2 butterfinger candy bars, crushed

Directions:
- in a 9x13 tear/cut angel food cake into 1 inch pieces
- place half of cake pieces in cake pan
- in bowl whisk pudding mix and milk for 30 seconds
- fold in 1 1/2 containers of cool whip into pudding mixture
- pour half of pudding mixture in pan over cake pieces
- sprinkle with one of the candy bars
- add the rest of the angel food cake pieces
- pour rest of pudding mixture over top.
- add remaining cool whip on top
- sprinkle with remaining butterfinger
- refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving

Marinated Grilled Flank Steak

Ingredients:
- juice of 1 lemon
- 1/2 c. soy sauce
- 1/4 c. dry red wine
- 3 Tbsp. vegetable oil
- 2 Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
- 1 large clove garlic, sliced or powder
- pepper to taste
- chopped green onion or chives (optional)
- chopped dill weed (optional)
- 1 to 1 1/2 lb. flank steak

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients in the pan in which the meat is to be marinated.
- Marinate steak, turning occasionally, for 2 to 12 hours in the refrigerator.
- Broil meat over hot coals for 5 minutes per side for rare meat or cook until desired doneness. Slice meat on a diagonal across the grain and serve.
- Great for summer on the grill.
- Makes 3 to 4 servings.

Creamy Aubergine And Cannellini Soup

Ingredients:
- 1 cup cannellini beans a can of cooked beans
- 2 aubergines
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 2 cloves garlic chopped
- 2 red chilis small dried, crushed or chopped
- 1 tablespoon fresh basil
- 1 tablespoon fresh parsley chopped
- 2 1/8 cups vegetable stock from 1 cube
- freshly ground black pepper
- 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese grated

Directions:
- Prick the eggplant and bake it on a tray at your oven's highest temperature for 40 minutes.
- In a deep pan fry the olive oil, garlic, chilli, basil and parsley until garlic is soft but not coloured.
- Cut the eggplant and scrape the insides into the pan.
- Add the cooked beans and stock.
- Bring to boil, simmer for 20 minutes.
- Puree half, then mix through the rest. Season with pepper.
- Sprinkle abundantly with grated Parmesan cheese and serve.

Holiday Confetti Snowballs

Ingredients:
- 1 cup butter, softened (no substitutes)
- 1/2 cup sugar
- 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
- 2 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1 (8 ounce) package Hershey kissables
- powdered sugar

Directions:
- Heat oven to 350°F.
- Beat butter, sugar and vanilla in large bowl until well blended. Gradually blend in flour. (Mixture will be crumbly, but will hold a shape if squeezed.)
- Stir in candies. Shape mixture into 1-inch balls.
- Place on ungreased cookie sheet.
- Bake 10 to 12 minutes or until set but not browned.
- Cool slightly; remove from cookie sheet to wire rack.
- While still slightly warm, roll in powdered sugar.
- Cool completely.
- Store in tightly covered container. Roll again in powdered sugar just before serving.

Artichoke Dip

Ingredients:
- 1 (14 oz.) can artichoke hearts
- 1 c. mayonnaise
- 1 c. Parmesan cheese
- salt and pepper to taste

Directions:
- Chop artichoke hearts up fine.
- Mix well with other ingredients.
- Sprinkle some Parmesan on top.
- Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.
- Dip with crackers or veggies.

Caramel Corn

Ingredients:
- 1/4 c. corn syrup
- 1 c. brown sugar
- 1/2 c. oleo
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 tsp. soda
- 2/3 c. popcorn

Directions:
- Microwave first 4 ingredients.
- Boil 2 minutes.
- Take out and add soda.
- Stir until very bubbly.
- Pop the popcorn.
- Spray inside of brown paper grocery bag with Pam.
- Put popcorn and caramel in the bag and shake.
- Yummy!

Cherry-Almond Couscous

Ingredients:
- 4 pieces scallions, chopped (save green part for garnishing)
- 3 cups couscous
- 2 tablespoons virgin olive oil
- 1/3 cup dried cherries
- 1/3 cup toasted almond slices or slivers
- 3 cups boiling water
- Salt and black pepper to taste

Directions:
- Mix scallion whites, couscous, olive oil and cherries.
- Boil water and add exactly 3 cups to bowl and quickly stir together.
- Immediately cover bowl with plastic wrap.
- Let stand 30 minutes.
- With a fork, fluff couscous, add almonds and check for seasoning.

S'Mores Marshmallow Pops

Ingredients:
- 12 pretzel sticks (4 inch)
- 12 Jet-Puffed Marshmallows
- 3 oz. Baker's Semi-Sweet Chocolate, melted
- 1/3 cup graham crumbs

Directions:
- Insert 1 end of each pretzel stick into marshmallow.
- Dip, 1 at a time, in chocolate then in graham crumbs, turning to evenly coat marshmallow; place on parchment-covered baking sheet.
- Refrigerate 30 min.
- or until chocolate coating is firm.

Bacon Wraps

Ingredients:
- 2 pkg. bacon
- 1 can cream of chicken soup
- 1 loaf white bread

Directions:
- Cut bacon in half.
- Cut crust off bread.
- Spread soup onto bread.
- Cut bread into thirds.
- Lay the cut bread on top of the cut bacon.
- Roll the bacon over the bread forming a tight roll. Secure with a toothpick.
- Bake in 350° oven for approximately 20 minutes or until bacon is crisp.

Spicy Italian Parmesan Chicken

Ingredients:
- 1 chicken breast
- 14 teaspoon oregano
- 14 teaspoon basil
- 14 teaspoon marjoram
- 18 teaspoon thyme
- 12 teaspoon garlic powder
- 18 cup parmesan cheese (grated)
- 12 tablespoon cayenne pepper (or to taste)
- olive oil

Directions:
- Heat skillet.
- Coat bottom of skillet with olive oil.
- Place thawed chicken breast in pan.
- Lightly coat one side of chicken breast with spice mixture.
- Cook until partially cooked on one side.
- Flip chicken breast.
- Lightly coat side of chicken breast with spice mixture.
- Place 1/2 of parmesan on top of upwards facing side of chicken.
- Cook until no longer pink.
- Flip (some parmesan will fall off.
- ).
- Let cook for about 30-45 seconds.
- Place remaining parmesan on the opposite side of the chicken breast.
- Flip.
- Let cook for about 30-45 seconds.
- (Cheese will form a sort of "crust".
- ).
- Serve.

Graduation Caps

Ingredients:
- 1 (16 ounce) package chocolate candiquik candy coating
- 1 (14 1/2 ounce) box graham crackers
- 24 miniature peanut butter cups (Reese's)
- cake writing icing
- round candy sprinkles

Directions:
- Melt CANDIQUIK(R) Candy Coating in Melt and Make Microwaveable TrayTM according to directions on package. Cut graham crackers into 1 inch squares.
- Dip 1" graham cracker squares in CANDIQUIK(R) Candy Coating; place on wax paper to dry. Place a round sprinkle in the center of each graham cracker while coating is still wet.
- Place unwrapped peanut butter cups upside-down. Use a dab of CANDIQUIK(R) Candy Coating to affix dried chocolate graham cracker squares to bottoms of peanut butter cups.
- 4.With writing icing, pipe on a tassel.

Blackened Grouper

Ingredients:
- 10 (6-ounce) grouper fillets
- 5 teaspoons canola oil, divided
- 5 teaspoons butter, divided
- 10 lemon wedges

Directions:
- Rub each side of fillets with Cajun Spice Mix. Heat 2 1/2 teaspoons oil and 2 1/2 teaspoons butter in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add 5 fillets; cook for 4 minutes on each side or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork or until desired degree of doneness. Repeat procedure with remaining oil, butter, and fillets. Serve with lemon wedges.

7-Up Cake

Ingredients:
- 2 sticks margarine
- 1/2 c. solid shortening
- 3 c. sugar
- 5 eggs
- 3 c. flour
- 3/4 c. 7-Up
- 1 tsp. lemon flavoring
- 1 tsp. butter flavoring

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 325°.
- Grease and flour Bundt pan or use Baker's Joy (sprays oil and flour at the same time).
- In a large bowl, cream margarine, shortening, sugar and eggs until well blended.
- Sift flour and add alternately with 7-Up, beginning and ending with flour.
- Add flavorings.
- Pour into prepared pan.
- Bake at 325° for at least 1 hour or until done.
- Let cool in pan for 20 minutes. Turn out onto rack and cool completely.

Gallitos De Papa From Costa Rica

Ingredients:
- 3 large potatoes
- 2 garlic cloves, chopped finely
- 3 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 1 teaspoon sugar
- 1 teaspoon paprika (if you can find it) or 1 teaspoon ground annatto seed (if you can find it)
- 4 corn tortillas
- 2 teaspoons chopped coriander, if desired, as garnish

Directions:
- Peel potatoes and dice into small pieces.
- Saute the finely chopped garlic in the oil and add some salt, about 1 teaspoon.
- Add the potatoes, sugar, and paprika.
- Cover the pan and cook on low heat, about 20 minutes, adding water as needed to prevent the potatoes from sticking.
- Remove and serve on the corn tortillas, which you can warm in the oven on a cookie sheet at 200°F.
- Garnish, to taste, with chopped coriander, salt, and pepper.
- Also, a little sour cream or salsa is often served as an accompaniment.

Ladybirds Ghost Sandwiches

Ingredients:
- 2 slice bread
- 2 slice cheese
- 2 slice cold meat of your choice , i used devon
- 1 few drops tomato sauce

Directions:
- Take your slices of bread and cut the crusts off .
- Cut the meat slice to a square shape to fit under the slice of cheese .
- Butter the prepared bread slices .
- Add one prepared slice of cold meat per slice of bread .
- Cut out eye holes , nose hold and scary mouth shapes in the cheese slice .
- Add couple drops of tomato sauce on top of the prepared cold meat slice on the bread , roughly where the eye and mouth holes will be .
- Place the prepared slice of cheese on top of the sauce dotted cold meat slice on the slice of bread and push down a little so the sauce oozes out a little to look like blood drops .
- Place on serving plate and enjoy .
- :-) .
- Fun for the kids

Pork With Chili Sauce - Atkins - 3.5 Net Carbs

Ingredients:
- 1 scallion, chopped
- 3 garlic cloves
- 12 cup green pepper, chopped
- 13 cup tomatillo, chopped
- 1 serrano chili, seeded and chopped
- 12 cup beef stock
- 1 tablespoon lime juice, fresh
- 3 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 12 lbs pork loin, cubed
- 1 tablespoon chili powder

Directions:
- Preheat broiler.
- Combine scallion, garlic, pepper, tomatillos, chili, stock, and lime juice in a food processor and process for 1 min until well blended.
- Transfer mixture to a saucepan and bring to a boil.
- Reduce heat and simmer 10 minute.
- Heat oil in large nonstick skillet over med heat.
- Add pork and sprinkle with chili powder.
- Cook 6-8 min, until browned and cooked through.
- Pour off excess oil.
- Add chili sauce to skillet and mix well.
- Transfer to platter and serve immediately.

Lemon Pie

Ingredients:
- 1 can Eagle Brand milk
- 1/4 c. lemon juice
- 1 (7 oz.) can Angel Flake coconut
- 1 (9 oz.) Cool Whip
- 1 (20 oz.) can crushed pineapple, drained
- 1 c. pecans, finely chopped
- 1 graham cracker pie shells

Directions:
- Mix in the order listed above; pour into the two pie shells and refrigerate. Makes a very rich dessert.

Grilled Halibut With Lemon-Caper Vinaigrette

Ingredients:
- Vinaigrette:
- 1 1/2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice
- 1 tablespoon extravirgin olive oil
- 1 1/2 teaspoons finely chopped shallot
- 1 teaspoon chopped capers
- 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt
- 1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
- Fish:
- Cooking spray
- 4 (6-ounce) halibut fillets
- 1/2 teaspoon kosher salt
- 2 tablespoons chopped fresh chives

Directions:
- To prepare the vinaigrette, combine first 6 ingredients in a small bowl; stir with a whisk.
- To prepare fish, heat a nonstick grill pan over medium-high heat. Coat pan with cooking spray. Sprinkle fish with 1/2 teaspoon salt. Add fish to pan; grill 4 minutes on each side or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork or until desired degree of doneness. Spoon vinaigrette over fish. Sprinkle with chives.

Hill Country Hot Wings 

Ingredients:
- 1 c cider vinger
- 1 bottle louisiana hot sauce
- 1 tbsp of salt and pepper
- 2 tbsp red pepper flakes and suger
- 1/2 cup ketchup
- 4 lb chinken wings

Directions:
- 1) combine all in a mixing bowl and refrigerate for 10mins ( vinger bring out the red pepper, longer the marinade sits, the hotter it will be)
- 2) pre heat oven to 400* and place on a sheet pan with rack . 20-25 mins.
- 3) sprinkle with sea salt and brush with olive oil to give a sheen

Garden Pizza

Ingredients:
- 1 large and 1 small pkg. Pillsbury crescent dinner rolls
- 1 (8 oz.) and 1 (3 oz.) pkg. cream cheese
- 1 Tbsp. horseradish
- 1 1/2 Tbsp. dill weed or dill seed
- 1 1/2 tsp. onion flakes or 1/4 c. minced onion
- 1 tsp. garlic salt
- dash of pepper sauce (optional)
- assorted raw chopped vegetables: broccoli, cauliflower, red and green peppers, sliced olives, shredded carrots
- shredded Cheddar cheese

Directions:
- Bake crescent rolls flat in jelly roll pan.
- Set aside.
- Mix cream cheese, mayo, horseradish, dill weed, onion, garlic salt and pepper sauce.
- Spread on dough and top with assorted raw chopped vegetables.
- Sprinkle with shredded Cheddar cheese. Cut into squares and serve.

No Calorie Dip

Ingredients:
- 1 carton cottage cheese
- 1 c. Ortega chillies
- 1 Tbsp. garlic salt

Directions:
- Place in a blender.
- Mix thoroughly.
- (If desired, add 2 tablespoons mayonnaise.)

Crunchy Mashed Potatoes

Ingredients:
- 3 cups chicken broth
- 1 cup 2% milk
- 1 garlic clove, minced
- 1/4 teaspoon pepper
- 3 cups mashed potato flakes
- 1/4 cup sour cream
- 1-1/2 cups cheddar French-fried onions
- 1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese

Directions:
- In a large saucepan, bring broth to a boil. Remove from heat. Add the milk, garlic and pepper. Whisk in potato flakes and sour cream until smooth.
- Spoon potato mixture into a greased 9-in. square baking pan. Sprinkle with onions and cheese. Broil 4-6 in. from heat for 20-30 seconds or until golden brown.

Shaved Honeycrisp Apple And Kale Salad

Ingredients:
- 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil
- Zest and juice of 1 medium lemon
- 2 cups thinly sliced kale
- 1/4 cup finely shredded parmesan cheese
- 1/4 cup roughly chopped candied almonds
- 1 Honeycrisp apple
- About 1/4 tsp. kosher salt
- About 1/4 tsp. pepper
- Ichimi togarashi*

Directions:
- Whisk together oil, zest, and juice in a medium bowl. Add kale, cheese, and almonds, then toss to coat.
- Cut sides off apple into 4 pieces, leaving the core. Slice the apple pieces thinly with a mandoline or a knife. Add to salad and toss to coat. Season with salt, pepper, and ichimi togarashi.
- *Find at Asian markets or online.

Stuffed Peppers

Ingredients:
- 4 large green peppers
- 10 c. boiling water
- 1 lb. ground beef (lean)
- 1/4 c. chopped celery
- 1/2 c. soft bread crumbs
- 1 1/4 c. crushed potato chips
- 2 eggs, beaten
- 1/4 tsp. catsup
- 1/4 tsp. poultry seasoning
- paprika
- 3/4 c. buttermilk

Directions:
- Slice tops off peppers; remove seeds and rinse.
- Place peppers in container and cover with boiling water and let stand 10 minutes.
- Drain peppers and sprinkle cavities with salt.
- Mix ground beef, 1 cup crushed potato chips, buttermilk, eggs, catsup and poultry seasoning.
- Fill peppers with mixture.
- Place filled peppers in baking dish.
- Sprinkle with remaining chips and paprika.
- Bake at 375° for 30 minutes.

Crepes

Ingredients:
- 1 cup all purpose flour
- 4 eggs
- 4 tbsp. butter, melted
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 3/4 cups milk
- 1 tsp. butter

Directions:
- Combine flour, eggs, melted butter, salt and milk in food processor until smooth.
- Chill at least 30 minutes.
- Cook crepes in omelette pan.
- Butter when cooked.
- Can be filled with any assortment of fillings.
- Example: cream cheese and sausage crepes are very good!

Linguine With Clams

Ingredients:
- 1 can chopped clams
- 1/2 c. chopped fresh parsley
- 1 can clam sauce

Directions:
- Heat and pour over cooked linguine pasta.
- Serve with garlic bread.

Pineapple Casserole

Ingredients:
- 1 (20 oz.) can crushed pineapple
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 1 Tbsp. flour
- 1/4 c. melted butter
- 1/2 c. crushed Ritz crackers
- 1 c. shredded Cheddar cheese

Directions:
- Drain pineapple; reserve 3 tablespoons of juice.
- Combine sugar and flour; stir in juice.
- Add cheese and pineapple, mixing well.
- Spoon into a greased 1-quart casserole dish.
- Combine melted butter and cracker crumbs; mix well.
- Sprinkle over pineapple mixture.
- Bake at 350° for 20 to 30 minutes.
- This is good as a side dish for meat, especially ham.

Chocolate-Chicory Sauce 

Ingredients:
- 10 oz bittersweet chocolate, finely chopped
- 1 1/2 cups heavy cream
- 1/2 cup brewed chicory coffee, such as Cafe du Monde brand
- 1 cinnamon stick

Directions:
- Put chocolate in a heatproof bowl. In a small saucepan, combine cream, coffee, and cinnamon stick; bring to a simmer over medium heat. Pour hot cream mixture over chocolate.
- Let stand, undisturbed, for about 2 minutes. Discard cinnamon stick; whisk until chocolate is completely melted and mixture is blended and smooth.

Crock Pot Pepper Steak

Ingredients:
- 2 (36 ounce) jars mushroom and green pepper flavor spaghetti sauce
- 1 (6 ounce) can tomato paste
- 3 green peppers
- 2 lbs stew meat
- 3 teaspoons sugar
- 2 teaspoons onion powder

Directions:
- Cut Green Peppers.
- In crock pot mix stew meat, Ragu sauce, tomato paste, green peppers, sugar and onion powder.
- Cook on low-medium heat for 7 hours.
- Serve over white rice.

Mayor Richard ("dick") Caliguiri's Ricotta Cheese Ball

Ingredients:
- 3 lbs ricotta cheese
- 1 lb mozzarella cheese, shredded
- 2 eggs, lightly beaten
- 1 12 cups seasoned bread crumbs
- 14 cup freshly grated parmesan cheese
- 1 teaspoon poultry seasoning
- seasoned bread crumbs (for dredging)
- vegetable oil (for frying)

Directions:
- Combine the first six ingredients in a large bowl.
- Mix well; chill for at least 4 hours.
- Shape into 1" balls; roll in the additional bread crumbs.
- Refrigerate at least another 1/2 hr.before cooking.
- In a large skillet, saute the cheese balls over medium heat in vegetable oil until golden brown.
- Drain on paper towels and serve.

Blueberry Pie

Ingredients:
- 2 1/2 c. blueberries
- 1 c. sugar
- 1/4 c. flour
- 1/8 tsp. salt
- 1 Tbsp. lemon juice
- 2 Tbsp. butter
- 2 pastry crusts

Directions:
- Combine berries, sugar, flour, salt and lemon juice. Place in pastry crust. Dot with butter. Cover with second pastry crust. Pinch edges to seal. Make slits in middle of top.
- Bake in hot 400° oven about 10 minutes. Reduce heat to 350°; cook for about 40 minutes more.

Choklit Cac

Ingredients:
- 1/2 kop of choklt
- 15 kops of yotr
- 6 egs
- 10 cups flir
- 7 scops icen

Directions:
- Put water in a pan.
- One cup.
- Buy carrots, tomatoes, onions, celery, corn, peas and chicken.
- Put in water pot.
- Add 2 cups water.
- Put on stove and turn on oven.
- Cook for 2 minutes.
- Stir soup.
- Add salt and pepper, about 6 ounces.
- Check to see if soup is warm.
- If not warm, cook for 1 more hour. Take off stove. Turn off stove.
- Then eat it with grilled cheese sandwich for lunch.

Japanese Style Omelet: Soft Dashimaki Tamago with a Hint of Sake

Ingredients:
- 2 Eggs
- 1/2 tbsp Shiro-dashi
- 1 tsp Mirin
- 1 tbsp Sake
- 1 tsp Sugar (optional)
- 3 tbsp Water
- 1 Vegetable oil (for cooking eggs)

Directions:
- In a bowl, lightly combine all the ingredients except the vegetable oil.
- In a Japanese omelet pan, heat a little bit of oil and pour in half of the egg mixture.
- Stir lightly once or twice.
- Keep the half cooked egg on one side of the pan.
- Pour in the rest of the egg mixture.
- When the eggs are set on top and nearly cooked through, quickly shape the omelet by rolling it up.

Beef Log

Ingredients:
- 3 lb. ground chuck or 1 1/2 lb. beef, lamb or elk
- 1 c. water
- 1 tsp. liquid smoke
- 1 Tbsp. brown sugar, packed
- 1/2 tsp. garlic salt or powder
- 2 Tbsp. Morton Tender Quick salt
- 2 Tbsp. mustard seed
- 1 1/2 Tbsp. cracked black pepper

Directions:
- Mix spices with water.
- Add to beef.
- Refrigerate overnight. Form rolls in wax paper and lift into the broiler pan that is sprayed with Pam.
- Bake at 300° for 1 hour and 45 minutes.
- Turn over about halfway through cooking if desired (in lower it will be done in one hour).
- Cool and wrap in foil.
- Keep in refrigerator.

Lick-The-Bowl-Clean Chocolate Frosting

Ingredients:
- 1 (2 pound) package confectioners' sugar, divided
- 1 cup shortening
- 1/2 cup cold water, or more as needed
- 1/2 cup unsweetened cocoa powder
- 1 tablespoon Irish cream liqueur (such as Bailey's Irish Cream(R))
- 1 1/2 teaspoons pure vanilla extract
- 1/2 teaspoon salt

Directions:
- Beat 1/2 of the confectioner's sugar, shortening, cold water, cocoa powder, Irish cream liqueur, vanilla extract, and salt together in a bowl with an electric mixer until light and fluffy, about 8 minutes. Beat in the remaining confectioner's sugar. If necessary, add cold water, 1 tablespoon at a time, to reach desired consistency.

Victorian Sandwich

Ingredients:
- 250 g butter
- 250 g sugar
- 4 eggs
- 250 g cake flour
- 12 g baking powder

Directions:
- Using a medium size bowl, With bare hands, mix butter and sugar.
- continue until light in color.
- Add eggs one by one.
- In a separate bowl, mix cake flour and baking powder.
- Add gradually to butter mixture using a cut and fold motion.
- Using a 2 round baking pans (8-inch), brush with shortening and dust little flour.
- Divide the mixture and pour into pans.
- Even out using pastry scraper.
- Bake in 170C for 15 minutes.
- Check with wooden toothpick.
- Even out both baked cakes using a bread knife.
- Fill in one baked cake with jam.
- And place other cake on top.
- Dust with powdered sugar.

Chicken And Zucchini Casserole

Ingredients:
- 3 medium sized zucchini, washed (about 1 lb.)
- 2 1/2 to 3 lb. chicken pieces
- salt and pepper to taste
- 2/3 c. bottled barbecue sauce
- 1 tsp. dried oregano leaves
- 1 Tbsp. lemon juice
- 1 tsp. minced onion

Directions:
- Heat oven to 400°.
- Slice unpeeled zucchini crosswise into slices about 1/2-inch thick.
- Arrange along bottom of a shallow 3-quart baking dish.
- Sprinkle chicken with salt and pepper. Place chicken over zucchini.
- In a small bowl combine remaining ingredients and pour evenly over chicken.
- Bake, uncovered, for 30 minutes.
- Baste chicken with sauce from baking dish and continue cooking for 30 minutes or until chicken is done.
- Serves 4.

AMIEs CIARAMICOLA

Ingredients:
- 400 grams baking flour
- 200 grams sugar
- 2 eggs
- 100 grams butter, melted
- 60 grams alchermes liquore
- 15 grams baking powder
- 1 orange juice and rind
- 1 a pinch of salt
- 2 egg whites
- 200 grams sugar
- 1 tsp lemon juice
- 1 colored small chips, for decoration

Directions:
- Beat eggs until fluffy.
- Add the sugar gradually and beat until thick.
- Combine the butter, orange juice and orange rind, and a pinch of salt.
- Beat until smooth
- Fold in flour, liquore and baking powder.
- Fold gently, bringing scraper accross bottom of bowl, and continue folding until completely blended.
- Bake at 170AC for 30 minutes.
- Meanwhile, beat egg whites with sugar and lemon juice until they form very stiff peaks.
- When the cake is cooked and done, spread the frosting all over the cake and sprinkle colored sweet chips on top.
- Return the cake in the oven at 150AC for 15-20 minutes until the frosting is dry.
- Serve, share and enjoy.

Quick Spoon Rolls

Ingredients:
- 1/4 c. sugar
- 1 1/2 sticks margarine, melted
- 2 c. very warm water
- 1 egg, slightly beaten
- 1 pkg. dry yeast
- 4 c. self-rising flour

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients together.
- Drop by spoonfuls in greased muffin pans.
- Do not let rise in pans.
- Just pop into preheated 400° oven and bake 15 to 20 minutes or until brown.
- Dough will keep in fridge for several days.
- Do not stir when removed from the fridge.
- Just bake as directed.

Perfect Chicken Brine

Ingredients:
- 16 cups water
- 3/4 cup kosher salt
- 2/3 cup white sugar
- 2 heads garlic, crushed and chopped
- 1/4 cup dried sage, or to taste
- 1/4 cup dried basil, or to taste
- 1 tablespoon whole black peppercorns
- 1 large bay leaf

Directions:
- Mix water, kosher salt, white sugar, garlic, sage, basil, peppercorns, and bay leaf in a large pot over medium-high heat; bring to a simmer and cook, stirring occasionally, until the salt and sugar are dissolved completely, about 20 minutes.
- Remove pot from heat and cover with a lid. Cool brine at room temperature for 2 hours before refrigerating to cool completely.

Mom'S Upside-Down Pizza

Ingredients:
- 2 lbs ground beef
- 1 cup onion, chopped
- 15 ounces tomato sauce
- 1 1/4 ounces spaghetti sauce mix
- 8 ounces sour cream
- 8 ounces mozzarella cheese, shredded
- 8 ounces crescent roll dough

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350.
- Brown meat and onion in a large skillet and drain.
- Stir in tomato sauce and mix, cook over low heat for 10 minutes.
- Spoon mixture into lightly greased 13X9 dish, top with sour cream and sprinkle with cheese.
- Unroll crescent rolls and place over cheese.
- Bake, uncovered, for 20 to 25 minutes until done.

Angel Hair Pasta W/Garlic & Sun-Dried Tomatoes

Ingredients:
- 8 ounces angel hair pasta
- 34 cup olive oil
- 14 cup sun-dried tomato (chopped)
- 6 garlic cloves (pressed or minced)
- 1 tablespoon italian seasoning
- parmesan cheese, for sprinkling

Directions:
- Cook pasta in boiling water for 3-5 minutes (depending on your taste).
- Drain.
- In a small saucepan, heat olive oil until warm.
- Add sundried tomatoes& garlic.
- Saute for 4 minutes.
- Add italian seasoning and saute for 1 more minute.
- Toss drained pasta with desired amount of sauce.
- Sprinkle with parmesan cheese.

White Cheddar Cheese Dip

Ingredients:
- 4 cups shredded white cheddar cheese
- 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour
- 1/4 teaspoon dry mustard
- 1/4 teaspoon onion powder
- 3/4 cup half-and-half
- 1/2 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce
- 1 loaf unsliced pumpernickel bread
- paprika
- red apple, sliced
- green apple, sliced

Directions:
- In 8-cup measure, combine cheese, flour, dry mustard and onion powder.
- Toss to coat.
- Stir in half-and-half and Worcestershire sauce.
- Microwave at%50 (Medium) for 5 to 7 minutes, or until mixture can be stirred smooth, stirring twice with whisk.
- Set aside.
- Cut to 1 to 1 1/2-inch slice from top of bread.
- Cut around inside of loaf, leaving 1/2 inch of bread around outside.
- Remove center, leaving at least 1 inch of bread on bottom.
- Cut center and top into pieces for dipping.
- Spoon warm cheese mixture into bread shell.
- Sprinkle with paprika.
- Serve with bread cubes and apples slices for dippers.

Potato Salad

Ingredients:
- 2 lb. potatoes (about 6 medium)
- 1/2 c. finely chopped onion
- 1/4 c. bottled Italian dressing
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/8 tsp. pepper
- 1/2 c. mayonnaise
- 1/2 c. chopped celery
- 2 hard-cooked eggs, cut up

Directions:
- Heat water to boiling.
- Add potatoes and heat to boiling. Reduce heat; cover and cook until tender.
- Drain and cool.
- Cut potatoes into cubes; stir in onion, salad dressing, salt and pepper.
- Cover and refrigerate at least 2 hours.

Hero Sandwich

Ingredients:
- 2 teaspoons extra-virgin olive oil
- 1 teaspoon balsamic vinegar
- salt
- fresh ground black pepper
- 1 (6 -8 inch) Italian rolls, sliced lengthwise down the middle (can use French roll)
- 2 teaspoons mayonnaise (optional)
- 2 thin slices soppressata
- 3 thin slices prosciutto, preferably imported from Italy
- 2 thick slices fresh buffalo mozzarella cheese
- 18 cup yellow onion, chopped finely (or sliced paper thin)
- 14 cup shredded romaine lettuce or 14 cup iceberg lettuce
- 2 thick slices tomatoes
- 2 teaspoons sliced pepperoncini peppers (optional)
- 4 basil leaves

Directions:
- In a small bowl, whisk together the oil, vinegar, salt and pepper to taste; set aside.
- Spread mayo (if using) inside roll, then drizzle with half the oil-vinegar mixture.
- Layer soppressatta, prosciutto, and mozzarella inside roll.
- Add onions, lettuce, tomato, pepperoncini, and basil.
- Drizzle with remaining oil-vinegar mixture.
- Close sandwich and dig in.

Cheddar Twice-Baked Potatoes

Ingredients:
- 6 large baking potatoes
- 8 tablespoons butter, divided
- 1/4 pound sliced bacon, diced
- 1 medium onion, finely chopped
- 1/2 cup 2% milk
- 1 large egg
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/8 teaspoon white pepper
- 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 400°. Scrub and pierce potatoes; rub each with 1 teaspoon butter. Place on a
- . Bake 45-50 minutes or until tender.
- Meanwhile, in a small skillet, cook bacon over medium heat until crisp. Remove to paper towels; drain, reserving 1 tablespoon drippings. In drippings, saute onion until tender; set aside.
- When potatoes are cool enough to handle, cut a thin slice off the top of each and discard. Scoop out pulp, leaving a thin shell. In a small bowl, mash pulp with remaining butter. Stir in milk, egg, salt and pepper. Stir in the cheese, bacon and onion.
- Spoon into the potato shells. Place on a
- . Bake at 400° 15-20 minutes or until heated through.

Pineapple Pops

Ingredients:
- 2 cups plain yogurt
- 1/2 cup canned crushed pineapple (packed in its own juice instead of packed in syrup)
- 1 (12 ounce) can pineapple juice concentrate (concentrate, thawed) or (12 ounce) can pineapple-orange juice (concentrate, thawed)

Directions:
- Drain the can of crushed pineapple so all the juice runs out.
- Put all the ingredients in a medium-sized bowl and mix them together.
- Spoon the mixture into the paper cups. Fill them almost to the top.
- Stretch a small piece of plastic wrap across the top of each cup.
- Using the popsicle stick, poke a hole in the plastic wrap. Stand the stick straight up in the center of the cup.
- Put the cups in the freezer until the mixture is frozen solid.
- Remove the plastic wrap and peel away the paper cup and enjoy.

Fruit Salad

Ingredients:
- 2 (11 oz.) cans mandarin oranges, drained
- 6 medium bananas, sliced
- 1 (No. 2) can crushed pineapple, drained and juice saved
- 1 (6 oz.) pkg. mini marshmallows
- drained pineapple juice
- 2 eggs, beaten
- 1 Tbsp. sugar
- 1 Tbsp. flour
- 1 (3 oz.) pkg. apricot, peach or orange gelatin

Directions:
- Combine pineapple juice, eggs, sugar and flour.
- Cook over low heat until thick, about 5 minutes.
- Add gelatin; stir until dissolved.
- Cool before adding orange sections, bananas, pineapple and marshmallows.
- Chill in refrigerator for several hours before serving.

Bread And Butter Sticks

Ingredients:
- 8 slices white bread, edges trimmed
- 1/4 to 1/2 c. melted butter
- 1/4 tsp. Italian seasoning
- 1/2 tsp. Parmesan cheese

Directions:
- Cut each slice of bread into 4 sticks.
- Combine butter, seasoning, and Parmesan.
- Stir well to mix.
- Brush on both sides of the sticks.
- Place on an ungreased baking sheet and bake at 400 degrees for 5 minutes.
- Turn the sticks over and continue baking for another 5 minutes or until the sticks are lightly browned.

Tamale Casserole

Ingredients:
- 1 to 1 1/2 lb. ground meat
- 1/3 c. chopped onion
- 1 tsp. chili powder
- 1 can Niblet corn
- 1 can Ranch Style beans
- 1 can tomato sauce
- 1 c. grated cheese (optional)
- 1/2 tsp. black pepper
- corn bread batter

Directions:
- Brown meat and onions.
- Add chili powder, corn, beans and tomato sauce and pepper.
- Simmer 15 minutes.
- Pour mixture in baking dish.
- Sprinkle with cheese and cover with corn bread batter.
- Bake 20 minutes at 425°.

Best Macaroni Salad

Ingredients:
- 8 ounces elbow macaroni (4 cups cooked)
- 1 (7 ounce) can tuna, drained (optional)
- 1 green pepper, chopped
- 1 tomatoes, chopped
- 1 cup low-fat mayonnaise
- 2 tablespoons vinegar
- 2 teaspoons prepared mustard
- 1 1/2 teaspoons salt
- 1/8 teaspoon pepper
- 1/2 teaspoon celery seed

Directions:
- Combine the macaroni, tuna, pepper and tomato.
- Mix together the mayonnaise, vinegar, mustard, salt, pepper and celery seeds, and stir into the macaroni mixture.
- Chill.

Coconut Ice Cooked Version

Ingredients:
- 450 g sugar
- 150 ml milk
- 150 g desiccated coconut (a very finely ground dried shelf-stable coconut)
- 2 -5 drops red food coloring

Directions:
- Grease a pan (8x6inches) with oil or butter.
- Heat sugar and milk in large heavy saucepan over low heat. Stir with a wooden spoon until sugar has dissolved.
- Bring to a boil, cover, and boil for 3 minutes exactly.
- Uncover and place a prewarmed candy thermometer in the pan. Boil until it reaches 116C/240F, the soft ball stage.
- Remove from heat and stir in coconut.
- Quickly pour the mixture into the pan.
- Add food colouring, stir in quickly and pour into pan on top of the white layer.
- Cool until half-set, mark into squares or fingers with an oiled knife.
- Leave until completely set then break or cut into pieces.
- Wrap in waxed paper and store in an airtight container in a cool place for up to 7 days.

Tdg Blue Cornmeal Porridge 

Ingredients:
- 1 c TdG Blue Cornmeal
- 3 c water
- 1 pinch salt

Directions:
- If you remember, mix the ingredients in the pan the night before.
- 
- Otherwise, add the water to the salted meal, and bring to the boil stirring the while. As soon as it thickens turn the heat to very low, and put on the lid. Cook another ten minutes or so, stirring now and again.
- 
- Serve in bowls with syrup, home made jam, red chile and a fried egg, or sprinkled with brown sugar.

Avocado And Chickpea Sandwiches 

Ingredients:
- 1 (15 ounce) can chickpeas
- 1 large ripe avocado
- 1/4 cup fresh cilantro, chopped
- 2 tablespoons chopped green onion
- Juice from 1 lime
- Salt and pepper, to taste
- Bread of your choice
- Fresh spinach leaves or other sandwich toppings: lettuce, tomato slices, sprouts, etc.

Directions:
- 1. Rinse and drain the chickpeas.
- 
- 2. In a medium bowl, using a fork or potato masher, smash the chickpeas and avocado together. Add in cilantro, green onion, and lime juice. Season with salt and pepper, to taste.
- 
- 3. Spread salad on bread and top with your favorite sandwich toppings.

Orange-Cashew Cookies

Ingredients:
- 1/2 cup butter or margarine, softened
- 23 cups sugar
- 1 each eggs
- 1 teaspoon orange zest grated
- 3 tablespoons orange juice
- 2 cups flour, all-purpose
- 1 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1 cup cashew nuts chopped

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350F (180C).
- Beat butter and sugar in large bowl until creamy.
- Beat in egg, orange peel and juice until light and fluffy.
- Mix in flour, baking soda and salt until well blended.
- Stir in cashews.
- Drop tablespoonfuls of dough 2 inches apart onto ungreased cookie sheets.
- Bake 9 minutes or until lightly browned.
- Remove to wire racks; cool completely.
- Store in airtight container.

Wine Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 pkg. yellow cake mix with pudding
- 1/2 tsp. nutmeg
- 4 large eggs
- 3/4 c. cream sherry
- 3/4 c. vegetable oil

Directions:
- Combine all ingredients; mix on low speed one minute, mix on medium speed three minutes.
- Oil and flour a Bundt pan; pour in mix.
- Bake 45 minutes at 350°; cool 15 minutes.
- After removing from pan, sprinkle with powdered sugar if desired.

Stove Top Pot Roast

Ingredients:
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 1 (3 pound) beef chuck roast
- 1 red onion, chopped
- 4 cloves garlic, crushed
- 4 stalks celery, chopped
- 1 tablespoon dried basil
- salt and pepper to taste
- 6 medium red potatoes, quartered
- 6 turnips, peeled and cut into chunks
- 6 carrots, peeled and cut into chunks

Directions:
- Heat the oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Place the roast in the pot, and quickly brown on all sides.
- Fill the pot with enough water to cover the roast. Add the onion, garlic, celery, basil, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low and simmer for 2 hours and 15 minutes, adding water if needed to keep the roast covered. Add potatoes and turnips; simmer for an additional 15 minutes. Add carrots; simmer for 30 minutes, or until roast can be pulled apart with a fork. Taste, and adjust salt and pepper if needed before serving.

Beet Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 small pkg. raspberry Jell-O
- 1 pkg. strawberry Jell-O
- 1 pkg. cherry Jell-O
- 4 c. boiling water
- 1/2 c. sweet pickle juice
- 1 (16 to 17 oz.) can julienne
- 1 (16 oz.) can crushed pineapple

Directions:
- Dissolve packages of Jell-O in boiling water and pickle juice. Cool until slightly thickened.
- Add remaining ingredients.
- Chill until set.

Crunchy Peanut Bar Cookies

Ingredients:
- 1 cup whipping cream
- 1 cup sugar
- 1 cup light corn syrup
- 1 tablespoon butter or margarine
- 6 cups corn flakes cereal
- 2 cups oven-toasted rice cereal
- 2 cups salted peanuts

Directions:
- Combine whipping cream, sugar, syrup, and butter in a 3- quart saucepan; cook over low heat, stirring constantly, until sugar dissolves. Cook over medium heat, without stirring, until mixture registers 232° (thread stage) on a candy thermometer. Remove from heat.
- Combine cereal and peanuts in a large mixing bowl. Pour hot sugar mixture over cereal mixture, stirring well to combine. Press firmly into a greased 13- x 9- x 2-inch baking pan, using back of spoon. Cool and cut into 2- x 1-inch bars.

Pizza Casserole

Ingredients:
- 3 cups Macaroni Or Other Pasta, Cooked
- 1 pound Sausage, Browned
- 1 whole Onion, Diced
- 1 whole Green Pepper, Chopped
- 1 can (10.75 Oz. Can) Cheddar Cheese Soup
- 6 cups Spaghetti Or Pizza Sauce
- 1 can (about 3 Oz. Can) Sliced Black Olives
- 1 can (4 Oz. Can) Mushrooms
- 2 cups Sliced Pepperoni
- 4 cups Shredded Mozzarella Cheese
- 2 ounces, weight Parmesan Cheese

Directions:
- Cook macaroni and set aside.
- Brown sausage and set aside.
- Saute the onions and peppers and set them aside.
- Spray a 9x13 pan with cooking spray.
- Pour cooked macaroni into the pan.
- Stir in cheddar cheese soup, spaghetti sauce, sauteed onions/peppers mixture as well as the olives, mushrooms, pepperoni and sausage.
- Spread mozzarella on the top, and then sprinkle with Parmesan.
- Bake in 350 degree oven for 30 minutes or until bubbly and heated through.

Grape Jelly Meatballs

Ingredients:
- 1 small onion
- 1 1/2 pounds ground beef
- 1 cup breadcrumbs
- 2 eggs
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1 (18-ounce) jar grape jelly
- 1 (12-ounce) bottle chili sauce

Directions:
- Preheat the oven to 350F.
- Peel and finely chop the onion.
- Place the ground beef, onion, breadcrumbs, eggs, and salt in a large bowl and mix with your hands until thoroughly combined.
- Roll the mixture into 1-inch balls and place them on a baking sheet.
- Bake for 30 to 35 minutes, until cooked through.
- Remove the meatballs from the pan and place on paper towels to drain.
- Place the grape jelly and chili sauce in a microwave-safe serving container and stir until combined.
- Place the meatballs in the sauce and stir until completely coated.
- (The meatballs can be refrigerated for several days and reheated on the stovetop or in the microwave for about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally to ensure they are heated through.)
- Serve with toothpicks on the side.

Panhandle Beef Brisket

Ingredients:
- 2-1/4 cups ketchup
- 1-1/2 cups beef broth
- 1 large onion, chopped
- 1/2 cup packed brown sugar
- 1/2 cup white wine vinegar
- 2 tablespoons chili powder
- 2 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce
- 3 garlic cloves, minced
- 1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper
- 1 fresh beef brisket (5 to 7 pounds), trimmed
- 2 tablespoons Liquid Smoke, optional

Directions:
- In a large saucepan, combine the first nine ingredients. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Reduce heat; simmer, uncovered, for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally. Remove from the heat. Remove 2 cups sauce to a bowl; cover and refrigerate for serving.
- Place brisket in a shallow roasting pan; brush with Liquid Smoke if desired. Pour remaining sauce over meat. Cover and bake at 325° for 3 hours or until meat is tender.
- Let stand for 5 minutes. Heat reserved sauce. Thinly slice meat across the grain. Serve sauce with meat.

Sopaipilla Mix

Ingredients:
- 4 c. flour
- 2 tsp. baking powder
- 1 c. warm water
- 3/4 tsp. salt
- 1 Tbsp. shortening

Directions:
- Thoroughly mix dry ingredients, then add shortening and mix until it's dissolved.
- Slowly add about 1 cup warm water and knead until smooth.
- Your dough should be the consistency of pie dough or a little stiffer.
- Cover dough with a damp cloth and let rise for about an hour.

Spiders

Ingredients:
- 1 (12 oz.) bag butterscotch morsels
- 1 c. salted peanuts
- 2 c. Chinese noodles

Directions:
- Melt morsels in microwave or double boiler.
- Add peanuts and noodles to melted morsels.
- Using teaspoon, drop small amount onto wax paper.
- Let cool and enjoy!

Party Creamed Potatoes

Ingredients:
- 8 -10 medium potatoes
- 8 ounces cream cheese
- 8 ounces sour cream
- 2 tablespoons butter
- 1 dash paprika
- salt and pepper

Directions:
- Pare potatoes, boil until tender and drain.
- Beat softened cream cheese and sour cream at medium speed until blended.
- Add hot potatoes gradually beating constantly until light and fluffy.
- Season with salt and pepper.
- Pour into a 2-quart baking dish, dot with butter.
- Sprinkle with paprika.
- Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes.
- Chives may be added with the seasonings for extra flavor and color.

Red Chicken

Ingredients:
- 1 whole chicken, boiled and deboned
- 1 medium onion
- 1 medium bell pepper
- 1 Tbsp. bacon grease
- 1 (4 oz.) can tomato sauce
- 1 Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
- 1 Tbsp. Texas Pete
- 1 c. ketchup
- 1 can cream of mushroom soup
- 1 can green peas, drained
- 2 c. chicken broth

Directions:
- Boil and debone chicken (save broth).
- Saute onion and peppers in bacon grease.
- Add tomato sauce, Worcestershire sauce and Texas Pete.
- Let simmer.
- Add ketchup and chicken broth.
- Stir in peas, then add chicken pieces.
- Serve over rice.

Zucchini Pie

Ingredients:
- 1 c. Bisquick
- 1/2 c. oil
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/2 tsp. pepper
- 1/2 c. grated cheese
- 4 eggs
- 4 sliced tomatoes
- 1 clove garlic, chopped
- parsley, chopped
- 4 c. sliced zucchini
- 1 fresh green pepper
- 1/2 c. chopped onion

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients together well.
- Bake in a greased 9 x 13-inch pan at 350° for 30 to 35 minutes or until done.

Pecan Butter Balls

Ingredients:
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1/4 cup white sugar
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1 cup margarine
- 2 cups chopped pecans
- 1/3 cup confectioners' sugar for decoration

Directions:
- Sift together into a medium sized bowl the flour, sugar and vanilla. Work in the margarine with a spoon or hands until well blended. Add chopped pecans and mix well.
- Shape dough into 1 inch balls and put on ungreased pans. Bake in a preheated 325 degree F (165 degrees C) oven for about 25 minutes or until pale brown. When slightly cool roll or shake in confectioners' sugar. Store in an air tight container.

Teddie'S Apple Cake (Nyt 11.4.07)

Ingredients:
- butter, for greasing pan
- 3 cups flour, plus more to dust pan
- 1 1/2 cups vegetable oil
- 2 cups sugar
- 3 eggs
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1 teaspoon cinnamon
- 1 teaspoon baking soda
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 3 cups peeled cored, and thickly sliced tart apples (Honeycrisp or Granny Smith)
- 1 cup chopped walnuts
- 1 cup raisins
- vanilla ice cream (optional)

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350°F Butter and flour a 9-inch tube pan. Beat the oil and sugar together. After about 5 minutes, add the eggs and beat until the mixture is creamy.
- Sift together 3 cups of flour, the salt, cinnamon, and baking soda. Stir into the batter. Add the vanilla, apples, walnuts and raisins and stir until combined.
- Transfer the mixture to the prepared pan. Bake for 1 hours and 15 min., or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
- Cool in the pan before turning out. Serve at room temperature with vanilla ice cream, if desired.

Bayou Baked Red Snapper Recipe

Ingredients:
- 1 whl Red Snapper (4 Lb.)
- 1 stk margarine, pareve
- 1 bn Shallots, minced
- 1/2 tsp Oregano
- 1 can Button mushrooms Or possibly
- 8 lrg fresh mushrooms Salt and pepper to taste.

Directions:
- Clean fish and pat dry.
- Rub cavity with salt, pepper and margarine.
- Place in well-greased baking pan and set aside.
- Heat 3 or possibly 4 tbs.
- margarine in heavy skillet.
- Add in shallots and saute/fry till soft, but not brown.
- Add in more margarine and mushrooms and continue cooking, shaking pan till most of fat is absorbed.
- Stir in oregano and pour mix over fish.
- Measure fish at its thickest point and bake exactly 10 minutes.
- per inch of thickness in preheated 450 F. oven.
- Baste several times with pan juices.
- Serves 8 to10.

Corn Capsicum Masala

Ingredients:
- semi dry curry with capsicum and tomatoes ,which is simple to make and taste great.

Directions:
- Pressure cook corn kernals with a cup of water and a pinch of salt for 2 whistles,strain and keep aside.
- Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds,when seeds start crackling add asafoetida,ginger and chopped tomatoes.
- Add salt mix and then cover and cook till tomatoes become soft.
- Now add tomato puree ,chili powder,turmeric,pav bhaji masala,coriander powder and saute for a minute.
- Add chopped capsicum and corn and mix well.
- Cover and cook till capsicum become slightly cooked and gravy thickens.
- Add fresh cream, lemon juice and fresh coriander and mix.
- Serve with rice,paratha or roti
- NOTE-
- 1-You may substitute tomato puree with 1.5 tbsp of tomato ketchup
- 2- Addition of fresh cream is optional,I have not used it.

Frozen Fruit Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese
- 1 c. mayonnaise
- 1 c. cream, whipped
- 1/2 c. red maraschino cherries, cut
- 1/2 c. green maraschino cherries, cut
- 1 large can crushed pineapple, drained
- 2 1/2 c. miniature marshmallows

Directions:
- Combine cheese and mayonnaise.
- Blend until smooth.
- Fold in whipped cream, fruit and marshmallows.
- Pour into 13 x 9-inch dish.
- Freeze firm.
- Cut squares.
- Great for Christmas!

Cheese And Sausage Bake

Ingredients:
- 6 to 8 slices white bread
- 1 lb. mild sausage
- 1 doz. eggs
- 1 c. milk
- 1 1/2 c. Cheddar cheese

Directions:
- Use a 9 x 11-inch baking dish, greased.
- Cover bottom of pan with white bread.
- Fry sausage, drain well and spread over bread layer.
- Mix eggs and milk; spread over sausage layer.
- Spread Cheddar cheese over egg mixture.
- Bake at 375° for 40 or 45 minutes.
- Ham may be used in place of sausage.

Macon Hot Vanilla

Ingredients:
- 1 cup milk
- 1 teaspoon honey
- 1 drop vanilla
- 1 pinch ground cinnamon

Directions:
- Heat the milk until very hot but not boiling.
- Pour into a mug.
- Add the rest or the ingredients then mix well.
- Serve immediately.

Snickerdoodles

Ingredients:
- 1 c. shortening
- 2 eggs
- 1 1/2 c. sugar
- 2 tsp. baking powder
- 2 3/4 c. flour
- 1/2 tsp. salt

Directions:
- Mix first three ingredients.
- Add next three ingredients. Chill dough at least one hour.
- Roll dough into balls the size of walnuts.
- Roll in a mixture of 2 teaspoons cinnamon and two tablespoons sugar.
- Bake on an ungreased cookie sheet for 8 to 10 minutes at 350°.

Lamb Ragu

Ingredients:
- 2 tablespoons rendered lamb fat or 2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil
- 1 medium onion, finely diced
- 1 1/2 lbs ground lamb
- 1 teaspoon ground fennel
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 1/2 teaspoons fresh rosemary or 1/2 teaspoon dried rosemary, to taste
- 3 teaspoons fresh thyme or 1 teaspoon dried thyme, to taste
- 1 teaspoon salt, to taste
- 1 teaspoon fresh ground black pepper, to taste
- 1/2 cup dry red wine or 1/2 cup water
- 1 (28 ounce) can diced tomatoes
- 1 1/2 cups lamb stock or 1 1/2 cups chicken stock

Directions:
- In a heavy pot, heat the fat or oil until it just begins to shimmer. Add onions and sweat gently until soft, about 5 minutes.
- Add ground lamb and spices. Cook, stirring often, until lamb is no longer pink and most of the moisture has evaporated, about 5 minutes.
- Add the wine, the tomatoes (with their juices), and the stock. Bring to boil, reduce to a simmer, cover partially and cook until liquid is reduced, 25-30 minutes.

Potato Chip Cookies

Ingredients:
- 1 c. brown sugar
- 1 c. white sugar
- 1 c. shortening (Crisco)
- 2 c. crushed potato chips (use the ones from the bottom of bag)
- 2 c. flour
- 2 eggs, beaten
- 1 c. nuts
- 1 tsp. baking powder
- 1/4 tsp. salt

Directions:
- Mix all together.
- Roll or drop by teaspoon.
- Press down with fork.
- Bake on ungreased cookie sheet at 325° for 10 minutes.

Potato and Onion Tortilla with Moroccan Harissa

Ingredients:
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 2 large onions, sliced
- 700g new potatoes, cut into 1cm cubes and cooked until just tender Safeway 2 pkg For $5.00 thru 02/09
- 2 tablespoons flour
- 6 eggs, lightly beaten
- Salt and pepper, to taste
- 1 x 150g Captain's Table Moroccan Harissa Dip
- 1/2 cup sour cream
- 1/2 cup chopped chives

Directions:
- Heat the oil in a fry pan and gently cook the onions for 20-25 minutes until softened and caramelised.
- Combine the onion and potato then spoon into a lightly greased and lined 28cm x 18 cm slab tin.
- Whisk together the flour and eggs, season with salt and pepper then pour over the vegetables.
- Bake the tortilla in a moderate oven at 180C for 20 minutes or until set.
- Allow to cool.
- Cut the tortilla into 24 squares.
- Top with a dollop of Moroccan Harissa, a little sour cream and a sprinkle of chives.
- Serve immediately.

Jello Two-Tone Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 pkg. lemon jello
- 1- 3 oz. pkg. cream cheese
- 1/2 pt. whipping cream, whipped
- 1 small can crushed pineapple
- 1 pkg. orange jello
- 1 c. apricot nectar

Directions:
- Dissolve lemon jello in 1 c. hot water. While still hot, add cream cheese and stir well. When starting to jell, add crushed pineapple with
- juice and whipped cream. Pour into oblong pan. Let set until firm. Take 1 cup apricot nectar, (hot) and pour over orange jello with one cup hot water. When cold pour over top of first mixture.

Radish-And-Avocado Salad

Ingredients:
- 2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 teaspoon country-style Dijon mustard
- 1 garlic clove, minced
- Salt
- Freshly ground black pepper
- 8 cups torn red or green leaf lettuce
- 4 radishes, thinly sliced
- 1 avocado, sliced

Directions:
- Whisk together first 4 ingredients and salt and pepper to taste; toss with remaining ingredients.

Snickerdoodles

Ingredients:
- 2 eggs
- 1/2 c. white sugar
- 1 c. brown sugar
- 1 c. shortening
- 2 2/3 c. flour
- 1 tsp. baking soda
- 2 tsp. cream of tartar
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 1 tsp. cinnamon

Directions:
- Cream together the shortening, sugars and eggs.
- Sift together the flour, salt, baking soda and cream of tartar.
- Gradually add to make soft dough (may chill overnight).
- Form dough into 1-inch balls.

Easy Mexican Casserole

Ingredients:
- 3 chicken breasts, cooked and diced
- 10 ounces diced tomatoes with green chilies (Ro-Tel Mexican Fiesta style)
- 10 12 ounces Campbells condensed creamy verde soup
- 1 cup sour cream
- 7 12 ounces Doritos, crumbled (I used Nacho Cheese...use your favorite flavor though!)
- 2 cups cheddar cheese, shredded

Directions:
- Mix together chicken, Ro-Tel, soup, and sour cream.
- Spread half of this mixture on bottom of 9x13 baking dish.
- Top with half of the Doritos.
- Spread remaining half of chicken mixture in dish, and top with remaining Doritos.
- Top with shredded cheese.
- Bake at 350 degrees for 20-30 minutes until cheese is melted and casserole is hot all the way through.

Low-Fat Cheesecake

Ingredients:
- 30 g softened low-fat butter or margarine
- 20 g stevia sugar
- 1/2 None vanilla pod, scored lengthwise, seeds scraped
- 25 g dried cherries, roughly chopped
- 250 g low-fat cottage cheese
- 1 None egg
- 150 g apple sauce
- 60 g semolina
- 30 g flaked almonds

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease a 9 x 5 inch pan. Cream butter and stevia until light and fluffy. Mix together the vanilla seeds or extract with the cherries, cottage cheese, egg, apple sauce and semolina. Mix into the creamed butter mixture.
- Sprinkle three-quarters of the sliced almonds into the baking pan. Pour the cake mixture into the pan, smooth the surface and sprinkle with remaining almonds. Bake for 40 mins, covering with foil after 30 mins.
- Leave to cool in the pan for 30 mins. Carefully remove from the pan and place on a wire rack to cool for another 30 mins. Cut cheesecake into seven pieces.

Summer Vegetable Soup

Ingredients:
- 2 teaspoons olive oil
- 1 1/2 cups diced onion (about 1 large)
- 1 garlic clove, minced
- 3 (14-ounce) cans fat-free, less-sodium chicken broth
- 2 1/4 cups (1-inch) sliced fresh green beans (about 8 ounces)
- 1 1/4 cups diced zucchini (about 1 small)
- 1 1/4 cups diced yellow squash (about 1 small)
- 1 cup fresh corn kernels (about 2 ears)
- 2 large tomatoes (about 1 1/2 pounds), chopped
- 1/2 cup chopped fresh basil
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper

Directions:
- Heat olive oil in a large Dutch oven over medium heat. Add onion; saute 5 minutes. Add garlic; saute 1 minute. Add chicken broth; bring to a boil. Stir in green beans, and bring to a boil; cook 3 minutes. Add zucchini, yellow squash, and corn. Bring to a boil, and cook 4 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Stir in tomatoes; bring to a boil. Remove from heat; stir in basil, salt, and pepper.

Mary's Italian Love Cake Recipe

Ingredients:
- 1 chocolate cake mix - mixed as box indicates
- 3/4 c. sugar
- 3 Large eggs
- 2 lbs. Ricotta cheese
- 1 teaspoon vanilla

Directions:
- Make cake as box directs.
- Pour into a 9x13 greased and floured cake pan.
- Mix cheese, vanilla, sugar and Large eggs.
- Spoon over cake mix.
- Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour and 10 min.

Chocolate Macaroons

Ingredients:
- 1/3 cups Unbleached Flour
- 1-1/4 cup Flaked Coconut
- 1/8 teaspoons Salt
- 7 ounces, fluid Sweetened, Condensed Milk
- 1 teaspoon Vanilla
- 1/2 cups Melted Chocolate
- 5 Tablespoons Sprinkles

Directions:
- 1. Preheat oven to 350
- 2. Stir together flour, coconut and salt
- 3. Add milk and vanilla
- 4. Use hands and mix together
- 5. Form golf ball size cookies and place on a greased baking sheet
- 6. Bake for12 to 15 minutes
- 7. Once cool enough to handle, dip in melted chocolate and set on wax paper
- 8. Sprinkle with candies and allow to set in fridge or freezer

Saucijzebroodjes - Pigs In A Blanket

Ingredients:
- Blanket
- 2 cups flour
- 3 teaspoons baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 2 tablespoons butter
- 2/3 cup milk
- Filling
- 1 1/2 lbs ground pork (lean)
- 1 1/2 cups rusks, crumbs
- 1 egg
- 1/2 cup milk
- salt and pepper, to taste

Directions:
- For the blankets: Sift dry ingredients together in a bowl.
- Cut butter in with a pastry blender.
- Mix to a soft dough with milk.
- Roll out a little thicker than a piecrust and cut into squares.
- For the filling: Season meat; add crumbs, eggs and milk.
- Fill squares with meat mixture, pinch ends together, place in a pan and bake in a preheated, moderate oven (350F) 1/2 hour until brown.

Chocolate Calpico Milk Cocktail

Ingredients:
- 30 ml Chocolate liqueur
- 30 ml Calpico
- 100 ml Milk
- 1 glass worth Ice

Directions:
- Fill your glass with ice.
- Pour the chocolate liqueur, Calpico and milk slowly over the ice and enjoy!
- Give it a good mixing right before drinking!
- If you mix it up, it'll look like this.
- This time, I used "Mozart Gold" chocolate liqueur!

Mystery Cookies

Ingredients:
- 35 soda crackers
- 1 c. real butter
- 1 c. brown sugar
- 12 oz. milk chocolate chips
- nuts (optional)

Directions:
- Line jelly roll pan with foil.
- Spray foil with Pam.
- Line crackers up in pan.
- In saucepan, melt butter; add brown sugar and bring to boil.
- Boil for 3 minutes lowering temperature as you go. Pour this over crackers and bake for 5 minutes at 350°.
- Remove from oven and sprinkle chips on top.
- Smooth over with back of spoon; must cover all crackers.
- Add nuts if wanted.
- Cool and cut.
- Refrigerate.

Layered Pineapple-Lemon Cheesecake Pie

Ingredients:
- 1 pkg. (8 oz.) PHILADELPHIA Cream Cheese, softened
- 1/4 cup sugar
- 1 can (8 oz.) crushed pineapple, drained, divided
- 2 cups thawed COOL WHIP Whipped Topping
- 1 ready-to-use graham cracker crumb crust (6 oz.)
- 1-1/3 cups cold milk
- 1 pkg. (4-serving size) JELL-O Lemon Flavor Instant Pudding

Directions:
- Beat cream cheese and sugar in large bowl with wire whisk until well blended.
- Stir in half of the pineapple.
- Gently stir in whipped topping.
- Spread into pie crust.
- Pour milk into medium bowl.
- Add dry pudding mix.
- Beat with wire whisk 2 min.
- or until well blended.
- (Mixture will be thick.)
- Stir in remaining pineapple.
- Spoon over cream cheese layer in pie crust.
- Refrigerate several hours or until chilled.
- Store leftover pie in refrigerator.

Pink Frozen Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 can cherry pie filling
- 1 c. chopped nuts
- 1 can crushed pineapple
- pinch of salt
- 1 can sweetened condensed milk
- 1 large carton Cool Whip, thawed

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients together.
- Freeze in an 8-cup mold or in individual molds.

Chicken And Rice

Ingredients:
- 1 whole fryer, cut up
- 1 large onion
- 3 boiled eggs
- rice
- salt to taste
- pepper to taste

Directions:
- Cook fryer until boiled tender.
- Cool and take all meat off bones.
- Add meat, onion, cut up boiled eggs and rice to juice from chicken.
- Cook until rice is done.
- Stir occasionally.

Avocado Dip / Spread

Ingredients:
- 3 avocados
- 2 tomatoes
- 1 jalapeno, remove seeds
- 12 teaspoon lemon juice
- cilantro, as much as you like

Directions:
- Chop the avocados.
- Chop the tomatoes.
- Cut jalapeno in half and remove seeds.
- Dice the jalapeno.
- Add the lemon juice.
- Add cilantro.
- Allow to sit in fridge for one hour.
- Eat same day made.

Green Bean Casserole

Ingredients:
- 2 cans your favorite sliced green beans
- 1 can cream of mushroom soup (undiluted)
- 1 can French's fried onion straws

Directions:
- Mix the green beans and mushroom soup together and place in baking dish.
- Bake, uncovered, for 25 minutes at 350°.
- Remove from oven and sprinkle onion straws on top.
- Bake for another 5 minutes or until onion straws are golden brown.
- This is delicious as a side dish and is very low in carbs!!!

Easy Nacho  Cheese Dip

Ingredients:
- 1 lb ground beef
- 1 (16 ounce) jar salsa (hot, medium or mild, your choice)
- 1 (2 lb) package Velveeta cheese

Directions:
- Brown ground beef.
- Put everything in crockpot and melt together, stirring occasionally.
- Once the cheese is melted, turn crockpot on low.
- Keep an eye on the mixture, if you leave it to cook all day long it may burn- it all depends on your crockpot.

Crock Pot Chicken

Ingredients:
- 4-5 Chicken breasts
- 2- 8 oz packages cream cheese
- 1 can cream of mushroom soup
- salt and pepper

Directions:
- Place all ingredients into a slow cooker cook on high 4 hours and low

Sugar Cookies

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. butter
- 1 c. sugar
- 2 eggs
- 1 Tbsp. rich cream
- 1 tsp. vanilla extract
- 2 1/4 c. flour
- 1 1/2 tsp. baking powder
- nutmeg (if desired)

Directions:
- Cream butter, sugar and eggs.
- Add other ingredients.
- Roll out dough and cut.
- Bake at 400° for 6 to 9 minutes.

Kicked Up Cocktail Sauce

Ingredients:
- 1 cup ketchup
- 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice, freshly squeezed
- 2 tablespoons prepared horseradish, drained
- 1/2 teaspoon hot sauce
- 1 pinch salt & freshly ground black pepper

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients together and whisk well to combine.

Pear And Orange Sponge Cake

Ingredients:
- 3 eggs separated
- 1 cup granulated sugar
- 1 cup 2% milk
- 1/3 cup self-rising flour sifted
- 1/4 cup orange juice
- 2 teaspoons orange zest
- 4 pears cored, cut into 8 pieces
- whipped cream to serve

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease a large baking dish with oil.
- Whip egg yolks and 1/2 cup sugar until thick and creamy. Transfer to a large bowl. Stir in milk, flour, orange juice and orange zest. Whip egg whites to soft peaks then gradually add remaining sugar, beating well until thick and glossy. Fold into orange mixture.
- Arrange pears in prepared dish. Pour orange batter over top. Place in a large baking pan and add enough just-boiled water to come halfway up sides of baking dish. Bake for 35-40 mins, until lightly browned and firm to the touch. Serve with whipped cream.

Fresh Apple Cookies

Ingredients:
- 1 cup sugar
- 1/2 cup shortening
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla
- 1 large Red Delicious apple, peeled & grated
- 2 cups flour
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 1 teaspoon baking soda

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
- Cream together sugar, shortening & vanilla.
- Add in grated apple.
- Sift together dry ingredients.
- Add gradually to creamed mixture, combining thoroughly.
- *If dough appears slightly dry and doesn't come together, let it sit for a few minutes to allow the sugar to pull the juice from the apples.
- Roll in walnut-sized balls and roll in mixture of 2 Tbsp sugar, 1/2 tsp nutmeg and 1/4 tsp cinnamon.
- Bake 8-10 minutes on aluminum foil or parchment, until cookies are golden brown and appear crackled.
- Let cool on cookie sheet 4-5 minutes before transferring to cooling rack.

Turtles

Ingredients:
- 2 c. sugar
- 2 c. canned milk
- 1 3/4 c. white corn syrup
- 1 c. butter
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1/2 lb. pecans

Directions:
- Cook sugar, 1 cup milk, corn syrup and butter vigorously. Gradually add the other cup of milk (keep it boiling), stirring constantly.
- Test in cold water until soft balls form.
- Add vanilla and pour into buttered 7 x 11 x 1 1/2-inch pan.
- Cool enough to handle.
- Create turtles by pressing pecan meats into four corners of a teaspoon of the candy (caramels).
- Set on wax paper and let dry.
- Dip into milk chocolate that has been heated in double boiler.
- Lay turtles on wax paper to cool.
- Makes 2 to 3 dozen.

Scalloped Corn

Ingredients:
- 1 (16 oz.) can cream-style corn
- 1 c. milk
- 1 egg, well beaten
- 1 c. cracker crumbs
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 c. buttered cracker crumbs

Directions:
- Mix first 5 ingredients together and place into a greased casserole dish.
- Top with buttered crumbs.
- Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.

Fantastic Light Peanut Butter Dip-Spread for Fruit and Vegetabl

Ingredients:
- 1 tablespoon peanut butter
- 1 tablespoon fat free cream cheese
- 1 tablespoon Cool Whip or 1 tablespoon Cool Whip Lite or 1 tablespoon Cool Whip Free
- 1 tablespoon Splenda sugar substitute

Directions:
- Mix together all ingredients until smooth.
- Serve with sliced apples, carrots, celery, bananas etc.
- Start with 1 t. and adjust to your taste.
- I use 1 tbsp Splenda when serving with tart apples, less with sweet.
- My favorite is with tart apples, the flavor contrast is what makes it so good.

Cherry Pie

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 c. graham cracker crumbs
- 1 stick margarine, melted
- 1 (8 oz.) cream cheese
- 1 small container Cool Whip
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 1 can cherry pie filling

Directions:
- Mix together the cracker crumbs and margarine and press into oblong pan. Bake 5 minutes at 350°. Let cool.

Barbecue Grill Potatoes

Ingredients:
- 1 washed potato for each person
- oleo or butter
- granulated chicken bouillon

Directions:
- Cut potato into 4 slices. Place slices on square of aluminum foil (to wrap and bake potato in). Place oleo or butter on the slices with chicken bouillon sprinkled generously over that. Wrap aluminum foil around the potato and place in coals of barbecue for one hour.

Potato Doughnuts

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 c. milk, scalded
- 2 pkg. quick yeast
- 2 eggs
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 1/3 c. butter
- 1 c. mashed potatoes
- 2 c. flour

Directions:
- Mash potatoes, adding milk and butter.
- Add yeast, eggs, salt and flour; mix.
- Add flour; let stand until bubbly.
- Add enough flour to make soft dough.
- Let rise until double.
- Cut out with doughnut cutter.
- Let rise again.
- Fry in deep fat fryer, turning only once, until light golden brown.

Creamy Polenta With Parmesan And Mozzarella

Ingredients:
- 3 1/2 cups whole milk
- 3/4 cup yellow cornmeal
- 1/2 teaspoon minced fresh rosemary
- 1 cup grated mozzarella cheese
- 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese

Directions:
- In a large saucepan over high heat, combine milk and cornmeal, whisking until mixture boils.
- Reduce heat to medium and simmer, whisking frequently until mixture thickens, about 15 minutes.
- Add rosemary and cheeses.
- Whisk until cheese is melted.
- Season to taste.

Raw Potato Dumplings

Ingredients:
- 2 c. raw potatoes
- 1 tsp. salt
- 2 eggs, beaten
- 1 1/2 c. flour
- 1/2 c. bread crumbs

Directions:
- Grate potatoes fine and drain off brown liquid. Add the beaten eggs, salt, crumbs and flour to make a stiff dough.
- Drop into boiling salted water from a wet spoon.
- Dumplings should be about 1 1/2-inches long and 1/2-inch in diameter when cooked.
- They are done as soon as they float to the top.

Dr. Oz'S Tangerine Weight-Orade

Ingredients:
- 8 cups brewed green tea
- 1 tangerine, sliced
- 1 handful mint leaf

Directions:
- Place brewed green tea and remaning ingredients into a pitcher and refrigerate overnight.
- Drink 1 pitcher daily for maximum metabolism-boosting results.

Buttermilk Candy

Ingredients:
- 1 c. buttermilk
- 2 c. white sugar
- 2 Tbsp. white corn syrup
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 c. nuts, chopped

Directions:
- Place all ingredients in saucepan, except vanilla and nuts. Cook, stirring constantly, until soft ball or 234° is reached. Remove from heat and add vanilla and nuts.
- Pour into 8 x 8-inch buttered dish and cool.
- Cut into squares.

Strawberry Cream Cheese Ice Cream

Ingredients:
- 2 beaten eggs
- 1 1/4 c. sugar
- 3 c. half and half cream
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese
- few drops red food coloring (optional)
- 2 c. whole strawberries
- 1 c. chopped strawberries

Directions:
- Combine eggs, sugar
- and
- 1 1/2 cups half and half in a small saucepan.
- Cook
- and stir over medium heat until mixture just comes
- to
- boil.
- Remove
- from heat.
- Transfer to a large bowl. Stir
- in
- remaining
- half
- and
- half,
- vanilla and food coloring. Cover and chill.
- Mix cream cheese in a large mixer bowl until fluffy.
- Gradually beat in the 2 cups berries until berries are coarsely
- crushed.	Gradually
- beat in the cooled egg mixture. Stir
- in the 1 cup chopped berries.
- Freeze in a 4 to
- 5
- quart ice
- cream freezer according to manufacturer's directions.	Makes 2 quarts.

Apple Hill Cake

Ingredients:
- 2 c. sugar
- 1/2 c. oil
- 2 eggs
- 4 c. diced apples
- 2 c. flour
- 2 tsp. cinnamon
- 1 tsp. nutmeg
- 1 tsp. salt
- 2 tsp. soda

Directions:
- Combine sugar, oil and eggs; add diced apples.
- Sift together the flour, salt, soda, cinnamon and nutmeg; add to the apple mix. Pour batter into 9 x 13-inch greased cake pan.
- Bake for 1 hour in 350° oven.

Spaghetti Salad I

Ingredients:
- 1 pound spaghetti, broken into pieces
- 1 (16 ounce) bottle Italian-style salad dressing
- 1 tablespoon grated Parmesan cheese
- 1 tablespoon sesame seeds
- 1 tablespoon poppy seeds
- 2 teaspoons seasoning salt
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
- 1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper
- 1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper
- 1 cucumber, chopped
- 1 red onion, diced
- 2 tomatoes, chopped

Directions:
- Cook spaghetti according to package directions. Drain, rinse with cold water and drain well. Transfer to large bowl.
- In medium bowl, whisk together salad dressing, cheese, seeds, salt, paprika, garlic powder and peppers until well blended. Stir in cucumber and onion. Pour mixture over spaghetti and toss lightly to coat evenly. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or up to 24 hours. Top with tomatoes to serve.

Meat Loaf

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 lb. lean ground beef
- 3/4 c. ketchup
- 2 eggs, beaten
- 3/4 c. oats
- 1/4 c. finely chopped onions
- 2 tsp. prepared mustard
- 1/2 tsp. each: salt and black pepper
- BBQ sauce (your favorite)

Directions:
- In a large bowl, combine everything but BBQ sauce; mix well. Shape into loaf on a baking pan and bake at 400° for 45 minutes or until done.
- Remove from oven and cover with BBQ sauce.
- Return to oven for about 15 minutes.
- Rest meat loaf 5 minutes before serving.

Peach Pudding

Ingredients:
- 2 tablespoons cornstarch
- 1/4 cup brown sugar
- 4 cups frozen peaches (sweetened and sliced)
- 1 tablespoon butter (can sub. marg.)
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
- 1 cup granulated sugar
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 3 eggs
- 3 tablespoons milk
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla
- 2 tablespoons butter (can sub. marg.)

Directions:
- Heat oven to 350 degrees.
- Butter 9x13 baking pan.
- In a large saucepan, mix the cornstarch, brown sugar and peaches. Cook and stir until thick.
- Add 1 tablespoon butter and lemon juce.
- Spread in buttered baking pan.
- In a large mixing bowl combine granulated sugar, flour and baking powder.
- In another bowl, beat eggs lightly with butter, milk and vanilla.
- Add dry ingredients and stir to mix.
- Spread over peach mixture.
- Bake 30 minutes.

Lamb Shanks

Ingredients:
- 1 lamb shank, cut off fat
- 1 can V-8 juice
- 1 tsp. paprika
- 1 c. chicken broth
- 1 tsp. ginger

Directions:
- Put some onion and lamb shank in frying pan and saute.
- Add the rest of the ingredients.
- Cook until hot, then pour over meat.
- Put in 350° oven for 3 hours.
- Cover.

Apricot Candy

Ingredients:
- 3/4 c. dried apricots
- 1/2 c. nuts
- 3/4 c. shredded coconut
- 1 Tbsp. grated orange rind
- 1 Tbsp. lemon juice

Directions:
- Combine apricots, nuts and coconut; chop very fine.
- Mix with orange rind and lemon juice.
- Shape into balls and then roll in confectioners sugar.
- Makes approximately 50 balls.

Oreo Dessert

Ingredients:
- 1 large bag Oreo cookies, ground
- 1/2 c. melted butter
- 1/2 gal. vanilla ice cream
- 1 can Hershey's fudge topping
- 8 oz. soft Cool Whip

Directions:
- Set 1 cup Oreos grounded aside; mix melted butter and Oreos together.
- In 13 x 9-inch glass dish, press Oreos down.
- Slice ice cream long ways, 3/4-inch thick.
- Set in pan on top of Oreos 1 can of fudge on top of ice cream.
- Spread Cool Whip on top of fudge; sprinkle 1 cup Oreos on top Cool Whip.
- Cover with Saran Wrap. Put in freezer.

Savory Baked Chicken

Ingredients:
- 3 boneless chicken breasts, skinned and halved
- 2 egg whites
- 3/4 ??? oat bran
- 1 tsp. garlic powder
- 1 tsp. onion powder
- 1 tsp. paprika
- 1 tsp. basil
- 1 tsp. dry mustard
- 1/2 tsp. black pepper

Directions:
- Remove skin from chicken.
- Put egg whites in pie pan and beat slightly.
- Combine remaining ingredients in another pie pan.
- Dip chicken into egg whites and then into dry ingredients, turning to coat.
- (If coating looks dry, moisten with any remaining egg white.)
- Place coated chicken into a baking pan and bake at 350° for 45 minutes.

Hot Sweet Pickles

Ingredients:
- 1 gal. hamburger dills
- 5 lb. sugar
- 2 cloves garlic
- 1/2 bottle Tabasco sauce

Directions:
- Drain juice from dills. Add sugar.
- Add garlic, Tabasco sauce and
- more
- Tabasco sauce if hotter pickles are desired. It	is hard to get the sugar in the jars.	Keep turning until all	sugar is in jars.
- Let marinate five days, turning every day.

Hamburger Minestrone

Ingredients:
- 1 lb lean ground beef
- 1 medium onion, chopped
- 1 garlic clove, minced
- 1 cup shredded cabbage (or broken spaghetti)
- 12 cup uncooked elbow macaroni
- 1 (10 1/2 ounce) can condensed beef broth
- 2 (10 1/2 ounce) soup cans water
- 1 teaspoon dried Italian herb seasoning
- 2 medium celery ribs, thinly sliced (1 cup)
- 1 small zucchini, sliced (1 cup)
- 1 (28 ounce) can diced tomatoes, undrained
- 1 (8 ounce) can kidney beans, rinsed and drained
- 1 (8 ounce) can whole kernel corn, undrained
- grated parmesan cheese

Directions:
- Cook the beef, onion and garlic in a dutch oven, over medium heat, breaking up the meat.
- Drain.
- Stir in remaining ingredients except cheese.
- Heat to boiling; reduce heat to low and simmer, covered, 15 minutes.
- Serve sprinkled with cheese.

Renee'S Cheesecake

Ingredients:
- 1 c. crushed chocolate graham crackers
- 3 Tbsp. sugar
- 3 Tbsp. melted butter
- 5 (8 oz.) pkg. softened cream cheese
- 3 Tbsp. flour
- 1 Tbsp. vanilla
- 1 c. sugar
- 3 eggs
- 1 c. sour cream

Directions:
- Mix graham crackers, sugar and melted butter well; line the bottom of a 9-inch spring-form pan and bake at 350° for 10 minutes.

Cheesy Broccoli Dish

Ingredients:
- 2 small boxes frozen, chopped broccoli
- 1 stick margarine or butter
- 1 c. Ritz cracker crumbs
- 1/2 lb. Velveeta cheese

Directions:
- Cook broccoli according to package directions.
- Place in 1 1/2-quart or 2-quart casserole dish.
- Cube the cheese and place cubes on top of broccoli. Melt butter in separate pan and pour 1/2 of melted butter over broccoli and cheese.
- Place cracker crumbs on top.
- Pour remaining butter or margarine over crackers.
- Bake 30 minutes at 350° or until bubbly.

Green Chile

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 lb. lean ground beef
- 4 tsp. oil (peanut or other)
- 4 Tbsp. flour
- 1 small medium onion, chopped
- 2 cans (28 oz. each) green tomatoes
- 2 cans (4.5 oz. each) diced green chiles
- 3/4 c. beef broth
- cumin (pinch)
- garlic powder to taste
- salt and pepper to taste

Directions:
- Quantities do not have to be exact!

Applesauce Cake

Ingredients:
- 2 c. sugar
- 1 c. shortening
- 2 1/2 c. warm applesauce, with 3 tsp. soda stirred in and set aside to cool
- 4 c. plain flour
- 1 lb. raisins
- 1 c. nuts
- 1 tsp. all kinds spice
- 1/4 tsp. salt

Directions:
- Mix together.
- Bake for 2 hours at 300°.

Ras El Hanout (Moroccan Spice Mix)

Ingredients:
- 1 teaspoon allspice berry
- 1 whole nutmeg
- 20 Spanish saffron threads
- 2 teaspoons black peppercorns
- 1 three-inch cinnamon stick
- 2 teaspoons cardamom seeds
- 1 1/2 teaspoons ground mace
- 2 teaspoons ground ginger
- 2 teaspoons salt
- 1 teaspoon ground turmeric

Directions:
- Put all the whole spices in a nonstick pan over medium-high heat and toast for 3-5 minutes stirring constantly. Your kitchen should start smelling wonderful!
- Remove from heat and cool.
- Grind the ingredients to a fine powder,using a mortar and pestle or a grinder,.
- Sift to remove any unground bits.
- Place in a tightly sealed container and store in a cool, dark place, or in the freezer.

Muffins

Ingredients:
- 2 c. All-Bran cereal
- 2 c. shredded wheat cereal
- 2 c. quick cooking oats
- 2 c. warm water
- 1 c. shortening
- 3 c. sugar
- 4 eggs
- 5 c. self-rising flour
- 1 tsp. baking soda
- 1 qt. buttermilk

Directions:
- Place All-Bran, crushed shredded wheat, oats and warm water in mixing bowl, stirring until smooth.
- In another bowl, cream shortening, sugar and eggs.
- Beat in the combined flour, soda and salt, alternating with buttermilk.
- Add cereal mixture.
- Put in a gallon jar and place in the refrigerator.
- Use desired amount of mixture as needed to prepare muffins.
- Bake at 350°
- for 45 minutes.
- Muffin dough keeps well in refrigerator for approximately 1 month.

The Best Spinach Dip Ever

Ingredients:
- 16 ounces cream cheese softened
- 16 ounces sour cream
- 10 ounces frozen chopped spinach thawed & well-drained packages of
- 3 tablespoons onions dried, more or less to taste
- 1 tablespoon worcestershire sauce more or less to taste
- 1 tablespoon season salt more or less to taste
- 2 packages fritos Scoops
- 1 round loaf mountain bread, pumpernickel, etc.

Directions:
- Thaw and drain the 2-10 oz packages of frozen chopped spinach.
- Squeeze out as much of the water as possible.
- Add to the 16 oz of softened cream cheese and 16 oz of sour cream.
- Mix thoroughly with an electric mixer.
- Mix in the dried onions, Worcestershire sauce, and season salt, to taste.
- Cover and refrigerate. This is best when made about 24 hours in advance.
- Can be served in a bowl or in a hollowed out loaf of bread.
- I prefer to serve with Fritos Scoops for a strong chip to hold the dip.
- Recipe can be doubled or tripled for larger parties.

Cheesy Olive Bites 

Ingredients:
- In food processor
- combine equal volumes (eg: 1 cup each) of shredded cheddar cheese
- all-purpose flour
- and unsalted butter. Blend until forms a dough. Form into quarter-sized diamener logs
- and chill.

Directions:
