- Drain a jar of pimento-stuffed spanish olives. Pinch off piece of the dough log the size of the olive, flatten, and wrap around olive, rolling between palms to smooth. Put on a baking tray, and freeze. Bake at 350 degrees for 10-15 mins, dust with pimenton, and serve.

Vegemite Chicken Bites

Ingredients:
- 350g chicken mince Whole Foods 1 lb For $3.99 thru 02/09
- 2 cooking apples, peeled cored and grated
- 1 medium carrot, peeled and grated Target 2 lb For $3.00 thru 02/06
- 2 medium zucchini, grated and excess moisture drained
- 1 medium onion, peeled and diced
- 3 teaspoons VEGEMITE
- 1/4 teaspoon ground ginger
- 1 teaspoon grated lemon rind
- 1 cup wholemeal breadcrumbs
- 1 tablespoon oil

Directions:
- Combine chicken, apples, carrot, zucchini, onion, Vegemite*, ginger and lemon rind; mix well.
- Take tablespoonfuls of mixture and roll into balls.
- Coat with breadcrumbs.
- Refrigerate for 40 minutes.
- Cook in a preheated hot oven (200C) for 25 - 30 minutes.

Black Bottom Cupcakes

Ingredients:
- 1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese
- 1 egg
- 1/3 c. sugar
- 1/8 tsp. salt
- 1 (6 oz.) pkg. chocolate chips
- 2 1/4 c. flour
- 1 1/2 c. sugar
- 1/3 c. cocoa
- 1 1/2 tsp. baking soda
- 1/2 c. oil
- 2/3 tsp. salt
- 1 Tbsp. vinegar
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 c. water

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350°.
- In a medium mixing bowl, beat cream cheese, egg, 1/3 cup sugar and salt with an electric mixer.
- Stir in chocolate chips; set aside.
- In another bowl combine flour, 1 1/2 cups sugar, cocoa, baking soda, salt and water.
- Next, mix oil, vinegar and vanilla.
- Add to flour mixture.
- Fill cupcake papers 1/2 full with cocoa batter.
- Place 1 teaspoonful cream cheese mixture in center of each cupcake and bake 15 to 20 minutes.
- No frosting is needed.

Mexican Chicken Casserole

Ingredients:
- 3 boneless skinless chicken breasts, diced
- 8 (8 inch) flour tortillas, torn into bite size
- 1 (10 3/4 ounce) can condensed cheddar cheese soup, undiluted
- 1 (10 3/4 ounce) can condensed cream of chicken soup, undiluted
- 1/2 cup salsa
- 1/4 cup milk
- 4 -6 ounces light sour cream
- 4 ounces shredded cheddar cheese

Directions:
- Preheat the oven to 375 degrees. Scatter the tortilla shells in the bottom of a 9x13 pan.
- Spray a frying pan with cooking spray then cook the chicken until no longer pink.
- Mix the soup, salsa, sour cream, milk, cheese, & chicken together in a bowl then pour over the tortillas.
- Bake in the oven for 30 minutes.

Methodist Chicken

Ingredients:
- 1 c. uncooked rice
- 1 can cream of mushroom soup
- 1 can cream of celery soup
- 1 pkg. Lipton onion soup mix
- 2 c. water
- 1 cut up chicken

Directions:
- Put rice in a 9 x 13-inch baking dish.
- Lay pieces of fryer on top of rice; mix all other ingredients together and spoon over chicken.
- Bake uncovered for 1 1/2 hours.
- Cover and continue baking another 1/2 hour in a 350° oven.

Potsie'S Famous Fried Bolony Sandwich

Ingredients:
- 2 slices white bread
- 2 slices , thick cut balony
- 1 tablespoon yellow mustard
- 1 slice of a large onion
- 1 slice of a large ripe tomatoes

Directions:
- It ain't rocket science or quantum physics. Just make the sandwich.
- Tip: score the balony slices with a knife and they won't curl up when frying. I like to fry them until they are just a little blackened but still plenty greasy. If the grease doesn't drip down your arm and off your elbows then you have overcooked it.

Strawberry and Cream Cupcakes

Ingredients:
- 18 ounces white cake mix
- 1 14 cups strawberry soda
- 13 cup vegetable oil
- 3 egg whites
- 16 ounces cream cheese frosting
- 1 -3 drop red food coloring
- 12 cup white jimmies candy sprinkles

Directions:
- Heat oven to 350.
- Place paper baking cups in 24 regular-size muffin cups.
- In large bowl, beat cake mix, soda pop, oil and egg whites on low speed 30 seconds.
- Beat 2 minutes on medium speed, scraping bowl occasionally.
- Fill each cup 2/3 full of batter.
- Bake 15 to 20 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.
- Remove from pan to wire rack.
- Cool completely, about 20 minutes.
- Stir frosting in container 20 times.
- Stir in 1 to 2 drops red food color.
- Frost cupcakes.
- Place sprinkles and 1 drop red food coloring in small resealable plastic food storage bag; seal bag.
- Gently shake and massage sprinkles until mixture is various shades of pink; sprinkle around edges of frosted cupcakes.

Shrimp Creole

Ingredients:
- 4 c. water
- 1 lb. fresh or frozen, shelled and cleaned shrimp
- 1/2 c. chopped onion
- 1/2 c. chopped green pepper
- 1/4 c. water
- 1 (28 oz.) can diced tomatoes
- 2 tsp. instant chicken bouillon granules
- 2 tsp. sugar
- 1 tsp. dried crushed thyme
- 1/4 tsp. hot pepper sauce
- 1/4 c. water
- 2 Tbsp. cornstarch
- 2 c. hot cooked rice
- 1/4 c. snipped parsley

Directions:
- In a large saucepan bring 4
- cups water to a boil.
- Add shrimp and simmer 1 to 3
- minutes
- or until shrimp turns pink. Drain and set aside.
- In
- a large skillet combine onion, green pepper and 1/4 cup water.
- Cover
- and simmer 3 to 4 minutes or until vegetables are slightly tender.
- Do not drain.

Crab Tartlets 

Ingredients:
- 1/2# Jumbo Lump Crabmeat
- 4 oz. Cream Cheese
- 1/3 cup finely chopped onion
- 1/2 cup finely chopped red bell pepper
- 3 Tbls Butter
- 1 tsp finely chopped parsley
- 1 tsp finely chopped tarragon
- 2 packages premade frozen phyllo mini cups
- 1 small bottle thai sweet chile sauce

Directions:
- Saute all vegetables Together in butter until just begining to soften. Add to picked crabmeat, cream cheese, and herbs. Mix well. Then place by spoonfuls into premade mini phyllo cups. Bake at 375 for 8-12 minutes or untiltops begin to turn golden. Serve hot with a 1/2 tsp. Thai sweet chile sauce on top.

Chrissy'S Lamb Chops 

Ingredients:
- 4-8 lamb chops. (shoulder or loin)
- 2-3 packets of low sodium beef boullion seasoning (depends on how many chops.
- seasoned salt
- pepper
- oil (for searing)

Directions:
- preheat oven to 350'
- 
- season chops with seasoned salt.
- 
- generously sprinkle beef bouillon seasoning on chops
- 
- lightly pepper them
- 
- oil hot pan and lay chops (seasoned-side down) to brown. season other side and brown.
- 
- place chops in baking dish (overlapping wo'nt hurt), cover pan with foil and bake for about 20 minutes.
- 
- note* oven time depends on how you like it.

Lentil, Garbanzo Bean and Tomato Salad

Ingredients:
- 2 1/2 cups water
- 1 cup lentils
- 2 large carrots peeled, diced
- 1 each bay leaves
- 16 ounces chickpeas (garbanzo beans) rinsed, drained
- 1/2 basket cherry tomatoes halved
- 1 cup parsley leaves fresh, chopped
- 5 each scallions, spring or green onions chopped
- 4 1/2 tablespoons olive oil
- 2 tablespoons lemon juice fresh

Directions:
- Combine 2 1/2 cups water, lentils, diced carrots, and bay leaf in heavy medium saucepan.
- Bring to boil.
- Reduce heat, cover and simmer until lentils are just tender, about 25 minutes.
- Drain, transfer to large bowl.
- Cool.
- Mix all remaining ingredients into lentils.
- Season to taste with salt and pepper.

Dessert Bars

Ingredients:
- 1 box yellow cake mix
- 1 c. brown sugar
- 1/2 c. butter
- 2 eggs
- 2 tsp. vanilla
- 1 (6 oz.) pkg. semi-sweet chocolate chips
- 3/4 c. pecans, chopped

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients, except chocolate chips and nuts. Beat well. Pour into greased 9 x 13 x 2-inch pan. Sprinkle chocolate chips and nuts on top. Bake at 350° for 25 minutes. These are chewy and may not look done, but are. Cool and cut into bars.

Tandori Chicken(Foreign Flavor, Healthy)  

Ingredients:
- 1 (8 oz.) c. plain yogurt
- 1 1/2 tsp. chili powder
- 1/8 tsp. ground ginger and coriander
- 1 large clove garlic, minced
- 3 Tbsp. lemon juice
- 3 lb. chicken pieces, skinned

Directions:
- Combine all ingredients except chicken.
- Skin chicken, rinse and pat dry.
- Place chicken in a leakproof plastic bag (or a bowl) and add marinade to cover chicken pieces.
- Marinate for 3 to 4 hours or preferably overnight.
- Shake off marinade and grill or bake for 1 hour in 350° oven.
- Serve with rice.
- Makes 4 servings.

Buttermilk Pie

Ingredients:
- 10-inch unbaked pie crust
- 1 1/2 c. sugar
- 4 eggs, beaten
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 stick butter, melted
- 3 Tbsp. flour
- 1 c. buttermilk

Directions:
- Beat eggs well.
- Mix flour and sugar together and add to eggs. Add melted butter and beat well.
- Stir in buttermilk and vanilla. Pour mixture into pie crust.
- Bake at 325° until firm in center, about 45 minutes to 1 hour.

French Onion Drop Biscuits

Ingredients:
- 2 c. self-rising flour
- 2 Tbsp. softened butter
- 1/4 c. French onion dip (sour cream base)
- 2/3 c. milk
- Extra butter for brushing on top of biscuits

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Combine flour, butter, dip, and milk.
- Mix well and drop from tablespoon onto greased baking sheet.
- Bake about 10 to 12 minutes or until lightly browned. Immediately after removing biscuits from oven, brush tops with butter.

Cheesy Hash Browns Casserole

Ingredients:
- 2 cups sour cream
- 1 (8 ounce) can cream of chicken soup
- 12 cup onion, finely chopped
- salt and pepper
- 12 cup melted butter
- 2 cups corn flakes
- 2 lbs hash browns
- 2 cups grated cheddar cheese

Directions:
- mix together the first 4 ingredients.
- put half of the hash browns into a 9x13 dish.
- put on 1 cup of cheese, and half of the soup mix.
- add another layer of hash browns and then the cheese and soup mix on top.
- crush the corn flakes and mix with the butter.
- spread the corn flake mixture on top.
- bake at 350 degrees for 45 mins-1 hr, if the has browns are thawed, 1hr-1 1/2 hr if not.

Faux Pesto

Ingredients:
- 4 cups fresh baby spinach
- 1/2 cup pecans
- 2 cloves garlic
- 1 cup Parmesan cheese
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
- 1/2 cup extra virgin olive oil
- 1 pinch salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste

Directions:
- Mix the spinach, pecans, garlic, Parmesan cheese, and lemon juice in the bowl of a food processor; stream the olive oil into the mixture as it blends. Season with salt and pepper.

Laura'S Breadless Fried Egg Sandwich

Ingredients:
- 3 slices bacon
- cooking spray
- 2 eggs
- salt and ground black pepper to taste
- 1/3 cup shredded Cheddar cheese

Directions:
- Place bacon slices in a large skillet and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about 10 minutes. Drain slices on paper towels. Crumble into pieces and set aside.
- Spray another skillet with cooking spray and heat over medium-low heat. Crack eggs side by side into the skillet; season with salt and black pepper. Cook until egg whites are set and firm, 3 to 4 minutes. Flip eggs. Sprinkle bacon pieces and Cheddar cheese over one egg. Continue cooking to desired doneness and cheese is melted, 3 to 4 minutes more. Place second egg on top. Transfer to serving dish.

"baconsalt" Quiche

Ingredients:
- 400 g cottage cheese (low-fat)
- 4 eggs
- 2 onions (sliced)
- 1 tomatoes (sliced)
- 1 chili
- 1 teaspoon flavoring (BaconSalt)

Directions:
- Mix the eggs and cottage cheese in a bowl with one of the onions and add a heaped teaspoon of baconsalt.
- Lightly oil an 8 to10inch flan dish, (no pastry!)
- and pour the mixture inches
- Top with sliced onion, sliced tomato and chilies or peppers.
- Bake at 200C until firm to the touch, (30 to 40 minutes)
- Serve on its own for a snack or with a mixed salad for lunch.

Chive Biscuits

Ingredients:
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- 3 teaspoons baking powder
- 12 teaspoon salt
- 14 teaspoon baking soda
- 13 cup butter flavor shortening
- 1 cup buttermilk
- 2 tablespoons minced chives

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 450 degrees F.
- Combine flour, baking powder, salt and baking soda in a small bowl.
- Cut in shortening with pastry blender until coarse crumbs.
- Stir in buttermilk and chives and stir until just moistened.
- Drop by tablespoons 2 inches apart onto a greased baking sheet.
- Bake for 10-12 minutes until lightly browned.
- Serve warm and enjoy!

Veggie Saugage and Eggs

Ingredients:
- 3 slices vegetarian sausages
- cooking spray
- 2 eggs
- 1 teaspoon chopped basil
- shredded cheese
- 2 tablespoons cream cheese with vegetables
- 3 tablespoons red onions
- 3 tablespoons chopped carrots
- 1 dash salt
- 1 dash pepper

Directions:
- Pan fry veggie sausage patties with pan coated in non stick cooking spray.
- wisk eggs and remning ingredients.
- place in pan (coated with non stick cooking spray), scramble eggs.
- Enjoy.

Baked Chicken With Almond Sauce

Ingredients:
- 1 (2 1/2 lb.) chicken, cut into pieces
- 1/2 c. flour
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1/2 stick margarine
- 1 can mushroom soup
- 1 c. water
- 1/4 c. slivered almonds

Directions:
- Dredge chicken in flour mixed with salt and pepper.
- Place chicken, skin side down, in buttered baking dish.
- Melt margarine; pour over chicken. Bake at 400° for 20 minutes.
- Turn chicken; bake 20 minutes at 350°.
- Pour mushroom soup and water over chicken.
- Sprinkle almonds on top. Bake for 20 minutes at 350°. Makes 4 to 5 servings.

The Peabody Peppermint Patti

Ingredients:
- 4 (1 ounce) envelopes hot chocolate powder
- 4 cups boiling water
- 14 cup peppermint schnapps
- sweetened whipped cream

Directions:
- Empty all envelopes of hot chocolate mix into a saucepan.
- Add 4 cups boiling water, stirring until hot chocolate mix dissolves; stir in peppermint schnapps.
- Pour mixture into mugs; top each serving with whipped cream.

Corn Tortillas 

Ingredients:
- 2 cups masa harina, preferably Bob's Red Mill
- 1 1/2 cup water

Directions:
- In a lg bowl mix m.h. with water and stir ntil moist. On a sheet of plastic wrap, roll the dough into an 8 inch log and cut the log into 16 pieces. Roll each piece into a ball and transfer to a large plate and cover loosely with plastic wrap.
- Heat a griddle until very hot. Line a basket or a wide shallow bowl with a clean towel. Cut a sturdy resealable plastic bag at the seam. Set 1 ball of dough between the sheets of plastic and roll out into a 5 inch tortilla. Set on a hot griddle and cook for 1 min. or until till brown spots appear. Flip and cook 30 seconds longer. Wrap in a towel to keep warm.

Baked Beans

Ingredients:
- 1/4 c. vinegar
- 1/4 c. mustard
- 1/4 c. ketchup
- 1/4 c. brown sugar
- 1 small onion, chopped
- 1/2 bell pepper, chopped
- 2 cans pork and beans
- 1 can red kidney beans
- 1 can Spam (optional)

Directions:
- Mix first 4 ingredients until smooth.
- Set aside.
- Mix remaining ingredients and add first 4.
- Bake at 400° for 30 to 40 minutes.
- May add sliced Spam to top before baking.

Pasta Salad With Curried Yogurt Dressing

Ingredients:
- 11 oz dried pasta
- 1 bunch scallions, trimmed and sliced
- 1/2 lb radish, sliced
- 1 None cucumber, halved lengthways and sliced
- 1 head romaine lettuce, leaves torn
- 1 cup low fat mayonnaise
- 1 1/3 cup yogurt
- Pinch None curry powder

Directions:
- Cook the pasta in salted boiling water according to the package directions. Drain. Rinse in cold water and set aside to cool completely.
- Place the scallions in a bowl with the radish, cucumber, lettuce with the cooled pasta and mix well.
- For the dressing, place the mayonnaise in a small bowl with the yogurt and curry powder. Season to taste with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Coat the pasta in the dressing, toss well and serve.

Cabbage Roll Casserole

Ingredients:
- 10- 3/4 ounces, fluid Can Of Tomato Soup
- 2 cans (5 1/2 Oz. Can) Tomato Juice
- 3 Tablespoons Brown Sugar
- 3 Tablespoons Vinegar
- 2- 1/2 pounds Ground Beef
- 1- 1/2 cup Minute Rice Or Oatmeal
- 1 teaspoon Seasoned Salt
- 1 teaspoon Garlic Salt
- 2 whole Eggs
- 1 cup Milk
- 1 whole Cabbage Head, Cut Into Wide Strips

Directions:
- Mix the tomato soup, tomato juice, brown sugar, and vinegar for the sauce.
- Combine ground beef, Minute Rice, seasonings, eggs and milk.
- Layer in a large glass dish the cabbage strips and meat mixture in multiple layers until the meat mixture is used up.
- Top with the sauce.
- Cover with aluminum foil and bake at 350F for 2 hours.

Oyster Casserole

Ingredients:
- 1 qt. oysters
- 1/2 c. liquor
- 3 c. Ritz cracker crumbs
- 1 1/2 sticks melted butter
- a few minced scallops (optional)
- chopped parsley
- sprinkle of thyme
- 1/2 c. milk

Directions:
- Drain oysters, saving 1/2 cup of liquor.
- Mix liquor with 1/2 cup of milk; melt butter or margarine and mix with the cracker crumbs.
- Spread a layer of buttered crumbs in a casserole.
- Add 1/4 of oysters, salt and pepper to taste.
- Pour a little of the liquor/milk mixture over the oysters and sprinkle on more crumbs. Repeat until out of oysters.
- Top with buttered crumbs and pour on remaining liquor.
- Bake in a 350° oven for 45 minutes.

Irish Grinders

Ingredients:
- 3 lbs corned beef brisket, with spice packet
- 1 cup water
- 13 cup Dijon mustard
- 2 teaspoons prepared horseradish
- 4 cups coarsely shredded cabbage
- 8 kaiser rolls
- dijon-style mustard

Directions:
- Trim meat.
- Sprinkle spices over meat.
- Place in slow cooker.
- Combine water, mustard and horseradish.
- Pour over meat and top with cabbage.
- Cover and cook on low for 8-10 hours.
- Transfer meat to cutting board.
- Thinly slice across the grain.
- Place on rolls.
- With slotted spoon, place some of the cooked cabbage on the meat.

Crab Dip

Ingredients:
- 1 clove garlic, minced
- 2 -3 ounces cream cheese
- 14 cup mayonnaise
- 12 cup minced chives
- 18 teaspoon salt
- 14 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce
- 6 -8 ounces crabmeat
- 2 drops Tabasco sauce
- 12 cup light cream
- 1 teaspoon minced onion
- 2 teaspoons lemon juice

Directions:
- cream together mayonaise, cream cheese, garlic, chives, salt and worcestershire sauce.
- add lemon juice, tobasco, cream and onion.
- mix in crab meat.
- refridgerate.
- serve with pita shells, or any thing you love to dip with!

Mango-Strawberry Smoothies for Two

Ingredients:
- 1/2 cup BREAKSTONE'S or KNUDSEN 2% Milkfat Low Fat Cottage Cheese
- 1/3 cup water
- 1 Tbsp. honey
- 1 cup frozen chopped mangos
- 1/2 cup frozen strawberries

Directions:
- Blend ingredients in blender until smooth.
- Serve immediately.

Broccoli Gorgonzola Cream Soup

Ingredients:
- 2 heads Broccoli
- 700 milliliters Water
- 1 Onion, Peeled And Cut Into Chunks
- 1 pinch Salt
- 1 teaspoon Oregano
- 1 Potato, Peeled And Cut Into Chunks
- 200 grams Crumbled Gorgonzola
- 1 Tablespoon Finely Grated Parmesan

Directions:
- Cut off the hard trunks of the broccoli and cut it into small pieces. Prepare a pot with water, add broccoli, onion, salt and oregano and boil for about 30 minutes.
- Add the peeled potato and boil for another 20 minutes. When vegetables are cooked, strain and save the stock.
- Using a hand blender, puree vegetables, adding as much stock as desired. Bring soup back to heat over low heat, and sir in gorgonzola. Remove from heat and add Parmesan.

Spanish Chicken And Rice From Birds Eye®

Ingredients:
- 1 tablespoon vegetable oil
- 1 pound boneless, skinless chicken thighs, cut into bite-sized cubes
- 1 (8 ounce) bag Birds Eye(R) Recipe Ready Sofrito
- 1 (10 ounce) bag Birds Eye(R) Steamfresh(R) Long Grain White Rice with Mixed Vegetables, cooked according to package directions
- 1/2 cup chicken broth
- 1 packet sazon seasoning blend
- 1/2 teaspoon salt

Directions:
- Heat oil in large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat and cook chicken, stirring occasionally, 6 minutes or until golden brown.* Remove from pan.
- Add Recipe Ready Sofrito and cook over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally, 4 minutes or until vegetables are softened.
- Stir in reserved chicken, prepared Long Grain White Rice with Mixed Vegetables, chicken broth, Sazon seasoning and salt. Cook, stirring frequently, 2 minutes or until well combined.

Lemon Jello Mix

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 1 Tbsp. flour
- 1 egg yolk
- 2 Tbsp. butter
- 1 can crushed pineapple (save juice)
- 1 pkg. lemon jello mix
- 1 c. hot water
- 1 c. cold water
- 2 bananas
- 1 c. marshmallows
- 1 c. nuts (optional)

Directions:
- Mix first 4 ingredients.
- Put pineapple juice in measuring cup and add water to make 1 cup; add to the first 4 ingredients. Bring to a good boiling point and boil for 5 minutes.
- Mix jello mix with 1 cup hot water and 1 cup cold water and add boiling mixture to it.
- Chill this until firm, then add the pineapple, bananas, marshmallows and nuts.
- Top with off with 1 cup of whipped cream.

Boozy Pomegranate Popsicles

Ingredients:
- 3-1/2 cups Sliced Strawberries
- 1 whole Lemon, Zested
- 3-1/2 Tablespoons Lemon Juice
- 1/3 cups Pomegranate Infused Tequila

Directions:
- Place strawberries, lemon zest, lemon juice and tequila in a food processor. Pulse until mixture is smooth. Add additional tequila to taste (or if mixture is too thick).
- Carefully pour mixture into 6 Dixie cups and freeze for about 1 1/2 hours.
- Carefully insert wooden popsicle sticks into the middle of the popsicle. Re-freeze for about 3 hours or until set.
- Enjoy!

Monster Cookie Bars

Ingredients:
- 1/2 cups Butter
- 1 cup Sugar
- 1 cup Brown Sugar
- 1-1/2 cup Peanut Butter
- 3 whole Eggs
- 1 teaspoon Vanilla
- 2 teaspoons Baking Soda
- 4-1/2 cups Oatmeal
- 1 cup M&Ms
- 3/4 cups Chocolate Chips

Directions:
- Combine the butter, sugars, peanut butter, eggs, vanilla and baking soda till well mixed. Add in the oatmeal, M&Ms and chocolate chips. (You may need to blend these in by hand.) Spread in a greased jelly roll pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 15-20 minutes.

Simple British Flapjack

Ingredients:
- 1/2 cup butter
- 3 tablespoons white sugar
- 2 tablespoons golden syrup
- 2 cups rolled oats
- 5 tablespoons raisins (optional)
- 1 (5 ounce) milk chocolate, melted (optional)

Directions:
- Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly butter a baking pan.
- Combine butter, sugar, and golden syrup in a saucepan over low heat. Mix until butter has melted and sugar has dissolved. Remove from heat. Add 2 cups oats and raisins. Mix until oats are well coated. Pour mixture into the prepared pan; flatten down with the back of a spoon.
- Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown on top, 10 to 20 minutes. Let flapjack cool.
- Melt chocolate in a microwave-safe glass or ceramic bowl in 15-second intervals, stirring after each interval, 1 to 3 minutes. Pour over the cooled flapjack. Let cool until chocolate is set.

Tender Carrots With Apricots

Ingredients:
- 1/2 cup dried apricot
- 1 1/2 cups carrots, cut into 1/2 inch rounds
- 1 1/2 tablespoons water
- 1/2 teaspoon unsalted butter
- 1/8 teaspoon sugar
- 1 1/2 teaspoons fresh parsley (optional)

Directions:
- Cover apricots with hot water in a bowl and soak 1 1/2 hours.
- Drain and pat dry.
- Cut apricots into thin strips.
- Combine next 4 ingredients in a heavy nonstick pan over medium heat.
- Cover tightly, reduce heat to low and cook 12-15 minutes, or until carrots are just tender.
- Add apricots and return to heat 1-2 minutes.
- Serve carrots sprinkled with parsley if desired.

Turkey-Cucumber Pita

Ingredients:
- 1 whole wheat pita bread (6 inch)
- 1 Tbsp. MIRACLE WHIP Dressing Family Dollar $3.50 thru 02/07
- 1 lettuce leaf
- 4 slices OSCAR MAYER Deli Fresh Smoked Turkey Breast
- 2 slices tomato King Sooper's 1 lb For $0.99 thru 02/09
- 1 KRAFT 2% Milk Singles
- 4 slices cucumber

Directions:
- Spread bread with dressing.
- Top with lettuce, turkey, tomatoes, 2% Milk Singles and cucumbers.
- Fold in half to serve.

Cheese Ball

Ingredients:
- 1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese
- 1 lb. chopped Cheddar cheese
- 1/2 pkg. ranch-style dressing

Directions:
- Let cheeses stand to room temperature.
- Mix all ingredients together; form into a ball.
- Chill for at least 2 hours before serving.

Golumpka(Polish Stuffed Cabbage)  

Ingredients:
- 3 lb. hamburger
- 2 eggs
- 1/2 tsp. garlic salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1/2 c. raw rice
- 2 cans tomato soup
- 1 small green pepper, chopped
- 1 large head cabbage
- 1 small onion, chopped

Directions:
- Break leaves of cabbage off head.
- Put about 8 to 10 leaves on dish and microwave on High about 3 minutes or until limp.
- Prepare the rest of the cabbage in the same manner.

Crabs With Garlic And Butter

Ingredients:
- 2 doz. blue crabs, live
- 4 oz. crushed garlic in oil or 2 cloves garlic
- 1/2 lb. butter or 1/4 lb. butter plus 1/4 lb. margarine
- 1 tsp. paprika
- Old Bay seasoning to taste
- 12 oz. beer
- 1 c. vinegar
- 1 tsp. crushed red pepper
- 1 bunch parsley

Directions:
- In large pot heat beer, vinegar and hot pepper seeds to boil. Add crabs, cover steam for approximately 20 minutes until bright red.
- Remove crabs and allow to cool.
- In large roaster pan put butter, garlic and paprika.
- Heat slowly.
- Remove shell and clean crabs of lungs and mustard, put crabs in roaster.
- Baste crabs, garnish with Old Bay seasoning and fresh chopped parsley.

Barley Scallion Pine Nut Casserole Recipe

Ingredients:
- 1 c. Pearl barley
- 2 tsp Butter
- 1 med Onion, minced
- 3 c. Chicken stock, warm, defatted
- 1/4 c. Scallions, finely minced
- 1/3 c. Finely minced fresh parsley
- 2 Tbsp. Pine nuts, toasted Salt, to taste Freshly grnd black pepper, to taste

Directions:
- 1.
- Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
- 2.
- Rinse barley, drain and set aside.
- 3.
- Heat butter in a 1 1/2-qt flameproof casserole dish over medium heat.
- Add in onions and cook till softened, about 2 min.
- Add in barley and continue cooking, stirring constantly, till the barley is coated with butter, about 1 minute.
- Stir in stock and scallions.
- Mix well.
- 4.
- Bring to a boil, cove, [transfer to oven I assume] and bake for 1 hour, or possibly till barley is tender and liquid is absorbed.
- 5.
- Add in parsley and pine nuts.
- Taste and adjust seasonings.
- Fluff with two forks and turn out into a hot serving dish.
- Serves 6.

Vegetable Casserole

Ingredients:
- 2 cans mixed vegetables (I prefer Del Monte)
- 1 can sliced water chestnuts
- 1 medium onion, chopped
- 1 c. shredded cheese (I use sharp)
- 1 c. mayonnaise
- 1/2 to 1 pkg. Pepperidge Farm stuffing
- 1 stick margarine

Directions:
- Melt margarine and mix with stuffing.
- Set aside.
- Drain vegetables and chestnuts, reserving liquid.
- Mix vegetables, chestnuts, onion, mayonnaise and cheese.
- Add liquid as needed, approximately 1/2 cup.
- Pour in a 13 x 9-inch casserole dish. Cover with stuffing.
- Bake at 350° until brown, about 30 minutes.

Salisbury Steak With Mushroom Gravy 

Ingredients:
- 1/3 cup grated onion
- 1/2 teaspoon black pepper
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 pound ground sirloin
- cooking spray
- 1 tablespoon butter
- 8 ounces cremini mushrooms, quartered
- 1/3 cup red wine
- 1 1/4 cups fat- free, lower sodium beef broth
- 1 tablespoon all-purpose flour
- 1 teaspoon red wine vinegar

Directions:
- Combine 1/4 cup onion, pepper, salt, garlic and beef. Shape into 4 1/2 inch thick patties. Heat a skillet over medium-high heat. Coat with cooking spray. Add patties, cook 3 minutes on each side or until browned.
- 
- Melt butter in pan. Add mushrooms, suate 4 minutes. Stir in wine and remaining onion; cook 2 minutes. Combine broth and flour; add to pan, and bring to boil. Cook 5 minutes or until thick. Add patties and vinegar to pan; cook 2 minutes.

French 75 Recipe

Ingredients:
- 2 ounces gin
- 1 ounce freshly squeezed lemon juice
- 2 teaspoons sugar
- Champagne or sparkling wine
- Garnish: long thin lemon spiral and cocktail cherry

Directions:
- Fill cocktail shaker with ice. Shake gin, lemon juice, and sugar in a cocktail shaker until well chilled, about 15 seconds. Strain into a champagne flute.
- Top with Champagne. Stir gently, garnish with a long, thin lemon spiral and a cocktail cherry.

Potato Quiche

Ingredients:
- 3 to 4 c. frozen hash browns, thawed
- 5 Tbsp. butter, melted
- 1 c. diced ham, cooked
- 1/4 c. diced green pepper
- 1/4 c. diced onion
- 1 c. cheese, shredded
- 2 eggs, beaten
- 1/2 c. milk
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- pepper to taste

Directions:
- Press excess moisture from potatoes and place in greased deep dish pie pan.
- Pour melted butter over and bake 30 to 45 minutes at 425°.

Bob'S Italian Sausage Sliders

Ingredients:
- 1 lb mild Italian sausage
- 1 cup marinara sauce
- 1 cup fire-roasted peppers and onion (red and green)
- 2 slices mozzarella cheese (quartered or shredded)
- 8 sliced dinner rolls or 8 slider buns
- butter (For rolls) or liquid butter (For rolls)

Directions:
- Weigh and divide the sausage into 2 ounce balls.
- Flatten into patties.
- Fry them until done.
- If cooking a large amount of them such as a party, I have baked them as one big sheet and divided into patties.
- Top individual patties with about a teaspoon of marinara sauce each.
- Place a little of the fire roasted red and green peppers and onion on the marinara sauce.
- Place the quartered sliced Mozzarella cheese on the peppers.
- Bake at 350 degrees Fahrenheit or broil until the cheese is melted and slightly browned.
- Butter the sliced rolls; place on griddle or grill.
- When browned, place the patties on the rolls. And enjoy!

Microwave Bread Pudding 

Ingredients:
- 1 Croissant
- 1 Egg
- 2 tablespoons Sugar
- 2 tablespoons Cream
- 2 tablespoons Butter
- 1 tablespoon Vanilla
- 1 dash Cinnamon

Directions:
- Tear up the croissant into small pieces and place in a microwavable container, then set aside.
- Whisk together all of the remaining ingredients until evenly blended, if the butter is not soft it is okay to microwave until melted
- Slowly pour the mixture onto the torn croissant
- Put in the microwave for two minutes
- Set aside for two to five minutes to let the flavors meld and the custard texture set in

Sweet And Sour Chicken

Ingredients:
- 3 lb. boneless chicken, cubed
- 1 Tbsp. oil
- 1 c. green and red pepper strips
- 2 medium onions, cut in strips
- 1 Tbsp. cornstarch
- 1/4 c. lite soy sauce
- 1 (8 oz.) can chunk pineapple and juice
- 3 Tbsp. vinegar
- 3 Tbsp. brown sugar
- 1/2 tsp. ground ginger
- 1/2 tsp. garlic powder
- cooked rice

Directions:
- Cook and stir chicken in hot oil in large skillet until well browned.
- Add peppers and onions; cook until just soft, still a little crisp.
- Mix cornstarch and soy sauce.
- Add to pan with pineapple and juice, vinegar, sugar, ginger and garlic powder. Bring to a full boil.
- Meanwhile, prepare rice as directed on package.
- Serve over rice.

Sausage Appetizers

Ingredients:
- 12 lb roll Italian pork sausage
- 13 cup mozzarella cheese
- 14 cup sour cream
- 3 tablespoons mayonnaise
- 2 tablespoons chopped green onions
- 12 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce
- 20 slices miniature party rye rounds

Directions:
- Preheat broiler.
- Crumble and cook sausage in medium skillet until browned.
- Drain on paper towels.
- T.
- Transfer sausage to small bowl
- Stir in cheese, sour cream, mayonnaise, green onions and Worcestershire.
- Cut crusts from bread.
- Cut each slice into 4 squares; spread about 1 teaspoons sausage mixture onto each square.
- Arrange squares on ungreased baking sheet; place under hot broiler just until cheese melts and filling bubbles.
- Serve hot and enjoy.

Salsa Rojo

Ingredients:
- 1 tablespoon olive oil, extra-virgin
- 1 cup onions diced
- 2 each chile pepper diced, medium
- 2 cloves garlic minced
- 1 1/2 pounds italian plum (roma) tomatoes diced
- 1 tablespoon chili powder
- 1 teaspoon cumin ground
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1 x cayenne pepper to taste
- 1/4 cup cilantro freshly chopped
- 2 tablespoons lime juice

Directions:
- Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat.
- Add onion, chile peppers and garlic and cook, stirring, until the onion is soft and beginning to brown, 3 to 4 minutes.
- Reduce heat to medium.
- Add tomatoes, chili powder, cumin, salt and cayenne.
- Cook, stirring occasionally, until the tomatoes have broken down and thickened slightly, 6 to 8 minutes.
- Carefully transfer the tomato mixture to a food processor or blender.
- Pulse to make a chunky sauce, or until desired consistency.
- Let cool to room temperature, about 1 1/2 hours.
- Stir in cilantro and lime juice just before serving.

Brisket And Potatoes

Ingredients:
- 2 onions, chopped
- 1 chopped green pepper
- 1 chopped red pepper
- 1 chopped yellow pepper
- 0.5 (1 1/4 ounce) envelope onion soup mix
- 3/4 cup red wine
- ketchup
- 3 -4 lbs beef brisket, trimmed
- 1 teaspoon pepper
- garlic powder
- paprika
- 4 potatoes, peeld and cut into 1/8ths

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 325 degrees Fahrenheit.
- Saute onions until browned.
- Add peppers until soft.
- Add mushrooms.
- Combine onion soup mix, wine, and ketchup.
- In foil lined pan, place 1/3 of the sauteed peppers.
- Place meat seasoned with the pepper, garlic powder, and paprika.
- Pour wine mixture on top.
- Arrange potatoes around sides.
- Add remaining peppers.
- Wrap airtight in foil and bake at 325 degrees Fahrenheit for 3 to 4 hours.

Brisket With Cranberry Sauce

Ingredients:
- 8 lb. first cut brisket
- 3 (1 lb.) cans whole cranberry sauce
- salt and pepper
- 4 cans steak sauce with mushrooms
- onions
- 1 Tbsp. salad oil or olive oil
- 1 small clove garlic, minced or pressed
- 1 (about 2 1/2 lb.) rib, frozen solid (standing rib beef roast)
- 2 large Russet potatoes

Directions:
- Combine oil and garlic; rub evenly over cut surfaces of frozen meat.
- Stand rib, bone side down, in a shallow baking pan between potatoes placed like book ends.

Fancy Green Salad

Ingredients:
- celery, thinly sliced
- green peppers, chopped
- boiled eggs, chopped
- red onion, thinly sliced
- bacon, crumbled
- shredded Swiss cheese
- barely cooked green peas, drained well
- lettuce and/or spinach
- mayonnaise
- sour cream

Directions:
- Tear lettuce and/or spinach 1/3 to 1/2-inch deep in dish. Make fairly complete layers of the 8 ingredients over the greens.

Garbanzo Salad

Ingredients:
- 8 cups chopped romaine lettuce
- 4 medium tomatoes, chopped
- 3 cups , cooked or canned
- 1/2 medium red onion, chopped
- 1/2 cup KRAFT Lite CATALINA Dressing
- 1/2 cup PLANTERS Sunflower Kernels
- 4 medium apple
- 32 fl oz (4 cups) fat-free milk

Directions:
- Combine lettuce, tomatoes, beans and onions in a bowl.
- Toss with dressing.
- Divide evenly onto 4 plates.
- Sprinkle each with 2 Tbsp.
- sunflower seeds.
- Complement each salad with an apple.
- Serve each person an 8 fl oz glass of milk with the meal.

Linguine With Fourme D'ambert And Fresh Basil

Ingredients:
- Kosher salt
- 13 cup dry white wine
- 2 shallots, peeled and chopped
- 13 cup vegetable stock
- 23 cup heavy cream
- Freshly ground black pepper
- Freshly ground nutmeg
- 4 ounces fourme d'Ambert or Roquefort cheese, cut into 1/2-inch cubes
- 1 small bunch fresh basil, chopped
- 3/4 pound linguine

Directions:
- Fill a large pot with lightly salted water, and bring to a boil over high heat.
- In a medium saucepan, combine wine and shallots and bring to a boil.
- Reduce by half.
- Add stock, and boil until liquid is nearly gone.
- Reduce heat to low, and stir in cream.
- Simmer 5 minutes.
- Season with salt, pepper and nutmeg to taste.
- Remove from heat, and stir in cheese and basil, reserving a little basil for garnish.
- Cover, and keep warm.
- Add pasta to boiling water, and cook until al dente.
- Drain well.
- Add to sauce, and toss gently.
- Adjust seasonings.
- Serve in bowls, garnished with reserved basil.

Ranch Style Beans

Ingredients:
- 2 lbs ground beef
- 1 (2 ounce) envelope dry onion soup mix
- 2 (1 lb) cans pork and beans
- 1 lb pinto beans, drained
- 1 cup catsup
- 12 cup cold water
- 2 tablespoons prepared mustard
- 2 teaspoons white vinegar

Directions:
- Brown ground beef and drain.
- Mix ground beef and rest of ingredients.
- Bake at 400 degrees for 35-45 minutes.

Whole Wheat Yeast Bread

Ingredients:
- 1 cup (225 ml) scalded milk
- 1/4 cup (60 ml) lard
- 4 tsp (20 ml). salt
- 1/4 cup (60 ml) honey
- 1 cup (225 ml) water, 110-115 degrees
- 2 pkg. dry yeast
- 2 Tbsp (30 ml). brown sugar
- 2 cups (475 ml) whole wheat flour
- 3 cups (700 ml) or more white flour

Directions:
- Mix scalded milk, lard, salt & honey and let cool to lukewarm - about 85 degrees (30 C.).
- Mix water, yeast & brown sugar and let stand to dissolve for 2-3 minutes.
- Add yeast mixture to milk mixture.
- Add whole wheat flour and enough white flour to make dough.
- Mix well.
- Knead 5 - 10 minutes.
- Put in bowl to rise until double in size.
- Punch down and divide into two portions.
- Let rest 5 - 10 minutes and then shape into two loaves.
- Let rise in pans one hour or until double in bulk.
- Bake at 375 degrees (200 C.) for 5 minutes and 350 degrees (175 C.) for 30 - 35 minutes.
- Remove from pans and let cool thoroughly before wrapping

Microwave Caramel Corn

Ingredients:
- 1 stick butter
- 1/4 c. white Karo syrup
- 1 c. brown sugar
- 1/2 tsp. baking soda
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- peanuts (if desired)
- 4 qt. popped corn

Directions:
- Place 4 cups of popped corn in a double brown bag (grocery bag).

Party Cheese Ball

Ingredients:
- 8 oz. cream cheese
- 8 oz. sharp Cheddar, shredded
- 1 Tbsp. green pepper, chopped
- 1 Tbsp. onion, chopped
- 1 Tbsp. fresh lemon juice
- 2 Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
- salt and pepper to taste
- finely chopped pecans or walnuts

Directions:
- Mix everything together (except nuts) well and shape into a ball.
- Roll in finely chopped pecans or walnuts.
- Chill at least 8 hours before serving.

Congealed Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 family size Jell-O (any flavor)
- 1 small can crushed pineapple
- 1 large cottage cheese
- 1 large (12 oz.) Cool Whip
- 1 c. chopped pecans

Directions:
- Mix Jell-O and pineapple.
- Bring to a boil and melt Jell-O. Remove from heat.
- "Cool!!"
- Add 1 large cottage cheese, 1 large Cool Whip and pecans.
- Pour into 9 x 13-inch dish and chill 1 to 2 hours.

Ham Wrap Arounds

Ingredients:
- 8 slices cooked ham, cut 1/4-inch thick
- 2 pkg. frozen broccoli spears, cooked and drained
- 3 c. cubed French bread, toasted
- 3 c. (12 oz. pkg.) shredded Swiss cheese
- 3 Tbsp. flour
- 2 tsp. prepared mustard
- 1/2 tsp. garlic powder
- 1 1/2 c. dry white wine

Directions:
- Wrap ham slices around broccoli spears and place in shallow baking dish.
- Sprinkle with bread crumbs.
- Heat wine in saucepan. Mix cheese and flour, while stirring, add to wine.
- Stir until smooth, then stir in mustard and garlic powder.
- Pour sauce over all in dish.
- Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.
- Toast French bread cubes.
- Add to the top of casserole, right before serving.
- Oh so good!
- You'll love this.

Crock Pot Cashew Chicken

Ingredients:
- 6 boneless skinless chicken breast halves, cut into 1-inch
- 1 lb fresh mushrooms, sliced
- 3 green onions, sliced into 1/2-inch pieces
- 1/4 cup soy sauce
- 2 teaspoons fresh gingerroot, grated
- 1/2 cup chicken broth
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon pepper
- 1 (8 ounce) can bamboo shoots, drained and sliced
- 1/2 cup cashews, toasted
- 1/2 cup Chinese pea pod
- 2 tablespoons cornstarch
- 3 tablespoons water
- cooked rice

Directions:
- Place chicken and mushrooms in a slow cooker.
- Add green onions, soy sauce, ginger, broth, salt and pepper.
- Cover and cook on low about 4 hours.
- Add bamboo shoots, cashews and pea pods. Turn control to HIGH.
- In a small bowl, dissolve cornstarch in water.
- Stir into chicken mixture in cooker.
- Cover and cook on HIGH 20-30 minutes or until thickened, stirring at least once.
- Serve over cooked rice if desired.

Chocolate Cherry Pudding (Low-Calorie, Sugar-Free)

Ingredients:
- 1 (1 2/3 ounce) package instant chocolate pudding mix
- 1 3/4 cups very cold water
- 1 cup sugar-free cherry pie filling (1/2 a 20-oz can)

Directions:
- Combine the pudding mix and water in the bowl of an electric mixer and stir for two minutes.
- Add the pie filling and stir until combined.
- Pour into serving bowls and refrigerate for about an hour or until slightly firm.

Rice Shrimp

Ingredients:
- 1/2 lb. shrimp
- 1 medium onion
- 2 Tbsp. oil
- 2 eggs
- 2 c. rice (cooked)

Directions:
- Peel and season shrimp with salt and red and black pepper. Saute shrimp and onion in oil.
- Add rice and 2 beaten eggs.
- Fry as desired.
- Serves 1 or 2.

Pla Nung Horapa

Ingredients:
- 2 pounds red snapper fillets
- 1 teaspoon galangal root chopped
- 1/2 tablespoon lemongrass
- 6 each red chili peppers
- 2 tablespoons red onion chopped
- 1 tablespoon fish sauce nam pla
- 1 teaspoon kaffir lime leaves
- 1/2 cup basil

Directions:
- Chop coarsely--the Galanga, lemon grass, onions, chilies and soy beans in a blender or food processor (add a tbsp of water if necessary).
- Wash, clean and pat dry the fish well.
- Cut 3 to 4 deep slits crosswise on both sides and cover with the spice mixture pushing the mixture into the slits.
- Place the dressed fish in a platter deep enough to accommodate extra liquid when the fish is cooked.
- Place the platter in the steamer.
- Sprinkle basils and Kaffir lime leaves.
- Place 2 pieces of paper towels over the top but not on the fish to catch any excess moisture while steaming.
- Cover and steam over high heat for 20 minutes or until fish is fully cooked.
- Serve immediately with cooked rice.

Super Simple Scalloped Potatoes

Ingredients:
- 3 cups heavy whipping cream
- 1-1/2 teaspoons salt
- 1/2 teaspoon pepper
- 1 teaspoon minced fresh thyme, optional
- 3 pounds russet potatoes, thinly sliced (about 10 cups)

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350°. In a large bowl, combine cream, salt, pepper and, if desired, thyme. Arrange potatoes in a greased 13x9-in. baking dish. Pour cream mixture over top.
- Bake, uncovered, until potatoes are tender and top is lightly browned, 45-55 minutes. Let stand 10 minutes before serving.

Ham Puffs

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. softened margarine
- 1 1/2 c. grated sharp Cheddar cheese
- 1 c. cooked ham, minced
- 1/2 tsp. Worcestershire sauce
- 1 c. self-rising flour
- dash of red pepper

Directions:
- Combine
- butter, cheese, ham and seasonings.
- Add flour and shape into small balls.
- Place on greased cookie sheet and bake at 350° for 15 to 18 minutes.
- Yield:
- 50 puffs.
- (Freezes well.)

Parmesan Chicken

Ingredients:
- 2 to 3 lb. chicken breasts, boneless and skinless
- 1 c. Miracle Whip
- 1/2 c. Parmesan cheese
- 2 tsp. oregano

Directions:
- Mix last three ingredients together.
- Spoon over chicken.
- Bake at 375° for 45 minutes.
- Serves 4 to 6. Good served with brown rice.

Lemon Sponge Pie

Ingredients:
- 1 (9-inch) unbaked pie shell
- 6 Tbsp. margarine
- 1/8 tsp. salt
- 1 1/2 c. sugar
- 1/3 c. lemon juice (fresh or bottled)
- grated rind of 1 lemon or 1 tsp. dried peel
- 3 Tbsp. flour
- 3 extra large eggs, separated
- 1 1/2 c. milk (whole preferred)

Directions:
- Cream butter, sugar, salt and flour.
- Add egg yolks and lemon juice; beat until fluffy.
- Stir in milk.
- Fold in stiffly beaten egg whites with a wire whisk, gently, until well blended.

Easy Slow Cooked Vegetarian Taco Soup

Ingredients:
- 3 (15 ounce) cans Mexican-style diced tomatoes
- 1 1/2 cups frozen corn
- 1 (15 ounce) can ranch-style pinto beans
- 1 (4 ounce) can of chopped green chilies
- 1 large onion, chopped fine
- 1 tablespoon fresh cilantro
- 2 tablespoons powdered broth
- 1/2 teaspoon chili powder
- 1/4 teaspoon cumin
- 1/4 teaspoon thyme

Directions:
- Combine all ingredients in slow cooker.
- Simmer for three or more hours.
- Serve with grated cheese, tortilla chips, extra fresh cilantro and diced onions, shredded cabbage or diced radishes.

Eggless Coconut Macaroons

Ingredients:
- 4 cups sweetened coconut flakes
- 3/4 cup condensed milk
- 1/4 teaspoon baking soda
- 1 tablespoon sour cream
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1 tablespoon chocolate syrup

Directions:
- Combine condensed milk, baking soda, sour cream and vanilla extract in a large bowl. Add coconut flakes gradually and mix all the ingredients that they are evenly mixed.
- Preheat the oven to 325 deg F. Scoop the macaroons in a baking sheet giving enough space.
- Now place the sheet into the oven and bake for about 15 minutes. The bottoms of the macaroons should be little dark brown. After it cools down, if using chocolate syrup drizzle on macaroons.

Chicken Wings

Ingredients:
- 10 lb. chicken wings
- 10 oz. apricot dressings
- 8 oz. red Russian dressing (Wish-Bone)
- 1 Tbsp. garlic powder

Directions:
- Mix in large pan.
- Marinate 2 or 3 hours.
- Place on cookie sheets and bake in 350° oven for 45 minutes.
- Turn them over after 20 minutes.

Savory Ostrich Stuff (Sos)

Ingredients:
- 1 pound ground ostrich
- 3 teaspoons vegetable shortening
- 1 tablespoon flour
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/8 teaspoon cayenne pepper
- 1 cup milk
- 3 English muffins, split and toasted
- 1 (1.27 ounce) packet fajita seasoning mix
- 1 pinch paprika

Directions:
- Place the ground ostrich in a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Cook, stirring to crumble, until no longer pink. Add the shortening, flour, salt, and cayenne pepper, salt and stir until the shortening has melted entirely.
- When the mixture begins to bubble, slowly pour the milk into the skillet while stirring until the mixture thickens. Spoon the mixture over English muffins and garnish with paprika.

Impossible Pie

Ingredients:
- 4 eggs
- 1/4 c. margarine
- 1 c. white sugar
- 1/2 c. flour
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1/2 tsp. baking powder
- 2 c. milk
- 1 c. coconut
- 1 tsp. vanilla

Directions:
- Place all ingredients in a blender at once and blend until mixed.
- Pour into buttered pie pan.
- Bake at 350° for 50 minutes.

Garden Scramble

Ingredients:
- 1 cup liquid egg substitute
- 18 teaspoon black pepper
- 18 teaspoon marjoram
- 1/4 cup celery finely chopped
- 1/4 cup sweet red bell peppers
- 2 tablespoons green bell peppers
- 1 tablespoon chicken broth fat free
- 1 cup cheddar cheese nonfat, shredded
- 2 slices bread white or whole wheat, toasted
- 1 tablespoon chives chopped

Directions:
- In a bowl, combine egg substitute, pepper and marjoram; set aside.
- In a nonstick skillet spray with cooking spray, over medium heat, cook celery, red pepper, green pepper and chives in chicken broth until tender.
- Add egg substitute and grated cheese to mixture.
- Cook stirring occasionally until set.
- Serve immediately with toast halve if desired or plain.

Watermelon Martini 

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 parts ABSOLUT Vodka
- 1 part Hiram Walker Watermelon Schnapps
- 2 parts Cranberry Juice
- 1 Splash Pineapple Juice

Directions:
- Shake with ice. Strain into a chilled martini glass

Gourmet Chicken And Noodles

Ingredients:
- 2/3 c. chopped onion
- 6 c. frozen egg noodles
- 2 Tbsp. oleo
- 5 1/2 c. chicken broth
- stock celery
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 can cream of mushroom soup
- 8 oz. pkg. cream cheese
- 6 Tbsp. parsley
- 1 pt. fresh mushrooms
- 1/4 c. black olives
- 4 c. cooked chicken
- 2 c. grated Cheddar cheese

Directions:
- When cooking chicken broth add stock of celery, a piece of onion and 1 teaspoon salt.
- Cook onions in oleo, then add broth, put noodles in and cook until done.
- Add cream of mushroom soup, cream cheese, parsley, mushrooms, black olives and cooked chicken. Bake, covered, at 375° for 1 hour.
- Top with Cheddar cheese the last 15 minutes and bake uncovered.

Barley Vegetable Beef Soup Recipe

Ingredients:
- 3 quarts. water
- 2 1/2 pound bean soup meat (I like chuck)
- 1/2 reg. pearled barley
- 2 whole bay leaves
- 4 c. minced cabbage (half a small head)
- 2 c. minced carrots
- 1/2 c. minced celery
- 2 env. dry onion soup mix
- 1 quart. blended tomatoes or possibly tomato juice
- 1/4 c. beef bouillon granules
- 1/2 c. catsup
- 1/3 c. brown sugar
- 1 teaspoon vinegar

Directions:
- In a 6 qt kettle combine water and meat.
- Simmer for 1 hour.
- Add in next six ingredients and simmer for 45 min.
- Add in rest of the ingredients and simmer for 10 min.
- Remove bay leaves and serve.
- Yield 10 servings.
- Very hearty a meal in itself.

Soda Cracker Caramel Bars

Ingredients:
- 40 soda crackers
- 1 c. brown sugar
- 1 c. real butter
- 2 c. milk chocolate chips

Directions:
- Line jelly roll pan with foil or spray Pam.
- Line crackers in bottom of pan.
- Boil brown sugar and butter for 3 minutes.
- Pour over crackers; bake for 5 minutes at 350° or until crackers float to the top of pan.
- Take from oven and sprinkle with milk chocolate chips.
- Spread on top and sprinkle with nuts.

Italian sausage

Ingredients:
- 1 lb fresh ground pork
- 1/4 tsp sage
- 1 tsp fennel seed
- 1/2 tsp basil
- 1/2 tsp whole leaf oregano
- 1 tbsp chopped parsley
- pinch salt
- 1/2 tsp red pepper flakes, optional

Directions:
- In a bowl, mix all the ingredients together
- I made these into meatballs.
- If you want links, wrap in plastic wrap, or wax paper( butter paper).
- steam litely or smoke litely.
- When firm remove wrapping then cook like you want.

Cook The Book: Big Mama'S Chow-Chow

Ingredients:
- 1 medium head of cabbage, cored and shredded
- 4 green bell peppers, cored, seeded, and diced
- 2 onions, diced
- 2 green tomatoes, or 5 husked tomatillos, diced
- 1/2 cup of salt
- 3 cups distilled white vinegar
- 2 1/2 cups sugar
- 1 tablespoon celery seed
- 1 teaspoon ground turmeric

Directions:
- In a medium nonreactive stockpot, combine the cabbage, bell peppers, onions, and tomatoes (the raw vegetables should equal 2 1/2 to 3 quarts). Stir in the salt, cover the pot, and let the vegetables stand at room temperature for 4 to twelve hours. Drain well in a colander.
- Rinse the pot and add the vinegar, sugar, celery seed, and turmeric. Bring to a boil. Add the drained vegetables, return to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 1 hour stirring occasionally. Serve hot or cold.

Shrimp Creole

Ingredients:
- 4 strips bacon
- 1 1/2 onions
- 1 bell pepper
- 2 stalks celery
- chopped bacon
- 1 can tomatoes
- salt and pepper
- garlic salt
- Worcestershire sauce
- 3 bay leaves
- 2 lb. raw shrimp
- rice

Directions:
- Fry bacon in drippings,
- Saute onions, bell pepper and celery. Add chopped bacon and tomatoes with salt, pepper, garlic salt, Worcestershire sauce and bay leaves.
- Cook about 45 minutes. Add raw shrimp.
- Cook 10 minutes more.
- Serve on rice.

Chicken Mushroom Fettuccine

Ingredients:
- 200 g high fiber pasta
- 1 teaspoon olive oil
- 400 g chicken breasts, cut into strips
- 2 onions
- 2 garlic cloves
- 1 cup mushroom, sliced
- 400 g light evaporated milk
- 2 teaspoons parsley
- 12 teaspoon pepper
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1 cup peas

Directions:
- Cook Pasta according to directions.
- Heat oil in skillet.
- Onions for 2-3 minutes.
- Add chicken, garlic, and mushrooms.
- Saute until chicken is cooked almost through, about 5-6 minutes.
- Add evaporated milk, pepper, salt, peas and parsley.
- Bring to a boil.
- Reduce heat and simmer for an additional 5 minutes.
- Add pasta, stir to coat, and serve.

Ritzy Fish Fillets

Ingredients:
- 10 to 12 fish fillets (any kind of fish)
- 1 pkg. shredded Mozzarella cheese
- 1 box Ritz crackers
- butter
- lemon juice
- salt and pepper to taste
- seafood sauce (for dipping; not added in recipe)

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350°.
- Wash fish fillets, then dry them off with a paper towel to absorb some of the excess water.
- Lay as many as you can close together in a 13 x 9 x 2-inch glass baking dish. Put a little dab of butter (1/2 teaspoon) on each fillet.
- Pour a little lemon juice over all fillets.
- (I use a squeeze bottle of lemon juice and just "squeeze" it all over.)
- Add salt and pepper to taste.
- Bake at 350° for 20 minutes.
- Pull out pan and crumble Ritz crackers (1 to 2 rolls from package in a box) all over fillets.
- Add shredded Mozzarella all over crackers.
- Bake another 5 to 10 minutes, until cheese is melted.
- Dip into seafood sauce as you eat, if desired.

Caper, Olive, And Tomato Sauce

Ingredients:
- 1/4 cup dried tomatoes
- 1/4 cup pitted ripe olives
- 2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley
- 1 tablespoon capers
- 1/2 cup olive oil
- 4 plum tomatoes, chopped

Directions:
- Process first 4 ingredients in a food processor until coarsely chopped. With processor running, pour oil through food chute in a slow, steady stream. Add tomatoes, and pulse until blended.

Pumpkin Bread

Ingredients:
- 3 c. sugar
- 4 eggs
- 2/3 c. water
- 1 c. oil
- 2 c. pumpkin
- 1/2 tsp. nutmeg
- 3 1/2 c. self-rising flour
- 1 tsp. cinnamon

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients together.
- Fill 4 loaf pans 1/2 full. Bake at 350° for 1 hour.

44 Calorie A Cup Of Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 head cauliflower
- 1 bunch broccoli
- 3/4 celery, cut up
- 1 small onion
- 1 small pkg. frozen peas
- 4 carrots, cut up
- dressing (creamy cucumber)

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients.
- Cover and refrigerate.
- Ranch Free dressing is also good.

Italian Limoncello

Ingredients:
- 10 medium Eureka lemons, cleaned without pesticides or wax
- 1 (750 mL) bottle of Ever Clear (151 proof) or vodka
- 3 cups water
- 3 cups granulated sugar

Directions:
- .
- Using a vegetable peeler, peel outer skin of lemons, If you get any of the white pith, using a pairing knife cut or scrap it off.
- The pith will create a bitter drink.
- Place peel in the gallon jar.
- Pour Ever Clear over the lemon peel, Seal jar and let sit in a cool dry place for 72 hours.
- In a saucepan on medium heat, bring water to a boil.
- Take off of heat, add
- sugar and whisk.
- Let cool completely.
- Set aside.
- Strain out lemon peel and add sugar water to the ever clear.
- Place in smaller bottles.
- Serve out of freezer.

Second Baby Food: Carrots and Broccoli

Ingredients:
- 2 cups chopped carrots
- 2 cups broccoli florets
- 1/2 cup breast milk
- 1/2 cup water

Directions:
- Place a steamer insert into a saucepan and fill with water to just below the bottom of the steamer.
- Bring water to a boil.
- Add carrots and broccoli, cover, and steam until tender, about 20 minutes.
- Place carrots, broccoli, breast milk, and water in a blender or food processor and blend until creamy.
- Strain the mixture through a fine-mesh sieve to remove any lumps.
- Spread carrot-broccoli mixture into an ice cube tray, cover with plastic wrap, and freeze until solid, 2 to 3 hours.
- Transfer frozen cubes to a resealable plastic bag and store in the freezer.
- To serve, heat cubes in the microwave until warm but not hot, about 30 seconds.
- Stir thoroughly.

Blintz Souffle

Ingredients:
- 12 sweet cheese blintzes
- 2 cups sour cream
- 12 cup sugar
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 14 cup orange juice
- 4 eggs

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
- Place blintzes approximately an inch apart in a pyrex baking dish.
- Put remaining ingredients into a mixing bowl and mix well.
- Pour over blintzes.
- Cover with foil and bake for approximately 1 hour.

Denver Sandwiches

Ingredients:
- 6 slices bacon, diced before cooking
- 3 Tbsp. minced onion
- 6 beaten eggs
- 1/4 c. milk
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1/8 tsp. pepper
- 1 Tbsp. butter
- 12 slices bread

Directions:
- Partially fry diced bacon.
- Add minced onion; cook until tender.
- Mix eggs with milk and seasonings.
- Pour over bacon and onion.
- Fry on one side until brown.
- Turn, fry on other side, cut into six pieces.
- Butter slices of bread.
- Put egg filling on six slices of bread; cover with the other six slices.
- Makes six sandwiches.

Instant Spice Tea Mix

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. instant tea
- 2 c. Tang
- 1 large pkg. Kool-Aid sweetened lemonade
- 1 tsp. ground cloves
- 1 tsp. ground cinnamon
- 2 c. sugar

Directions:
- Combine ingredients in large bowl and mix well.
- Spoon into jars and seal.
- To serve, add 2 teaspoons of tea mixture to a cup of hot water.
- Great for us kids to make! Yield:
- 40 cups.

Orange Julius

Ingredients:
- 1 1/3 c. orange juice
- 1/2 c. milk
- 1/2 c. water
- 1/4 c. sugar
- 1/2 tsp. vanilla
- 5 to 6 ice cubes

Directions:
- Combine all ingredients in blender; cover and blend until smooth, about 30 seconds.

Baked Corn

Ingredients:
- 1 can cream-style corn
- 1 pkg. frozen corn, thawed
- 1/2 stick oleo, melted
- 1 egg, well beaten
- 2 Tbsp. sugar
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1/2 box Jiffy corn muffin mix

Directions:
- Grease casserole with 1 tablespoon oleo.
- Mix all ingredients well.
- Place in casserole and bake at 350° for 45 minutes to 1 hour.

Blueberry Pie

Ingredients:
- baked pie shell
- 3/4 c. toasted chopped pecans
- Cool Whip
- 1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese
- 1 1/4 c. powdered sugar
- 1 pkg. Dream Whip (powdered)
- 1/2 c. milk
- 1 can blueberry pie mix

Directions:
- Sprinkle toasted, chopped pecans in pie shell. Mix cream cheese and powdered sugar. Mix Dream Whip and milk. Combine cream cheese mixture and Dream Whip mixture. Pour into pie shell. Pour blueberry pie mix over cream mixture. Chill before serving.

Cranberry Orange Bread

Ingredients:
- 2 c. plain flour, sifted
- 3/4 c. sugar
- 1 1/2 tsp. baking powder
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/2 tsp. soda
- 1 c. chopped cranberries
- 1/2 c. chopped nuts
- 1 tsp. orange peel
- 1 egg, beaten
- 3/4 c. orange juice
- 2 Tbsp. salad oil

Directions:
- Mix dry ingredients and set aside. Mix egg, oil and orange. Add to the dry ingredients.
- Stir until moist.
- Pour into greased 9 1/2 x 5 x 3-inch loaf pan. Bake at 350° for 50 minutes.

Fava Bean Bruschetta

Ingredients:
- 2 1/4 pounds unshelled fava beans
- 1 tablespoon chopped fresh tarragon
- 2 tablespoons extravirgin olive oil
- 1 tablespoon fresh lime juice
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1 garlic clove, minced
- 1 (1-pound) French bread baguette, cut into 32 slices
- 1/2 cup (2 ounces) shaved Manchego viejo cheese

Directions:
- Remove beans from pods; discard pods. Cook beans in boiling water 1 minute; rinse with cold water. Drain; remove outer skins from beans. Discard skins. Place beans in a food processor. Add tarragon and next 4 ingredients (through garlic); process until almost smooth. Spread about 1 1/2 teaspoons bean mixture over each bread slice. Arrange cheese evenly over bread slices.

Mixed Vegetable Casserole

Ingredients:
- 1 (16 oz.) pkg. frozen mixed vegetables
- 1 c. grated cheese
- 1 c. mayonnaise
- 1 c. chopped celery
- 1 medium onion, chopped
- 1 stick oleo
- 1 tube crackers, crumbled

Directions:
- Cook vegetables according to directions until tender.
- Spread in greased casserole pan.
- Mix onion, celery, cheese and mayonnaise; spread over vegetables.
- Melt oleo; mix with cracker crumbs.
- Sprinkle on top.
- Bake 30 minutes at 350°.

Beef And Barley Vegetable Soup

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 lbs extra lean ground beef or 1 1/2 lbs extra lean ground turkey
- 1 medium onion, chopped finely
- 28 ounces tomatoes (diced)
- 2 cups water
- 3 (10 ounce) cans beef consomme (preferably low sodium)
- 1 (10 ounce) can tomato soup (preferably low sodium)
- 4 carrots, chopped
- 3 celery ribs, chopped
- 1 bay leaf
- 1 teaspoon thyme
- 1 teaspoon parsley
- 1/2 teaspoon pepper
- 8 tablespoons barley

Directions:
- Brown beef and onion, drain any fat.
- Add remaining ingredients. Cook for a minimum of two hours.
- or.
- After browning beef and onion you can also use your slow cooker on low for 7 -8 hours.

Potato Candy

Ingredients:
- 2 medium potatoes
- 1 lb. box powdered sugar (10x)
- peanut butter
- flour

Directions:
- Peel and cube potatoes.
- Boil until done.
- Take couple pieces of potato and mash with fork until they are liquified.
- Mix powdered sugar and potatoes until forms a doughy ball (should be firm).
- Sprinkle flour on wax paper.
- Roll dough ball out thin. Spread even layer of peanut butter over dough.
- Roll into log; cut into thin slices.
- Put on plate and refrigerate until firm.

Marie'S Macaroni And Cheese

Ingredients:
- 2 c. uncooked macaroni
- 3 to 4 c. shredded cheese
- 2 Tbsp. butter or margarine
- 2 c. milk
- 4 eggs
- salt and pepper to taste

Directions:
- Cook macaroni as per directions; drain and return to cooking pan.
- Add the butter or margarine; stir thoroughly.
- In lightly buttered pan (either 9 x 13-inch or 9 x 9-inch), place 1/2 the macaroni.
- Cover with 1 1/2 to 2 cups shredded cheese.
- Add second layer of macaroni and cheese.
- Beat the eggs with a fork or beater; add the milk, blending thoroughly.
- Bake at 350° (325° if glass pan if used) for 40 to 45 minutes, or until cheese on top is slightly browned and a bit crusty.

New Yorker

Ingredients:
- 1 3/4 ounces Wild Turkey 101-proof rye whiskey
- 1 ounce freshly squeezed lemon juice
- 3/4 ounce simple syrup (page 154)
- 3 ounces club soda
- 1 lemon wheel, for garnish
- 3/4 ounce dry red wine (Malbec or Syrah)

Directions:
- Pour the whiskey, juice, and syrup into a Collins glass.
- Add large cold ice cubes and shake briefly.
- Top off with the club soda, leaving room at the top.
- Garnish with the lemon wheel and gently float the red wine on top (see page 23).
- Dominant Flavors: citrus
- Body: light with a slight sparkle
- Dryness: medium
- Complexity: low
- Accentuating or Contrasting Flavors: fruit accents from the wine
- Finish: short, airy, oaky tannins and slightly acidic
- Glass: Collins

Low Calorie Noodles With Peanut Sauce

Ingredients:
- 2 cups cooked whole wheat noodles
- 2 tablespoons peanut butter
- 1 tablespoon light soy sauce
- 1 tablespoon water
- 1 dash ground ginger
- 1 dash garlic powder

Directions:
- Plece room temperature noodles in a medium bowl.
- In a small bowl, combine remaining ingredients. Mix well, until blended. (If you are using a thinker type of peanut butter you may need to use more water).
- Spoon over noodles and serve.

Diet Fruit Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 c. seedless raisins
- 1 c. chopped pecans
- 1 c. cranberries, coarsely chopped
- 1 c. pineapple chunks (if big, cut in half)
- 1 Tbsp. grated orange rind
- 1 Tbsp. grated lemon rind
- 3 Tbsp. artificial sweetener
- 1/2 c. orange juice
- 2 Tbsp. melted margarine
- 1 1/2 c. sifted flour
- 1 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. cinnamon
- 1/4 tsp. allspice
- 1/4 tsp. nutmeg

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350°.
- Put artificial sweetener in orange juice; pour over cranberries.
- Let set 1 hour.
- Combine raisins, pecans, cranberries, pineapple chunks, orange rind and lemon rind. Add melted margarine.
- Sift and measure flour. Add salt, soda and spices to flour and sift.
- Put in muffin cups and bake 35 minutes.

Fragrant Milk Sherbet

Ingredients:
- 34 cup ice cube
- 12 cup pistacho nuts, shelled
- 14 cup caster sugar
- 12 teaspoon cardamom, ground
- 12 teaspoon cinnamon, ground
- 1 14 liters milk

Directions:
- Place ice cubes in a blender or food processor and process in bursts for 5 minutes, or until the ice is crushed.
- Place the ice in 4 tall glasses.
- Place 1/2 cup pistachio nuts, caster sugar, ground cardamom and teaspoon cinnamon in the blender.
- Process for 2 minutes until smooth.
- Add milk, process until frothy and pour over the ice.

7 Layer Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 medium head lettuce
- 1 cucumber, sliced thin
- 1 medium red onion, sliced thin
- 6 boiled eggs, sliced
- 1 green pepper
- 1 (10 oz.) pkg. frozen peas, slightly cooked
- 1 c. mayonnaise
- 1 c. sour cream
- 1 pkg. Hidden Valley Ranch dressing (original)
- 6 oz. shredded Swiss cheese
- bacon bits

Directions:
- Layer in a 9 x 13-inch pan the lettuce, cucumber, onion, sliced boiled eggs, green pepper and slightly cooked peas.
- Mix together mayonnaise, sour cream and original Hidden Valley Ranch dressing and put over other layers.
- Sprinkle with bacon bits.
- Refrigerate 24 hours before serving.

Grilled Sliced Brisket 

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 pound brisket (from point or flat end)
- Vegetable oil (for grilling)

Directions:
- Freeze brisket until frozen solid in the center, at least 8 hours.
- Let brisket stand at room temperature 2 hours. Slice brisket 1/8" thick.
- Meanwhile, prepare grill for high heat; oil grate. Grill brisket until lightly charred, about 1 minute per side for medium-rare.

Chicken Salad Chapala

Ingredients:
- 4 flour tortillas
- 1 lb cooked chicken breast, diced cubed or shredded
- 1 (15 ounce) can pinto beans or 1 (15 ounce) can red kidney beans
- 1 (15 ounce) can black beans
- 1 cup cubed mango
- 1 medium zucchini
- 12 cup chopped red bell pepper
- 14 cup chopped green onion
- 6 cups torn salad greens
- honey-cumin vinaigrette dressing (posted)

Directions:
- Prepare dressing.
- preheat oven to 375.
- Cut tortillas into 6 slices spray tops with cooking spray.
- Back on cookie sheet for 5-8 minutes until crisp.
- In a bowl combine the remaining ingredients except salad greens, pour in dressing, toss to coat Arrage salad greens on plate, top with chicken salad, garnish with tortilla crisps.

Nan'S Icebox Cookies

Ingredients:
- 1 c. butter
- 1 tsp. molasses
- 2 1/2 c. flour
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 c. sugar
- 1 c. pecans
- 1/2 tsp. baking soda
- 1 beaten egg

Directions:
- Cream butter and sugar.
- Add in and mix the egg (beaten) and molasses.
- Mix in flour, salt and baking soda.
- Fold in pecans. Make several rolls and refrigerate for several hours or overnight. Slice and bake until lightly browned at 350°.

Beef And Barley Soup

Ingredients:
- 1 Tbsp. cooking oil
- 2 lb. beef short ribs
- 2 medium onions, coarsely chopped
- 3 large carrots, sliced
- 3 celery stalks, sliced
- 1 (28 oz.) can whole tomatoes with liquid, chopped
- 2 qt. water
- 4 chicken bouillon cubes
- 1/3 c. medium pearl barley

Directions:
- In a large 3 1/2-quart kettle, heat oil over medium-high heat. Brown beef.
- Add onions, carrots, celery, tomatoes, water and bouillon; bring to boil.
- Cover and simmer for about 2 hours or until beef is tender.
- Add barley; simmer another 50 or 60 minutes or until barley is done.
- Yields 10 to 12 servings.

Noodles

Ingredients:
- 2 egg yolks
- 2 Tbsp. cream or Milnot
- 1/4 tsp. baking powder
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. Crisco
- 1/2 c. flour

Directions:
- Blend first 5 ingredients, then add flour. Roll to desired thickness on flat floured surface. Let dry at least one hour. Cut into strips. Keep in an airtight Ziploc bag.

Taco Pizza

Ingredients:
- 1 large Boboli or Moon Bread
- 1 (16 oz.) can refried beans
- 1/2 lb. hamburger, cooked and seasoned
- grated cheese
- salsa
- chopped lettuce
- diced tomatoes
- jalapenos (optional)
- crushed chilies (optional)
- chopped chives (optional)
- chopped olives (optional)

Directions:
- On a
- pizza
- pan
- or
- cookie sheet, place Boboli bread. Spread a
- layer
- of refried beans.
- Then add the hamburger and cover with layer
- of
- cheese.
- Place
- in an oven or Dutch oven and bake
- at 325° until cheese is melted, but don't overcook. Remove from
- oven and
- cover
- with lettuce, tomato and salsa. Serve at once.

Pork Chop Casserole

Ingredients:
- 4 to 6 pork chops, browned
- 1 medium onion
- potatoes, cut up
- 1 can mushroom soup
- 1/2 c. water

Directions:
- Brown chops; place in baking pan.
- Put cut up potatoes around chops.
- Add chopped onion.
- Add mushroom soup and water.
- Bake at 250° for 2 hours.

Bean Bag Vegetable Soup

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 cups 10 bean soup mix
- 6 cups cold water
- 1 large onion, chopped
- 2 large carrots, chopped
- 3 hot Italian sausages or 3 italian sweet sausage, sliced
- 1 (28 ounce) can diced tomatoes, undrained
- 1 teaspoon chili powder
- 1 pinch ground cloves
- 2 tablespoons dry sherry (optional)
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
- salt and pepper

Directions:
- Rinse the bean mix, cover generously with cold water, and let soak for 8 hours or overnight.
- Drain.
- In a large saucepan, combine the bean mixture with 6 cups water.
- Bring to a boil, reduce the heat, cover and simmer for 1-1/2 hours or until tender.
- Add the onions, carrots, sausage, tomatoes, chili powder and cloves.
- Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer, uncovered, for 30 minutes or until the flavours are well blended.
- Stir in the sherry, lemon juice, salt and pepper.

Herb-Garlic Chicken

Ingredients:
- 6 (6-ounce) skinned chicken breast halves
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 2 teaspoons vegetable oil, divided
- 40 garlic cloves, peeled (about 5 whole garlic heads)
- 1 cup dry white wine or fat-free, less-sodium chicken broth
- 1 cup fat-free, less-sodium chicken broth
- 1/2 teaspoon dried herbes de Provence or thyme

Directions:
- Sprinkle chicken with salt and pepper. Heat 1 teaspoon oil in a Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add half of chicken; cook 3 minutes on each side or until browned. Remove from pan. Repeat procedure with 1 teaspoon oil and remaining chicken. Add garlic to pan; cook 4 minutes or until lightly browned, stirring frequently. Add wine, broth, and herbes de Provence, scraping pan to loosen browned bits. Return chicken to pan; cover, reduce heat, and simmer 30 minutes or until chicken is tender.

Poppy Seed Dressing

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 1/4 c. vinegar
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. dry mustard
- 1/2 onion, grated
- 1 Tbsp. poppy seed
- 1 c. oil

Directions:
- Combine sugar, salt, dry mustard and poppy seed; mix well.
- Add onion and vinegar.
- As you are mixing these ingredients, begin adding oil in a slow trickle.
- Stir constantly while you are adding oil.
- Dressing may be kept in refrigerator for a week or more.

Meringues with Mixed Berries

Ingredients:
- 250 ml PHILADELPHIA Cream For Desserts, double cream alternative
- 10 mini meringue nests/pavlovas
- Mixed berries e.g. strawberries and blueberries Whole Foods 3 For $10.00 thru 02/09
- icing sugar, for dusting

Directions:
- SPOON the PHILLY evenly into the meringue nests, top with the mixed berries and dust with icing sugar.
- Serve immediately.

Taco Pie

Ingredients:
- 1 deep dish pie shell
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 1 onion, chopped
- 1 pkg. taco seasoning
- 1 can refried beans
- 8 oz. taco sauce
- 2 c. shredded cheese
- tortilla chips
- lettuce
- tomatoes

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 400°.
- Thaw pie shell for 10 minutes.
- Prick shell with fork.
- Bake for 10 minutes.
- Reduce oven to 350°.
- Cook beef and onion until brown, then drain.
- Add taco seasoning and cook according to package directions.

Fish Tortilla Wraps

Ingredients:
- 1 pkg (6 oz) nacho cheese tortilla chips
- 1 1/4 lbs firm white fish fillets, cut into 1-inch strips
- 8 None flour tortillas
- 1 large avocado, finely chopped
- 2 medium tomatoes, finely chopped
- 1 can (10 oz) corn kernels, drained
- 2 tbsp chopped cilantro
- 1 tbsp lemon juice
- 1 tbsp vegetable or olive oil
- None None Salsa, to serve

Directions:
- Preheat the oven to 350°F. Line a baking pan with foil. Finely crush tortilla chips in package. Place fish in chip package; shake gently to coat lightly. Place fish, in a single layer, on prepared pan. Spray with no stick cooking spray.
- Bake for 10-12 mins or until fish is golden brown and cooked through.
- Meanwhile, wrap tortillas in foil. Bake for 5 mins or until heated.
- Combine avocado, tomato, corn, cilantro, lemon juice and oil in a medium bowl. Top each tortilla with fish, avocado mixture and salsa. Roll to enclose filling. Serve.

Judy's Baked Beans

Ingredients:
- 1 lb ground beef, cooked & drained
- 2 (16 ounce) cans baked beans
- 1 small onion, chopped
- 12 cup ketchup
- 14 cup Karo syrup
- 12 cup brown sugar

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients together and bake in 350 oven for 1 hour.

Easy Yeast Rolls

Ingredients:
- 1 pkg. dry yeast
- 2 c. warm water
- 4 c. self-rising flour
- 1/4 c. sugar
- 3/4 c. melted margarine
- 1 beaten egg

Directions:
- Dissolve yeast in warm water.
- Add other ingredients to yeast and water.
- Store covered in refrigerator.
- Use as needed.
- Fill muffin tins 3/4 full.
- Bake at 425° for 20 minutes.

Roasted Cauliflower Salad With Lemon Herb Dressing

Ingredients:
- 2 cups Cauliflower Florets
- 2 Tablespoons Olive Oil
- 1 Tablespoon Lemon Juice
- 1 teaspoon Mayonnaise
- 1/2 teaspoons Mustard
- 2 Tablespoons Chopped Parsley
- 1 clove Garlic, Peeled And Finely Minced
- Salt And Pepper, to taste
- Parmesan Cheese (Optional)

Directions:
- Place the cauliflower florets on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Bake in a 400°F oven for approximately 45 minutes or until the cauliflower is a light golden brown.
- Make the dressing by combining the olive oil, lemon juice, mayonnaise, mustard, parsley and garlic. Whisk well, add the roasted cauliflower, season and top with some shards of Parmesan cheese, if desired.

Cheesecake Squares

Ingredients:
- 1/3 c. margarine
- 1/3 c. brown sugar
- 1 c. flour
- 1/2 c. nuts, chopped
- 1/4 c. sugar
- 1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese, softened
- 1 egg
- 2 Tbsp. milk
- 1 Tbsp. lemon juice
- 1/2 tsp. vanilla

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350°.
- Use an 8 x 8-inch pan.
- Cream together margarine and brown sugar; add flour and nuts.
- Mix to make a crumb mixture.
- Reserving 1 cup of mixture for topping, press remainder into bottom of pan.
- Bake for 12 to 15 minutes or until lightly browned.
- Blend sugar with cream cheese until smooth.
- Add egg, milk, lemon juice and vanilla; beat well.
- Spread over baked layer and sprinkle with reserved crumb mixture.
- Bake for 20 to 25 minutes.
- Cool; cut into 2-inch squares.

My Mom's Stuffed Green Chilis

Ingredients:
- 25 chili peppers, cut off top and clean out insides carefully
- 12 cup butter
- 1 cup mushroom, chopped
- 1 cup cubed bread, stale
- 2 tablespoons parsley, fresh & chopped
- 34 cup parmigiano-reggiano cheese, fresh grated
- 2 garlic cloves, minced
- 2 eggs, mixed
- salt
- pepper

Directions:
- Melt butter in a large saute pan and brown mushrooms.
- Add bread crumbs and garlic,saute for a 2-3 minutes.
- Add parsley and cheese, cook for another 1-2 minutes.
- Remove from pan.
- Add eggs and mix well.
- Add salt and pepper to taste.
- Allow to cool.
- Stuff chilis with filling.
- Bake in a 375 degree oven for 30 minutes.
- Turn half-way through to ensure proper roasting on both sides.
- Serve with a little extra fresh grated cheese.
- I like to freeze these and keep around for snacking or last minute appetizers.

That Good Peanut Butter Cornflake Candy, A.K.A. Aunt Altha’S Candy

Ingredients:
- 1 cup White Sugar
- 1 cup Light Corn Syrup
- 1 pinch Salt
- 1 cup Crunchy Peanut Butter
- 8 cups Cornflakes Cereal

Directions:
- Cook sugar, corn syrup and salt over medium heat until the sugar dissolves. Add peanut butter and stir to blend. Pour over corn flakes in a large bowl and stir to coat. Press mixture into a buttered 10 x 15 inch jelly roll pan with buttered hands. Let cool. Cut into squares and store in an airtight container. Makes about 60 one-inch squares.

Congo Bars

Ingredients:
- 1 stick margarine, melted
- 1 lb. brown sugar
- 4 eggs
- 3 c. flour
- 3 tsp. baking powder
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 c. chocolate chips
- 1 c. chopped nuts

Directions:
- Melt margarine and brown sugar. Beat in eggs, one at a time.

A Nice Vegetable Soup

Ingredients:
- 1/4 cup olive oil
- 2 cups diced (1/2 inch) carrots
- 1 cup each diced (1/2 inch) onion, celery and fennel
- 1 cup chopped leek (white part only)
- 2 tablespoons minced garlic
- 6 ripe plum tomatoes, seeded and diced
- Salt and pepper, to taste
- 6 cups Fresh Vegetable Broth
- 2 large sprigs fresh thyme
- 4 tablespoons chopped parsley
- 1 cup chopped (1/2 inch) green beans
- 1 cup diced (1/2 inch) zucchini
- 1/2 cup torn basil leaves

Directions:
- 1.
- Place oil in a pot over low heat.
- Wilt carrots, onion, celery, fennel, and leek, stirring, for 15 minutes.
- Add garlic during the last 5 minutes.
- 2.
- Stir in tomatoes and season with salt and pepper; cook for 3 minutes.
- Add broth, thyme, and 2 tablespoons parsley; bring to a boil.
- Reduce heat to medium; simmer for 20 minutes.
- 3.
- Add the green beans, zucchini, and basil; simmer 10 minutes or until vegetables are tender.
- Stir in remaining parsley.
- Serve.

Portuguese Batatas A Murro

Ingredients:
- 5 large baking potatoes (Yukon Gold work best)
- extra virgin olive oil
- 5 -8 crushed garlic cloves
- fresh ground pepper
- chopped green onion

Directions:
- Bake potatoes in a 350 oven, unwrapped, until cooked.
- Take potatoes out of oven and"punch" them so as to have the center of the potato pop open and then push the potato pulp up.
- Place desired amount of garlic and green onions in each open potato.
- Drizzle with a bit of olive oil.
- Sprinkle with freshly ground pepper.
- Serve it with grilled cod fish
- Enjoy!

Cherry Angel Delight

Ingredients:
- 1 large prepared angel food cake
- 1 can (21 oz.) cherry pie filling
- 1 small pkg. instant vanilla pudding mix
- 1 1/2 c. cold milk
- 1 (8 oz.) sour cream
- 1 small can crushed pineapple, drained
- Cool Whip

Directions:
- Cut or tear cake into 1/2-inch pieces to measure 8 cups. Place half cake cubes in 9 x 9-inch pan.
- Reserve 1/3 cup of pie filling; spread remaining filling over cake.
- Top with remaining cake.
- Spread pineapple over cake.
- Combine pudding mix, milk and sour cream.
- Spoon over cake.
- Cover and chill. Cover top with Cool Whip and cut into squares.
- Top each square with reserved cherries.

Strawberry Pretzel Salad

Ingredients:
- 2 c. crushed prezels
- 1/4 c. sugar
- 1 1/2 sticks margarine
- 1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese
- 1 c. sugar
- 2 c. Cool Whip
- 2 (3 oz.) pkg. strawberry jello
- 2 c. hot pineapple juice
- 2 (10 oz.) boxes frozen strawberries

Directions:
- Blend together the first 3 ingredients and press on the bottom of a cake pan.
- Bake at 350° for 10 minutes.

Peanut Butter Pie

Ingredients:
- 1 c. 10x sugar
- 1/2 c. peanut butter
- 1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese
- 1 (8 oz.) container Cool Whip
- 1 graham cracker pie crust

Directions:
- Mix sugar and cream cheese together.
- Add peanut butter.
- Fold in Cool Whip.
- Put in pie crust.
- Drizzle chocolate syrup over top and sprinkle with crushed peanuts.
- Put in freezer.
- Remove from freezer and place in refrigerator for 1 hour before serving.

Broccoli Salad

Ingredients:
- 2 bunches broccoli
- 10 slices bacon
- 1 large red onion
- 1/3 c. raisins
- 1 c. mayonnaise
- 1/4 c. sugar
- 2 Tbsp. cider vinegar
- 1/2 tsp. black pepper
- 1/2 c. toasted sunflower seeds

Directions:
- Cut broccoli flowerets into smaller than bite-size pieces. Cut off tough outer layer of stalks and chop the tender part into small pieces.
- You need 8 cups of broccoli.
- (Do this the day before and store in plastic bag.)
- Saute bacon until crisp.
- Slice onion lengthwise.
- In large bowl, combine the broccoli, onion and raisins and bacon.
- In small bowl, mix together mayonnaise, sugar, vinegar and pepper.
- Combine dressing with the vegetables; refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.
- Top with sunflower seeds.

Fruit Cake Cookies

Ingredients:
- 2 1/2 c. sifted plain flour
- 1 tsp. soda
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 1 c. butter
- 1 1/2 c. sugar
- 2 eggs
- 1/2 lb. candied cherries
- 1/2 lb. candied pineapple
- 1 lb. pecans

Directions:
- Mix flour, soda, salt and cinnamon.
- Cream butter.
- Add sugar gradually.
- Cream until smooth.
- Add eggs.
- Mix. Stir in dry ingredients.
- Add fruit and nuts.
- Drop with spoon.
- Bake 10 minutes at 350°.

Bloody Mary

Ingredients:
- ice cubes
- 1 jigger vodka
- dash of Worcestershire
- 1/8 tsp. salt
- dash of hot pepper sauce
- 1 large lime wedge

Directions:
- Over ice cubes in 10-ounce highball glass, measure all ingredients, except lime wedge.
- Squeeze lime wedge into mixture; stir well.

The Best Sugar Cookies You Ever Snitched

Ingredients:
- 1 c. margarine
- 2 c. sugar
- 2 eggs
- 1 c. salad oil
- pinch of salt
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 5 c. unsifted flour
- 2 tsp. baking soda
- 2 tsp. cream of tartar

Directions:
- Cream together margarine and sugar.
- Add next four ingredients.
- After measuring, sift the dry ingredients together and mix well with creamed mixture.
- Roll into balls between palms of hands about the size of a golf ball.
- Roll in sugar and "smoosh" down with a decorative cookie marker and the bottom of a glass dipped in sugar.
- Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes or until lightly browned on the edges.

3-5 Sherbet

Ingredients:
- 3 lemons juice
- 3 bananas, mashed
- 3 oranges juice
- small can crushed pineapple
- small jar cherries (no juice)
- 3 eggs, beaten
- 3 c. sugar

Directions:
- Add milk to fill line on ice cream freezer.

Pistachio Ambrosia

Ingredients:
- 1 (16 oz.) Cool Whip non-dairy topping
- 1 (16 oz.) can pineapple chunks
- 1 small can crushed pineapple
- 1 c. coconut
- 1 c. pecans or walnuts
- 1 small box pistachio pudding
