Directions:
- Combine both cans of pineapple in a large bowl, including undiluted liquid.
- Sprinkle pudding on top and do not mix.
- Let sit for 3 minutes.
- Fold in Cool Whip, coconut and nuts.
- Pour into graham cracker pie crust and refrigerate for 3 hours.

Pear Salad with Smoked Almonds

Ingredients:
- 4 cups (1/2 of 10-oz. bag) packed torn mixed salad greens
- 1 large ripe pear, sliced Safeway 1 lb For $1.88 thru 02/09
- 1/2 cup PLANTERS Smoked Almonds
- 2 thin sliced red onion, separated into rings
- 1/4 cup KRAFT Lite Ranch Dressing

Directions:
- Toss salad greens with pears, almonds and onions in large salad bowl.
- Add dressing just before serving; mix lightly.

Pecan Pies

Ingredients:
- 5 eggs
- 2 c. white syrup
- 1 tsp. salt
- 4 Tbsp. butter
- 2 c. sugar
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 6 Tbsp. flour
- 6 Tbsp. hot water

Directions:
- Place pecan halves real close together in pie crusts. Pour the mixture, which has been heated enough to melt the butter, over the nuts. (Beat egg whites and yolks together for best results.) Place in oven and bake at 350° for 30 to 35 minutes or until top is golden brown and filling is thick. Serve with whipped cream if desired. Yields 2 pies.

Buffalo Chips

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. butter or oleo
- 2 c. sugar
- 2 c. brown sugar
- 4 beaten eggs
- 4 c. flour
- 2 tsp. baking powder
- 2 tsp. vanilla
- 2 tsp. baking soda
- 1 c. chopped pecans
- 2 c. uncooked oatmeal
- 3 c. corn flakes
- 1 c. coconut
- 6 oz. semi-sweet chocolate chips
- 6 oz. milk chocolate chips
- 6 oz. butterscotch chips

Directions:
- Cream butter or oleo and sugars.
- Add eggs, flour, baking powder, vanilla and soda.
- Add remaining ingredients.
- Mix all ingredients well.
- Chill.
- Drop from a tablespoon on cookie sheet sprayed with Pam.
- Bake at 350° for 10 to 12 minutes.

Angel Biscuits

Ingredients:
- 3 c. sifted self-rising flour
- 1 Tbsp. sugar
- 1/2 tsp. soda
- 1/2 c. Crisco
- 1 pkg. yeast, dissolved in a 1/4 c. lukewarm water
- 1 c. buttermilk

Directions:
- Sift together flour, sugar and soda.
- Cut shortening into flour.
- Add yeast and milk.
- Roll and cut into biscuits and bake at 450° for 8 to 10 minutes.

Grilled "Chicken" Sandwich

Ingredients:
- 1 BOCA Spicy Chikn Veggie Patty
- 1 whole wheat sandwich roll
- 1 Tbsp. KRAFT Light Mayo Reduced Fat Mayonnaise
- 2 pieces lettuce leaves
- 3/4 cup baby carrots
- 1 medium apple
- 1 FIG , fat free
- 8 fl oz (1 cup) fat-free milk

Directions:
- Heat patty per package instructions.
- Spread roll with mayonnaise and top with patty and lettuce.
- Complement sandwich with carrots.
- Enjoy an apple and a FIG NEWTONS cookie for dessert.
- Serve a glass of milk with the meal.

Tootsie'S Peanut Butter Balls

Ingredients:
- 1 box confectioners sugar (10x)
- 2 sticks butter or oleo
- 1 c. peanut butter
- 12 oz. chocolate chips
- 1/4 block paraffin wax

Directions:
- Mix the first 3 ingredients and roll into balls.
- Refrigerate overnight.
- Melt chocolate chips and paraffin wax over water.
- Dip each ball.
- I use part white chocolate to give a milk chocolate coating on balls.

Papaya Soup Cold

Ingredients:
- 1 ripe papaya
- sugar, to taste
- fresh lime juice, to taste

Directions:
- Peel the papaya and cut in half. Spoon out the seeds and keep them in a small container in the refrigerator.
- Cut the papaya into chunks and reduce to a liquid puree in the food processor. Add the sugar and lime juice. If the puree is too thick, stir in a little water, but be very careful that you do not add too much water or you will lose the consistency.
- Serve in fruit cups with a dab of the reserved seeds in the center of each serving.

Zucchini Casserole

Ingredients:
- 2 c. Italian seasoned bread crumbs
- 1/4 c. margarine, melted
- 1/4 c. Parmesan cheese
- 2 lb. zucchini, sliced, parboiled and drained
- 1 medium carrot, shredded
- 10 1/2 oz. can cream of mushroom soup
- 1 c. sour cream
- 1/4 c. chopped green onion

Directions:
- Combine crumbs, margarine and cheese; spread half in bottom of 13 x 9 x 2-inch pan.
- Combine zucchini and carrot; spread over crumbs.
- Mix soup, sour cream and onion; pour over vegetables. Top with remaining crumbs.
- Bake at 350° for 1 hour.

Black-Kale and White-Bean Soup With Barley

Ingredients:
- 10 cups water
- 34 cup pearl barley, rinsed and drained
- 3 cups low sodium chicken broth
- 1 large onion, chopped
- 2 garlic cloves, thinly sliced
- 12 teaspoon red pepper flakes
- 34 teaspoon coarse salt
- fresh ground pepper
- 28 ounces cannellini beans, liquid reserved
- 6 ounces kale (Tuscan black is best)
- 2 tablespoons grated parmesan cheese
- 12 teaspoon lemon zest, grated

Directions:
- Bring 8 cups of water to a boil in a large pot.
- Reduce heat, add barley and simmer until just tender, about 1 hour.
- Add 2 cups stock to pot and bring to a boil.
- Reduce heat, and add onion, garlic, red-pepper flakes and salt.
- Season with pepper.
- Simmer until barley is soft, about 20 minutes.
- Add beans with liquid, kale and remaining 2 cups water and 1 cup stock.
- Simmer until kale is tender and cooked through, about 7 minutes.
- Divide into bowls.
- Sprinkle with Parmesean and lemon zest and season with pepper.

Green Bean Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 (7 oz.) box macaroni, cooked and drained
- 1 can whole green beans
- 1 small onion, chopped
- 1 medium bell pepper, chopped
- Italian salad dressing to taste
- salt and pepper to taste

Directions:
- Combine all ingredients and refrigerate.

Butter Flavored Brickle Drizzles

Ingredients:
- 1 cup Butter Flavor Crisco
- 1 cup sugar
- 1 cup brown sugar
- 1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 1 3/4 cups flour
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
- 3 1/2 cups oats
- 1 cup almond brickle chips
- 1 cup chocolate chips (I prefere dark chocolate)

Directions:
- milk and vanilla, mix well. Combine flour, salt and soda. Stir into creamed mixture, stir in oats.
- Shape dough into balls (approx. 2 T). Press tops into Brickle Chips (flatten as you do so, use bottom of a glass if you wish). Place brickle side up on baking sheet. Bake at 350* for 7-10 minutes.
- Remove from sheet and cool completely.
- When all cookies are baked, place chocolate chips in a microwave safe ziplock type bag. Microwave med-hi for 1 minute. Knead chips in bag, cut small tip off of corner of bag and drizzle chocolate over cookies. A nice pattern makes them look professional. Eat and enjoy.

Camp Potatoes

Ingredients:
- 5 medium potatoes
- 1 medium onion
- 1 medium green pepper
- 6 Tbsp. butter
- salt
- pepper

Directions:
- Peel and chop potatoes.
- Chop onion and green pepper.
- Place potatoes, onion and green pepper on heavy-duty foil; dot with butter.
- Sprinkle salt and pepper over top.
- Fold foil up around potatoes.
- Be sure to seal edges of foil well.
- Grill, covered, over medium coals for 35 to 40 minutes or until potatoes are tender.

Pepperoni Bread

Ingredients:
- 1 cup water, plus
- 2 tablespoons water (70-80 degrees)
- 13 cup shredded mozzarella cheese
- 2 tablespoons sugar
- 1 12 teaspoons garlic salt
- 1 12 teaspoons dried oregano
- 3 14 cups bread flour
- 1 12 teaspoons active dry yeast
- 23 cup sliced pepperoni

Directions:
- In a bread machine pan, place the first seven ingredients in order suggested by your bread machine manufacturer.
- Select basic bread setting.
- Choose medium crust color and loaf size.
- Do not use delay timer is not recommended for this recipe.
- Bake according.
- You may need to check dough after 5 minutes of mixing.
- If dough isn't right consistency add 1 to 2 Tablespoons fo water or flour as needed.
- Just abefore the final kneading, add the pepperoni.

Grilled Salmon Salad

Ingredients:
- 8 ounces salmon, grilled
- 1 tablespoon mayonnaise
- 14 teaspoon dill
- 18 teaspoon garlic
- 18 teaspoon black pepper
- 1 head green leaf lettuce
- 2 tomatoes, chopped
- 1 small red onion, chopped
- 6 ounces feta cheese, crumbled
- 12 cup unsalted sunflower seeds
- 2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar

Directions:
- Spread the mayonnaise evenly over the salmon.
- Mix dill, garlic, and pepper in a bowl.
- Sprinkle over the salmon and grill for about 10 minutes.
- Cut the salmon into bite-size pieces and place in the refrigerator until chilled.
- Add lettuce, tomatoes, onion, feta cheese, and sunflower seeds to a bowl.
- Toss with the grilled salmon and balsamic vinegar.

Cinnamon Apple Pizza

Ingredients:
- 1 tube (12.4 ounces) refrigerated cinnamon rolls with icing
- 1 can (21 ounces) apple pie filling
- 1/4 cup packed brown sugar
- 1 tablespoon butter, melted

Directions:
- Set cinnamon roll icing aside. Separate cinnamon rolls; roll out each into a 4-in. circle. Arrange on a greased 12-in. pizza pan, overlapping edges. Bake at 400° for 8 minutes.
- Spoon the apple pie filling over rolls to within 1/2 in. of edge. Combine the brown sugar and butter; sprinkle over pie filling. Bake 6-8 minutes longer or until the crust is golden brown. Cool. Drizzle with the reserved icing.

Blueberry And Pineapple Smoothie

Ingredients:
- 1 cup soy milk
- 1 banana
- 1/2 cup blueberries
- pineapple chunks frozen, use as many as you want

Directions:
- Add the soy milk, banana, pineapple and blueberries to a blender and blend until smooth,

Oven Fried Buttermilk Chicken

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. Parmesan cheese
- 1/2 c. bread crumbs
- 1/2 tsp. rosemary
- 1/2 tsp. thyme
- 1/4 tsp. garlic powder
- 1/4 tsp. onion powder
- 1/4 tsp. black pepper
- 4 chicken breasts (I prefer skinless)
- 1 c. buttermilk

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 375°.
- Cover a baking sheet with foil.
- Mix dry ingredients.
- Dip chicken in buttermilk and then in
- dry mixture.
- Place on pan and bake 45 minutes.

Podnuh'S Beans 

Ingredients:
- 4 slices of bacon
- 2 onions chopped
- 1 cup Bell Pepper chopped
- 1 cup chopped parsley
- 1 cup chopped celery
- 2 large cans Pork and Beans
- 1 can Rotel Tomatoes
- 1 can pimento chopped
- 1 tablespoon mustard
- 1 teaspoon chili powder
- 2 cups barbeque sauce

Directions:
- Fry bacon until crisp; remove from drippings and set aside.
- Saute all the vegies in the bacon drippings until tender
- Add bean, tomaotes, pimento and seasonings, BB Sauce and crumbled bacon.
- Cook in a slow cooker for 5-8 hours.

Carrot Muffins 

Ingredients:
- 3 cups flour
- 2 1/4 cups brown sugar
- 1 tbsp baking soda
- 1 tbsp cinnamon
- 1 cup oil
- 4 eggs
- 1 tbsp vanilla
- 1 1/3 cup pureed carrots

Directions:
- Mix together. Bake at 325° for 15-20 minutes.

Cookies

Ingredients:
- 1 c. margarine
- 2 eggs
- 1 c. white sugar
- 2 c. brown sugar
- 4 tsp. vanilla
- 2 c. pecans, chopped
- 3 c. flour

Directions:
- Cream margarine and sugars.
- Add eggs.
- Beat in vanilla, pecans and flour.
- Roll into logs.
- Chill dough or may be frozen. When ready to use, slice into 1/4 inch cookies.
- Place on baking sheet.
- Cook approximately 10 to 12 minutes at 350°.

Pumpkin Spice Muffins

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. raisins
- 1 1/2 c. self-rising flour
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 1/2 tsp. cinnamon
- 1/4 tsp. nutmeg
- 3/4 c. vegetable oil
- 1/2 c. canned pumpkin
- 2 large eggs
- 1/2 c. chopped pecans

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350°.
- Grease 12 muffin cups.
- Place raisins in small bowl.
- Pour enough boiling water over to cover; let stand 5 minutes.
- Drain raisins.
- Mix all dry ingredients in a large bowl.
- Add oil, pumpkin and eggs; mix just until combined.
- Mix in raisins and nuts.
- Put in prepared pans; bake about 25 minutes.

Sour Cream Hamburgers

Ingredients:
- 12 teaspoon salt
- 4 teaspoons Worcestershire sauce
- 2 teaspoons instant minced onion
- 23 cup sour cream
- 1 lb ground beef
- 23 cup corn flakes, slightly crushed

Directions:
- Mix everything but corn flakes.
- Gently stir in corn flakes.
- Let stand 1/2 hour.
- Shape into patties.
- Broil 4" from heat about 6 minutes on each side.

Escalloped Corn

Ingredients:
- 2 c. cracker crumbs
- 1/4 c. melted butter
- 2 c. milk
- 2 eggs, well beaten
- 2 cans cream-style corn
- 1/2 c. minced onion
- 1/4 c. chopped green pepper
- 1 small jar chopped pimento

Directions:
- Mix 3/4 cup crumbs with melted butter; set aside.
- Combine rest of ingredients and pour into buttered 1 1/2-quart casserole. Sprinkle with the buttered crumbs.
- Bake at 350° for 1 hour. Serves 12.

Sweet And Sour Potato Salad

Ingredients:
- 10 potatoes, peeled and cooked (dice)
- 1 medium onion, diced
- 1 medium red pepper, diced
- 1 medium green pepper, diced
- celery seed to taste
- 4 eggs, beaten
- 2 Tbsp. margarine
- 2/3 c. vinegar
- 2/3 c. sugar

Directions:
- Cook eggs, margarine, vinegar and sugar over medium heat, stirring constantly, until mixture thickens (about 12 minutes). If mixture becomes too thick, add a little milk.
- If too lumpy, you may strain mixture.
- Pour mixture over potatoes, onion and peppers and mix thoroughly.
- Best if refrigerated overnight.

Easiest and Best Fudge

Ingredients:
- 1 lb powdered sugar
- 23 cup unsweetened cocoa
- 14 cup whole milk
- 2 14 teaspoons vanilla
- 12 cup butter
- 12 cup chopped walnuts (optional) or 12 cup filberts (optional)

Directions:
- Sift cocoa and sugar together.
- Stir in milk and mix well.
- Place butter on top of mixture and microwave for 2 minutes.
- Add vanilla.
- Beat with spoon until well blended.
- Spread in 8 inch glass pan.
- Chill at least 1 hour before serving.

Aunt Delores’S Broccoli Casserole

Ingredients:
- 2 boxes Chopped Fresh Or Frozen Broccoli 8oz
- 1 package Kraft Garlic Cheese
- 1 can Cream Of Mushroom Soup 10.5 Oz
- 2 Tablespoons Butter
- 1 can French's Onion Rings Small Size

Directions:
- Cook broccoli according to directions on package. Drain and set aside.
- On medium heat, melt cheese, cream of mushroom soup and butter. You will need to watch carefully because it can burn fast. You will need to stir it almost constantly.
- Once it is melted, layer the broccoli and cheese mixture in a 2.5 qt. casserole dish. Cook, covered at 350 degrees for 25 minutes.
- Remove from oven and top with onion rings. Cook for an additional 10 minutes, uncovered.

Creamy Pimento Cheese

Ingredients:
- 1 block Cheddar cheese, grated
- 2 jars pimento
- 1 small jar Miracle Whip salad dressing
- salt and pepper to taste
- pinch of sugar

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients together.
- May have to add mayonnaise to make creamier.

Blue Cheese, Apple And Spinach Pizza

Ingredients:
- 1 (7 ounce) can refrigerated breadstick dough
- 2 cups loosely packed spinach leaves
- 2 medium rome apples, thinly sliced
- 1 cup crumbled blue cheese

Directions:
- Coil breadstick dough into a spiral.
- Flatten to a 12-inch circle.
- Place on a greased 12-inch pizza pan.
- Arrange spinach, then apple, then cheese over dough.
- Bake at 450 degrees F for 15 minutes or until crust is golden.

Grape-Nuts Pudding

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. Grape-Nuts
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 1/2 tsp. vanilla
- 1 egg
- 2 c. milk
- pinch of salt

Directions:
- Let Grape-Nuts stand in milk for 5 minutes. Add the remaining beaten ingredients. Bake at 325° for 1 hour.

Creamy Peanut Butter Banana Oatmeal

Ingredients:
- 14 cup quick oats, uncooked
- 1 ripe banana, mashed
- 1 tablespoon natural-style peanut butter
- 12 cup evaporated milk
- 1 teaspoon honey (optional) or 1 teaspoon brown sugar (optional)
- 1 pinch salt (optional)
- 1 pinch cinnamon (optional)

Directions:
- For best results, soak the oats overnight in 1/4 cup warm water.
- This will make them easier to digest and therefore easier to get the nutrients out of.
- The cook time does not include this time.
- Combine everything in a pan on stovetop over medium heat.
- Cook, stirring occasionally, for about 5 minutes.
- If using honey, do not add that until the very end.
- Eat this for a quick but very comforting and balanced breakfast!
- :).

Make-Ahead Meatballs

Ingredients:
- 4 eggs, lightly beaten
- 2 cups dry bread crumbs
- 1/2 cup finely chopped onion
- 1 tablespoon salt
- 2 teaspoons Worcestershire sauce
- 1/2 teaspoon white pepper
- 4 pounds lean ground beef (90% lean)

Directions:
- In a large bowl, combine the first six ingredients. Crumble beef over mixture and mix well. Shape into 1-in. balls, about 12 dozen.
- Place meatballs on greased racks in shallow baking pans. Bake at 400° for 10-15 minutes or until no longer pink, turning often; drain. Cool.
- Freeze cooled meatballs in freezer containers. To use, partially thaw in refrigerator overnight. Reheat on a greased 15x10x1-in. baking pan in a preheated 350° oven until heated through.

Quick Baking Mix

Ingredients:
- 9 cups all-purpose flour
- 1/3 cup baking powder
- 1/4 cup sugar
- 3 teaspoons salt
- 1 teaspoon cream of tartar
- 2 cup butter-flavored shortening

Directions:
- In a large bowl, combine the dry ingredients. Cut in shortening until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Store in an airtight container in a cool, dry place or in the freezer for up to 6 months.
- Quick Baking Mix may be used to prepare the following recipes (also found in Recipe Finder): Cinnamon Coffee Cake, Golden Biscuits and Country Cornbread.

Tomato and Red Lentil Soup

Ingredients:
- 20 ml olive oil
- 1 brown onion, halved, finely chopped
- 2 garlic cloves, crushed
- 3 (415 g) cans diced tomatoes
- 1 liter vegetable stock
- 175 g split red lentils

Directions:
- Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a large saucepan over medium heat.
- Add the onion and garlic and cook, stirring often, for 5 minutes or until onion softens.
- Add the tomato and stock and bring to the boil.
- Add the lentils and stir until well combined.
- Reduce heat to low and cook, stirring occasionally, for 20 minutes or until the lentils are tender and the soup thickens.
- Taste and season with salt and pepper.

Company Cheesecake

Ingredients:
- 1-3/4 c. graham cracker crumbs
- 1 stick softened butter
- 1/2 tsp. cinnamon
- 1/4 c. ground walnuts or pecans
- 1/4 c. sugar

Directions:
- Add all ingredients together and press into a spring form pan. Set aside.

Honey Wheat Bread

Ingredients:
- 2 pkg. active dry yeast
- 1/2 c. warm water
- 1/3 c. honey
- 1/4 c. shortening (butter flavor Crisco)
- 1 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 3/4 c. warm water
- 6 to 7 c. whole wheat flour
- 1/4 to 1/3 c. wheat germ

Directions:
- Dissolve yeast in 1/2 cup warm water.
- Stir in all ingredients, adding enough flour to make firm dough that's easy to handle.
- Turn into greased bowl so greased side is up.
- Let rise to double (about 1 hour).
- Punch down; divide into half.
- Flatten each half, rolling into a rectangle.
- Fold in two sides and roll up tightly into a loaf.
- Place in greased bread pan; brush top with margarine.
- Let rise to double (about 1 hour).
- Bake at 375° for 35 to 45 minutes.
- Cool on rack.
- Cover for softer crust.

Lemon Poppy Seed Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 (18.5 oz.) pkg. low-fat yellow cake mix
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 1/3 c. vegetable oil
- 1/4 c. water
- 1 c. egg substitute
- 3 Tbsp. lemon juice
- 2 Tbsp. poppy seed
- 1 c. plain nonfat yogurt

Directions:
- Combine cake mix and sugar in a large mixing bowl. Add oil, water, yogurt, egg substitute and lemon juice. Beat at medium speed for 6 minutes. Stir in poppy seed.
- Spray Bundt pan with Baker's Joy or Pam.
- Pour in batter.
- Bake at 350° for 40 minutes. Remove from pan and drizzle with Lemon Glaze.

Macaroni And Cheese

Ingredients:
- 2 Tbsp. flour
- 2 Tbsp. butter
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. minced onion
- 8 oz. elbow macaroni
- 3 slices bread, torn in small pieces
- 1/2 tsp. paprika
- 2 1/2 c. milk
- 1 1/2 c. shredded cheese
- 1/8 tsp. garlic salt
- 1 Tbsp. cornstarch

Directions:
- Melt butter; blend in flour and seasonings.
- Add milk and cornstarch.
- Cook, stirring constantly, until thickened.
- Add 1 cup of cheese and stir until melted.
- Cook macaroni as directed on package; drain.
- Combine with sauce in greased baking dish.
- Top with remaining cheese and bread crumbs.
- Bake, uncovered, at 375° for 25 minutes.
- Serves 6 to 8.

Mushroom-Blue Cheese Quiche

Ingredients:
- 1 pastry shells, 9-inch, uncooked
- 1/2 lb mushroom
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
- 1/4 cup blue cheese, crumbled
- 4 scallions, chopped
- 3 slices bacon, cooked, crumbled
- 3 eggs
- 1/2 cup milk
- 1/4 cup half-and-half
- pepper, to taste
- salt, to taste

Directions:
- Make or buy a prepared shortbread pastry crust and line a pie tin with it.
- Cook the mushrooms and lemon juice until "dryish".
- Pour this mixture into the pie shell along with the blue cheese, scallions and bacon.
- In a separate bowl, lightly beat the remaining ingredientss and add them to the pie shell.
- Cook at 350 (maybe hotter-recipe says "hot oven") for 45 minutes until browned and puffy.

All Vegetable Spaghetti Sauce

Ingredients:
- 3/4 c. diced onions (fresh or frozen)
- 3/4 c. green pepper (fresh or frozen)
- 4 to 8 oz. fresh mushrooms
- 1 large or 2 small zucchini
- 1 1/2 tsp. Italian seasoning
- 1 or 2 cloves garlic (freshly pressed)
- 28 oz. can crushed tomatoes
- 2 (8 oz.) cans tomato sauce
- 2 tsp. sugar

Directions:
- Process (in food processor) onions and green peppers until very finely chopped or to your liking.
- Heat in a large (like Dutch oven size) saucepan, stirring occasionally, on the stove over medium heat.
- Wash and cut off ends of zucchini.
- Cut and process until pureed.
- Add to the cooking vegetables.
- Mince the fresh mushrooms and add them to the vegetables.
- Add garlic and cook until onions are translucent, 5 to 10 minutes.

Chicken Broccoli

Ingredients:
- 1 (10 oz.) pkg. frozen chopped broccoli
- 4 c. cooked, chopped chicken
- 1 (10 3/4 oz.) can condensed cream of chicken soup
- 1/2 c. low-fat mayonnaise
- 1 (4 oz.) can mushroom stems and pieces, drained
- 1/4 tsp. curry powder
- 3/4 c. grated Parmesan cheese

Directions:
- Cook broccoli in boiling water according to package directions.
- Drain broccoli and spread it in a 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking dish.
- Mix chicken, soup, mayonnaise, mushrooms, curry powder and 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese in a medium bowl.
- Spread chicken mixture over broccoli.
- Sprinkle 1/4 cup Parmesan cheese over top.
- Cover dish with foil and bake in a preheated 350° oven for 40 minutes.
- Remove foil and stir; bake 10 to 20 minutes more. Can be frozen and served later.

Dieter'S Potato Salad

Ingredients:
- 2 large red potatoes, boiled and diced (leave the skin on)
- 1/2 c. cold, steamed broccoli
- 1/2 c. cold, steamed cauliflower
- 1 Tbsp. Dijon mustard
- 2 Tbsp. vinegar
- pepper to taste

Directions:
- Lightly toss all ingredients and chill.
- Surprisingly tasty and satisfying.
- Serves 2.

No - Bake Granola Bars

Ingredients:
- 2 1/2 cups Rice Krispies
- 1/2 cup raisins
- 1/2 cup brown sugar
- 1/2 cup light corn syrup
- 1/2 cup peanut butter
- 1 teaspoon vanilla

Directions:
- In large bowl, combine cereal, oats and raisins; set aside.
- In small saucepan, combine brown sugar and syrup.
- Bring to a boil while stirring.
- Remove from heat.
- Stir until smooth.
- Pour over cereal mixture, mix well.
- Press into ungreased 9 x 13 inch pan.
- Cool.
- Cut into bars.

Whole Wheat  And Oatmeal Bread

Ingredients:
- 1 1/4 cups water
- 2 tablespoons dried powdered milk
- 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
- 1 teaspoon lemon juice (bottled is fine)
- 1 1/2 cups whole wheat flour
- 1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
- 1/2 cup oats (not instant)
- 1/4 cup sugar
- 1 1/2 teaspoons salt
- 2 teaspoons yeast
- 1/4 - 1/2 teaspoon gluten (optional)

Directions:
- Add the ingredients to your bread machine pan according to your machine's instructions.
- Set to the dough cycle.
- When it is ready, take out the dough, shape into a loaf.
- This dough is very easy to handle.
- Place in a lightly greased or sprayed 8 1/2 x 4 1/2 loaf pan.
- Do not use a too large pan or your loaf will not turn out right.
- Cover and let rise about a half hour.
- Bake about 30 minutes at 350° or until nicely browned.

Trifle

Ingredients:
- 1 pkg. (8 oz.) PHILADELPHIA Neufchatel Cheese, softened
- 2 cups fat-free milk, divided
- 1 pkg. (1 oz.) JELL-O Vanilla Flavor Sugar Free Fat Free Instant Pudding
- 1 tub (8 oz.) COOL WHIP FREE Whipped Topping, thawed
- 1 can (20 oz.) crushed pineapple in juice, undrained
- 1 pkg. (12 oz.) frozen raspberries without syrup, thawed
- 1 pkg. (8.5 oz.) prepared angel food cake, cut into 3/4-inch cubes

Directions:
- Beat Neufchatel in large bowl with mixer until creamy.
- Gradually beat in 1/2 cup milk until blended.
- Add dry pudding mix and remaining milk; beat on low speed 2 min.
- Gently stir in COOL WHIP.
- Combine pineapple and raspberries.
- Layer 1/3 each of the cake, fruit mixture and pudding mixture in 3-qt.
- bowl.
- Repeat layers twice.
- Refrigerate several hours.

Breakfast Delight

Ingredients:
- 6 slices bread, crumbled
- 1 lb. sausage, browned, drained and crumbled
- 5 eggs, beaten with 3 c. milk
- 1/2 to 1 c. grated cheese

Directions:
- Place bread crumbs on bottom of casserole dish.
- Add crumbled sausage on top of bread.
- Sprinkle cheese on sausage.
- Add egg and milk mixture.
- Cover and let set overnight in refrigerator.
- Bake at 350° for 30 to 35 minutes.

Spiced Round

Ingredients:
- 1 pt. brown sugar
- 1 pt. salt
- 1 tsp. saltpeter
- 1 teacup spices
- a few cloves
- mace
- nutmeg

Directions:
- When the hog heads have been cleaned and soaked in salt water for some days, put in a dinner pot and cook in plenty of water until very tender.
- Take out in another pot and with a fork, break up fine; put in some of the juices and one pint of sifted meal to a head or more if you like; return to the stove and boil a few minutes.
- Can use the whole head and jowl which makes it very nice.
- In this case, you take off all the grease that you can. Mold and fry in a hot skillet.

Grilled Salmon With Pecan Butter

Ingredients:
- Pecan Butter
- 1/2 cup unsalted butter, softened
- 1/3 cup pecans, finely chopped
- 1 tablespoon fresh flat-leaf parsley, chopped (can substitute chives)
- 1 tablespoon fresh lemon zest
- 1 teaspoon fresh lemon juice
- 2 teaspoons fresh ginger, grated
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- Salmon
- 4 salmon steaks (6 ounces each)
- 1 tablespoon pecan oil (or olive oil)
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1 teaspoon black pepper

Directions:
- In a small mixing bowl, combine the pecan butter ingredients; beat until well blended. Set aside.
- Rub salmon steaks with oil and season with salt and pepper. Grill, broil, or pan-sear for 4-5 minutes on each side or until salmon is cooked to desired doneness. Transfer to dinner plates or a serving platter. Top each with a dollop of pecan butter. Pass the remaining butter.

Holiday Gumdrop Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 cup butter
- 2 eggs
- 1 teaspoon cinnamon
- 1/2 teaspoon nutmeg
- 1 1/2 cups applesauce
- 1 teaspoon baking soda (dissolved in a little hot water)
- 1 1/2 lbs gumdrops
- 2 cups sugar
- 4 cups flour
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1 cup raisins
- 1 cup nuts
- 1 teaspoon vanilla

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 325 degrees.
- Grease and flour Bunt or angle food cake pan.
- Cream butter add eggs and sugar.
- Mix applesauce, soda, nutmeg and cinnamon together.
- Add to butter and egg mixture.
- Add gumdrops, nuts to flour and salt.
- (Mix to dredge).
- Add the flour-salt-gumdrop-nut mixture, mix thoughly.
- Pour into prepared pan and bake 1-1/2 hours.

Slow Cooked Potato Soup

Ingredients:
- 5 12 cups peeled potatoes, divided
- 2 34 cups water
- 13 cup butter, cubed
- 1 13 cups cooked ham, diced
- 2 celery ribs, chopped
- 23 cup chopped onion
- 34 teaspoon garlic powder
- 34 teaspoon paprika
- 18 teaspoon pepper
- 12 lb Velveeta cheese, cubed
- 23 cup sour cream
- milk (optional)

Directions:
- Place 4-1/2 cups of the potatoes in a saucepan add water.
- Bring to a boil reduce heat cover and cook 15-20 min or until tender.
- Remove from heat; do not drain.
- Mash potatoes stir in butter.
- In a 3 quart slow cooker combine the ham, celery, onion, garlic powder, paprika, pepper and remaining cubed potatoes.
- Stir in the mashed potatoes top with cheese.
- Cover and cook 5-6 hours or until potatoes are tender.
- Stir in the sour cream until blended.
- Thin soup with milk if desired.

Voodoo Manhattan Cocktail

Ingredients:
- 2 1/2 ounces Woodford Reserve
- 1/2 ounce Averna Amaro
- 1/2 ounce Clement Creole Shrubb
- 1/2 barspoon pink peppercorns
- skewered blood orange supremes, for garnish
- inflamed orange peel, for garnish

Directions:
- In a pint glass, muddle peppercorns and then add Woodford Reserve, Averna, and Creole Shrub.
- Top with ice and stir.
- Double strain into a chilled martini glass.
- Garnish by rubbing skewered blood orange supremes along the rim of the glass then placing in glass and finishing with an flamed orange peel.

Mexican Cornbread

Ingredients:
- 2 c. corn bread mix
- 2 eggs
- 1/2 c. cooking oil
- 1 c. longhorn cheese, grated
- 1 c. chopped onions
- 1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and finely chopped
- 1 Tbsp. sugar
- 1 can cream-style corn

Directions:
- You can add a little vinegar from the peppers.
- Mix all together and bake at 350° for 30 to 40 minutes in a 9 x 13-inch pan.

Low Fat Smothered Sirloin Steak-Kraft Foods

Ingredients:
- 1/2 cup reduced-fat Italian salad dressing
- 1 lb beef sirloin steak, well-trimmed
- 1/3 cup fat free sour cream
- 4 1/2 teaspoons grated parmesan cheese
- black pepper
- 1 medium onion, thinly sliced

Directions:
- POUR 1/4 cup of the dressing over steak in resealable plastic bag.
- Seal bag; turn to coat.
- Refrigerate 30 minute or overnight to marinate.
- Combine sour cream, 2 tablespoons of the remaining dressing, the Parmesan cheese and pepper.
- Refrigerate until serving time.
- HEAT remaining 2 tablespoons dressing in large nonstick skillet on medium heat.
- Add onions; cook 7 to 8 minute or until golden brown, stirring frequently.
- Remove onions; set aside.
- DRAIN steak; discard marinade.
- Cook steak in same skillet on medium heat 3 to 4 minute on each side for medium doneness.
- Place on cutting board; slice crosswise into thin strips.
- Serve steak topped with sauce and onions.

Magda's Colorful Lentil Salad

Ingredients:
- 34 cup lentils
- 12 small onion, diced
- 1 garlic clove, minced
- 1 medium carrot, grated
- 1 small tomatoes, diced
- 14 cup roasted red pepper, diced
- 12 cup frozen corn
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 12 teaspoon sesame oil
- 1 tablespoon red wine vinegar
- 12 teaspoon thyme, dried
- 12 teaspoon cumin, ground
- salt, to taste
- pepper, to taste
- fresh cilantro, chopped
- 12 cup feta cheese

Directions:
- Rinse lentils.
- Cook lentils in lots of water until tender but not mushy.
- Drain and rinse briefly in cold water.
- Combine the lentils and vegetables.
- Mix gently to combine.
- In a small bowl, combine the oils, vinegar and seasonings.
- Add to vegetables and mix gently.
- Add crumbled feta cheese.
- Refrigerate for a minimum of one hour and up to 24 hours to allow flavors to combine.

Cranberry Conserve

Ingredients:
- 3 apples
- 3 oranges
- 1 lb. cranberries
- 3 1/2 c. sugar

Directions:
- Core apples. Seed oranges.
- Grind apples, oranges and cranberries.
- This should make about 7 cups of pulp.
- Mix with sugar and refrigerate.

Loaded Baked Potato Salad

Ingredients:
- 5 pounds Russet Potatoes, Scrubbed
- 1 bunch Green Onions, Chopped
- 2 cloves Garlic, Finely Chopped
- 2 Tablespoons Fresh Parsley, Choppped
- 2 cups Shredded Cheddar Cheese
- 2 cups Sour Cream (light Is Fine)
- 1/2 cups Ranch Dressing (Light Works)
- 1/2 cups Mayonnaise (Light Is Fine)
- 1 package Real Bacon Bits
- Salt and Pepper

Directions:
- Place scrubbed potatoes on a plate and pierce with fork, microwave on high 15 minutes, or until soft.
- While potatoes are cooling: chop onions, garlic, parsley and shred the cheese. (its better if you freshly shred the cheese)
- In a small bowl mix sour cream, Ranch dressing, mayo, garlic, salt & pepper.
- Chop the potatoes small and put in a large mixing/serving bowl. Add in the bacon, cheese, onions, parsley. Stir together and pour the dressing over the top.
- Refrigerate at least one hour before serving.

Minted Carrots & Sprouts

Ingredients:
- 250 -500 g Brussels sprouts (x cut in bottom)
- 2 -3 carrots (peeled & sliced in rings)
- 1 -2 tablespoon butter
- 1 tablespoon mint (finely chopped)

Directions:
- Either microwave or boil sprouts & carrots together in a little water until tender.
- Drain and add butter & mint.
- Swirl to coat veggies and serve hot.

Chile Mole Recipe

Ingredients:
- 5 lbs. pork tenderloin, cut in 3 or possibly 4 pcs
- 1 1/2 c. flour
- 2 c. cool water
- 6 c. meat stock
- 1 quart. chile caribe (seasoned with garlic, oregano and salt)

Directions:
- Place pork tenderloin in large kettle.
- Add in water to cover meat.
- Boil slowly till tender, adding water if needed, approximately 3 hrs.
- Remove meat to platter; set aside.
- Measure 6 c. meat stock; bring to boil.
- Dissolve flour in cool water and add in slowly to boiling meat stock.
- Stir vigorously till it comes to a second boil.
- Boil slowly for 45 min, stirring frequently.
- Strain.
- Add in to strained mix 1 qt chile caribe, mix well, stir and bring to a boil.
- If mix appears too thick, add in more meat stock.
- Add in 1 tsp.
- salt.
- Cut cooled meat in small cubes and shred, add in to chile sauce.
- Simmer 5 min.
- Serve.
- Pour leftover cool chile in small containers and freeze.

Sweet-And-Salty Party Popcorn

Ingredients:
- 1 cup popcorn kernels
- Coconut oil (use equal amount to package oil recommendation)
- 1 ounce bag white chocolate chips
- 1/4 cup butter
- 1 tablespoon salt
- 1/2 cup sprinkles

Directions:
- Follow the package instructions to pop kernels on the stove top in coconut oil, using a large pot (the biggest one you have!).
- Add bag of white chocolate chips and butter to a microwave-safe bowl. Melt in microwave in 15-second intervals until ingredients are almost fully melted. Remove from microwave and stir ingredients until they are fully melted. Add salt and mix.
- Pour white chocolate mixture over popcorn and mix to incorporate. Pour in sprinkles while mixture is still damp and mix.

Sweet Potato Pie

Ingredients:
- 1 deep pie crust
- 1 can sweet potatoes, drained and mashed
- 1 can sweetened condensed milk
- 2 eggs
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 1 tsp. allspice
- 1 tsp. salt

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients together.
- Pour into the pie crust.
- Bake at 350° for an hour.

Betty'S Brazil Nut Fruitcake

Ingredients:
- 1 lb shelled brazil nut, chopped
- 1 (8 ounce) package pitted dates (cut in half)
- 1/2 lb pineapple bits (the kind for fruit cake)
- 1 cup drained maraschino cherry, chopped
- 1 cup raisins (you can mix the gold and dark raisins if desired)
- 3/4 cup flour
- 3/4 cup sugar
- 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 3 eggs
- 1 teaspoon vanilla

Directions:
- Sift the dry ingredients together.
- In large bowl, place chopped fruits and nuts.
- Add the sifted flour and mix to coat well.
- Beat the eggs and add the vanilla.
- Mix with the dry ingredients and fruit and nuts until well coated.
- Grease a 9x5x3 loaf pan and line with wax paper.
- Add mixture to prepared pan.
- Bake at 300 degrees for 1 hour and 45 minutes.
- Remove from pan and immediately remove wax paper and cool before slicing.

Rhonda'S Butter Chess Pie

Ingredients:
- 5 eggs
- 1 stick melted butter
- 2 c. sugar
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 Tbsp. cornstarch
- 1/2 c. buttermilk
- unbaked 9-inch deep dish pie shell

Directions:
- Mix eggs with sugar and cornstarch until smooth.
- Add melted butter, vanilla and buttermilk.
- Bake at 350° for 30 minutes or until done.
- Let cool and chill.
- Similar to Furr's Butter Chess Pie.

Honey Moist Cornbread

Ingredients:
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 1 cup yellow or white cornmeal
- 1/4 cup sugar
- 1 tablespoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1 cup Land O Lakes Half & Half
- 1/4 cup Land O Lakes Butter, melted
- 1/4 cup honey
- 2 Land O Lakes Eggs, slightly beaten

Directions:
- Heat oven to 400F.
- Combine flour, cornmeal, sugar, baking powder and salt in bowl.
- Stir in all remaining ingredients just until moistened.
- Pour into greased 8- or 9-inch square baking pan.
- Bake 18-22 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.

Adobo

Ingredients:
- 1 whole black peppercorn
- 14 teaspoon dried oregano leaves
- 1 garlic clove, peeled
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 12 teaspoon olive oil
- 12 teaspoon vinegar (or fresh lime juice)

Directions:
- Crush & mix first 3 ingredients in a mortar.
- Mix crushed ingredients with remaining ingredients.
- Rub seasoning into meat thoroughly & set in the refrigerator or several hours.
- This is enough for about 1 pound of meat or poultry.

Teriyaki Drumettes

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 cups white sugar
- 1 cup soy sauce
- 1 cup water
- 2 tablespoons ground ginger
- 3 cloves garlic, diced
- 3/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper
- 1 1/2 pounds chicken drumettes

Directions:
- Combine sugar, soy sauce, and water in an 8-quart pot; stir until sugar is dissolved. Turn heat to medium-high; add ginger, garlic, cinnamon, and black pepper and stir.
- Bring mixture to a boil and add chicken drumettes. Once mixture begins to boil again, reduce heat to medium-low, and partially cover pot with a lid tilted to allow steam to escape. Simmer until chicken is no longer pink in the center and teriyaki sauce is thickened, at least 1 hour.

Farmers Breakfast

Ingredients:
- 1/4 c. margarine
- 1/4 c. diced onion
- 3 medium potatoes, cut into 3/4-inch cubes
- 12 oz. chopped ham, cut into 3/4-inch cubes
- 6 eggs
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/4 c. shredded sharp Cheddar cheese

Directions:
- Saute onion and potatoes in large skillet, in hot margarine until potatoes are slightly browned.
- Cook, covered, 15 minutes or until potatoes are almost tender.
- Stir in ham cubes.
- Beat eggs with salt; pour over potato mixture.
- Cook over low flame, occasionally slip spatula underneath potatoes and ham to let uncooked egg flow to bottom.
- When eggs are set, sprinkle with cheese; cover skillet a minute or until cheese is melted.
- Makes 6 servings.

Peanut Butter Fudge

Ingredients:
- 1 jar peanut butter
- 1 jar Marshmallow Creme

Directions:
- Use same size jars.
- Mix well in pan over low heat until mixed and pour into buttered pan (big one).
- Cool and cut into squares.

Rainbow Poke Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 pkg. SuperMoist white cake mix
- 1 c. boiling water
- 1 c. cold water
- 1 pkg. (3 oz.) Jell-O brand raspberry
- 1 pkg. (3 oz.) Jell-O brand lime
- 1 container Cool Whip

Directions:
- Prepare cake mix as directed on package.
- Bake as directed. Cool for 10 minutes.
- Spoon raspberry over 1 layer.
- Repeat with lime gelatin.

Baked Winter Pear & Apple Crisp

Ingredients:
- 3 cups apples, peeled
- 3 cups pears, peeled
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
- 1 teaspoon fresh lemon rind, grated
- 1/3 cup all-purpose flour
- 1 cup rolled oats
- 1/2 cup chopped nuts
- 1 cup brown sugar
- 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon
- 1/2 teaspoon nutmeg
- 1/3 cup melted butter or 1/3 cup margarine

Directions:
- Toss fruit with lemon juice.
- Spread in lightly buttered 9-inch baking pan or deep pie plate.
- In a mixing bowl, combine lemon rind, flour, oats, nuts, sugar and spices.
- Blend in butter with a fork and spread over fruit.
- Bake in preheated 350 degrees oven for 30 to 40 minutes or until tender and golden.
- Serve with milk, cream or ice cream.

Ham And Asparagus Roll-Ups

Ingredients:
- 1 (15 oz.) can asparagus
- 12 slices baked ham/lunchmeat
- toothpicks

Directions:
- Roll individual stalks of asparagus inside individual slices of ham.
- Cut across each stalk, making each roll up into 2 or 3 pieces.
- (Shorter stalks should be cut only once, into 2 pieces). As you make each cut, pin the ham to the asparagus with a toothpick.
- Makes an appetizer or party finger food to feed about 12 people.

Yet Another Sourdough Starter (No Yeast)

Ingredients:
- 1 12 cups water
- 1 cup whole wheat flour
- 4 tablespoons molasses or 4 tablespoons honey

Directions:
- Mix thoroughly water, flour and molasses (or honey) in a covered plastic or glass jar.
- Place mixture in a warm draft-free area for several days.
- Each day stir, remove several Tablespoons of mixture and add several Tablespoons of flour and water.
- After yeast bubbles form, continue the process for 3 or 4 days.
- Starter is ready to use when bubbly and sour smelling.
- Mixture will be similar to pancake batter.
- Remove starter quantity for your recipe, store remainder in the refrigerator feeding weekly.

Chocolate Snappers

Ingredients:
- 1-3/4 cups (425 ml) flour
- 2 tsp (10 ml) baking soda
- 1 tsp (5 ml) cinnamon
- 1/4 tsp (1 ml) salt
- 3/4 cup (175 ml) shortening
- 1 cup (225 ml) sugar
- 1 egg
- 1/4 cup (60 ml) Karo syrup
- 2 squares melted unsweetened chocolate
- sugar for rolling cookies

Directions:
- Combine flour, baking soda, cinnamon and salt.
- Combine shortening, sugar and egg.
- Mix in Karo syrup and chocolate.
- Blend in flour mixture.
- Shape into balls, roll in sugar.
- Bake at 350 degrees (175 C.) for 15 minutes.

Applesauce Cookies

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 c. butter
- 2 c. sugar
- 2 c. warm applesauce
- 2 tsp. baking soda
- 4 1/2 c. flour
- 1/2 tsp. cloves
- 2 tsp. cinnamon
- 2 tsp. nutmeg
- 2 c. raisins
- 2 c. chopped pecans

Directions:
- Cream butter and sugar.
- Add baking soda to applesauce.
- Add applesauce to butter mixture.
- Blend well.
- Stir together flour and spices; add to first mixture.
- Add raisins and nuts.
- Drop by teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheet.
- Bake at 350° for 12 minutes.

Hawaiian Wedding Cake

Ingredients:
- 2 c. flour
- 2 eggs
- 1 c. chopped nuts
- 1 (20 oz.) can crushed pineapple (do not drain)
- 2 c. sugar
- 2 tsp. baking soda
- 1 c. shredded coconut

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients.
- If batter is dry, add more liquid.
- Bake at 350° for 45 minutes in a 13 x 9-inch pan.

Eggplant

Ingredients:
- 2 eggplant, cubed
- 6 Tbsp. oil
- 2 cloves garlic, chopped
- 2 onions, finely chopped
- 1 green bell pepper, sliced
- 1 Tbsp. oregano
- 1 Tbsp. brown sugar
- 2 Tbsp. wine vinegar
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. pepper
- 2 (4 oz.) cans pimientos, cut up

Directions:
- Peel and cube eggplant; boil in salted water for 5 minutes. Drain and set aside.
- Put 2 tablespoons oil in skillet.
- Saute garlic for one minute.
- Add onions and green pepper.
- Saute until wilted, about 5 minutes.
- Remove from pan and set aside.
- Add 4 tablespoons oil, the oregano and eggplant to skillet.
- Sprinkle with brown sugar; heat for 10 minutes, stirring the eggplant so it cooks evenly.
- Remove from heat.

Spring Delight Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 yellow cake mix
- 1 medium can mandarin oranges
- 4 eggs
- 3/4 c. oil

Directions:
- Mix and pour in a greased and floured pan.
- Bake at 350° in a 9 x 13-inch pan for 35 minutes or until done.

Angel Hair Pasta With Tomato Seafood Cream Sauce Recipe

Ingredients:
- 2 tsp extra virgin olive oil
- 2 x cloves garlic chopped
- 1 c. tomatoes seeded, finely diced
- 1 1/2 c. evaporated skim lowfat milk
- 1 tsp marjoram fresh grnd pepper
- 3/4 lb sea scallops
- 6 c. cooked angel hair pasta

Directions:
- Prep: 10 minutes, Cook: 10 minutes.
- In a skillet over medium high heat, heat the oil.
- Add in the garlic and saute/fry for 30 seconds.
- Add in the tomato and saute/fry for 2 min.
- Add in the evaporated lowfat milk and stir constantly over medium heat till thickened.
- Add in the marjoram and pepper.
- Add in the scallops and cook for 2 min till the scallops turn opaque.
- Pour the sauce over the angel hair pasta and serve.

The Bible Cake

Ingredients:
- 4 1/2 c. of I Kings 4:22
- 1 c. of Judges 5:25 (last clause)
- 2 c. of Jeremiah 6:20
- 2 c. of I Samuel 30:12
- 2 c. Nahum 3:12
- 2 c. of I Samuel 14:25
- 2 pinches of Leviticus 2:13
- 6 Jeremiah 17:11
- 1/2 c. Judges 4:19
- season to taste with 2 Chronicles 9:9

Directions:
- Mix well and bake in greased and floured pan at 350° until done.
- The verses names will tell you what the ingredients are and if followed will give a wonderful result.

Herbed Tomato Cheese Bread

Ingredients:
- 1 French bread, cut lengthwise
- 1/4 cup KRAFT House Italian Dressing
- 1 medium onion, sliced King Sooper's 1 lb For $0.99 thru 02/09
- 2 medium tomatoes, thinly sliced
- 5 Kraft Singles Swiss Cheese Slices, cut into triangles Target 2 For $5.00 thru 02/06
- 2 tsp. dried basil

Directions:
- LIGHTLY brush both cut sides of bread with dressing and top with onion, tomato and cheese slices.
- SPRINKLE with basil.
- BROIL 2 to 3 minutes or until cheese begins to melt.
- Cut into pieces.

Habanero Wing Sauce

Ingredients:
- 2 tablespoons honey
- 2/3 cup butter
- 2 large habanero peppers, chopped and seeded
- 1 tablespoon garlic
- 1 3/4 tablespoons vinegar
- 1/2 lemon
- 1 3/4 cups hot sauce

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients into large saucepan. Cook on low for 1 hour.

Shrimp and Crab Dip

Ingredients:
- 2 cans Small Shrimp
- 2 blocks Cream Cheese (8 Ounces Each)
- 1/2 cans Shrimp Juice
- Juice Of 2 Lemons
- 1 Tablespoon Grated Onion
- 1 teaspoon Pressed Garlic
- 1 can Crabmeat (6.5 Ounces)
- Tabasco To Taste

Directions:
- Drain shrimp and reserve the juice.
- Cream the cheese and combine with shrimp juice.
- Add lemon juice, onion, garlic, crabmeat, Tabasco, and half of the shrimp.
- Add the last of the shrimp and fold in carefully.
- Serve with Ritz crackers.

Microwave Fudge

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. powdered sugar
- 1/2 c. cocoa
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1/4 c. milk
- 1 Tbsp. vanilla
- 1 c. nuts

Directions:
- Stir all ingredients until blended in a 1 1/2-quart dish.
- Top with 1/2 cup butter.
- Microwave on High for 3 minutes; stir until smoothy.
- Blend in nuts.
- Pour into an 8-inch square pan lined with waxed paper.
- Chill; cut into squares.

Banana Walnut Smoothie

Ingredients:
- 1- 1/2 cup Ice
- 1/2 cups Unsweetened Almond Milk (coconut Milk Is Also Nice)
- 1/2 cups Water
- 3 Tablespoons Walnut Pieces
- 2 whole Dried Pitted Dates, Large
- 1/2 whole Banana
- 1 teaspoon Maca Powder

Directions:
- Combine ice, milk, water, walnuts, dates, banana and maca powder in your blender.
- Blend on high until smooth.
- Pour into a glass and enjoy!

Bean Casserole

Ingredients:
- 2 cans medium-size pork and beans (do not drain)
- 1 can kidney beans, drained
- 1 lb. hamburger
- 1/2 onion, chopped
- 1 c. ketchup
- 2 Tbsp. mustard

Directions:
- Brown hamburger and onion; drain.
- Mix beans and hamburger. Then add 1 cup ketchup and 2 tablespoons mustard.
- Bake 45 minutes at 375°.

Cocoa Crunch Clusters

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 cups raisins
- 1 cup unsweetened shredded or flaked coconut
- 1 /2 cup cacao nibs
- Big pinch of sea salt

Directions:
- Combine all ingredients in a food processor and pulse until the mixture is sticky and well-combined.
- Roll into balls of any size and refrigerate until firm.
- Store in an airtight container at room temperature for up to a week, in the refrigerator for up to 3 weeks, or in the freezer for up to 3 months.
- If frozen, bring them to room temperature before serving.
- Substitution:
- Raisins: dried cherries, golden raisins, or 1 1/4 cups pitted dates

Chicken Roulade A La Hart

Ingredients:
- 1 c. chopped spicy sausage
- 1/2 c. mixed red and green bell peppers
- 1/2 c. diced onions
- Italian spices
- fresh garlic
- chopped tomatoes
- salt and pepper
- smoked Gouda cheese

Directions:
- Saute onions, peppers and seasoning for a minute or so.
- Mix with sausage, chopped tomatoes, garlic, salt and pepper.
- Beat chicken breast until real thin.
- Cover breast with filling; fold in the sides and roll in flour and egg with bread crumbs.
- Deep fry for a few minutes to seal, then bake in oven at 300° for 1/2 hour to 45 minutes, depending on oven.
- Bon appetit!

Marinated Duck

Ingredients:
- 2 ducks
- 2 Tbsp. sugar
- 1 small onion, chopped
- 2 garlic cloves, minced
- 1/2 c. soy sauce
- 1/2 c. dry red wine
- 1 tsp. ground ginger
- 2 bay leaves, crumbled

Directions:
- Cut ducks in half lengthwise.
- Place in plastic bag in shallow pan.
- Combine remaining ingredients and pour over duck.
- Cover and marinate overnight in refrigerator, turning occasionally.

Tortilla Casserole

Ingredients:
- 1 lb ground beef
- 1 onion, chopped
- 1 (10 1/2 ounce) can mushroom soup
- 1 (2 ounce) can black olives, sliced
- 1 (15 ounce) can tomato sauce
- 1 cup taco sauce or 1 cup salsa
- 1 lb cheddar cheese, grated
- 12 corn tortillas, torn into small pcs
- salt and pepper, to taste

Directions:
- Brown ground beef and onion in skillet.
- Put all the other ingredients into large mixing bowl and mix well.
- Add ground beef mixture.
- Put in covered casserole dish.
- Bake at 350°F for 1 hour.

Tuna With Zucchini Noodles

Ingredients:
- 2 five ounce cans of tuna in oil
- 2 large cloves garlic
- 1/4 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes
- 3 small to medium zucchini
- 1 small lemon
- 1/4 to 1/2 cup water

Directions:
- Prep your ingredients: Either spirailze the zucchini or julienne into long strips. Finely mince the garlic and zest the lemon.
- Drain the oil from the tuna into a large saute pan. Over medium heat add the garlic and crushed red pepper flakes. Saute until fragrant.
- Add the zucchini strands and saute until they soften. Stir in the tuna and lemon zest. Add a little water to loosen everything up and continue to cook until heated through. Add the juice of the lemon and serve.

Squash Casserole

Ingredients:
- 2 c. cooked spinach
- 1 c. fat-free sour cream
- 1 chopped onion
- Pepperidge Farm dressing mix
- 1 can cream of mushroom soup
- celery salt, garlic powder and black pepper to taste
- 1/4 c. butter
- 1 c. low-fat cheese

Directions:
- Butter or spray with Pam a casserole dish.
- Sprinkle dressing mix to cover bottom of dish.
- Mix ingredients and pour in dish. Sprinkle more crumbs on top.
- Dot with butter and cheese.
- Bake at 350° until done.

White Chocolate Rice Pudding with OREO

Ingredients:
- 1-1/4 gal. milk
- 2-3/4 qt. whipping cream
- 1-1/4 pt. Arborio rice, uncooked
- 2 cups sugar
- 4-2/3 cups white chocolate, chopped
- 1 Tbsp. vanilla
- 1-3/4 qt. OREO Pieces-Medium

Directions:
- Combine milk, cream, rice and sugar in large saucepan (or medium saucepan for trial recipe).
- Cook on medium-low heat 30 min.
- or until rice is tender, but not mushy, stirring occasionally.
- (Watch carefully so rice mixture does not boil over.)
- Add chocolate and vanilla; cook until chocolate is completely melted, stirring constantly.
- Remove from heat.
- Stir in OREO Pieces.
- Ladle 2/3 cup of the rice mixture into each of 50 small dessert dishes (or 7 dessert dishes for trial recipe).
- Cover and refrigerate at least 4 hours before serving.

Baked Squash with Maple-Pecan Topping

Ingredients:
- 1 large acorn squash (1 1/2 lb.), ends trimmed, cut into four 3/4-inch-thick rounds
- 1/2 cup pecan halves (2 oz.)
- 1/4 cup dark brown sugar (1 1/2 oz.)
- 1 Tbs. chilled butter or margarine, diced
- 1/2 tsp. ground cinnamon
- 2 Tbs. maple syrup (preferably Grade B)

Directions:
- Place oven rack in center of oven, and preheat oven to 425F.
- Line 12- x 9-inch rimmed baking sheet with non-stick foil.
- Season squash with salt and very lightly with pepper, if desired.
- Arrange squash rounds on foil with larger surface area down.
- Roast 15 minutes.
- Pulse pecans, brown sugar, butter, cinnamon, and salt (if desired) in mini food processor until nuts are chopped to pea-size pieces.
- Transfer mixture to bowl; mix in maple syrup.
- Turn squash over.
- Top with pecan mixture.
- Bake 8 minutes more, or until squash is tender, and topping is hot and bubbling.

Pumpkin Tofu Cheesecake

Ingredients:
- 2/3 cup canned pumpkin
- 4 2/3 ounces packages tofu, cubed
- 8 ounces cream cheese, softened
- 2 eggs
- 1/2 cup sugar
- 3 tablespoons milk
- 1 teaspoon cinnamon
- 1 prepared graham cracker pie crust

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
- In blender or food processor, blend cream cheese, eggs and sugar until creamy.
- Remove and put in separate bowl.
- In blender or food processor, blend pumpkin, tofu, milk and cinnamon until well blended.
- Fold pumpkin mixture into cream cheese mixture.
- Pour into crust.
- Bake about 45 minutes until knife comes out clean.

Angel Cornbread

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 c. self-rising corn meal
- 1 c. self-rising flour
- 1 tsp. soda
- 1 pkg. dry yeast
- 1 Tbsp. sugar
- 2 eggs, beaten
- 2 c. buttermilk
- 1/2 c. oil

Directions:
- Combine all ingredients and stir well with wire whisk.
- Pour into 10-inch iron skillet sprayed with Pam.
- Bake at 425° for 30 minutes.
- Serve hot.
- Delicious!

Avocado & Garbanzo Bean Quinoa Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 cup quinoa, rinsed
- 1 can (15 ounces) garbanzo beans or chickpeas, rinsed and drained
- 2 cups cherry tomatoes, halved
- 1 cup crumbled feta cheese
- 1/2 medium ripe avocado, peeled and cubed
- 4 green onions, chopped (about 1/2 cup)
- 3 tablespoons white wine vinegar
- 1 teaspoon Dijon mustard
- 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt
- 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder
- 1/4 teaspoon freshly ground pepper
- 1/4 cup olive oil

Directions:
- Cook quinoa according to package directions; transfer to a large bowl and cool slightly.
- Add beans, tomatoes, cheese, avocado and green onions to quinoa; gently stir to combine. In a small bowl, whisk the first 5 dressing ingredients. Gradually whisk in oil until blended. Drizzle over salad; gently toss to coat. Refrigerate leftovers.

Linguine Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. linguine, broken in 4 sections and cooked as directed on pkg.
- 1 sliced cucumber
- 2 cut up tomatoes
- 1 chopped green pepper
- 1 purple onion, chopped
- 1 bottle McCormick's Salad Supreme (red)
- 1 bottle Italian dressing or 2 envelopes

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients in a 3-quart casserole.
- Chill.

Turkey And Mango Picadillo 

Ingredients:
- 2 cup cooked brown rice
- 1 1/2 medium mango(es)
- 1 cup salsa
- 1 tsp ground thyme
- 1 tsp dried oregano
- 1 tsp ground cumin
- 1 tsp ground coriander
- 1 tsp ground cinnamon
- 2 medium garlic clove(s)
- 1/2 cup scallion(s)
- 1 Tbsp canola oil
- 1 pound lean ground turkey

Directions:
- 1. Cook turkey in a large skillet over medium-high heat until browned, about 5 minutes. Drain off any fat.
- 
- 2. Add oil to skillet and heat over medium-high heat until sizzling. Stir in scallions, garlic, cinnamon, coriander, cumin, oregano and thyme. Cook, stirring, for 2 minutes. Gently stir in salsa and mango. Cover and cook until heated through, about 2 minutes more. Serve over brown rice. Yields about 3/4 cup of stew and 1/2 cup of rice per serving.
- 
- This recipe freezes well.

Cheryls Kicked Up Queso

Ingredients:
- 4 ounces, weight Cream Cheese (1/2 Block)
- 1 whole Mexican Chorizo Sausage Link, Cooked And Drained
- 4 ounces, weight Sliced Olives (small Can)
- 10 ounces, weight Rotel (1 Can)
- 4 ounces, weight Green Chilis Chopped (small Can)
- 16 ounces, weight Velveeta (Medium-Sized Loaf)
- 1/4 whole White Or Yellow Onion, Diced
- 1 cup Grated Cheddar
- Cholula Hot Sauce, To Taste
- 1 bag Fritos Scoops

Directions:
- Saute the onions briefly in a scant bit of olive oil until softened.
- Remove and saute the chorizo until done.
- Carefully remove the meat, leaving the red fat behind.
- Place the onions and chorizo in the vessel you will use for your queso dip.
- Add in the remaining ingredients, stir till well melted.
- Add Cholula to taste for the heat factor.
- Serve with Fritos Scoops chips.

Dijon Vinaigrette

Ingredients:
- 1/2 cup cider vinegar
- 1/4 cup coarse-grained Dijon mustard
- 4 to 6 garlic cloves
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 to 1/2 teaspoon pepper
- 1 cup extra-virgin olive oil

Directions:
- Process first 5 ingredients in a blender or food processor until smooth. With blender or processor running, add oil in a slow, steady stream; process until smooth.
- Note: Store extra dressing in refrigerator up to 1 week.

Salmon Mold

Ingredients:
- 1 (16 oz.) can salmon, drained
- 1 (8 oz.) cream cheese
- 1 Tbsp. minced onion
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1 Tbsp. lemon juice
- chopped parsley

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients well.
- Shape into ball and refrigerate 4 hours.

Satisfying Tomato Soup

Ingredients:
- 2 teaspoons oil
- 14 cup onion, finely chopped
- 14 cup celery, finely chopped
- 2 (14 ounce) cans diced tomatoes, undrained
- 1 12 cups chicken stock
- 2 teaspoons brown sugar
- 12 teaspoon salt
- 12 teaspoon basil
- 14 teaspoon oregano
- 14 teaspoon pepper

Directions:
- Warm oil in a saucepan over medium-high heat.
- Add onion and celery, stirring constantly, until tender, about 2-4 minutes.
- Stir in remaining ingredients.
- Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer uncovered, about 10 minutes.
- Puree soup using an immersion blender, or cool soup slightly and puree in batches in a blender.
- Return to pan and heat through.

Chocolate And Coffee Truffle Cake

Ingredients:
- 16 ounces chocolate
- 1/2 cup prepared strong coffee
- 6 eggs
- 1/2 cup sugar
- 1 cup whipping cream
- 1 tablespoon confectioners' sugar

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
- Melt chocolate with coffee and stir until smooth. Set aside.
- In separate bowl, beat eggs and sugar until light.
- Fold in chocolate mixture until blended.
- Whip cream until stiff.
- Fold into chocolate mixture.
- Pour into buttered and floured 10-inch springform pan.
- Bake in preheated 350 degree oven approximately 50 minutes, just until center is no longer loose.
- Refrigerate until cold.
- Sprinkle powdered sugar over top.

Candied Peanut Clusters

Ingredients:
- 1 cup lightly salted peanuts
- 2 tablespoons corn syrup
- 2 tablespoons brown sugar
- 12 teaspoon garlic powder
- 12 teaspoon cinnamon
- 1 dash cayenne powder
- 14 cup miniature marshmallow

Directions:
- Mix together corn syrup, garlic powder, cinnamon, and cayenne powder.
- Coat peanuts well in the mixture.
- Pour coated peanuts and any remaining mixture into a pan.
- Stir constantly until syrup has been absorbed onto peanuts.
- Stir in marshmallows, mix in well.
- Spoon peanuts onto oiled or buttered foil in clusters.
- Allow to completely cool.

Mashed Potato Casserole

Ingredients:
- 8 large potatoes
- 2 Tbsp. onion salt
- 1 pt. sour cream
- 4 Tbsp. butter
- 1 c. grated cheese (Cheddar)

Directions:
- Peel and cook potatoes until soft.
- Mash with onion salt and sour cream.
- Add butter to mixture.
- Place in 2-quart casserole dish and top with cheese.
- Refrigerate overnight.
- Bake at 350° for one hour.

Mars Bar Slice

Ingredients:
- 3 Mars bars
- 1 teaspoon margarine
- 1 tablespoon honey
- 4 cups Rice Krispies
- 150 g milk chocolate

Directions:
- cut mars bars into pieces& melt with margarine& honey.
- add rice bubbles& mix together well.
- press into lined (for removing easily) Laminton tray.
- melt chocolate and pour over top.
- put in fride for 1 hour.
- cut into squares.
- will keep in air tight container for 2 weeks but I dont know anyone who has managed to keep from eating it for that long.

Baked Chicken

Ingredients:
- 1 (2 to 3 lb.) fryer
- 2 c. bread crumbs
- 3/4 c. grated Parmesan
- 1/4 c. chopped parsley
- 1 clove garlic, crushed
- 2 tsp. salt
- 1/8 tsp. pepper

Directions:
- Dip chicken pieces in melted butter then in crumb mixture. Arrange chicken so they do not overlap in shallow roasting pan. Dot with 2 tablespoons butter.
- Bake 1 hour at 350°.

Blueberry Pie

Ingredients:
- 2 baked pie shells
- 3 or 4 bananas
- 1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese
- 1 large container Cool Whip or Dream Whip
- blueberry pie filling

Directions:
- Slice bananas in bottom of pie crusts.
- Mix cream cheese with Cool Whip or Dream Whip.
- Put over bananas.
- Top with blueberry pie filling and chill.

I Don'T Have Time To Cook

Ingredients:
- prefried fish, chicken, pork or beef patties
- 1 box instant potatoes
- 1 can green beans
- 3 Tbsp. butter and Creole seasoning

Directions:
- Using microwave directions, make potatoes.
- Heat up green beans in microwave 12 minutes.
- Add seasoning.
- Add butter and heat up. Put prefried pattie or two in microwave for 2 minutes (one minute on each side).

Baked Pork Chops And Stuffing

Ingredients:
- 4 pork chops
- 3 c. soft bread crumbs
- 2 Tbsp. chopped onion
- 1/4 c. melted butter or margarine
- 1/4 c. water
- pepper to taste
- 1/3 c. water
- 1 can cream of mushroom soup

Directions:
- Brown the pork chops on both sides in a skillet and place in a shallow baking dish.
- Mix the bread crumbs, onion, butter, 1/4 cup water and pepper; place on pork chops.
- Blend the soup and 1/3 cup water; pour over all.
- Bake at 350° for 1 hour or until pork is tender.
- Makes 4 servings.

Corn-Green Bean Casserole

Ingredients:
- 1 can French-style green beans
- 1/2 of 8 oz. carton sour cream
- 1/4 c. chopped onion
- 1 tube Ritz crackers, crushed
- 1/4 c. chopped almonds
- 1 can Shoe Peg corn
- 1 can cream of celery soup
- 3/4 c. grated Cheddar cheese
- 1 stick oleo, melted

Directions:
- Drain corn and beans and mix.
- Put in 8 x 8 x 3-inch baking dish.
- Mix sour cream, soup, onion and cheese.
- Spread over vegetables.
- Mix crackers, oleo and almonds; spread on top.
- Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 45 minutes.

Homemade Mustard Vinaigrette

Ingredients:
- 1/2 teaspoons Whole Grain Mustard
- 1/2 teaspoons Dijon Mustard
- 1/2 teaspoons Honey
- 1 Tablespoon Red Wine Vinegar
- 1 Tablespoon Extra Virgin Olive Oil
- Salt And Pepper

Directions:
- Combine the mustards and honey.
- Add the vinegar, mix, and then while whisking, drizzle in the olive oil.
- Sprinkle with salt and pepper.
- Serve with your favorite mixture of greens or over some grilled chicken for a complete meal!

6 Can Spicy Soup - Day Ahead Recipe

Ingredients:
- 1 lb ground beef
- 12 large onion, chopped
- 2 cups water
- 3 (19 ounce) cans minestrone soup
- 1 (10 ounce) canoriginal rotel
- 1 (14 ounce) can pinto beans, drained
- 1 (14 ounce) can white corn, drained

Directions:
- Brown ground beef with onion in large soup pot, drain any fat from cooked beef and place back in pot.
- Add water, minestrone soup, Rotel, pinto beans, and corn to pot.
- Bring to a boil.
- Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 1 hour stirring occasionally.
- Turn off burner and let sit for 1 hour to cool, place pot directly into refridgerator and cool for at least 2 hours to let flavors come together (preferably overnight.)
- Reheat, serve, and enjoy!

Wheat Free Oatmeal Chocolate Chip Cookies

Ingredients:
- 1 cup oatmeal
- 1 cup kamut flour
- 14 teaspoon salt
- 12 teaspoon baking powder
- 12 teaspoon baking soda
- 12 cup lactose-free margarine
- 1 cup brown sugar
- 14 cup applesauce
- 12 teaspoon vanilla
- 1 12 cups non-dairy chocolate chips

Directions:
- Preheat oven at 375F.
- Combine all dry ingredients in a large bowl.
- Cream butter and sugar.
- Add applesauce and vanilla.
- Add dry ingredients to wet and stir until well combined.
- Fold in chocolate chips.
- Spoon onto a cookie sheet and bake for 14 min or until brown.

Sabzi Polow

Ingredients:
- 500 g basmati rice or 500 g long-grain rice
- 1 kg herbs (parsley, dill, coriander, fenugreek, spring onion ends)
- cooking oil
- salt
- black pepper

Directions:
- Wash herbs and chop finely, then add salt and black pepper.
- Prepare rice as described in the recipe for polow but after rice is half-cooked and rinsed, mix it with herbs and continue cooking.
- Sabzi polow is usually served with fish.

Shrimp Dip

Ingredients:
- 1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese, softened
- 1/4 c. milk
- 2 tsp. lemon juice
- 1 1/2 tsp. Worcestershire sauce
- 1/2 tsp. garlic salt
- dash of salt and pepper
- 1 (6 1/2 to 7 1/2 oz.) can shrimp, drained

Directions:
- Beat cream cheese, gradually adding milk.
- Beat until smooth. Add lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce, garlic, salt and pepper. Add shrimp and stir in cream cheese mixture.
- Chill.
- Makes about 1 1/2 cups dip.

German Hazelnut Waffles With Blackberry Cream

Ingredients:
- 9 tablespoons unsalted butter
- 12 cup sugar
- 1 ounce vanilla sugar
- 4 eggs
- 23 cup flour
- 12 cup cornstarch
- 2 teaspoons baking powder
- 4 ounces heavy cream
- 34 cup finely ground hazelnuts
- 23 lb cream cheese
- 8 tablespoons blackberry jam
- 2 tablespoons confectioners' sugar
- 13 lb blackberry
- confectioners' sugar, for dusting

Directions:
- With an electric mixer, beat the melted butter with the sugar, vanilla sugar and eggs until fluffy.
- In a separate bowl, combine flour, corn starch and baking powder.
- Add the dry ingredients and the cream gradually to the butter-egg-sugar mixture.
- Fold in the ground hazelnuts.
- Prepare waffles in preheated waffle maker.
- Combine the cream cheese, confectioners' sugar and blackberry jam until smooth.
- Serve the waffles with the cream and fresh blackberries.
- Dust with confectioners' sugar.

Cordon Bleu-With An Italian Twist 

Ingredients:
- 4 boneless chicken breasts,pounded thin.
- 1 egg, slightly beaten with 1 tbl water., 1 cup Italian bread crumbs, 2 Tbl. parmesan cheese, 1 tbl. chopped fresh parsley, t tsp. paprika, salt and pepper, 4 slices prosciutto ham, 4 slices gruyere cheese.
- 2 tbl. vegetable oil, 2 tbl butter

Directions:
- Mix together bread crumbs, parmesan cheese, parsley, paprika and salt and pepper and set aside.
- Place chicken breasts on a flat surface and top each with 1 slice of ham and 1 slice of cheese. roll up and secure with toothpicks. Dip each breast in the egg mixture and cover completely with the breadcrumb mixture.
- Place oil and butter in a frying pan over medium heat. When bubbly saute chicken on all sides until brown. Place in a 350 degree over and bake until cooked through, about 15 - 20 min. Remove toothpicks and serve.

Pecan Pie

Ingredients:
- 1 c. light brown sugar
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 tsp. lemon
- 3 eggs
- 1/4 c. milk
- 1 stick margarine, melted
- 2 c. chopped pecans
- 1 deep dish pie shell or 2 regular pie shells, unbaked

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients except pecans in blender.
- Stir them in last, then pour into pie shells and cook 50 minutes at 350°.

Colorful Green Bean Medley

Ingredients:
- 1 pound fresh green beans, cut into 2-inch pieces
- 1 medium sweet orange pepper, cut into strips
- 1 can (8 ounces) sliced water chestnuts, drained
- 2 tablespoons butter
- 2 garlic cloves, minced
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon onion powder
- 1/4 teaspoon dried basil
- 1/4 teaspoon coarsely ground pepper

Directions:
- Place green beans in a steamer basket; place in a large saucepan over 1 in. of water. Bring to a boil; cover and steam for 8-10 minutes or until crisp-tender.
- Meanwhile, in a large skillet, saute orange pepper and water chestnuts in butter until tender. Add the garlic, salt, onion powder, basil and pepper; cook 1 minute longer. Add beans; toss to coat.

Chewy Almond Cookies...wow!

Ingredients:
- 34 cup almond paste, not marzipan
- 1 cup sugar
- 2 egg whites, at room temperature

Directions:
- Blend almond paste and sugar in the food processor until it is completely combined.
- Add egg white and blend until smooth.
- Transfer mixture to a pastry bag and make small dallops on a greased cookie sheet (parchment paper is even better).
- With a wet finger, smooth out the tops of the cookies.
- bake at 300 for 15 to 20 minutes, or until they start to get a golden color.

Fettuccine Alfredo

Ingredients:
- 1/2 cup (1 stick) butter
- 2 cups heavy cream
- 1/8 tsp. garlic powder
- 1/8 tsp. ground black pepper
- 1 (12 oz.) box fettuccine pasta
- 1/4 cup grated parmesan cheese

Directions:
- Melt the butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat.
- Add the cream, garlic powder, and pepper and simmer for 10 - 12 minutes or until thick.
- At the same time, bring 4 - 6 quarts of water to a boil and add the pasta.

Chocolate Fudge Pie

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. melted butter
- 1 c. sugar
- 1/2 c. flour
- 2 eggs
- 2 Tbsp. vanilla
- 3 Tbsp. cocoa

Directions:
- Mix sugar and eggs.
- Add to butter and other ingredients.
- Mix well.
- Pour into unbaked pie shell.
- Bake at 350° for 20 to 25 minutes.

Chocolate-Covered Strawberries

Ingredients:
- 1 pt. strawberries with hulls intact
- 2/3 c. semi-sweet chocolate chips
- 4 Tbsp. butter

Directions:
- Cover cookie sheet with wax paper, set aside.
- Wash and pat dry strawberries.
- Melt chocolate chips and butter on top of a double boiler over simmering water, stirring until smooth.
- Remove from heat; keep double boiler over water.
- Dip each strawberry two-thirds of the way up into chocolate mixture; allow excess to drip off.
- Place on prepared cookie sheet.
- Allow chocolate to set. Chill until ready to serve.

Vegetable Stuffed Potatoes

Ingredients:
- 3 large baking potatoes
- 1 pkg. frozen vegetables with cream sauce
- 2 Tbsp. milk
- salt and pepper
- 2 Tbsp. butter or oleo

Directions:
- Scrub potatoes.
- Place on baking sheet and bake in a 400° oven for 1 hour or until tender.
- Meanwhile, cook frozen vegetables according to directions.
- Halve each potato; scoop out contents. Mash until smooth with the milk and butter.
- Add salt and pepper. Next, spoon cooked vegetables into potato shells.
- Place mashed potatoes on top of vegetables.
- Return to oven (400°) and bake 15 minutes more or until golden brown.

Goat Cheese Tartletts

Ingredients:
- 12 ounces soft fresh goat cheese
- 1 cup heavy cream
- 3 eggs
- 14 cup basil leaves, chopped
- 14 teaspoon salt
- 18 teaspoon black pepper
- 24 wonton wrappers
- 3 tablespoons mango chutney or 3 tablespoons raspberry preserves

Directions:
- Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
- Place the goat cheese in the bowl of the food processor and process until crumbly.
- Add the cream, eggs, basil, salt, and pepper and process until blended.
- Coat one side of each wonton wrapper with non-stick cooking spray; press greased side down into miniature muffin cups.
- Pour the goat cheese mixture into the wonton shells.
- Bake for 10 -15 minutes, or until tartletts are firm when shaken and the tops are lightly browned.
- Allow to cool for 5 minutes.
- Top each with 1/2 tsp Mango Chutney or Raspberry preserves.

Grammy's Vegetable Salad Recipe

Ingredients:
- 1 can white corn, liquid removed
- 1 can sm. green peas, liquid removed
- 1 can French green beans, liquid removed
- 1 c. minced celery
- 1 c. minced onion
- 1 c. green pepper, minced
- 1 jar minced pimento
- 3/4 c. vinegar
- 1 c. sugar
- 1/2 c. salad oil
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon pepper
- 1 tbsp. water

Directions:
- Combine corn, green peas, green beans, celery, onion, green pepper and pimento.
- Bring to a boil the rest of the ingredients.
- Cold.
- Then mix with the liquid removed vegetables.
- Let stand overnight.
- Keeps several weeks in the refrigerator.
- This is a great dish to serve!
- Makes 10 servings.

Festive Tropical Fruit Balls

Ingredients:
- 2 cups crisp rice cereal
- 2/3 cup dried chopped tropical fruit mix
- 1/2 cup pecans, chopped
- 1/3 cup sweetened dried cranberries
- 2 tablespoons Land O Lakes Butter
- 3 cups miniature marshmallows
- 1 cup sweetened flaked coconut

Directions:
- Line large baking sheet with waxed paper or parchment paper.
- Set aside.
- Combine cereal, tropical fruit mix, pecans and cranberries in bowl.
- Set aside.
- Melt butter in 3-quart saucepan over low heat; add marshmallows.
- Cook, stirring constantly, until marshmallows are melted and smooth.
- Pour marshmallow mixture over cereal mixture in bowl; stir to coat.
- Let cool 5 minutes or until cool enough to handle.
- Place coconut into shallow bowl.
- Shape cereal mixture into 1-inch balls; roll in coconut.
- Place in single layer onto prepared baking sheet.
- Cool completely.
- Store between sheets of waxed paper in container with tight-fitting lid.

Roasted Mustard Potatoes

Ingredients:
- Pam vegetable spray
- 4 Tbsp. Dijon style mustard
- 2 tsp. paprika
- 1 tsp. chili powder
- 1/2 tsp. garlic powder (optional)
- 16 baby red potatoes

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 400°.
- Spray large flat pan 3 times with Pam. Cut red potatoes into wedges (approximately 4 wedges each), leaving skins on.
- Combine mustard, paprika, chili powder and garlic powder in large bowl.
- Add potato wedges, tossing to coat evenly.
- Put wedges on pan, skin side down.
- Bake 45 to 60 minutes, until potatoes are fork-tender.
- Serves 4. Per serving:
- 122 calories, 2 g. fat.

Cinnamon Breakfast Cake

Ingredients:
- 2 cups flour, all-purpose
- 4 teaspoons baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 cup raisins, seedless
- 2 tablespoons sugar
- 1 teaspoon cinnamon
- 4 tablespoons brown sugar
- 4 tablespoons vegetable shortening
- 1 each eggs well beaten
- 1/2 cup milk
- 1 tablespoon butter melted, or butter substitute

Directions:
- Sift flour, measure, and sift with baking powder, and salt.
- Add brown sugar; cut in shortening with 2 spatulas.
- Add egg and sufficient milk to form a soft dough.
- Add raisins.
- Spread in well-oiled and floured cake tin.
- Pour melted butter over top of cake.
- Sprinkle with 2 tablespoons sugar and cinnamon.
- Bake in hot oven (435F) for 20 to 25 minutes.

Chocolate Caramel Nut Turtles

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 c. pecans or walnuts
- 1 (16 oz.) bag caramel squares
- 1 (6 oz.) bag semi-sweet chocolate chips

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350°.
- Place clusters of three nuts each on a buttered cookie sheet.
- Place one caramel on top of each cluster of nuts.
- Bake in oven for 5 to 7 minutes or until the caramel has softened but still retains its shape.
- Remove from oven.
- Melt chocolate chips in small saucepan over low heat.
- Flatten the caramel squares with the back of a spoon, then pour a little chocolate over each cluster with a spoon.
- Cool.

Fried Green Tomatoes

Ingredients:
- 3 green tomatoes, sliced
- 1/2 c. cornmeal
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1/2 c. buttermilk
- salad oil

Directions:
- Combine
- cornmeal,
- salt
- and pepper in a shallow dish. Pour buttermilk	into
- shallow bowl.
- Heat 1/2-inch of oil in large cast-iron
- skillet.
- Dip
- tomato
- slices in buttermilk, then
- in cornmeal.
- Dip in buttermilk again, then the cornmeal again. Gently
- drop slices into hot fat and fry on both sides until golden brown.
- Drain on paper towels and serve hot.

Hamburger Stroganoff

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. onion, minced
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 1 garlic clove, minced
- 2 Tbsp. flour
- 2 tsp. salt
- 1 (8 oz.) can mushrooms
- 1 can cream of chicken soup
- 1 c. sour cream

Directions:
- Saute beef and onion.
- Remove grease. Add other ingredients except sour cream. Simmer for 5 minutes. Add sour cream. Serve over noodles, rice or mashed potatoes.

Zucchini Souffle

Ingredients:
- 1 egg, beaten slightly
- 1 c. sour cream
- 1 c. Cheddar cheese, shredded
- 1 1/2 c. zucchini, grated, cooked and cooled
- 20 saltine crackers, crushed
- Parmesan cheese for topping

Directions:
- In bowl, put together ingredients as listed and let stand 15 minutes.
- Bake 25 to 30 minutes at 350° in round cake or quiche pan or 8-inch square pan.

Easy Fruit Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 can cherry pie filling
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 1 c. mini marshmallows
- 1 c. sliced pineapple
- 3 to 4 bananas
- 1/2 c. pecans

Directions:
- Add sugar to pie filling. Stir in marshmallows and allow to stand 2 to 3 hours or overnight.
- Before serving, cut up and add drained pineapple, bananas and nuts.

Johnsonville Strawberry And Apple Chicken Sausage Salad

Ingredients:
- 6 ounces Johnsonville(R) Apple Chicken Sausage sliced
- 5 ounces salad greens
- 1 quart strawberries hulled and quartered
- 1 granny smith apples medium, cored and cut into chunks
- 1/3 cup walnut pieces toasted
- 1/4 cup low-fat feta
- 2 tablespoons cider vinegar
- 2 tablespoons honey
- 1 tablespoon canola oil

Directions:
- In a non-stick skillet, lightly brown sausage slices, set aside.
- In a large salad bowl combine salad greens, strawberries, apple, walnuts, feta cheese and sausage.
- In a small bowl, combine cider vinegar, honey, and canola oil to make dressing; mix well. Pour over the salad and gently toss.

Creamed Corn Bisquits

Ingredients:
- 6 Tablespoons Butter
- 1-1/2 Cups Dry Buttermilk Baking Mix
- (8 1/2 Oz. Size) Can Creamed Corn

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 375*.
- Melt butter, and pour in a 10 x 15 x 1" baking sheet. Swirl pan around to evenly coat with melted butter.
- In a medium bowl, with a wooden spoon, mix together the baking mix and creamed corn.
- Drop by large teaspoonfuls onto pan, and turn each around with fingers in butter to coat.
- Bake about 15 minutes, or until golden. This makes 15-20 biscuits, depending on the size. You can make them larger, just be sure to adjust baking time.
- *Use a less expensive brand of creamed corn. The pieces will be smaller and will hold the biscuits together better.
- NOTE: These are amazing warmed in the microwave the next morning with a smear of apricot jam!

Zesty Bites 

Ingredients:
- 1 Pkg large soft flour tortillas
- i pkg cream cheese softened
- 1 pkg powdered hidden valley ranch dressing
- 1 pkg shredded cheddar cheese
- 1 can chopped black olives

Directions:
- Mix hidden valley ranch seasoning with cream cheese. Blend well. Spread evenly to cover entire tortilla. Sprinkle on cheese and olives.
- Roll into a roll. Cut into half inch slices.

Yum-A-Setta

Ingredients:
- 2 lb. hamburger
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1/4 onion, chopped
- 1 can tomato soup (undiluted)
- 1 can cream of chicken soup (undiluted)
- 1 pkg. 16 oz. egg noodles
- 1 (8 oz.) pkg. shredded cheese

Directions:
- Brown hamburger with salt, pepper and onion.
- Drain fat.
- Add tomato soup.
- Cook noodles; drain.
- Add chicken soup to noodles. Layer hamburger mixture and noodle mixture in large casserole with cheese between layers, ending with cheese on top.
- Bake at 350° for 1/2 hour.

Cranberry Salad

Ingredients:
- 2 c. raw cranberries, ground
- 1 orange rind, grated
- 1 c. sugar
- 1 small can crushed pineapple
- 3/4 c. celery, cut fine
- 2 (3 oz.) pkg. lemon jello
- 2 c. boiling water
- 1 c. cold water

Directions:
- Mix cranberries, orange rind, sugar, pineapple and celery together well.
- Mix jello, boiling water and cold water together. Allow jello mixture to jell slightly.
- Then add cranberry mixture. Refrigerate.

Pureed Watercress

Ingredients:
- 1 tablespoon salt
- 1 medium potato, cut into small cubes
- 4 bunches watercress (1-1 1/2 lbs)
- 4 tablespoons butter
- pepper

Directions:
- Bring a pot of water & salt to a boil. Add potato. Boil until very soft, about 20 minutes.
- Add watercres. When the water comes back to a boil, cook 1 minute.
- Drain & press down to get all the liquid out. puree in a food processor, add butter, puree again. Season to taste.

Cherry Delight

Ingredients:
- 1 can cherry pie filling
- 1 large can crushed pineapple
- 1 stick margarine
- 1 yellow cake mix
- 1 can coconut
- 1 c. pecans, chopped

Directions:
- Pour cherry pie filling in bottom of 9 x 13 x 2-inch casserole.
- Sprinkle cake mix over this.
- Melt butter and pour over cake mix.
- Top with coconut and pecans.
- Bake 1 hour at 325°

Taco Chicken Rice

Ingredients:
- 1 can white boneless chicken
- 1 lg. can chicken broth
- 1 can tomatoes, chopped
- onions, peppers to taste
- 1 can corn
- 1 pkg. taco seasoning
- 2 c. Minute rice
- shredded cheese
- nacho chips or tortilla shells

Directions:
- Mix first 6 ingredients.
- Bring to a boil, add rice, turn off heat, let sit 5 minutes, serve over chips or shells, top with cheese.

Celebration Granola

Ingredients:
- 6 cups old-fashioned oats
- 1 cup chopped pecans
- 1 cup chopped walnuts
- 1 cup toasted wheat germ
- 1-1/2 cups packed brown sugar
- 1/2 cup canola oil
- 1/2 cup maple syrup
- 1 cup dried cherries or cranberries
- 1 cup raisins

Directions:
- In a large bowl, combine the oats, nuts and wheat germ; set aside. In a small saucepan, combine the brown sugar, oil and syrup. Cook and stir over medium heat for 2-3 minutes or until heated through. Pour over oat mixture and toss to coat.
- Transfer to two greased 15x10x1-in. baking pans. Bake at 350° for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown, stirring once. Cool on wire racks.
- Sprinkle with cherries and raisins; toss to combine. Store in an airtight container.

Chicken Dressing

Ingredients:
- 1 can cream of chicken soup
- 1 c. sour cream
- 1 pkg. seasoned stuffing mix
- 1 stick margarine
- 1 1/2 c. chicken broth

Directions:
- Melt butter in broth.
- Add soup, then seasoned mix.
- Add chicken and sour cream.
