- Add broth to chicken; mix if too thick. Butter baking dish.
- Bake at 350° for 30 to 40 minutes.

Apple Dumplings

Ingredients:
- 4 c. flour
- 1 Tbsp. sugar
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 3/4 c. butter Crisco
- 1 egg, beaten
- 1 Tbsp. vinegar
- 2 c. brown sugar
- 2 c. water
- 1 Tbsp. margarine
- 1 tsp. cinnamon

Directions:
- Bring to a boil.
- Cover apples and bake until golden brown and apples are tender.

Cream Cheese Tarts

Ingredients:
- 2 lb. cream cheese
- 1 1/4 c. sugar
- 4 eggs
- 2 tsp. vanilla
- 1 can cherry pie filling (or any favorite pie filling)
- vanilla wafers

Directions:
- Mix cheese, sugar, eggs and vanilla.
- Line cupcake pans with baking cups. Place a vanilla wafer in bottom of each baking cup in pans.
- Pour cheese mixture on top.
- Add cherry filling.
- Bake 10 to 15 minutes at 375°.
- Chill before serving.

Leek Potato Pancakes

Ingredients:
- 1/2 pound russet potatoes, peeled and quartered (about 1 large)
- 2 pounds medium leeks (white portion only), thinly sliced
- 4 large eggs, lightly beaten
- 1/2 cup dry bread crumbs
- 1/3 cup grated Parmesan cheese
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon pepper
- 1/4 cup canola oil, divided
- 6 tablespoons sour cream

Directions:
- Place potato quarters in a large saucepan and cover with water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat; cover and cook for 15-20 minutes or until tender, adding leeks during the last 3 minutes. Drain.
- Transfer potato quarters to a large bowl; mash with eggs, bread crumbs, cheese, salt and pepper. Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour.
- Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a
- over medium heat. Drop batter by 1/4 cupfuls into oil. Fry in batches until golden brown on both sides, using remaining oil as needed. Drain on paper towels. Serve with sour cream.

Basic Marinated And Baked Tofu

Ingredients:
- 16 ounces tofu (not the silken kind)
- 1/4 cup soy sauce
- 2 tablespoons rice vinegar
- 2 tablespoons sesame oil

Directions:
- Wrap the tofu in paper towels and press under a heavy skillet for 15 minutes. If it's still pretty wet, replace the towels and press it again.
- Mix the soy sauce, vinegar, and oil in a container that is small but big enough for all the tofu.
- Cut the tofu in half inch slices and place in marinade.
- Turn it over after about 15 minutes.
- Preheat oven to 350°F.
- Wipe some of the oil from the marinade on your baking sheet.
- Arrange the tofu slices in one layer and bake for 15 minutes.
- Turn them over and bake another 15 minutes.

Crispy Bacon Potato Salad

Ingredients:
- 6 cups quartered Yukon gold potatoes
- 3/4 cup KRAFT Real Mayo Mayonnaise
- 1 Tbsp. GREY POUPON Dijon Mustard
- 8 slices OSCAR MAYER Bacon, cooked, crumbled
- 4 green onions, sliced
- 1/4 cup finely chopped fresh parsley

Directions:
- Cook potatoes in boiling water in saucepan 15 min.
- or just until tender; drain.
- Cool.
- Mix mayo and mustard in large bowl.
- Add potatoes and remaining ingredients; mix lightly.
- Refrigerate 1 hour.

Poppy Seed Dressing

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 c. sugar
- 2 tsp. dry mustard
- 2 tsp. salt
- 2 tsp. onion salt
- 2/3 c. wine vinegar
- 1 Tbsp. poppy seed

Directions:
- Combine and beat sugar, mustard, salt and wine vinegar.
- Add salad oil slowly, continuing beating.
- Last, add poppy seed and stir.
- Chill before serving.
- Makes 3 cups.

Chocolate Mushrooms

Ingredients:
- 3 egg whites
- 1/4 teaspoon cream of tartar
- 2/3 cup sugar
- 125 g baking chocolate
- 30 g Copha
- cocoa, for decorating

Directions:
- Line two baking sheets with greaseproof paper. Make a stiff meringue in the usual way with the egg whites, cream of tartar and the sugar.
- Use a piping bag and a plain 1cm nozzle pipe to make 24 rounds of meringue onto the baking paper sheets for the 'caps' of the mushrooms, and 24 oblonges approximately 4cm long for the 'stems' of the mushrooms.
- Bake at 110*C for approximately 1 hour, turn off oven and leave the meringues to cool.
- Melt the chocolate and copha together in a bowl over hot water. Carefully make a hole in the base of each mushroom cap for the stem. Spoon a little chocolate into each cap and place the stem into position. Leave on a cooling tray until the chocolate has hardened.
- Just before serving, sift a little cocoa over the mushrooms to give them an earthy look.

Vegan Cauliflower Buffalo Wings

Ingredients:
- 1 small cauliflower
- 1/2 cup chickpea flour
- 3 tablespoons rice flour
- 1/2 teaspoon red chili powder
- 2/3 cup buffalo wing hot sauce
- 1-2 scallions, sliced

Directions:
- Cut cauliflower into large "wing-size" florets
- Steam cauliflower for 8 minutes or until a fork can pierce it easily. Set aside to cool
- In a small bowl, mix together chickpea flour, rice flour, red chili powder, salt, and 3/4 cup of water. You want a batter a little looser than pancake batter. Add a tbsp of more of water if needed.
- Heat a pot of oil to 370 F. You need enough oil to submerge the entire cauliflower into the oil. Dip the cauliflower florets into the batter and shake off excess. Drop into the oil and fry for 4-5 minutes or until golden brown.
- Place the fried "wings" onto a paper towel to soak up excess oil.
- Add all the "wings" to a large bowl and toss with buffalo wing sauce. Garnish with scallions and serve right away. Enjoy!

Baked Caramel Corn

Ingredients:
- 6 qt. popped corn
- 1 c. butter or margarine
- 2 c. firmly packed brown sugar
- 1/2 c. light or dark corn syrup
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/2 tsp. baking soda
- 1 tsp. vanilla

Directions:
- Coat the bottom and sides of large roasting pan with nonstick vegetable spray.
- Place popped corn in roasting pan.
- In a heavy pan, slowly melt butter.
- Stir in brown sugar, corn syrup and salt.
- Bring to a boil, stirring constantly.
- Boil, without stirring, for 5 minutes.
- Remove from heat.
- Stir in soda and vanilla.
- Gradually pour over popped corn, mixing well.

Maple Roasted Bacon Wrapped Chicken And Vegetables

Ingredients:
- 8 chicken drumsticks
- 4 slices bacon cut in half
- 1 1/4 pounds yukon gold potatoes cut into bite-sized pieces
- 2 parsnips peeled and quartered
- 1 Granny Smith apple cored, cut into 8 wedges
- 1 onion peeled and cut into 8 wedges
- 3 sprigs fresh thyme
- 3 tablespoons butter melted
- 1/4 cup maple syrup
- 1 handful flat leaf parsley leaves fresh, roughly chopped

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 425°F. Wrap each chicken drumstick with half a slice of bacon, then place in a roasting pan.
- Place potatoes, parsnips, apple, onion and thyme in a large bowl and drizzle with butter and maple syrup. Season with salt and pepper and toss well to combine.
- Arrange vegetables around chicken on baking tray and pour over butter and maple syrup from bowl. Roast for 40 mins, or until chicken and vegetables are cooked through and golden.
- Remove from oven, sprinkle with parsley and serve.

Lulu'S Curry Sauce 

Ingredients:
- Vermont Curry Blocks
- 4-6 T curry powder
- Coconut milk
- green onion
- Thai Paste
- Chicken Stock
- Sugar
- Garlic
- Bay leaf
- Basil

Directions:
- Brown garlic and onion in oil. Saute powder. Pour in stock, cubes and rest of stuff. Simmer

Artichoke Dip

Ingredients:
- 1 c. mayonnaise
- 2 cans artichoke hearts (not marinated), chopped fine
- 1 c. Parmesan cheese
- 4 slices fried bacon, chopped fine

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients; put in casserole dish or glass pie pan. Bake
- at 350° for 45 minutes or until brown.
- Serve with sesame seed crackers or wheat thins.

Ten-Minute Taco Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 lb lean ground beef
- 1 garlic clove, minced
- 1 34 teaspoons chili powder
- 12 teaspoon salt
- 28 ounces lettuce, shredded
- 2 tomatoes, chopped
- 2 green peppers, chopped
- 1 cup low-fat sharp cheddar cheese or 1 cup monterey jack cheese, shredded
- 12 cup black olives, sliced
- 2 ounces tortilla chips, coarsely broken (aprox 2 cups)
- 34 cup ranch dressing
- 1 avocado, sliced
- 1 ounce unbroken tortilla chips, to garnish (12 chips)

Directions:
- In a nonstick skillet, over medium-high heat, brown ground beef with garlic, chili powder and salt, stirring occasionally (5 minutes); then drain off excess fat.
- In a large bowl, mix ground beef with lettuce, tomato, green pepper, cheese, olives, tortilla chips, and dressing (mix well).
- Serve hot or cover and refrigerate.
- Just before serving, garnish with avocado and tortilla chips.

Toffee

Ingredients:
- 1 c. sugar
- 1 c. dark corn syrup
- 1 c. whipping cream
- 1/2 c. chopped blanched almonds
- 1/4 tsp. baking powder

Directions:
- Combine sugar, syrup and cream in a heavy saucepan.
- Cook 50 minutes over low heat or until mixture forms a firm ball when a bit is dropped in ice water.
- Add almonds and baking powder, stirring to mix.
- Spoon into small candy cups.
- Let stand until firm.
- Store airtight in a cool place.

Chicken Continental

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 c. cooked, cut up chicken
- 1 (4 oz.) can mushrooms
- 1 garlic clove, crushed
- 2 Tbsp. oil
- 1 (13 3/4 oz.) can chicken broth or 2 chicken bouillon cubes and 1 1/2 c. water
- 1 (9 oz.) pkg. French-cut green beans
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/2 tsp. basil leaves
- dash of pepper
- 1 1/2 c. dry Minute rice

Directions:
- Saute chicken, mushrooms and garlic in oil, 2 to 3 minutes or until chicken is brown.
- Add remaining ingredients, except rice, and bring to a boil.
- Stir in rice; remove from heat.
- Cover and let stand 5 minutes or until rice is fluffy.
- Makes 4 servings.

Maple-Mustard Grilled Chicken

Ingredients:
- 1/2 cup Dijon mustard
- 1/4 cup maple syrup
- 2 tablespoons white vinegar
- 4 skinless chicken breast halves (6 ounce)
- vegetable oil cooking spray
- 1/2 teaspoon ground pepper
- 1/8 teaspoon salt

Directions:
- Combine mustard, maple syrup, and vinegar in a small bowl, stirring well; set aside.
- Coat chicken lightly with cooking spray; sprinkle with pepper and salt.
- Coat grill rack with cooking spray; place on grill over medium-hot coals (350-400 degrees).
- Place chicken on rack; grill, uncovered, 15 minutes, basting often with mustard mixture.
- Turn chicken, and grill 15 additional minutes or until meat thermometer inserted into thickest part of chicken registers 180 degrees, basting often with mustard mixture.

Penny Supper

Ingredients:
- 6 wieners, cooked and cut in slices
- 4 potatoes, cubed and cooked
- 2 Tbsp. onion, chopped
- 1 Tbsp. mustard
- 1 can mushroom soup

Directions:
- Mix ingredients together and place in casserole dish.
- Cover and bake 30 minutes at 350°.

Hungry Boy Cookies

Ingredients:
- 1 c. white sugar
- 1 c. brown sugar
- 2 sticks margarine, softened
- 2 eggs, at room temperature
- 2 c. all-purpose flour
- 1 tsp. baking powder
- 2 tsp. soda
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 c. coconut
- 3/4 c. chopped dates
- 1 c. chopped pecans
- 1 pkg. butterscotch or chocolate chips
- 1 c. raisins
- 2 c. oatmeal, uncooked
- 2 c. Rice Krispies

Directions:
- Cream sugars and margarine together.
- Add eggs.
- Beat until well mixed.
- Add flour, baking powder, soda and salt which have been sifted together.
- Mix well.
- Add coconut, dates, pecans, chips, raisins, uncooked oatmeal and Rice Krispies.
- Stir by hand until well mixed.

Tropical Tapioca

Ingredients:
- 1 (3 1/2 ounce) can coconut milk
- 2 1/2 cups whole milk (approximately)
- 3 tablespoons quick-cooking tapioca
- 1/3 cup granulated sugar
- 1 egg, lightly beaten
- sliced strawberry
- pineapple bits
- banana, sliced
- shredded coconut
- raisins

Directions:
- Shake can of coconut milk well. Pour coconut milk into a 1-quart measure. Add whole milk to make 3 cups. Pour milk into a saucepan and add tapioca, sugar and egg. Stir gently just to combine, then let set 5 minutes.
- Over medium heat, bring tapioca mixture slowly to a full boil, stirring constantly with a rubber or wooden spatula. At the boil, remove from heat. Fold in fruit of choice. Pour into ramekins, dessert bowls, or lidded containers. Cool 20 minutes.
- Stir tapioca well in each container, then chill. Tapioca will thicken as it cools.

Chicken Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 large whole chicken (4 1/2 to 5 pounds)
- 9 to 10 cups chicken broth or water
- 2 cups mayonnaise
- 1/2 cup sweet pickle relish
- 2 cups chopped apples
- 2 cups halved seedless red grapes
- 1 cup chopped pecans
- 8 hard-boiled eggs, chopped
- Salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste

Directions:
- Place the chicken and broth in a large pot, cover, and bring to a boil.
- Reduce the heat and simmer gently until the chicken is cooked through and the meat is ready to fall off the bone, about 45 minutes.
- Using tongs, transfer the chicken to a plate; set it aside until it is cool enough to handle.
- Then pull the meat from the bones in large pieces, discarding the skin and bones.
- In a large bowl, combine the chicken with the mayonnaise, relish, apples, grapes, pecans, and eggs.
- Season with salt and pepper.
- Mix well.
- Serve over greens or in a sandwich.

Dilly Cream Cheese In Pastry

Ingredients:
- 1 (10 ounce) can refrigerated crescent roll dough
- 1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese
- 1 tablespoon prepared horseradish, or to taste
- 1 teaspoon dill weed

Directions:
- Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a baking sheet.
- On a lightly floured surface, unroll the crescent roll dough into a rectangle, and press all of the seams together to make a single sheet. Spread horseradish over the top of the block of cream cheese, then sprinkle with enough dried dill to cover. Place the block of cream cheese dill side down in the center of the sheet of dough. Sprinkle the other side with enough dill to cover. Wrap the dough around the cheese like a present, and seal any openings. Place on the prepared baking sheet.
- Bake for about 20 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the pastry is golden brown. Serve warm.

Very Low Calorie Banana Bread

Ingredients:
- 2 mashed bananas
- 1 tablespoon unsweetened applesauce
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 12 cup Splenda sugar substitute
- 1 dash salt
- 1 teaspoon baking powder
- 2 egg whites
- 2 tablespoons nonfat milk
- 14 cup white flour
- 12 cup wheat flour

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350 and spray two mini-baking pans with non-stick cooking spray.
- Place all ingredients but flour in a medium-sized mixing bowl and gently mix by hand until smooth.
- Add in flour to wet ingredients.
- Cook about 20 minutes - or until golden brown.

Refried Bean Dip

Ingredients:
- 1 cup refried beans
- 12 cup salsa
- 6 slices bacon
- 12 cup chopped onion
- 12 cup sour cream
- 12 cup shredded cheese
- 1 tablespoon chili powder
- 14 teaspoon salt

Directions:
- Fry and crumble bacon.
- Saute onion in bacon grease until translucent.
- Mix all remaining ingredients with onion and desired amount of bacon grease.
- Serve warm or cold with tortilla chips.

Butter Cake

Ingredients:
- 3 sticks
- 3 c. sugar
- 5 eggs (extra large)
- 3 c. flour (regular)
- 1 tsp. salt
- 3 Tbsp. butternut flavor
- 1 small can condensed milk

Directions:
- Cream sugar and butter until it becomes light lemon in color. Add eggs one at a time and beat well.
- Add flavor and salt; mix well.
- Sift flour one time.
- Empty can of milk into measuring cup and add water to make one cup.
- Add flour and milk alternately. Pour into well-greased and floured tube pan.
- Bake in a 300° oven for 1 hour and 30 minutes.
- Start in cold oven.
- Time could vary depending on oven.

Spaghetti Slaw

Ingredients:
- 1 cup uncooked thin spaghetti, broken into small pieces
- 2 green onion, chopped
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 green pepper, diced
- 2 cups shredded cabbage
- 3/4 cup mayonnaise
- 2 Tbsp. sugar
- 1/8 cup milk or 2 Tbsp.

Directions:
- Cook spaghetti, drain and cool.
- Mix spaghetti, onion, salt, green pepper and cabbage in large bowl.
- Mix mayonnaise, sugar and milk to make dressing.
- Pour over spaghetti cabbage mixture and refrigerate until chilled.

Cake Batter Ice Cream

Ingredients:
- 1 cup milk
- 1/2 cup white sugar
- 2 egg yolks, beaten
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 2 cups heavy whipping cream
- 3/4 cup white cake mix, sifted

Directions:
- Whisk together milk, sugar, egg yolks, vanilla, cream, and cake mix in a saucepan until well blended. Cook over medium-low heat until mixture reaches 160 degrees F (70 degrees C), stirring frequently. Remove from heat and place in the refrigerator or freezer until liquid is cold.
- Pour the chilled mixture into an ice cream maker and freeze according to manufacturer's directions until it reaches "soft-serve" consistency. Transfer ice cream to a one- or two-quart lidded plastic container; cover surface with plastic wrap and seal. For best results, ice cream should ripen in the freezer for at least 2 hours or overnight.

15 Minute Beef Stroganoff

Ingredients:
- 2 lb. ground beef
- 2/3 c. water
- 1 can cream of chicken soup
- 1 envelope onion soup mix
- 1 c. sour cream
- 2 Tbsp. flour
- noodles or rice

Directions:
- Brown the meat.
- Add water and soups.
- Heat to boiling.
- Reduce heat.
- Blend sour cream and flour and add to the meat.
- Cook and stir until thick.
- Heat through, but do not boil.
- Serve over rice or noodles.

Smoky Bean Dip

Ingredients:
- 1 can bean with bacon soup
- 1 (5 oz.) jar cheese spread with bacon
- 1 1/2 tsp. liquid smoke
- 1/4 to 1/2 tsp. hot pepper sauce
- 1 (8 oz.) sour cream

Directions:
- Combine all ingredients in 1-quart casserole.
- Blend well. Heat on Full power for 4 to 6 minutes or until heated thoroughly. Stir 2 or 3 times during cooking time; serve warm.

Apple And Cheese Grills Recipe

Ingredients:
- 2 x Red dessert apples
- 4 x Thick slices wholemeal bread
- 150 gm Cheddar, Cheshire or possibly Emmental cheese, grated (5z)
- 25 gm Butter, softened (1oz)
- 1 tsp Paprika
- 8 x Sage leaves, finely minced

Directions:
- Preheat the grill to the highest setting.
- Cut the apples into quarters, core and slice finely.
- Toast the bread on one side under the grill.
- Butter the untoasted side of bread and arrange the apple slices on top then sprinkle with cheese and a healthy pinch of paprika.
- Grill for 2-3 min till the cheese melts and the apple cooks through.
- Sprinkle with sage before serving.
- NOTES : A quick and tasty snack.

Chili For 100(Approximately 16 Gallons)  

Ingredients:
- 20 onions, chopped
- 2 1/2 boxes garlic
- 35 lb. ground meat
- 4 gal. tomatoes
- 1 gal. tomato soup
- salt to taste
- 5 gal. Ranch beans
- 24 cans refried beans
- 2 (13 oz.) cans chili powder
- 1 box comino
- 10 pkg. onion soup
- 6 chopped jalapenos

Directions:
- Brown meat and drain.
- Saute onions and garlic.
- Add all ingredients.
- Simmer all afternoon.

Seven Layer Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 c. shredded lettuce
- 1 c. chopped bell pepper
- 1 c. diced celery
- 1 c. chopped green onion
- 1 c. English peas
- 1 c. diced ham
- 1 c. mild Cheddar cheese, shredded
- 1 c. mayonnaise
- 2 tsp. sugar
- 2 tsp. vinegar

Directions:
- Layer first five ingredients in order given.
- Add layer of diced ham and cheese.
- Add sugar and vinegar to mayonnaise and mix thoroughly.
- Spread over cheese and refrigerate overnight before serving.

Hot Punch

Ingredients:
- 4 c. pineapple juice
- 1 can apricots, pureed
- 1 c. orange juice
- 4 c. apple juice
- 6 cinnamon sticks
- 1 tsp. whole cloves
- 1/2 tsp. cardamom

Directions:
- Put cinnamon, cloves and cardamom in basket of percolator and perk liquid mixture.
- Makes 15 (6-ounce) servings.

Baked Chicken Parmesan

Ingredients:
- 1 cup corn flakes, crushed
- 1/4 cup KRAFT Grated Parmesan Cheese
- 1/8 tsp. pepper
- 1 broiler-fryer chicken (3 lb.), cut up, skinned Safeway 1 lb For $1.99 thru 02/09
- 1/4 cup KRAFT Real Mayo Mayonnaise

Directions:
- Heat oven to 350F.
- Mix crushed corn flakes, cheese and pepper.
- Brush chicken with mayo; sprinkle with crumb mixture.
- Place in 13x9-inch baking dish sprayed with cooking spray.
- Bake 1 hour or until chicken is done (165F).

Taste Of Asia Honey Lime Chicken Wings

Ingredients:
- 10 Tyson(R) Fresh Chicken Wings
- 1/4 cup green onion chopped
- 3 tablespoons soy sauce
- 3 tablespoons lime juice
- 3 tablespoons honey
- 2 teaspoons dark sesame oil
- 1 1/2 teaspoons lime peel grated
- 1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes crushed
- 1 gingerroot 1-inch fresh piece, peeled
- 2 cloves garlic

Directions:
- Cut off wing tips; discard. Cut remaining wing into two parts at joint.
- In blender or food processor, combine all ingredients except chicken. Process until smooth. Place marinade and chicken pieces into a resealable plastic bag. Refrigerate 8 hours.
- Preheat oven to 425°F. Spray baking dish with nonstick cooking spray or line with aluminum foil. Add chicken; brush generously with marinade. Discard remaining marinade.
- Bake wings, turning once, 30 to 40 minutes or until done (internal temp 180°F) and a deep golden brown.

Chicken Piquant

Ingredients:
- chicken parts (for 4 people)
- 1 lb. fresh mushrooms, sliced
- 3/4 c. Rose wine
- 1/4 c. soy sauce
- 2 Tbsp. brown sugar
- 4 Tbsp. water
- 2 Tbsp. cornstarch
- 1 garlic clove, crushed
- 1/4 tsp. oregano

Directions:
- Place sliced mushrooms in the bottom of a casserole.
- Top with chicken parts; mix water and cornstarch.
- Combine with all other ingredients and pour over chicken.
- Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 1 1/2 hours.
- Serve with rice.

Spiced Lamb  With Coriander Pumpkin (21 Day Wonder Diet: Day 1 )

Ingredients:
- 200 g butternut pumpkin, peeled and cut into 1cm pieces
- 125 g chickpeas, rinsed and drained
- 1/2 cup frozen baby peas
- 2 tablespoons fresh coriander leaves
- 4 french-trimmed lamb cutlets
- 2 teaspoons curry powder
- cooking spray
- 1/3 cup light coconut milk
- 2 tablespoons chicken stock
- 1 garlic clove, crushed

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 200C/180C fan-forced.
- Roast pumpkin in small, shallow baking dish, uncovered, 10 minutes. add chickpeas and peas; cook uncovered, about 5 minutes or until pumpkn is tender. Remove from oven; sprinkle with coriander.
- Meanwhile, sprinkle lamb with curry powder. Spray lamb with cooking oil. Cook lamb in heated medium frying an; remove from pan.
- Add coconut milk, stock and garlic to same pan, bring to the boil, stirring; remove from heat.
- Serve pumpkin mixture and lamb drizzled with coconut sauce.

Mombasa Coffee

Ingredients:
- 3 cardamom pods, unhusked
- 2 cinnamon sticks
- 4 whole cloves
- 2 cups water
- 5 teaspoons coffee, freshly ground

Directions:
- Boil the cardamom, cinnamon, and cloves in the water in a pot for 10 minutes.
- Add the coffee and boil 5 minutes longer.
- Pour into a serving pot, but do not strain the spices.
- Allow to stand until the grounds settle, then pour into small cups.
- *You can also make this by adding the whole spices and coffee to the basket of an automatic coffee brewer.

Monkey Bread

Ingredients:
- 2/3 c. sugar
- 2 tsp. cinnamon, divided
- 4 cans biscuits, each cut in quarters
- 1 c. chopped nuts
- 1 c. brown sugar
- 1/2 c. butter

Directions:
- Combine sugar and 1 teaspoon cinnamon in a plastic bag.
- Shake biscuit quarters in sugar to coat.
- Drop biscuits in a greased tube pan.
- Sprinkle layers with nuts.
- Combine brown sugar, 1 teaspoon cinnamon and butter in a saucepan and bring to a boil over medium heat.
- Pour over biscuits.
- Bake at 350° for 40 to 45 minutes. Turn out on a plate.
- Serve warm.

Cream Pound Cake

Ingredients:
- 3 c. sugar
- 1/2 pt. whipping cream
- 1 c. pure butter
- 3 c. Swans Down cake flour
- 6 eggs
- 2 tsp. "pure" vanilla

Directions:
- Cream butter and sugar; add eggs, one at a time, alternating with flour.
- Add whipping cream and vanilla; blend well.
- Pour into greased and floured tube pan and place in cold oven.
- Set temperature at 325° and bake 1 hour and 25 minutes.
- Do not open the door while baking.

Stacy's Peanut Butter Pie

Ingredients:
- 8 oz Cream Cheese, softened
- 1/4 cup Granulated Sugar
- 1/4 cup Peanut Butter, Creamy
- 1 packages Cool Whip
- 1 Oreo Pie Shell
- 1/2 cup Milk Chocolate Chips (I use Ghiradelli)

Directions:
- Beat sugar, cream cheese and peanut butter till well combined.
- Fold in Cool Whip.
- Pour into Oreo pie shell and smooth out.
- Sprinkle top with chocolate chips.
- Cover and refrigerate for 3-4 hours.
- Serve.

How to Cook Quinoa

Ingredients:
- 1 cup uncooked quinoa (rinsed if you prefer)
- 2 cup water or stock
- 1/2 tsp salt, if preferred

Directions:
- Combine uncooked quinoa, water, and salt in a medium saucepan.
- Bring to a boil, cover, decrease the heat, and simmer for 25 to 30 minutes, until the quinoa is tender and you can see the little quinoa "curlicues."
- Cooked quinoa stays fresh for up to 6-7 days in the refrigerator or 8 months in the freezer.
- 1 cup dry yields about 3 cups cooked.

Make Ahead Salad

Ingredients:
- 20 oz. pkg. frozen mixed vegetables
- 1 c. vinegar
- 1 c. sugar
- 1/2 c. salad oil
- 1 c. chopped celery
- 1 c. chopped onions
- 1 c. red and green peppers or pimentos

Directions:
- Cook vegetables as directed on package; drain well.
- Combine only vinegar, sugar and salad oil, boil 5 minutes.
- While vegetables and dressing are still hot, pour over drained vegetables.
- Let cool, then add remaining ingredients.
- Cover and refrigerate.
- Must be made several days before serving.

Scallop Stew

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. scallops
- 1 onion, chopped
- 1 can evaporated milk
- 1 qt. milk
- 2 Tbsp. margarine
- 1/2 tsp. garlic powder
- 1 tsp. Worcestershire sauce
- 1/8 tsp. sugar
- 1/8 tsp. pepper

Directions:
- Saute onions, sprinkled with garlic, in butter.
- Remove from pan.
- Saute scallops in same butter, sprinkled with Worcestershire sauce and sugar.
- Mix onion, scallops and two milks and heat slowly.
- Add pepper and a pat of butter.

Asparagus Pasta Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. fresh asparagus, cut into 3/4-inch pieces
- 2 c. small seashell pasta
- 1/4 c. buttermilk
- 3 Tbsp. lemon juice
- 2 Tbsp. olive oil
- 1 Tbsp. Dijon mustard
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. dried basil, crushed
- 1/8 tsp. pepper

Directions:
- Steam asparagus 4 to 6 minutes.
- Cool, drain and reserve. Cook pasta; drain, rinse and drain.
- Cool.

Cheese-Sausage Balls

Ingredients:
- 3 c. Bisquick
- 1 lb. hot sausage
- 10 oz. sharp cheese, room temperature, grated

Directions:
- Mix all 3 ingredients well into a large ball.
- Pinch off into small balls.
- Bake on ungreased cookie sheet for 12 to 15 minutes at 350°.
- Makes 125 to 175 balls.
- (Mix may be frozen before cooked and stored until needed.)

Merry Vanilla Birthday Cake!

Ingredients:
- 2 1/2 cups cake flour
- 3/4 cup all purpose flour
- 1 tablespoon baking powder
- 1 teaspoon baking soda
- 3/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 stick unsalted butter softened
- 1/2 cup vegetable shortening
- 1 3/4 cups sugar
- 1 tablespoon vanilla extract
- 1 large egg
- 1 1/2 cups ice water
- 3 large egg whites
- 1/4 teaspoon cream of tartar

Directions:
- Read up on http://bit.ly/1ENzOtI

Grilled Portabellos 

Ingredients:
- Portobello muschrooms
- Kosher salt
- Extra virgin olive oil

Directions:
- Slice portobellos into strips. Coat with olive oil and a sprinkling of salt. Take a piece of tinfoil and poke small holes in it for drainage. Place the tinfoil on your grill, then put the mushrooms on top, bending the foil slightly around them. Let them steam/grill for about five minutes. Serve as a side for steak, burgers or just about anything!

Karmen's Hot Cheese Dip Recipe

Ingredients:
- 2 and 1/2 c. Velveeta cheese
- 1/2 c. lowfat milk
- 16 ounce of salsa

Directions:
- Pour lowfat milk and cheese into saucepan.
- Let it heat over medium-low heat.
- Stir in salsa till well combined.
- Season to taste with garlic or possibly onion pwdr, or possibly a healthy pinch of cayenne pepper, if you like.
- Enjoy!

Apple Bundt Cake

Ingredients:
- 3 Cups Flour
- 2 Cups Sugar
- 1 1/2 tsp. Baking Soda
- 1 tsp. Salt
- 2 Eggs
- 1 1/2 Vegetable Oil
- 2 tsp. Vanilla
- Juice of one Lemon
- 3 Cups Peeled and Chopped Apples
- 1 1/2 Cups Broken Pecans
- 1/4 Cup Confectioners Sugar
- Pecans

Directions:
- Mix flour, sugar, baking soda and salt.
- Set aside.
- In a large bowl, beat eggs until light.
- Add oil, vanilla and lemon juice.
- Add flour mixture until well blended.
- Fold in apples and pecans.
- Pour into greased Bundt pan.
- Bake at 375 for 1 hour. Sprinkle with confectioners sugar.

Holiday Boil(To Give A Holiday Aroma To Your House)  

Ingredients:
- 1 qt. pineapple juice
- 1 qt. water
- 1 qt. apple cider
- 3-4 cinnamon sticks
- 16 whole cloves
- 1/2 tsp. allspice
- 4 tsp. ground ginger

Directions:
- Combine all ingredients in a stainless steel pan and bring to a boil.
- Reduce heat and simmer for several hours.
- Cover and leave on stove.
- Reheat and simmer each day during the holidays.

Stir-Fry(Low-Fat)  

Ingredients:
- 2/3 lb. chicken breast or lean pork, cut into 1-inch pieces
- 1 tsp. olive oil, divided or olive oil Pam
- 3 c. sliced raw vegetables such as carrots, celery, onion, green pepper, water chestnuts, sugar snap peas and/or mushrooms
- 1/2 to 3/4 tsp. Spice Mixture (follows)
- 1 Tbsp. brown sugar
- 1 Tbsp. light soy sauce

Directions:
- Coat stir-fry pan or large frying pan with 1/2 teaspoon of oil or Pam.
- Stir-fry meat over medium heat until done.
- Remove meat to platter.
- Add remaining oil.
- Stir-fry sliced vegetables for about 2 minutes.
- Add spices and brown sugar.
- Toss to coat vegetables.
- Cook for another 2 minutes.
- Add soy sauce and return meat to pan.
- Cook all ingredients one more minute, tossing frequently.
- Serves 2.

Moroccan Chicken

Ingredients:
- 12 oz. cubed boneless, skinless chicken breasts
- 1 large onion, chopped
- 1 clove garlic, minced
- 1 c. defatted reduced sodium chicken broth
- 1 (16 oz.) can reduced sodium tomatoes (with juice)
- 1 (15 oz.) can chick peas, rinsed and drained
- 1/2 c. raisins
- 3 Tbsp. chopped fresh parsley
- 1 tsp. dried thyme leaves
- 1 tsp. ground cumin
- 1/4 tsp. ground cinnamon
- freshly ground black pepper
- salt (optional)
- 3 c. hot cooked rice

Directions:
- Raisins and onions add a bit of sweetness to this mix of flavors and textures.

Cranegranate Sauce

Ingredients:
- 1 cup Cranberries
- 1/2 cup Pomegranates
- 1/4 cup Sugar
- 1/4 teaspoon Cinnamon
- 1/8 teaspoon Nutmeg
- 1/2 cup Water

Directions:
- Throw all your ingredients in a pot.
- Bring it to a boil, then turn it down to medium and let it cook for about 5 min.
- Remove it from the heat, pop it in the fridge, and let it chill down for at least 3-4 hours.

Macaroni And Cheese

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 c. macaroni
- 1 1/2 c. chopped onion
- 2 eggs, slightly beaten
- 1 1/2 c. grated cheese
- 1/4 c. margarine
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/8 tsp. pepper
- 1/2 tsp. paprika
- 2 c. milk

Directions:
- Cook macaroni until about 1/2 done.
- Drain.
- Add the other ingredients and mix well (except paprika).
- Bake 50 minutes at 350°.
- Remove from oven; sprinkle paprika on top and return to oven for 10 more minutes to brown.

Crock-Pot Cube Steak

Ingredients:
- 4 large pieces cube steak
- flour
- salt and pepper
- 1 c. milk
- 1 c. water
- 1/4 c. Wesson oil

Directions:
- In a frying pan, heat Wesson oil, flour, salt and pepper cube steak.
- Brown lightly on both sides.
- Don't cook.
- Cut large pieces in half.
- Put cube steak in crock-pot.
- Sprinkle flour in pan with drippings.
- Brown well.
- Add milk and water, stirring constantly. Bring to a boil.
- Pour over cube steak in crock-pot.
- Cook on low 2 1/2 to 3 hours.
- Tender melt in your mouth.

Apple Fritters

Ingredients:
- 2 c. sifted flour
- 3 tsp. baking powder
- 1 tsp. salt
- 2 Tbsp. sugar
- 2 eggs, beaten
- 1 c. milk
- 1 Tbsp. fat melted
- 1 c. apple pulp
- oil for frying

Directions:
- Sift dry ingredients together. Combine the beaten eggs, milk and melted fat. Add gradually to dry ingredients, stirring only until batter is smooth. Add fruit pulp and drop by spoonfuls into oil heated 365° to 370°. Remove when light brown on both sides (need to flip) about 2 minutes. Drain on absorbent paper. Sprinkle with powdered sugar.

Sweet Pastry Dough

Ingredients:
- 1 stick (1/2 cup) cold unsalted butter
- 1 1/3 cups all-purpose flour
- 2 tablespoons sugar
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1 large egg yolk
- 1 1/2 tablespoons ice water

Directions:
- Cut butter into 1/2-inch cubes.
- In a bowl with your fingertips or a pastry blender blend together flour, sugar, salt, and butter until most of mixture resembles coarse meal with remainder in small (roughly pea-size) lumps.
- In a small bowl or cup stir together yolk and ice water.
- Drizzle yolk mixture over flour mixture, stirring gently with a fork until incorporated, and gently form mixture into a ball.
- Turn mixture out onto a floured work surface and divide into 4 portions.
- With heel of hand smear each portion once in a forward motion to help distribute fat.
- Gather dough together and form it, rotating on work surface, into a disk.
- Chill dough, wrapped in plastic wrap, until firm, at least 1 hour, and up to 1 day.

Randis Chicken

Ingredients:
- 21 ounces, weight Cream Of Chicken Soup (or 1 Large Family Sized Can)
- 9 ounces, weight Sour Cream
- 3 ounces, weight Dried Beef (Found On The Canned Tuna Isle)
- 1 pound Boneless, Skinless Chicken Breasts
- 1/4 cups Bacon Bits Or Pieces

Directions:
- 1.
- In a medium bowl, stir cream of chicken soup and sour cream together until all one color.
- 2.
- Cut dried beef into 1/2 inch squares.
- Sprinkle them into the bottom of a 9x13 baking dish.
- 3.
- Lay chicken breasts evenly over the dried beef.
- 4.
- Sprinkle the bacon bits over the chicken.
- You can add more if you want to.
- 5.
- Pour sour cream mixture over the chicken.
- Make sure chicken is completely covered.
- 6.
- Bake at 250 degrees F for 3 hours.
- 7.
- Serve over brown or white rice.

Crock Pot Magic Venison Meat Loaf

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 pounds ground venison
- 1/4 c. milk
- 2 slices bread crumbled
- 2 Tbsp chopped green pepper
- 4 to 6 potatoes, cut up
- 1 egg, beaten
- 1 1/2 tsp salt
- 1/2 small onion chopped
- 2 Tbsp celery, chopped
- catsup

Directions:
- Mix the egg, milk, salt and bread crumbs and allow to soften. Thoroughly combine with ground venison and chopped vegetables. Shape into a loaf and place into crock pot.
- Top with catsup and green pepper rings.
- Place potatoes along side of the loaf.
- (If potatoes are peeled, coat them with butter.)
- Cover and set on high for 1 hour.
- Turn down to low for 8 to 9 hours.
- This may be doubled for 5 quart crock pots.

Olive Garden Risotto Milanese

Ingredients:
- 14 cup olive oil
- 12 cup yellow onion, minced
- 1 12 cups arborio rice
- 12 cup white wine
- 5 cups chicken broth or 5 cups vegetable broth
- 12 teaspoon saffron thread
- 2 tablespoons butter
- 12 cup parmesan cheese
- salt & pepper, to taste

Directions:
- In a saucepan, heat oil until fragrant.
- Add onions and saffron and saute 3 minutes or until onions are soft.
- Keep broth warm in a separate pot.
- Add rice to the onions and stir for 2 minutes.
- Add white wine and let evaporate.
- Add the broth, about 1/2 cup at a time, stirring frequently.
- Wait until each addition is almost completely absorbed by the rice.
- Continue to add until all of the broth has been used.
- Turn off heat.
- Add butter and Parmesan cheese.
- Stir to combine with rice/risotto.
- Transfer to large bowl and garnish with parsley.
- Serve immediately.
- Finished risotto should be creamy and rice is firm.

Tuna Steaks With Chilli Edamame

Ingredients:
- 2 tuna steaks
- 1 teaspoon oil
- 210 g edamame beans
- 1 lime
- 1 chili
- noodles

Directions:
- Brush the tuna with a little oil on each side and season well.
- Griddle (make sure it is really hot before you start cooking and don't add any more oil other than what you have brushed the tuna with) or grill under a hot grill for 2-3 minutes on each side or until just cooked through.
- Squeeze over half the lime.
- Tip the edamame salad into a bowl, add the chilli and squeeze over the rest of the lime.
- Season.
- Serve with the tuna and some rice noodles.

Apple Cake

Ingredients:
- 4 c. finely diced cooking apples
- 2 c. sugar
- 2 eggs
- 1/2 c. vegetable oil
- 2 tsp. vanilla
- 2 c. sifted flour
- 2 tsp. baking soda
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 2 tsp. cinnamon
- 1 c. chopped nuts

Directions:
- Combine apples and sugar; let stand 1/2 hour.
- Beat eggs slightly; beat in oil and vanilla.
- Sift flour, baking soda, salt and cinnamon together.
- Stir in alternately with apple sugar mixture.
- Stir in walnuts.
- Pour into greased and floured 9 x 13-inch pan.
- Bake at 350° for 1 hour.
- Cool.

Hirame With Spicy Cucumber Vinaigrette

Ingredients:
- 2 Japanese cucumbers or 1 small cucumber, sliced lengthwise and seeded
- 2 to 3 jalapenos, stems and seeds removed
- Salt
- 1/4 cup rice vinegar
- 1/4 cup nam pla fish sauce
- 4 ounces hirame fluke fillet, skinned and boned (flounder or sole may be substituted)
- Lime, cut into wedges
- Cilantro sprigs, for garnish

Directions:
- In a food processor, pulse together 1 Japanese cucumber (or half of a small cucumber), the jalapenos and 1/2 teaspoon salt until finely chopped.
- Transfer to a bowl, stir in the rice vinegar and fish sauce and set aside.
- Thinly slice the remaining cucumber into 1/8-by-1/8-by-1-inch sticks.
- Using a very sharp knife with the blade lying flat, horizontally slice the fluke as thinly as possible.
- Stack 5 or 6 cucumber sticks and wrap with a slice of fish.
- Place 4 fish wraps on each of 4 plates.
- Spoon the dressing over the fish, sprinkle with lime juice and garnish with cilantro.

Chicken And Tomato Pizza

Ingredients:
- 1 tbsp oil
- 2/3 lb chicken breast, cut into bite-sized pieces
- 1/2 lb mozzarella cheese, sliced
- 3 tbsp store-bought pesto
- 1 None large pizza dough base
- 2/3 cup tomato sauce
- 8 None tomatoes, sliced
- None None fresh basil leaves, for garnish

Directions:
- Preheat the oven to 400°F. Heat the oil in a pan and sear the chicken on all sides. Season then remove from the pan.
- Brush the mozzarella with the pesto. Place the pizza dough base on a baking sheet and spread with the tomato sauce. Season. Arrange the chicken, mozzarella and tomatoes over the top. Bake for 20 mins, until golden and bubbling. Garnish with basil leaves.

Chocolate Zucchini Cake

Ingredients:
- 3 sq. chocolate
- 3 c. flour
- 1 1/2 tsp. baking powder
- 1 tsp. baking soda
- 1 tsp. salt
- 4 eggs
- 3 c. sugar
- 1 1/2 c. salad oil
- 3 c. finely grated zucchini
- 1 c. chopped nuts

Directions:
- Melt the chocolate in double boiler.
- Sift the flour, salt, baking powder and soda.
- Beat the eggs and gradually add sugar; beat well.
- Add oil and chocolate; beat until well blended.
- Add sifted dry ingredients and beat until smooth.
- Stir in zucchini and nuts.
- Pour in greased and floured tube pan.
- Bake at 350° for 1 hour and 15 minutes.

Meat Phyllo Rolls

Ingredients:
- 2 lbs hamburger
- 1/2 cup red wine
- 1 cup raisins
- 1/2 cup pine nuts
- 2 teaspoons cinnamon
- 1 teaspoon nutmeg
- butter, for phyllo dough
- 1 lb phyllo dough

Directions:
- Saute hamburger until brown.
- Add wine,raisins, pine nuts,and spices.
- Stir until liquid is absorbed.
- Cool.
- Cut phyllo into 3 strips.
- Butter the phyllo.
- Place 1 tbsp of filling at the base.
- Tuck each side in about 1/2 inch.
- Roll up.
- It should look like a sleeping bag.
- Brush the top with butter.
- They can be frozen at this point.
- Place seam side down on a cookie sheet.
- Bake at 375* until golden (25 minutes).
- 45 minutes if frozen.

Cranberry Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 pkg. cranberries
- 2 oranges, peeled
- 2 apples, cored
- 1 c. celery
- 1 c. nuts
- 2 c. sugar
- 1 large box raspberry jello
- 2 c. hot water

Directions:
- Add jello to hot water.
- Grind all ingredients.
- Add sugar. Mix all together.
- Pour in dish and chill until firm.

Amish Pudding

Ingredients:
- 1/2 lb. dates
- 1 tsp. soda
- 1 c. boiling water
- 2 eggs
- 1 c. sugar
- 2 Tbsp. shortening
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 2 c. sifted flour
- 1 tsp. baking powder
- 1 c. chopped nuts

Directions:
- Combine dates, soda and boiling water and let cool.
- Beat eggs, sugar, shortening, salt, flour and baking powder.
- Combine with date mixture and fold in nuts.
- Bake in a greased 9 x 13-inch pan at 325° for 35 to 40 minutes.

Carrot Jello Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 pkg. orange Jell-O
- 1 small can crushed pineapple, well drained
- 3 carrots, finely grated

Directions:
- Mix Jell-O as directed on package and set aside.
- Add carrots and pineapple to Jell-O.
- Pour into salad bowl and chill until firm, then serve.

Italian Vegetable Pizzas

Ingredients:
- 1 (10 oz.) pkg. frozen Italian style vegetables in seasoned sauce
- 2 Tbsp. grated Parmesan cheese
- 4 English muffins, split and toasted
- 1/2 c. pizza sauce
- 1 c. shredded Mozzarella cheese

Directions:
- Prepare vegetables according to package directions, omitting water.
- Stir in Parmesan cheese.
- Spread pizza sauce on each muffin half.
- Top with vegetable mixture and Mozzarella cheese. Broil to melt cheese or microwave on High (100%) for 2 minutes. Makes 4 servings.

Bahamian Macaroni And Cheese

Ingredients:
- 8 ounces elbow macaroni, cooked & drained
- 1 tablespoon finely chopped onion
- 1 tablespoon finely chopped green pepper
- 1 tablespoon finely chopped celery
- 6 ounces cheddar cheese, grated
- salt & pepper
- 1 tablespoon evaporated milk

Directions:
- Add the onion, green pepper and celery to the cooked macaroni; stir.
- Add 1/2 of the cheese & stir over low heat until melted.
- Season & stir in evaporated milk.
- Spoon into well-greased 8x8x2" baking pan & sprinkle remaining cheese evenly over top.
- Bake in a preheated oven at 350° for 20 minutes.
- Let stand for 10 minutes and cut into squares to serve.

Strawberry Glaze Pie

Ingredients:
- 3 Tbsp. cornstarch
- 2 Tbsp. corn syrup
- 2 Tbsp. strawberry Jell-O
- 1 c. sugar
- 1 c. cold water

Directions:
- Cook first four ingredients until thick.
- Add Jell-O and cool. Pour over strawberries that have been placed in a baked pie shell.

Ritz® Cookies

Ingredients:
- 1 cup white sugar
- 3 egg whites
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 20 buttery round crackers
- 1 cup chopped pecans

Directions:
- Crumble crackers finely in mixing bowl and add pecans. In another bowl, add 1/2 cup sugar to beaten egg whites slowly and beat until very stiff. Add remaining 1/2 cup sugar slowly. Add vanilla. Fold this mixture into crackers and nuts.
- Spoon onto lightly greased cookie sheet and bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) until light brown.

Tinklee's Baked Chicken, Potatoes and Carrots All-In-One Dish

Ingredients:
- 6 medium potatoes
- 1/2 lb baby carrots
- 8 whole mushrooms
- 2 boneless chicken breasts
- 1 envelope Lipton's secrets savoury herb with garlic
- 2 tbsp oil

Directions:
- heat oven to 400F.
- Spray a baking sheet that has a edge at least 1" high ( you need space to spread the food out flat)
- peel and cut potatoes into bite size pieces and put in the pan
- cut baby cuts in half and add to pan with potatoes
- quarter mushrooms and add to pan with the potatoes and carrots
- cut up chicken breasts into bite size pieces and add to the veggies
- add oil and mix around everything
- now add the seasoning packet and remix (I mix with the oil first, so this way the seasoning will coat better)
- make sure it is spread out as flat as it can be, but don't leave gaps
- bake for 35-45 mins,
- April 2013

Dad's Blonde Brownies

Ingredients:
- 1 stick butter, melted
- 2 eggs
- 1 tsp. baking powder
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1-1/2 cup flour
- 1 cup sugar
- 1/2 cup brown sugar
- 1/2 cup chopped nuts
- 2 tbsp. melted butter
- 2 cups powdered sugar
- 1/4 tsp. vanilla
- 3 tbsp. milk (or to desired consitency)

Directions:
- Combine ingredients and place in greased 9x13 baking dish.
- Bake at 350F for 1 hour.
- After cooled, spread frosting over top equally.
- Cut into square bars and serve.

Tasty Cornbread Taco Bake

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 lbs ground beef, cooked and drained
- 1/4 cup of chopped onion
- 1 (8 ounce) can tomato sauce
- 1 (15 ounce) can whole kernel corn, drained
- 1/2 cup water
- 3 tablespoons taco seasoning (1 package)
- 1 (8 ounce) package cornbread mix
- 1/3 cup shredded sharp cheddar cheese or 1/3 cup shredded Mexican blend cheese

Directions:
- After cooking and draining the ground beef, add the onions, tomato sauce, corn, water, and taco seasoning.
- Spoon into a greased 2 1/2 quart baking dish.
- Prepare the corn bread according to the package directions. Pour over the beef mixture.
- Bake uncovered at 400 degrees for 20 minutes or until the cornbread is done.
- Top with cheese and bake 5 more minutes to melt the cheese.
- Enjoy!

Dead Eds Dip

Ingredients:
- 3/4 cups Cider Vinegar
- 1 Tablespoon Water
- 1 Tablespoon Salt
- 1/2 teaspoons Pepper
- 1 cup Sugar
- 1 can (15 Oz. Can) Kernel Corn
- 1 can (15 Oz. Can) Pinto Beans
- 2 cans (15 Oz. Can) Black Eyed Peas
- 1 whole Red Onion
- 1 whole Yellow Pepper
- 1 whole Red Pepper
- 1 whole Green Pepper
- 1 jar (small 4 Oz. Jar) Pimentos
- 1/4 cups Olive Oil

Directions:
- Boil and cool the cider vinegar, water, salt, pepper, and sugar (you can use Splenda, if desired).
- Rinse and drain the corn, pinto beans, and black-eyed peas.
- Chop the red onion and yellow, red, and green peppers.
- Mix all and add the pimentos and olive oil.
- Mix and marinate overnight.
- Serve with tortilla chips.

No Peek Chicken

Ingredients:
- 1 can cream of mushroom soup
- 1 can cream of chicken soup
- 1 can water
- 1 Tbsp. parsley
- 3/4 c. uncooked rice
- 1 fryer chicken, cut up
- 1 envelope Lipton onion soup

Directions:
- Mix together cream of mushroom soup, cream of chicken soup, water, parsley and rice.
- Pour into 9 x 13-inch pan.
- Arrange pieces of chicken on top of mixture. Sprinkle onion soup over top and cover with foil.
- Bake at 350° for 2 hours.
- Do not peek, it will be done at that time.

All Natural Cough Syrup(Good For Sore Throat)  

Ingredients:
- 2 lemons
- honey
- 5 peppermint balls
- antiseptic, small amount

Directions:
- Mix all together.
- Shake well.
- Take one swallow at night.

Mary'S Turkey

Ingredients:
- turkey
- Duke's mayonnaise
- cream of mushroom soup
- 1 c. water
- black pepper
- salt

Directions:
- Boil chicken in water until tender, but does not fall off the bone.
- Remove from water and cover with your choice of barbecue sauce.
- Let stand in refrigerator for 3 to 4 hours or overnight. Place on grill and finish cooking, turning several times.

Longhorn Iced Tea

Ingredients:
- Ice
- 3/4 ounce reposado tequila
- 3/4 ounce light rum
- 3/4 ounce vodka
- 3/4 ounce triple sec
- 2 ounces fresh orange juice
- 1 ounce fresh lime juice
- 1 ounce Simple Syrup
- 1 1/2 teaspoons grenadine
- 1 lime wheel

Directions:
- Fill a pint glass with ice.
- Add the tequila, light rum, vodka and triple sec to the pint glass and stir well.
- Add the fresh orange juice, fresh lime juice and Simple Syrup and stir again.
- Top the cocktail with the grenadine and garnish with the lime wheel.

Tomato Soup French Dressing

Ingredients:
- 2 Tbsp. sugar
- 2 tsp. dry mustard
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/2 tsp. pepper
- 1 can tomato soup
- 1/2 soup can vinegar
- 1/2 can oil
- 2 Tbsp. onion

Directions:
- Makes about 3 cups.

Beef-And-Veggie Stew

Ingredients:
- Cooking spray
- 2 pounds beef round, cut in 1-inch cubes, and seasoned with salt and pepper
- 1 pound small red potatoes (golf-ball size), washed
- 16-oz bag baby carrots
- 16-oz bag peas and onions
- 10.75-oz can condensed french onion soup
- 1/2 cup water
- 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce
- 2 tablespoons cornstarch, mixed with 4 Tbs of water

Directions:
- Prep time: 10 minutes
- Cooking time: 5 hours
- Coat cooker with cooking spray. Add meat, potatoes, carrots, and peas and onions.
- Combine onion soup, water, and Worcestershire sauce and pour into cooker. Cover and cook on low for 4 1/2 hours or until meat and vegetables are just tender.
- Increase heat to high. (Out all day? Set the cooker's timer for 4 1/2 hours; increase the temp when you get home.)
- Add cornstarch-and-water mixture, stir, cover, and cook for 30 minutes, or until gravy thickens.
- How kids can help: Measure ingredients, add to cooker; mix cornstarch and water.

Happy Change Meatballs

Ingredients:
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 1/2 lb. ground beef
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1/4 tsp. nutmeg
- 1/2 c. cracker crumbs
- 1/2 c. milk
- 2 eggs, slightly beaten
- 2 c. tomato juice
- 2 Tbsp. flour
- 3/4 c. ketchup
- 1/2 tsp. Worcestershire sauce
- 1/4 c. water

Directions:
- In a bowl, combine tomato juice, and flour.
- Mix them well and add the ketchup, Worcestershire sauce and water.
- Mix these ingredients until blended, then pour the mixture over the meatballs and bake them for 30 minutes longer.

Mexican Pork

Ingredients:
- 1 bone-in pork shoulder roast (4 to 5 pounds)
- 1 can (28 ounces) enchilada sauce
- 1 large green pepper, chopped
- 1 medium onion, finely chopped
- 2 garlic cloves, minced
- 1/4 cup minced fresh cilantro
- 1 tablespoon lime juice
- 1-1/2 teaspoons grated lime peel
- Flour tortillas (8 inches), optional

Directions:
- Cut roast in half; place in a 4- or 5-qt. slow cooker. Top with enchilada sauce, green pepper, onion and garlic. Cover and cook on low for 8-10 hours or until meat is tender.
- Remove roast; cool slightly. Skim fat from cooking juices. Remove meat from bone; discard bone. Shred pork with two forks and return to slow cooker.
- Stir in the cilantro, lime juice and lime peel; heat through. Serve with a slotted spoon on tortillas if desired.

Garlic Roasted Potato Wedges

Ingredients:
- 4 large red potatoes
- 1/4 c. margarine
- 1/4 c. grated Parmesan cheese
- 1 tsp. minced fresh garlic or garlic powder
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper

Directions:
- Heat oven to 425°.
- Cut potatoes in wedges (with jacket on). Boil 8 to 12 minutes in a saucepan.
- Melt margarine (in a long baking dish); stir in remaining ingredients.
- Add potatoes; coat with margarine mixture on both sides.
- Bake 10 minutes; turn potatoes and bake 10 to 15 minutes longer or until lightly brown.

chocolate chip pancakes

Ingredients:
- 1 any pancake batter
- 1/2 cup chocolate chips
- 1 water

Directions:
- put dry batter in bowl and add in water to get consistentsy you wish add in chocolate chips and mix well
- put pan on stove and spray with cooking spray keep on medium ,when pan is ready put in pancakes and flip when you see bubbles in the pancakes and press down lightly ,when done take out of pan and continue until all pancakes are done and add on your favorite toppings ,enjoy

Carob Crunchies

Ingredients:
- 1 c. carob chips
- 1/2 c. peanut butter
- 1/4 c. honey
- 1/3 c. chopped nuts
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 tsp. CINNAMON SUBSTITUTE
- 2 1/2 c. crisp brown rice cereal

Directions:
- Melt carob chips in double boiler until smooth.
- Remove from heat and add other ingredients, stirring in cereal last. Spread into
- 8 x 8-inch pan and chill.
- Cut into chunks before serving.

Corn And Bacon Chowder

Ingredients:
- 3 tbsp butter
- 2 None strips bacon, sliced
- 1 lb potatoes, peeled, finely chopped
- 4 cups chicken stock
- 2 cups milk
- 14 oz can creamed corn
- 14 oz can corn, drained
- 3 stalks celery, chopped
- 3 None spring onions, sliced
- None None red chili pepper, finely sliced, parsley and toast, to serve

Directions:
- Heat butter in a large saucepan on medium. Saute bacon 2-3 mins until golden. Add potato and stock. Bring to a boil on high. Reduce heat to low. Simmer, covered, 8-10 mins until potato is tender. Stir in milk, corn and celery. Simmer, uncovered, 10-15 mins. Stir in spring onion and season to taste. Serve in warmed bowls, topped with chili pepper and parsley. Accompany with toast.

Mardi Gras King Cake

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. milk
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 1 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 c. shortening
- 1/3 c. warm water (110~ to 115~)
- 2 pkg. dry yeast
- 3 eggs
- 1 tsp. grated lemon rind
- 1/2 tsp. nutmeg
- 4 1/2 to 5 c. bread flour, sifted

Directions:
- Will need a 1-inch China baby doll.

Cheese Bread

Ingredients:
- 2 eggs, beaten slightly
- 3 c. milk
- 7 1/2 c. Bisquick
- 1 1/2 c. sharp Cheddar cheese, grated

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350°.
- Grease and line 2 loaf pans with waxed paper.
- Blend eggs and milk, then stir in Bisquick and cheese. Blend well.
- Pour into greased loaf pans and bake 1 hour at 350°. Cool 5 minutes and slice 1/2-inch thick.

Carrot Cake

Ingredients:
- 2 c. flour
- 2 c. sugar
- 2 tsp. baking powder
- 2 tsp. soda
- 2 tsp. cinnamon
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 1/2 c. salad oil
- 3 c. grated raw carrots
- 4 eggs
- 1/2 c. nuts

Directions:
- Grease and flour 13 x 9-inch pan.
- Mix all ingredients together and put in pan.
- Bake at 325° for 45 minutes.
- Frost while warm.

Corn Casserole

Ingredients:
- 1 (12 oz.) can whole kernel corn
- 2 (12 oz.) cans cream-style corn
- 5 lightly beaten eggs
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 4 Tbsp. cornstarch
- 1 1/2 tsp. seasoned salt
- 1/2 tsp. dry mustard
- 1 tsp. minced onion
- 1/2 c. milk
- 1/2 c. melted butter

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients together.
- Bake in a greased 3-quart casserole at 400° for 1 hour.
- This will be thin.
- Thickens in baking.
- Stir once while baking.
- Serves 8 to 10.

Pumpkin Crunch Torte

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 c. walnuts, finely chopped
- 1 1/2 c. packed light brown sugar
- 1 1/2 c. vanilla wafer crumbs (about 36 cookies)
- 3/4 c. margarine or butter, melted

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients until well blended.
- Evenly distribute crunch topping in four 9-inch round cake pans.
- Pat to cover bottom of pans.
- Set aside.

Smelt, Italian Style

Ingredients:
- 2 c. sliced onion
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1/4 c. melted fat or oil
- 1 can (1 lb. 12 oz.) Italian tomatoes, undrained
- 1 can (6 oz.) tomato paste
- 1 1/2 tsp. oregano
- 1 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. sugar
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1/4 c. chopped parsley
- 2 lb. dressed Pacific smelt
- 1 c. shredded Mozzarella cheese
- 1/4 c. shredded Parmesan cheese

Directions:
- Cook onion and garlic in melted fat or oil until onion is tender.
- Add tomatoes, tomato paste, oregano, salt, sugar and pepper; mix well.
- Cover and cook slowly about 30 minutes until slightly thickened and flavors blend.
- Stir often during cooking. Stir in parsley.
- Spread sauce over bottom of 2 or 3-quart shallow baking dish.
- Arrange smelt in a single layer on sauce down the center of baking dish.
- Sprinkle with remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt and cheeses.
- Bake in oven at 400° for 15 to 20 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with fork.
- Serves 6.

Crunchy Macaroni

Ingredients:
- 1 lb elbow macaroni
- 1 can Spam, diced
- 1 cup parmesan cheese, grated
- 1 tablespoon maggi seasoning (liquid seasoning)
- 12 cup breadcrumbs
- 3 tablespoons butter

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 400 degrees.
- Cook macaroni but don't overcook it-- it needs to be al dente.
- While pasta is cooking, butter a shallow oven-safe baking dish and coat with bread crumbs.
- Drain macaroni and return to pan.
- Add Spam, Maggi and most of the Parmesan.
- Put mixture into prepared baking pan.
- Sprinkle the top with more bread crumbs and parmesan.
- Dot with butter.
- Bake for 40 minutes at 400 degrees.

Blue Cheese Apple Salad

Ingredients:
- 3 medium unpeeled red apples, cubed
- 2 teaspoons lemon juice
- 3 cups cantaloupe, cubes (or balls)
- 2 cups sliced celery
- 12 cup sour cream
- 12 cup crumbled blue cheese
- 13 cup mayonnaise
- lettuce leaf

Directions:
- In a large bowl, toss apples with lemon juice.
- Add cantaloupe and celery; mix well.
- In a small bowl, combine sour cream, blue cheese and mayonnaise.
- Pour over the apple mixture and toss to coat.
- Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour.
- Serve in a lettuce-lined bowl.
- Cook time is chill time.

One Bowl Cake

Ingredients:
- 2 c. flour
- 1 1/3 c. sugar
- 2 tsp. baking powder
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/2 c. shortening
- 2/3 c. milk
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1/4 c. milk
- 2 eggs

Directions:
- Sift together flour, sugar, baking powder and salt.
- Add shortening, 2/3 cup milk and vanilla.
- Beat 1 minute at medium. Add milk 1/4 cup milk and eggs.
- Beat 2 minutes at medium.
- Bake 25 to 30 minutes at 375°.
- Use any flavor icing.

Mounds Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 box dark chocolate cake mix
- 1/2 c. oil
- 1 1/4 c. water
- 3 eggs

Directions:
- Mix and bake.
- Let cool completely, then split the layers.

Herbed Parmesan Bread

Ingredients:
- 3-3/4 cups biscuit/baking mix
- 1 cup plus 2 tablespoons grated Parmesan cheese, divided
- 1 teaspoon Italian seasoning
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1 large egg, room temperature
- 1 can (5 ounces) evaporated milk
- 3/4 cup water

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350°. In a large bowl, combine biscuit mix, 1 cup cheese, Italian seasoning and salt. In a small bowl, whisk egg, milk and water. Stir into dry ingredients just until moistened. Transfer to a greased 8x4-in. loaf pan. Sprinkle with remaining cheese.
- Bake until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean, 35-40 minutes. Cool 10 minutes before removing from pan to a wire rack.

Egg-Spinach Casserole

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. frozen spinach
- 1 (7 oz.) can chopped mushrooms
- 1 pkg. croutons
- 1 doz. eggs
- 2 c. milk
- 1 tsp. dry mustard
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 tsp. pepper
- 1 c. grated Cheddar cheese

Directions:
- Thaw spinach and put in a 9 x 13-inch Pyrex pan. Put mushrooms on top of spinach and then crumble croutons and sprinkle on top of mushrooms. Beat eggs and spices and pour over top. Pour milk over top and sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350° for 35 minutes or until done.

Chicken And Sausage Sauce Piquant Recipe

Ingredients:
- 1 chicken, cut in pcs
- 1 pound sausage
- 2 (8 ounce.) cans tomato sauce
- 1 (6 ounce.) can tomato paste
- 1 onion, minced
- 1 clove garlic
- 1/2 bell pepper, minced
- Parsley
- 3 tbsp. Lea & Perrin's
- 3 tbsp. Louisiana warm sauce
- 3/4 c. barbecue sauce
- 1 cooking spoon sugar
- Water
- Season to taste

Directions:
- Brown chicken and sausage, drain grease.
- Cook onions, bell peppers, parsley, and garlic.
- Add in tomato paste, tomato sauce, Lea & Perrin's warm sauce and barbecue sauce and all remaining ingredients.
- Cook for 30 min.
- Add in chicken and sausage and water to cover 1/2 inch over chicken and sausage.
- Simmer for 30 min.
- Add in sugar and simmer for 1 hour.
- Serve over rice.

Broccoli Salad

Ingredients:
- 4 c. broccoli tops
- 8 slices cooked bacon
- 3/4 c. sunflower seeds
- 1/3 c. raisins
- 1/4 c. chopped onions
- 3/4 c. salad dressing
- 3 Tbsp. vinegar
- 1/4 c. sugar

Directions:
- Wash broccoli; place in a large bowl.
- Fry bacon until crisp; drain thoroughly.
- Break bacon into small pieces; add to broccoli. Add sunflower seeds, raisins and onions; mix well.
- Prepare sauce by combining the remaining ingredients.
- Pour the sauce over the broccoli mixture; toss.
- Refrigerate the salad at least 3 hours before serving.

Jon Marzetti

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 1 small onion, chopped
- 1 green pepper, chopped
- 1 Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
- 1 can tomato soup
- 3/4 can water
- 1 (8 oz.) pkg. noodles
- 1 small cream cheese

Directions:
- Brown the beef, add the onions and peppers.
- Add the Worcestershire sauce and 1 tablespoon salt.
- Add soup and water. Cook noodles according to package directions with salt.
- Drain. Stir in cream cheese, combine with the meat.
- Pour into greased casserole dish.
- Sprinkle Parmesan cheese over the top.
- Bake at 350° for 25 minutes.

Warm Salmon Dip

Ingredients:
- 1 can (6 oz.) salmon, drained, flaked
- 1 pkg. (8 oz.) PHILADELPHIA Cream Cheese, cubed

Directions:
- Combine salmon and cream cheese in microwaveable bowl.
- Microwave on HIGH 1-1/2 min.
- or until cream cheese is completely melted and dip is heated through, stirring every 30 sec.

Scalloped Potatoes

Ingredients:
- 1 stick margarine
- 1 can cream of mushroom soup
- 1/4 can Ro-Tel tomatoes
- 1 lb. potato slices
- Velveeta cheese

Directions:
- Melt butter, stir in soup and tomatoes and mix well.
- Place thinly sliced potatoes in baking dish and cover with the soup mixture.
- Bake at 350° until potatoes are done.
- When done, cover with cheese and cook until cheese is melted.

Raisin-Spice Squares

Ingredients:
- 2 c. flour
- 1 tsp. baking soda
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 1 tsp. nutmeg
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 c. raisins
- 2 c. water
- 1 egg
- 1/2 c. shortening
- 1 c. sugar
- 1/2 c. nuts, chopped

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350°.
- Grease a 13 x 9-inch pan.
- Boil raisins rapidly in water, uncovered, for 10 minutes.
- Put in large bowl and cool to lukewarm.
- Stir in egg, then shortening and sugar, flour mixture.
- Add nuts.
- Turn into pan and bake for 25 minutes.
- Cool in pan and cut into squares.

Overnight Coffee Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 pkg. Rhodes frozen dinner rolls
- 6 Tbsp. margarine, melted
- 1 pkg. vanilla pudding (not instant)
- 1/2 c. brown sugar
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 1/2 c. pecans or walnuts

Directions:
- Place 18 frozen bread balls in greased Bundt pan.
- (Do not use angel food cake pan!)
- Drizzle melted margarine over frozen dough. Combine dry ingredients.
- Sprinkle over frozen dough.
- Let sit overnight at room temperature.
- In the morning, bake coffee cake at 350° for 25 to 30 minutes.
- Remove from oven and after a minute or so, invert onto large plate.
- Lots of gooey caramel!!

Taco Salad I

Ingredients:
- lettuce
- onion
- bite sized tomato pieces
- Mexican chili beans
- grated Cheddar
- Seven Seas creamy Italian
- Doritos taco chips, crushed

Directions:
- Layer the ingredients in a large bowl.
- Place in refrigerator until ready to serve.
- Toss ingredients just before serving.

Chili Beef

Ingredients:
- 3 c. cooked rice
- 1 c. sliced beef (round steak)
- 1/2 c. young baby corn
- 1/2 c. chopped bell pepper
- 1 Tbsp. chopped hot pepper
- 1/2 c. mushrooms
- 1 medium onion, sliced
- 2 Tbsp. soy sauce
- 2 Tbsp. oyster sauce
- 1 Tbsp. flour
- 1 Tbsp. brown sugar
- 1 Tbsp. ginger (pounded)
- 1/2 tsp. garlic powder
- 1/2 c. water or beef broth
- 1/4 c. vegetable oil

Directions:
- Chop all of the vegetables, wash and drain.
- Slice beef with a sharp knife into thin slices.
- Combine meat, pounded ginger, brown sugar, soy sauce, garlic powder and flour.
- Marinate for 1 hour.

Scotch Cakes

Ingredients:
- 6 c. flour
- 1 3/4 c. sugar
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 c. Crisco
- 1 tsp. baking soda
- 1 1/2 tsp. baking powder
- 1 lb. raisins
- 1/2 pt. sour cream
- 2 eggs

Directions:
- Mix dry ingredients.
- Add raisins which have been cooked, about 5 minutes.
- Set aside.
- Mix sour cream, eggs and a little milk together.
- Then add a little of the wet to the dry and roll out.
- Cut with knife.
- Continue until all dry ingredients are used.
- If you don't think you will have enough wet mixture, add milk.
- Bake at 350° for 8 to 12 minutes.

Cranberry Barbecue Sauce

Ingredients:
- 1 (16 oz.) can jellied cranberry sauce
- 2/3 c. chili sauce
- 2 Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce
- 1 Tbsp. lemon juice

Directions:
- In saucepan, break cranberry sauce up with fork.
- Stir in remaining ingredients.
- Cook over low heat until smooth and blended.
- Good on grill.
- Makes 2 cups.

Island Ketchup

Ingredients:
- 1 cup ketchup
- 14 cup applesauce
- 1 onion, minced
- 1 green bell pepper, minced
- 14 cup ponzu sauce
- 14 cup maple syrup
- 14 cup water
- 18 cup hot pepper sauce (to taste, such as Franks)

Directions:
- In a saucepan, stir all ingredients together and cook over low heat until onions and peppers are softened to the point that they are fully incorporated, about 1 hour.
- If needed to maintain consistency, add additional water.
- Stir in hot sauce to taste.
- Let cool to room temperature, then store covered in the refrigerator for up to a month.

Raspberry Sauce

Ingredients:
- 1 c. raspberry juice or jelly
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 1/2 c. water
- 2 tsp. cornstarch

Directions:
- Bring to a boil the water and sugar.
- Add the fruit and cornstarch dissolved in a little water and boil all together, stirring constantly.
- When boiling, remove from the fire and strain.
- Serve hot or cold.

Cole Slaw 

Ingredients:
- 3 LBS. cabbage
- 3 ribs of celery
- 1 onion (yellow)
- 1 bell pepper
- 3 carrots
- 2 C sugar (Hawaiian when you can get it.)
- 1/2 Cup of white vinegar
- 1/2 Cup of Apple Cider vinegar
- 1/2 C olive oil (my twist)
- 1 tsp celery seed
- 1 tsp (kosher salt)

Directions:
- Shred, chop or dice first six ingrediants. Set cabbage mixture aside.
- 
- Bring remaining ingredients to a boil and pour over cabbage mixture and chill overnight.

Chili

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 lb. ground beef
- 1 lb. ground sausage
- 1/2 lb. Smokey Hollow smoked sausage
- 1 c. chopped onion
- 3 tsp. chili powder
- 1 (8 oz.) can tomato sauce
- 1 (16 oz.) can stewed tomatoes
- 1/2 c. catsup
- 1/4 c. beer (optional)
- 1 (16 oz.) can red kidney beans
- salt and pepper to taste

Directions:
- Brown beef and sausages with onion in a skillet.
- Place other ingredients in a Dutch oven and bring to a slow boil.
- Add meat mixture and simmer over low heat for 45 minutes to 1 hour.

Busy Day Stew

Ingredients:
- stew meat (lean)
- carrots
- potatoes
- 1 (10 oz.) pkg. frozen English peas
- 1 pkg. onion soup mix
- 1 can cream of mushroom soup
- 1 can water

Directions:
- Place raw stew meat and raw vegetables in casserole.
- Pour soups and water over all.
- Bake at 325° for 1 1/2 hours.

Maple Pecan Sour Cream Streusel Cake

Ingredients:
- 2 cups maple-pecan whole grain cereal flakes
- 1/2 cup firmly packed brown sugar
- 1 tsp. ground cinnamon
- 4 eggs
- 1 pkg. (2-layer size) yellow cake mix
- 1 cup BREAKSTONE'S or KNUDSEN Sour Cream
- 1/2 cup oil

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350F.
- Mix cereal, sugar and cinnamon; set aside.
- Beat eggs, cake mix, sour cream and oil in large bowl with electric mixer on low speed just until moistened, stopping frequently to scrape side of bowl.
- Beat on medium speed 4 min.
- Pour half of the batter into greased and floured 10-inch tube pan; sprinkle with half of the cereal mixture.
- Repeat layers.
- Bake 50 to 55 min.
- or until toothpick inserted near center comes out clean.
- Cool 15 min.
- in pan on wire rack; remove cake from pan.
- Cool completely on wire rack.

Farmer Salad (Farmersalat)

Ingredients:
- 2 (500 ml) jars of grated carrots
- 1 (500 ml) jar of grated celery
- 2 spring onions, in cut fine rings (only green parts)
- 4 tablespoons Miracle Whip
- 1 pinch sugar
- 1 dash cider vinegar

Directions:
- mix all ingredients together.
- Let sit in the fridge for at least 30 min, so the flavours can melt together.

Apple Ginger Scones Recipe

Ingredients:
- 2 c. Bisquick
- 1/2 c. Apple, minced, peeled
- 3 Tbsp. Brown sugar
- 1/4 tsp Ginger
- 1/3 c. Lowfat milk
- 1 x Egg, or possibly 2 egg whites or possibly 1/4 c egg substitute Lowfat milk Sugar

Directions:
- Heat oven to 425F.
- Grease cookie sheet.
- Mix bisquick, apple, brown sugar, ginger, lowfat milk and egg till dough forms.
- Knead 10 times.
- Pat dough into 8 inch wide circle on cookie sheet.
- Brush with lowfat milk.
- Sprinkle with sugar.
- Cut into 8 wedges.
- Bake about 14 min or possibly untl golden.
- Serve hot.

Homemade Vanilla Bean Coffee Blend

Ingredients:
- 4 vanilla beans, scraped
- 1 lb coffee beans, freshly ground

Directions:
- Using a paring knife, scrape the seeds from the vanilla beans.
- Mix the scraped seeds with the coffee.
- For best results use a medium-bodied coffee from Kenya or Colombia.
- Transfer the mix into a coffee bag.
- Decorate with a lilac ribbon(use whichever is your favourite colour) and don't forget to add your personal message before you seal it up with a pretty sticker.
- Enjoy the season of Christmas, Hannukah and New Year!
- Note: You may substitute the vanilla beans with 1 or 2 tsps. of cinnamon or nutmeg powder for a different flavour. I haven't tried other flavours, but if you do, be sure to let me know in your comments how it turned out.

Prize-Winnin' Zucchini Bread

Ingredients:
- 3 eggs
- 1 cup vegetable oil
- 1 12 cups sugar
- 3 medium zucchini (grated 2 cups and well drained)
- 2 teaspoons vanilla extract
- 2 12 cups all-purpose flour
- 2 teaspoons baking soda
- 14 teaspoon baking powder
- 3 teaspoons ground cinnamon
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1 cup raisins
- 1 cup walnuts (chopped)

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 375F and grease well 2 loaf pans.
- Beat eggs lightly in a large bowl and stir in the oil, sugar, zucchini and vanilla.
- In a separate bowl mix together the flour, baking soda, baking powder, cinnamon and salt.
- Stir the flour mixture into the egg mixture until well blended and then stir in the raisins and walnuts.
- Spoon the batter into prepared loaf pans and bake for 1 hour or until the centre springs back when lightly pressed by your fingertips.
- Cool in the pans on wire racks for 10 minutes and then remove from the pans and cool on the rack completely.

Scalloped Pineapple

Ingredients:
- 2 c. sugar
- 1 c. butter
- 3 eggs, beaten
- 1 (No. 2 1/2) can crushed pineapple with juice
- 1 qt. fresh bread cubes (moistened with 2 Tbsp. milk)

Directions:
- Cream together sugar and butter until fluffy.
- Add eggs.
- Fold in pineapple and bread cubes.
- Bake in 8 x 13-inch greased pan for 1 hour at 350°.

Low Fat Chicken Divan

Ingredients:
- 2 (10 ounce) packages frozen broccoli, cooked but firm
- 4 chicken breast halves, cooked and cut into small pieces
- 1 (10 3/4 ounce) can 98% fat-free cream of chicken soup
- 1/2 cup fat-free mayonnaise
- 1 -2 tablespoon lemon juice
- 1/2 teaspoon curry powder
- 1 cup shredded fat-free cheddar cheese
- 1 cup bread crumbs seasoned stuffing mix

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350°F.
- Arrange cooked broccoli in greased 7x11 or 9x13 in pan with crowns facing the edges of the pan.
- Place chicken on top.
- In a small bowl, combine soup, mayo, lemon juice, and curry powder and pour on top of chicken.
- Sprinkle with cheese.
- Combine bread crumbs and margarine and sprinkle all over.
- Bake 30 minute.

Brewed Tea

Ingredients:
- 8 tea bags in a coffee pot basket
- 8 cups water
- 1/2 cup sugar

Directions:
- Brew tea.
- When done, pour tea syrup into 1 gallon jug.
- Add sugar.
- Dissolve, and fill gallon jug to top with cold water.

Semi Homemade Margarita Chicken

Ingredients:
- 4 bone-in chicken breast halves
- 1 (10 ounce) can frozen margarita mix, thawed (recommended -- Bacardi)
- 23 cup tequila
- 12 cup fresh cilantro leaves, chopped
- 2 tablespoons chicken seasoning (recommended -- McCormick's Grill Mates)

Directions:
- Rinse the chicken breasts and pat dry; set aside.
- In a small bowl, combine the remaining ingredients.
- Place the chicken and marinade in large resealable plastic bag.
- Squeeze out the air and seal.
- Let marinate in the refrigerator for 1 to 2 hours.
- Set up the grill for direct cooking over medium heat and oil grate when ready to start cooking.
- Remove the chicken from the refrigerator and let sit at room temperature for 30 minutes.
- Place chicken on hot oiled grill and cook 5 to 6 minutes per side, or until done.
- INDOOR: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Prepare chicken breasts as directed.
- Roast chicken breasts in preheated oven for 35 to 40 minutes.

Hot Sweet Pickles

Ingredients:
- 1 gallon jar of sliced dill pickles
- 12-oz jar of hot jalapeno peppers
- 4 lbs sugar

Directions:
- Drain dill pickles.
- Remove about half of the pickles from the jar and place in a large bowl.
- Pour the sugar and jalapeno peppers, including the juice over the pickles in the jar.
- Stir with a wooden spoon until the sugar dissolves.
- Add remaining pickles to the jar, a few at a time, stirring after each addition. Let set for 4 or 5 days, stirring them each day; they do not need to be refrigerated during this time.

Pork Tenderloin With Apricots And Gorgonzola

Ingredients:
- 1 tbsp oil
- 1 2/3 lb pork tenderloin, cut into 1 inch thick medallions
- 1/2 cup vegetable stock
- 3.5 oz Gorgonzola cheese, crumbled
- 6 None apricots, pitted and cut into wedges
- 3.5 oz arugula
- None None sliced baguette, to serve

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 325°F. Heat oil in a frying pan and sear pork over high heat for 2 mins. Transfer to an ovenproof serving dish and add stock. Top each medallion with cheese and apricot wedges. Season and bake for 15-20 mins, until pork is cooked through. Sprinkle with arugula and serve with sliced baguette.

Eggnog

Ingredients:
- 2 eggs, well beaten
- 1 can condensed milk
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1 qt. milk
- 1/2 pt. heavy cream, whipped
- 1 tsp. rum extract (optional)
- vanilla or eggnog ice cream (optional)

Directions:
- Combine well beaten eggs, condensed milk, vanilla and salt. Gently beat in milk.
- Fold in whipped cream.
- Sprinkle with nutmeg.
- Float ice cream block to keep cold.

Easy And Delicious Rolls Recipe

Ingredients:
- 1 box white Jiffy cake mix
- 1 pkg. dry yeast
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 2 1/2 to 3 c. hot water

Directions:
- Place hot water in a bowl; add in salt.
- Mix yeast in cake mix before emptying box.
- Add in to water and mix well.
- Cover and let stand 1 hour.
- Shape into rolls.
- Cover with a damp tea towel, let stand 2-3 hrs in a draft- free hot area.
- Bake in 425 degree oven approximately 12 min.

Easy Stuffed Cabbage Soup

Ingredients:
- 1 lb ground beef
- 8 cups water
- 6 teaspoons beef base (or beef bullion cubes)
- 1 (15 ounce) can crushed tomatoes or (15 ounce) can diced tomatoes
- 1/4 cup dried onion flakes
- 4 cups cabbage, sliced very thinly, like angel hair coleslaw
- 1 medium zucchini, cut into small cubes
- 1/2 cup uncooked brown rice

Directions:
- Brown ground beef in skillet, drain and place in soup pot.
- Add water, beef base (or cubes), dried onion and canned tomatoes.
- Bring to a boil for about 10 minutes.
- Add cabbage, zucchini and brown rice.
- Turn down heat to low, place a lid on soup pot and simmer for about 45 minutes.
- Add salt and pepper to taste.

Easy Tuna Casserole 

Ingredients:
- 1/2 lb. wide egg noodles
- 6 ounces canned tuna, drained
- 1/2 cup canned sweet peas
- 1-1/3 cups cream of mushroom soup
- 1 cup potato chips, crushed

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350°F. Cook noodles in a large pan of boiling water 5-7 minutes, or until almost tender. Drain and transfer to a casserole dish. Stir in tuna and peas. Heat soup in a saucepan over medium heat until just heated through. Thoroughly stir into noodles mixture. Top with crushed potato chips and bake 15-20 minutes.

Fudge Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 stick margarine
- 2 eggs
- 1 tsp. soda (in first c. flour)
- 1 c. buttermilk
- 1/2 c. boiling water
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 1/2 c. sugar
- 2 c. flour, divided
- 2 Tbsp. cocoa (put in boiling water)

Directions:
- Cream butter and sugar.
- Add eggs.
- Add 1 cup flour with soda in it.
- Next, add buttermilk, then other cup of flour.
- Add cocoa mixture and then 1 teaspoon vanilla.
- Cook 30 minutes at 350°.

Ww Asian Pork With Vegetables

Ingredients:
- 14 cup low sodium soy sauce
- 14 cup red wine
- gingerroot, minced
- 1 lb boneless pork loin chop, sliced
- 1 tablespoon cornstarch
- 12 cup water
- 1 medium onion, chopped
- 1 medium carrot, sliced
- 1 medium zucchini, sliced
- 4 cups bok choy, trimmed and chopped
- 2 12 cups snow peas, trimmed and halved
- 1 cup mung bean sprouts

Directions:
- Combine soy sauce, wine, garlic, ginger and pork in a bowl.
- Marinate for a 2 hours, up to over night.
- Coat a pan with cooking spray, heat, then cook pork until browned.
- Remove.
- Combine cornstarch and water.
- Recoat pan with cooking spray and saute onion, carrot and zucchini for 2 minutes.
- Add cornstarch, water and rest of marinade.
- Stir in green vegetables, snow peas and sprouts.
- Return pork to pan and cook until heated through.

Pan Con Tomate (Tomato and Garlic Rubbed Toast)

Ingredients:
- 1 large loaf crusty peasant or country bread
- olive oil for brushing the bread
- 4 large cloves garlic, cut in half
- 3 large tomatoes
- Fleur de sel or coarse salt if desired

Directions:
- Pre-heat oven broiler.
- Slice bread into thick slices, generously brush them with olive oil and place them on a cookie sheet.
- Place bread under broiler and toast until golden.
- Cut tomatoes in half.
- Cut each garlic clove in half and rub each bread slice with the cut side of a garlic clove.
- Rub toast with tomatoes, squeezing slightly to distribute juice and seeds evenly on bread.
- Sprinkle with fleur de sel or coarse salt and serve immediately.

Traditional Sangria

Ingredients:
- 2 bottles dry garnacha red wine
- 1 bottle dry rosado (Spanish rose)
- 12 ounces orange soda (preferably a less-sweet brand such as Spanish KAS or San Pellegrino aranciata, or use Fanta)
- 1 ounce Torres orange liqueur or Triple Sec
- 2 ounces Romate or other Spanish brandy
- 1 tablespoon sugar, or to taste
- 2 apples, cored and diced, for garnish
- 2 oranges, cut into wedges, for garnish

Directions:
- In a large vessel, combine all liquid ingredients.
- Stir with a wooden spoon.
- Let rest for 5 minutes.
- Taste, and add sugar if desired, stirring to dissolve.
- Refrigerate for at least four hours, preferably overnight.
- To serve, fill glasses with ice.
- Pour 5 ounces sangria into each glass and garnish with diced apple and orange wedges.

Banana Nut Bread

Ingredients:
- 2 1/2 c. flour (self-rising)
- 1 ripe banana
- 1 c. sugar
- 1 c. pecans, chopped
- 3 Tbsp. canola oil
- 2 Tbsp. milk
- 1 egg

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350°.
- Grease and flour a loaf pan.
- Measure all ingredients into a large mixer bowl.
- Beat on medium speed for 1 minute.
- Bake 50 to 60 minutes or until done.
- Cool before slicing.

Cherry Delight

Ingredients:
- 3 c. graham cracker crumbs
- 3/4 c. margarine
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 1 pkg. Dream Whip
- 1/2 c. milk
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 1 8-oz. pkg. cream cheese
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 2 cans of cherries

Directions:
- Combine graham cracker crumbs, margarine and sugar.
- Place crumbs on bottom of dish and save 1/4 for the top.
- Add milk and vanilla to Dream Whip;
- beat on high speed until peaks form.
- Warm cream cheese to room temperature and add to whipped mixture.
- Whip until smooth.
- Add sugar until blended.
- Place 3/4 of whipped mixture on top of graham crust.
- Add cherries, remaining crumbs and whipped mixture as blended topping.

Macaroni-N-Pea Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 small bag elbow macaroni
- 1 small can green peas
- 2 hard-boiled eggs
- 1/2 onion, chopped
- 1/2 small Miracle Whip

Directions:
- Cook macaroni until tender.
- Drain and cool under cold water. Drain off all water, then add peas, 1/2 onion (chopped small), 1/2 jar (small) Miracle Whip and top with eggs, chopped or sliced.

Chicken L'Orange

Ingredients:
- 8 chicken breast halves
- 1 large or 2 small bottles Deluxe French dressing (orange in color)
- 3/4 jar low-sugar orange marmalade (about 6 oz.)
- 1 1/2 pkg. onion soup mix

Directions:
- Wash chicken breasts and pat dry.
- Mix next 3 ingredients together in a small bowl.
- Spoon mixture over chicken and bake in preheated 350° oven for 1 hour.
- Serve with rice or buttered noodles and salad.
- Serves 6. This is a great company dish and very easy.

Tartar Sauce

Ingredients:
- 1 cup Miracle Whip (mayonaise may be used)
- 14 cup finely chopped dill pickle
- 14 cup sweet relish
- 2 teaspoons parsley
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
- 1 12 teaspoons chopped onions (semi-fine)
- 1 teaspoon vinegar
- 12 teaspoon coriander powder
- 18 teaspoon salt

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients together.
- Refrigerate before use.
- Note: Fresh is always better, but store-bought/dried may be used for parsley, lemon juice and onions.

Buffalo Chicken Dip

Ingredients:
- 16 oz Soften cream cheese
- 20 oz Can chicken
- 1 cup Franks hot Sauce
- 1 cup Hidden valley ranch
- 2 cup Shredded sharp cheddar

Directions:
- Combine in crock pot with the exception of 1 cup of shredded cheese.
- When all ingredients are combined and melted add the additional shredded on top of the mixture
- Serve with tortilla cops or crackers.
- Yummy

Hot Broccoli Dip

Ingredients:
- 1 round sourdough bread loaf (1-1/2 lb./675 g)
- 2 cups chopped fresh broccoli
- 1/2 cup chopped red peppers
- 1/4 cup chopped onions Safeway 3 lb For $2.99 thru 02/09
- 1 stalk celery, chopped
- 1/4 tsp. dried rosemary leaves, crushed
- 2 Tbsp. non-hydrogenated margarine
- 1 lb. (450 g) Velveeta Process Cheese Product, cut into 1/2-inch cubes
- 1/4 tsp. hot pepper sauce

Directions:
- Heat oven to 350F.
