- Cut thin slice from top of bread loaf; remove centre leaving 1-inch-thick shell.
- Cut removed bread into 48 pieces; spread onto baking sheet.
- Add bread shell; replace top.
- Bake 15 min.
- Meanwhile, cook and stir vegetables and rosemary in margarine in large skillet on medium-high heat 5 min.
- or until crisp-tender.
- Add Velveeta and pepper sauce; cook on low heat 2 min.
- or until Velveeta is melted and vegetables are evenly coated, stirring constantly.
- Spoon dip into warm bread shell just before serving.
- Serve with toasted bread pieces.

Bitter Queen

Ingredients:
- Ice
- 2 ounces vodka
- 1 ounce Campari
- 1 ounce limoncello
- 2 ounces chilled, fresh orange juice
- 1 lime wheel

Directions:
- Fill a cocktail shaker with ice.
- Add the vodka, Campari and limoncello and shake well.
- Strain into a large chilled martini glass, top with the orange juice and garnish with the lime wheel.

Quinoa-Stuffed Zucchini

Ingredients:
- 2 zucchini (1 lb./450 g), cut lengthwise in half
- 2-2/3 cups cooked quinoa
- 2/3 cup Classico di Napoli Tomato & Basil Pasta Sauce
- 1/2 cup Kraft 100% Parmesan Aged Grated Cheese
- 1/2 cup Cracker Barrel Shredded Mozzarella Cheese

Directions:
- Heat barbecue to medium-high heat.
- Use small spoon to scoop out insides of zucchini halves, leaving 1/2-inch-thick shells; discard removed pulp.
- Grill, cut sides down, 1 min.
- Transfer, cut sides up, to foil-covered baking sheet sprayed with cooking spray.
- Combine quinoa, pasta sauce and Parmesan; spoon into zucchini shells.
- Place topped baking sheet on barbecue grate.
- Grill 10 to 12 min.
- or until zucchini is tender.
- Top with shredded cheese; grill 2 to 4 min.
- or until melted.

Peanut Brittle

Ingredients:
- 1 c. sugar
- 1/2 c. white Karo syrup
- 2 c. raw peanuts
- 1 tsp. soda
- dash of salt

Directions:
- Using a thick pan to cook in, mix syrup, salt and sugar.
- Cook on high heat until forms a ball by dropping a little in a cup of cold water.
- Add peanuts and stir constantly.
- When peanuts start popping and turning tan, take off heat and stir in soda.
- Pour into two buttered glass plates.

Chef Dine's Banana Quick Bread

Ingredients:
- 2 cups Bisquick
- 3 ripe bananas
- 1 cup sugar
- 23 cup milk
- 12 teaspoon pure vanilla extract

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 375 degrees.
- In a large mixing bowl, mix all ingredients together with an electric mixer until smooth.
- Spray bread loaf pan with nonstick cooking spray.
- (Or use a stoneware bread loaf pan).
- Pour batter into bread pan.
- Bake at 375 degrees for 35-40 minutes or until toothpick comes out of the middle clean.

Homemade Egg Noodles

Ingredients:
- 1 c. all-purpose flour
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 2 egg, beaten

Directions:
- Mix flour and salt in a bowl.
- Make a well in center and add eggs.
- Blend thoroughly.
- Turn dough onto a floured board and knead.
- Cover and let stand 30 minutes.
- Roll until dough is paper thin.
- Cut dough into lengthwise strips in desired widths.
- Let dry thoroughly.
- If not used immediately, store in air tight container in refrigerator.

Grandma Shirley'S Cheesecake 

Ingredients:
- Crust:
- zest of 1 lemon
- 1/2 cup graham cracker crumbs
- 3 tbsp powdered sugar
- 1 tbsp unsalted butter
- Filling:
- 5 8-oz bars of cream cheese, Philadelphia-style
- 1 3/4 cups sugar
- 3 tbsp all-purpose flour
- 1 1/2 tsp lemon juice
- 1/2 tsp vanilla
- 1/2 cup half-and-half
- 5 eggs, plus 2 egg yolks

Directions:
- Crust:
- Mix together lemon zest, graham cracker crumbs, powdered sugar, and butter. Pat on bottom of springform pan.
- 
- Filling:
- Mix all ingredients together, adding the eggs last; beat well. Bake 1 1/2 hours in 250 °F oven. Turn oven off and let sit in oven for 1 hour. Remove from oven and chill for 2-3 hours before serving.

Scallop Kabobs 

Ingredients:
- 1 lb scallops (large)
- 2 cups cherry tomatoes
- 2 cups fresh small mushrooms
- 2 cups fresh pineapple chunks or 1 can (13 1/2 oz.) pineapple chunks
- 1 green pepper cut into 1-inch squares
- 1/4 cup vegetable oil
- 1/4 cup lemon juice
- 1/4 cup chopped cilantro
- 1/4 cup soy sauce
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/8 tsp. pepper

Directions:
- Use fresh scallops if possible; if not, thaw before using. Rinse in cold water.
- Place scallops, tomatoes, mushrooms, pineapple and green pepper in a medium bowl.
- Combine oil,lemmon juice, cilantro, soy sauce, salt and pepper and pour over scallop mixture. Let stand 30 minutes stirring occasionally.
- On long skewers, alternate scallops, tomatoes, mushrooms, pineapple chunks and green peppers until skewers are filled.
- Cook about 4 inches from moderate hot coals for 6 minutes,brushing occasionally with sauce.
- Turn and cook for 3 or 4 minutes more or until scallops are opaque.

Taco Beef Noodle Bake

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. ground chuck
- 1/2 c. onion, chopped
- 1 (8 oz.) can tomato sauce
- 2 pkg. taco seasoning mix
- 1 (15 oz.) container Ricotta cheese
- 1/2 c. sour cream
- 1/4 c. green onion (tops included)
- 1 (16 oz.) pkg. wide noodles
- 2 Tbsp. flour
- 1/2 c. water
- 1 c. shredded Mozzarella cheese

Directions:
- Brown chuck, stirring often, and drain.
- Add onion, tomato sauce, water and taco seasoning mix.
- Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes.
- Cook noodles according to package directions; drain. Combine noodles, Ricotta cheese, sour cream, flour and green onion; mix well.
- Spoon noodle mixture into a 13 x 9-inch pan. Top with meat mixture.
- Bake at 350° for 25 minutes.
- Sprinkle with Mozzarella cheese and bake for 5 additional minutes or until cheese melts.
- Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.
- Serves 8. Recipe may be halved and it also freezes well.
- Prepare recipe as indicated all the way up to the cooking.

Breakfast Sausage Gravy Recipe

Ingredients:
- 1 lb Bob Evans sausage
- 3 Tbsp. Flour
- 1 pt Lowfat milk, (as required)
- 1 x Glob lowfat sour cream, (optional)

Directions:
- Use cast iron skillet, break up and brown Bob Evans sausage.
- Add in flour to sausage; brown it up for awhile.
- This gives it a good color.
- Add in lowfat milk required to give thick gravy; simmer to merge flavor.
- Add in glob of lowfat sour cream just before serving, after removing from heat.
- Serving suggestions: Serve on top of toast, biscuit, hash browns, home fries or possibly whatever you're eating.
- Variation: A: Use half hamburger and half sausage.
- B.
- Use half warm and half mild sausage.
- Caution: Don't use any sausage except Bob Evans for proper results.

Marc's Spicy Tuna (Sushi Hand Rolls)

Ingredients:
- 250 grams Tuna sashimi
- 1 clove Garlic
- 2 Green onions
- 2 tbsp Sesame oil
- 2 tsp Ichimi spice
- 1/4 teapoon Sansho pepper
- 1 tsp White pepper
- 3 tbsp Masago or Tobiko fish roe
- 3 tbsp Mayonnaise

Directions:
- Cut the tuna sashimi into 1-1.5 cm cubes.
- Cut the green onion in small pieces.
- Finely chop the garlic.
- Add the sesame oil to the tuna, green onion and garlic from Step 1, and mix lightly.
- Add all of the seasonings, except the mayonnaise.
- Adjust the amount of chilli powder and other spices to suit your taste.
- Add the fish roe and mix until it's blended into the other ingredients.
- Add in the mayonnaise and mix well.
- Taste, and adjust the seasoning to your liking.
- It's done.
- It looks something like Negitoro (minced fatty tuna and green onion).

Pumpkin Cookies

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 c. brown sugar
- 1/2 c. soft butter
- 1 c. pumpkin
- 1 egg
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 tsp. nutmeg
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. soda
- 1 tsp. baking powder
- 2 1/2 c. flour

Directions:
- Blend in bowl and mix well.
- You may also want to add 1/2 cup nuts and 1 c. raisins.
- Drop by teaspoonfuls on greased cookie sheet.
- Bake at 400° for 10 to 12 minutes.
- Remove from oven and cool.

Impossible Pumpkin Pie

Ingredients:
- 2 Tbsp. brown sugar
- 4 Tbsp. flour
- 2 Tbsp. margarine
- 2 c. skim evaporated milk
- 2 eggs
- 2 tsp. vanilla
- 1 (16 oz.) can pumpkin
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 1/2 tsp. ginger
- 1/2 tsp. ground cloves

Directions:
- Put all ingredients into blender; blend until smooth.
- Pour into a sprayed 9 or 10-inch pie plate.
- Bake at 350° for 45 to 50 minutes.

Popcorn Snack

Ingredients:
- 2 cups brown sugar
- 1 cup butter
- 12 cup corn syrup
- 1 teaspoon almond extract or 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 14 teaspoon cream of tartar
- 12 teaspoon baking soda
- 16 cups popped popcorn
- salt, lightly
- 2 -3 cups pecan halves (or cashews, peanuts...)

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 300 degrees.
- In a medium saucepan mix together the butter, brown sugar and corn syrup.
- Heat to boiling.
- Boil for 5 minutes stirring OFTEN.
- Remove from heat.
- While stirring add the cream of tartar and baking soda as it will foam up.
- Stir in the almond or vanilla extract.
- Place popcorn and nuts on a cookie sheet.
- Pour the sugar mixture over and mix well, coating each piece.
- Bake at 300 degrees for 20 minutes, stirring after 10 minutes.
- Remove from oven, cool and break apart.

Nutritious Cookies

Ingredients:
- 2/3 c. butter
- 2/3 c. sugar
- 1 egg
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 3/4 c. plain flour
- 1/2 tsp. baking soda
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 1/2 c. oatmeal
- 1 c. shredded Cheddar cheese
- 1/2 c. wheat germ
- 6 slices crispy crumbled bacon

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350°.
- Beat together butter, sugar, egg and vanilla.
- Add
- flour,
- soda
- and
- salt.
- Mix well; stir in oats and
- other ingredients.
- Drop by rounded tablespoonful on a cookie sheet.
- Bake at 350° for 12 to 14 minutes.

Peggy'S Special Chicken Bake

Ingredients:
- 6 chicken breasts
- any flavor Rice-A-Roni
- 1 can cream of celery soup

Directions:
- Pour dry rice into bottom of baking dish.
- Arrange breasts on top.
- Pour spice mix from Rice-A-Roni on top of breasts.
- Spoon soup on top of all; pour 1 can water into dish.
- Cover with foil; bake at 350° for 1 1/4 hours.

Best Oreo® Milkshake Ever!

Ingredients:
- 2 scoops chocolate ice cream
- 1/3 cup milk
- 2 tablespoons whipped cream, or more to taste
- 1 tablespoon chocolate syrup
- 2 chocolate sandwich cookies (such as Oreo(R))
- 1/4 cup whipped cream
- 2 chocolate sandwich cookies (such as Oreo(R)), crushed

Directions:
- Blend chocolate ice cream, milk, 2 tablespoons whipped cream, chocolate syrup, and 2 chocolate sandwich cookies in a blender until smooth and frothy. Divide milkshake between two glasses. Top each with 2 tablespoons whipped cream and crushed chocolate sandwich cookies.

Angel Biscuits

Ingredients:
- 1 pkg. yeast
- 2 Tbsp. lukewarm water
- 5 c. flour (plain)
- 1 tsp. baking soda
- 3 tsp. baking powder
- 1 tsp. salt
- 4 Tbsp. sugar
- 2 c. buttermilk
- 1 c. oil

Directions:
- Dissolve yeast in water.
- Sift together dry ingredients.
- Add buttermilk, oil and yeast.
- Knead enough to hold together and roll dough to 1/2-inch thickness.
- Cut with biscuit cutter and fold in half.
- Bake at 400° for approximately 20 minutes.

Zesty Italian Loaf

Ingredients:
- 3 tablespoons mayonnaise
- 2 tablespoons butter or margarine, softened
- 1 teaspoon prepared mustard
- 1 garlic clove, minced
- 1/8 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes
- 1 unsliced loaf (1 pound) Italian bread
- 6 slices mozzarella cheese
- 6 thin slices tomato
- 6 thin slices salami
- 6 thin slices red onion
- 12 thin slices pepperoni

Directions:
- In a small bowl, combine the first five ingredients; set aside. Make 11 slices in the bread, not cutting all the way though bottom crust. Place loaf on a piece of foil large enough to wrap it completely. Gently separate every other slice and spread 1 tablespoon mayonnaise mixture on cut surfaces. Insert cheese, tomato, salami, onion and pepperoni between every other slice. Wrap the foil tightly around loaf; place on a
- . Bake at 350° for 25 minutes. To serve, cut bread between unstuffed slices; serve warm.

Oven Baked Meat Balls

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 lb. hamburger
- salt and pepper to taste
- 1 c. milk
- 3/4 c. cracker crumbs

Directions:
- Spray pan with Pam.
- Mix together 2 tablespoons vinegar, 1 cup catsup, 1 tablespoon sugar and 2 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce. Pour over meat balls and bake 1 hour at 350°.

Marinated Charcoaled Flank Steak Recipe

Ingredients:
- 1/4 c. soy sauce
- 3 tbsp. honey
- 2 tbsp. vinegar
- 1 1/2 teaspoon garlic pwdr
- 1 1/2 teaspoon grnd ginger
- 3/4 c. salad oil
- 1 minced onion

Directions:
- Marinate 1 1/2 to 2 pound flank steak about 4 hrs (or possibly longer) in sauce.
- Grill over charcoal 5 min each side.

Knock You Nakeds

Ingredients:
- 1 (18 ounce) package German chocolate cake mix
- 13 cup evaporated milk
- 1 cup chopped nuts, pecans, walnuts whatever you like
- 34 cup butter, melted
- 60 pieces caramel candies
- 12 cup evaporated milk
- 1 cup chocolate chips

Directions:
- Combine and mix well: cake mix, 1/3 cup evaporated milk and melted butter.
- Press one half of the mixture with fingers into a greased 9 x 13 inch pan.
- Bake at 350 for 8 minutes.
- Melt candy in the top of a double boiler with 1/2 cup evaporated milk.
- When mixture is well mixed, pour over baked crust, cover with chocolate chips and nuts, then flatten the rest of the dough on to waxed paper and place on top.
- Bake for 18 minutes at 350.
- Cool before slicing.

Broken Hearted Fettuccine

Ingredients:
- 12 cup butter
- 4 tablespoons chopped garlic
- 4 tablespoons chopped green onions
- 12 lb bay scallop
- 2 cups heavy cream
- 1 (6 ounce) cancooked crabmeat
- 1 lb fettuccine pasta, cooked
- 8 canned artichoke hearts, halved
- 2 lemons, juice of
- salt and pepper

Directions:
- Melt butter in a skillet
- add garlic and green onions and saute for 1 minute.
- add scallops and cook for 1 minute.
- Add cream and simmer for 2 mins to reduce.
- Add crab , fettucine and artichokes.
- Toss all together until heated through.
- Add lemon juice and salt and pepper to taste.
- serve immediately.

Nitamago (Flavored Boiled Egg)

Ingredients:
- 2 eggs (or as many as you want)
- MARINADE: (per 2 eggs)
- 1 1/2 Tbsp soy sauce
- 1 1/2 Tbsp mirin
- 1/2 Tbsp sugar

Directions:
- Bring the water to a boil in a pot.
- Put the eggs in the boiling water carefully with a spoon so that they won't break.
- Lower the heat, but still keep boiling for 6:30 to 7 minutes.
- Quickly drain water and put them in iced water (It makes it easier to peel).
- Then peel.
- Mix the ingredients for the marinade in a ziploc bag.
- Put eggs into it and squeeze out the air and seal up a bag.
- Soak for half day to overnight.

Coffee Cake In A Mug

Ingredients:
- 1 tablespoon butter
- 2 teaspoons white sugar
- 1/4 cup all-purpose flour
- 1 tablespoon applesauce, or as needed
- 1/8 teaspoon baking powder
- 2 drops vanilla extract, or to taste
- 1 pinch salt
- 2 teaspoons all-purpose flour
- 1 teaspoon butter
- 1 teaspoon brown sugar
- 1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon

Directions:
- Heat 1 tablespoon butter in a microwave-safe mug until softened, about 10 seconds. Stir white sugar into butter until dissolved. Mix 1/4 cup flour, applesauce, baking powder, vanilla extract, and salt into butter-sugar mixture until batter is smooth.
- Mix 2 teaspoons flour, 1 teaspoon butter, brown sugar, and cinnamon together in a bowl using your hands until the texture of lumpy sand is reached; sprinkle over batter.
- Cook in the microwave until coffeecake appears to be barely set, 50 to 80 seconds. Cool before eating.

Banana Oatmeal Bread

Ingredients:
- 1/2 cup shortening
- 1 cup white sugar
- 2 eggs, beaten
- 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 1 cup quick cooking oats
- 1 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 cup milk
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 1 1/2 cups mashed bananas
- 1/2 cup chopped raisins (optional)

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x5-inch loaf pan and set aside.
- Cream together the shortening and sugar. Add eggs and vanilla; beat until fluffy.
- Sift together the flour, oatmeal, baking soda, salt and cinnamon. Add dry ingredients alternately with bananas and milk. Mix until blended.
- Fold in raisins and pour into prepared pan. Bake for 50 to 60 minutes; remove from oven and cover for 5 minutes.

Fresh Garden Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 oz. pkg. macaroni
- 2 c. diced ham, cooked
- 1 c. diced Cheddar cheese
- 1 c. cooked peas
- 1 c. torn lettuce
- 1 medium tomato, chopped
- 1/2 c. minced onion
- 3/4 c. Italian dressing
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper

Directions:
- Prepare macaroni as directed.
- Drain.
- Rinse in cold water. Combine all ingredients.
- Cover and chill.

Hot Fudge Sauce, Soda Shop Style

Ingredients:
- 1 14 cups dark chocolate, melted
- 12 cup cocoa powder
- 34 cup water
- 12 cup unsalted butter
- 1 cup sugar
- 3 tablespoons light corn syrup
- 12 teaspoon salt
- 1 tablespoon vanilla extract

Directions:
- Place the melted chocolate, cocoa and water in a saucepan over low heat.
- Stir mixture until it is fully combined.
- Add the butter, sugar, corn syrup and salt to the mixture.
- Bring mixture to a simmer over medium heat until it thickens, about 5 minutes.
- Remove pan heat and stir in vanilla extract.
- Sauce may be kept under refrigeration in an airtight container for 7 days.

Melanie's Sweet Potato Pie Recipe

Ingredients:
- 2 c. mashed, cooked sweet potatoes
- 1/2 c. brown sugar, firmly packed
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1 teaspoon cinnamon
- 1/2 teaspoon nutmeg
- 4 egg yolks
- 1/3 c. melted butter
- 2 c. lowfat milk
- 4 egg whites
- 9 inch unbaked pie shell

Directions:
- Combine sweet potatoes, sugar, salt, cinnamon and nutmeg.
- Beat egg yolks; add in with butter to potato mix.
- Mix well.
- Add in lowfat milk and combine.
- Beat egg whites stiff but not dry; fold into the mix.
- Pour into unbaked pie shell.
- Bake in warm oven (425 degrees) for 15 min.
- Reduce heat to moderately warm (375 degrees) and bake 25 min longer, r or possibly till hard.
- Cold.
- Makes 6 servings.

Chicken And Broccoli Casserole

Ingredients:
- 2 (2 oz.) boxes frozen broccoli
- 3 large chicken breasts or 2 c. chicken pieces
- 2 cans cream of chicken soup
- 1/4 c. mayonnaise (with lemon) or 1 tsp. lemon juice
- 1/2 pkg. Pepperidge Farm stuffing mix
- 3 Tbsp. melted butter or margarine
- 1 (8 oz.) pkg. grated Cheddar cheese

Directions:
- Cook chicken, bone and cut into bite-size pieces.
- Cook broccoli according to directions and drain.
- Combine mayonnaise and soup.
- Arrange broccoli in a 3-quart baking dish.
- Cover with chicken, then soup mixture and grated cheese.
- Melt margarine in saucepan; add crumbs and toss until well buttered.
- Sprinkle on top of casserole.
- Bake 20 to 30 minutes at 350°.

Hearty And Delicious Cholent For A Crowd

Ingredients:
- 5 lbs potatoes, peeled and cut into large chunks
- 2 large onions, chopped
- 5 lbs beef (flanken, short ribs, or chuck steak with the bone)
- 1 lb dry mixed beans, soaked (cholent mix, or a combination of kidney and navy beans)
- 3 lbs barley
- 6 tablespoons salt
- 4 tablespoons garlic powder
- 1 cup ketchup
- 1 cup barbecue sauce (we prefer KC Masterpiece original recipe)
- 1 tablespoon black pepper
- 2 -3 tablespoons onion soup mix (optional)
- water

Directions:
- In an 18 qt electric roaster, layer ingredients in order listed.
- Cover with water (plus an extra inch or two), cover pot, and cook at 250F for about a day and a half. (We put it up on Thursday night, and check the water levels again on Friday morning and Friday afternoon.).
- Eat with lots of pickles, and a good shot (or 2? or more?) of vodka.
- Shabbat Shalom!

Dessert Tortillas With Caramel

Ingredients:
- 6 flour tortillas, cut in quarters (6-inch size)
- cooking oil, for frying
- 12 cup sugar
- 12 teaspoon cinnamon
- 18 caramels
- 14 cup pure unsweetened orange juice

Directions:
- Fry tortillas in 3/4" hot oil until crisp and golden, turning once; drain.
- Toss with combined sugar and cinnamon.
- Melt caramels and orange juice over low heat, stirring until smooth.
- Serve with tortillas.
- Microwave: Microwave caramels and juice in a 2- cup measuring cup or 1 quart bowl on high for 1 1/2 minutes; stir.
- Return to microwave for 1 minute or until smooth, stirring every 30 seconds.

Tomato-Ricotta Spaghetti

Ingredients:
- 2 pints cherry tomatoes, halved (about 4 cups)
- 5 tsp evoo, divided
- 1/2 tsp salt, divided
- 8 oz uncooked spaghetti
- 1/3 cup chopped fresh basil
- 1/4 tsp freshly ground black pepper
- 1/2 cup ricotta cheese, crumbled

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 400
- Place tomatoes on a foil lined baking sheet.
- Drizzle with 1 teaspoon oil; sprinkle with 1/8 teaspoon salt.
- Bake for 20 minutes or until tomatoes collapse.
- Cook pasta according to package directions, omitting salt and fat.
- Drain pasta in a colander over a bowl, reserving 1/3 cup cooking liquid.
- Return pasta and reserved liquid to pan; stir in tomatoes, remaining 4 teaspoons oil, remaining 3/8 teaspoon salt, basil, pepper, and cheese.
- Toss well.
- Serve immediately.
- Yield: 4 servings ( serving size: 1 1/4 cups).

Golden Mint Punch

Ingredients:
- 30 -35 mint sprigs
- 2 cups granulated sugar
- 2 quarts boiling water
- 2 13 cups lemon juice (fresh, frozen or canned)
- 2 quarts orange juice
- 1 (20 ounce) can pineapple juice
- 1 quart ginger ale
- 1 quart sparkling water
- 12 mint sprigs
- 1 cup lemon, zest of

Directions:
- Wash mint.
- In 4 quart saucepan, place 30-35 mint sprigs, sugar and water.
- simmer uncovered for 10 min.
- Chill and make sure all ingredients are chilled.
- Strain mint syrup.
- add lemon, orange and pineapple juice.
- add ginger ale and sparkling water.
- top with 12 mint sprigs and zest.
- serve at once.

Broccoli Casserole Ii

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. onions, chopped
- 1 1/2 c. celery, chopped
- 1/2 c. oleo
- 4 c. bread cubes
- 1 qt. frozen chopped broccoli
- 8 oz. Swiss cheese, cubed
- 2 eggs, slightly beaten
- 1 1/2 c. rich milk
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/8 tsp. pepper
- 1/2 tsp. poultry seasoning
- 1/4 tsp. Italian seasoning

Directions:
- Cook onions and
- celery
- in oleo until tender, about 15 minutes. Remove from heat
- and add remaining ingredients.
- Mix together well and pour into greased casserole dish.
- Bake at 325° for 1 1/4 hours.

Oatmeal Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 1/4 c. boiling water
- 1 stick margarine or butter
- 1 c. white sugar
- 2 egg whites
- 1 1/3 c. flour
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1 c. oats
- 1 c. brown sugar
- 1 egg
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 1 tsp. soda

Directions:
- Add water, oats and butter or margarine together; let cool. Cream together brown sugar, white sugar, egg and egg whites.
- Sift together flour, soda, salt and cinnamon.
- Mix all together and add 1 teaspoon vanilla and 1 cup dates or raisins.
- Bake at 350° for 45 minutes or until done.

Oreo Brownies, A Variation Of Irresistible Brownies

Ingredients:
- 2/3 cup butter
- 1 3/16 cups dark chocolate
- 4 eggs
- 5 1/4 ounces sugar cane
- 3 tablespoons flour
- 1 pinch salt
- 1 box OREO(R) Cookies mini

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 180 degrees Celsius.
- Melt the butter in a pan, add chocolate chopped in small pieces. Mix well to obtain a smooth, homogeneous paste.
- Whisk the eggs until they triple in volume, add sugar, and continue whisking for about 3 to 4 minutes. Add melted chocolate, mix in flour and salt. Cut 1/3 of the Oreos into pieces, add to dough .
- Line a 20 centimeter square pan with parchment paper (just a reminder: grease pan with butter so that parchment paper sticks).
- Pour batter in pan, and place a few pieces of chopped Oreos on top.
- Bake for about 30 minutes.
- Cool before cutting out brownies.

Fruit Dip

Ingredients:
- 1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese
- 1 c. light brown sugar
- 2 tsp. vanilla flavoring

Directions:
- Mix with spoon.
- Cut apples into slices and put in salt water to keep from discoloring.
- You may also use other fruit.

Dreamy White Chip Cup Cakes

Ingredients:
- 1 (18.25 ounce) package white cake mix
- 2 cups white chocolate chips
- 2 tablespoons grated orange zest

Directions:
- Line a cup cake or muffin pan with paper liners.
- Mix cake mix according to instruction on box. Stir in the orange zest then stir in the white chocolate chips.
- Pour batter into the prepared pan and bake according to the directions on the box.

Taco Chicken

Ingredients:
- 2 cups cooked chicken
- 1 medium onion
- 1 can cream of chicken soup
- 1 can Rotel Tomatoes (Do not drain)
- taco flavored doritos tortilla chips (or any other flavor depending on taste)
- 1 12 cups shredded cheddar cheese or 1 12 cups colby cheese
- butter or margarine

Directions:
- Generously grease bottom and sides of an 8x8 pan using butter or margarine (DO NOT USE SPRAY TYPES).
- Crush enough tortilla chips to line bottom of pan.
- Place cooked chicken on top of tortilla chips.
- Dice onion, and sprinkle over the cooked chicken.
- Make soup according to directions without cooking.
- Blend in undrained Rotel tomatoes into soup.
- Pour the soup and tomato mixture over the top of the onion,chicken,and tortilla chips.
- Sprinkle shredded cheese over the top.
- Cook at 350 degrees for 35 minutes.

Homemade Pizza Sauce

Ingredients:
- 2 tablespoons oil
- 1 medium onion, chopped
- 14-12 teaspoon oregano
- 3 cups tomato sauce
- 3 cloves garlic, minced
- 12 teaspoon sugar
- 1 12 teaspoons brown sugar
- 12 teaspoon salt
- 14 teaspoon thyme
- 2 teaspoons beef bouillon
- 1 dash pepper

Directions:
- Saute onion, garlic and oregano in oil.
- Add tomato sauce.
- Mix in remaining ingredients; Simmer until thick.
- When cool, pour over 2 pizza crusts.

Cheesecake Factory'S J. W. Pink Lemonade

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 ounces Absolut citron vodka
- 1/2 ounce Chambord raspberry liquor
- 6 ounces country time lemonade
- Garnish
- sugar, for rim
- lemon wedge

Directions:
- Moisten the rim of a 16-ounce glass. Dip the rim in sugar then fill it with ice.
- Add the ingredients in the order listed, garnish with a lemon wedge, and serve with a straw.

Spice Crackers

Ingredients:
- 1 large bag oyster crackers
- 1/4 tsp. dill weed
- 1/4 tsp. garlic powder
- 1 pkg. Ranch style dressing
- 1 c. Wesson oil

Directions:
- Mix dry ingredients and crackers in plastic bag.
- Add 1 cup oil.
- Keep in refrigerator and shake once a day.
- Great snack.

Al'S Piggly Wiggly Broccoli Salad

Ingredients:
- 1/2 large head cauliflower, cut in small pieces
- 1/2 large bunch broccoli, cut in small pieces
- 1/2 medium red onion, chopped fine
- 1 c. shredded Cheddar cheese
- 1/2 lb. bacon, fried, drained and crumbled
- 1 c. mayonnaise or salad dressing
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 2 Tbsp. vinegar

Directions:
- Mix vegetables, cheese and bacon. In another bowl, combine mayonnaise, sugar and vinegar.
- Mix well.
- Pour over vegetable mixture.
- Mix well.
- Serve immediately.
- Makes 10 to 12 servings. Can be made 24 hours in advance.

Molasses Cookies

Ingredients:
- 1 c. brown sugar
- 1 c. sugar
- 2 eggs
- 1 c. molasses
- 1 tsp. ginger
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 3 1/2 c. flour (all-purpose)
- 2 tsp. baking soda
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/2 c. cold water

Directions:
- Cream butter and sugar together. Add egg, molasses, ginger and cinnamon. Sift the flour, baking soda and salt.
- Add sifted dry ingredients to the creamed mixture alternately with the cold water. Drop by spoonful (large) onto greased baking sheet and bake 8 to 10 minutes in moderate hot 375° oven.

Peanut Butter Chicken

Ingredients:
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 6 chicken breasts
- 2 onions chopped
- 400 grams tomato pulp
- 10 ounces water
- 6 tablespoons peanut butter
- 3 bird's eye chili peppers
- salt to taste
- ground black pepper to taste

Directions:
- Heat the olive oil in a large pot and add the chicken breasts to brown.
- Remove the chicken from the pan and set aside.
- Add the onions to the pan and fry on low heat.
- In a bowl, mix the tomato pulp, water, and peanut butter.
- Put the chicken back in the pan and add the tomato/peanut butter mixture.
- Coat the chicken with the sauce.
- Add the chili peppers.
- Simmer on low heat for about 45 minutes.
- Season with salt and pepper.
- Serve with white rice.

Crock Pot Chicken Italiano

Ingredients:
- 4 boneless chicken breast halves, cut into bite size pieces
- 1 (16 ounce) can tomatoes, diced
- 1 carrot, peeled and diced
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1 large green pepper, diced
- 1 medium celery rib, diced
- 1 bay leaf (remove before serving)
- 1 teaspoon dried basil
- 1 garlic clove, chopped
- 1/2 teaspoon red pepper flakes
- 1/2 cup grated parmesan cheese or 1/2 cup romano cheese

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients EXCEPT grated cheese; put in a crock pot.
- Cook on LOW for 6-8 hours.
- Sprinkle with grated cheese before serving.
- Serve over rice or pasta.

Parmesan Oven Fries

Ingredients:
- 1 12 lbs potatoes, cut in 1/2 lengthwise, halves cut lengthwise to make big, fat wedges, peeled or not peeled
- 13 cup extra virgin olive oil
- 34 teaspoon kosher salt (or sea salt)
- 2 tablespoons fresh parsley leaves, chopped
- 14 cup parmigiano-reggiano cheese, freshly grated

Directions:
- Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F. Preheat a baking sheet in the hot oven for at least 5 minutes.
- While the baking sheet is heating, toss the potatoes with the olive oil and salt in a large bowl.
- Then dump the potatoes, oil and all, out onto a baking sheet, spreading to a single layer.
- Roast for 30 to 35 minutes, shaking the pan every now and then, until the potatoes are cooked through, brown and crispy.
- LIft potatoes out of the oil with a spatula.
- Toss the fries in a big bowl with the parsley and cheese.

Barbecue Muffins

Ingredients:
- 1 can buttermilk biscuits
- 1/2 c. tomato sauce
- 3 Tbsp. brown sugar
- 1 Tbsp. cider vinegar
- 1/2 tsp. chili powder
- 1 c. shredded cheese
- 1 lb. ground beef

Directions:
- Separate dough into 10 biscuits; flatten into 5-inch circles. Press each into the bottom and up side of greased muffin cup.
- Set aside.
- In a skillet, brown ground beef; drain.

Apple Cider Sauce And Pork Loin Chops

Ingredients:
- 3 tablespoons olive oil
- 4 pork loin chops
- seasoning salt to taste
- black pepper to taste
- garlic powder to taste
- 1/2 teaspoon poultry seasoning
- 3 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce
- 1 (8 ounce) container frozen apple cider concentrate, undiluted
- 1/4 cup dry sherry

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
- Heat olive oil in a large oven-safe frying pan over medium-high heat. Sprinkle chops with salt, pepper, garlic powder, and poultry seasoning. Place in hot oil, and brown on both sides. Drizzle Worcestershire sauce over chops, and pour in apple cider.
- Bake in preheated oven for 25 minutes. Remove chops to a plate, and return frying pan to stove over medium-high heat. Stir sherry into pan, and boil until sauce thickens, stirring frequently. Serve sauce over chops.

Steve'S Favorite Dressing(For Tossed Salads)  

Ingredients:
- 1 c. salad oil
- 1/3 c. vinegar
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 1 tsp. celery seed
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. dry mustard
- lettuce
- spinach
- red onion
- canned grapefruit
- mandarin oranges
- seedless grapes

Directions:
- Mix above ingredients and pour over:

Bread And Butter Pickles

Ingredients:
- 1 gal. cucumbers, sliced
- 8 small onions, sliced
- 1 c. salt
- 5 c. vinegar
- 4 1/2 c. sugar
- 1 tsp. ground cloves
- 1 tsp. mustard seed
- 1 tsp. celery seed
- 2 tsp. turmeric

Directions:
- Dissolve this and let come to a boil.
- Drain cucumbers well and put in mixture.
- Let come to a boil.
- Should make 6 pints.

Artichoke Dip

Ingredients:
- 1 can artichokes
- 1 small can green chilies
- 4 oz. size pimento
- 1 c. mayonnaise
- 1 c. Parmesan cheese
- 1 Tbsp. lemon juice
- dash of garlic powder
- 1 can mushrooms

Directions:
- Mash all ingredients together.	Put in Pyrex dish and bake at 350° for 25 minutes.

Pasta Chips

Ingredients:
- 14 lasagna noodles
- Vegetable oil

Directions:
- Cook lasagna in boiling, salted water for 8 to 10 minutes, or until tender but firm.
- Do not overcook.
- Drain and rinse with cold water; drain again.
- Blot on paper towels.
- Toss cooked noodles with a bit of oil to prevent drying.
- Cut lasagna strips crosswise into quarters.
- Cut each square diagonally in half; each lasagna strip makes 8 triangles.
- In a deep, heavy pot, or deep fryer, heat oil to 350F.
- Use a candy thermometer to measure the temperature of the frying oil.
- Fry pasta chips in batches for 90 seconds, or until golden.
- Drain on paper towels and season with salt.
- Serve with dips and spreads.

Crunchy Choco-Peanut Candy

Ingredients:
- 1 (14 oz.) can sweetened condensed milk
- 1 (12 oz.) pkg. semi-sweet chocolate morsels
- 1 c. peanut butter
- 1 (3 oz.) can chow mein noodles, coarsely crushed (about 1 1/3 c.)
- 1 1/2 c. coarsely chopped peanuts

Directions:
- In medium saucepan, combine first 3 ingredients; cook and stir over medium heat until smooth and well blended.
- Remove from heat. Stir in noodles and 1 cup nuts.

Layered Pumpkin-Gingersnap Dessert

Ingredients:
- 30 gingersnaps, finely crushed (about 1-1/2 cups)
- 1/4 cup butter or margarine, melted
- 1-1/2 pkg. (8 oz. each) PHILADELPHIA Cream Cheese (12 oz.), softened
- 1/4 cup sugar
- 2 cups plus 2 Tbsp. milk, divided
- 1 tub (8 oz.) COOL WHIP Whipped Topping, thawed, divided
- 1 can (15 oz.) pumpkin
- 2 pkg. (3.4 oz. each) JELL-O Vanilla Flavor Instant Pudding
- 1-1/2 tsp. pumpkin pie spice

Directions:
- Combine gingersnap crumbs and butter; press onto bottom of 13x9-inch dish.
- Freeze 10 min.
- Beat cream cheese, sugar and 2 Tbsp.
- milk in large bowl with mixer until blended.
- Add 1-1/4 cups COOL WHIP; mix well.
- Spread onto crust.
- Whisk pumpkin, dry pudding mixes, spice and remaining milk 2 min.
- (Mixture will be thick.)
- Spread over cream cheese layer.
- Refrigerate 4 hours or until firm.
- Top with remaining COOL WHIP before serving.

Sweet And Simple Coleslaw

Ingredients:
- 1 medium head cabbage, finely chopped
- 2 c. onion, cut in rings
- 2 c. green pepper, cut in rings
- 1 c. vinegar
- 3/4 c. cooking oil
- 1 c. sugar
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. dry mustard
- 1 tsp. celery seed
- 1/4 tsp. turmeric

Directions:
- Layer onion rings and green pepper rings over cabbage in large bowl.
- Combine other 7 ingredients and heat to boiling.
- Stir occasionally.
- Pour over cabbage, onion and pepper.
- Refrigerate, tightly covered, at least 4 hours.
- Toss lightly.

Chocolate Delicious

Ingredients:
- 1 stick margarine, melted
- enough flour to make thick paste
- 1 to 1 1/2 c. chopped pecans

Directions:
- In 9 x 12-inch pan make crust.
- Mix melted margarine, flour and pecans.
- Press into pan.
- Bake at 350° for 12 to 15 minutes until browned.
- Let cool.

Egg Pancake

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. flour
- 1/2 c. milk
- 2 eggs, slightly beaten
- pinch of nutmeg
- 2 to 4 Tbsp. butter or margarine
- powdered sugar
- juice of 1/2 lemon or lime
- lingonberries

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 425°.
- Mix flour, eggs, milk and nutmeg together.
- Batter will be lumpy.
- Melt butter in a large frying pan.
- (I find that an iron frying pan works well).
- Add batter. Bake 15 to 20 minutes until pancake is nicely brown and puffy. Remove from pan to warm plate and spread with a couple tablespoons of lingonberries; sprinkle with lemon or lime juice over the berries and sprinkle the whole pancake with powdered sugar.
- Eat! You will think you died and went to heaven!

Home Made Ranch Recipe

Ingredients:
- 1/4 cup black pepper
- 1 1/2 cup parsley flakes
- 1/2 cup garlic salt
- 2 tbsp salt
- 1/4 cup granulated garlic
- 3/4 cup granulated onion
- 2 tbsp dill weed
- 2 cup mayonnaise
- 2 cup buttermilk
- 1 1/2 cup sour cream
- 1 tsp lemon juice

Directions:
- Combine all dry ingredients, store in airtight container.
- Makes about 3 1/2 cups of dry mix.
- To make dressing, whisk together all wet ingredients with 2 tablespoons of the mix together.
- Refrigerate for 2 hours.
- Makes 1 3/4 quarts.

Colored Punch

Ingredients:
- 2 cans pineapple juice
- 3 pkg. Kool-Aid
- 1 liter 7-Up
- 6 c. cold water
- 3/4 c. Sugar Twin sweetener

Directions:
- Mix all together except 7-Up.
- Just before serving, add 7-Up. Good to use for weddings and showers because of Kool-Aid.
- Goes with whatever color you need.

Chimichurri Sauce

Ingredients:
- 1 cup tightly packed Italian parsley leaves (about 1 bunch, stems removed)
- 1/4 cup tightly packed cilantro leaves
- 2 garlic cloves
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1/4 teaspoon dried crushed red pepper
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/3 cup olive oil
- 1/4 cup red wine vinegar

Directions:
- Process all ingredients in a food processor until finely chopped.

Buttermilk Icing

Ingredients:
- 2 c. sugar
- 1/2 c. butter
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 c. buttermilk
- 1 tsp. soda

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients in a large saucepan, except vanilla. Bring to a boil and cook until forms a soft ball, 238° on candy thermometer.
- Remove from heat; add vanilla and beat until thick. Spread on warm cake.

Rhubarb Chutney

Ingredients:
- 14 oz rhubarb, chopped
- 1 None apple, cored, chopped
- 1 None red onion, chopped
- 6.25 oz mixed dried fruit
- 1 1/4 cups sugar
- 1/2 cup golden raisins
- 1 tbsp coriander seeds
- 2 cups cider vinegar

Directions:
- In a saucepan, combine rhubarb, apple, onion, dried fruit, sugar, raisins and coriander seeds. Stir in vinegar.
- Bring to a boil, stirring. Reduce heat and simmer, without stirring, for 15-20 mins, until pulpy.
- Reduce heat to very low and cook for 30 mins, or until the mixture is very thick and pulpy.
- Spoon into clean jars, seal, label and store in refrigerator (or shelf, if heat processed) for a few weeks before serving.

Texas Caviar

Ingredients:
- 1 can hominy
- 2 cans black eyed peas
- 1/2 medium onion, chopped
- 2 tomatoes, diced
- 2 cloves garlic, chopped
- 1 medium green pepper, chopped
- 1/2 c. parsley, chopped
- 8 oz. Italian salad dressing

Directions:
- Combine all ingredients, cover and chill well, at least 2 hours.
- Serve with tortilla chips.

Bull Dog Gravy - Arkansas Native

Ingredients:
- 2 Tbsp. shortening
- 2 Tbsp. flour
- 1 1/2 c. milk
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper

Directions:
- Cook until thickened and serve over baking powder biscuits (hot).
- Serves 4. Kids love it and it's cheap and filling.

Canadian Chicken

Ingredients:
- 2 whole chicken breasts
- 1 c. chicken broth
- 1/2 lb. Canadian bacon, cubed
- 1 Tbsp. diet margarine
- 1/2 lb. fresh mushrooms, sliced
- 1/2 c. chopped green pepper
- 1/4 c. flour
- 13 oz. evaporated skim milk
- 1/3 c. dry white wine (substitute extra chicken broth)
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. white pepper
- 1/4 tsp. nutmeg

Directions:
- When chicken has cooled, remove the skin and bones and dice the meat. Skim the chicken broth of fat by using a bulb-type baster.
- Combine the diced chicken and Canadian bacon.
- Melt the margarine in a nonstick skillet and saute the mushrooms and pepper for 5 minutes. Add the mushrooms and peppers to the meat.
- Blend the flour with the chicken broth and milk in a saucepan. Bring this mixture to a boil, stirring to keep it smooth. Add the meat and vegetables to the saucepan along with the wine, salt, pepper and nutmeg.
- Simmer the entire mixture for 3 minutes.

Sherry Pound Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 (18 ounce) box Duncan Hines yellow cake mix
- 1 (3 1/2 ounce) box instant vanilla pudding
- 3/4 cup Crisco cooking oil
- 1 cup dry sherry
- 4 eggs
- 1 tablespoon cinnamon
- 3 tablespoons brown sugar

Directions:
- Mix at medium speed the cake mix, pudding, oil, sherry and eggs.
- In a small bowl mix the cinnamon and brown sugar.
- Grease a bundt pan.
- Pour a little batter in the bottom of the pan, then sprinkle a little of the sugar on top of that.
- Continue to layer having the batter as the last layer.
- Bake at 350 for 50-60 minutes.
- Once cooled sprinkle a little more cinnamon and sugar on top.

Roasted Asparagus With Balsamic Brown Butter

Ingredients:
- 2 pounds Asparagus, trimmed
- 2 tablespoons butter
- 2 teaspoons soy sauce
- 2 teaspoons balsamic vinegar

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 400. Arrange asparagus in a single layer on baking sheet, then coat lightly with cooking spray and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake at 400 for 12 minutes or until tender.
- Meanwhile, melt butter in a small skillet over medium heat; cook for 3 minutes or until lightly browned, shaking pan occasionally. Remove from heat, let cool a few minutes and then stir in soy sauce and vinegar.
- Place asparagus in serving dish and drizzle with butter mixture, tossing to coat. Serve immediately.

Artichoke Frittata(Serves 16)  

Ingredients:
- 2 jars artichoke hearts, marinated
- 1 onion, minced
- minced parsley
- 1 garlic clove, minced
- 4 eggs, beaten
- 2 c. Cheddar cheese, grated
- 1/4 c. fine cracker crumbs

Directions:
- Drain artichokes and keep juice from 1 jar.
- Take artichoke juice, onion, parsley and garlic and cook until limp.
- Beat 4 eggs and the Cheddar cheese and cracker crumbs.
- Mix with other ingredients chopped artichokes.
- Bake in a shallow 9 x 13-inch greased pan for 30 minutes at 350°.
- Cut in squares and serve hot. May also be served at room temperature.

Thistledew Gingersnap Cookies

Ingredients:
- 3 cups shortening
- 4 cups water
- 4 large eggs
- 1 cup molasses
- 8 cups flour
- 1 12 teaspoons salt
- 8 teaspoons baking soda
- 3 tablespoons powdered ginger
- 1 tablespoon cinnamon
- 2 cups white sugar

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
- Mix shortening, water, eggs and molasses in a large mixing bowl using an electric beater at low speed.
- Add the flour, salt, baking soda, ginger and cinnamon, and stir until a light dough forms.
- Roll walnut sized pieces of dough in sugar.
- Place on un greased sheet pans and bake 10-12 minutes .

No-Bake Cookies

Ingredients:
- 1 stick butter
- 2 c. white sugar
- 1/2 c. milk
- 1/3 c. cocoa
- 1/2 c. peanut butter
- 3 c. quick oatmeal

Directions:
- Mix butter, sugar, milk and cocoa in a pan. Bring to boil. Boil 1 to 2 minutes. Add peanut butter and oatmeal. Mix well. Drop by spoonfuls onto wax paper. Cool and refrigerate.

Spaghetti Salad(Serves 10 To 12)  

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. spaghetti
- 1 large cucumber, chunked
- 1 bell pepper, sliced
- 1 red onion, thinly sliced
- 3 Tbsp. poppy seed
- 3 Tbsp. sesame seed (don't toast)
- 8 heaping Tbsp. Parmesan cheese
- 1 (16 oz.) bottle Wish-Bone Italian dressing

Directions:
- Cook spaghetti; drain.
- Toss with remaining ingredients (easier in large, flat baking pan).
- Garnish with tomato wedges and paprika.
- Refrigerate several hours.

Banana Berry Oatmeal Muffins

Ingredients:
- 2 teaspoons vanilla
- 1 egg beaten
- 1 cup flour
- 3/4 cup milk
- 1 cup cereal Gerber oatmeal
- 2 tablespoons baking powder
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 cup apple sauce unsweetened
- 1 1/2 bananas ripe, - mashed
- 1/2 cup blueberries
- 1/2 cup strawberries diced

Directions:
- Find the directions at: http://www.mommysfabulousfinds.com/2016/05/banana-berry-oatmeal-muffins.html

Mexican Cheese Dip

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. Velveeta cheese
- 1 can Ro-Tel tomatoes and green chilies, mashed and drained
- dash of chili powder
- 1 grated onion

Directions:
- In double boiler, simmer all ingredients until onion is soft. Use as a dip for corn chips or put over tortillas.

Serious Salads: Chickpeas, Corn And Red Peppers With Honey-Lime Vinaigrette Recipe

Ingredients:
- 1 15-ounce can chickpeas, rinsed and drained
- 1 red pepper, diced
- 2 ears cooked corn, kernels scraped from the cob
- 1 cup cooked edamame
- 3 scallions, white and green parts, finely sliced
- 1/4 cup lime juice, from 2 limes
- 1 large garlic clove, minced
- 1/4 cup extra virgin olive oil, best quality (recommended: Lucini)
- 2 tablespoons honey
- 1-1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
- 1 teaspoon cumin

Directions:
- Combine all ingredients in a large bowl and toss well. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate until ready to serve.

Jazzy Hot Dogs

Ingredients:
- Hot Dogs
- 1/4 cup vinegar
- 2 tsp. sugar
- 1/2 cup catsup
- 1/4 cup water
- 1 tsp. dry mustard
- 1 medium onion sauteed in small amount of oil
- (Optional: may also add 4 tsp. Worcheshire sauce)

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
- Slit hot dogs down the center lengthwise.
- Place slit side down in 9 x 13 baking dish.
- Pour mixture over.
- Bake uncovered for 35 minutes.

Banana Nut Bread

Ingredients:
- 1 3/4 c. flour
- 1 1/4 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 tsp. baking soda
- 2/3 c. sugar
- 1/3 c. shortening
- 2 eggs
- 2 Tbsp. milk
- 1 c. mashed ripe banana
- 1/2 c. chopped nuts
- 3/4 tsp. salt

Directions:
- Stir together flour, baking powder, soda and salt.
- Set aside. In mixing bowl, beat sugar and shortening with electric mixer until light.
- Add eggs and milk, beating until smooth.
- Add flour mixture and banana alternately to creamed mixture.
- Fold in nuts.

The Next Best Thing To Robert Redford

Ingredients:
- 1 c. flour
- 1/2 c. butter or margarine
- 1 c. nuts, finely chopped
- 1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese
- 1 c. sugar
- 1 carton Cool Whip (any size)
- 1 (5 oz.) pkg. instant vanilla pudding
- 1 (6 oz.) pkg. chocolate pudding
- 3 c. cold milk
- 1 Hershey chocolate bar (refrigerated)

Directions:
- Mix butter, flour and nuts until crumbly.
- Press into 9 x 13-inch greased pan.
- Bake crust at 350° for 15 to 20 minutes until golden.
- Cool.

Pepper Corn

Ingredients:
- 3 slices bacon, fried
- 1/2 small onion, chopped
- 1 pkg. frozen cut corn
- 1 (8 oz.) can tomatoes
- 1/2 small bell pepper
- 1 tsp. salt

Directions:
- Fry bacon and onion.
- Drain off half the fat.
- Add corn, tomatoes, green pepper and salt.
- Cook for 15 or 20 minutes. Yield:
- 4 servings.

Mrs. Snow'S Mushrooms

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. mushrooms, chopped fine
- 1/2 c. butter
- 6 Tbsp. flour
- 1 1/2 tsp. salt
- 2 c. light cream
- 2 tsp. lemon juice
- 1 tsp. onion salt
- 1 1/2 loaves bread

Directions:
- Saute mushrooms in butter for 5 minutes.
- Let cool.
- Add flour and blend well.
- Add salt.
- Stir in cream, stirring constantly. Add lemon juice and onion salt.
- Take crust off bread and roll slices thin.
- Then spread mixture on each slice of bread and roll like a jelly roll.
- Freeze slightly; cut into thirds.
- Brush with melted butter.
- Bake at 375° for 15 to 20 minutes.

Strawberry Vanilla Almond Granola

Ingredients:
- 5 cups Oats
- 1 cup Almonds, Roughly Chopped
- 1/4 teaspoons Salt
- 18 teaspoons Cinnamon
- 1/4 cups Vegetable Oil
- 3 Tablespoons Butter
- 1/4 cups Honey
- 13 cups Strawberry Jam
- 4 teaspoons Vanilla

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 300F.
- Lightly grease a baking sheet.
- Mix oats, almonds, salt, and cinnamon in a large bowl.
- In a small saucepan, combine oil, butter, honey, and jam.
- Bring to a simmer over medium-low heat.
- Remove from heat, stir in vanilla.
- Pour hot liquid over the oat mixture, stir well until thoroughly mixed.
- Spread granola onto prepared cookie sheet.
- Bake until golden brown, about 20-30 minutes.
- (For less clumps, stir occasionally during baking.
- For more clumps, just turn the baking sheet once during baking.)
- Cool completely.
- Store in an airtight container.
- Makes about 9 cups or so.

Sounds Unusual But Its Yummy: Garhwal Ka Fannah

Ingredients:
- 2 tablespoons oil
- 1 teaspoon ginger paste
- 1 teaspoon garlic paste
- 1 teaspoon red chili paste
- 1 cup kulad dal, soaked in plenty of water (lentils)
- 1 cup water
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 3 tablespoons fresh coriander leaves, to garnish

Directions:
- Heat oil in a pan.
- Add the prepared pastes and stir-fry until the raw smell is gone.
- Drain and add the lentils.
- Cook on medium flame for 5 minutes.
- Add water and salt.
- Mix well.
- Cook, covered for 10-15 minutes, or until the lentils are tender.
- Garnish with corriander leaves.
- Serve hot with Black and White Roti for a complete meal in lentil and roti heaven!

Steamed Cakes With Strawberry Jam

Ingredients:
- 1 cup strawberry jam (or jam of choice)
- 1/2 cup butter, softened, chopped
- 1/2 cup granulated sugar
- 1 tsp vanilla extract
- 2 None eggs, at room temperature
- 1/2 cup all-purpose flour, sifted
- 1 tbsp baking powder
- None None vanilla ice cream, to serve

Directions:
- Lightly grease 6 - 11 oz ramekins. Line bases with parchment paper. Spread 2 tbsp jam over base of each ramekin.
- Cream butter, sugar and vanilla until pale. Add eggs, 1 at a time, beating well after each addition. Fold in flour and baking powder until just combined. Transfer to prepared ramekins and smooth tops.
- Place ramekins in a steamer basket. Cover with parchment paper and steamer basket lid. Place steamer basket over simmering water. Steam for 15-20 mins, until a skewer inserted in the center comes out clean.
- Run a knife around edges of ramekins and turn cakes out onto serving plates. Serve warm with vanilla ice cream.

Banana Muffins

Ingredients:
- 5 large ripe bananas, peeled and mashed
- 1 egg
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 c. sugar
- 1 tsp. baking soda
- 1/4 c. softened margarine
- 2 1/2 c. flour

Directions:
- Preheat the oven to 375°. Mix the bananas, egg, salt, baking soda, sugar, baking powder and margarine. Gradually add the flour, stirring lightly. Pour the mixture into muffin tins and bake for 15 to 20 minutes until they are golden brown.

Shrimp Scampi With Tomato

Ingredients:
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 1/4 lbs large shrimp, peel and deveined
- 3 garlic cloves, minced
- 1/2 cup halved cherry tomatoes (or 2 Tbs slivered sun dried tomatoes)
- 1/2 cup dry vermouth or 1/2 cup dry white wine
- 1 tablespoon butter
- salt and pepper

Directions:
- Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium high heat add shrimp and brown for 1-2 minutes. Add garlic and tomatoes stir a few seconds then add vermouth. Cool until liquid is reduced and shrimp are cooked through 2-3 minutes longer.
- Add Butter and salt and pepper to taste, swirling pan to melt butter.

Stracciatella With Spinach

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 quarts chicken or turkey stock
- Salt
- freshly ground pepper to taste
- 2 large or extra large eggs
- 1 1/2 tablespoons semolina
- 13 cup freshly grated Parmesan (1 1/2 ounces)
- 1 6-ounce bag baby spinach, or 1 bunch spinach, stemmed, washed, dried and coarsely chopped

Directions:
- Place the stock in a large saucepan or soup pot.
- Remove 1/3 cup and set aside.
- Bring the rest to a simmer.
- Season to taste with salt and freshly ground pepper.
- If there is any visible fat, skim it away.
- Beat the eggs in a bowl, and stir in the 1/3 cup of stock, the semolina and the cheese.
- Stir the spinach into the simmering stock, then drizzle in the egg mixture, scraping all of it in with a rubber spatula.
- Stir very slowly with the spatula, paddling it back and forth until the little rags form.
- Taste, adjust seasoning and serve at once.

Pineapple Cheese Balls

Ingredients:
- 2 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese (room temperature)
- 1 (8 1/2 oz.) can crushed pineapple, drained
- 1/4 c. finely chopped green bell peppers
- 2 Tbsp. finely chopped onion
- 1 Tbsp. seasoned salt
- 1 c. chopped pecans or walnuts

Directions:
- Mix cream cheese, pineapple, bell pepper, onion and salt. Form 2 balls and chill.
- Roll in nuts.
- Enjoy!

Party Wieners

Ingredients:
- 2 lb. wieners or little Smokies
- 1 jar barbecue sauce
- 1 jar grape jelly (same size jar as barbecue sauce)

Directions:
- Cut wieners in 1-inch lengths.
- Mix ingredients in a crock-pot.
- Put in wieners.
- Cook on low heat until thoroughly hot, about 3 to 4 hours.

Citrus Spiced Mule

Ingredients:
- 1 12 ounces london dry gin, Bombay Sapphire
- 12 ounce fresh lime juice
- 1 ounce fresh orange juice
- 1 small pinch cinnamon
- 1 small pinch nutmeg
- approx 4oz ginger beer

Directions:
- Build the entire drink in a tall beer glass or highball glass.
- Add all ingredients to the glass except Ginger beer and stir for 10 seconds.
- Fill the glass with ice and stir for further 20 seconds.
- Place 2 Orange slices & 2 Lime slices into the sides of the glass.
- Top off with Ginger beer.
- Garnish with orange twist.

Make Ahead Egg Casserole

Ingredients:
- 6 bread slices, cut in cubes
- 2 c. grated Cheddar
- 1 c. sausage or turkey sausage, cooked
- 1/4 c. chopped green pepper
- 1/2 c. finely chopped onion
- 6 eggs
- 3 c. milk

Directions:
- Mix bread, cheese, sausage, green pepper and onion.
- Spread in greased 13 x 9-inch pan.
- Whisk eggs and milk.
- Pour over top. Cover dish with foil and freeze.

Egg Plant Augratin Recipe

Ingredients:
- 1 med. eggplant
- 3 med. onions, minced
- 1 c. cracker crumbs
- 1 egg, beaten
- 1/2 c. crumbled cheese
- 3 tbsp. butter

Directions:
- Pare eggplant and dice.
- Cover and cook with onions in small amount of boiling salted with water till tender (10 min).
- Drain.
- Add in 3/4 c. of crumbs, egg and cheese.
- Mix lightly but thoroughly.
- Turn into greased 1 1/2 qt casserole.
- Top with remaining crumbs and dot with butter.
- Bake at 350 degrees for 30 min.
- Serves 4 to 6.

Chocolate Truffle Loaf

Ingredients:
- 16 oz. semi-sweet chocolate
- 1/2 c. light corn syrup
- 1/2 c. heavy cream
- 1 1/2 c. heavy cream
- 1/4 c. powdered sugar
- 1/2 c. butter
- 3 egg yolks
- 1 tsp. vanilla

Directions:
- Line a loaf pan with plastic.
- Mix 1/2 cup cream with egg yolks.
- In a 3-quart pan stir the chocolate, corn syrup and butter over a medium heat until melted.
- Add egg mixture and stir constantly for 3 minutes.
- Cool to room temperature and beat the remaining cream, sugar and vanilla until soft peaks form.
- Fold into chocolate, pour into pan and freeze.
- Unmold and slice thin. Serve with raspberry sauce.

Black-Eyed Pea Casserole

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. chopped onion
- 1 Tbsp. butter or oleo
- 1 lb. ground meat
- 2 cans jalapeno black-eyed peas
- 1 can tomatoes, drained and chopped
- 2 c. cooked rice
- Cheddar cheese

Directions:
- Saute onions in butter.
- Add ground meat and brown.
- Add remaining ingredients; mix well.
- Spoon mixture into casserole. Sprinkle cheese over top.
- Bake at 350° for 20 minutes or until cheese is melted.

Homemade Taai Taai

Ingredients:
- 1 cup sugar
- 1 cup liquid honey
- 1 cup water
- 3 1/3 cups flour
- 1 teaspoon baking soda
- 1 pinch salt
- 1 teaspoon of spirits anise or 1 tablespoon anise
- 1 teaspoon cinnamon
- 1/4 teaspoon ground cloves
- nonstick cooking spray

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 325°F.
- Bring first 3 ingredients to a boil in a large pan. Remove from heat.
- When contents are at room temperature, add remaining ingredients. Thoroughly mix together using a wooden spoon.
- Spray a jelly roll pan with cooking spray.
- Spread dough on pan and bake for 30 minutes or until lightly brown.
- Cool on pan and cut into 2" squares.
- Store in air-tight container.

Easy Peach Cobbler

Ingredients:
- 2 cans (29 Oz. Size) Sliced Peaches, Drained, But Save The Juice
- Brown Sugar To Taste, To Sprinkle Over Top
- 2 cups Self-Rising Flour
- 2 cups Granulated Sugar
- 2 sticks Margarine, Softened

Directions:
- Spray a 9 x 13" pan with non-stick coating. Preheat your oven to 350 F.
- Pour drained peaches into the pan, sprinkle lightly with brown sugar and set aside.
- In another bowl, combine the self-rising flour, granulated sugar and softened margarine and mix. Pour peach juice into the flour mixture a little at a time and continue mixing.
- Next, pour flour mixture over the prepared peaches and bake at 350 F for 45 minutes or until top of cobbler is golden brown. Best served warm with a little ice cream!
- Notes:
- 1. I cut down on the sugar. I used 1 1/2 cups sugar and 1/2 cup splenda. (optional)
- 2. To half this recipe: use a 9 x 9" pan, half the amount of ingredients and bake at 350 F for about 30 minutes.

Coconut Hot Chocolate

Ingredients:
- 1/4 cups Coconut Milk
- 3/4 cups Milk
- 4 teaspoons Cocoa Powder
- 1 Tablespoon Honey
- 1 teaspoon Cinnamon
- 1 dash Vanilla
- 2 teaspoons Coconut Oil
- Coconut Flakes, For Garnish (optional)

Directions:
- Heat the coconut milk and milk until it begins to boil.
- In a mug, add cocoa powder, honey, cinnamon, vanilla, and coconut oil.
- Once milk is heated, remove it from the stove and add a teaspoon of it into the mug. Mix well. Add the rest of the milk into the mug and stir. Add coconut flakes on top (optional) and enjoy!

Cheesy Pretzels

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 c. biscuit mix
- 1/2 c. milk
- 2 oz. shredded cheese
- 1 egg
- dash of salt

Directions:
- Heat oven to 400°.
- Grease cookie sheet.
- Mix biscuit mix, milk and cheese to make a soft ball.
- Roll out to a 12 x 8-inch rectangle.
- Cut in strips.
- Twist strips in pretzel shapes.

Pineapple Pickles

Ingredients:
- 1 (29 oz.) can pineapple chunks
- 3/4 c. cider vinegar
- 1 c. sugar
- 6 cloves allspice
- 3 whole cloves
- 1 (3-inch) stick cinnamon
- 1 tsp. powdered coriander seed
- dash of salt
- 1 to 2 drops red food coloring

Directions:
- Drain pineapple, save 3/4 cup of syrup.
- Put 3/4 cup syrup and all ingredients (except pineapple chunks and coloring) in saucepan.
- Cook, uncovered, for 15 minutes.
- Add pineapple and boil briskly for 5 minutes.
- Remove from heat and add food coloring.
- Cool and pour into jar with tight fitting lid and refrigerate at least 24 hours.
- Serve very cold.
- Yields 20 servings.

Orange Blossom Punch

Ingredients:
- 2 (6 oz.) cans frozen lemonade
- 1 (6 oz.) can frozen orange juice
- 5 pt. pineapple sherbet
- 1 qt. vanilla ice cream
- 9 c. cold water

Directions:
- Combine
- concentrates
- and add water. Place sherbet and ice cream
- in
- punch
- bowl in small pieces.
- Add juice mixture and stir until sherbet and ice cream partially melt.

Basic Pie Recipe For Sugar-Free Pie

Ingredients:
- 2 1/2 Tbsp. cornstarch
- 2 Tbsp. Karo
- 1 c. water
- 3 oz. pkg. sugar-free strawberry jello
- 6 packets Equal
- 1 qt. fresh or frozen strawberries
- baked pie crust
- Cool Whip

Directions:
- Stir together the cornstarch, Karo syrup and water.
- Put on stove and cook until clear.
- Cook 1 to 2 minutes.
- Add sugar-free jello and cook 2 minutes on low heat.
- Use 6 packets of Equal in 1 quart of fresh or frozen strawberries.
- Combine with cornstarch mixture and put in baked pie crust.
- Put Cool Whip on top when cool.
- Place in refrigerator.

Champagne Fruit Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese
- 3/4 c. sugar
- 1 (10 oz.) pkg. frozen strawberries in syrup, do not drain
- 1 (20 oz.) can pineapple, drained
- 2 bananas, sliced
- 1/4 c. pecans, chopped
- 1 (8 oz.) container whipped topping, thawed

Directions:
- Whip cream cheese and sugar until fluffy.
- Add strawberries, pineapple, bananas and pecans.
- Pour into bowl or rectangular dish.
- Top with whipped topping.
- Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Tri-Level Brownies

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. all-purpose flour
- 1/4 tsp. baking soda
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1 c. oats
- 1/2 c. brown sugar
- 6 Tbsp. margarine, melted
- 3/4 c. sugar
- 1/4 c. margarine, melted
- 1 (1 oz.) sq. unsweetened chocolate, melted
- 1 egg
- 2/3 c. all-purpose flour
- 1/4 tsp. baking powder
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1/4 c. milk
- 1/2 tsp. vanilla
- 1/2 c. chopped walnuts
- Perfect Fudge Frosting (buy)

Directions:
- Stir together first 3 ingredients.
- Mix with oats and brown sugar.
- Stir in 6 tablespoons butter.
- Pat mixture in 11 x 7 x 1 1/2-inch pan.
- Bake at 350°
- for 10 minutes.

Semi-Clean Apple Pie

Ingredients:
- 2 Braeburn Apples
- 1 cup Unsweetened Apple Sauce
- 2 Tablespoons Ground Cinnamon
- 2 whole Pie Crusts (I Used Pillsbury Pie Crusts)

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 400°F (the box said 450°F, but 400°F worked better for me).
- In a medium-sized bowl, combine sliced/chopped apples, apple sauce, and cinnamon, mixing well.
- Lightly butter or grease a 9-inch pie pan. Follow directions on pie crust box to thaw dough and roll out into pie pan. Fill crust with apple mixture and follow the directions on the pie crust box to top the pie with the second crust.
- Bake for about 25 minutes or until crust is golden brown and delicious-looking. Let cool before digging in!
- Recipe adapted from The Gracious Pantry.

Cool Whip Pie

Ingredients:
- 2 graham cracker pie crusts
- 1 can sweetened condensed milk
- 1 can crushed pineapple, drained
- 3 Tbsp. lemon juice
- 1 c. pecans, chopped
- 1 large carton Cool Whip

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients and put into pie shells.
- Refrigerate overnight.

Biscuit Mix

Ingredients:
- 8 c. flour
- 3 pkg. dry milk
- 5 Tbsp. baking powder
- 1 Tbsp. salt
- 1/4 c. sugar
- 2 c. shortening
- eggs

Directions:
- Make a cup or 2 cups mix at a time.
- Just add water.
- Makes muffins, pancakes, biscuits, etc.

Chocolate Sauce

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 c. sugar
- 1/3 c. cocoa
- boiling water
- 1 c. milk or cream

Directions:
- Add enough boiling water to dissolve the sugar and cocoa.
- Add almost 1 cup milk or cream.

Mushroom XO Sauce

Ingredients:
- 1/2 pound shiitake mushrooms, stemmed and caps finely diced (4 cups)
- 1 tablespoon toasted sesame oil
- 1 teaspoon tamari
- 1 tablespoon fermented black beans, rinsed and mashed
- 2 teaspoons Sriracha
- 1 teaspoon rice vinegar
- 1 teaspoon sugar
- 1/4 cup water

Directions:
- Preheat the oven to 450 and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
- In a bowl, toss the mushrooms with the sesame oil.
- Spread the mushrooms out on the baking sheet and roast for 12 minutes, stirring once or twice, until dried and lightly browned.
- Transfer the mushrooms to a bowl and stir in all of the remaining ingredients.
- Let stand for 30 minutes before serving.

Pimento Cheese Dip

Ingredients:
- 3 large boxes cream cheese, softened
- 1 small jar chopped pimentos
- 2 Tbsp. Miracle Whip

Directions:
- Beat together with mixture until smooth.
- Use as vegetable dip or on crackers.

Lemon Pie

Ingredients:
- 3 large eggs
- 3 Tbsp. lemon juice
- 1 c. sugar
- 3 Tbsp. water
- pinch of salt
- 1 tsp. butter
- 1 (9-inch) pastry pie shell, baked

Directions:
- Separate eggs. Beat whites well and add 1/3 cup sugar. Beat yolks; add juice, water, sugar and butter. Cook over low heat, stirring constantly until thick (like pancake batter). Beat in 1/3 of egg whites with spoon. Pour into baked pie shell and cover with remainder of egg whites. Place in 425° oven and bake until lightly brown on top.

Sour Cream-Chocolate Frosting

Ingredients:
- 10 oz. Baker's Semi-Sweet Chocolate, broken into small pieces
- 1-1/2 cups sour cream (at room temperature)
- 2 tsp. vanilla

Directions:
- Melt chocolate as directed on package.
- Mix with remaining ingredients until blended.

Banana Milk Shake (Batido De Banana)

Ingredients:
- 2 bananas, ripe
- 4 cups milk
- 1/4 cup sugar (to taste)
- 1 pinch ground cinnamon

Directions:
- Place all ingredients in a blender.
- Cover and blend on low speed about 1 minutes or until smooth.
- Pour into 4 or 6 glasses and serve immediately.

Cornell Chicken Marinade

Ingredients:
- 1 egg
- 1 cup vegetable oil
- 2 cups cider vinegar
- 3 tablespoons salt
- 1 tablespoon poultry seasoning
- 1 teaspoon ground black pepper

Directions:
- Crack the egg into a medium bowl and whisk until beaten. Slowly whisk in the oil until fully blended. Then whisk in the vinegar, salt, poultry seasoning, and ground black pepper. Set some of the sauce aside to use for basting while grilling. Place chicken in shallow baking dish, and coat with sauce. Cover, and marinate in the refrigerator for 24 hours.

Vegetarian Chopped Liver *

Ingredients:
- 6 hard-boiled eggs
- 3 onions, chopped
- 1 lb. green beans (fresh or frozen)
- dash of pepper
- 1 Tbsp. oil
- 1/2 c. wheat germ

Directions:
- Saute onions in oil.
- Cook green beans until soft.
- Place eggs, onions, beans, pepper and wheat germ in bowl of food processor and process until smooth.
- Refrigerate.

Meat Loaf

Ingredients:
- 2 lbs. ground chuck
- 1 egg
- 1/4 c. chopped onion
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/2 tsp. black pepper
- 1 can (14 1/2 oz.) diced tomatoes, mashed
- 12 - 15 saltine crackers crushed
- 1 (8 oz.) can tomato paste

Directions:
- Use potato masher and mash tomatoes until very small pieces. Add to meat with egg, onion, salt, pepper, and crushed crackers. Place in baking dish and pour tomato sauce over it. Bake at 350 for approximately 1 hour.

Lentil Soup Neomonde

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 cups dry green lentils
- 1 1/2 lbs potatoes, peeled and diced
- 2 1/2 lbs yellow onions, chopped
- 1 lb carrot, chopped
- 1 bunch celery, chopped
- 1 lb yellow squash, chopped
- 6 tablespoons garlic, minced
- 4 quarts water
- 3 bunches parsley, chopped
- 1/2 lb spinach, chopped
- 1 cup fresh lemon juice
- 1 cup extra virgin olive oil
- 2 teaspoons salt
- 1 teaspoon black pepper

Directions:
- Rinse lentils and pick them over, discarding any stones or debris.
- Place lentils in large stockpot and add potatoes, carrots, celery, squash, and garlic.
- Add water and bring to a boil.
- Reduce heat and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 20-30 minutes, until lentils are tender.
- Add parsley, spinach, lemon juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
- Return to a simmer and cook for 10 more minutes.

Broccoli And Cheese Soup

Ingredients:
- 1 large head broccoli, cut
- 1/2 c. butter
- 1 medium onion, chopped fine
- 1/2 c. flour
- 2 c. milk
- 1 c. grated mild Cheddar cheese
- 1 can chicken broth
- salt and pepper to taste

Directions:
- Cook broccoli pieces in small amount of water until tender. Drain, leaving small amount of liquid; set aside.
- Saute onions in butter until transparent.
- Stir in flour and cook about 2 minutes. Add milk; stir constantly.
- Add grated cheese.
- Blend.
- Puree half of the broccoli in blender.
- Leave remaining broccoli in pieces.
- Add chicken broth, all broccoli, salt and pepper.
- Simmer for 15 minutes.

Polynesian Hot Dog

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. franks
- 1 large onion, sliced
- 4 stalks celery, cut up
- 1 large green pepper, cut up
- 1/4 c. water
- 1/4 c. vinegar
- 3 Tbsp. brown sugar
- 1 small can pineapple chunks, drained (save liquid)
- 2 Tbsp. cornstarch
- 1 Tbsp. soy sauce

Directions:
- Combine syrup from pineapple chunks with water.
- Add vinegar, brown sugar, cornstarch and soy sauce.
- Set aside.
- Saute onion and celery in oil until hot, not brown.
- Add franks, pineapple and sauce mixture.
- Heat, stirring for 3 to 4 minutes until thick. Add green pepper (if desired).
- Heat.
- Serve over rice or noodles.

Old-Fashioned Lemonade

Ingredients:
- 2 c. granulated sugar
- 1 c. water
- 1 c. freshly squeezed lemon juice

Directions:
- Boil sugar and water in a small saucepan for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
- Remove from heat and stir in lemon juice. Cool, then pour into jar and refrigerate.

Squash Salad 

Ingredients:
- 2 each small zucchini and yellow squash, ends trimmed
- 2 tablespoons red-wine vinegar
- 1 tablespoon Dijon mustard
- 3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil
- 1 large bunch arugula, trimmed, washed, and patted dry
- 1 large ripe tomato, cored
- 2 tablespoons chopped flat-leaf parsley

Directions:
- 1. Cut the zucchini and squash in thin slices on the diagonal; place in a bowl.
- 2. Prepare the dressing: Whisk the vinegar, mustard, salt, and pepper together in a bowl. Slowly drizzle in the oil, whisking constantly until thickened. Toss with the squash. Let rest 10 minutes.
- 3. Place the arugula in a salad bowl. Cut the tomato in half lengthwise and then into very thin wedges; scatter over the greens.
- 4. Before serving, spoon the squash and dressing over arugula. Sprinkle with parsley and season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately, tossing at the table.

Meat Loaf

Ingredients:
- 2 lb. ground beef
- 1 c. milk
- 1/4 c. catsup (optional)
- 2 eggs
- chopped onions
- 3 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- cracker crumbs (enough to make medium consistency)

Directions:
- Mix and shape into loaves.
- Bake at 300° about 2 hours.

Grilled Vegetables With Rice Pilaf

Ingredients:
- 3 plum tomatoes quartered
- 2 red bell peppers deseeded, each cut into 8 pieces
- 2 zucchini sliced lengthwise into 1/3 inch slices
- 1 eggplant medium, sliced into 1/3 inch slices
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 2/3 cup yogurt
- 1 clove garlic minced
- 1/2 teaspoon cumin seeds
- 18 ounces rice pilaf

Directions:
- Preheat grill pan over medium-high heat. Toss vegetables with olive oil. Cook pepper for 10 mins per side, until tender. Cook remaining vegetables for 5 mins per side, until tender and lightly charred. Season.
- Meanwhile, combine yogurt, garlic and cumin. Set aside.
- Serve vegetables with rice pilaf and garlic yogurt.

Oyster Snack Crackers

Ingredients:
- 1 c. oil
- 1 Tbsp. dill weed
- 1/2 tsp. garlic powder
- 1 pkg. Ranch salad dressing (original flavor)
- 2 (12 oz.) oyster crackers

Directions:
- Mix first 4 ingredients.
- Pour over crackers.
- Mix well.
- Let stand for 1 hour to dry or microwave on paper towel for 2 minutes on High.
- They dry faster.

Cinnamon Raisin Biscuits

Ingredients:
- 4 cups Flour
- 1 cup Sugar
- 6 Tablespoons Butter
- 3 teaspoons Baking Powder
- 1-1/2 teaspoon Cinnamon
- 1 teaspoon Salt
- 2/3 cups Milk
- 1 cup Raisins

Directions:
- Mix all the ingredients together. Butter a cookie sheet or other flat pan. Cut the dough with a biscuit cutter and place on the pan. Bake 12 minutes at 450 degrees (F).
- Let cool. Yum, yum, yum.

Herbed Twice Baked Potatoes

Ingredients:
- 2 medium baking potatoes
- 1 1/2 ounces reduced-fat cream cheese, cubed
- 1 tablespoon minced chives
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon dried basil
- 1 dash cayenne pepper
- 3 tablespoons nonfat milk
- 3 teaspoons butter, melted, divided
- 1 dash garlic powder
- 1 dash paprika

Directions:
- Scrub and pierce potatoes. Bake at 375° for 1 hour or until tender. Cool for 10 minutes. Cut potatoes in half. Scoop out pulp, leaving a thin shell.
- In a large bowl, mash pulp with the cream cheese, chives, salt, basil and cayenne. Add milk and 1-1/2 teaspoons butter; mash. Spoon into potato shells. Drizzle with remaining butter; sprinkle with garlic powder and paprika.
- Place on an ungreased baking sheet. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until heated through.

Easy Pasta Salad

Ingredients:
- 4 spring onions
- 14 green capsicum
- 14 red capsicum
- 4 hard-boiled eggs
- 1 stalk celery
- 1 can pineapple chunk
- 2 cups cooked spiral shaped pasta
- 4 tablespoons mayonnaise
- salt and pepper

Directions:
- Chop onions, capsicum, eggs and celery into similar sized pieces.
- Place in a bowl and add pineapple pieces, cooked pasta and salt and pepper.
- Spoon in mayonnaise and mix well.
- Chill then serve.

Chili con Carne

Ingredients:
- 6 tablespoons butter, margarine, or salad oil
- 6 medium onions, sliced
- 3 pounds ground beef
- 3 cans (20 ounces each) tomatoes
- 1 can (6 ounces) tomato paste
- 1 cup beer or ale
- 1 tablespoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon Tabasco
- 2 to 4 tablespoons chili powder
- 2 cans (12 ounces each) whole-kernel corn

Directions:
- Melt the butter, margarine, or oil in a large saucepan.
- Add the onions and cook until tender but not brown.
- Add the ground beef and cook until lightly browned, breaking up with a fork.
- Add the tomatoes, tomato paste, beer, salt, Tabasco, and chili powder.
- Cover and simmer 45 minutes.
- Add the com and simmer 15 minutes longer.

Meatball Soup With Vegetables And Brown Rice

Ingredients:
- 1 cup onion, diced
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 1 cup celery, diced
- 1 cup carrot, diced
- 1/2 teaspoon garlic, crushed
- 2 tablespoons flour
- 4 cups chicken broth
- 20 -24 meatballs
- 2 -3 cups prepared brown rice
- salt, to taste
- pepper, to taste

Directions:
- Heat olive oil in large saucepan and saute onion, garlic, celery and carrots for 5 minutes.
- Stir in flour to coat vegetables. Add chicken broth, meatballs, salt and pepper.
- Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 10-15 minutes.
- Add prepared brown rice and serve immediately.

Glazed Carrots

Ingredients:
- 2 pounds carrots, peeled and cut into sticks
- 1/4 cup butter
- 1/4 cup packed brown sugar
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/8 teaspoon ground white pepper

Directions:
- Place carrots into a large saucepan, pour in enough water to reach depth of 1 inch, and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer carrots until tender, 8 to 10 minutes. Drain and transfer to a bowl.
- Melt butter in the same saucepan; stir brown sugar, salt, and white pepper into butter until brown sugar and salt have dissolved. Transfer carrots into brown sugar sauce; cook and stir until carrots are glazed with sauce, about 5 more minutes.

Curried Shrimp

Ingredients:
- 2 tsp. vegetable oil
- 1 green pepper, chopped
- 1 onion, chopped
- 1 clove garlic, chopped
- 2 Tbsp. flour
- 1 Tbsp. curry powder or to taste
- 1/4 tsp. ground ginger
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1 1/2 c. chicken broth
- 1 lb. peeled medium shrimp
- 4 c. hot cooked brown rice

Directions:
- In large nonstick saucepan, heat the oil.
- Add the pepper, onion and garlic.
- Cook, stirring as needed until softened, about 5 minutes.
- Add the flour, curry, ginger and salt.
- Cook, stirring constantly until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
- Add the broth; cook stirring constantly until the mixture comes to a boil and thickens, about 2 minutes.
- Add the shrimp and cook, stirring as needed until heated through, about 3 minutes.
- Serve the rice topped with shrimp mixture.

Marinated Green Beans

Ingredients:
- 2 cans whole green beans
- 1 bottle (small) Zesty Italian dressing
- bacon

Directions:
- Drain green beans (whole). Pour Zesty Italian dressing over beans. Marinate overnight. Next day, drain and put 4 or 5 beans in a bundle. Wrap with bacon and bake in oven at 425° until bacon is done.

Cold Cucumber Soup

Ingredients:
- 2 None English cucumbers, cut into chunks, plus a few slices for garnish
- 2 None Vidalia onions, coarsely chopped
- 2 cloves garlic, coarsely chopped
- 2 bunches chives, chopped
- 1 pkg cream cheese (8 oz)
- None None Splash of Worcestershire sauce
- None None Thin breadsticks, for serving

Directions:
- In a blender, combine the cucumber chunks, onions, garlic, chives, cream cheese, Worcestershire and salt and pepper to taste. Puree until smooth. Chill for 30 mins, then puree again. Serve in glasses with some breadsticks and cucumber slices for garnish.

Strawberry Jam Turnovers

Ingredients:
- 8 oz. pkg. refrigerated crescent dinner rolls
- 1 large egg white, beaten
- 1/3 c. whipped cream cheese
- 1/4 c. strawberry preserves or any kind

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 375°.
- On cookie sheet, separate dough into 4 rectangles, pinching diagonal seams closed.
- Sprinkle with 1 tablespoon confectioners sugar.
- Spoon 1/4 cream cheese and 1/4 preserves in center of each.
- Brush edges with egg whites.
- Fold corners to center and press.
- Brush tops with egg whites.
- Bake 15 to 20 minutes or until golden.

Four-Bean Salad

Ingredients:
- 16 oz. can green beans
- 16 oz. can wax beans
- 16 oz. can garbanzo beans
- 16 oz. can kidney beans
- 8 sliced green onions
- 1/4 c. slivered green pepper
- 3/4 c. sugar
- 1/2 c. vinegar
- 1/4 c. vegetable oil
- 1/2 tsp. salt

Directions:
- Rinse and drain all beans.
- Combine with pepper and onions. Blend remaining ingredients together well to dissolve sugar.
- Pour over bean mixture.
- Cover and chill overnight.

Banana Bread

Ingredients:
- 2 c. flour
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 tsp. soda
- 1/2 tsp. baking powder
- 1 c. sugar
- 3 to 4 ripe bananas, mashed
- 1/2 c. nuts (optional)
- 1 c. chocolate chips
- 1/2 c. Crisco shortening

Directions:
- Cream shortening, sugar, eggs, bananas and flour mixture.
- Add nuts and chocolate chips if wanted.
- Bake at 350° for 1 hour or until toothpick inserted comes out clean.

Chicken Fingers

Ingredients:
- 1-1/2 lb. boneless skinless chicken breasts, cut into 1-inch-wide strips
- 1 pkt. SHAKE 'N BAKE Chicken Coating Mix

Directions:
- Heat oven to 400F.
- Coat chicken with coating mix as directed on package.
- Place in single layer in foil-lined 13x9-inch pan.
- Bake 10 to 15 min.
- or until chicken is done.

Appetizers

Ingredients:
- 4 doz. crackers
- 3/4 c. catsup
- 2 oz. sliced pepperoni
- 1 (4 oz.) pkg. shredded Mozzarella cheese
- oregano

Directions:
- Heat oven to 400°.
- Spread cracker rounds with catsup; top with pepperoni.
- Sprinkle cheese and oregano over pepperoni. Place on ungreased baking sheet.
- Bake for 3 to 5 minutes, or until cheese is melted.

Oatmeal Cookies

Ingredients:
- 2 c. sugar
- 3 Tbsp. cocoa
- 1/2 c. milk
- 2 c. quick oatmeal
- 1/2 c. peanut butter
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 stick margarine

Directions:
- Mix sugar, cocoa and milk in saucepan.
- Bring to a boil and boil for 1 minute. Remove from heat and add the other ingredients. Spoon out on wax paper and let cool.

Saturday Steak

Ingredients:
- 1 kg rump steak (economy grade)
- 2 onions
- 2 tomatoes (optional)
- 12 cup tomato sauce
- 12 cup flour (plain)

Directions:
- Put your rump steak in one layer, in a baking tray or casserole dish.
- Choose one that the meat "just" fits in, without overlapping.
- Sprinkle over salt and pepper, thinly sliced onion, sliced tomatoes, and tomato sauce.
- Sprinkle over plain flour, and cover the meat with cold water.
- The amount depends on the size of your pan, but the meat and flour should be covered.
- cover with lid or alfoil, I use a cookie tray :).
- Put in a very slow oven and leave for about 2 hours.The flour should have turned into the best gravy by then, if, after an hour, there are still bits of flour showing, give them a little whisk with a fork.
- When cooked, the meat will be good, but the gravy will be sensational!
- Serve with mashed potatoes and greens.

Garlicky Bean And Spinach Salad

Ingredients:
- 2 1/4 cups coarsely chopped spinach
- 1 (15-ounce) can navy beans, rinsed and drained
- 1/2 cup sliced red onion
- 1 tablespoon cider vinegar
- 1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil
- 1 garlic clove, minced
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/8 teaspoon pepper

Directions:
- Combine first 3 ingredients in a large bowl. Combine vinegar and remaining 4 ingredients in a small bowl; add to bean mixture, tossing gently to coat. Serve immediately.

Ski Slope Soup

Ingredients:
- 1 lb bulk sausage
- 2 (15 ounce) cans kidney beans
- 1 (14 1/2 ounce) can tomatoes
- 1 large onion, chopped
- 1 quart water
- 1/8 teaspoon seasoning salt
- 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
- 1/2 teaspoon dried thyme
- 2 bay leaves
- 1/8 teaspoon pepper
- 1 cup potato, peeled and diced

Directions:
- Brown sausage and drain well.
- Combine all ingredients in a 4 quart saucepan or Dutch oven.
- Cover and simmer for 1 hour.
- Add potatoes and cook another 20 minutes.
- Remove and discard bay leaves.
- Beat soup with an electric mixer until all ingredients are well shredded, about 3 minutes.
- Serve.

Easy Homemade Tortilla Chips

Ingredients:
- 6 corn tortillas, cut into wedges
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1/2 teaspoon fine grain sea salt

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
- In a medium bowl, toss tortilla wedges with olive oil and salt.
- Arrange tortilla wedges in an even layer over a baking sheet and bake for 10 minutes, or until golden and crispy.

Grilled Plantains

Ingredients:
- 4 very ripe plantains, soft but not mushy (with blackened skins)
- Freshly ground black pepper to taste
- 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon
- Salt to taste, optional

Directions:
- Gently roll the plantains back and forth across the table to soften before grilling.
- Peel and slice the plantains into long, bias-cut slices 1/4-inch thick.
- Season on one side with pepper, cinnamon and with salt, if desired.
- Grill plantains before grilling the swordfish or, if there is enough room, grill plantains and fish simultaneously, cooking plantains a couple of minutes at the most on each side.
- Plantains do not have to be hot.
- Arrange on the plate with swordfish and salsa.

Veg-All Casserole

Ingredients:
- 2 cans Veg-All mixed vegetables
- 1 (8 oz.) block sharp Cheddar cheese, shredded
- 3/4 c. chopped onion
- 1 c. mayonnaise
- 1 can sliced water chestnuts
- 2 c. crushed Ritz crackers

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients except crackers together.
- Top with crushed crackers.
- Bake 45 to 50 minutes at 350°.

Triple Citrus Cake

Ingredients:
- 8 ounces yogurt lime
- 4 eggs
- 3/4 cup sugar
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 1/2 cup grapeseed oil
- 2 lemons minced
- 1 1/2 cups flour
- 2 teaspoons baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1 cup powdered sugar
- 2 tablespoons orange juice

Directions:
- Whisk flour, baking powder and salt. Set aside.
- With an electric mixer, beat yogurt, eggs, sugar, vanilla, oil, and lemon zest until combined.
