- Switch to a spatula and fold in flour mixture until incorporated.
- Coat a 9 x 5 loaf pan with floured baking spray (or use parchment paper coated with baking spray as well) and pour in batter. Smooth evenly. Bake in a preheated oven at 350 degrees for 40-50 minutes or until a cake tester comes out clean.
- Allow cake to cool at least an hour.
- When cake is cool, move to a serving plate or cake platter. Mix powdered sugar with orange juice until smooth and drizzle the glaze over cake.

Chicken, Broccoli Casserole

Ingredients:
- 6 boneless breast of chicken (Market Day Chic Steaks)
- 1 can cream of chicken (no water)
- 1 can cream of mushroom (no water)
- 2 c. Brownberry stuffing (sage, onion)
- 2 c. broccoli
- 1 pkg. Cheddar cheese

Directions:
- Cook chicken and cut into cubes. Set aside.
- Mix soups, broccoli and the sage and onion stuffing all together into large bowl.
- Mix well.
- Pour into casserole dish, then top with Cheddar cheese and bake at 425° for 1/2 hour.

Apple Butter Steak

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 lbs flank steaks
- 4 tablespoons apple butter
- 2 tablespoons light soy sauce
- 2 tablespoons dry sherry
- 1/4 teaspoon grated ginger
- 4 green onions, chopped

Directions:
- Place the steak on a plate.
- Mix the remaining items together and rub 2 Tbs onto the steak, both sides.
- Marinate for 1/2 hour and then broil on an oven rack to your liking.
- Slice the steak across the grain of the meat and place the pieces in an oven proof dish.
- Pour the remaining sauce on top of the meat and place under th broiler for just a few moments, allowing it to glaze a bit Serve.

Pimiento Cheese And Tomato Bites

Ingredients:
- 1/2 (8 ounce) package softened cream cheese
- 1/4 cup mayonnaise
- 1 tablespoon finely grated onion
- 1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce
- 1 teaspoon lemon juice
- 3/4 teaspoon dried mustard
- 3/4 teaspoon hot sauce
- 1/2 teaspoon white sugar
- 1/4 teaspoon kosher salt
- 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper
- 1 (4 ounce) jar diced pimiento peppers, drained
- 3 ounces shredded sharp Cheddar cheese
- 3 ounces shredded extra-sharp white Cheddar cheese
- 30 buttery crackers
- 1 pint cherry tomatoes, halved

Directions:
- Stir together cream cheese, mayonnaise, onion, Worcestershire, lemon juice, dried mustard, hot sauce, sugar, kosher salt, and pepper in a bowl. Fold in diced pimiento and cheeses. Spread 1 tablespoon cheese mixture onto each cracker. Top with cherry tomato halves.

Low-Fat Ranch Dressing

Ingredients:
- 1 pkg. Ranch style dressing mix (the kind that calls for buttermilk) *
- 1/2 c. nonfat plain yogurt
- 1/2 c. reduced calorie mayonnaise
- 1 pt. buttermilk
- 1 Tbsp. dried onion
- 1/4 tsp. dried basil
- 1/4 tsp. garlic powder
- 1 Tbsp. dried parsley
- 1/8 tsp. pepper
- 1/2 tsp. salt

Directions:
- In a large bowl, blend package (or seasonings) with yogurt and mayonnaise.
- Mix in buttermilk.
- This stores well in the refrigerator for several weeks.
- Yields 3 cups.

Kalf Tong - Calf'S Tongue

Ingredients:
- 3 calf tongues
- 3 bay leaves
- 1 onion, peeled and sliced
- 1 teaspoon peppercorn
- 1 tablespoon salt
- 1 tablespoon flour
- 2 tablespoons prepared horseradish

Directions:
- Place tongues, bay leaves, onion, peppercorns and salt in a stockpot; cover with water.
- Cook until tender, 1 1/2 to 2 hours.
- Remove the skin and root ends; cut in half lengthwise.
- Strain liquid; add flour mixed with a little water and the horseradish.
- Cook until smooth, stirring constantly.
- Place tongues on a serving platter and pour sauce over.

Mary Lou'S Bread And Butter Pickles 

Ingredients:
- 1 large cucumber, sliced thin (6 cups)
- 1 medium onion, sliced
- 1/2 cup white vinegar
- 1 cup sugar
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon mustard seed
- 1/4 teaspoon celery seed
- 1/4 teaspoon turmeric

Directions:
- Place cucumbers and onions in 2 quart microwave bowl. Mix the other ingredients and pour over onions and cucumbers.
- 
- Cover and microwave on high for 10 minutes. Remove and cool. Store in refrigerator.

Raspberry Banana White Chocolate Pudding Pie

Ingredients:
- 1 (16 ounce) package vanilla wafers
- 1 cup fresh raspberry
- 2 medium bananas, sliced and dipped in lemon juice and drained
- 1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, softened
- 1 (14 ounce) can sweetened condensed milk
- 3/4 cup cold water
- 1 (6 ounce) package instant white chocolate pudding and pie filling mix
- 1 cup whipping cream, stiffly whipped

Directions:
- Line a pie plate, both on bottom and up sides with vanilla wafers. Place a layer of bananas on top of wafers lining the bottom of pie plate and follow with raspberries; set aside.
- In large mixer bowl, beat cream cheese until fluffy; gradually beat in sweetened condensed milk until smooth. On low speed, beat in water and pudding mix until smooth. Chill 10 minutes.
- Meanwhile, stiffly whip your whipping cream and fold into chilled batter. Pour into prepared pie plate. Chill until firm. Garnish as desired. Refrigerate leftovers.

Hamburger Pot Pie

Ingredients:
- 2 c. sifted flour
- 3/4 c. Crisco
- 1/2 tsp. onion salt

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 400° or if using metal pan heat to 425°.
- Cut Crisco into flour, mixing in onion salt and water and work until like pie crust.
- Divide dough in half.
- Roll out and put half of crust in pie can.

Orange Grove

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 ounces rye whiskey
- 1 1/2 ounces fresh orange juice
- 1 ounce ginger liqueur (such as Domaine de Canton)

Directions:
- Combine the whiskey, orange juice and ginger liqueur in a cocktail shaker.
- Fill with ice and shake until chilled.
- Strain into a rocks glass over ice.
- Photograph by John Kernick

Bahraini Prawns / Shrimp in Tomato Sauce

Ingredients:
- 1 kg fresh prawns, shelled and de-veined
- 2 cups chopped tomatoes
- 12 cup green capsicum, chopped
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1 teaspoon prawn garam masala powder
- 1 teaspoon turmeric
- 3 tablespoons tomato paste
- 3 tablespoons oil

Directions:
- Put the prawns, tomatoes and capsicum into a covered saucepan and boil for about 10 minutes.
- Add the salt, prawn masala, turmeric, tomato paste and oil.
- Decrease heat and simmer, covered, for about 20 minutes.
- Serve with basmati rice.

Toll House Cookie Pie

Ingredients:
- 2 eggs
- 1/2 c. flour
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 1/2 c. brown sugar
- 1 c. butter, melted and cooled to room temperature
- 1 (6 oz.) pkg. chocolate bits
- 1 (9-inch) unbaked pie crust shell

Directions:
- Beat eggs until foamy. Beat in flour and both sugars. Blend in cooled butter. Stir in chocolate bits.
- Pour into pie shell and bake 1 hour at 325°. Preheat oven.

Mixed Fruit Cider

Ingredients:
- 1 quart apple cider
- 1 quart pineapple juice
- 3 cinnamon sticks
- 2 lemons, thinly sliced
- 1 orange, thinly sliced

Directions:
- In a Dutch oven, combine all ingredients.
- Bring to a boil over medium heat; reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
- Strain mixture, discarding solids.
- Serve warm.

Macaroni Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 (1 lb.) box macaroni (elbow or shell)
- 1 large green or red bell pepper
- 1 large onion, chopped
- 1 can tuna, packed in water (2 if desired)
- 1 pt. salad dressing
- paprika

Directions:
- Cook macaroni until done.
- Rinse and drain well.
- Add onion, pepper and tuna; mix well with salad dressing.
- (Use more salad dressing, if needed.)
- Sprinkle with paprika.
- Keep in refrigerator.

Pink Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 box strawberry Jell-O
- 1 can crushed pineapple
- 1 bowl whip cream
- 2 c. miniature marshmallows

Directions:
- Put Jell-O in bowl.
- Add pineapple, whip cream and marshmallows.
- Stir well.
- Mix all ingredients together well.

Summer Solstice - Midsummer Night'S Dream Cocktail

Ingredients:
- 2 ounces vodka
- 1 ounce kirschwasser
- 1 teaspoon strawberry liqueur
- 5 fresh strawberries
- tonic water, as needed (use Schweppes Russian if available)
- 1 drop Angostura bitters
- splash grenadine
- halved fresh strawberry, for garnish
- ice

Directions:
- Puree the strawberries in a blender then pour over ice in a shaker before adding the Vodka, Kirsch and strawberry liqueur.
- Shake thoroughly then pour into a highball glass with ice, and top-up with the Schweppes Russian.
- *NOTE: If you can't find Schweppes Russian, use tonic water and add a drop of Angostura bitters and a splash of grenadine).
- Garnish with halved strawberries and serve.

Blueberry Syrup

Ingredients:
- 1/4 cup orange juice
- 1 tablespoon cornstarch
- 1 (10 ounce) package frozen blueberries, thawed
- 1 tablespoon sugar

Directions:
- In a small bowl stir together orange juice and cornstarch, set aside. In a small saucepan mix together blueberries, sugar, and orange juice mixture.
- Bring mixture to a boil, then reduce to a simmer and cook for 10 minutes.

JELL-O Dessert Nachos

Ingredients:
- 20 graham wafer crackers
- 1 pkg (4-serving size) Jell-O Vanilla Instant Pudding
- 2 cups sliced strawberries Safeway 1 lb For $3.99 thru 02/09
- 3 kiwis, chopped
- 1 large banana, sliced
- chocolate sauce

Directions:
- SCORE each wafer diagonally with a knife; break apart to form 2 triangles.
- PREPARE pudding as directed on package.
- Divide wafer triangles evenly among 8 dessert plates.
- Spoon pudding over cookies.
- Top with fruit.
- DRIZZLE with chocolate sauce.
- Serve immediately.

Best Banana Bread

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. shortening
- 2 eggs
- 1 c. sugar
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 3 very ripe bananas (large)
- 2 c. flour
- 1 tsp. soda
- 1 c. nuts

Directions:
- Cream shortening; add sugar.
- Beat in eggs and add salt.
- Mash bananas with fork; add to mixture.
- Add soda and flour last.
- Fold in nuts.
- Bake at 350° for 40 to 50 minutes.

Pineapple Cobbler

Ingredients:
- pie crust for 2 pies
- 2 (15 1/2 oz.) cans crushed pineapple in heavy syrup
- 1 (15 1/4 oz.) can chunk pineapple
- 1 Tbsp. cornstarch
- 2 c. sugar
- 2 Tbsp. oleo (butter is better)

Directions:
- Combine ingredients; pour over pie crust in medium size pan Top with top crust; cut into strips.
- Sprinkle with sugar.
- Bake 40 to 50 minutes.
- Serves 10 to 12.

BOCA-Stuffed Baked Poblanos

Ingredients:
- 1 Tbsp. olive oil
- 1 cup chopped onions
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 pkg. (12 oz.) frozen BOCA Veggie Ground Crumbles
- 2 cups chopped seeded tomatoes Safeway 1 lb For $1.29 thru 02/09
- 2 cans (11 oz. each) reduced-sodium corn, drained
- 1 bay leaf
- 1/2 tsp. ground cumin
- 1/2 tsp. black pepper
- 1 cup shredded reduced-fat Cheddar cheese, divided
- 8 poblano chiles, roasted, peeled and seeded
- 1/2 cup finely chopped cilantro

Directions:
- Heat oven to 350F.
- Heat oil in medium saucepan on medium heat.
- Add onions and garlic; cook 2 min., stirring frequently.
- Stir in crumbles, tomatoes, corn, bay leaf, cumin and black pepper; cook 10 min., stirring occasionally.
- Remove from heat.
- Discard bay leaf.
- Stir in 3/4 cup cheese.
- Spoon into chiles; place, filled-sides up, in single layer in greased shallow baking dish.
- Sprinkle with remaining cheese.
- Bake 15 min.
- or until cheese is melted.
- Sprinkle with cilantro.

Pumpkin Pudding Cake

Ingredients:
- 3 eggs
- 1 can evaporated milk
- 1 c. sugar
- 1 large can pumpkin
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1/2 tsp. cinnamon
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 yellow or white cake mix
- 1 cube melted margarine
- 1/2 c. chopped nuts

Directions:
- Mix eggs, milk, sugar, pumpkin, vanilla, cinnamon and salt. Pour into lightly oiled 9 x 13-inch pan.
- Sprinkle 1 yellow or white cake mix over the pumpkin mixture.
- Drizzle 1 cube melted margarine over cake mix.
- Top with 1/2 cup nuts.
- Bake at 350° for 1 hour.

Spaghetti And Ham And Cheese Sauce

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. spaghetti
- small block Velveeta, cut in 1/4-inch squares
- 1/2 onion, diced
- 4 c. milk
- 1/2 stick margarine
- 2 (1/4-inch) slices ham, cut in 1/4-inch squares
- 1/4 c. flour

Directions:
- Cook spaghetti.
- Saute onions in butter.
- Add flour until butter is soaked up.
- Add milk and cheese.
- Add ham and stir constantly until sauce starts to thicken.
- Serve over spaghetti.

Chicken and pineapple

Ingredients:
- 1 lb chicken breasts
- 1 tbsp vegetable oil
- 1 onion, red or white
- 1 can pineapple chunks in juice (260 gm)
- 1/2 pints pineapple juice (10 fluid ounces)
- dash soy sauce
- 10 grams cornflour (starch)

Directions:
- Cut chicken into 2 cm cubes or 1/2 cm slices
- Place oil in wok or frying pan over medium heat, add chicken and stir fry until sealed and golden on all sides
- Remove chicken, coarsely chop onion and add to pan, lower heat and fry until transparent, but not coloured.
- Return chicken to pan, add pineapple and juice, bring to boil add soy sauce
- Slake cornflour with 2 tablespoons water, add to pan, bring back to boil, stirring constantly.until thickened
- Serve with rice or noodle dish of choice.
- Also works with pork fillet.

Teriyaki-Lime Salmon

Ingredients:
- 10 ounces salmon fillets, 2 pieces (5 oz. each)
- 2 green onions, chopped
- 1 tablespoon fresh lime juice
- 1 tablespoon teriyaki sauce
- 1/2 teaspoon thyme
- 1 lime, cut into wedges

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 450 and spray a shallow baking dish with nonstick cooking oil. Place salmon in the dish.
- Stir together the green onions, lime juice, teriyaki sauce and thyme. Drizzle over the fish.
- Bake uncovered, until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. (Allow 5 minutes per half inch of thickness.)
- Serve with lime wedges.

Lemon Whipper Snappers

Ingredients:
- 1 pkg. lemon cake mix
- 1 egg
- 2 c. (4 1/2 oz.) whip cream
- 1/2 c. confectioners sugar

Directions:
- Mix first 3 ingredients.
- Shape into 1-inch balls.
- Roll in confectioners sugar. Bake at 350° for 10 to 12 minutes.

Algerian Chicken Stew

Ingredients:
- 3 cups chicken broth
- 1 chicken bouillon cube
- 2 cups cooked chicken, chopped
- 1 medium onion, chopped
- 2 cups fresh green beans, cut
- 2 carrots, sliced
- 1 teaspoon ground cumin
- 1 teaspoon basil
- 1 garlic clove, minced (optional)
- 2 bay leaves (optional)
- 1/2 teaspoon dried parsley (optional)
- salt
- pepper
- 2 medium tomatoes, chopped
- 2 small zucchini, sliced (or 1 medium)
- 1 (16 ounce) can garbanzo beans, drained (also known as chick-peas)
- 1/4 teaspoon ground red pepper (to taste)

Directions:
- In a large saucepan combine broth, bouillon, chopped chicken, onion, green beans, carrots, cumin, basil, garlic, bay leaves, parsley, salt and pepper.
- Bring to a boil; reduce heat, cover and cook about 8 minutes.
- Add tomatoes and zucchini and cook briefly.
- Add garbanzo beans and red pepper.
- Cover and cook until heated through.
- Serve over steaming bowls of couscous.

Chicken Tetrazzini

Ingredients:
- 5 lb. chicken
- 1 (8 oz.) pkg. 1/4-inch noodles
- 3 (5 oz.) jars pimento cheese spread
- 3 cans mushrooms (ends and pieces)
- 3 cans cream of mushroom soup
- 1 onion, diced

Directions:
- Cook chicken.
- Remove bones.
- Cook noodles for 8 minutes. Drain and rinse with very hot water.
- Add cheese immediately, stirring constantly.
- Add mushrooms, soup and onion.
- Bake in a 375° oven for 1 hour or more.
- Yields 18 servings.

Alfredo Linguine

Ingredients:
- 1 tbsp. I Can't Believe It's Not Butter! Spread
- 1/2 c. walnuts
- 1 large clove garlic
- 1 jar Bertolli Creamy Alfredo Sauce
- 8 oz. linguine

Directions:
- Melt spread in 2-quart saucepan over medium heat and cook walnuts 3 minutes or until golden.
- Stir in garlic and cook 30 seconds.
- Stir in sauce.
- Reduce heat to low and simmer, stirring occasionally, 3 minutes or until heated through.
- To serve, toss sauce with hot linguine.
- Sprinkle with additional chopped walnuts and garnish, if desired, with chopped fresh parsley.Per serving this recipe contains: Vitamin A 15%, Vitamin C 0%, Iron 15%

Garlicky Eggs

Ingredients:
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 6 large eggs
- 2 garlic cloves, chopped
- 12 teaspoon grated gingerroot
- 12 teaspoon cumin
- 12 teaspoon coriander
- 12 teaspoon salt
- 6 ounces chopped tomatoes
- fresh cilantro stem (to garnish)

Directions:
- Heat olive oil in non-stick skillet.
- Saute garlic and ginger one minute.
- Add spices, scrambled eggs and tomatoes and stir until soft set.
- Garnish with cilantro sprigs.

Baby Food Cake

Ingredients:
- 3 eggs, well beaten
- 2 cups sugar
- 1 1/4 cups oil
- 2 cups flour
- 2 teaspoons baking soda
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 2 teaspoons cinnamon
- 1 (4 ounce) jar applesauce baby food
- 1 (4 ounce) jar carrot baby food
- 1 (4 ounce) jar peach baby food
- Frosting
- 3 ounces cream cheese
- 3/8 cup butter
- 1 tablespoon milk
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 1 1/2 - 2 cups powdered sugar

Directions:
- Mix all the ingredients together well.
- Bake in lightly greased jelly roll pan at 350 degrees for 20 minutes.
- Frost with cream cheese frosting or dust with powdered sugar.

Old Fashion Tea Cakes

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. butter
- 6 or 7 eggs
- 10 c. plain flour
- 3 Tbsp. nutmeg
- 5 c. sugar
- 1/2 c. buttermilk
- 3 tsp. baking powder

Directions:
- Cream butter, sugar and nutmeg in bowl or pan until soft like ice cream.
- In separate bowl beat 6 or 7 eggs.
- Add beaten eggs to mixture.
- Add 1/2 cup buttermilk and flour.
- Chill dough before rolling out tea cakes.
- Bake at 375°.

Smoked Goose Or Duck Breasts

Ingredients:
- 1/4 cup brown sugar
- 1/4 cup salt
- 1 cup soy sauce
- tsp. onion powder
- 1 tsp. garlic powder
- 1/2 cup of sherry or white wine
- 2 tsp. ground ginger
- 1/2 cup orange juice
- 1 1/2 cups water
- Optional: Tabasco sauce, black or red pepper, mustard powder

Directions:
- If using oven only, add 2 tsp. liquid smoke to brine.

Preserved Lemons

Ingredients:
- 5 lemons
- 1/4 cup salt (I would use kosher)
- 1 cinnamon stick (optional)
- 3 cloves (optional)
- 5 -6 coriander seeds (optional)
- 3 -4 black peppercorns (optional)
- 1 bay leaf (optional)
- fresh lemon juice, not the bottled stuff,if needed

Directions:
- Quarter each lemon from top to 1/2 inch from bottom.
- Sprinkle with salt on exposed flesh and reshape fruit.
- Place 1 T of salt in the bottom of a sterilized one pint mason jar.
- Pack in the lemons, pushing down with addition and layering remaining salt and spices along the way.
- Press lemons down to release their juices.
- Add FRESH lemon juice to cover lemons if needed, leaving some head space.
- Top with a sterile lid, and shake jar well.
- Shake jar once every day, for 30 days, and then you're ready to use.
- Note---if you see a"lacy" white substance clinging to the lemon's don't worry, it's not harmful.
- You need to rinse your lemons anyway before using to remove the salty brine.

Fruity Chicken & Rice Salad

Ingredients:
- Dressing
- 1/3 cup red wine vinegar
- 2 tablespoons honey
- 1 tablespoon oil
- 1 teaspoon sugar
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- Salad
- 1 1/4 cups water
- 1/2 cup carrot, diced
- 1 1/2 cups instant brown rice
- 1/2 cup raisins
- 2 cups chicken, cooked and diced
- 1 cup red seedless grapes
- 2 tablespoons almonds, toasted and chopped
- 1 tablespoon parsley, chopped

Directions:
- For Dressing: Mix vinegar, honey, oil, sugar and salt in a small bowl and set aside.
- For Salad: Bring water, carrots and raisins to a boil in a medium saucepan.
- Stir in rice, return to a boil.
- Cover and reduce heat to medium and simmer for 5 minutes.
- Remove from heat and stir. Recover and let stand another 5 minutes.
- Place rice mixture into a pretty salad bowl and then add the chicken, grapes, almonds and parsley.
- Top with honey dressing and toss.
- Refrigerate at least one hour before serving.

Burrito Bake

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 1 can refried beans
- 1/2 c. water
- 1 1/2 c. Cheddar cheese
- 1/2 pkg. taco seasoning mix
- 1 c. Bisquick
- 16 oz. jar chunky salsa

Directions:
- Brown and drain ground beef.
- Add 1/4 cup of water to taco seasoning mix.
- Blend well and add to ground beef.
- Mix together the refried beans, Bisquick and 1/4 cup water.
- Spread in well-greased 9 x 13-inch baking dish.
- Then layer the seasoned meat and chunky salsa.
- On top, sprinkle Cheddar cheese and salsa, if any left.
- You may layer Cheddar cheese with meat and salsa. Bake for 35 to 40 minutes at 375°.
- Let sit a few minutes before serving.

Crunchy Hot Chicken Salad

Ingredients:
- 4 cups diced cooked chicken
- 1 1/2 cups celery, finely chopped
- 1 cup toasted slivered almonds
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 4 tablespoons grated onions
- 1 cup chopped green pepper
- 1 cup mayonnaise
- 4 tablespoons chopped pimiento
- 4 tablespoons lemon juice
- 1 (10 1/2 ounce) can cream of chicken soup
- 2 hard-boiled eggs
- 2 cups grated cheddar cheese
- crushed potato chips, for topping

Directions:
- Combine all ingredients except potato chips and cheese, blend well.
- Spoon into a lightly greased 3 quart shallow casserole dish.
- Top with 2 cups cheese.
- Bake at 350 for 30 mins.
- Put sprinkling of crushed potato chips over surface during last 10 minutes.

Dottie'S Hot Vegetable Casserole

Ingredients:
- 3 pkg. frozen vegetables (lima beans, green beans, corn)
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 tsp. garlic salt

Directions:
- Cook vegetables; drain.
- Put into casserole dish.
- Add salt and garlic salt.

Done Buttered Rolls

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 sticks butter or margarine, melted
- 1 (8 oz.) c. low-fat sour cream
- 2 c. self-rising flour

Directions:
- Heat oven to 400°.
- Mix all ingredients.
- Spoon into small muffin tins.
- Bake for about 15 minutes or until golden.
- Makes about 36.

Potato Casserole

Ingredients:
- 2 lb. pkg. hash brown potatoes, thawed
- 1 (16 oz.) sour cream
- 1/2 c. melted butter
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 2 c. grated Cheddar cheese
- 1 can Cheddar cheese soup

Directions:
- Mix 1/4 cup melted butter with all ingredients.
- Remaining 1/4 cup of butter combine with 2 cups corn flakes.
- Mix well and top casserole.
- Bake at 350° for 1 hour.

Chinese Chop Suey

Ingredients:
- 3/4 stick margarine
- 2 c. onions
- 2 c. celery
- 1 (28 oz.) can bean sprouts
- 2 c. chicken broth
- 1 to 2 c. diced chicken, cooked
- 6 Tbsp. soy sauce
- 6 Tbsp. cornstarch
- 2 Tbsp. sugar

Directions:
- Slice onions (long way).
- Cut celery into 1-inch pieces.
- Melt margarine; cook celery 5 to 10 minutes.
- Add onions; cook 5 minutes more.
- Add drained bean sprouts (drained well).
- Add 1 1/3 cups of broth and cover; cook for 20 minutes.
- Meanwhile, with leftover chicken broth (2/3 cup).
- Add the cornstarch, soy sauce and sugar.
- Add to bean sprout mixture and cook 10 minutes more, along with diced chicken.

Brauoterta – Icelandic Style Sandwich: Tuna & Egg

Ingredients:
- 2/3 cup mayonnaise
- 1/3 cup sour cream
- 5 hard-boiled eggs
- 7 ounces canned tuna
- 1 medium onion
- garlic powder, to taste
- lettuce
- tomatoes

Directions:
- Mix together mayo, sour cream and garlic powder. Mash the eggs with a fork and drain the tuna well. Chop the onion very finely. Mix everything together and layer between the bread slices. Add lettuce, tomato as desired.

Paula Deen's Eggs in a Nest

Ingredients:
- 6 tablespoons melted butter, divided
- 1 garlic clove, minced
- 3 sheets phyllo dough, thawed
- 4 eggs
- 1 tablespoon water
- 2 tablespoons butter
- 34 cup diced cooked ham
- 12 cup grated cheddar cheese
- salt and pepper

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 375 degrees.
- Butter 4 muffin cups.
- Combine 4 T butter and garlic.
- On a cutting board, stack the phyllo sheets and cut into fourths, forming 12 squares.
- Cover with a damp paper towel when not in use because it dries out quickly.
- Crinkle one sheet into the bottom of each tin; it may tear and that's ok. Brush with butter.
- Add another sheet and brush with butter.
- Repeat a third time.
- Bake for 10 minutes.
- Carefully remove from tin and cool on rack.
- Beat eggs and 1 T water.
- Place 2 T butter in skillet and add ham.
- Add eggs and scramble to desired doneness.
- Sprinkle with cheese and stir until melted.
- Spoon in phyllo cups and serve.

Hawaiian Teriyaki Marinade

Ingredients:
- 1/4 cup brown sugar
- 1/4 cup vegetable oil (I use canola)
- 1/4 cup soy sauce (I prefer the light soy)
- 1/4 cup dry sherry
- 1 teaspoon dry mustard
- 1 teaspoon ground ginger
- 1 teaspoon minced garlic
- 2 tablespoons molasses

Directions:
- Combine all ingredients. Marinate meat of your choice for several hours. Our favorite is steak tips which we marinate for at least 6-8 hours, but I prefer to marinate it over-night.

Cheese Straws

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. sharp Cheddar cheese, grated
- 1 stick margarine
- 1 egg
- 1 Tbsp. cold water
- 1 3/4 c. flour
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. red pepper
- 1/2 tsp. paprika

Directions:
- Beat together margarine, cheese, egg and water.
- Combine flour, salt, red pepper and paprika and add this dry mixture to the cheese mixture (add in 3 additions).
- Set cookie press on thick, and put mixture through cookie press; or roll mixture and cut in circles. Bake at 325° for 15 minutes.

Italian Chicken 

Ingredients:
- 	2 pounds of boneless/skinless chicken breasts
- 	2 garlic cloves, minced
- 	1 packet ranch dressing mix
- 	1/2 Tbsp. chili powder
- 	1/2 cup water*
- 	1 cup Italian dressing (Don't put in the freezer bag)

Directions:
- Place all the ingredients in the freezer bag.
- *If you use pre-frozen chicken there is a layer of ice, so you do not need to add the water.
- 
- Can be cooked on the stove-top at medium heat for 15 minutes if the sauce is drained after thawing
- Can be baked in the oven for 35-40 minutes in the sauce at 375 F.
- Also, can be cooked in the crock-pot for 6-8 hours on low.

Rice Pudding In A Crock-Pot

Ingredients:
- 1 c. rice
- 1 c. water
- 7 c. milk
- 3 eggs, beaten
- 1 c. sugar
- 2 tsp. vanilla
- 2 tsp. cinnamon
- 1 tsp. salt

Directions:
- On stove, cook rice in water until water is evaporated.

Candied Walnuts

Ingredients:
- 1/2 cup powdered sugar
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon ground red pepper
- 4 cups water
- 2 1/4 cups (8 ounces) walnut halves

Directions:
- Combine first 3 ingredients in a medium bowl.
- Bring 4 cups water to a boil in a medium saucepan. Add walnuts, and cook 3 minutes; drain. Immediately place walnuts in bowl with sugar mixture, tossing to coat. Place walnuts in a single layer on a lightly greased jelly-roll pan.
- Bake at 350° for 20 to 22 minutes or until deep golden brown. Cool completely in pan. Store in an airtight container.
- Laura Werlin, The New American Cheese

Cocotini

Ingredients:
- 1 ounce white rum
- 1 ounce triple sec
- 1 ounce Malibu rum
- ice

Directions:
- Shake in a shaker and pour in martini glass.

The Ultimate Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 box yellow cake mix
- 3/4 c. oil
- 4 eggs
- 1 small can mandarin oranges, juice and all
- 1 large can crushed pineapple
- 1 box instant vanilla pudding
- 1 lb. container Cool Whip

Directions:
- Mix first four ingredients well.
- Bake at 350° for 30-35 minutes.
- When cool, poke cake full of holes.
- Drain juice from pineapple and pour over cake.
- Mix pineapple, pudding, and Cool Whip together and spread over cake.

Berried Treasure

Ingredients:
- 1 8 -ounce package cream cheese, at room temperature
- 1/2 cup heavy cream
- 1/2 cup confectioners' sugar
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1 cup chocolate-hazelnut spread (such as Nutella)
- 2 cups raspberries (1 pint)
- Short bread cookies, sliced baguette or ladyfingers, for serving

Directions:
- Beat the cream cheese, heavy cream, sugar and vanilla in a bowl with a mixer until light and fluffy, about 3 minutes.
- Spoon 1/4 cup chocolate-hazelnut spread each into two 12-ounce glass or plastic jars and smooth to make an even layer.
- Divide half of the cream cheese mixture between the 2 jars, then top each with a handful of raspberries.
- Repeat with the remaining chocolate-hazelnut spread, cream cheese mixture and raspberries.
- Serve with cookies or baguette slices, or cover the jars with lids and pack them to go.
- (The spread can be made the night before; cover, refrigerate and return to room temperature before serving.)
- Photograph by Sam Kaplan

Kevin's Aloo Ki Tikya

Ingredients:
- 400 g potatoes
- 1 tablespoon lemon juice
- 1 tablespoon chopped mint
- 12 teaspoon salt
- 1 small onion, finely chopped
- 2 teaspoons ground coriander
- 1 teaspoon cumin seed
- 14 teaspoon chili powder
- 2 green chilies, chopped
- 3 tablespoons fresh coriander, chopped
- 1 medium egg
- 2 tablespoons cooking oil

Directions:
- Peel and dice potatoes then boil until tender.
- Meanwhile mix together lemon juice,mint salt and onion and set to one side.
- Mash potatoes so that they are still a little lumpy then blend in the ground coriander, cummin seeds, chilli powder, green chillies and chopped coriander.
- Divide mixture into 8 then roll into balls.
- Make an indentation in each ball and fill with a little of the mint and onion mixture.
- Cover the dent then press each ball into a flat patty Whisk and season the egg and dip the patties into it before frying them in the oil.
- Serve with a mixed salad and Kevin's Mint Yogurt Sauce.

Easy Eggs Benedict

Ingredients:
- 1 can cream of celery, chicken or mushroom soup
- 1/3 c. milk
- 6 slices ham (thin)
- 6 slices buttered toast or English muffin halves
- 6 eggs, poached
- 1 tsp. minced parsley

Directions:
- Blend soup and milk; heat. Place slice of ham on each slice of toast/muffin half. Top with poached egg. Pour sauce over eggs. Sprinkle with parsley.

Refrigerator Rolls

Ingredients:
- 1 c. shortening
- 3/4 c. sugar
- 1 c. boiling water
- 1 tsp. salt
- 2 eggs
- 3 pkg. yeast
- 1 c. warm water
- 5 c. flour

Directions:
- Cream shortening and sugar with electric mixer; add boiling water and mix until shortening melts.
- Add salt and the eggs, one at a time, beating well.
- Add yeast which had been dissolved in warm water.
- Add flour, 1/2 cup at a time.
- Place in well-greased mixing bowl, cover and refrigerate.
- (This will keep several days in refrigerator.)

Chocolate Sour Cream Fudge

Ingredients:
- 2 c. sugar
- 1 c. sour cream
- 2 sq. chocolate
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 2 Tbsp. light corn syrup
- 2 Tbsp. margarine
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1/2 c. chopped nuts

Directions:
- In heavy 2-quart saucepan with cover, combine sugar, sour cream, chocolate, salt and syrup. Cook and stir over medium heat until mixture boils. Cover and cook 3 minutes. Uncover and cook, stirring frequently, until candy thermometer registers 234° to 240°. Remove from heat. Stir in margarine and vanilla. Cool to 110° without stirring. Beat until creamy and has lost its gloss. Stir in nuts and pour in buttered dish. Chill until hard.

Ensalada De Palmitos (Hearts Of Palm Salad)

Ingredients:
- 3 garlic cloves
- 2 (28 ounce) can hearts of palm or (14 ounce) cans hearts of palm, drained
- 1/3 cup extra virgin olive oil (plus or minus, see description)
- 1 large vine-ripened tomatoes, seeded and diced
- 1/2 cup scallion, finely chopped (whites of the scallion)
- 1 dash salt (optional)
- mixed greens (optional)

Directions:
- Using a food processor, puree the garlic into a paste. Add hearts of palm and process to a course puree. With the machine on, add oil in a thin stream until mixture is a velvety puree.
- Transfer the puree to a serving bowl and stir in tomatoes and scallions. Adjust salt if needed.
- Let sit at room temperature and serve within an hour. If topping salad greens chill mixture in refrigerator.

Quick Fruit Dessert

Ingredients:
- 1 large can fruit cocktail (undrained)
- 1 small box instant vanilla pudding
- any fruit

Directions:
- Mix together thoroughly and refrigerate until thick.
- You may also add additional fruit, such as mandarin oranges, sliced peaches or bananas.
- Drain any additional fruit you add.

Hush Puppies

Ingredients:
- 2 c. self-rising meal
- 1/2 tsp. soda
- 1 c. plain flour
- 2 Tbsp. olive oil
- 1 large onion
- buttermilk

Directions:
- Mix all together; add enough milk to make it thick enough to make about 1 1/2-inch balls.
- Cook in deep fat until done.

Coconut Custard Pie

Ingredients:
- 3 eggs
- 3/4 c. sugar
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- dash of nutmeg
- 2 c. milk
- 1/2 c. coconut
- vanilla flavoring

Directions:
- Slightly beat eggs and add other ingredients. Mix well. Put in 2 unbaked pie shells. Bake at 400° for 35 to 45 minutes.

Apple Crisp

Ingredients:
- 4 c. sliced apples (about 4 c.)
- 1/4 c. brown sugar
- 1/4 c. flour
- 1/4 c. uncooked oats
- 1/3 tsp. cinnamon
- 1/4 tsp. nutmeg
- 2 Tbsp. soft margarine

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 375°.
- Oil 8-inch square pan.
- Place apple slices in pan.
- Mix remaining ingredients and sprinkle over apples.
- Bake 30 minutes or until apples are tender.
- Serve plain or add yogurt or ice cream or whipped cream.

Swiss Cheese Bake

Ingredients:
- 8 boneless chicken breasts
- 8 slices Swiss cheese
- 1 can cream of chicken soup
- 2 cups Pepperidge Farms herb season stuffing mix
- 1/2 cup butter

Directions:
- Grease 9 x 13 inch pan.
- Single layer chicken.
- Top each piece with a slice of cheese.
- Spoon soup over the chicken.
- Melt butter and mix with stuffing.
- Sprinkle over chicken.
- Bake uncovered 45 to 55 minutes at 350 degrees.

Zesty Home Fries

Ingredients:
- 2 lb. red potatoes (about 6), cut into large chunks King Sooper's 5 lb For $1.88 thru 02/09
- 1/2 cup KRAFT Lite Zesty Italian Dressing
- 1/2 tsp. black pepper
- 1 large red onion, cut into chunks
- 1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley
- 2 slices OSCAR MAYER Bacon, cooked, crumbled
- 1 cup KRAFT 2% Milk Shredded Sharp Cheddar Cheese

Directions:
- Heat oven to 450F.
- Toss potatoes with dressing and pepper in 15x10x1-inch pan sprayed with cooking spray.
- Spread into single layer.
- Bake 40 min.
- or until vegetables are tender, stirring in onions after 20 min.
- Sprinkle with parsley and bacon; stir.
- Top with cheese.
- Bake 2 min.
- or until cheese is melted.

Rachel'S Chicken Fajitas

Ingredients:
- 2 boxes Tyson Time Trimmers chicken
- 1 to 2 pkg. fajita wraps
- 1 pkg. dry mix sauce for fajitas
- 1 pt. sour cream
- 1 jar Tostitos mild salsa
- 1 pkg. shredded cheese (optional)

Directions:
- Put 1 tablespoon oil and
- chicken in skillet to let chicken thaw. Add dry sauce mix. Add 1/2 cup water. Add salsa. Add sour cream. Microwave wraps. Fill wraps with sauce made. Put in baking pan; sprinkle cheese on top. Bake 10 to 15 minutes at 350°.

Sour Cream Jumbles

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. shortening
- 1 c. sugar
- 1 egg
- 2 1/2 c. flour
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1/2 tsp. soda
- 3 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 tsp. mace
- 1 c. sour cream
- 1/2 c. chopped nuts
- 1 tsp. vanilla

Directions:
- Cream shortening and sugar together until creamy.
- Add egg and beat well.
- Add sifted dry ingredients alternately with sour cream.
- Add nuts and flavoring.
- Drop by teaspoons on greased cookie sheet.
- Bake at 375° for 12 to 15 minutes.
- Makes 40 cookies.

Cream Cheese Pie

Ingredients:
- 1 graham cracker crust
- 1/2 pt. whipping cream, whipped firm
- 3 oz. cream cheese, softened
- 1/2 c. powdered sugar
- 1/8 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 can pie filling (blueberry or cherry are best)

Directions:
- Whip cream until firm and set aside.
- Whip the next 4 ingredients.
- Fold whipped cream into mixture.
- Spread into crust. Pour pie filling over top.
- Refrigerate 6 hours or overnight.

Katie Bars

Ingredients:
- 1 box devil's food cake mix
- 13 cup butter, soft
- 1 egg
- 1 cup seedless raspberry preserves
- 1 (8 ounce) package cream cheese, soft
- 1 (12 ounce) bag white chocolate chips
- 12 cup semi-sweet chocolate chips
- 2 tablespoons butter

Directions:
- Oven@ 350 Combine base ingredients until crumbly.
- Press into an 11x15 pan.
- Bake 8 to 12 minutes until crust appears dry, but soft.
- Immediately spread raspberry preserves over warm crust.
- Melt white chocolate morsels in the microwave, stirring constantly until melted.
- Combine with soft cream cheese using a hand mixer.
- Spread over raspberry glaze.
- In the microwave melt the 2 tablespoons butter with the semi-sweet chocolate chips.
- Drizzle over cream cheese layer.
- Cool completely before cutting into bars.

Palacinka

Ingredients:
- 2 eggs
- 3/4 c. flour
- 1/4 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 c. water

Directions:
- Add more flour; sift it in, if batter is thin.

Chicken Breast Supreme

Ingredients:
- 4 boneless chicken breasts
- 1/2 c. sour cream
- 1 Tbsp. chicken bouillon
- 1/4 tsp. paprika
- 1/4 tsp. sage
- 1/4 tsp. rosemary
- 1/4 tsp. thyme
- 1 tsp. garlic powder or minced garlic
- fresh ground pepper to taste
- 1/2 c. Ritz cracker crumbs (fresh)

Directions:
- Whisk sour cream, chicken bouillon, paprika, sage, rosemary, thyme, garlic and pepper.
- Coat chicken in mixture, then roll in cracker crumbs.
- Bake in baking dish sprayed with nonstick spray at 350° until chicken is done.

Strawberry Punch

Ingredients:
- 1 (16 oz.) pkg. frozen strawberries, sliced
- 1 (16 oz.) big red soda, chilled
- 2 qt. Sprite, chilled
- 1/2 gal. strawberry ice cream (optional)

Directions:
- Chill bowl.
- Mix Big Red and Sprite.
- Add strawberries, partially thawed.
- Serve.
- Scoops of ice cream may be added to punch before serving.

Cranberry-Orange Nut Bread

Ingredients:
- 2 cups all-purpose flour
- 3/4 cup sugar
- 1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder
- 3/4 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/4 cup butter, softened
- 1 tablespoon orange zest
- 3/4 cup orange juice
- 1 egg
- 1 cup of chopped cranberries
- 1/2 cup of chopped nuts

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350°F.
- Grease bottom of 9 x 5 x 3-inch loaf pan.
- Combine flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, and baking soda; cut in the butter until crumbly.
- Add orange peel, orange juice and egg, and stir just until moistened.
- Mix in cranberries and nuts; pour into prepared pan and bake 55 to 65 minutes, or until wooden toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.
- Cool completely before cutting.

Spicy Beef Sandwich

Ingredients:
- seeded French roll
- rare roast beef, sliced
- garlic butter, with capers
- 1 leaf romaine lettuce

Directions:
- Spoon garlic/caper butter on cut surfaces of the Roll.
- Add beef and lettuce and cut on the diagonal.

Sausage Balls

Ingredients:
- 3 c. Bisquick mix
- 1 lb. grated Cheddar cheese
- 1 lb. ground sausage (hot or mild)

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients together and make balls about 3/4-inch in diameter.
- Put in freezer at least 1 hour.
- Bake at 425° until golden, about 15 minutes.

Fruit Magic

Ingredients:
- 1 box Jiffy cake mix
- 1 can pie filling
- 1/2 stick oleo

Directions:
- Put can of fruit in an 8 x 8-inch baking dish.
- Sprinkle cake mix over fruit.
- Dot with oleo.
- Bake 40 to 45 minutes at 350°.

Veronica's Chocolate Peppermint Shake

Ingredients:
- 12 cup sugar
- 2 cups milk
- 1 tablespoon cocoa powder
- 1 teaspoon peppermint extract
- 2 cups chocolate ice cream

Directions:
- Mix the sugar completely in the milk.
- Blend in the cocoa powder and peppermint.
- (use either a blender or a hand held mixer).
- Whip in Ice Cream and serve very cold.

Cheeseburger Pie

Ingredients:
- 1 c. tomato sauce
- 1/2 green pepper, diced
- 1/2 pkg. Sweet 'N Low (not Equal)
- 1/4 tsp. garlic powder
- 1/2 c. diced onion
- 1 pkg. instant beef broth
- 1/2 tsp. chili powder
- 8 oz. cooked ground beef
- 2 c. cooked rice
- 4 oz. shredded cheese

Directions:
- Combine first 7 ingredients.
- Simmer for 10 minutes.
- Add beef, 3 ounces cheese and rice.
- Stir until cheese melts.
- Place in a 8 x 8-inch pan sprayed with Pam.
- Top with remaining cheese. Bake for 30 minutes at 350°.
- Makes 4 servings.

Simply Roasted Cauliflower

Ingredients:
- 1 head fresh cauliflower
- 2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil
- 1 teaspoon kosher salt
- 1 teaspoon fresh ground black pepper

Directions:
- Preheat the oven to 400 degrees.
- Wash and separate the cauliflower into flowerettes and dry.
- Toss with the olive oil and salt and pepper.
- Place in a small-medium baking pan with sides.
- Roast in the oven and toss every 15 minutes or so for 45 minutes or until browned on the edges.

Pork Chop Casserole

Ingredients:
- 5 boneless pork chops
- 2 cans cream of mushroom soup
- 6 large potatoes, sliced thickly

Directions:
- Slice potatoes, put in casserole dish, then mix up the soup like you would for soup (with milk or water).
- Pour over potatoes. Wash off the pork chops and place them on top of the potatoes. Cover tightly with foil and bake at 350° for 2 hours.
- Serves 5 people.

Doritos Chicken Casserole

Ingredients:
- 1 chicken
- 1 large bag Doritos
- 1 can whole kernel corn
- grated cheese
- 1 can cream of chicken soup
- 1 small onion
- 1 can cream of mushroom soup
- 1 c. milk
- 1 can Ro-Tel tomatoes

Directions:
- Boil and debone chicken.
- Layer chicken, Doritos, cheese, onion and corn in casserole dish.
- Mix chicken soup, mushroom soup, milk and tomatoes.
- Pour over casserole.
- Top with cheese. Bake at 375° until done, about 30 minutes.

Sauce Soubise (Onion Sauce)

Ingredients:
- 2 white onions, chopped finely
- 4 tablespoons butter (2 for cooking the onion & 2 to make the roux)
- 2 tablespoons flour
- 1 cup milk
- salt & pepper, to taste
- 3 tablespoons heavy cream

Directions:
- Cook the onions in 2 T of butter until they are very soft (about 12 minutes). They should not brown. (In France they puree the onions for a more refined sauce.) At this point it's your choice.
- In a saucepan, melt the other 2 T of butter & incorporate the flour, stirring over low heat for 2 minutes.
- Gradually whisk in the milk, blending well after each addition. Cook the sauce over low to medium heat until it thickens & comes just to a boil. Remove from heat & stir in the cooked onions & heavy cream.

Chicken Delight

Ingredients:
- 8 chicken breasts (without bones and skin), halved
- 2 cans cream of chicken soup
- 1 large can evaporated milk
- Swiss cheese
- 14 oz. pkg. Pepperidge Farm herb seasoned stuffing cubes
- butter (about 1/2 stick)

Directions:
- Mix soup and milk until smooth.
- Put a slice of Swiss cheese on top of each chicken breast.
- Pour some of the soup mixture over all.
- On top of this cover with the stuffing cubes.
- Put rest of the soup mixture on top. Dot with butter. Cover with foil and bake at 325° for 1 1/2 hours.
- Uncover and bake 15 minutes.

Apple Cake

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. shortening
- 1 1/2 c. sugar
- 2 1/2 c. flour
- 3 eggs
- 1 tsp. soda
- 2 1/2 c. apples
- 1 tsp. cinnamon and nutmeg
- 1 c. nuts and raisins

Directions:
- Cream shortening and sugar; add eggs and mix in all ingredients.
- Pour into greased loaf pans.
- Bake very slow.
- Keep pan of water below cake while baking.

berries in syrup

Ingredients:
- 12 cup sugar
- 2 cups extra heavy malaga wine
- 3 cups raspberries
- 3 cups blackberries

Directions:
- cook sugar in a heavy pot over low heat until melted and golden.
- continue cooking until darker brown and remove from heat.
- carefully add malaga wine return to heat and simmer until caramelized sugar is dissolved and mixture reduces to 1 1/2 cup.
- remove and cool.
- mix berries and divide between 8 cups, pour syrup over berries, serve.

Tarragon Chicken And Vegetables

Ingredients:
- 1/2 cup white vinegar
- 1/2 cup vegetable oil
- 2 teaspoons soy sauce
- 1 garlic clove, minced
- 1 1/2 teaspoons chopped fresh tarragon
- 2 whole chicken breasts, halved
- 3 medium carrots, cut into 1 inch pieces
- 1 medium zucchini, cut into 1 inch pieces
- 1 large onion, cut into 1 inch pieces

Directions:
- For marinade, combine vinegar, oil, soy sauce, garlic and tarragon.
- Reserve 1/4 cup of marinade.
- Place chicken in resealable plastic bag, turn to coat chicken.
- Marinate in refrigerator 1 to 12 hours.
- Preheat oven to 375 degrees.
- Drain chicken, discard marinade.
- Place chicken in shallow baking pan.
- Toss vegetables with reserved 1/4 cup marinade.
- Place in 1 1/2 quart casserole dish, cover.
- Bake chicken and vegetables 25 minutes.
- Remove cover from vegetables.
- Bake 20 minutes more or until chicken is tender and no longer pick and vegetables are tender.

Herbed Potatoes And Onions

Ingredients:
- 3 medium red potatoes, thinly sliced
- 1 medium onion, thinly sliced
- 1/2 teaspoon Italian seasoning
- 1/8 teaspoon pepper
- 2 tablespoons reduced-fat margarine, melted

Directions:
- In an ungreased 2-qt. microwave-safe baking dish, layer half the potato and onion slices. Combine Italian seasoning and pepper; sprinkle half over the onion and potato layer. Drizzle with 1 tablespoon margarine. Repeat layers. Cover with vented plastic wrap. Microwave on high for 7-8 minutes or until potatoes are tender turning dish after 4 minutes.

Ice Cream Sandwiches

Ingredients:
- 1 qt. vanilla ice cream
- 18 graham crackers
- 1 can frozen tangerine or orange juice
- 1 c. semi-sweet chocolate mini chips

Directions:
- Soften ice cream at room temperature.
- Arrange crackers in 9-inch pan.
- Stir juice into ice cream.
- Fold in chocolate chips. Spoon evenly over crackers.
- Top with remaining crackers.
- Cover and freeze about 2 hours.
- Makes 9 sandwiches.

Strawberry Onion Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 bunch romaine, torn
- 1 pt. fresh strawberries, sliced
- 1 small red onion, thinly sliced
- 1 c. mayonnaise
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 1/4 c. milk
- 2 Tbsp. cider vinegar
- 1 Tbsp. poppy seed

Directions:
- In a large bowl, combine romaine, onion and strawberries. Combine all ingredients in a small bowl or jar with a lid.
- Mix well.
- Pour over salad and toss.
- Serve immediately.
- Serves 6 to 8.

Hot Beer Soup (Heisse Biersuppe)

Ingredients:
- 3 (12 ounce) bottles light beer
- 1/2 cup sugar
- 4 egg yolks
- 1/3 cup sour cream
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- fresh ground pepper

Directions:
- Pour beer and sugar into a heavy 4 to 5 quart saucepan.
- Bring to a boil over high heat, stir constantly until sugar is dissolved, then remove from heat.
- In a small bowl, whisk egg yolks and beat in the sour cream a little at a time. Stir about 1/4 cup of the hot beer into the mix then whisk it into the beer. Add cinnamon, salt and grindings of pepper.
- Return to heat and cook stirring constantly until it thickens slightly. Do NOT let it boil or it could curdle.
- Serve.

Low Fat Chicken Stroganoff

Ingredients:
- 2 boneless skinless chicken breasts
- 2 cups portabella mushrooms, sliced
- 1 medium white onion, diced
- 1 (10 1/2 ounce) can fat-free cream of mushroom soup
- 8 ounces fat free cream cheese
- 1 cup nonfat beef broth
- 1 tablespoon onion powder
- 1 teaspoon garlic powder
- 1 teaspoon browning sauce
- 12 teaspoon pepper
- 12 teaspoon salt

Directions:
- Cut chicken and cream cheese into 1" chunks.
- Saute the mushrooms and onions until soft.
- Combine all ingredients in slow cooker.
- Stir to mix well.
- Cook over low for 6-8 hours or over high for 4 hours.
- Serve over rice, couscous or noodles.

Double Lime Punch

Ingredients:
- 1/2 pt. lime sherbet
- 6 oz. frozen limeade concentrate
- 14 oz. ginger ale, chilled
- 2 c. water

Directions:
- In a punch bowl, stir all ingredients together.
- Makes 10 servings.

Grainola Cereal

Ingredients:
- 4 c. rolled oats
- 3/4 c. wheat germ
- 1/2 c. brown sugar
- 1/4 c. salad oil
- 1/4 c. honey

Directions:
- Mix in microwave bowl. Coat everything thoroughly with the honey. Cook in microwave 6 minutes. Stir every 2 minutes. Put out on cookie sheet to cool. Store in plastic airtight bag or container.

Asparagus

Ingredients:
- 1 pound asparagus
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- Salt and pepper, to taste

Directions:
- Boil asparagus for 3 to 5 minutes.
- Add olive oil and salt and pepper, to taste.

Corn Flake Candy

Ingredients:
- 1 c. white Karo syrup
- 1 c. sugar
- 1 c. peanut butter
- 6 c. corn flakes

Directions:
- Mix first 3 ingredients and cook until peanut butter and sugar are dissolved.
- Add corn flakes.
- Spread in buttered pan.
- Cut in squares when cool.

Corn Meal Muffins

Ingredients:
- 2 c. self-rising meal
- 1 egg
- 1 tsp. baking powder
- 1 tsp. sugar
- 1 c. buttermilk

Directions:
- Mix the meal, baking powder and sugar, then add egg and buttermilk.
- Mix well.
- Bake in well-greased muffin tins at 450° until brown, approximately 30 minutes.

Burrito Casserole

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 lb. ground meat
- 1 small clove garlic, chopped
- 1 can chicken and rice soup
- 1 pkg. enchilada sauce mix
- 2 chicken bouillon cubes
- flour tortillas
- 1 large onion, chopped
- 1 can Ro-Tel tomatoes
- 1 can chili beans
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 carton sour cream
- grated cheese

Directions:
- Brown meat, onion and garlic.
- Add soup, enchilada sauce mix, bouillon cubes, chili beans, salt and Ro-Tel tomatoes.
- Mix well and simmer for 10 minutes.
- Put half of mixture in baking dish. Top with tortillas torn into bite size pieces, then layer of sour cream, then grated cheese.
- Repeat layers.
- Bake for 15 minutes at 375°.

Fettuccine With Catfish in Peppercorn Sauce

Ingredients:
- 2 teaspoons butter
- 3 green onions, minced
- 2 teaspoons fresh coarse ground black pepper (to taste)
- 12 cup dry white wine
- 3 catfish fillets, cut in thin strips and patted dry
- 34 cup milk
- 34 cup whipping cream
- 14 teaspoon nutmeg
- 12 teaspoon salt
- 1 teaspoon fresh lemon juice
- 8 ounces fettuccine, cooked and drained
- chopped parsley or chives (to garnish)
- parmesan cheese (optional)

Directions:
- In a heavy skillet over medium heat, melt butter.
- Cook green onions and pepper for 1 minute.
- Add the wine and catfish strips, stirring gently to coat catfish on all sides, cooking almost through.
- Add the milk, cream, nutmeg and salt, continuing to stir.
- Add the lemon juice and stir constantly while the sauce thickens.
- Check the seasonings and adjust if necessary.
- Serve immediately tossed with the fettuccine.
- Sprinkle each serving with parsley or chives and cheese.

Christmas Cookies

Ingredients:
- 1 c. shortening
- 2 c. sugar
- 2 eggs
- 2 1/2 c. flour
- 2 tsp. baking powder

Directions:
- Sift together flour and baking powder.
- If not stiff enough yet, add more flour.
- Add flavoring of your choice, about 1 tablespoon.
- Put in oven for about 10 minutes.

Dressing

Ingredients:
- 1 large potato, grated
- 1 large onion, chopped
- 2/3 to 3/4 c. loaf bread, minus crust
- 2 eggs
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/2 to 1 c. milk
- 6 stalks celery, chopped
- 1 pkg. corn bread mix, baked
- 1 lb. bulk sausage
- 2 Tbsp. poultry seasoning
- pepper to taste
- 1 can chicken or turkey broth

Directions:
- Crumble breads up; add enough milk to moisten.
- Add remaining ingredients and saute until onion and celery are tender.
- Place in big casserole.
- Bake at 350° for 1 to 2 hours.

California Bundt Cake

Ingredients:
- 3 c. sifted flour
- 1 tsp. cinnamon
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. baking soda
- 2 c. sugar
- 2 c. diced bananas
- 1 1/2 c. cooking oil
- 1 1/2 tsp. vanilla
- 3 eggs
- 1 (8 oz.) can crushed pineapple, undrained

Directions:
- Mix dry
- ingredients
- well.
- Add bananas, oil, vanilla, eggs and pineapple with juice.
- Stir to blend well, but do not beat. Pour into a greased and floured Bundt pan and bake in a preheated 350° oven for
- an
- hour and 20 minutes or until cake tests done. Cool
- in
- pan
- on rack completely before removing cake from pan.

Chocolate Chip Cookies

Ingredients:
- 1 c. sugar
- 1 c. brown sugar
- 1 1/3 c. Crisco
- 2 eggs
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 3 c. flour
- 1 tsp. baking soda
- 1 tsp. salt

Directions:
- Blend sugar, brown sugar and Crisco together.
- Add eggs and vanilla.
- Add flour, baking soda and salt.
- Mix together and drop by teaspoonfuls on an ungreased cookie sheet.
- Bake at 350°. Watch carefully and remove when lightly browned.

fiesta shrimp creole

Ingredients:
- 1 tbsp oil
- 1 tbsp flour
- 1 small green pepper, chopped
- 2 stalks of celery, chopped
- 2 clove garlic, minced
- 1 jar of thick n' chunky salsa
- 1 can tomato sauce
- 1 1/2 lb cleaned shrimp
- 4 cup hot cooked rice

Directions:
- mix the oil and flour in a saucepan.
- cook on medium heat for 6-8 minutes, or until browned.
- stir it occasionally.
- add celery, green pepper and garlic, cook & stir for 4 minutes or until tender.
- stir in the salsa and tomato sauce, let it simmer for 10 minutes, stir occasionally
- add the shrimp and cook for 6-8 more minutes or until the shrimp is cooked.
- serve over the rice

Low-Fat Potato Bacon Soup

Ingredients:
- 2 onions, chopped
- 1/2 c. chopped Canadian bacon or turkey ham
- 2 c. water
- 4 potatoes, cubed
- 12 oz. evaporated milk
- 1/2 oz. pkg. butter flavor seasoning mix
- pepper

Directions:
- Cook onions and bacon until tender.
- Stir in water and potatoes.
- Boil.
- Reduce heat.
- Slightly mash a few potatoes. Stir in milk, seasoning and pepper to taste.

Super Easy Shepherd's Pie

Ingredients:
- 1 lb ground beef
- 1 (15 ounce) can creamed corn
- 5 potatoes
- 14 cup milk
- 3 tablespoons butter
- black pepper

Directions:
- Peel& boil potatoes until tender.
- While potatoes are cooking brown the ground beef& drain it and dump it into the bottom of a pie plate.
- Add pepper to taste on top of the beef.
- Open the can of corn& dump it on top of the pepper& beef.
- Then once the potatoes are tender drain& add butter& milk and mash.
- Then spoon them on top of the corn.
- Bake at 350 for 30 minutes & enjoy!

Pound Cake Deluxe

Ingredients:
- 8 large eggs
- 1 lb. butter
- 2 3/4 c. sugar
- 3 1/2 c. flour, sifted
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 8 Tbsp. coffee cream

Directions:
- Beat egg whites and add 6 tablespoons of original sugar; set aside.
- Cream butter and sugar; add egg yolks, two at a time. Alternate flour with cream; fold in beaten egg whites.
- Add vanila. Bake in stem pan 1 hour 35 minutes in 300° oven.

Low Carb Tipsy Tomato Soup

Ingredients:
- 14 onion, minced
- 2 tablespoons butter
- 14 cup vodka
- 1 tablespoon crushed garlic
- 1 (15 ounce) can tomato sauce
- 12 cup heavy cream
- 2 teaspoons Splenda sugar substitute
- salt and pepper, to taste

Directions:
- Saute the onions and butter for 5 minutes over medium-high heat.
- Add the vodka (remove pan from flame, for safety, if using gas stove) and reduce the heat to medium for 10 minutes.
- Add the garlic and cook for 5 minutes.
- Add the tomato sauce, cream and Splenda; bring to simmer and serve.

Spicy Brown Sugar Carrots

Ingredients:
- 2 pounds carrots, peeled and cut on the bias into 2 1/2-inch pieces
- 1/4 cup apple cider
- 1/4 cup light brown sugar
- 1/2 teaspoon pumpkin pie spice
- 1/4 teaspoon chili powder
- 2 tablespoons butter
- Salt and freshly ground black pepper
- 2 tablespoons freshly chopped parsley leaves, for garnish

Directions:
- Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil over medium heat and add the carrots.
- Cook for 2 minutes, then drain in a colander and set aside.
- In a medium-size pot combine all the remaining ingredients, except the parsley, and bring to a simmer over low heat.
- Add the drained carrots and toss to combine.
- Simmer on low heat for 5 minutes to incorporate flavors.
- Transfer to a serving bowl, garnish with parsley and serve.

TANG Banana Shake

Ingredients:
- 1/2 cup milk
- 1/3 cup water
- 1/4 cup TANG Orange Flavor Drink Mix
- 1 banana, cut into chunks
- 1/2 cup ice cubes

Directions:
- Blend milk, water and drink mix in blender until mix is dissolved.
- Add bananas and ice; blend on high speed until thickened and smooth.
- Serve immediately.

Browned Butter Frosting

Ingredients:
- 1/2 cup butter or margarine
- 3 cups sifted powdered sugar
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract

Directions:
- Cook butter in a small heavy saucepan over medium heat, stirring constantly, 4 to 5 minutes or until golden brown. Add powdered sugar and vanilla, beating with a wooden spoon until spreading consistency is reached (add water to thin, if necessary).

Five Spice Salmon With Warm Potato Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 1/4 lb baby potatoes, washed, halved if large
- 4 (5 oz) salmon fillets, skin-on
- 1 1/4 tsp Chinese five-spice powder
- 1 handful fresh cilantro leaves, roughly chopped
- 3 stalks celery, diced
- 3/4 cup fresh chives, chopped
- 2 tsp white wine vinegar
- 1 1/2 tbsp olive oil
- 2-3 drops sesame oil

Directions:
- Cook potatoes in salted boiling water for 15 mins, or until just tender. Drain.
- Lightly coat salmon fillets with oil then rub both sides with five-spice powder. Season. Oil a frying pan and place over medium-high heat. Cook for 5 mins, skin-side down, then flip over and cook for 4 mins, or until cooked to your liking.
- Meanwhile, place warm potatoes in a mixing bowl along with cilantro, celery and chives. Drizzle with vinegar, olive oil and sesame oil and season. Serve with salmon.

Baked Bean Special

Ingredients:
- 1 can Ranch Style beans
- 1 can pork and beans
- 1 can kidney beans
- 1 can tomato sauce
- 1/2 c. barbecue sauce
- 1 Tbsp. Worcestershire
- 1 Tbsp. soy sauce
- 1 tsp. Cajun seasoning
- 1 tsp. Italian seasoning
- 1 small chopped onion
- 1 c. sliced smoked sausage
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 1/2 tsp. oregano
- 1/2 pinch red pepper (optional)

Directions:
- Brown and drain beef.
- Add remaining ingredients mixing well. Place in a 3-quart baking dish and bake at 350° for 1 hour. Serves 10.

Perfect Pie Crust I

Ingredients:
- 5 cups all-purpose flour
- 4 tablespoons white sugar
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
- 1 1/2 cups shortening
- 2 egg yolks

Directions:
- Combine flour, sugar, salt, and baking powder. Cut in Crisco until pea sizes form.
- In one-cup measuring cup, beat egg yolks and add COLD water to fill entire one cup. Add to the mixture. Do not overmix. Divide into thirds.

Texas Caviar

Ingredients:
- 2 cans black-eyed peas
- 1 bell pepper, chopped
- 1 tsp. garlic, crushed
- 2 green peppers, chopped
- 1 bottle reduced calorie Italian dressing
- 2 tomatoes, chopped
- 1 bunch green onions, chopped
- 2 red peppers, chopped
- jalapeno peppers (3 to 4 or more), diced

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients and chill.
- The longer it chills, the better it tastes.
- Will keep in the refrigerator indefinitely. Use with nachos as a dip.

Wilted Escarole With Garlic, Lemon And Oil

Ingredients:
- 1/4 cup extra virgin olive oil, 4 turns of the pan
- 2 garlic cloves, crushed
- 2 teaspoons anchovy paste, eyeball it
- 6 anchovy fillets, chopped
- 2 -3 dashes red pepper flakes
- 2 heads escarole, trimmed, rinsed, and dried
- 1 lemon, juice of

Directions:
- Heat the extra-virgin olive oil in a deep skillet over medium-low heat with garlic and anchovy. Cook together 3 to 4 minutes to infuse garlic into oil.
- Remove the garlic cloves and stir oil to mix in the melted anchovies and add the red pepper flakes.
- Raise heat to medium-high. When oil ripples or begins to waft smoke, add greens and stir fry them 2 to 3 minutes. Squeeze lemon juice over the greens, toss, and serve.

Yogurt And Whipped Cream Pie

Ingredients:
- 1 (8 oz.) Lite Cool Whip
- 2 (6 oz.) yogurt (any flavor)
- 3/4 c. mixed fresh or frozen berries, sweetened with sugar or Splenda
- 1 (6 oz.) graham cracker pie crust

Directions:
- Mix Cool Whip and yogurt together. Place into graham cracker crust. Heat mixed berries in small bowl in microwave, about 2 to 3 minutes. Use sugar or Splenda to sweeten. Wait until berries cool and drop across the top of pie. Spoon the juice over top and sides of pie. Put into freezer until frozen and then cut into slices and serve.

Cucumber Dill Spread

Ingredients:
- 2 packages (8 ounces each) cream cheese, softened
- 2 teaspoons lemon juice
- 2 teaspoons finely chopped onion
- 1/2 teaspoon dill weed
- 1/4 teaspoon prepared horseradish
- Dash hot pepper sauce
- 3/4 cup finely diced seeded cucumber
- Assorted crackers or assorted fresh vegetables

Directions:
- In a large bowl, beat cream cheese until smooth. Add the lemon juice, onion, dill, horseradish and pepper sauce. Fold in cucumber. Cover and chill for at least 1 hour. Serve with crackers or fresh vegetables.

Healthy Berry And Spinach Smoothie

Ingredients:
- 2 cups frozen berries
- 1 cup plain yogurt
- 1/2 cup orange juice
- 1/4 cup fresh spinach, or to taste
- 5 strawberries

Directions:
- Blend berries, yogurt, orange juice, spinach, and strawberries together in a blender until smooth.

Mulligatawny Soup

Ingredients:
- 1 medium tart apple, peeled and diced
- 1/4 cup each chopped carrot, celery and onion
- 1/4 cup butter, cubed
- 1/3 cup all-purpose flour
- 1 teaspoon curry powder
- 1/2 teaspoon sugar
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/8 teaspoon pepper
- 1/8 teaspoon ground mace
- 6 cups chicken or turkey broth
- 1 cup cubed cooked chicken or turkey
- 1 medium tomato, peeled, seeded and chopped
- 1/2 cup chopped green pepper
- 2 whole cloves
- 1 tablespoon minced fresh parsley
- 1 cup cooked rice

Directions:
- In a Dutch oven, saute the apple, carrot, celery and onion in butter for 5 minutes or until tender. Stir in the flour, curry, sugar, salt, pepper and mace until blended. Gradually add broth.
- Bring to a boil. Cook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened. Add the chicken, tomato, green pepper, cloves and parsley; return to a boil. Reduce heat; cover and simmer for 20-30 minutes. Add rice; heat through. Discard cloves.

Dry rub for barbecued ribs

Ingredients:
- 8 tbsp Brown sugar
- 1 tbsp Kosher salt salt
- 1 tbsp Chili powder
- 1/2 tsp Pepper pepper
- 1/2 tsp Cayenne pepper pepper
- 1/2 tsp Old Bay seasoning
- 1/2 tbsp thyme
- 1 tsp Onion powder
- 1 tsp Garlic powder powder

Directions:
- Mix all herb and spice ingredients
- Rub over both sides of ribs
- Let sit in refrigerator for a couple of hours or overnight

Wassail

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 qt. cranberry juice
- 1 1/2 qt. apple juice
- 6 cinnamon sticks
- sliced orange (stud with cloves)

Directions:
- Mix and warm for 3 hours in a crock-pot.
- Serve hot.

Batter-Fried Shrimp

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 lbs shrimp, peeled & deveined
- 1/2 cup oil
- 1 egg, beaten
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 1/2 cup milk
- 3/4 teaspoon seasoning salt
- 1/4 teaspoon salt
- oil (for deep frying)

Directions:
- Preheat oil to 350 degrees.
- Combine 1/2 cup oil and egg; beat well.
- Add remaining ingredients except oil for frying and stir until well blended.
- Dip shrimp into batter to coat.
- Drop shrimp into hot oil and fry for 30-60 seconds or until golden brown.
- Remove with slotted spoon; drain on paper towel.
- Add a 1/2 teaspoon of baking powder to batter to make a much lighter crust, or use beer instead of milk for a barley flavor.

Homemade Mayonnaise

Ingredients:
- 1 large egg
- 1 egg yolk
- 1/2 teaspoon salt, or to taste
- Juice of 1/2 lemon
- 1 teaspoon Dijon mustard
- Pinch of cayenne
- 1 1/2 cups canola or grapeseed oil
- 1 to 2 tablespoons warm water, if needed

Directions:
- Combine the egg, egg yolk, and salt in a food processor and process for 30 seconds.
- Add the lemon juice, mustard, and cayenne and process for 15 seconds with the machine running.
- Slowly pour the oil through the feed rube until the mayonnaise is thick and emulsified.
- If the mixture becomes too dense, stop pouring in the oil and add warm water, a little at a time, until the mayonnaise loosens, then slowly incorporate the remaining oil.
- Taste and adjust the seasoning.
- The mayonnaise can be stored, covered, in the refrigerator for up to 1 week.

South Of The Border Dip

Ingredients:
- 2 (16 oz. each) cans refried beans
- 1 pkg. taco seasoning mix
- 1 (16 oz.) carton sour cream
- 2 c. (8 oz.) shredded Cheddar cheese

Directions:
- Combine beans and taco seasoning.
- Spoon mixture into a 12 x 8 x 2-inch ovenproof dish.
- Spread on sour cream and top with cheese.
- Bake 30 minutes at 350°.
- Serve hot with corn chips. Makes 5 1/2 cups.

Kona Banana Bread

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. shortening
- 1 c. sugar
- 2 eggs
- 3/4 c. mashed banana
- 1 1/4 c. sifted flour
- 3/4 tsp. baking soda
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 c. chopped nuts (optional)

Directions:
- Cream shortening and sugar until light.
- Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each.
- Stir in mashed bananas.
- Sift together flour, soda and salt.
- Add to banana mixture.
- Mix until well blended.
- Bake at 350° in a bread pan for 45 to 55 minutes.

Avocado Relish 

Ingredients:
- 2 ripe avocados, halved, pitted, peeled and coarsely chopped
- 1/2 small red onion, finely diced
- 1 jalapeno, seeded and finely minced
- Juice of one lime
- 1/4 cup finely chopped cilantro
- Kosher salt
- Black pepper

Directions:
- Combine all ingredients in a small bowl.

Lamb In Foil

Ingredients:
- 2 lamb chops, all fat cut off
- 1/4 onion, thinly sliced
- garlic salt or powder
- 1/2 tomato
- powdered basil leaves
- 1/2 green pepper, cut to desired size
- salt and pepper

Directions:
- Place lamb chops in a roomy envelope of aluminum foil.
- Add the remaining ingredients.
- Fold tightly so no steam escapes. Place on baking sheet and bake for 1 hour at 350°.
- Serves 1.

Pizza Casserole

Ingredients:
- 1 (4 oz.) pkg. sliced pepperoni
- 1 medium onion, chopped fine
- 1 (6 oz.) pkg. thin spaghetti, cooked and drained
- 1 c. grated Swiss cheese
- 1 lb. Mozzarella cheese, sliced thin
- 3 (8 oz.) cans tomato sauce
- 1 (4 oz.) can mushroom pieces, drained
- 1/2 tsp. oregano or 1 tsp. Italian seasoning
- 1/2 tsp. basil

Directions:
- Saute onion in 1 1/3 tablespoons butter. Heat oven to 350°. Pour remaining 1/4 cup butter into 11 x 7 x 2 baking dish. Toss cooked spaghetti in butter. Cover spaghetti with 1 1/2 cans tomato sauce. Add in order listed:
- 1/2 pepperoni, 1/2 Mozzarella and all the onions and mushrooms. Sprinkle with Italian seasoning. Pour on top of this 1 1/2 cans tomato sauce. Top with remainder of Swiss cheese, pepperoni and lastly Mozzarella cheese. Bake 20 to 25 minutes in 350° oven until bubbly. Serves 6.

Rich And Creamy Tomato Soup

Ingredients:
- 1 medium onion, chopped
- 2 tablespoons butter
- 2 cans (14-1/2 ounces each) diced tomatoes, undrained
- 2 cans (10-3/4 ounces each) condensed tomato soup, undiluted
- 1-1/2 cups milk
- 1 teaspoon sugar
- 1/2 to 1 teaspoon dried basil
- 1/2 to 1 teaspoon paprika
- 1/8 to 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder
- 1 package (8 ounces) cream cheese, cubed

Directions:
- In a large saucepan, saute onion in butter until tender. Stir in tomatoes, soup, milk, sugar, basil, paprika and garlic powder.
- Bring to a boil. Reduce heat; cover and simmer for 10 minutes. Stir in cream cheese until melted. Serve immediately.

Cheez-It Chicken

Ingredients:
- 4 chicken breasts or 4 chicken thighs
- 4 mozzarella string cheese
- 1 1/2 cups Cheez-It crackers, crushed fine
- 1 cup creamy Italian dressing (Marie's Brand Only, Creamy Italian Garlic Dressing in refrigerated salad dressing section)
- 3 tablespoons butter

Directions:
- Place butter in metal cooking sheet & put in pre-heated oven at 350 degrees. Pound chicken thin. Roll with mozzarella stick. Dip each chicken roll 1st in shallow bowl of dressing & coat well then dip into 2nd shallow bowl with crushed cheez-its & coat well. Remove cookie sheet of melted butter & spread butter coating sheet well.
- Put rolled, dipped chicken on sheet & bake 25 minute then turn over onto other side & bake another 25-30 minute or until juices run clear.

Mediterranean Tilapia

Ingredients:
- 6 tilapia fillets (6 ounces each)
- 1 cup canned Italian diced tomatoes
- 1/2 cup water-packed artichoke hearts, chopped
- 1/2 cup sliced ripe olives
- 1/2 cup crumbled feta cheese

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 400°. Place fillets in a 15x10x1-in. baking pan coated with cooking spray. Top with tomatoes, artichoke hearts, olives and cheese. Bake, uncovered, until fish flakes easily with a fork, 15-20 minutes.

Sweet Pungent Chicken Wings

Ingredients:
- family style pkg. chicken wings
- 2/3 c. soy sauce
- 4 cloves garlic, pressed
- 2/3 c. (packed) dark brown sugar
- 2 tsp. dry mustard

Directions:
- Disjoint wings.
- Arrange wings in long casserole dish.
- Blend remaining ingredients to make marinade.
- Pour over wings, cover. Marinade overnight.
- The next day, preheat oven to 350°.
- Bake uncovered 1 1/2 hours or until chicken is tender and dark brown.

Sweet "N" Sour Beans (Crock Pot)

Ingredients:
- 8 slices bacon, strips diced
- 2 medium onions, halved and thinly sliced
- 1 cup packed brown sugar
- 1 1/4 cups cider vinegar
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1 teaspoon ground mustard
- 1 1/4 teaspoons garlic powder
- 1 (16 ounce) can baked beans, undrained
- 1 (15 1/2 ounce) can pinto beans, rinsed and drained
- 1 (15 ounce) can lima beans, rinsed and drained
- 1 (15 1/2 ounce) can black-eyed peas, rinsed and drained

Directions:
- In a large skillet, cook bacon until crisp. Remove to paper towels. Drain, reserving 2 tablespoons drippings.
- In the drippings, saute onions until tender.
- Add brown sugar, vingear, salt, mustard and garlic powder. Bring to a boil.
- In a slow cooker, combine beans and peas. Add onion mixture and bacon; mix well. Cover and cook on high for 3-4 hours or until heated through.

Strawberry Dip

Ingredients:
- 1/2 containers (about 12 Oz. Container) Frozen Strawberries (thawed And Blended Smooth)
- 8 ounces, weight Cream Cheese, Softened
- 3/4 cups Brown Sugar
- 1/2 cups White Sugar
- 1 teaspoon Vanilla

Directions:
- Cream the sugars and cream cheese until light and fluffy.
- Add vanilla and smooth blended strawberries and mix until smooth and fluffy!
- Serve with fresh cut fruit, cookies, and/or angel food cake squares!

Spiced Hot Apple Cider

Ingredients:
- 2 teaspoons whole cloves
- 2 cardamom pods
- 2 cinnamon sticks
- 1 orange peel
- One 64-ounce bottle apple cider
- 2 cups orange juice

Directions:
- Place the cloves, cardamom pods, cinnamon sticks and orange peel on the cheesecloth.
- Pull the corners up, and tie with kitchen string.
- In a large Dutch oven, combine the cider, orange juice and spice bundle.
- Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, 30 to 45 minutes.
- Remove and discard the spice bundle before serving.

Meringue

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 1/8 tsp. salt
- 1/4 c. water
- 1/8 tsp. cream of tartar
- 2 egg whites
- 1/4 tsp. almond extract

Directions:
- Cook ingredients to thread stage (232°).
- Gradually pour this over 2 stiffly beaten egg whites, beating constantly.
- Continue beating until mixture holds stiff peaks.
- Add 1/4 teaspoon almond extract.

Flax Blueberry Muffins

Ingredients:
- 4 tablespoons butter, melted
- 6 eggs
- 1 12 cups ground flax seeds
- 12 cup Splenda granular
- 2 teaspoons baking powder
- 2 teaspoons vanilla
- 1 cup blueberries

Directions:
- Whisk eggs with butter.
- Stir in remaining ingredients.
- Pour into greased muffin tin.
- Bake in 400 degree oven for 15-17 minutes.

Meat With Red Chili

Ingredients:
- 2 lb. beef roast
- 1 lb. tomatoes, toasted and peeled
- 1 tsp. garlic
- 5 red chili peppers, toasted and peeled

Directions:
- Cut beef into small pieces.
- Cook in pan with small amount of oil.
- Cook until medium rare.
- Add tomatoes, chilies and garlic into blender.
- Add to meat.
- Add 1 cup of water or 2 to thicken . Add flour and let boil for 15 minutes on low heat.

Festive Potato Medley

Ingredients:
- 1 (900 ml) boxcampbell's ready-to-serve chicken broth (regular or 25% less salt)
- 3 cups yukon gold potatoes, peeled, and cut into 1-inch pieces
- 2 cups sweet potatoes, peeled and cut into 1-inch pieces
- 2 cups red potatoes, unpeeled, and cut into 1-inch pieces
- 12 cup sour cream, light
- 2 tablespoons butter or 2 tablespoons margarine
- generous dash ground black pepper

Directions:
- Heat broth and potatoes to a boil over medium-high heat in 3-quart saucepan.
- Reduce heat to medium.
- Cover and cook for 10 minutes or until potatoes are tender.
- Drain, reserving broth.
- Mash potatoes, with 1/4 cup broth, sour cream, butter and black pepper.
- Add additional broth if needed, until desired consistency.

Have It Your Way Squash Casserole

Ingredients:
- 2 large zucchini, cut in 1/4-inch slices
- 2 large yellow squash, cut in 1/4-inch slices
- chopped red pepper *
- chopped green pepper *
- chopped celery *
- chopped onion *
- 1 Tbsp. oil (butter, olive oil or vegetable oil, depending on taste)
- 1 1/4 c. milk (use skim for less fat)
- 2 Tbsp. flour
- 3/4 to 1 c. filler (package stuffing, dry bread, cereal or lightly crushed crackers)
- 1 c. shredded cheese (Cheddar, Monterey or Mozzarella)
- spice (salt, pepper, Mexican or Italian, depending on taste)
- topping (more cheese, any of the fillers suggested, crushed chips, Bran Buds or chopped nuts)

Directions:
- *Use any or all but do not exceed 1 cup total.

Squash Dressing

Ingredients:
- 2 c. squash
- 2 c. cornbread crumbs
- 3 eggs, beaten
- 1 c. cream of chicken soup
- 1 stick butter, melted
- 1/2 c. chopped onion
- pinch of sage
- salt and pepper to taste

Directions:
- Boil squash until tender.
- Slice squash and mix with all other ingredients.
- Pour mixture into a casserole dish and bake at 350° until golden brown.

Potato Cheese Chowder

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. sliced carrots
- 1/2 c. chopped onion
- 1/4 c. chopped celery
- 2 Tbsp. margarine
- 2 c. peeled, cubed potatoes
- 3/4 c. cold water
- 1 (8 oz.) jar Cheez Whiz

Directions:
- Place all ingredients, except cheese, in a 2-quart glass casserole.
- Microwave, covered, on High for 10 to 12 minutes or until vegetables are tender.
- Stir in cheese until melted. Microwave, uncovered, on High, stirring every 2 to 3 minutes until desired consistency.

Katie'S Spaghetti Sauce

Ingredients:
- 3 lbs extra lean ground beef
- 4 bell peppers, chopped
- 2 large onions, chopped
- 1 lb mushroom (any on hand)
- 6 tablespoons italian seasoning
- 2 bay leaves
- 10 -12 garlic cloves, chopped
- 1 -2 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes
- 1/4 cup any 'drinkable' red wine (our fave is Chianti by Ruffino)
- 4 (12 ounce) cans tomato paste
- 3 -4 tablespoons sugar

Directions:
- In a large kettle, brown beef with veggies. Add the tomato paste.and continue browning.
- Add the rest of the ingredients and top off with approx 8 cups of water.
- Simmer for 4 to 6 hours. Never put the lid on tight -- it will make your sauce watery!
- Stir frequently.have plenty of crusty Italian bread on hand for dipping (taste testing)!

Yeast Breads

Ingredients:
- 2 c. warm water
- 4 tsp. yeast
- 2 Tbsp. sugar
- 5 c. flour
- 1 tsp. salt
- 2 Tbsp. sugar
- 2 Tbsp. oleo
- 1 1/2 c. dry milk or Coffee Mate

Directions:
- Mix water, yeast and sugar together and let sit in mixing bowl.
- Add top mixture and beat.
- Stir in rest of flour.
- Let rise in bowl until double.
- Punch down; knead.
- Make into loaves or rolls.
- Let rise again.
- Bake at 350° for 18 to 22 minutes.
- It will be golden brown.
- Remove from oven; brush with oleo.

Texas Sheet Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 c. water
- 4 Tbsp. cocoa
- 1 c. shortening
- 2 c. flour
- 2 c. sugar
- 1/2 c. buttermilk
- 2 eggs
- 1 tsp. soda
- 1/2 tsp. cinnamon
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- dash of salt

Directions:
- Bring to boil the water, cocoa and shortening.
- Pour over the flour and sugar (combined).
- Add the buttermilk.
- Add the eggs; beat until smooth.
- Add the soda, cinnamon, vanilla and salt.
- Mix well.
- Bake at 400° for 20 minutes in a 12 x 15-inch pan.

Ma G's Purple Passion

Ingredients:
- 16 oz almond milk
- 1 small pk mix frozen berries
- 1 large scoop of Vegan Protein Powder

Directions:
- Blend all ingredients

Rosemary Roasted Chicken With Vegetables

Ingredients:
- 1 (3 lb) whole chickens
- salt & freshly ground black pepper
- 1 teaspoon rosemary, crushed
- 2 tablespoons butter or 2 tablespoons margarine, softened
- 4 medium potatoes, peeled and cut into 2 inch cubes
- 4 small onions, peeled and quartered
- 4 carrots, peeled and cut into 1 inch pieces
- 1 cup dry white wine

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 375F.
- Season chicken inside and out with salt and pepper.
- Place1/2 tsp rosemary in the cavity.
- Tie legs together and rub butter over skin.
- Place in a large baking dish or roasting pan.
- Roast chicken for 15 minutes.
- Arrange carrots, potatoes and onions around chicken.
- Sprinkle remaining rosemary over chicken and vegetables.
- Pour wine over all and bake 1 hour and 15 minutes with pan drippings.
- Add water as needed if wine evaporates.

Quick-Pickled Jalapenos Recipe

Ingredients:
- 6 ounces jalapenos
- 1/2 cup white vinegar
- 1/2 cup water
- 2 tablespoons sugar
- 2 tablespoons kosher salt
- A few black peppercorns

Directions:
- Slice the jalapenos and place in a clean jar with a tight-fitting lid.
- In a small saucepan, combine the vinegar, water, sugar, salt, and peppercorns.
- Bring to the boil over medium heat, making sure the sugar and salt are dissolved.
- Pour the pickle brine over the jalapenos in the jar.
- Leave at room temperature until cooled, about 1 hour.
- Cover tightly and refrigerate.

Garbanzo-Vegetable Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 (15 ounce) can garbanzo beans, rinsed and drained
- 1 cup tomatoes, chopped
- 12 cup cucumber, peeled and chopped
- 13 cup green bell pepper, chopped
- 13 cup red onion, chopped
- 14 black olives, thinly sliced
- 1 tablespoon dried parsley flakes
- 12 teaspoon dried mint
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 3 tablespoons vinegar
- 1 tablespoon water
- 1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice
- 2 teaspoons sugar
- 12 teaspoon fresh lemon peel, grated
- 3 garlic cloves, crushed
- 14 teaspoon salt
- 14 teaspoon pepper

Directions:
- In a large bowl, combine beans, tomato, cucumber, bell pepper, onion, and olives.
- Sprinkle with parsley and mint.
- Mix well.
- In a small bowl, combine remaining ingredients, mixing until blended.
- Pour over vegetables, mixing well.
- Cover and chill several hours or overnight.
- Stir before serving.

Chocolate Pudding Cake

Ingredients:
- 2 egg whites, lightly beaten
- 1/4 c. water
- 1/2 c. light corn syrup
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 2 1/2 c. Basic Baking Mix
- 1 c. firmly packed light brown sugar
- 1 1/2 c. boiling water

Directions:
- Stir together egg whites, water, corn syrup and vanilla.
- Mix well, then add Basic Baking Mix.
- Spread batter evenly in 9 x 9 x 2-inch square pan coated with nonstick spray.
- Sprinkle brown sugar evenly over batter.
- Pour 1 1/2 cups boiling water over batter (water should cover mixture).
- Bake 35 to 40 minutes at 350°; cool slightly.
- Spoon into dessert plates warm or refrigerate to serve cold.

Big Bean Pot

Ingredients:
- 3/4 lb. bacon, diced
- 3 medium onions, chopped
- 1/2 tsp. dry mustard
- 1/2 c. brown sugar
- 1/3 c. cider vinegar
- 1 (15.5 oz.) can kidney beans, drained
- 1 (15 oz.) can butter beans, drained
- 1 (32 oz.) can baked style beans
- 1 tsp. garlic powder

Directions:
- Heat oven to 350°.
- In Dutch oven, cook and stir bacon and onions until bacon is crisp and onions are tender.
- Drain.
- Add remaining ingredients; mix well.
- Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 60 to 70 minutes or until hot and bubbly.
- Makes 12 (1/2 cup) servings.

Slow Cooker Apples With Cinnamon And Brown Sugar

Ingredients:
- 1 Reynolds(R) Slow Cooker Liner
- 4 medium tart baking apples (such as Granny Smith, Braeburn, or Jonathan), cored
- 1/4 cup regular rolled oats
- 1/4 cup raisins
- 2 tablespoons packed brown sugar
- 1 tablespoon butter, chopped
- 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 2/3 cup apple juice

Directions:
- Line a 5- to 6-quart slow cooker with a Reynolds(R) Slow Cooker Liner.
- Place apples in prepared slow cooker. Combine oats, raisins, brown sugar, butter, and cinnamon in a small bowl. Spoon mixture into centers of apples, patting in with the back of a spoon or a narrow metal spatula. Mound any remaining oat mixture on top of apples. Pour apple juice around apples in cooker.
- Cover and cook for 3 hours on low.
- Transfer apples to serving bowls and drizzle with cooking liquid.

Michel Roux Jr's duck confit recipe

Ingredients:
- 8 duck legs
- 500 g (17.6oz) good-quality coarse sea salt
- 1.5 kg (3.3lbs) duck fat
- 6 sage leaves
- 1 sprig of thyme

Directions:
- Liberally sprinkle the salt over the duck legs and refrigerate for 90 minutes.
- Then brush off the salt with a cloth and discard.
- Warm the duck fat in a pan over low heat.
- Add the duck legs and the thyme and sage.
- Bring to a very gentle simmer, cover with greaseproof paper and cook for 2 hours or until tender.
- The slower and longer the cooking time, the better the duck will be.
- Leave to cool in the fat and then refrigerate.
- The confit will keep for several weeks.
- When you want to eat the confit, gently lift the legs out of the fat and place skin-side down in a non-stick pan.
- Cook over medium heat until crispy and golden.
- Turn the legs over and put in preheated oven at 180C to finish warming through for 10-15mins.
- Serve with saute potatoes.

Individual Fruit Cake

Ingredients:
- 1/2 lb. candied cherries
