- 1 lb. chopped dates
- 6 slices candied pineapple, chopped
- 2 c. pecans
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 4 oz. coconut
- 1 can Eagle Brand condensed milk

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients and shape into balls about size of ping-pong balls. Cook on greased cookie sheet at 325° for 10 minutes. Reduce heat to 300° for 15 to 20 minutes.
- Remove from sheet while hot. Store in Tupperware or tummy! They better with age.

Jello Angel Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 pkg. raspberry Jell-O
- 1 lemon (juice)
- 1 tall can evaporated milk
- 1 c. boiling water
- 3/4 c. sugar
- 1 large angel food cake, cut in 3 layers
- whipped cream, sweetened

Directions:
- Pour boiling water over Jell-O, sugar and lemon juice; let set until quite thick, but not completely set.
- Whip evaporated milk and add Jell-O mixture, beating all the time, until thoroughly mixed and like whipped cream.
- Put a small amount of Jell-O mixture on bottom of large angel food cake pan.
- Put 1 layer of cake on top, then another layer of mixture, layer of cake, layer of mixture and layer of cake (top).
- Let set in refrigerator until firm (overnight), then unmold on large plate and decorate top and sides with whipped cream.

Chicken Artichoke Skillet

Ingredients:
- 4 boneless skinless chicken breast halves
- 14 teaspoon salt
- 12 teaspoon ground pepper
- 2 tablespoons olive oil or 2 tablespoons use olive oil flavored cooking spray
- 2 12 cups chicken broth, can use low-fat
- 14 cup lemon juice
- 1 12 cups uncooked instant rice
- 1 (14 ounce) canquartered artichoke hearts, drained
- 2 tablespoons capers
- 1 -2 tablespoon chopped fresh parsley, can be optional

Directions:
- Sprinkle chicken breasts with salt and pepper.
- Saute chicken in hot olive oil in a large skillet 5-6 minutes on each side or until done.
- Remove chicken from skillet.
- Add chicken broth and lemon juice to skillet and bring to a boil.
- Stir in rice, artichokes, and capers.
- Top with chicken.
- Cover, remove from heat and let stand for 5 minutes.

E Z Coffee Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 pkg. frozen dinner rolls
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 1 1/2 tsp. cinnamon
- 1/2 c. chopped pecans
- 1/2 c. brown sugar
- 1 small box cook and serve butterscotch pudding mix
- 1 stick oleo, cut into pats

Directions:
- Spray Bundt pan with Pam.
- Put frozen rolls in bottom of pan. Sprinkle other ingredients over rolls in layers.
- Cover loosely with dish towel and let rise overnight.
- Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.
- Cover with foil the last 15 minutes.

Roasted Red Pepper & Sun-Dried Tomato Hot Cheese Dip - Yum!

Ingredients:
- 2 (8 ounce) packages cream cheese, softened
- 1 cup mayonnaise
- 1 cup sour cream
- 1/4 cup onion, finely chopped
- 4 garlic cloves, minced
- 1 (7 ounce) jar sun-dried tomatoes packed in oil, finely chopped
- 2/3 cup roasted red pepper, finely chopped
- 4 cups Italian cheese blend, shredded
- 1 cup parmesan cheese, shredded and divided

Directions:
- Combine the cream cheese, mayo, sour cream, onion and garlic in a large mixing bowl - stir until blended. Stir in the tomoatores and peppers. Add the Italian blend cheese and 2/3 cup Parmesan. Stir until blended.
- Transfer mixture to greased 9x13 baking dish. Sprinkle remaining parmesan cheese on top. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes, until edges are bubbly and browning.
- Serve hot with crackers or vegetables.

Spa Water (Citrus Cucumber)

Ingredients:
- 1 large lemon, sliced
- 1 large lime, sliced
- 1 large orange, sliced
- 1 large cucumber, sliced
- 12 gallon water, cold

Directions:
- Place all the sliced fruits and the cucumber in a large glass pitcher; Add water.
- Refrigerate for two hours to allow flavors to infuse.
- Serve in glasses over ice.
- Best if served the day it is made.

Mango Ice Cream 

Ingredients:
- 2 cups mango puree
- 1/2 cup heavy cream
- 1 2/3 cups vanilla custard or pudding
- 1/4 cup lemon juice
- 1/2 cup powdered sugar

Directions:
- Combine ingredients. Churn in an ice cream maker or transfer to a loaf pan, cover and freeze until a 2/3 inch hardened rim forms around edge of pan. Whisk until mixture is homogenous then return to pan and freeze until almost firm. Whisk together again then freeze until firm.

Hawaiian Carrot Cake

Ingredients:
- 2 cups all-purpose white flour
- 2 teaspoons baking soda
- 2 teaspoons cinnamon
- 1/2 teaspoon nutmeg
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 3 eggs
- 1 1/2 cups brown sugar
- 3/4 cup plain yogurt or 3/4 cup h. mayonnaise
- 1 (8 ounce) can crushed pineapple
- 2 1/2 cups grated carrots
- 3/4 cup walnuts, chopped

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350°F.
- Grease a 9 inch tube mold or bundt cake mold.
- In a medium mixing bowl, mix together the first 5 ingredients.
- In a large mixing bowl, mix together the eggs and sugar, yogurt(or mayonnaise) and the drained crushed pineapple.
- Incorporate gradually the dry ingredients, mixing well.
- Add the carrots and nuts, mix well.
- Pour the cake batter into cake mold and bake in 350°F oven for 50-60 minutes.
- Let cool, and unmold onto cake rack.
- Ice the cake with cream cheese icing, garnish with toasted coconut.

Monkey Bread

Ingredients:
- 6 1/2 c. flour
- 1 stick butter
- 1 c. milk
- 1/2 c. water
- 2 pkg. dry yeast
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. sugar
- 3 eggs
- 1 stick butter, melted

Directions:
- Melt at low temperature, 1 stick butter, milk and water.
- Mix yeast, salt, sugar and 4 cups flour.
- Add milk mixture to flour mixture.
- Add the eggs and another cup of the flour.
- May mix this with a mixer until smooth.
- Using a spoon, add rest of the flour (up to 1 1/2 cups).
- Let rise until double.

Refrigerator Rolls

Ingredients:
- 2 pkgs. dry yeast
- 2 1/4 c. lukewarm water
- 6 1/2 to 7 c. plain White Lily flour, sifted
- 1 heaping Tbsp. salt
- 1 c. Crisco
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 2 eggs

Directions:
- In large mixing bowl, dissolve yeast in the lukewarm water; add 1/2 of flour, salt & sugar, beating with electric mixer or dough hook, add eggs, Crisco and remaining flour.
- May have to stir some of flour in by hand, since it gets to stiff for mixer. Cover tightly & place in refrigerator to rise.
- The dough will need to be punched down 2 or 3 times before it stops rising.
- Two hours before serving time roll dough out to about 1/3 inch thickness, brush tops with melted butter or margarine.
- Bake in 450° oven until golden brown.
- I usually make these up the day before I plan to serve them so they will finish rising before bedtime.
- I always buy yeast with the furtherest expiration date away.

Salisbury Steak

Ingredients:
- 1 can cream of mushroom soup
- 1 Tbsp. prepared mustard
- 2 tsp. Worcestershire sauce
- 1 tsp. horseradish
- 1 1/2 lb. ground beef
- salt and pepper
- 1/4 c. bread crumbs
- 1 egg
- 1/4 c. mushroom mixture

Directions:
- Mix well and shape into 6 patties.
- Brown in 1 to 2 tablespoons oil, drain off fat and add balance of mushroom mixture to which you have added 1/2 cup water.
- Cook 10 to 15 minutes, covered, until meat is done.
- Place patties on serving platter and pour sauce over meat and serve.

Meringue Kisses

Ingredients:
- 2 egg whites
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 1/2 c. chopped peanuts

Directions:
- Beat egg whites until stiff with electric mixer.
- Add sugar and mix well.
- Egg whites should hold peaks. Fold in nuts with spatula or spoon.
- Drop mix by teaspoon on foil lined cookie sheets.
- Bake at 275 degrees for 40 mins.
- Let cool and peel off foil.
- Cookies will keep indefinitely in a tin container.

Chocolate Delight

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. powdered sugar
- 1 c. flour
- 1 c. chopped nuts
- 1/2 c. powdered sugar
- 2 small boxes chocolate pudding (instant type)
- 1 stick butter
- 1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese
- 1 c. Cool Whip
- 3 c. milk
- Cool Whip

Directions:
- Melt butter; mix well with flour, nuts and 1/4 cup powdered sugar.
- Line a 10 x 12 x 2-inch pan with mixture.
- Add 1/4 cup powdered sugar, cream cheese and 1 cup Cool Whip.
- Spread over crust.
- Mix pudding and milk; beat until thick.
- Spread over cream cheese mixture.
- Top with Cool Whip.

Baked Spaghetti

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 1/2 c. onions, chopped
- 1 (8 oz.) pkg. spaghetti
- 1 can or pkg. spaghetti sauce or using pkg. add 8 oz. can tomato sauce
- 1/2 c. mushrooms
- 1/2 c. Parmesan cheese
- 2 c. Mozzarella cheese

Directions:
- Cook spaghetti as directed.
- In another skillet, cook hamburger with onion and mushrooms until done.
- Drain off.
- Add spaghetti sauce and simmer about 15 minutes.
- Add to spaghetti with Parmesan cheese.
- Mix well in a casserole dish.
- Top with Mozzarella cheese.
- Cook until cheese is turning light brown in a moderate oven.

Gruyere Nachos

Ingredients:
- 4 handfuls yellow corn tortilla chips
- 2 handfuls grated gruyere cheese
- 2 tablespoons pesto
- 2 dashes habanero hot sauce (store bought is fine)

Directions:
- Lay tortilla chips on plate or tray (ideal is baked in the oven, but sometimes I just toss it all on a plate and microwave...food52ers don't hate me..)
- Dollop the pesto on top of the tortillas. Then cover with grated cheese. Top off with dashes of habanero hot sauce if you like it spicy...
- Heat until cheese is melted. Don't burn the roof of your mouth when you inhale these!

Sunshine Turbosa Recipe kdgstowe

Ingredients:
- Green Mountain Sunshine Vodka( 3 count pour)
- Champagne(as much as u would like)
- Fresh Squeezed Orange Juice
- Grand Marnier(just a touch)

Directions:
- mix them all together over ice.
- very simple

Fried Chicken

Ingredients:
- skinless chicken breast
- seasoned meat tenderizer
- paprika
- salt and pepper

Directions:
- Take chicken breast, wash in cold water.
- Sprinkle with meat tenderizer, paprika, salt and pepper.
- Place in Teflon skillet on low heat; cook 50 minutes.
- Last ten minutes, turn heat up to brown.

Pork Tenderloin In Puff Pastry

Ingredients:
- 1 (3/4 lb) pork tenderloin, whole
- Dijon mustard
- 1 (17 1/3 ounce) package frozen puff pastry
- 1/4 teaspoon tarragon, crushed

Directions:
- Trim off fat and wipe meat well. Thaw the puff pastry and roll out one sheet to make a 12-inch square.
- Spread with 2 tablespoons of mustard. Put meat on one end of pastry and sprinkle with tarragon. Roll pastry around meat, tucking in ends.
- Place on ungreased baking sheet and bake in moderate oven at 350°F for 1 hour. Slice and serve hot or chill, slice and serve cold.

Tuna Pasta Salad

Ingredients:
- 8 ounces small shell pasta
- 1 (7 ounce) can tuna
- 3 eggs, hard-cooked, diced
- 1 small apple, I use Granny Smith, diced finely
- 1 celery rib, diced finely
- 3 green onions, use all, sliced thinly
- 1 tablespoon fresh dill, finely cut
- 1/3 - 1/2 cup mayonnaise
- 1/4 teaspoon celery salt
- black pepper

Directions:
- Cook pasta until al dente. Immediately cool in cold water.
- Drain tuna. Mix with next 8 ingredients.
- Mix tuna mixture into pasta. You may need a little more mayonnaise.

Bran Muffins

Ingredients:
- 1 1/4 cups all-purpose flour
- 1 tablespoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 cup sugar
- 3 cups Raisin Bran cereal
- 1 1/4 cups skim milk
- 1 egg
- 1/3 cup shortening

Directions:
- Stir together flour, baking powder, salt, and sugar. Set aside.
- Measure cereal and milk into large mixing bowl. Stir to combine.
- Let stand 1 to 2 minutes, until cereal is softened.
- Add egg and shortening. Beat well.
- Add flour mixture, stirring only until combined.
- Portion batter evenly into 12 baking cups.
- Bake in a 400°F oven for about 25 minutes or until lightly browned.

Quick And Easy Slow Cooker Stew

Ingredients:
- 1 pound beef stew meat, cut into 1-inch cubes
- 1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of mushroom soup
- 1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of celery soup
- 1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed golden mushroom soup
- 1 (10.5 ounce) can condensed French onion soup

Directions:
- Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir beef in hot skillet until browned on all sides, 7 to 10 minutes. Transfer beef to a slow cooker.
- Pour cream of mushroom soup, cream of celery soup, golden mushroom soup, French onion soup over beef.
- Cook on Low for 8 hours.

Apple Pecan Pie

Ingredients:
- 6 -7 apples (any kind you like for pie)
- 2 tablespoons lemon juice
- 1 cup sugar
- 2 tablespoons flour
- 1 teaspoon cinnamon
- 12 teaspoon nutmeg
- 1 pinch salt
- 1 tablespoon butter (melted)
- 14 cup chopped pecans
- 12 cup brown sugar
- 14 cup flour
- 12 teaspoon cinnamon
- 14 cup butter (melted)
- 14 cup chopped pecans

Directions:
- FILLING: In large bowl toss together apples and juice.
- Stir sugar, flour, cinnamon, nutmeg & salt - mix over apples - then add melted butter.
- Sprinkle pecan over bottom of pie shell, add apple mixture.
- TOPPING: In bowl combine brown sugar, flour & cinnamon - mix with melted butter & add pecans, sprinkle over apples.
- Bake pie at 425 for 15 minute .
- Reduce to 375 and bake for 25 - 30 minutes.
- Cool.

Chocolate Shortbread X-Mas Trees

Ingredients:
- 1 cup powdered sugar
- 1 cup butter, softened
- 1 34 cups flour
- 13 cup unsweetened cocoa
- 1 teaspoon vanilla
- 12 teaspoon ground cinnamon
- 1 12 cups white chocolate chips
- 2 tablespoons shortening
- decorator sugar

Directions:
- Heat oven to 350.
- Combine powdered sugar and butter in mixer bowl.
- Beat until creamy, 1-2 minutes.
- Add flour, cocoa, vanilla, cinnamon until well mixed for about 1-2 minutes.
- Roll out dough on lightly floured surface one-half at a time (keeping remaining dough refrigerated), to 1/4-inch thickness.
- Cut with X-mas tree cookie cutters.
- Bake for 10-12 minutes.
- Melt baking chips and shortening in 1-quart saucepan over low heat, stirring occasionally until smooth.
- After cookies are cooled, drizzle glaze over cookies.
- Let stand until set.

Beef Marinade Basic Beef Marinade Recipe

Ingredients:
- 2 1/2 c. vinegar
- 12 whl cloves
- 2 1/2 c. water
- 2 x or possibly 3 bay leaves
- 3 x onions, sliced
- 1 1/2 Tbsp. salt
- 1 x lemon, sliced
- 3 Tbsp. black pepper

Directions:
- Combine ingredients; let stand at room temperature for 24 hrs.
- Add in meat and put in the refrigerator.
- For mild flavor, leave meat in mix for 24 hrs.
- Cook as usual.

New York Sour

Ingredients:
- 1.25 ounces Bulleit rye
- .75 ounces fresh lemon juice
- .5 ounces simple syrup*
- 1 egg white
- .25 ounces red wine or ruby port

Directions:
- Combine ingredients other than red wine in cocktail shaker without ice. Shake hard, then add ice and shake again, until well-chilled. Strain into a rocks glass with fresh ice. Gently pour red wine on top.
- *To make the simple syrup: Dissolve 1 part sugar in 1 part hot water. Let cool before using.

Favorite Cookie

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. shortening
- 1 c. brown sugar, packed
- 1/2 c. white sugar
- 1 egg
- 1 c. Carnation evaporated milk
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1/2 tsp. soda
- 2 3/4 c. sifted flour
- 1 tsp. salt

Directions:
- Mix thoroughly shortening, sugar and egg.
- Stir in Carnation milk and vanilla.
- Sift together flour, soda and salt; chill 1 hour.
- Drop rounded tablespoonfuls 2-inches apart on greased cookie sheet.
- Bake at 375° about 10 minutes.

Mam Maw'S Fruit Cake

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. crushed graham crackers
- 2 c. chopped pecans
- 1 can grated coconut
- 1/2 (1 lb.) box raisins
- 30 large marshmallows or 36 medium (not jet-puffed)
- 1 can sweetened condensed milk (Eagle Brand)

Directions:
- In a large bowl, mix the graham crackers, pecans, coconut and raisins.
- On very low heat, mix the marshmallows in sweetened condensed milk.
- Mix thoroughly with dry ingredients.
- Press into foil lined dish.
- Stores in refrigerator for weeks.

Squash Casserole

Ingredients:
- 4 c. cooked sliced squash
- 1 can cream of chicken soup
- 2 medium onions, chopped fine
- 1 medium pimento, chopped fine
- 1 (12 oz.) carton sour cream
- 1 (8 oz.) pkg. herb dressing
- 1 stick butter or margarine

Directions:
- Melt butter; mix with herb dressing until well coated.
- Mix all other ingredients together.
- Line greased casserole dish with 1/2 of the dressing.
- Pour mixed ingredients over this; sprinkle remaining dressing on top.
- Cover with foil; bake in a 350° oven for 30 minutes.
- Casserole serves 16.

Chicken And Bisquick Dumplings

Ingredients:
- 1 whole chicken or chicken breasts
- 6 c. broth
- 3 c. milk
- 2 c. plus 1 Tbsp. Bisquick mix
- butter, salt and pepper to taste

Directions:
- Wash and boil chicken or chicken breasts until tender.
- Use enough water to cover chicken.
- When done, pour broth off and set aside 6 cups.
- Season broth with milk, butter, salt and pepper to taste.
- Have broth boiling; mix Bisquick with enough milk to pick up enough for a dumpling.
- Pinch off dumplings from spoon the size desired.
- Drop dumplings in boiling broth.
- Press dumplings down in broth.
- Do not stir.
- Keep heat on medium to prevent scorching. Dip each dumpling in flour to thicken broth.
- Tear chicken off bone and add to dumplings when done.

Manwich Night Meat Loaf

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 lb. ground beef
- 1 c. soft bread crumbs
- 1/2 c. minced onion
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 (15 oz.) can Manwich Sloppy Joes sauce
- 1 Tbsp. prepared mustard
- 1 egg
- 1/4 tsp. pepper

Directions:
- Mix the ground beef, crumbs, onion, salt, egg and pepper with 1/2 cup sauce.
- Shape into loaf and place in pan.
- Bake for 40 minutes.
- Drain.
- Spread mustard over loaf and pour remaining sauce over it.
- Bake an additional 30 minutes.
- Makes 6 to 8 servings.

Healthy Pumpkin-Apple Cakes

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 cups pumpkin puree
- 1 cup unsweetened applesauce
- 1/2 cup buttermilk
- 2 large eggs
- 2 egg whites
- 1/3 cup black strap molasses
- 2 1/2 cups spelt flour
- 1/2 cup arrowroot powder
- 1 tablespoon baking soda
- 2 tablespoons baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 2 teaspoons ground cinnamon
- 1/2 teaspoon ground nutmeg
- 1/2 teaspoon allspice
- 1/4 teaspoon cloves
- 1/4 teaspoon cardamom
- 1 teaspoon ground ginger
- 2 apples diced

Directions:
- Preheat your oven to 375F and coat your individual/mini Bundt pans or a 9" Bundt pan with coconut oil.

Pepperoni Pie

Ingredients:
- 2 cups milk
- 2 eggs
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1 teaspoon oregano
- 1 1/2 cups flour
- 8 ounces muenster cheese, diced
- 1 cup chopped pepperoni

Directions:
- Whisk together the milk, eggs, salt and oregano.
- Stir in the flour, blending well.
- Add the cheese and pepperoni, sitrring to combine.
- Put in a buttered 9"x13" pan.
- Bake at 400 degrees for 30 minutes or until golden brown.
- Cut into squares-- large for a breakfast or brunch, or smaller for appetizers.

Brownies

Ingredients:
- 1 c. sugar
- 1 c. flour
- 1 stick margarine
- 1 lb. can Hershey's chocolate syrup
- 1 tsp. baking powder
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 4 eggs

Directions:
- Mix and bake in greased 11 x 14-inch pan for 35 minutes at 350°.

Apple Crunch Pie (2 Extra Servings)

Ingredients:
- 1 (9 ounce) graham cracker crust (large size)
- 1 egg yolk, beaten
- 3 teaspoons ground cinnamon
- 14 teaspoon ground nutmeg
- 14 teaspoon allspice
- 2 (21 ounce) cans apple pie filling
- 3 tablespoons sugar
- 3 tablespoons light brown sugar
- 12 cup flour
- 12 cup oats
- 4 tablespoons butter, melted

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 375F.
- Brush bottom and sides of crust with egg yolk; bake on baking sheet until light brown, about 5 minutes.
- Mix spices with pie filling and spoon into crust; combine sugar, brown sugar, flour, oats and melted butter together until blended.
- Sprinkle topping mixture over pie filling.
- Bake at 375F on a cookie sheet for 35 minutes.

New Orleans French Quarter Doughnuts

Ingredients:
- 1 c. Pillsbury all-purpose flour
- 1 Tbsp. sugar
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 c. water
- 1/2 c. margarine or butter
- 5 eggs
- 1 tsp. grated lemon rind
- confectioners sugar

Directions:
- Lightly spoon flour into measuring cup.
- Combine flour, sugar and salt and set aside.
- Heat water to boiling.
- Add flour mixture all at once, stirring to form a ball.
- Remove from heat.
- Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition until mixture is smooth and glossy.
- Stir in peel.
- Drop dough by teaspoon in 3 to 4 inches hot fat (about 5 minutes) until golden brown.
- Sprinkle with confectioners sugar.

Meatballs In Beer

Ingredients:
- 2 c. beer
- 2 c. ketchup
- 1/2 c. vinegar
- 1/2 c. Worcestershire sauce
- 1/2 c. sugar
- pepper to taste
- 2 lb. ground beef
- 1 c. bread crumbs
- 1 chopped onion
- 1 tsp. horseradish
- 4 dashes (about) Tabasco sauce
- 1/2 c. mayonnaise
- 1/2 tsp. nutmeg
- 1/2 tsp. pepper

Directions:
- Combine first 6 ingredients in saucepan; simmer 20 minutes. Mix remaining ingredients; form into small meatballs.
- Brown in oven; drain fat.
- Add meatballs to beer sauce; simmer 10 minutes (I add 1/2 cup or more brown sugar to beer sauce, depending how sweet you want it).

Black-Eyed Peas And Ham

Ingredients:
- 2 teaspoons olive oil
- 1 cup onion, chopped
- 1 cup ham, diced
- 2 (15 7/8 ounce) cans black-eyed peas, rinsed and drained
- 1 (14 1/2 ounce) can diced tomatoes with basil oregano and garlic, undrained
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper

Directions:
- Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat.
- Add onion and ham; saute 5 minutes or until onion is tender.
- Stir in peas and remaining ingredients and cook until heated.

Cheese Ball

Ingredients:
- 6 oz. dried beef, cut fine
- 2 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese
- 2 Tbsp. Accent
- 1 Tbsp. minced onion
- 1 Tbsp. Worcestershire sauce

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients together, saving 1/4 of the beef to roll the ball in.
- Put in the refrigerator until ready to serve.

Nine Layer Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 small head lettuce, shredded
- 1 c. chopped celery
- 1 c. chopped green peppers
- 1/2 c. chopped onion
- 1 can drained peas
- 1 can sliced mushrooms
- 1 c. sliced radishes
- 8 oz. sour cream
- 1 c. mayonnaise
- 6 oz. shredded cheese
- 1 Tbsp. sugar
- bacon bits
- may add tomatoes if you wish

Directions:
- In 9 x 13-inch pan, put layer of lettuce and add other vegetables in layers on top of lettuce.
- Mix sour cream, mayonnaise and sugar.
- Spread over top.
- Sprinkle with cheese and bacon bits.
- Put chopped tomatoes on top if you wish.
- Chill and serve.

Artichoke, Rcotta And Onion Tarts

Ingredients:
- 2 sheets frozen puff pastry, thawed, halved
- 2 None Spanish onions, peeled, sliced thinly
- 1 (12 oz) jar marinated artichokes, halved
- 7 oz ricotta cheese, crumbled
- 1 tbsp fresh thyme leaves
- 2 tbsp extra virgin olive oil
- 1 handful fresh basil leaves, to serve
- None None mixed greens, to serve

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 425°F. Line 2 large baking trays with parchment paper.
- To assemble the tarts, lay 2 sheets of puff pastry on each baking tray. Arrange onions, artichokes, ricotta and thyme over top, leaving a 1/3 inch border around edges. Drizzle oil over top and season. Bake for 25 mins, or until pastry is cooked through and ricotta is golden. Top with basil leaves.
- Serve hot or at room temperature with a mixed greens.

Mexican Chicken Casserole

Ingredients:
- 1 can (15 oz.) tomato sauce
- 1 c. chicken broth
- 1 c. chopped onion
- 1 can (4 oz.) diced green chilies
- 2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 tsp. ground cumin
- 1/2 tsp. oregano
- 3 chicken breasts (6 halves), cooked, cut in large bite pieces
- 3 c. cooked rice
- 1 c. sour cream
- 2 c. grated Cheddar cheese
- 1 1/2 c. corn chips

Directions:
- Stir together rice and
- sour
- cream.
- Spoon
- into 2 1/2 quart casserole.
- Sprinkle with
- 1
- cup
- of the grated cheese. Mix chicken with sauce and pour over rice.
- Sprinkle remaining cheese on top.
- Top with corn
- chips
- and
- bake at 350° for 30 minutes. Serves 6 to 8.

Beef Goulash With Noodles Recipe

Ingredients:
- 1 large onion
- 2 lbs beef chuck
- 4 tbsp flour
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 1/2 c. beef or possibly chicken broth
- 1/2 c. water
- 1/4 tsp pepper and 1tsp salt
- 3 tsp red vinegar
- 2 bay leaves
- 3 Tbsp. oil
- 1 Tbsp. paprika
- 1 pkg egg noodles

Directions:
- In 4 qt pot, saut

Farro Flavored With Orange And Smoked Paprika

Ingredients:
- 1 cup semi-pearled cracked farro, picked over for any stones and debris and rinsed (6 ounces)
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1/3 cup onion, diced
- 1/3 cup orange bell pepper, diced
- 1 garlic clove, minced
- 1/3 cup marmalade
- 1 teaspoon smoked paprika
- 2 cups hot water

Directions:
- In a medium high heat pot stove top or a rice cooker set on add oil when hot add onions, peppers, and garlic stirring for 3 minutes. Add remaining ingredients.
- Cook stove top 20-30 minutes. Cooking in ricer cook according to directions.
- When done stir and fluff.
- Enjoy garnished with an orange slice.

Rice with Colorful Autumn Vegetables (Gomoku Takikomi Gohan)

Ingredients:
- 700 grams White rice
- 2 cuts Autumn salmon fillets
- 200 grams Sweet potato
- 50 grams Carrot
- 40 grams Edamame
- 100 grams Shimeji mushrooms
- 1 Soup stock cube
- 2 tbsp Sake
- 1/2 tbsp Soy sauce
- 2 tbsp Mirin
- 1 Sesame salt

Directions:
- Rinse and drain the rice 30 minutes before cooking.
- Prepare all the "A" ingredients.
- Put rice into the rice cooker, fill with water up to the 2 cup level mark, mix in the "B" ingredients, add the prepared ingredients from Step 2, and cook the rice on the usual setting.
- When it's done, leave to steam for 10 minutes without opening the rice cooker, shred the fish and briskly stir, transfer to serving bowls, then sprinkle sesame salt on top.

Carrot Meat Balls

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. hamburg
- 2 large carrots, shredded
- 1/3 c. chopped onions
- 1/2 c. bread crumbs
- 1 Tbsp. oil
- 1 egg
- 1/4 c. milk
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1/4 tsp. pepper
- 1 can beef gravy

Directions:
- In a large bowl mix beef, carrots, onions, egg, bread crumbs, milk, salt and pepper.
- Shape into balls.
- Heat oil in large skillet and brown meat balls.
- Add gravy; cover and simmer 15 to 20 minutes until done.

Deconstructed Skillet Apple Dumplings

Ingredients:
- 2 Envy Apples, Peeled And Diced
- 1 teaspoon Lemon Juice
- 1 teaspoon Vanilla Extract
- 2/3 cups Heavy Cream
- 5 Tablespoons Butter, Cut Into Small Pieces
- 1 cup Brown Sugar
- 1-1/2 Tablespoon Flour
- 1 teaspoon Cinnamon
- 1 Pie Crust

Directions:
- Add apples into a large skillet. Add lemon juice, vanilla extract, heavy cream and butter.
- In a separate bowl, add brown sugar, flour and cinnamon. Sprinkle over the apple mixture. Lightly stir until all the ingredients are blended together.
- Bring apple mixture to a boil, reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 5 minutes until slightly thickened.
- Drop in crumbled pie dough into the apples. Continue to cook until the dough starts turning golden, about 10 minutes.
- Take off the heat. Serve it up and enjoy!

Licorice Cookie Strips

Ingredients:
- 1 cup butter, softened
- 1 cup sugar
- 1 cup brown sugar
- 1 egg
- 2 12 cups flour
- 2 teaspoons anise seed
- 1 teaspoon baking soda
- 12 teaspoon salt
- 12 teaspoon cinnamon
- 12 teaspoon nutmeg

Directions:
- In a mixing bowl, cream butter and sugars.
- Beat in egg.
- Combine dry ingredients; add to creamed mixture and mix well.
- Divide dough into 10 portions; shape each into a 12 inch log.
- Place 3 inches apart on ungreased baking sheets.
- Flatten with a fork to 1/4 inch thickness.
- Bake at 350 degrees for 8-10 minutes or until golden brown.
- Cool for 5 minutes; cut diagonally into 1 inch slices.
- Remove to wire racks to cool completely.

Strawberry Crunch

Ingredients:
- 2 c. crushed pretzels
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 3/4 c. melted butter
- 8 oz. cream cheese
- 2 1/2 c. boiling water
- 1 large pkg. strawberry jello
- 2 c. cut up strawberries
- 1/2 c. powdered sugar
- 1 medium Cool Whip

Directions:
- Mix pretzels, sugar and melted margarine.
- Pat in 9 x 13-inch pan for 15 minutes.
- Cool in refrigerator.
- Cream together cream cheese and powdered sugar and gently stir in Cool Whip and spread on cool crust.
- Dissolve jello in water and add strawberries.
- Put in refrigerator until barely set, then pour over cream mixture.

The Obscene Chocolate Cake

Ingredients:
- cooking spray (for greasing a Bundt pan)
- 1 (18.25 oz.) Butter Recipe Golden or yellow cake mix
- 1/4 c. unsweetened cocoa powder, sifted
- 1/2 c. granulated sugar
- 1 c. sour cream
- 1/2 c. vegetable oil
- 4 large eggs
- 1 (12 oz.) bag mini semi-sweet chocolate chips

Directions:
- Do not preheat oven. Spray one 12-cup Bundt pan with vegetable cooking spray.

Salmon Croquettes

Ingredients:
- 2 c. deboned salmon
- 1 Tbsp. chopped onions
- 1/4 c. chicken broth
- 1/4 c. skim milk
- 1 Tbsp. chopped parsley
- 1 Tbsp. margarine
- 1 Tbsp. flour
- 1 c. fine bread crumbs
- 2 eggs, well beaten
- dash of pepper

Directions:
- Melt butter.
- Blend flour and pepper.
- Cook on low heat until bubbly.
- Stir in broth and milk bringing to a boil, stirring constantly.
- Cook 1 minute.
- Remove from heat.
- Blend in salmon, onions and parsley thoroughly and refrigerate 1 hour.

BBQ Football Pizza

Ingredients:
- 1 cup thick barbecue sauce
- 1 pound sliced deli roast beef, coarsely chopped
- 1 (1 pound) loaf frozen bread dough, thawed
- 10 (3/4-ounce) slices Land O Lakes Deli Provolone Cheese, cut in half

Directions:
- Heat oven to 375F.
- Place barbecue sauce and roast beef in 10-inch skillet.
- Cook over medium-low heat, stirring occasionally, 15-20 minutes or until heated through and barbecue sauce is absorbed.
- Place thawed bread dough onto large greased baking sheet.
- Form into 16x10x1/4-inch football shape (grease hands, if necessary).
- Poke dough several times with fork.
- Let dough rest 10 minutes.
- Bake 12-15 minutes or until lightly browned.
- Top baked crust with barbecued beef mixture; layer cheese slices over beef.
- Continue baking 8-10 minutes or until cheese is completely melted.
- Let stand 5 minutes; cut into servings.

Kale Salad With Chickpeas In A Jar

Ingredients:
- 8 tablespoons salad dressing of your choice, or to taste
- 2 large carrots, chopped
- 2 (15 ounce) cans chickpeas, drained
- 1 bunch chopped kale
- 4 tablespoons crumbled feta cheese

Directions:
- Set out 4 mason jars and start layering. Divide dressing equally between the 4 jars. Add equal amounts of carrots, chickpeas, kale, and feta, in that order. Close jars with a lid and refrigerate until using.

Apple Pie Filling For Canning

Ingredients:
- 12 c. grated apples
- 5 c. sugar (can use less)
- 3 c. water
- 6 Tbsp. Minute tapioca

Directions:
- Stir all together and cold pack 15 minutes.
- For winter use. Don't make jars too full.

Applesauce Squares

Ingredients:
- 2 c. sifted flour
- 2 tsp. soda
- 3/4 tsp. cinnamon
- 1/4 tsp. nutmeg
- 1/2 c. soft butter
- 1 c. sugar
- 2 eggs
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 1/2 c. applesauce
- 1 c. raisins
- 1 c. chopped nuts
- confectioners sugar

Directions:
- Mix first 4 ingredients.
- Set aside.
- Cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
- Add eggs and vanilla.
- Beat well.
- Beat in flour mixture.
- Add applesauce, nuts and raisins.
- Mix.
- Pour into greased 10 x 15-inch pan.
- Bake at 350° for 25 minutes. Sprinkle with confectioners sugar.

Date Nut Balls

Ingredients:
- 1 stick margarine
- 1 c. dark brown sugar
- 1 small (8 to 10 oz.) pkg. dates, chopped
- 1 c. chopped walnuts
- 1 c. coconut
- 2 c. Rice Krispies
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- dash of salt

Directions:
- Mix together the first three ingredients.
- Cook on low heat until it starts to bubble for 5 minutes.
- Take off heat.

Fantasy Fudge

Ingredients:
- 3 c. sugar
- 3/4 c. margarine
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 2 c. chocolate chips
- 1 c. chopped nuts
- 2/3 c. evaporated milk
- 2 c. marshmallow cream

Directions:
- Combine sugar, margarine and milk.
- Bring to a rolling boil, stirring constantly.
- Remove from heat.
- Stir in chocolate chips. Add marshmallow cream, nuts and vanilla.
- Beat until well blended. Pour into 9 x 13-inch pan.

Pepperoni Calzone

Ingredients:
- 1 package refrigerated pizza crust 10 oz.
- 6 Tbsp. Ragu(R) Pizza Quick Sauce
- 18 slices pepperoni
- 1/3 cup onions chopped
- 1/3 cup green bell pepper chopped
- 1 1/4 cups shredded mozzarella cheese about 5 oz

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 425°. Lightly grease baking sheet; set aside.
- Unroll crust and press into a 12 x 14-inch rectangle; cut into six equal rectangles. Spread each rectangle with 1 tablespoon Sauce to within 1/2 inch of edges. Arrange 3 pepperoni slices on 1/2 of the longest side of each rectangle; top with onion, green pepper and 1 cup cheese. Starting at longest side, fold dough over to form rectangles. Seal edges with a fork, then cut 3 two-inch slits in top of each rectangle.
- Bake 9 minutes or until light golden brown. Sprinkle with remaining 1/4 cup cheese. Bake an additional 1 minute or until cheese is melted. Serve, if desired, with additional Sauce.

Chinese Almond Cookies

Ingredients:
- 1 1/4 c. shortening
- 3 c. flour
- 1 tsp. baking soda
- 1 egg
- 1 1/2 c. sugar
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. almond extract
- almonds (1/2 for each cookie)

Directions:
- Mix shortening and sugar.
- Add egg and rest of ingredients. Make into small balls.
- Flatten and place a half almond in center. Bake until lightly browned at 350° (approximately 15 minutes, depending upon your oven).

Grace'S Buttermilk Pancakes 

Ingredients:
- 1 egg, beaten
- 1 cup sifted flour
- 1 tsp b.p.
- 1 Tbsp sugar
- 1/2 tsp. soda
- 1 cup buttermilk
- 2 T. melted shortening

Directions:
- Mix quickly. Stand a few minutes before making.

Chicken Pillows

Ingredients:
- 1 (9 3/4 ounce) can canned chicken
- 8 ounces neufchatel cheese
- 1 green onion
- 12 teaspoon salt
- 8 ounces crescent roll dough

Directions:
- mix cream cheese chicken green onion and salt together.
- fill each cresent roll and top with "i cant believe it's not butter" Spray.
- Cook to cresent roll cooking directions until the golden brown.

Jalapeno Artichoke Dip

Ingredients:
- 2 (8 ounce) packages cream cheese, softened
- 12 cup sour cream
- 2 (8 ounce) cans artichoke hearts, drained and chopped
- 12 cup jalapeno, from a jar and chopped
- 2 tablespoons jalapeno juice, from the jalapeno jars (to taste)
- 8 ounces shredded parmesan cheese
- tortilla chips
- 1 loaf sliced baguette

Directions:
- Set aside about 3 ounces of the parmesan cheese.
- Combine all of the ingredients and the remaining parmesan cheese in a mixing bowl and mix until combined.
- Spread evenly into either a 9x9 baking dish, or a 7 x 11 baking dish.
- Sprinkle the remaing parmesan cheese on top of mixture.
- Bake for 20 minutes, or until cheese is bubbly and golden brown on the edges.
- Serve warm with tortilla chips and/or sliced baguette.

Sherried Beef

Ingredients:
- 4 lb. round steak
- 1 1/2 c. cooking sherry (water if preferred)
- 1 pkg. onion soup mix
- 3 cans golden mushroom soup

Directions:
- Cut steak in bite size pieces and remove fat.
- Mix all ingredients together and cook, covered, 3 hours at 325°.
- Serve with rice or noodles.

Asparagus Chicken Casserole

Ingredients:
- 4 oz. white chicken meat, cooked and diced
- 2 (10 oz.) cans asparagus, broken spears
- 1/2 c. margarine or butter
- 1 can condensed cream of mushroom soup
- 1/2 can asparagus liquid
- 12 crackers, crushed
- 1 c. extra-sharp Cheddar cheese, grated
- 1 can water chestnuts, drained
- 1/4 tsp. garlic powder
- slivered toasted almonds

Directions:
- Drain asparagus and combine with soup, chicken, cracker crumbs, cheese and water chestnuts in a 1-quart baking dish. Sprinkle with garlic powder and almonds.

Chasu (Glazed Pork Loin)

Ingredients:
- 12 cup soy sauce
- 2 tablespoons sugar
- 1 tablespoon molasses
- 4 tablespoons catsup
- 1 tablespoon chopped garlic
- 4 lbs pork loin

Directions:
- Make sauce with soy, sugar, molasses, catsup and garlic.
- Cut pork loin into 1 1/2x4-inch strips.
- Marinate meat for 2 hours in sauce; store in the refrigerator.
- Bake in oven for 1 hour at 350 basting often.
- Serve with hot mustard on the side.

Sausage In A Sauce

Ingredients:
- 2 Tbsp. butter or margarine
- 1/3 c. onions, chopped
- 1/3 c. bell pepper, chopped
- 1 pkg. cocktail sausages, cut in small pieces
- 2 cans tomato soup
- 1 tsp. Worcestershire sauce
- 1/3 c. brown sugar
- 1/2 tsp. mustard

Directions:
- Saute
- onions
- and
- bell pepper in butter until tender. Brown sausages.
- Add
- soup, Worcestershire sauce, brown sugar and mustard.
- Mix all ingredients together thoroughly and warm in crock-pot on low all day.

Mexican Coffee Balls

Ingredients:
- 1 (9 oz.) box chocolate wafers, crushed into crumbs
- 1/2 lb. ground blanched almonds
- 1/3 c. unsweetened cocoa powder
- 1/4 c. sugar
- 2 Tbsp. instant coffee
- 1/3 c. coffee liqueur
- 1/2 c. light corn syrup
- cinnamon sugar

Directions:
- Mix chocolate wafers with almonds, cocoa powder and sugar. Dissolve instant coffee in cup of coffee liqueur and stir into crumb mixture with corn syrup.
- Shape into 3/4-inch balls and roll in cinnamon sugar.
- Store in refrigerator.
- Makes 5 dozen.

Pickled Peaches

Ingredients:
- 1 qt. vinegar
- 6 lb. sugar
- 4 sticks cinnamon
- ginger
- cloves
- 12 lb. fruit

Directions:
- Make syrup of vinegar, spices and sugar; pour over fruit while still hot.

Rum Balls 2

Ingredients:
- 2 cups Vanilla Wafer Crumbs
- 1 cup Finely Chopped Nuts (Walnuts Or Pecans)
- 1 cup Powdered Sugar, Plus More For Coating
- 2 Tablespoons Cocoa Powder
- 2 Tablespoons White Corn Syrup
- 1/3 cups Rum, Brandy, Or Cointreau

Directions:
- Mix everything together with a spoon until thick, then mix with your hands to thoroughly blend. Roll into balls, about a tablespoonful of mix each. Roll in powdered sugar, chocolate shot, or chopped nuts.

Blueberry Coffeecake

Ingredients:
- 1 teaspoon oil
- Flour
- 1 stick of butter
- 1 cup of sugar
- 2 eggs
- 1/2 cup milk
- 2 1/2 cups of blueberries
- 2 cups flour
- 2 teaspoon baking powder
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1 teaspoon vanilla

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 375 degrees.
- Grease and flour 9x13-inch baking dish.
- Set aside.
- In bowl cream together butter and sugar.
- Beat in eggs.
- Add milk.
- In small bowl mash 1/2 cup blueberries then add to egg mixture.
- Add flour, baking powder, salt and vanilla.
- Mix well.
- Carefully stir in remaining blueberries.
- Pour into baking dish.
- Sprinkle with sugar.
- Bake for 30 minutes or until firm.

Mother's Day Strawberry, Melon and Avocado Salad

Ingredients:
- 1/4 cup honey
- 2 tablespoons sherry vinegar or red-wine vinegar
- 2 tablespoons mint leaves fresh chopped
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper freshly ground
- 1 pinch salt
- 4 cups baby spinach
- 5 ounces avocados peeled, pitted and cut into 16 slices, about 1 small
- 1/2 small cantaloupe rind removed, 16 thin slices
- 1 1/2 cups strawberries hulled, sliced
- 2 teaspoons sesame seeds toasted

Directions:
- Whisk honey, vinegar, mint, pepper and salt in a small bowl.
- Divide spinach among 4 salad plates.
- Arrange alternating slices of avocado and cantaloupe in a fan on top of the spinach.
- Top each salad with strawberries, drizzle with dressing and sprinkle with sesame seeds.

Coconut Party Bars

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 c. flour
- 2 c. packed brown sugar
- 1/2 c. butter or margarine
- 3 eggs
- 1 tsp. baking powder
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1 1/2 c. coconut

Directions:
- Combine flour, 1/2 cup brown sugar and butter or margarine until particles are fine.
- (Use low speed of mixer.)
- Press into bottom of greased 13 x 9-inch pan.
- Bake at 350° for 15 minutes.

Beans

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. pinto beans
- 1 lb. chopped green pepper
- 1 1/2 Tbsp. salad oil
- 1 1/2 lb. chopped onions
- 2 cloves crushed garlic

Directions:
- Cook beans as follows:
- Add 6 to 8 cups hot water.
- Bring to a boil 2 minutes.
- Set aside to soak 1 hour.
- Drain beans. Sort beans for any undesirable ones and discard them.
- Put all good beans in pot with 6 cups hot water.
- Boil gently with lid ajar until tender.

Tapenade Sauce

Ingredients:
- 1 cup dry white vermouth
- 1/3 cup chopped shallot
- 3 tablespoons whipping cream
- 1/4 cup chilled unsalted butter, in pieces
- 1/4 cup olive tapenade (see data base)

Directions:
- In a small saucepan, combine the vermouth and shallots.
- Simmer until liquid has reduced to 1/4 cup, about 10 minutes.
- Strain and discard solids.
- Retun the cooking liquid to the pan and add the whipping cream and bring to a boil.
- Reduce to low and gradually add the butter, whisking until just melted.
- Whisk in the tapenade.
- Season.

Creamy Fruit Dip

Ingredients:
- 8 oz. pkg. cream cheese
- 1/4 c. fruit juice
- 7 or 8 oz. jar marshmallow cream

Directions:
- In medium bowl, combine cream cheese, marshmallow cream and fruit juice.
- Blend with electric mixer until smooth.
- Ready to serve.
- Keep refrigerated.
- Dip any fruit or melon in cream.

Special Squash Cornbread

Ingredients:
- 3 yellow squash, grated
- 4 eggs, beaten
- 12 ounces cottage cheese
- 1 (8 1/2 ounce) box Jiffy cornbread mix
- 12 cup margarine
- onion, grated, to taste

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients and pour into a greased 9 x 13" baking dish.
- Bake at 350 degrees for 20 - 35 minutes until firm in the middle.

Zesty Fresh Fruit Salad

Ingredients:
- 1 orange
- 1/2 cup pomegranate seeds
- 1 cup raspberries
- a few fresh mint leaves, sliced
- Zest 1/2 lime
- 1 tablespoon low-fat plain yogurt, to serve

Directions:
- Use a small sharp knife to remove all the skin and pith from the orange. Over a bowl to catch the juice, cut away the orange segments from the membrane. Squeeze out any leftover juice and discard the rest.
- Add the pomegranate seeds, raspberries, mint, and lime zest to the orange. Serve with the yogurt and extra zest, if desired.

Chocolate Ganache

Ingredients:
- 2 cups (12 oz.) semisweet chocolate morsels
- 1/3 cup whipping cream
- 1/4 cup butter, cut into pieces

Directions:
- Microwave chocolate morsels and cream in a glass bowl on MEDIUM (50% power) 2 to 3 minutes or until morsels are melted, stirring after 1 1/2 minutes; whisk until smooth. Gradually add butter, whisking until smooth. Cool about 35 minutes or until spreading consistency, whisking every 10 minutes.

Rapid Rise Whole Wheat Bread (Bread Machine)

Ingredients:
- 2/3 cup water, luke warm
- 1 tablespoon non-fat powdered milk, plus
- 1 teaspoon non-fat powdered milk, stirred into water
- 1 egg, stirred into water
- 1 tablespoon canola oil
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 2 tablespoons honey
- 2 cups whole wheat flour, plus
- 3 tablespoons whole wheat flour
- 1 tablespoon fast rising yeast, plus
- 1 teaspoon fast rising yeast

Directions:
- Simply put add ingredients in order shown and start on the rapid setting, light crust.

Pasta With Spinach And Sausage 

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. pasta
- 2 tablesp. olive oil
- 1 large can (28 oz.) Del Monte diced tomatoes
- 1 package fresh sliced mushrooms (16 oz.)
- 1 (1lb.) pkg. frozen chopped spinach
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1/4 cup hearty red wine (I use Paisanno)
- 1 lb. Italian sausage, take out of casings and cut in chunks
- 1 beef bouillion cube, disolved in 1 cup hot water
- Fresh parmesano-reggiano cheese

Directions:
- In large dutch oven, lightly brown garlic in olive oil. Add sausage chunks and cook till no longer pink, about 6 to 8 minutes. Add frozen spinach, pkg of mushrooms, can of diced tomatoes, 1/4 cup wine, the beef broth and cook for about 1/2 hour over med.-low flame covered. Stir occasionally.
- Spoon over cooked pasta and sprinkle grated parmesano-reggiano cheese over all.
- Bon Appetit!

Miss Edna'S Turnip Casserole

Ingredients:
- 2 lbs turnips, peeled and thinly sliced
- 6 ounces bacon, fried
- 2 tablespoons reserved bacon drippings
- 1 1/2 teaspoons sugar or 1 1/2 teaspoons Splenda sugar substitute
- Tabasco sauce, to taste
- 1 cup chicken broth
- 1 cup heavy cream
- salt and black pepper

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350° F.
- Butter a 1 1/2-quart casserole dish.
- Place turnips in a large saucepan with water to cover, bacon grease and Splenda.
- Bring to a boil, reduce heat to moderate, simmer till tender, about 20 minutes; remove from heat.
- Stir in a dash of Tabasco and crisp, crumbled bacon.
- Meanwhile, combine broth and heavy cream in a medium-size saucepan, bring to a low boil over moderate heat.
- Cook till slightly thickened, about 20 minutes.
- With a slotted spoon, transfer turnips to prepared casserole and pour cream mixture over top.
- Season with salt and pepper and bake 'til golden brown, about 30 minutes.
- Serve hot.

Crispy Coconut Shrimp

Ingredients:
- 12 shrimp medium
- 1 teaspoon honey
- 1 tablespoon tapioca flour
- 1 tablespoon coconut flour
- 1/2 teaspoon paprika
- 1 teaspoon garlic powder
- 1 egg
- 1/2 cup shredded unsweetened coconut shreds
- 2 tablespoons coconut oil

Directions:
- Heat the oil in a saucepan over medium-high heat.
- In one bowl, combine the coconut and tapioca flours, garlic and paprika. In another, beat the egg with the honey, along with one tablespoon of tapioca flour. In the final bowl, place the coconut flakes.
- Dip each shrimp into the egg quickly, then pat both sides into the flours. When fully coated, dip again in the egg and pat into the shredded coconut.
- Place the shrimp in the heated saucepan and allow to cook for a minute or two, or until they turn pink and the coating is golden and crispy
- Season with salt and pepper before serving

Chocolate Cherries

Ingredients:
- 1 (7 1/4 oz.) pkg. vanilla wafers, crushed fine
- 1/2 c. powdered sugar
- 1/2 c. chopped walnuts
- 1/4 c. boiling water
- 2 Tbsp. butter or oleo
- 1 Tbsp. light corn syrup
- 2 tsp. instant powdered coffee
- 1 (12 oz.) pkg. semi-sweet chocolate bits*
- flaked coconut (optional)
- chopped nuts (optional)
- chocolate sprinkles (optional)
- cherries with stems

Directions:
- *Add a little milk to chocolate bits when melting.

Ego Batter Buns

Ingredients:
- 1 c. warm water (105~ to 115~)
- 1 pkg. Fleischmann's active dry yeast
- 2 Tbsp. sugar
- 2 1/4 c. Gold Medal flour
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 egg
- 1 Tbsp. margarine or shortening

Directions:
- Measure warm water into a large warm bowl.
- Sprinkle in yeast. Stir until dissolved.
- Stir in sugar, salt and half the flour. Beat with a spoon until smooth.
- Add egg and margarine.
- Beat in rest of flour until smooth.
- Scrape down sides of bowl; cover.
- Let rise in warm place until double in bulk, about 30 minutes.
- Stir down dough and spoon into 12 large greased muffin cups, filling to 1/2 full.
- Again let rise to top of muffin cups (20 to 30 minutes). Bake at 400° for 15 minutes or until done.
- Makes 12 buns.
- Very good.

Spaghetti In Pasta Broccoli

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. spaghetti
- 1 pkg. broccoli
- 2 c. diced ham
- 1/2 Velveeta block
- 1/3 c. milk

Directions:
- Cook spaghetti.
- Also cook broccoli until tender and drain. Melt cheese with milk.
- Place spaghetti in 9 x 13-inch pan; place broccoli on top of spaghetti.
- Put diced ham on top of broccoli, then pour cheese on top of all of it.
- Place in oven until warm all the way through.
- Serve while hot.

Meat Loaf With Shredded Vegetables Recipe

Ingredients:
- 4 c. packed shredded cabbage
- 1 med. onion, finely minced
- 3 tbsp. vegetable oil
- 1 c. packed shredded carrots
- 1 clove chopped garlic
- 1 pound minced meat
- 2 Large eggs
- 1/3 c. bread crumbs
- 1 teaspoon basil
- 1/4 teaspoon oregano
- 1 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon pepper
- 1/4 c. water
- 2 tbsp. white vinegar
- 1 med. potato, shredded

Directions:
- Saute/fry cabbage and onion in oil for 5 min.
- Add in carrots and garlic till brown.
- Cold to room temperature.
- Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
- Combine beef, Large eggs, bread crumbs, basil, oregano, salt, pepper, water, and vinegar in bowl.
- Add in vegetables; mix well.
- Shape into loaf in pan.
- Cover with foil and bake for 30 min.
- Uncover for another 30 min more baking.
- Let rest before serving for 15 min.

Cheesy After-School Nibbles

Ingredients:
- 2 stalks celery, cut into 4-inch pieces
- 2 Tbsp. Cheez Whiz Cheese Spread
- 1 Kool-Aid Singles Cherry Drink Mix
- 1 bottle (250 mL) cold water

Directions:
- Spread celery with Cheez Whiz.
- Add drink mix to water; close bottle with lid.
- Shake until mix is dissolved.
- Serve with celery.

Sour Cream And Nut Pound Cake

Ingredients:
- 3 c. sifted flour
- 1/4 tsp. baking soda
- 2 sticks butter/margarine
- 3 c. sugar
- 6 eggs
- 1 c. sour cream
- 1 tsp. vanilla
- 1 c. chopped nuts

Directions:
- Sift flour and baking soda together 2 times.
- Cream butter. Slowly add sugar; cream well.
- Add eggs, one at a time, beating well in between.
- Stir in sour cream.
- Add dry ingredients, 1/2 cup at a time, beating constantly.
- Add vanilla.
- Pour into greased and floured tube pan or separate into 2 smaller loaves. Bake at 325° for at least 1 hour, without opening oven door.

Butterfinger Pie

Ingredients:
- 3 large Butterfingers
- 1 (8 oz.) Cool Whip
- 1 baked 9-inch pie shell

Directions:
- Grate the Butterfingers until fine.
- Mix with Cool Whip.
- Pour in baked pie shell; freeze.
- Serve frozen.
- This is easy and so good!

Biscuit Crumb Crust For Cheesecake Recipe

Ingredients:
- 125 gm butter
- 2 c. Granita biscuits
- 1 Tbsp. hot water
- 1/2 tsp cinnamon, grnd

Directions:
- Heat butter, stir in finely crushed biscuit crumbs, water and cinnamon and mix to a hard paste.
- Press into a spring form pan, chill for 15 min.
- Use as a substitute for short pastry in cheesecakes and other cool and baked open tarts.
- A simple base for cheesecakes and tarts.

Oatmeal Cookies

Ingredients:
- 1 c. granulated sugar
- 1/2 c. shortening
- 1 egg
- 1 c. molasses
- 2 c. sifted flour
- 1 tsp. salt
- 1 1/2 tsp. soda
- 1 tsp. vanilla extract
- 1 c. quick cooking oatmeal

Directions:
- Cream sugar and shortening.
- Add egg and molasses; beat well. Add sifted dry ingredients and mix well.
- Add vanilla and stir in oatmeal.
- Drop from teaspoon onto greased baking sheet.
- Bake at 375° for 10 to 12 minutes.
- Yields approximately 48 cookies.

Deep Fried Sea Bass

Ingredients:
- sifted all-purpose flour
- 3 teaspoons salt
- 1 teaspoon fresh ground black pepper
- 1 teaspoon fresh ground white pepper
- 1 teaspoon spice essence
- 2 teaspoons baking powder
- 2 lbs fish fillets
- 2 eggs
- 1 cup milk
- 2 tablespoons oil

Directions:
- Into a deep-fryer, preheat frying oil to 375°F [190°C].
- Into a bowl, mix together flour, salt, both peppers, Essence, and baking powder.
- Coat fish fillets with mixture, reserving remaining mixture.
- Lightly beat eggs; beat in milk and oil.
- Mix in remaining reserved flour mixture; beat until smooth.
- Dip fish into mixture.
- Deep-fry fish fillets until crunchy and golden brown.
- Drain onto paper toweling.

Tender Chanterelle Salad 

Ingredients:
- 1 pound fresh chanterelles, brushed clean and trimmed (halved or quartered if large)
- 3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil
- 2 tablespoons chopped flat-leaf parsley
- 2 tablespoons white wine vinegar
- 2 teaspoons Dijon mustard
- 1 small shallot, thinly sliced
- 1 small garlic clove, minced
- Kosher salt, freshly ground black pepper
- Fresh lemon juice

Directions:
- Place mushrooms in a steamer basket and set over a pot filled with 1" gently simmering water (do not allow water to touch mushrooms). Cover and steam mushrooms until tender, about 5 minutes. Transfer mushrooms to a baking sheet and let cool slightly.
- Meanwhile, whisk oil, parsley, vinegar, Dijon mustard, shallot, and garlic in a medium bowl. Season with salt, pepper, and lemon juice. Add mushrooms; toss to coat evenly. Let marinate for 30 minutes. Season to taste with salt, pepper, and more lemon juice, if desired.

Broccoli And Rice Casserole

Ingredients:
- 1 pkg. frozen, chopped broccoli
- 1 c. Minute rice
- 1 (8 oz.) jar Cheez Whiz
- 1 small can evaporated milk

Directions:
- Prepare broccoli and rice according to package directions. Then mix together, adding Cheez Whiz and evaporated milk.
- Place in 1-quart dish, sprinkle with paprika.
- Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.

Heavenly Corn Rolls

Ingredients:
- 1 c. cornmeal
- 2 c. milk
- 2 pkg. yeast
- 1/4 c. warm tap water
- 3/4 c. milk, scalded
- 1/2 c. shortening
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 1 1/2 tsp. salt
- 3 beaten eggs
- 6 c. flour

Directions:
- Make a mush by cooking cornmeal in 2 c. milk; stir until milk is gone and meal is thick (burns easily), set aside to cool.
- Add scalded milk and water to a large bowl; add yeast and sugar.
- Let stand about 10 minutes.
- Mix other ingredients, adding the mush with the beaten eggs.
- This is a fairly stick dough.
- Use plenty of flour on a cloth to knead.
- Let rise.
- Roll out and cut in strips.
- Tie strips into knots and dip in melted butter.
- Let them rise.
- Bake at 350 degrees.
- Keeps well and reheats well.

Herbed Cheese Pinwheel Canapes Recipe

Ingredients:
- 1 (8 ounce.) pkg. Philadelphia cream cheese
- 2 tbsp. minced parsley
- 2 teaspoon lemon juice
- 1/2 teaspoon dry basil leaves, crushed
- 1/8 teaspoon pepper
- 1/8 teaspoon garlic pwdr
- 1 (1 l.b) unsliced whole wheat bread loaf, crust trimmed
- Soft butter
- 1/4 c. finely minced pecans
- 1/4 c. sesame seed
- 1 tbsp. Worcestershire sauce

Directions:
- Combine cream cheese, parsley, juice and seasonings, mixing well till blended.
- Slice bread lengthwise into 1/2 inch slices.
- Roll each slice to 1/4 inch thickness.
- Proportionately spread each bread slice cream cheese mix, roll up starting at narrow end.
- Spread bread rolls with butter including ends.
- In small skillet combine remaining ingredients, cook 30 min or possibly till Worcestershire sauce evaporates.
- Cold.
- Coat bread rolls with pecan mix.
- Cover and refrigerateat least 30 min.
- Cut each bread roll crosswise into 1/2 inch slices.
- This makes 2 1/2 dozen.

Vegetable Paella

Ingredients:
- 2 cups water
- 1 cup long grain rice, rinsed and drained
- vegetable oil
- 1 cup frozen corn and peas
- 1 cup frozen broccoli
- 1 cup sliced mushrooms
- 1 (12 ounce) package texturized vegetable protein (TVP)
- 1/4 teaspoon garlic salt
- 1/4 teaspoon paprika
- 1 pinch black pepper

Directions:
- Bring water to a boil in a medium saucepan. Add rice and stir. Reduce heat, cover and simmer for 20 minutes. Set aside.
- Heat oil in wok or deep frying pan over medium high heat. Cook frozen corn, peas, and broccoli until thawed. Stir in sliced mushrooms and veggie ground beef, and continue cooking for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Once vegetables are tender and vegetable protein is browned, stir in garlic salt and paprika. Reduce heat to low, and cook another 3 minutes. Serve warm over rice.

Flower Power Eggs In Pepper Rings

Ingredients:
- 1 dash Cooking Oil Spray
- 1 whole Large Bell Pepper
- 4 whole Large Eggs
- 1 pinch Salt And Pepper, to taste

Directions:
- Heat a non-stick skillet to medium low heat. Lightly spray skillet with cooking oil spray.
- Cut bell pepper into 4 1/2 inch thick slices (you can use one bell pepper or different colors of bell peppers to give a variety of colors).
- Place pepper rings in the skillet.
- Crack one egg into each pepper ring. Cover and cook for a few minutes, until egg yolks are to desired firmness. If you like your yolks firm, it helps to break the yolk right after cracking into pepper rings.
- Season to taste.

BBQ Chicken Marinade

Ingredients:
- 6 boneless skinless chicken breasts
- 1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil
- 2 teaspoons salt
- 1 (6 ounce) can tomato paste
- 2 tablespoons apple cider vinegar
- 2 tablespoons sugar
- 1 tablespoon cayenne pepper
- 1 cup chicken broth
- 2 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce

Directions:
- Whisk all ingredients together in a medium saucepan and simmer gently for 5 minutes.
- Refrigerate to cool completely BEFORE use (about an hour).
- Stab chicken breast with fork to allow juices to to soak in, then place chicken in marinade for at least 30 minutes.
- Throw on grill (meduim heat) and cook for about 10 minute.

Crab Salad

Ingredients:
- 8 oz. shredded crab meat
- 1/2 c. mayonnaise
- 1 c. chopped celery
- 1/4 c. finely chopped green onions
- pepper to taste

Directions:
- Combine all the ingredients in a bowl. Mix well. Cover, and chill. Serve as a sandwich spread or as a dip with crackers.

Peach Cobbler

Ingredients:
- 1 c. self-rising flour
- 1 c. sugar
- 3/4 c. milk
- 1 stick margarine
- 2 small cans or 1 large can peaches, drained
- 1 or 2 shakes cinnamon (optional)

Directions:
- Melt margarine in pan or Corning Ware first.
- Then mix sugar, flour and milk in melted margarine.
- Add peaches, stirring them in.
- Let bake about 1 hour.

Rolls

Ingredients:
- 2 c. biscuit
- 2/3 c. milk
- 1/2 c. Cheddar cheese, grated

Directions:
- Mix and drop on greased cookie sheet.
- Bake at 425° for 8 to 10 minutes.
- Remove from oven and spread 1 stick melted butter and 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder over biscuits.

Creamed Green Beans

Ingredients:
- 1 pkg. or bag frozen French-style green beans
- 2 Tbsp. melted butter
- 3 oz. cream cheese, softened
- garlic powder
- salt
- pepper

Directions:
- Cook beans according to directions; drain.
- Add seasonings, melted butter and cream cheese.
- Cover after 5 minutes.
- Stir with fork and cover again for another 5 minutes.

Fried Halloumi With Caraway

Ingredients:
- 225 g halloumi cheese (a standard block)
- 1 tablespoon olive oil
- 1 -2 teaspoon caraway seed
- 1/2 lemon

Directions:
- Heat the olive oil in a frying pan.
- Meanwhile, slice the halloumi into six even slices.
- When the oil is hot, lay the halloumi slices in a single layer and scatter on the caraway seeds.
- Cook until the halloumi is brown, then turn over and continue cooking until brown on the other side.
- Remove from the pan and put on a serving plate, squeezing a little lemon juice over the cheese. Serve hot.

Easy Chicken And Rice Casserole

Ingredients:
- 1 c. uncooked rice
- 1 can cream of chicken soup
- 1 pkg. dry onion soup mix
- 1 Tbsp. lemon juice
- 1 fryer chicken, cut up
- 2 1/4 c. warm water
- salt and pepper

Directions:
- Grease large baking dish; put in rice, cream of chicken soup, water, lemon juice and onion soup mix.
- Lay chicken pieces over mixture, then salt and pepper.
- Bake, uncovered, in 350° oven for 1 1/2 to 2 hours.

Easy Vegetable Pizza

Ingredients:
- 28 HoneyMaid Graham Wafers (Regular or 40% Less Fat)
- 2 tsp. oil
- 1 small onion, finely chopped
- 1 clove garlic, crushed
- 4 cups finely chopped vegetables (peppers, mushroom, zucchini, eggplant or broccoli) Target 2 lb For $3.00 thru 02/06
- 3 plum tomatoes, chopped
- 1 tsp. dried dried oregano leaves
- 1/2 tsp. dried basil
- 1/4 tsp. salt and pepper
- 2 cups Kraft Onion BarBQ Sauce

Directions:
- COOK onion in oil until softened.
- Add garlic, vegetables, tomatoes, dried herbs and seasonings.
- Cook and stir over medium heat for 10 minutes or until vegetables are softened.
- Arrange graham wafers in a single layer on baking sheet.
- Top with an even layer of vegetable mixture.
- Sprinkle grated cheese on top.
- Bake at 425F (220C) in oven for 10 minutes or until cheese melts and is bubbling.
- Allow to cool for a few minutes before serving.

Chewy Molasses Cookies

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. shortening
- 1 c. sugar
- 2 eggs
- 1 c. molasses
- 4 c. all-purpose flour
- 2 tsp. baking soda
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1 tsp. ground ginger
- 1 tsp. ground cinnamon
- 1/2 c. buttermilk

Directions:
- Cream shortening and sugar, beating well at medium speed of an electric mixer.
- Add eggs and molasses; mix well.
- Combine flour and next 4 ingredients.
- Add to creamed mixture alternately with buttermilk, beginning and ending with flour mixture.
- Drop dough by rounded teaspoonfuls 1 1/2 inches apart on lightly greased cookie sheets.
- Bake at 350° for 10 to 12 minutes.
- Cool on wire racks.
- Yield: approximately 8 dozen cookies.

Peanut Blossoms

Ingredients:
- 1 3/4 c. unsifted all-purpose flour
- 1 tsp. baking powder
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 1/2 c. sugar
- 1/2 c. packed light brown sugar
- 1/2 c. shortening
- 1/2 c. creamy peanut butter
- 1 egg
- 2 Tbsp. milk
- 1 tsp. vanilla extract
- 48 milk chocolate Kisses, unwrapped

Directions:
- Mix all ingredients with exception of milk chocolate Kisses. Chill for 30 minutes.
- Preheat oven to 375°.
- Roll into 1-inch balls.
- Bake for 12 minutes.
- Remove from oven and press Kisses into cookie.
- Yields 4 dozen.

Chicken And Chips

Ingredients:
- 1 can cream of chicken soup
- 1 small jar pimientos
- 1/2 c. milk
- 1 (5 oz.) can boned chicken
- 1 1/2 c. crushed potato chips
- 1 can green peas, drained

Directions:
- Heat oven to 350°.
- Empty soup into baking dish.
- Add milk and mix well.
- Add chicken, 1 cup potato chips, peas and pimientos. Mix well.
- Sprinkle remaining chips on top.
- Bake for 25 minutes.

Pete'S Crab Cakes

Ingredients:
- 1/4 c. chopped onion
- 1/4 c. chopped celery
- 5 Tbsp. butter (2 uses)
- 12 oz. crab meat, drained
- 1 1/4 c. Italian bread crumbs
- 1/4 c. mayonnaise
- 1 egg, lightly beaten
- 1 tsp. fresh lemon juice
- 1 1/2 tsp. Worcestershire sauce
- 1/8 tsp. ground white pepper

Directions:
- In a large skillet, saute onion and celery in 1 tablespoon butter for 3 minutes.
- In a medium bowl, combine onion and celery mixture, crab meat, 3/4 cup bread crumbs, mayonnaise, egg, lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce and pepper.
- Mix well and shape into 4 patties.
- Coat with remaining 1/2 cup bread crumbs, pressing crumbs into patties.
- In same large skillet over medium heat, melt remaining 4 tablespoons butter.
- Fry patties in butter until golden brown on both sides, about 8 to 9 minutes total.
- Makes 4 crab cakes.

Chocolate Yum Yum Cake

Ingredients:
- 2 c. cake flour
- 1 tsp. baking soda
- 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1 1/3 c. sugar
- 1/2 c. margarine
- 2 sq. chocolate
- 1 1/2 c. water
- 1 tsp. vanilla

Directions:
- Sift flour, soda and salt into a mixing bowl.
- Set aside. Combine sugar, water, chocolate and margarine in a saucepan; boil 10 minutes.
- Cool.
- Pour chocolate mixture into dry ingredients. Add vanilla and beat until smooth.
- Bake in a 9-inch square pan for 30 minutes at 350°.
- Frost as desired or sift confectioners sugar over the top.

French Onion Soup

Ingredients:
- 6 onions, sliced
- 6 to 8 Tbsp. butter
- 1 clove garlic, minced
- 1 tsp. sugar
- 3 to 4 Tbsp. flour
- 2 c. beef stock
- 2 c. chicken stock
- 1/4 c. dry white wine (optional)
- 1/2 lb. Swiss cheese, grated
- slices dry French bread

Directions:
- Saute onions in butter; add garlic.
- Cover first 15 minutes to wilt onions.
- Uncover and add sugar (sugar helps browning).
- Cook until a nice brown color; during this period keep a careful watch and stir as needed.
- Add flour and stir a few minutes.
- Add stock and simmer.
- Add wine last 15 minutes.
- Serve by placing a dry or slightly toasted slice of French bread in bottom of bowl.
- Add soup and top with cheese.
- Place bowls on cookie sheet and bake in oven at 350° until melted.

Pecan Stuffing

Ingredients:
- 4 cups breadcrumbs (soft)
- 1 cup celery, chopped
- 1 cup onion, peeled and chopped
- 1 cup raisins or 1 cup sultana
- 1 cup pecans, chopped
- 12 teaspoon salt
- 12 cup milk
- 2 eggs, well-beaten

Directions:
- Mix crumbs, celery, onions, raisins, nuts and salt together.
- Add milk to beaten eggs and stir into dry mixture.
- Mix well.

Fruit-And-Oat Jumbles

Ingredients:
- 1/2 cup sugar
- 1/3 cup stick margarine, softened
- 1/3 cup molasses
- 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
- 1 egg
- 1 cup all-purpose flour
- 1 cup quick-cooking oats
- 1 cup whole-wheat flake cereal (such as Wheaties)
- 1/4 cup toasted wheat germ
- 3/4 teaspoon baking soda
- 1/2 cup dried cranberries
- 1/2 cup chopped dried apricots
- Vegetable cooking spray

Directions:
- Cream the sugar and margarine at medium speed of a mixer until light and fluffy (about 3 minutes). Add molasses, vanilla, and egg; beat well. Combine flour, oats, cereal, wheat germ, and baking soda; stir well. Gradually add to creamed mixture, beating well. Stir in cranberries and apricots.
- Drop the dough by level tablespoons onto baking sheets coated with cooking spray. Bake at 350° for 10 minutes; let cool on pans 1 minute. Remove from pans; let cool completely on wire racks.

Ranch Chocolate Ice Cream

Ingredients:
- 3 c. granulated sugar
- 1 can condensed milk
- 3 c. granulated chocolate
- 1 1/2 qt. heavy whipping cream
- 2 qt. half and half

Directions:
- Combine
- sugar and condensed milk.
- Stir in granulated chocolate mixed to a paste in a little hot water.
- Stir like crazy.
- Add heavy whipping cream.
- Add half and half.
- Freeze in a 1 1/2-gallon freezer.

Easy Crab Dip

Ingredients:
- 1 (6 1/2 oz.) can white crabmeat, picked (blue crab type, not king crab)
- 1 (8 oz.) pkg. cream cheese
- 1/2 stick real butter (Old Bay, optional)

Directions:
- In a saucepan, combine crabmeat, cream cheese and butter. Heat and mix thoroughly.
- Transfer to hot chafing dish.
- Serve with large size corn chips.
- If you want to jazz it up a bit, add Old Bay seafood seasoning to taste.

Homemade Dressing

Ingredients:
- 5 -6 cups homemade cornbread, cubed
- 4 -5 cups homemade biscuits, cubed
- 1/4 - 1/2 cup butter, melted
- 1 cup celery, chopped
- 1/2 cup onion, chopped
- 2 eggs, well beaten
- 5 -6 cups chicken stock, equal to cornbread
- poultry seasoning, to taste, at least 1/2 tsp
- salt and pepper, to taste

Directions:
- Saute the onion and celery in the butter until tender. Add mushrooms if you would like!
- Combine all ingredients in a large bowl; mix well. I use a healthy sprinkling of poultry seasoning -- that is what makes it smell soooo good while cooking!
- Place into a 13x9x2 inch baking dish.
- Bake at 350 degrees for 25 to 30 minutes.
- If dressing begins to look too dry, add more chicken stock. (While waiting on the turkey to finish, you might leave the dressing in the oven -- in this case, add more chicken stock!).

Spaghetti with Crab and Jalapenos

Ingredients:
- Salt and pepper
- 1/4 cup extra-virgin olive oil
- 6 cloves garlic, peeled and thinly sliced
- 3 jalapeno peppers, seeded and cut into 1/8-inch dice
- 1/4 cup dry white wine
- 1 pound Dungeness crabmeat
- 1 pound spaghettini (recommended: DeCecco brand)

Directions:
- Bring 6 quarts water to boil and add 2 tablespoons salt.
- Heat olive oil over medium heat in a 12 to 14-inch saute pan.
- Add garlic and saute until lightly browned, about 2 to 3 minutes.
- Add jalapenos and wine and bring to boil.
- Add crabmeat and remove from heat.
- Boil spaghetti 1 minute less than stated on the package instructions and drain in colander over sink.
- Add pasta to crab mixture and return to heat.
- Cook until most of the liquid is absorbed, about 45 seconds.
- Pour into a warm serving bowl and serve.

Orange Dijon Chicken Wings

Ingredients:
- 1/4 cup GREY POUPON Country Dijon Mustard
- 1/2 cup HEINZ Tomato Ketchup
- 1/3 cup orange marmalade
- 1 Tbsp. reduced sodium soy sauce
- 1 Tbsp. dried minced onion
- 1 clove garlic, crushed
- 12 chicken wings, separated at joints, tips discarded Whole Foods 1 lb For $3.99 thru 02/09

Directions:
- Blend mustard, ketchup, marmalade, soy sauce, onion and garlic in small bowl.
- Place chicken in resealable plastic bag; coat with 1/2 cup of the mustard mixture.
- Refrigerate chicken and remaining mustard mixture separately for at least 1 hour.
- Preheat oven to 375F.
- Arrange chicken on baking sheet.
- Bake 20 minutes; pour off any excess fat.
- Bake an additional 20 to 25 minutes or until cooked through.
- Heat remaining mustard mixture until warm; serve as a dipping sauce with hot chicken wings.

Chocolate Sour Cream Frosting

Ingredients:
- 2 c. (12 oz. pkg.) semi-sweet chocolate pieces
- 1 c. dairy sour cream
- 1/8 tsp. salt

Directions:
- Melt chocolate over hot water.
- Beat in sour cream and salt. Makes 2 cups.

Canning Pork In Brine

Ingredients:
- 1 c. brown sugar
- 2 c. salt
- 1 gal. water, boiled and allowed to cool
- raw pork

Directions:
- Pour 1 cup brine in a quart jar. Fill with pieces of raw pork. Do not pack too solid.
- Remove air bubbles.
- Cold pack 1 hour. When serving meat, roll pieces in flour and fry.
- Discard the brine.
- This recipe will make brine for 14 to 15 quarts.

Impossible Cheeseburger Pie

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. ground beef
- 1 1/2 c. chopped onion
- 1 1/2 c. milk
- 3/4 c. Bisquick
- 3 eggs
- 1/2 tsp. salt
- 2 tomatoes, sliced
- 1 c. shredded Cheddar or processed American cheese

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 400°. Grease a 1 1/2 x 10-inch pie plate. Cook and stir beef and onion over medium heat until meat is browned.
- Drain spread in plate.
- Beat milk, baking mix, eggs, salt and pepper until smooth.
- Pour on top of meat in plate.
- Bake 25 minutes.
- Top with tomato, sprinkle with cheese and bake until knife inserted in center comes out clean, 5 to 8 minutes.
- Cool 5 minutes.

Puff Pastry Christmas Palmiers

Ingredients:
- 1 package (17.30 ounces) frozen puff pastry, thawed
- 1 large egg
- 1 tablespoon water
- 1/4 cup prepared pesto
- 1/2 cup feta or goat cheese, crumbled
- 1/4 cup oil-packed sun-dried tomatoes, patted dry and finely chopped

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 400°. Unfold one sheet of puff pastry. Whisk egg and water; brush over pastry. Spread with half of the pesto. Sprinkle with half of the feta and half of the sun-dried tomatoes.
- Roll up the left and right sides toward the center, jelly-roll style, until rolls meet in the middle. Repeat with remaining pastry sheet and ingredients. Freeze until firm, about 30 minutes.
- Cut each roll crosswise into 12 slices. On
- lined with parchment paper, bake palmiers until golden and crisp, about 15 minutes.

Marinated Cheese And Olives

Ingredients:
- 4 (8-ounce) packages cubed colby-Jack cheese
- 1 (10-ounce) jar or 2 (7-ounce) jars kalamata olives, drained
- 1 (16-ounce) bottle olive oil and vinegar dressing
- 1 tablespoon dried Italian seasoning
- 1/2 teaspoon dried crushed red pepper
- 6 garlic cloves, crushed
- 6 fresh rosemary sprigs

Directions:
- Combine all ingredients except rosemary in a large bowl; stir gently. Cover and chill at least 8 hours or up to 24 hours.
- Divide cheese and olives into 6 glass containers. Place 1 rosemary sprig in each container. Pour remaining dressing evenly into containers. Cover and refrigerate up to 2 weeks.

Mämmi 

Ingredients:
- +6 quarts (6 L)water
- +1 lb. (1/2 kg) rye malt
- +3 lbs (1.5 kg) rye flour
- molasses to taste
- +1-2 tsp. salt
- +4 Tbsp. chopped orange rind
- (syrup)

Directions:
- Mix 500 gm of malt with 1 litre of tepid water and put a thick layer of rye flour onto the surface. Cover, and leave it in a warm place for two hours. Sift the remaining malt and flour together. Uncover the pot, mix thoroughly and then add 1 litre of boiling water. Make another layer of malt/flour on the surface, cover the pot and again leave for an hour in a warm place. Repeat until all the ingredients are used. Finally add the salt and bigarade or orange zest and boil for 10 minutes, stirring well. Cool by whisking well and half fill moulds with the cooled mixture. Bake at 150°C (300F) for three hours.

Spinach Noodles

Ingredients:
- 1 (10 oz.) pkg. frozen spinach, thawed
- 1 c. noodles
- 1/2 c. shredded sharp cheese
- 1 can cream of mushroom soup
- 1/4 c. chopped onion
- 1/4 c. margarine
- dash of nutmeg

Directions:
- Cook noodles in salted water until tender; drain.
- Mix in remaining ingredients.
- Put in slow cooker.
- Cover; cook on low for 3 to 4 hours.
- Serves 4 to 6.

Swedish Gooey Chocolate Cake (Kladdkaka)

Ingredients:
- 1-3/4 stick Salted Butter
- 7 ounces, weight Dark Baking Chocolate
- 4 whole Eggs
- 1-1/4 cup Sugar
- 1/3 cups All Purpose Or Cake Flour
- 1/4 teaspoons Kosher Or Sea Salt

Directions:
- Preheat oven to 350°F and grease an 8-inch springform pan.
- Melt butter in a medium saucepan over low heat. Add chocolate and stir to combine until chocolate and butter are melted together.
- Take pan off heat (turn heat off) and stir in eggs, sugar, flour, and salt. Stir quickly to prevent the eggs from scrambling.
- Pour batter into springform pan and bake for 20-25 minutes until cake is bubbly on top but still jiggly at the center. Let cake cool completely in the pan.
- Before slicing, remove the edge of the springform and cut slices directly from the pan. Enjoy!
- Recipe adapted from Food52.com

Pecan Sugar Cookies Dipped In Chocolate 

Ingredients:
- 1 cup butter (2 sticks)
- 1 cup Sugar
- 2 Large eggs
- 2 tsp vanilla
- 2 1/4 cups flour
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/2 teaspoon baking powder
- 1 cup chopped pecans
- 1 cup semisweet choc chips

Directions:
- beat butter and sugar with a medium speed mixer until creamy and light yellow (about 3 min). Beat in eggs and vanilla.
- 
- When blended, add flour mixed with baking powder and salt about one third at a time, blending between additions. Fold in pecans.
- 
- Divide dough in half, roll into logs and place each log on a sheet of plastic wrap or waxed paper. Pop in the fridge to chill for at least 2 hours.
- 
- Heat oven to 375. Remove one log from the fridge at a time. Unwrap and cut into 1/4" slices.
- 
- Put the cookies on nonstick cookie sheets and bake 8 - 10 minutes until golden brown on the edges. Let cool.
- 
- Melt chocolate and dip cookies. Place on wax paper and chill. Cookies will peel off wax paper.

Chik'n Chalupa

Ingredients:
- 1 pkg. (10 oz.) frozen BOCA Spicy Chikn Veggie Patties
- 4 corn tostada shells (6 inch)
- 1 cup refried black beans, warmed
- 1 cup shredded lettuce
- 2 plum tomatoes, chopped
- 1/4 cup pitted black olives, sliced
- 1/4 cup shredded reduced-fat Cheddar cheese Target 2 For $5.00 thru 02/06
- 2 Tbsp. chopped onions

Directions:
- Cook chik'n patties as directed on package.
- Cut each patty into quarters.
- Spread tostada shells with beans.
- Top with patties and remaining ingredients

Herbed Lamb Chops

Ingredients:
- 4 (1-inch) lamb chops
- 4 Tbsp. soy sauce
- 4 Tbsp. Worcestershire
- 2 Tbsp. parsley flakes
- 2 Tbsp. red wine vinegar
- 2 tsp. crushed oregano
- 1 tsp. basil
- 1 tsp. paprika
- 1 tsp. ginger
- 1/2 tsp. garlic powder
- dash of pepper

Directions:
- Place chops in shallow dish.
- Combine ingredients and 1/4 cup water.
- Pour over chops, cover and refrigerate 3 hours, turning occasionally.
- Place chops on unheated rack of broiler.
- Broil 3 to 4 inches from heat for 5 minutes.
- Brush with marinade, turn and broil 3 to 5 minutes more.

Cheesy Beer Soup

Ingredients:
- 1/2 c. finely chopped onion
- 1 garlic clove (minced)
- 1 Tbsp. margarine or butter
- 1 lb. Velveeta (cubed)
- 3/4 c. milk
- 1/2 c. beer
- 1/4 tsp. Worcestershire sauce
- Few drops hot pepper sauce
- Green onions (sliced)

Directions:
- Cook and stir onion and garlic in margarine in large saucepan on medium-high heat until tender.
- Reduce heat to medium-low.
- Add cheese, milk, beer, Worcestershire sauce, and hot pepper sauce.

Lazy Sunday Casserole

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. stew meat
- 1 can consomme (not bouillon)
- 1/2 c. red wine
- 1/4 c. dry bread crumbs
- 1/4 c. flour
- 1 medium onion, chopped
- pepper

Directions:
- Combine first 3 ingredients and onion in casserole.
- Mix flour and crumbs.
- Stir into meat mixture.
- Cover and bake at 300° for 3 hours or until tender.
- If too thick, add 1/4 to 1/2 cup water. Serve with noodles, rice or potatoes.

Mexican Layer Dip

Ingredients:
- 2 containers bean dip
- 1 (16 oz.) container sour cream
- 1 pkg. taco mix
- 4 guacamole
- 1/2 lemon
- salt and pepper
- 2 tomatoes, seeded and diced
- 1 small can sliced black olives
- 1/4 c. sliced green onions

Directions:
- First spread bean dip in the bottom of a rectangular pan. Then mix guacamole with juice from 1/2 lemon and salt and pepper to taste.
- Spread over bean dip.

Shoo-Fly Cake

Ingredients:
- 4 c. all-purpose flour
- 2 c. brown sugar, packed
- 3/4 c. shortening
- 2 c. boiling water
- 1/2 c. molasses
- 1/2 c. dark Karo syrup
- 1 Tbsp. baking soda

Directions:
- Note:
- This is a
- recipe that comes from my grandmother and is very Pennsylvania Dutch.

Pineapple-Orange Punch

Ingredients:
- 1 qt. orange juice
- 2 small cans frozen lemonade
- 1 qt. pineapple juice
- 5 qt. ginger ale or 7-Up
- 1 lb. sugar

Directions:
- Combine sugar with just enough water to dissolve.
- Heat to make a

Bubble Soap

Ingredients:
- 1 c. Dawn dishwashing liquid
- 10 c. water
- 1/4 c. glycerin (available at drug store, for longer lasting bubbles)

Directions:
- Mix Dawn with water and glycerin in a dishpan.
- Make bubble blowers from a straw, a kitchen funnel or a thin wire shaped in creative forms.
- For spectacular bubbles, thread a string through straws to form a circle, dip in bubble solution and wave out a large bubble.

Zucchini Bread

Ingredients:
- 3 eggs
- 3/4 c. oil
- 1 1/2 c. sugar
- 2 c. raw grated zucchini
- 2 1/2 c. flour
- 2 tsp. baking soda
- 2 tsp. baking powder
- 1 tsp. salt
- 4 tsp. cinnamon
- 2 tsp. vanilla
- 1 c. chopped nuts

Directions:
- Combine all ingredients; mix well.
- Pour into greased and floured loaf pans.
- Bake at 350° for 1 hour.

That Casserole

Ingredients:
- 1 1/2 lb. ground beef
- garlic salt to taste
- 1 (15 oz.) can tomato sauce
- 6 oz. thin egg noodles
- 1 c. grated Cheddar cheese
- 3 oz. cream cheese
- 8 oz. sour cream
- 6 green onions, minced
- 1 Tbsp. minced bell pepper

Directions:
- Saute ground beef.
- Add garlic salt and tomato sauce.
- Simmer about 10 minutes.
- Cook noodles as directed on package.
- Drain. mix together cream cheese, sour cream, bell pepper and green onions.
- Layer ingredients in casserole, beginning with noodles, meat sauce and sour cream mixture, ending with grated cheese on top.
- Cover and bake 1 hour at 350°.
- Yield:
- 4 servings, unless they're teenagers.

Diet Cheese Danish

Ingredients:
- 1/4 c. cottage cheese
- cinnamon to taste
- sweetener to taste
- 1 capful vanilla

Directions:
- Mix and spread on toast; put under broiler until bubbly.

Shrimp Kebabs With Honey-Mustard Glaze

Ingredients:
- 1/4 c. honey
- 1/4 c. Dijon mustard
- 2 Tbsp. lemon juice
- pinch of dried sage
- 24 large uncooked shrimp, peeled (tails intact)
- 4 red bell peppers, cut into 2-inch pieces
- 4 yellow bell peppers, cut into 2-inch pieces
- 1 red onion, cut in 1-inch pieces
- 12 large mushrooms
- 12 cherry tomatoes

Directions:
- You will need 12 bamboo skewers, soaked for 30 minutes in water.

Apricot Fluff Recipe

Ingredients:
- 3 ounce Apricot Jello
- 1 c. Boiling water
- 8 ounce Can of apricots
- 4 ounce Philadelphia cream cheese

Directions:
- Let mix stand in refrigerator till set.
- Add in by mixer, approximately 7 or possibly 8 ounces of frzn whipping topping.
- Molds well.

Old-Fashioned Glazed Ham

Ingredients:
- 1/2 fully cooked bone-in ham (6 to 7 pounds)
- 2 tablespoons whole cloves
- 1 cup packed brown sugar
- 2/3 cup orange juice
- 1/2 cup unsweetened pineapple juice
- 1/3 cup maraschino cherry juice

Directions:
- Place ham on a rack in a shallow foil-lined roasting pan. Score the surface of the ham, making diamond shapes 1/2 in. deep; insert a clove into each diamond. Cover and bake at 325° for 2 hours.
- Meanwhile, in a small saucepan, bring the brown sugar and juices to a boil. Reduce heat; simmer, uncovered, for 30 minutes or until glaze is reduced to 1 cup.
- Baste ham with 1/3 cup glaze. Bake, uncovered, 25-35 minutes longer or until a thermometer reads 140°, basting with remaining glaze every 10 minutes.

Sunshine Chicken

Ingredients:
- 1 1/4 tsp. curry powder
- 1/4 and 1/4 tsp. salt
- 1/8 tsp. pepper
- 2 chicken breast (S&B) halves
- 3/4 c. orange juice
- 1/2 c. uncooked rice
- 1/3 c. water
- 1/2 Tbsp. brown sugar
- 1/2 tsp. dry mustard
- chopped parsley

Directions:
- Mix curry powder, 1/4 teaspoon salt and pepper. Pat chicken breasts dry. Sprinkle with and rub in spice mix. Combine 1/4 teaspoon salt with next 5 ingredients is large skillet. Arrange chicken over mix. Bring to boil, cover, reduce heat and simmer 20 minutes. Remove from heat. Let stand, covered, 5 minutes. Remove to serving plate; sprinkle with parsley.

Squash Souffle

Ingredients:
- 1 lb. squash
- 1 large onion
- 8 to 10 saltine crackers, crumbled
- 1/2 c. butter
- 2 eggs, separated
- 1/2 c. milk
- 1 c. grated cheese
- salt and pepper

Directions:
- Cook squash and onion until tender.
- Drain.
- Add crackers, butter, egg yolks, cheese, milk, salt and pepper.
- Beat egg whites and fold into mixture.
- Place in a greased casserole dish.
- Bake at 350° for 25 to 30 minutes or until firm and golden.
- Serve while hot.
- Serves 6.

Just Peachy Salsa

Ingredients:
